column6: review_text

Like the dark wood tones. All CM establishments I've been to have an air of sophistication, prevalent here. However, most of us where dressed in jeans and nice shirts, and I never felt out of place. Interesting that you have to enter this eatery via The Joseph. I wonder how many people forgo this place cause they're looking for a "front door". Service for our group of 14 was great! Our lone waitress did a great job keeping things rolling. She didn't rush us, checked in all the right times, gladly left us to chatting after eating. Very well managed. Lamb Burger. Yes, very, very tasty. Soft buttery bun. Fresh tomato topping. The meat was done just right - I asked for medium. Juicy. Great flavor. Chose their Cauliflower side dish. Get it. I want to find that recipe, it was so good! Not swimming in a dressing. The edamame and pickled onion were a perfect touch. Excellent gathering for Thanksgiving Day. They had a prix-fix turkey meal, if you were feeling the traditional avenue. Our time was never taken for granted.

This is technically attached to the Le Meridien, and if that makes it a "hotel restaurant" then it's one of the better ones I've been to. I typically turn my nose up...but I probably shouldn't, at least, not in trendy downtown areas like this.First off, get the prime rib cap. In fact, I would strongly consider ordering two (or even three) of these to make an entire meal out of. Awesome, tender, juicy, flavorful meat, with a perfect amount of salt and pepper plus a good amount of bleu cheese and mustard on the side. We were not disappointed with this recommendation from the wait staff. We also tried the smoked trout - which is served interestingly, with the protein and other items in a mason jar, and toast on the side (points for the mason jar, so trendy) and was also good, but is really overshadowed by that prime rib cab.For entree, two of the three of us had the pork. I somehow expected it to be a chop, but was not sad when it turned out to be nicely sliced pork off the bone. Not overcooked (people are so afraid to undercook pork, and I guess I get why, but it just becomes sawdust) and I really liked the sour apple cabbage. Not sauerkraut, mind you, not as strong of a sour, picked flavor, but getting there. I am not a sauerkraut lover, so this was OK with me. The pork had good flavor, and the sour savory combo of the cabbage and the brown butter sauce was great. Both of us were very happy with this.Wait staff were very helpful, providing a couple of spot on recommendations, so at least in the case of my particular waitress, it's worth listening to what they have to say. My standard line - I don't know when I'll be back in the area, but if I ever am, I would absolutely go back.

Visited as part of Columbus Burger Week. Pretty good burger: the meat was rarer than my medium rare order but delicious, and the bun was solid.  But far too much mayonaise. Some more lettuce, other vegetables, or pickles would've helped to cut the mayo.  Service was fine.Decent tasting, not terribly innovative--definitely Cameron Mitchell restaurant material. (Joined others on this visit, not my first choice)
Everything about this place was pure class. We ordered a few dishes and my favorite was the gnocchi with fava beans. I definitely plan to come back, and hope to bring my parents here one day!

After my latest visit to The Guild House, it's now on my short list of favorites!!!! We came on a Thursday night for a random date night after changing our plans and not having dinner where we initially intended. I am so glad we decided to come here instead even though I may or may not have been a little bit under dressed in jeans :/ but still everyone was lovely and welcoming. We were seated right away and got to sit at this small table near the fire place and it was just too cute! We had the stuffed poblanos, snapper, sea bass, and finished with the chocolate/peanut butter torte. This was one of THE best meals I've had so far this year!! The stuffed poblanos were perfect for sharing with 2 people since there were 2 peppers. I actually thought it was quite spicy, but my date didn't think so at all. We loved this so much 10/10 will order again next time! My entree, the snapper, oh my GOSH it was so good!! It was crispy and mushroomy and also saucy and the fish was perfect to me! I also really liked the smooth sunchoke puree even though I had no clue what it was when I was eating it (it's some sort of root vegetable). I really really had to restrain myself from licking my plate. I tried my date's sea bass too! That lobster broth was just soo flavorful!I mean I kind of didn't understand some of the ingredients on the menu but omg everything we had was just bursting with flavor! Every single dish we ordered we completely finished!! #cleanplateclub

While I never ate here, the service at the door was top notch. The Resturant was very busy the maÌ¨tre d' called 4 Restaurants and booked us a reservation at a very comparable restaurant. We can not wait to go back and try the food!

Visited for the first time while in Columbus for the weekend and absolutely loved it. For starters, the space is beautiful. We sat in the bar area, which was equally charming and had great service. The restaurant is known for its farm-to-table concept so all of the food is at its peak of freshness. The cocktails are handcrafted and unique. I had a bourbon cocktail and a champagne martini (yes, I was willing to set myself up for a hangover). It was 10:30pm so we didn't come in for dinner, but split a couple of apps - toast, and an order of french fries. The toast didn't sound like much of anything from the menu description, but we went with our bartender's recommendation and were blown away. I don't even know how something with 4 ingredients can taste so good. Just get it!

Cameron Mitchell does so many things well, and even though the company has expanded and opened several new restaurants in the past couple of years, the quality has not slipped. Solid 4.5 stars here for the Guild House.The new-build space is perfect for the (new) Short North area - bistro, high ceilings, plush seating, lots of glass and colored lights, along with tall windows facing High Street. Their music selection was more dubstep/dance mix, which was interesting and awesome (I tried to be subtle about Shazam-ing but no-go) - seemed to fit with the vibe.Service here, as with all CM restaurants, is excellent. They understand that for the majority of folks coming in, this will be a birthday/anniversary visit, or they're coming in from out of town, or stopping in for happy hour/Restaurant Week - and Guild House does a great job making their spot an occasion destination even if it's not going to be your weekly hotspot. [High-end service tends to fall down in this area; why you would treat anyone as a throw-away table is beyond me, but when you have a limited number of regular-repeat diners, it's especially egregious.] Everyone got great service at Guild House - we, the Restaurant Week folks, the people who were there on what looked like a first date, the conventioneers wearing khakis - every table in our service area was given equal time and attention.ANYWAY. The food! We were the Restaurant Week folks, and got to try a nice cross section of things. I had a great quinoa salad, the spouse a poblano pepper appetizer, and their salmon (I know, but I like to eat fish where I know it will be prepared properly). Dessert was a super-rich carrot cake and chocolate torte - the spouse heroically attempted to finish the carrot cake for me but alas.  Overall? The food was CM-quality modern American, which is to say a solid 4.5 out of 5.Having visited for dinner, I'm excited to try their brunch,  they've convinced me to be a repeat diner at Guild House.

This is a delicious restaurant in a fun, up and coming part of Columbus. Great use of space, our server was really funny and incredibly knowledgeable. Next time we're in Columbus, we're there! #gobucks

Charming and elegant spot on the ground floor of the Le MÌ©ridien hotel in the famous Short North district of Columbus.  Very extensive wine list caters to all tastes with a good selection of local and European wines for all budgets.Appetizers are small and light yet satisfying with the duck pÌ¢tÌ© and the prime rib cap really packing taste. Seafood entree choices are solid with the sea bass balancing a crispy crust and white tenderness in a rich broth base. The menu is seasonal so ingredients are fresh but dishes variable.  Expect to drop at least 75 for a full meal.  Service is professional and very prompt

This place exemplifies service and food. Unbelievable experience from drinks to dessert. Our server was amazing and extremely helpful in helping pick out the best items on the menu. The vegetable lasagna was like nothing I have ever tasted before. The steak was mouthwatering and the tuna appetizer was the best I've ever had. Well done guild house!!!!

Had a delicious New Year's Eve dinner here, one day early.  Riley was an outstanding server, and our entrees of scallops and salmon wee perfectly prepared.  My gray goose martini was awesome (they had blue cheese stuffed olives-yay!), and we really liked the apple fritter desert.  Not a big fan of the bread with olives (?) baked in.  This is weird, since I LOVE olives!The dining area is relaxing and beautiful.  One star off for having to wait over 10 minutes in the freezing cold anteroom for the valet to get our car, and then pay $10 for it.  This took the glow off of an otherwise exceptional dining experience.

This place is one of my favorites in Columbus! The perfect spot for a cozy anniversary dinner or a small birthday celebration! The decor is to die for and it's attached to Le Meridien hotel which has a great bar and awesome art! All the food at the Guild House is spectacular, but the appetizers are a bit on the small size.  The wine list is expansive, but opt for a signature cocktail instead! They are all delicious and unique. The hospitality here is A+ as well! Like any other Cameron Mitchell establishment, they aim to please. Of course the air conditioning is on full blast (why do all restaurants do this!?) but I dressed for the 80å¡ outdoor weather. The waiter brought down a blanket from the hotel! Follow my food adventures @madeatss on Instagram!
Been here 5 times, breakfast, lunch and dinners, really good food, service was glacially slow every time...

Outstanding lamb burger. If I'm ever back in Columbus, definitely returning to order this again. My side of cauliflower was bland and no sign of the avocado that was listed, but my tequila cocktail was very good. Classy spot, upscale. Perfect for business meals.

Their happy hour must be a well kept secret that's not so secret! Half off the raw, market, and appetizers (basically, half the menu)- a classy place with classy food, great deal!The beets are delish and different from the way most prepare. A healthy portion of both red and golden beets roasted with a bit of granola crunch and light creamy yogurt, served with a few beet chips. So so good, I couldn't even share! The brussels sprouts are also really tasty, especially with the sweet mustard dressing and grated white cheddar on top. The prime rib cap is an amazing deal during happy hour, and the sweet onion relish is addictive and good enough to eat by the fork on it's own. The prime rib itself is seasoned perfectly, although the piece I was served was mostly fat. Not sure I'd pay full price, but I'd get it again during happy hour!Lots of options are extremely fair happy hour prices- highly recommended!

Every time I eat here i get sick. This has gone one since they opened. I wouldn't call the menu groundbreaking. The stuffed chicken is the best thing on the menu. The staff is friendly and orders arrive quickly. Sometimes the flavors are a little off or bland. The space is very nicely done though.
New York ambiance in Columbus.. Love this place for all occasions!All the appetizers - especially the lamb chops have been delicious. Strongly recommend this place for special dinner.

Probably one of the better restaurants in Columbus. I've been visiting Columbus from Chicago a lot with a new Buckeye in the family and have been collecting my favorite places to eat. This is up there among the best meals I've had in Columbus.Breakfast was delicious. Portions are of the small size, but flavors were on point. We ordered the Simply Eggs, Lobster and Eggs and Smoked Chicken Hash. Our favorite is the Smoked Chicken Hash. The tortilla chips were so good, I wish they gave you more of that. The chicken was perfectly seasoned and cooked. I ordered my eggs over hard which I believe is better on this dish than poached.Coffee has to be one of my favorite cups so far. Service was okay. Took them awhile to take our order, but as soon as they realize we were fast movers, they were responsive. My only question would be is the orange juice free? They greet you by offering you orange juice and/or coffee. We were all confused is the orange juice complimentary or would we be charged. They didn't charge us for the 4 cups of coffee so it made it even more confusing.You can tell there is a lot of pride in the restaurant. The decor, the flatware, serve ware, staff, the ambiance has to be by far the best in the city. Definitely not to be missed and would be perfect for a special occasion. Can't wait to try dinner!

My husband and I tried this place for the first time last night and LOVED just about everything that we ate! For appetizers we had the lamb chops that were amazing and cooked medium rare.. not at our request, but it was still delicious! Scallops were good, but I wouldn't get them again. My husband got their pork, which I highly recommend if you like pork! Also, make sure that you save room for dessert because their peanut butter chocolate torte is to die for!!! We can't wait to try this place again and we hope that it's just as good the next time!
Ate here when i stayed at the Joseph last week. Service was good, and it is a beautiful spot. Had breakfast here and it was good! Next time I will try the lobster breakfast dish. I would recommend.

Was really searching for something unique in Columbus. The Guild House delivered. Seated at the bar, solo, for business and this place is HIGHLY recommended. Lauren and Alex behind the bar know to craft a cocktail. Get the RYE. On their recommendation, had the prime rib cap appetizer. Amazing. Absolutely delicious. BTW, this was one of four recommendations from the house. Then, I followed it up with the Sea Bass entree. It's a game changer. Seriously, unlike anything I've ever had. Has a broth that is perfect for fish. Dessert was the crisp merengue. Done here. You won't be disappointed. I'm coming back.

Amazing all around! For a drink order their primm's.  I recommend the toast for an appetizer, ribeye for dinner with cucumbers and tomatoes as your side. Everyone in our party loved what they ordered, you can't go wrong here!The staff also helped us celebrate a birthday.

Came here for brunch. The food is very high quality in taste. I got the lobster and eggs which is a drippy egg served ok top of lobster in a cup of butter which is delicious on their toast. The greens are served very scantily though and the portion sizes are very small. Excellent atmosphere though and great service. Great alcohol ratio in their mimosas too.

Disappointed in The Guild House brunch. We have been for dinner and it was fantastic but I do not recommend wasting your money on brunch. When coming to the guild house you expect a certain level of quality... we walked in and were never offered to have our coats taken, was offered orange juice like it was complementary but it's $5/glass and not fresh, and they served us bacon that was frozen and then microwaved. The main dish was mediocre. Hope to see an improvement as the atmosphere was the only good thing about the meal!
Nice place, a bit of a squeeze for comfort in the big dining room. A little pricy but the food is spectacular. Mature feel and welcoming atmosphere.

We have been to the Guild House two times previously and had good experiences. Our latest reservation was at 9:30 pm on New Years Eve after a Blue Jackets game.  We arrived at 9:05 and were told reservations were running 35 minutes late.  At 9:15 we overhead a customer with an 8:30 reservation ask when he would be seated. With no hope of being seated before 10:15, we left. Not a good way to run an upscale restaurant. Doubt that we'll go back.

Excellent. Awsome atmosphere and menu as well as food and service. I came across this place online looking up the short north and it didnt diappoint. The chicken hash on the breakfast menu was stellar. All the  breakfast looked amazing and i cant wait to come back and try lunch and dinner.

The restaurant is beautiful. Darkly lit, perfect for a date night! We had great service at our table & enjoyed what we ordered. I had the lamb chops with fried rice from the appetizer menu. It was small, but delicious. Overall the portions are small & the prices are high (mine was $18). The menu is also not great for a picky eater! Although our waitress was accommodating and brought my fiancÌ© a grilled chicken breast with mashed potatoes, not on the menu.

I had never been fortunate to enjoy the offerings of THE GUILD HOUSE until Valentine's Day when friends treated me to a memorable lunch.     I've cherished my love of The Pearl since it opened......THE GUILD HOUSE now ranks in the same category of love.   These two are similar bit different....THE GUILD HOUSE opened my eyes with the visuals of the space.   There must be a backstory on the materials, construction and visual appeal that encompasses this highest quality place to be.SERVICE...PROFESSIONAL SERVICE...ULTIMATE PROFESSIONALS begin your experience with the hostess add you enter.As you're seated the sound is dismissed because you are only able to hear those with you.     Being seated by true caring and focused professionals begins your review of the menu....a menu with the daily highlights.When you read or hear menu offerings, ask questions.    You will be guaranteed to learn something new about culinary delights.FOOD, FOOD, FOOD...well you're not courting on Campbell's Soup....PRESENTATION, TASTE and COST are extremely high quality, beautiful, appealing, welcoming, fulfilling extreme offerings that will excite your internal body functions well beyond taste buds.  There are absolutely zero considerations of pricing not being so acceptable and comfortable.   You will have a happy involved belly and an affordable pocket.I believe that when I find something in my world that I'd like others to experience I will always comment.     If you haven't traveled then you will honestly believe you are somewhere other than Columbus when in and enjoying THE GUILD HOUSE.I bet you get the idea one visit and I'm hooked.
Absolutely excellent.   Tried the sea bass croquettes. Not too much quantity but excellent.  But beef hash is plentiful and absolutely fabulous, like a beef burgundy!

Guild house is GORGEOUS on the inside. Plenty of lighting, large front windows overlooking high street and a DJ lightly playing music on this Saturday evening.This restaurant is definitely unique new American and you'd be hard pressed to find any dish on the menu you've truly had somewhere else before.We started with the shrimp and grits stuffed poblano pepper and it was amazing! The shrimp pieces are bite size which I appreciate for ease of eating an appetizer. Not very spicy for those afraid of some heat. Just note this is a smaller appetizer and would NOT serve more than 2 people.They do have an extensive wine list with a few medium priced options (around 42$) and a unique cocktail list.For entrees I had the veggie lasagna. I was definitely expected a red sauced based dish but I was pleasantly surprised. These are house made lasagna noodles and the "sauce" is thick pesto/avocado like layers. It's hard to describe but this dish had the perfect chew feeling to it.Minus a star because the portions are definitely small (with no sides) at a luxuryish price. Set that mindset going in so you won't be disappointed or expecting to walk away stuffed

This place is AMAZING! The ambience was incredible. The place is beautifully decorated and super clean. The menu is unique and well thought out. The service was outstanding. Rezi was our server and she recommended the truffled eggs which is to date the best breakfast I have ever eaten. My husband ate the lobster eggs and he really enjoyed them. I give this establishment 5 stars!

My family had graduation brunch here (on a Monday, thankfully), and we all enjoyed it!  There weren't many people, so our service was very attentive.  The decor is rustic and pretty cool.  I had the Lobster and Eggs, and it really was awesome.  It came in a little glass container, so it added to the dining experience by ensuring each bite was perfectly portioned.  The lobster was tasty and buttered, and the caviar was a nice touch.  I felt very satisfied and not stuffed.  If you like Lobster, this is the one to get for brunch!
First time dining at guild house. Friendly attentive staff. Excellent meals...had Brussels sprouts and parsnip purÌ©e as sides, main entrees were pork and snapper . All were perfectly prepared!

This was my first time in Ohio and I was pleasantly surprised at how lovely this restaurant was. Maybe it's just me being a snobbish New Yorker - I was expecting more Mom & Pop-type joints and horrible chain restaurants to dominate the area. The Guild House was visually stunning (high ceilings, glass partition for the backlit bar, birch log and manzanita branch decor, green glass chandeliers, heavy wood tables, fireplace, soft leather sofa, near-passable fake Eames chairs) and the food was beautifully presented and memorable. I ordered the snapper and BF had the sea bass. The snapper wasn't drowning in brown butter and was almost sinfully succulent and flavorful. The vegetables cut through the richness marvelously. The sea bass, presented in a lobster broth, was a tad bit over-salted for my palate was just fine for the BF. For dessert, we had their signature chocolate cherry sundae, with dark chocolate ice cream, cherry granita, cherry compote, and chocolate cake. The portion was generous for the price ($9) and was definitely meant to share. Our server, Aubry, was super friendly and helpful, and didn't rush us at all. I do have to mention that I felt a little bit overdressed - most people showed up in hoodies and fleece vests, which I found odd. Maybe it's just a regional thing.
Went here for brunch on New Years day 2016.Expensive and small portions - but food is decent.  Expect to either shell out the dough or stop at taco bell on the way hom!

Hostess was horrible, couldn't accommodate a party of 7 at 9 PM on Thursday which wasn't the problem. She was reading a book as she told us she couldn't accommodate, also she didn't make eye contact with us as we stood there in shock. She also came across rude but maybe that's because we interrupted her nightly read. Won't be back.

Last night was my first visit to The Guild House, but it will not be the last. It started at the bar where, I enjoyed a tequila cocktail (highly recommend!). We then sat at our table and started with the Stuffed Poblano. It was the perfect consistency and the creamy flavor was fantastic. For dinner, I had the Salmon and it truly melted in my mouth. My date had the pork entree. He really enjoyed it and it was good, but I prefer the salmon. Dessert was next and we shared the Torte. That Peanut butter mouse was everything!

Everyone I ordered here was great. The seafood was fresh, the wine was exceptional, you definitely feel like you're in a fine dining atmosphere. Our server was exceptional! Highly recommend. It is on the higher end in terms of price point, but it's well worth it

I'm all about atmosphere. I'd give this place an A++. The lighting and decor was to perfection. The food was extremely good. Highly recommend the smoked trout appetizer. I wouldn't normally pick it but a must! I don't have any complaints. Noise level was not high and staff was eager and attentive but let you take your time.

Stopped in for a quick snack.Service was rushed, but friendly.  Food was good, but not breath taking. Atmosphere was lovely.I think I would have enjoyed my experience more, if I wasn't in such a rush. I think the quality is there, unfortunately, we were in and out. Also, having a direct entrance to Le Meridian probably doesn't help, and just exasperated any minor frustrations I had.

Service was the issue. My entree was not what I ordered. The waitress had no excuse. I ate a delicious Sea Bass, instead of scallops. My partner waited over 10 minutes for his entree. Another waitress was hailed- it hadn't been 'fired up'. What?!The menu was soiled- a big no-no in my book. Is this a low end establishment?My partner did not like the corned beef entree- tasted like old, over cooked beef roast with finely chopped vegetables that lacked flavor. The place did offer free valet parking, when asked. The waitress took off the carrot cake dessert and a glass of wine. ( offered after we ordered them).Would we return- for the prices and poor service- no.

Went there this past weekend with some friends. Ordered the chicken and waffles.Once I got my food about 10 minutes after everyone else I was in shock. 4 pieces of chicken (about the size of a chicken nugget) and four pieces of "waffle" about 1inch by 1inch (clearly frozen) as it tasted like cardboard. The syrup however was delicious. I'm the future for how expensive they are, I'll avoid at all costs. Service was good and the atmosphere was great. Others at the table said the food was acceptable to good. Your mileage may vary
Good drinks, heavy on the sweet. Location is beautiful but the meat quality has a long way to go. Do not get the ribeye. The scallops are palatable.
Loved. Small portions but fabulous flavors, great variety with lots of veggies and ambiance was killer.

This place really is great. Went here for my birthday and enjoyed every single bite. I could have ordered just about everything on the menu. We settled on the cheese plate and hummus for apps, and the ribeye and scallops for dinner. The scallops were the best I've ever had!! I absolutely loved them. We also ordered the cocktail for two and a bottle of wine. I highly highly recommend the cocktail for two. It changes seasonally so no guarantees what you'll get, but it was the best cocktail I've ever had. Amazing flavors. That being said, our server wasn't great. He seemed pretty ambivalent about the whole thing, forgot to tell us the special, messed up my order, didn't know what was in the cocktail, etc. I would have expected more polished servers at a place like this. But it didn't deter me too much. They had the correct order out within a few minutes, and the food really made up for any personnel issues.

Probably my favorite current restaurant in Columbus. The guild house is a special restaurant located in the heart of the short north. It's a concept that falls nothing short of what you might expect of a Cameron Mitchell restaurant. From walking in, you are really transported into a warm environment. From the candles to leather couches, no detail has been spared. The service is friendly, but not standoffish, and the menu is delicious. A local concept, the guild house attempts to use primarily local foods in its menu. The one downside is that I have not noticed the menu changing too often, so it can get a bit repetitive... But it's only a problem if you return far too often as I have for brunch, lunch and dinner! Check out the cocktail for two as well! The porthole infuser is a unique touch I've only seen at the Aviary in Chicago.

Around this time last year, reservations at The Guild House were pretty difficult to come by. Fast forward a year to Memorial Day 2016, and they're already offering 1000 point reservations on OpenTable and sending out 30% off coupons by e-mail. I'm guessing that despite all the stellar reviews on Yelp that say something to the extent of "It's amazing just because it's a Cameron Mitchell restaurant!", the Guild House's flaws are starting to show. They're not bad in the sense of needing a 1 or 2 star review. But they're just... ok. They're really missing some of the magic that the more established Cameron Mitchell restaurants have. Living in the Midwest, I've never gone home hungry from a restaurant... until I went to the Guild House. My biggest gripe with this restaurant is how small their dishes are. If you dine here with a child, try ordering their kid's hamburger. There's a pretty good chance that the kid's meal will be larger than whatever $30 adult plate that you order for yourself. That's just ridiculous. I'm not entirely against expensive meals. I'll easily drop $50/person for a meal... as long as I feel that the meal is worth it. I do not feel that a meal here is worth it. I'm also not a huge fan of their menu... it's small, limited, and lacks a clear theme other than "Expensive stuff." Really, really... meh.

The Guild House is the Le Meridian, The Joseph's hotel restaurant. However you cannot bill the check to your room so bring your credit card. I ate breakfast (menu based) here two days in a row on the weekend and was pleased both times. The orange juice ($5) is worth a mention - it was so good! One day I got the Smoked Chicken Hash ($13). The portion was rather small, but the flavors were delicious. It comes with 2 poached eggs, sweet potatoes, bacon, roasted poblano, caramelized onions, gouda, salsa verde and is topped with a few corn chips. Definitely a go to menu item. The other day I tried to get something more substantial and succeeded by ordering the Farmer's Market Omelet ($14). While make your own omelet was an available option, this one was filled with rosemary ham, various wild mushrooms and goat cheese. It was served with a side of good, fresh, properly ripe seasonal fruit and a choice of white or wheat toast. If you're still hungry, opt for more OJ or split the Pecan Roll. The decor of the restaurant is also very pleasing and decorated quite lavishly and comfortably. Staff was friendly and the manager recognized us on our return visit. Window seating provides great views of High St.

Ever had a menu described to you like poetry? The staff at the Guild House have a treat for you. This trendy spot is conveniently located next to the Le Meridien hotel and in the Short North district. Started our lunch off with the Prime Rib Caps ($15) and Toast ($9). The 4 oz of prime rib was delicious. I think of the two dishes, the toast took first place. The bread was perfectly seasons and topped with avocado spread and cheese. It was hard to not down all four pieces immediately. The lunch entrees were the Chicken Roulade ($16) and the Meatloaf ($13). The Chicken Roulade was tasted like a chicken paste wrapped in a thin slice of chicken. It complemented the mash potatoes and greens on the side well. Overall felt like a light dish and didn't feel bloated after. The Meatloaf was a little heavier. There was a mix of flavored from the different seasonings, and maybe the meats, that the meatloaf consisted of. Overall liked the Chicken Roulade better. For dessert we had the Seasonal Donuts ($7). The three donuts each had a unique flavor that provided a good variety while not clashing tastes with one another. My favorite was the glazed donut. A very simple choice but it was delicious. Light and fluffy with a soft after taste of glaze. TL&DR; Great place to go out for a nice lunch or dinner. Suitable for a first date or meal out with friends. The staff had an excellent skill to describe every dish, so you will be able to imagine it before you even get it!
It's expensive, but it's worth it. I had Pork the first time and Ribeye the second time. I look forward to going again. Great atmosphere, great music.

what? Only 5 stars available?Clearly, hands down, the Finest restaurant experience I have had in 2016. 1. Later dining available. Yay! A 9pm seating that wasn't treated like "please leave we want to go home"!2. Attentive, pleasant valet parkers - albeit expensive. My only criticism. Dining should warrant at least a discount. 3. A DJ when you walk in the door. This is amazing. A handsome, cool, dude making sure a hip vibrancy resonated through the restaurant. 4. Service. Thank you Ryland for your attentive and very personal touches. (ask him to take your pic and he includes a selfie). Fine dining without stuffiness IS possible. 5. The food, the food, the food. Ahi tuna ribbons, rib eye cap, sea bass, stuffed poblano (a little too much "bread"inside), pork cheeks...un-be-freaking-lievable.Creative, well presented, executed, spot on.6. Price. Granted, we did not order a bottle of wine and CM is rather well known for high wine prices, but we had 3 cocktails, and 4 glasses of wine for the table and the bill was VERY reasonable for a fine dining experience at less than $100 per personUnless you prefer quiet, sedate surroundings (it is loud here) and ubiquitous food offerings, I cannot fathom anyone not loving this.

Whether I'm looking to take a client out to lunch or impress a date, The Guild House is my go to spot! The impeccable service, hand crafted cocktails and their trendy, yet sophisticated menu make The Guild House one of Central Ohio's premier restaurants in my eyes!

I was in town for Glass Problems Conference and came in for business dinner on Election Day as recommended by a local friend. The restaurant was popular and difficult to find a big table unless you called ahead for reservation. We ordered several appetizers (Duck PatÌ¬, Smoked trout, artichoke hummus and Prime rib cap) to share. I had Snapper for entrÌ©e. I meant to finished the review earlier, but forgot to finish. I don't remember what deserts we sampled as a group, but everything tasted great here.

I visited The Guild House for brunch today. I definitely walked out impressed. First of all, it's a beautiful physical space. The backlit bar, the wooden structures, Persian rugs and green glass chandeliers all add to the trendy atmosphere. The Guild House is undeniably classy, but maintains a comfortable and non-stuffy kind of vibe.Their attention to detail was remarkable. This was true in regards to the service. My water and coffee were refilled frequently. The dishes and checks also came out efficiently. The waiters' uniforms, with their bow ties and suspenders, were a good look. Maybe i'll rock the bow tie and suspenders look sometime soon.  In terms of food, I ordered the farmers market omelet consisting of rosemary ham, wild mushrooms and goat cheese ($14). The mushrooms were truly the star of the dish. It was delicious, yet clean without being oily. The accompanying fruit plate was also very fresh and tasty. I have to say, Cameron Mitchell does it again. It may be a pricier restaurant, but it's worth it in my opinion. Just for service and atmosphere, you're getting your money's worth. I'll definitely be back for dinner.

My boyfriend and I found ourselves in Columbus for our anniversary due to family events going on the same weekend. We asked locals for a recommendation and the Guild House was at the top of the list. It did not disappoint. Being from Michigan and having a die hard U of M fan as a boyfriend I know he was looking for something to be wrong with the experience. No issues found. I would simply encourage having a reservation and be open to trying unfamiliar menu items. Sitting against the sidewalk window makes for great people watching, too!!

This was a delicious and fun restaurant. We had steak and sea bass. The waiter was knowledgeable and made recommendations when we asked, which I like. We had the pea cake because it was a Columbus specialty, but I'd pass next time.

I went here with a friend on a Sunday night, the place was pretty empty (Sunday night) and thus there was less staff and it was kind of slow. the aesthetics of the place was beautiful and the atmosphere was very hip and relaxed.The food we ate was phenomenal, we had the Burrata Toast, seasonal Brussels sprouts, scallops, ricotta gnochi and the honey cake. All of the food was absolutely delicious, with the scallops being extremely decadent and buttery--it was phenomenal.My only feedback (aka 4 stars) is that although its a high end restaurant, the portions (especially for their entrees) was quite small and my friend and I wasn't full after the meal despite. In addition, we wanted to get one of their special drinks but they were out :/Overall, I would say this place is a good choice for something really special.

This place deserves 5 stars. The service is top notch. The atmosphere and decor is extremely inviting, upscale, yet still comfortable. And the food was amazing! The menu was creative but not intimidating. The quality of my smoked salmon was spectacular. I highly recommending coming here! And an extra bonus is the $10 valet. We all know parking in the short north is a nightmare, so this is a huge benefit in my opinion!
Looks like a four star restaurant. The food tasted ok. Service was excellent   Atmosphere very nice. Had the chopped salad and it was good.  It great however.

I thought I'd put some time into this Guild House review. I mean it's a CMR, am I right?! Actually, I had two meals here, dinner and breakfast the next day, and I'd say they were both pretty consistently four stars.When I stopped in for dinner with my parents, the place was pretty packed, but in a fun way, and everything was completely upscale casual, so it didn't feel too stuffy. Our waiter was pretty funny but maybe not the most sociable, but that's okay, I'm their to eat, not make friends. We started off with the tuna ribbons, stuffed poblano, and pork cheeks. I really liked all three, but the stuffed poblano was really my favorite. The flavor in that pepper was awesome, and I'm not much of a shrimp person. The tuna ribbons were tasty but a very small portion, and the pork cheeks were a bit heavier than I was expecting in the tomato gravy.For the main course, my girlfriend and I had the ribeye, my mom had a prime rib cap special, and my dad went with the vegetable lasagna. Once again, all of the dishes were pretty good, but I can't say they were my absolute favorites. The ribeye is cut from the eye, and it looks more like a filet, so don't be surprised when you receive it. It was pretty thick, so only the very inside was medium rare for me. Everyone loved my dad's vegetable lasagna, which is definitely non-traditional. It comes with a mushroom based sauce rather than a red sauce and an asparagus pesto. It was very tasty.The chocolate-peanut butter torte I had for dessert was incredible as was the cheesecake. They also offer a doughnut plate, which seemed to be pretty popular based on the tables around us.BREAKFAST:This was very much the same in terms of food. None of the plates were very big, but they packed great flavor. I went with the B.E.L.T. which was probably the least favorite of the group, while my girlfriend's smoked chicken hash was awesome. I wish I had ordered that and ate most of her's. The eggs benedict was very flavorful as well. As far as pricing goes, I don't really see this place as breaking the bank. Yes, you can come here on special occasions, but it's not nearly as bad as some other high end restaurants in town, including a lot of Cameron's other places. You don't go as much in the portion size, but it's clear you're getting high-quality ingredients in some very creative ways. If you're looking to have a MEGA feast, this just ain't your place. The ambiance inside as well as the professionalism of the staff, which you'd expect at a CMR, was very welcoming. I'd highly recommend bringing someone from out of town here, since it's a very fun and sophisticated atmosphere. Cameron Mitchell did a great job with this one.

The Guild House is OK. The ambiance is spectacular, but that's what you pay for. Serving sizes are a joke, (you really need to have a 5-course meal to be anywhere near full). Serivce is amazing, but you can tell the staff is not being treated well by management. I've overheard some conversations from the staff, and I feel bad for them. Restrooms are in the kitchen, which seems strange for an 'upscale' restaurant.

THE BEST RESTAURANT so far we had in Columbus! With all the flowers, mirrors, candles, paintings and beautiful people, it's like waking into a dream. We had Tuna and steak, with the most creative cocktail ever. This is our second dinner so we didn't order much, but the waitress was very patient and helpful even with small orders Double thumbs up!!

Truly exceptional service and food. Came here for brunch. The poached eggs with asparagus and local mushrooms were delicious. We had a wonderful waiter who was so eloquent with his descriptions of the dishes and at one point my wife said "I'll just have the basic eggs benedict," to which he replied "nothing is basic here" and went on to explain where every ingredient comes from and how the dish is prepared. Really good place. We also took some lunch items to go and really enjoyed the sandwiches on our road trip later in the day.

Gorgeous decor. Servers are exceptional - both friendly and knowledgeable. The drinks were exceptional. They have an extensive fresh ingredients ... section? ... in the bar. Tell the bartender what kind of mood you're on or flavors you like and they'll whip something up. The food was delicious. We only ordered the seafood/fish dishes and they were each exceptional. I can't wait to go back and try some of the other items made from land animals!

I love any CMR's, they all are very different and details never go unnoticed. The atmosphere is peaceful and charming. My friend and I split 2 appetizer and their special, the duck. The Brussel sprouts were fantastic and the smoked trout spread was a wonderful concoction. The duck was ok. And I have never had bad service at any CMR. Wonderful upscale restaurant.

Group of 8 celebrating an anniversary and a good friend in town. We had a great table in the back with the wrap-around couch. Highly recommend a reservation, was nearly fully booked 3 weeks out--though it didn't seem super busy when there.We lucked out in the bar and 6 bar seats were open when we came in; 20 min later it was completely packed with no standing room. Big kudos for the non-alcoholic drinks...this pregnant lady felt a little left-out until hubby pointed out "zero proof". Ordered the berry bramble-very refreshing and the bitters reminds you of a cocktail. The group loved the Pimms, a nice twist on the classic and a good light start to dinner...so I'm told.Hubby and I started with the Stuffed Poplano. Oh geeez, this was better than my entree. The corn, tomato gave balanced the smokiness of the pepper. So good!Dinner:Prego lady had fewer options, so scallops it was. It was a beautiful plate, but it left a little to be desired. The puree needed a little more salt and I preferred some of the preparations I've had elsewhere. The carrots didn't really seem to match scallops.Hubby went with ribeye, it appeared cooked to ordered (RARE!) and he ate it all. This isn't bone-in and at 7oz seems about right without the meat coma and sweats. Others ordered the ricotta gnocci, oysters, french onion dip, pork cheeks, more scallops and ribyeye.Then came dessert...a disappointment and actually a negative ending to dinner.I had the carrot cake, I had in my head that traditional carrot cake, esp the carrot cake from the Fish Market when CMR. Nope. Deconstructed mess. The pic doesn't even look appetizing. My favorite part of carrot cake, is actual shredded carrot, this cake had more ginger taste. The portion though small was not finished between hubby and me; just wasn't worth it.Another couple had the donuts. It appeared that we ate them, but it was actually everyone tasting them and remarking that they were not good. I know the reviews are raving about these...but these must have sat all day (or more). To the this pregnant lady with her intensified taste buds it tasted like oil...like when the oil is bad and old...and then anything you fry in it just tastes like oil. Table consensus was "take us to krispy kreme or schneider's". The flourless torte was reported as meh. Seriously, let's fix these desserts!All in all, I loved the decor and ambiance. Server was a bit slow, but we weren't in a hurry--seated around 7:30 and we weren't done eating until almost 11. Valet took 30 min to get our car when we left---1 valet working. They took our car with no issues, of course. Get it together! Thankfully, I went to the hotel lobby and just sat. I was joined by the others also waiting for valet.I'll try it again, but think they have a few kinks to work out. Until then, you can find me across the street at The Pearl.

Recently moved from Philadelphia, and I have to say this restaurant matches up with some of Philly's finest! From the tasteful decor to the attentive waitstaff, The Guild House is nothing short of impressive. My favorite item on the menu has to be ricotta gnocchi. The presentation is beautiful and the pasta literally melts in your mouth. Another memorable item was the flatbread crafted with a light flaky crust and the white bean puree was full of flavor. You can't leave this place without trying dessert. We sampled the torte and couldn't put our forks down. Can't wait to come back!

Been here twice. This is the place to entertain work guests. First time was excellent, second time was acceptable. Food is always great. Expect complicated dishes that are, by and large, fantastic. The duck pate is particularly awesome. (Thank you for having duck!) Beautifully designed interior; definitely stealing some ideas.My boss complained that the wine took too long to get to the table, however, I don't drink =P

At the airport 2.5h after having salmon prepared the way the chef wanted. I eat salmon 4-5x per week and never have a problem. Flying should be fun given I shouldn't be more than 5' from a toilet from food poisoning.

Glad I got to go! Reservation was easy to make online, and when my boyfriend and I got there, we were seated right away with no problems. We had a pretty decent meal! For appetizers we got the chips and French onion dip (it was alright, nothing special, although the dip was good), and pork cheeks with tomato gravy and spaghetti squash (tomato sauce was a bit overpowering, and the amount of pork was small even for an appetizer). For entrees, boyfriend got the lamb burger (he said it was pretty good, ordered it a medium and it was a good medium), and I got the chicken roulade. I was pretty happy with the chicken roulade. It was pretty on my plate, and had a good purÌ©e and vegetables that went with it. For dessert, we got the 3 seasonal donuts, and I am super happy about that choice. They were delicious, not too sweet, not too heavy, and the perfect way to top off the meal. Price overall was decent, our entrees were $17 and $21 each but there were certainly some more expensive options. The decor inside was beautiful, with a modern but rustic feel to it. I don't often notice the plates...but I thought they were pretty! Service was alright. Right after we ordered our appetizers, 2 waiters came by with soups and the Brussels sprouts appetizer, neither of which we ordered. We told them we didn't order either or those dishes, and they looked really confused and asked "aren't you table 11?" We finished our appetizers (the ones we actually ordered) and then no one came around to get our orders for entrees; we had to flag our waitress down. We later received our desserts...and probably 1 min later our waitress came by with our check. We hadn't even taken 2 bites of our dessert yet and felt like we were being rushed. I'm not usually super picky about service, but it kinda threw me off here. Our waitress was super nice though, and overall our experience was pleasant.

The Guild House is one of my favorite restaurants in Columbus for one reason: the atmosphere. From the moment you walk through the large wooden doors, it hits you... this place is cool. The low-lit bar covering the entire wall could be a backdrop for a James Bond film. The rest of the restaurant is covered in reclaimed wood and bright white furniture which provides a great palette for the pops of color like the pale green chandeliers scattered across the ceiling. I'd say the menu suffers from a bit of an identity crisis, unsure of whether it wants to be hip, progressive, or classic American upscale, but it's all very enjoyable still. The cocktails also seem to rotate across a wide range of flavor profiles but one thing you can always count on is the seasonal "cocktail for two" which never disappoints. It's worth getting just to see how they present it. From start to finish, it's a great location for a date night or valentine's day, just be sure to book way in advance on popular holidays.

Check out their trendy cocktails. Tequila was quite interesting. Service is spot on, food pops with flavor. Expect quality dining with gourmet portions. Loved the smoked trout. On my list of favorites in Columbus

Had 1pm reservations on my birthday last month. We got to the restaurant a few minutes before 1, and were told, along with three other couples, that they were turning tables and it would be a few minutes. By 1:10, the other three couples had been seated. By 1:30, two other couples had walked in and been seated in front of us. The final straw came when yet another couple walked in WITHOUT reservations and were seated while we still stood in the doorway waiting. When we asked why we hadn't been seated yet, we were told by the hostess that there wasn't any particular order in which people were seated. We left at that point. Guild House has been my favorite restaurant in the Short North since it opened, but we won't be back. Emailed the restaurant the next day and was told that I would be getting a phone call to discuss further, but that was 3 weeks ago, and I haven't heard another word.

Definitely a great ambiance, the appetizers we had were out of this world (tuna ribbons and pork cheeks), they were really really good.I am making this a four star because my business associate had a fish dish that he really really liked, it was a little crunchy in the right places.I had the beef and it was good but not out of this world, I think when you eat at as many restaurants and have so many steaks, you begin to measure them against each other.  The beef was cooked pretty good (med-rare), the potato bed it was sitting on was fantastic - I think I am not a fan of duck pate that was on the beef and would rather have had a butter base or something.Server Eric was phenomenal, super nice guy and very very knowledgeable about the area and the wines - he is definitely an asset to the organization.We will definitely be back, I think in this case I will focus on the seafood next time - great experience.Oh yeah - the dessert was crazy good, we had a chocolate peanut butter kind of thing, it was decadent too.

definitely come here for happy hour! 3-6 weekdays. Service is little slow at that time but well worth the price. Skip the duck pate and order the prime rib appetizer. Most of the happy hour dishes are very small so order 2-3 a person.

Lets start by saying that I am a Cameron Mitchell fan.That being said....do not beleive all of the hype on this place.Saturday afternoon and there were 2 yes 2 people in the place. You would that this would lead to great service? No.Sat at the bar where no less than 7 servers and bartenders congregated but not to provide service.The drink menu is lacking. When you do get a drink there is little to no alcohol in it.Appetizers.....Brussel Sprouts had no flavor. Stuffed Poblano was not stuffed it was cut in half and topped which means that you are really getting half of an appetizer. The Prime Rib Cap was excellent in flavor but cam with exactly 3 bites in the serving.After this showing we decided that an entree would be the same disaster, so after waiting 20 more minutes for less than stellar service to just pay the bill.... we were out.Go to Cameron Mitchell, but not this one. ALL HYPE.
Yes food was excellent. and a nice place. I do wish the waiter was a little quicker in getting our drinks.

Food fantastic. Staff exceptional. Samantha (Sammy) was the best server we could have hoped for. It was our 13 year wedding anniversary and they made it special, romantic, and super flavorful. My wife was over the moon which made me look good. Thank you to the entire Guild House staff. We will be back....... A lot.   Hmmm maybe I should book now.

Pretty but not tasty.  The lunch here is like a loud, fussy child that's not yours.  It's somehow cute but really annoying and liable to make a mess all over you.  The menu needs something more substantive and basic than the pretentious.  I predict this menu will change soon in order to survive.The quality overall is good but not fantastic.  Prices are outrageous, even for the Short North.  I think the concept is to "wow" an out of town guest staying at the hotel (or here for a convention) with a pretty atmosphere so as to maximize the drainage on their expense account.  The dining room is really stunning with a French country, distressed wood thing.  It's really pretty but this is not a place to have a good meal.  It's a place to have a drink with a date before you walk somewhere to eat real food that doesn't irritate you.The club sandwich had too many things going on and the steak salad was good but also a mix of so many flavors as to be annoying.  Much better places to eat in this area.

I wanted to like Guild House, but unfortunately both times I went I left disappointed. First time, service was slow and inattentive (and the place was not crowded). Food was meh, my friend really did not like her lasagna. Second time I went the service was better (it was a business lunch). I got a sandwich which just did not seem very fresh at all. Overall there are much, much better choices.

I'm noticing a trend - Cameron Mitchell restaurants seem to have GREAT happy hour menus! Came here with a happy hour group last week, and was pleasantly surprised at their delicious and affordable options for happy hour deals. When I first looked at the regular menu online, I was worried that I'd walk away with a hole in my wallet as well as my stomach, but they have a ton of great specials. All of their starters and appetizers were half off, as well as their specialty cocktails and glasses of wine! This means that we got the benefit of a lovely environment, delicious food, and fantastic service for at least half the price. Our waiter told us that Gordon Ramsay had been in the month prior and instagram'd a picture of their prime rib appetizer -- it's THAT GOOD. Two of my friends got this, and they both agreed that it was absolutely delicious. I had the stuffed pepper, which was really good but the poblano was surprisingly hot (they are variable in heat so it's no one's fault). My gin cocktail was refreshing and not too sweet. I really like that their signature cocktails revolve around different kinds of liquor for the base. I tried a sip of the bourbon cocktail with grapefruit, and that was well balanced too. $10 for a cocktail is too rich for my blood, but for $5 it was a steal. We had a great time! The happy hour is from 3-6 pm, so get here early. The restaurant was starting to fill up around 6:30pm. Also, one of the nicest bathrooms I've seen if such things are important to you. Very pleased with this swanky addition to Columbus!

If you want to experience a rich atmosphere, spacious seating, and of course quality food and drinks, Guild house is a your kind of dining experience. Loved that the server was so attentive as well. PS good Bloody Mary's
The food is so ordinary. I came to this place because I saw it had great reviews. However, the taste of the food disappointed me. Nothing special. Won't go there for breakfast again.
column12: What an awesome date night location. I hear it's new, but it really seems like they have their shit together. But hey, I guess that's what you always get when it's a Cameron Mitchell restaurant!Menu is a little small for me unfortunately. However, what I was interested in trying did end up being delicious. Actually the vegetable lasagna BLEW MY MIND. I thought I was going to get some sort of eggplant marinara sauce dish... But oh, this was so much better. And to top it off all it had POTATO CHIPS ON TOP! What! Are you serious! It was awesome. Also ordered was the lamb burger. The person I was with loves lamb, and he actually brought me here just so he could eat that burger again. So I think it's safe to say that it is drool worthy. I tried it and definitely appreciated the arugula mixture on top.  So overall what I'm trying to tell you is GO HERE!! But don't be like me and wear cut off shots with a plaid shirt. I was wayyyyyy under dressed. Whoops!

column6: People know Cameron Mitchell's greatness. People trust in Cameron Mitchell's greatness. People expect Cameron Mitchell's greatness. What makes him and his CMR the King of Columbus restaurants is that he and his dedicated team never let their believers down. I waited so long to make this review for The Guild House, not only because a real extraordinary restaurant needs multiple tests but also because I could not resist to try the next item on the menu before I can even reach my phone (lol). The Guild House is somewhere you would recommend to a true friend when he needs some delightfulness in life, somewhere you would celebrate your most important reunions, somewhere you would take your first date to impress her. From the hostess who greets you with a genuine smile to the server who serves you everything right when you need it, from the manager who folds every napkin neatly before the guest returns to the line cook who quietly does everything he could to serve your food at its best. I never think extraordinary restaurants make their names simply by a talented chef and his/her magical recipes. It is always a whole team of great people (everyone of them) that builds your unforgettable experiences second by second, step by step, dish by dish, and time after time.Why does every Cameron Mitchell's restaurant have a team of such Great People Delivering Genuine Hospitality? Because magic is real.

This place is starting to turn into my favorite Cameron Mitchell gem. Cocktails are creative & delicious. Happy hour is amazing. Service always impeccable. Lots of gluten free options for the bestie too. Gnocchi dish was my favorite only 2nd to the lamb lollipops. A great place for a girls night to share all the goodies. I've never had anything here I didn't like. Love the seasonal changes of cocktails & main dishes as well. Cameron Mitchell never disappoints.

The Guild House is a new restaurant in the short north area. My wife and I went for dinner very late on Saturday night and we were seated relatively quickly. The waiter was very polite and professional. He suggested the oyster appetizers, which I liked very much (my wife thought they were decent, but not great). We also shared a green salad with beets and goat cheese, which was excellent! They don't have automatic bread service here, so you have to ask for it, but the bread was good (a little salty, actually). For dinner, I had the chilean sea bass, which was made in a lobster broth, with carrots, leeks, and radish. It was a small portion, but it was outstanding. My wife ordered the chicken roulade, which gave four generous portions of cylindrical looking pieces stuffed with celery root purÌ©e, romanesco, wild mushrooms, and truffles, in some sort of a reduction. I think it was equally good. The ambience of the restaurant is modern and hip. The only complaint I had was that we were seated next to a gaggle of college girls who appeared to be a bit drunk and very loud. Worse still, the girl seated right next to my wife had a voice so shrill it could shatter a few windows ;-). To be fair, they seemed nice, but just ridiculously loud. What was surprising was that with so many open seats in the restaurant we'd be seated right next to such a large party in the first place. Anyway, this is a new modern restaurant with an interesting and creative menu. It is definitely worth a repeat visit.
Beautiful venue, spacious high ceilings, modern decor. Delicious, unpretentious and tasty Americana. Wonderful service with a smile. Easy. Peasy.

We were back in Columbus visiting family and decided to dine at the Guild House for our "night for ourselves" dinner. We throughly enjoyed our dinner but it's pretty obvious that a Cameron Mitchell restaurant is never going to take any huge chances. We started with the Tuna Ribbons which is very similar to tuna poke, minus the wonton/rice chips most places serve with it. The tune was exceptional and the sauce brought the whole dish together. Next we had the Prime Rib Cap which was my favorite dish. The prime rib was perfect and the blue cheese worked well. I went with the sea bass. I felt a bit guilty that it was from Chile with the whole "over fished" controversy but went ahead got it. It was just okay. I found the whole dish to be a bit salty and the lobster was really lost among the other ingredients. My partner had the pork but he found the sour apple cabbage and apricots added too much "citrus" and acidity. By itself the pork was good but the other items in the dish overtook the pork. We ended the meal with the cheese plate which was underwhelming. The "house made" crackers weren't anything special and the cheeses were pretty boring. Our sever, Audrey, was nice but didn't really seem to willing to interact with us much. The restaurant is very nice inside with the "rustic" meets "chick" style that's been the "go to" style for a lot of new restaurants. And I have to mention that their martinis are very expensive for the amount they give you.I was hoping Guild House would elevate the Columbus dining scene but instead it just settles in with all the other good restaurants in the city.
Very tasty food.  Best tasting food of all the Cameron Mitchell restaurants I've been to.  Our waitress was great and very pleasant.  Definitely a place to go for a nice dinner!

Went to Guild House during the week for a business lunch. Seated right away by a friendly and attentive hostess. The server came out some minutes later and introduced himself and the restaurant since they are less than a year old.I was not particularly impressed with the menu and didn't just want to get a sandwich or a burger.  As a table we ordered two of the prime rib tip appetizer to share 5 ways. It was nicely flavored and cooked, they even brought one medium and one med rare. I went on a limb and ordered the chicken roulade. Rolled chicken isn't usually my preference but the menu was minimalistic. This is to be expected though for a local fare farm to table place.I was slightly underwhelmed, though it did taste pretty good, I'm not sure what I was expecting. But it missed the mark for me.The service was quite good though, refills on point, waiter was knowledgeable of menu and food.Will likely return to try a different dish, see if they can't snag that 5th star from me.

The guild house has a great atmosphere and decor. All Cameron Mitchell restaurants have excellent servers that are extremely attentive and knowledgeable. I have been for brunch and lunch. I had an omelette at brunch that I thought was ok, but my friend LOVED hers. I had meatloaf for lunch that was extremely good and I recommend it! Also, for dessert we had a fall trifle that was out of this world! Perfect place for a special occasion or brunch with the girls. I recommend making a reservation!

The food was decent, but there were a few things that rubbed me the wrong way. I asked about an ingredient in their flatbread, and the waitress was like "yeah, of course it has that..it'd be weird if it didn't." I get that servers probably get asked a lot of annoying questions, but I didn't think that I was being terribly out of line for making sure that the food didn't have ingredients I couldn't eat. When I didn't finish the tomato hummus (which wasn't stellar), she again asked "Oh, you didn't like it?" The tone was that of "I can't believe you didn't finish this why are you even here please go away" rather than "I'm genuinely concerned that this dish might not have been up to par for our restaurant." The tuna was good and beautifully plated, and people in my party all seemed to have a decent time. I liked that it was open late, and they can accommodate large parties. I just think the service could be improved a bit.

We arrived for our 6:45 reservation only to be asked to sit at the bar for "a couple minutes"  until a table opens up. We sat there, enjoying very good and reasonably priced cocktails for over 30 minutes before finally asking the host what was happening. He then sat us promptly. Our server checked in quickly and remained very attentive throughout the meal. We had two very good appetizers, the brussel sprouts and the toast with duck, brie, and honey. Our pasta entrees, however, were mediocre at best. We opted to avoid the other entrees which were quite obviously overpriced (see other reviews). The gnocchi were pillow soft and the orecchiette tasted very fresh and both were served in edible but significantly oversalted sauces. As other reviewers have mentioned the portions were very small, probably around 6oz of cooked pasta. With such inexpensive base ingredients as found in a pasta dish (gnocchi, beans, shaved carrot, roasted red pepper) the portions were wholly inadequate. Finally, the loud electronic music was deeply unpleasant and out of sync with the decor. The DJ's selections forced everyone we could see to shout to one another across their tables. Go for cocktails or appetizers if you must, but avoid any nights with a DJ and head elsewhere for your dinner.

Last week, after making reservations on Open Table for 5:00 because 6:00 was not available, we met another couple for dinner here on Saturday night.  It is a lovely space, with large windows to see onto High Street, white leather seating, and chandeliers.  Since we arrived before our friends, we sat at the bar to have a drink.  I love that Pimm's is on the drink menu because it's not commonly found.  They offer several House Cocktails and I chose the Vodka, served in a martini glass and very good.  The bartenders were young and nice enough.Our server was a sweet young lady in her 20's.  We were served bread with butter.  The bread wasn't soft, but tasted pretty good since I was hungry.  Our table shared the Pork Cheeks and Brussels Sprouts to start.  Since I don't eat pork, I only sampled the spaghetti squash from that bowl, and ate a large portion of the Brussels Sprouts, which were crispy and delicious.I had planned on the Salmon entree, but actually got that evening's special, which was Halibut served with vegetables.  Three out of four in our party had the halibut and one had the salmon.  Everyone enjoyed the entrees very much.  They have two separate ladies rooms, which is nice, since they are both single rooms.  When we left after 6:00, there were many empty tables, so of course we wondered why we couldn't get reservations at that time.It was a nice dinner and although I am not dying to go back soon, it will be an option for a special occasion.

This was my first dining experience at what everyone was telling me was a fantastic new place to eat in the short north. I had visited previously for cocktails and absolutely loved it. So naturally I was excited to experience the other side of the house. But my expectations were ruined right from the start of our evening.We made reservations for 8 o'clock arrived a little bit before 8 and checked in with our hostess. We were a group of 4 and this was supposed to be a special occasion dinner. The hostess said they were running about 10 min behind, not. A if deal at all, so we naturally went to the bar to drink their fabulous cocktails...and again were not disappointed in the least. The guild houses bar and decor is where the restaurant really shines. However we were at the bar for a full 60 min before we were seated. I checked in with the hostess twice, being told that we were the next table...even though 20 min went by before we actually were sat. The final time I checked with the hostess she didn't even look at me when speaking even though I hadn't been rude at all. Checking in twice when waiting an hour past your reservation isn't uncalled for in my humble opinion. Before we were seated the manager did come and tell us that they would comp us some appetizers which was gracious and I appreciated the apology. I wish I would've gotten an apology from a hostess instead of the attitude of "leave me alone". My issue with being comped the appetizers is that we wouldn't have ordered appetizers...It would have been more appropriate to comp the drinks that we paid for while waiting for our table. I'll stop with the wordy review here. The ambiance and the drinks are fabulous. The food was nothing impressive. As another reviewer had stated the portions are tiny for what you pay for. I orders the prime rib which was 36 dollars and looked at most like 6 oz of meet with three tiny potatoes on the side. Again I appreciate what the acknowledgement of the wait that we had to encounter but I don't think I'll ever go back to the guild house for more than their cocktails. It's overpriced and underwhelming. Sorry Cameron, this one still needs a lot of work.

The food was good, but nothing spectacular or what one would expect based on the price and atmosphere.  The menu is somewhat limited and the items really don't go with the atmosphere.  The dinners were especially lacking in variety.  I actually ordered a few appetizers instead.  Many more options to choose from in the area, but I will still go back.  Perhaps only for an app and a drink at the bar.  Overall, it is a beautiful establishment.
So the food was fabulous BUT who wants to pay $10 to park ($15 if you give the valet a tip).

We made a reservation at 7:45 on a Thursday. It was packed when we got there! Not a table was open. It is a great atmosphere and draws a slightly older crowd - probably due to price point. We tried several different dishes - Cheese Plate, Brussel Sprouts, Flatbread and the Pork Cheeks. The Pork Cheeks were the best by far! The meat was super tender and the sauce was perfect. The flat bread was decent. I probably would not get it again.Our waiter was very personable and attentive. He was super helpful when recommending different dishes from what is most popular to his favorites. Overall it was a positive experience. It is great for a night out with friends or a date night.

My first time at the Guild House, I ordered the raw oysters, and the kale and roasted vegetable salad. Excellent choices--the raw oysters were some of the best I've ever had. The drinks were great, the atmosphere is relaxing, and the decorum is barn, shabby chic. I highly recommend--I look forward to my next visit.

Fabulous food, beautiful presentation, fun sophisticated modern feel, very attentive and accommodating staff. We were casually dressed, and they set us up with a table for 10 kids, and another separate table for 10 adults. Both tables had a blast. Favorites: oysters, smoked trout, scallops, prime rib, tomato cucumber salad, great French fries, apple fritters- YUM! Lauren is amazing, she orchestrated a fun and delicious evening for us all.

Cameron Mitchell does it again! My colleagues have been raving about this new restaurant so I decided to give it a try. I am glad to say it lived up to the hype! The decor is beautiful, the service was on point, and the food was fantastic. Highly recommend the brussels sprouts and the smoked trout for starters. The cavatelli with rabbit confit was cooked well but was missing a little something. My dinner companions ordered the ribeye and both left very satisfied. Highlights of the meal were definitely the "cocktail for two", with a tableside porter infuser and the doughnuts for dessert - best Boston cream doughnut I've ever had!!! Will definitely return!

I hate to advertise this but the Guild House has a great happy hour. There  are some very delicious, nicely priced HH specials like the prime rib cap.I have had brunch, and eaten at the bar, and had lunch in the bar area. All good. I am looking forward soon to actually have a proper dinner there as I expect it to be delicious.The bar staff is good and they make some excellent cocktails.

Came here for brunch and although the service was a bit too leisurely...our meal took 2+ hours....the food was hands-down excellent.  I had the Truffled eggs, and nearly licked the plate dry. It's not cheap for Cbus, but well worth the price.

Great food and excellent service. The infused cocktails are pretty awesome... the port cask idea is clever and serves well on the table. I'd recommend getting several small plates, as their appetizers are excellent. We had the tuna ribbons,  prime rib cap, ricotta gnocchi, scallops and sea bass, all split between two people. The prime rib cap was my favorite. And the donut for dessert was surprisingly delicious- not too sweet.

it would be nice if we can actually be seated.  outs now 820 and stool not seated for 800pm reservation.   and not apologetic.   I know the food is good from before but expect much better for the caliber this restaurant clearly strives to be.   I expect to wait at Dennys but honestly they are also more friendly.

Drinks were good. Service was decent. My main complaint was the food. I ordered a ribeye, and what I was served looked like a filet.  I ordered my steak rare, and it was served medium. Steak was also very tough.

Honestly, if you haven't been to a Cameron Mitchell restaurant for Happy Hour, get off your a$$. These are the best deals in the city for Happy Hour, by far. The newest CM restaurant, The Guild House, is just the latest in exceptional service, food, and ambiance.So, for starters, the apps and small plates are all half off as well as specialty cocktails and wine. I had a vodka cocktail (meh) and the gin cocktail (WIN). The vodka cocktail was just not my thing. No reflection on the bartender but the gin cocktail was DELICIOUS. These are normally $10 cocktails and half off just makes everything taste better.For food, I ordered the stuffed poblano and the flatbread. The stuffed poblano had a corn bread filling, goat cheese, and shrimp. I'll eat anything with goat cheese, really. The flatbread had chorizo, bleu cheese, figs, and ricotta. It was STACKED with toppings and a delicious blend of sweet and savory. It seems like their apps were a little more health conscious. They also have a brussels sprouts app and something with quinoa. Some friends ordered these and said they were very good. Again, all half off.Anyway, solid 5 stars, of course. I mean, it might be super pricey for dinner/lunch but if you have a stellar happy hour, I'm sold. Get here.

This place is damn good.....damn good. Everytime I come to Columbus for business, which is at least once a quarter I come here to ear no matter what! Last time my server I believe was Nathaniel and he is such a great great server and made a great recommendation for wine and cocktails. This time I had Eric as my server, and though I did miss Nathaniel, Eric was such a great attentive server as well. Even overhearing the bartender's interactions with her customers of the night was pleasant and she remembers repeats. So far all the staff seem to be well trained and very friendly. Happy hour by the way is 3-6pm. You can read all the other reviews raving about how good this place is for happy hour and for the quality of food you can't beat it! Ok, I have tried a ton of things on the menu.Hamachi: Must get it!!! Get it now!!! This dish is so tasty to me with such a blast of flavors and well balanced that I ordered it twice and had 2 to go. The curry flavored vinaigrette that they use is a punch of flavor and goes so wel with the velvety texture of hamachiTuna ribbons: Also another good one to taste. When you get quality tuna and simply dress it with a light soy and wasabi mixture it is heavenly. Not as hot diggity good as the hamachi to me, but a solid dish. To clarify it is simple, but not simple like getting nigiri and dipping it in soy. They definitely elevated it here.Carrot ginger soup (seasonal soup): It was tasty for a carrot ginger soup. I was told that it was non GMO, gluten free, and vegan. All things that I don't really care about, but I'm sure for it being all those things it is usually tasty in that population. It was ok to me.Sea bass: Recommended by Nathaniel the first time I went here. So good also. It was such a nice balanced dish. The broth, the perfectly cooked piece of fish, and the accoutrements went so well together. Even after the fish was gone I was scooping up the broth in my spoon to get every last drop.Scallops: Gosh, another great entree that was perfectly cooked. It was towards the end of my 6 course a la carte meal so I don't think I appreciated it enough because I was getting full.Duck pate: This was a bummer because while the texture and other items that came with it were tasty they had forgot to season the pate at all. I ended up adding salt to each bite.Toast: Forgettable dish. I think this is probably the only thing that they could rotate off the menu. It was very difficult to eat because there were too many crispy elements that just couldn't stay on probably. I would describe this dish as refreshing toast. if that makes any sense. If you eat it you'd probably agree. If you haven't eaten it yet, you probably won't get it. Prime rib caps: I agree with the other reviewed here that this is also amazing dish. Never have I ever had beef done to an actual medium rare. They did just that here. Everything paired very well from the blue cheese to the sweet oniony relish/jam underneath.Chocolate torte: I've gotten this each time I've come and everytime I eat it I can't help but make stupid giddy yummy noises because I am so damn satisfied. Don't take my word for it.....just get it. Eat it. And rollover and die. Hats off to the pastry chef on this one.See you guys again at the end of March!!!!!
Amazing time at the guild house! Delicious drinks, fresh food and great music! The ambience was perfect! Another fantastic Cameron Mitchell restaurant!!

Love the atmosphere and the service. It is top notch and a great place for a date.However, portions are a different story. While I don't expect and appreciate a boatload of food, they could a bit more generous in my opinion. I was half hungry when I left the place and I am not an obese person.

My go-to of all restaurants in the Short North. The vibe in the bar area is just what we needed in Columbus - it's a fun, (good)crowded, music playing lounge area where you feel like you can stay awhile. The service, just like every other Cameron Mitchell restaurant, is always top-notch and continues to exceed my expectations.
