The dinner was lovely and delicious, but I wasn't really full after eating only four scallops (that's what the scallop dish comes with: four scallops).  Overal, the food was good, but I didn't feel like the restaurant was necessarily ready for prime time that weekend.  The bar and kitchen were both slammed. a fact made more apparent due to the fact that the restrooms are neat the kitchen and it was pretty easy to see that they were frantic in there that night.  I suppose that my main impression of the restaurant is this: It's very trendy. It's in the Short North, attached to a  brand new boutique hotel, with very on trend decor, and was definitely a place where people were going to be "seen" that night.  The food was very pretty and was delicious, but I was still hungry when I left.  As for the service, our server was really nice, but I think that when there is a situation where the kitchen and bar as slammed, you need front of the house staff to be more attentive to your guests.I plan to come back to this restaurant at a less busy time in about 6 months.  I'm hoping that I'll be able to give it one or two more stars at that point.  Until then, I'll keep dining at my other favorite CM restaurants.

The Guild House might just be the crown jewel in Cameron Mitchell's collection. A recent addition to the Short North in the same building as the Le Meridien hotel, the restaurant offers some more daring fare than most of Mitchell's crowd pleasing restaurants. Now don't get me wrong, you shouldn't expect anything of the cutting edge of culinary arts here but you are more likely to find something that you won't find elsewhere in the city. For example, I had chicken roulade with celery root purÌ©e and sliced truffles. And by the way, they don't skimp on the truffles. It was fantastic. My date and I also ordered the "cocktail for two" which was some kind of infused tequila margarita on the rocks. It came in a modern looking circular decanter. We honestly didn't want to pour it at first because it looked so nice. Fortunately the server took care of that for us. The ice for the cocktail had also come from one of those large ice blocks that they chiseled smaller pieces off of. A nice touch. The drink itself was delicious too.The atmosphere is the blend of rustic and contemporary that you see at a number of places, but they do it very well. It feels fancier and more cohesive than you often find with that decor. At the same time, you wouldn't feel too out of place if you strolled in wearing something a bit more casual after waking around the Short North. Overall, The Guild House is a must visit even for those who don't typically frequent Mitchell's restaurants.

Not a bad place, but overpriced for what it is, relatively to its Short North and German Village competition. Food was decent as should be expected, but portions were weak.  The ribeye was probably not the best selection considering it's not a true steakhouse. Seasonal doughnut dessert offering was a fun touch to the menu. The decor however is BEAUTIFUL and uniquely chic which helps make the experience special. Cocktail for Two presentation is also great!  Would like to try breakfast here, as maybe that is a specialty void that Guild House could fill for the area. And for dinner I'd go back, once I've knocked out everything else on my downtown list.

Our server was slow with our first round of drinks and my G.Goose Martini was not dirty as ordered and, even more insulting, watered down. Ugh. I ordered the Sea Bass for my entree and it was like eating a cow's salt lick. We won't be back. The space is gorgeous but that is all it has going for it.

Great space and decor.  Great non alcoholic drinks loved the citrus bramble.  The salad I had (lunch entree salad) well I have honestly had better from Trader Joes.  Really disappointed.  Trying again tomorrow...would love to love this place.

Really spectacular decor - well spaced out, design was beautiful, and tables and energy was charming and elegant. Food was good - the small plates were well priced but the entrees were somewhat small. I wish there was also a better small salad option to add to dinner. The beef pasta was delicious but incredibly rich - hard to eat almost, still delicious but again, wished I had a side salad option. The dessert was good - the carrot cake bites were kind of disappointing in presentation, the chocolate torte was great, but the cookies left something to be desired. I would definitely be back and hope they tweak the menu a bit. They will find their groove - the space is spectacular and the food is almost there!

Lovely new Cameron Mitchell offering in the Short North. We dined there the second night the restaurant opened for business and had a great meal. The ambiance and decor (rustic chic) were delightful. The service was attentive but not intrusive. We had several appetizers: the raw tuna ribbons (good), the Brussels sprouts (excellent) and the Bao Buns (okay). The scallops were tasty but slightly rubbery, the kielbasa was delicious, very garlicky and homemade. Our dining companions had the salmon and ribeye and seemed very pleased. Drinks were excellent. This place will only get better. We'll be back for sure.

Cameron Mitchell has done it again. Delicious food, great atmosphere and impeccable service. The entire experience was relaxed and enjoyable. Even though the restaurant was at capacity we did not feel rushed or overwhelmed by the volume like tends to happen at most other Short North restaurants.
Good food, fabulous decor.  Definitely a fun, see-and-be-seen night on the town in Columbus!

I can't speak for the dinner because I haven't had it yet. However, I had drinks and dessert one night and it was amazing! I highly recommend the torte, donuts, and carrot cake! Their speciality cocktails are stupendous! So much so that I came back the next morning for bloody Mary's and breakfast! Bloody Mary was the best I've ever had, the eggs on toast hit the spot and chicken hash was incredible! We can't wait to come back for dinner! Service was on point - very well trained staff.

Decor is amazing.  Meatloaf is amazing but by far the most below average food.  When you're serving $5 boxed potatoes and smear 3 tablespoon on the plate, that's underwhelming and a waste. Cameron Mitchell has a lot of making up to me. The Pearl was worse than that.

I dined at CM's newest restaurant last weekend. So many great things to say about it, the atmosphere is gorgeous, great playlist, good drink/wine selection, and the food was well prepared. My friend and I split the tuna ribbons, kale quinoa salad, and a pasta dish, along with two desserts (donuts and trifle). Highly recommend the salad. I took off one star because were seated about 15 minutes after our reservation and then it took me waving someone down to get water and drink service about another 10 minutes later. I much prefer quality to quantity, but the dishes are somewhat on the small size for the price. Overall great experience and would definitely return.
I love every little thing about this restaurant. Again the thoughtful details that make a diner feel welcome and appreciated are there. A triumph !

What a disappointment. I was so excited to try this place. My boyfriend took me for brunch for my birthday and we had a really bad experience. First our waiter was terrible. Not friendly at all. It was uncomfortable. We were expecting the best service. Not the case. We ordered a tuna appetizer and it was SO small. I understand this is an expensive place and that's typically the case, but I could have eaten that in one bite. However, it was delicious. But our server.... Wow. I had asked him how the steak and eggs were. His response, " Have you ever had eggs?" I said, "Yes." He said, " Have you ever had steak?" I said, "Yes I have." His reply, " Well there you go. It's the same thing." Are you kidding me?! Way to sell me on it. I understand that it's steak and eggs, but be descriptive or recommend something more popular to me. When our food came, he just dropped it off and said, " Here you go." He walked away and we had no silverware. He was nowhere in sight for over 5 minutes. We had to get another waiter to bring us napkins and silverware. At the end of the meal he had asked us if we wanted any dessert and listed some desserts. I said that we were gluten free and if they had any options for us. He said, " Oh guess you can't have anything." Just bad delivery. I had also ordered hot tea. He brings it out just a bag in a cup which was fine..... Until I look over at another table that's being presented this wooden lit up case of all these different teas to choose from and it was very impressive. We were wishing we had that service. I don't see an immediate need to return here. I can buy an expensive steak somewhere else. But maybe I'll come back at some point in hopes of a better experience.
Loved the decor.  Rustic chic.  We ordered different items and shared them.  Lots of great vegetarian and healthy options.   Server did a good job recommending items.

Only had a few appetizers and a few cocktails but was very impressed and anxious to return.Vibe at the bar very cool and bar staff was very warm and friendly (it was a mid-afternoon on a Friday, so probably a bit more relaxed than usual).Tuna Ribbons, Carrot Hummus, Pork Cheeks and Prime Rib Cap were all very, very good.I'm a Whiskey guy, but the Gin Cocktail was outstanding...lemon juice, raison essence, sprig of rosemary and wonderful Botanist Gin...amazing drink.We will definitely return!

Would give it 4.5 if I could.The kitchen may be the best in the city.  We split the flatbread and home-made chips for an appetizer - both were excellent.My wife and daughter had the veggie lasagna, which they both enjoyed.  I tried a bite, not something I would order, but a unique and creative approach to a veggie lasagna that brings a deep, complex flavor.I had the Ribeye - best steak and accompaniment I have had in a very long time.My daughter had the trifle for desert - wonderful.  My wife has the chocolate tort - also wonderful.The ambiance is fantastic.  The only criticisms I have are:Our server seemed to be in the weeds all night and, while efficient, was rushed and displayed zero hospitality.The craft cocktail list is lacking.  The bartenders were friendly and attentive, but for this type of establishment should have superior mixologist skills, which I didn't see.As I read this review I think I sound I bit like a snob, but hey, at a place like this that shows they have the capability of delivering a true five star experience, I really want to experience it in every aspect of my visit.We will definitely be back.
Incredibly beautiful space.  Food was pretty good, drinks are great.
Lunch service and food was good.  The only complaint was that the portion sizes were VERY small.
Nice experience, beautiful setting, good strong drinks, decent food, overpriced. Great for date night though, I would go again.

A friend and I went for the happy hour and had three starters under "market"/appetizers. First of all - nice selection of bearable wines by the glass. Unfortunately, while the food was decent, it was nothing as special as the descriptions. The Grilled Portabello under the heading "Market"  had almost no mushroom in it - I think I counted 5 small slices in an otherwise enormous serving. The lamb chops appetizer had a very weak marinade, and since nobody asked me how I wanted the lamb, it came overdone (partly my fault for not saying anything , but medium is what I would have said if asked - not well done and flavorless.) The rice below the lamb chops was plentiful, seasoned okay but too overwhelmingly salty. So.....I'm going to give it another shot sometime and try actual dinner entrees. And hope for food that matches the lovely MÌ©doc I was drinking.

Oh man. I wish I could fly here every weekend just to experience the Tuna Ribbons. I dined by myself and absolutely loved it. I had the Tuna Ribbon appetizer and the Brussels Sprouts but was very full by the time I was done... Which is odd considering they were small, appetizer portions. However the bread is so good I had two servings! (Well, I guess I know why I'm full ;) ) The bread is served with 3 small multi-grain slices that have the perfect amount of sea salt that makes you crave more. The flavor on the tuna ribbon was just fantastic. So fresh and the perfect amount of soy that didn't cover up the freshness.  The Brussels Sprouts were wonderful however not life changing. Definitely save room for dessert; I did something I normally don't do and ordered what the waitress (who was wonderful, her name was Sammi, ask for her!) recommended instead of my go-to chocolate option. I had the trife which is a mango fresh fluffy cloud sent from heaven. Excellent job to the 12 chefs that put this menu together!! Great ambiance as well. I love the hip music paired with the warm yet modern ambiance. A+ !!

This place is amazing! I went for lunch this afternoon with a friend and we both enjoyed every second of it.  The food is great, but our bartender Keith was fantastic. Very knowledgable and friendly. He went out of his way countless time to make sure we were having a great dining experience. I would recommend eating at the bar. We learned all of these little details that go into the food and cocktails. Like the custom ice they use for their bloody Mary's!!! The attention to detail in this place is what makes it so amazing. I order the lamb burger and it was delicious. Great lunch item at a solid price point. Overall I loved my experience at The Guild House. Ask for Keith if you want fantastic service!

This place is a lot of hype!  The atmosphere is awesome! Decor is amazing and waiter are dressed to impress.  Ok enough about that.. The food is pretty tasty but a little overrated!  Everyone liked what they got but no one was talking about it after.  The lamb chops were tasty, the salmon was good, but small portions and a heavy price!  Vegetarian options were there and good but not memorable.  As for dessert, we got a few because we were honestly still hungry from dinner. The chocolate torte was great, if you love peanut butter, the carrot cake was very tasty.. I would get this again.  Others in my group really liked the trifle as well.  There are so many great restaurants out in cbus and I probably won't go back to this one for awhile

Overpriced and underwhelming. Food was just okay. Portions are quite small. Three of our group ordered the ribeye steak. It was a small thick piece of meat that was inconsistently tough. If you don't serve steak with a steak knife, it should be easy to cut. Brussels sprout starter was lacking in flavor. Skate was very good. The sides that come with the entrees are extremely small, more of a garnish than a side. Cocktails were pricey, but delicious.  Definitely a happening place. Noise level quite high. Food just wasn't up to Cameron Mitchell's standards. Valet parking is $10, you can pay on your phone but then it is $15 plus a service charge.
This is what Columbus needed!!  It's a funky cool kind of place!  Makes you forget you're in Ohio, more like a Chicago or New York bar. Definitely worth checking out.

I loved the fresh healthy food, rustic chic decor, menu and atmosphere! Brussels sprouts, beet salad and salmon were all perfectly prepared and delicious! Cameron Mitchell you have another big winner on your hands!

If you just want to be able to say that you have eaten at the Guild House then by all means go. But if you don't want to walk out as hungry as you were when you walked in or if you're not a fan of trendy hipster rabbit food then you'll want to pass.
Cool ambience , good place for a drink , small bar area though . Food is not that great and small portions . Been here 3 times to try and change my mind about it .

This is a great restaurant with great starters and cocktail.  However, if you're dropping several hundred dollars on dinner you should not have to wait OVER AN HOUR the valet to get your car.  Only response from management was its a busy night and that the valet is not associated with the restaurant.   It's right in front so you think they might have an interest.  Hopefully they realize this and improve the situation.  They proceeded to talk with the valet which was appreciated however we waited another half  hour so obviously it did no good whatsoever.

Had dinner here last night, it was our first visit. Overall, our experience was just okay.DÌ©cor - rustic chic. Lots of "repurposed" wood, vintage looking china for bread plates, hand blown water glasses, antique green glass chandeliers, leather benches. I thought it was very pretty. Good combination of lounge and homey feeling. Something annoying - our table was uncomfortably close to the neighboring tables. When the servers were helping the other tables, they were practically leaning over ours as well. It was annoying. Menu - underwhelmed. I'm not totally sure what I expected, I definitely get their farm to table idea with what's listed, but it seemed like a small selection with expensive prices. Sides are ordered a la carte. When we asked our server for suggestions, he was very helpful, but specifically mentioned how several dishes were small portions and wouldn't be a full meal for him. We had also heard about the small portions from someone who had dined here a few weeks ago. Food - it came out insanely fast. Like 10 minutes after ordering. It was hot and fresh, but we felt totally rushed. Aside from that, it was delicious. I had the lamb burger with a side of French fries, my boyfriend had the chicken roulade and brussel sprouts. We are big fans of Cameron Mitchell restaurants, so we're glad we got to check it out. Not sure we'll be back any time soon though.

OK, My prior review was stellar but I was there last night and I've got to say that when you have a $400+ bill for 6 people for dinner, no one should arrive home looking for food but that's what happened after my son dined on the $35.00 rib eye, which was about 1.5 inches thick but about 2.5 inches around with not one other thing on the plate.  That was the same for all the dishes.  Gnocchi,--large dish but small inner bowl of food.  Veggie lasagna - that and nothing more.  Three of us had the evenings special Copper Head salmon and it was very good and at least filled us up.  The bread for six was 6 tiny pieces of ok bread but nothing special.  When we saw how small the main courses were, we immediately ordered additional appetizers, but that should not have needed to happen.  Oh, almost forgot that we were celebrating a birthday but nothing special offered here for the celebrant.  So one desert was ordered - carrot cake, which at other Mitchell restaurants is superb.  Here...you get 3 TINY, TINY pieces.  OK, but no, won't do that again. Best thing was the drinks.  The decor here is still super cool but I won't be back after this experience.

My husband and I were staying at the Le Meridian for a wedding and wanted to grab a bite for lunch. We went to the Guild House, which basically is in the hotel, at around 2 pm. The place was pretty empty except for the bar area, where we sat in a booth. He ordered the Rum house cocktail and I got a glass of white wine. The white wine was good but I ended up drinking half of his rum cocktail, which was better, so we ordered a second one to share. We also ordered the Brussel sprouts appetizer, which is Brussel sprouts with a a mustard dressing. We ordered the sea bass croquette, which came with a salad that complemented the croquettes. Finally, and because we liked the appetizer and croquette so much, we got the flatbread with zucchini to take up to the room. All of the food was excellent, the service was great and we were very happy we went there for lunch. If we ever are back in Columbus, I would go back to Guild House for dinner.

The Guild House is worth a visit just to sit in its bold, elegant space. Really, it is a great atmosphere. The food just did not live up to my expectations. The menu gives the impression that they tried a little too hard to be quirky and made unusual pairings of ingredients. While I applaud the effort to do something new, the taste just didn't hit the mark. I got an appetizer of pork cheeks that came with a tomato sauce on top. The sauce really got in the way of that delicious pork! I wish they had not dressed it up so much. My entree was the kielbasa. There was cheese stuffed in it! That really turned me off and it did not taste good. My bf and I got the cocktail for 2 which was really fun - it comes in a glass porthole and you turn it to pour the cocktail. The drink was great. Overall, I won't be going back anytime soon but I do recommend a visit if you have not been to see for yourself.

I'm pretty sure this place is what white suburban middle-aged women fantasize about when they have wet dreams. It's a Cameron Mitchell spot, so that automatically means the menu is inflated more than the Russian Ruble during communist times. Warning to the wise: don't come hungry (unless you decided you feel like hitting the max on your black card), the portions are petite sized (perfect for getting you summer ready for that adorbs Kate Spade dress you're going to rock at the New Albany Country Club!!). Now with that being said the interior is attractive and they certainly paid attention to detail. I think the proper terminology is "French Rustic" (god I had that fucking word.. it's a nice synonym for old and shitty) but I think that might be a tab bit insulting to the French (let's be honest they are more sensitive than a pregnant lady trying to fit into jeans). I would venture to say it's more Mary Antoinette.. but instead of getting beheaded she moved to the MidWest Ohio farm fields and started calling coke, pop (seriously, why Ohio why?). The tuna ribbons are nice.. I think they call it ribbons so it seems like you're getting a present and feel better about dropping 15 bucks for 1oz of food. For brunch I recall having some kind of omelet.. Even if I wanted to I couldn't elaborate on that. It's an omelet... kinda hard to fuck up. It's like potatoes.. have you ever had bad potatoes? Of course not because if all else fails you just throw some more ketchup on those fuckers and voila! There's quite frankly nothing on this menu I can honestly say I have never seen before. As far as dranks go, I do like that they have a drink for every alcohol type.. I just wish they were better. The vodka cocktail was too lemony and sweet.. and not in the yum lemon pie kinda way.. more like a oh did some of the lemon pinsol you clean all this wood with get in my drink kinda way. The place overall is nice and the food is aesthetically pleasing. This is the kind of place that a white girl who wears a Louie purse with her yoga pants and gym shoes and thinks she's chic and bougie would find absolutely uhhh-mazing and that old white suburbanites travel alllllll the way from Dublin for! For the rest of us, it's just a nice place to stop by for a drink and get a much needed breather from the usual downtown douchery.

Worth the hype! Went on a Wednesday evening with a group of friends and it was packed. Luckily, we had a reservation so we were seated right away. Our waiter, Ben, was very polite and helpful in answering questions about the menu. We had the Brussels sprouts and carrot hummus appetizers, which were both good. The lamb burger was excellent and I got the cucumbers and tomatoes as my side. It is definitely pricey, but worth the money if you're looking for a nice night out. The restaurant itself is decorated beautifully and the bar is very cool too.

Went for Sunday brunch, group of 4 people and took us almost 3 hours - service was extremely slow. Ambience was cool. Majority of food was good except the brussel sprouts - not good at all so I sent them back (and I usually love brussel sprouts). Flatbread, steak & eggs, and torte were exceptional. Portions were very small for the price. Not my favorite Cameron Mitchell restaurant - probably will not go back.
Beautiful new restaurant, fab food!  Little rigid on reservations but worth the experience overall.

Best Cameron Mitchell restaurant in town. The Ribeye is amazing, and the tuna and oyster apps where flawless.  Bright, open space with casual elegant feel.  Can go formal or casual. Worth the splurge.

Came here on Sunday for brunch and overall the food and experience was disappointing. I loved the decor. The exposed wooden beams were great. However, that's where most of the compliments end. We got the donut trio to start. They were excessively greasy. I understand it's fried dough, and probably fried to order, but the paper they were put on was completely soaked in grease and every bite wreaked of grease. I couldn't even tell it was a Heath or strawberry cheesecake donut. Our eggs on toast were missing the caviar that was described on the menu. Maybe the kitchen forgot or was out or they really only meant essence of caviar. The smoked chicken hash was pretty good, but the portion was small. Our server was too busy chatting with her friends to give guests the attention they deserved. We clocked a solid 10 mins where she was at their table gabbing while our coffee mugs ran dry. Come to work to work or just go home.

Beautiful decor-scallops and pate were great and toast served w/pate exceptional. What stood out: the wait staff and valets treated us like old friends and were very attentive! What was disappointing: the beef ravioli was dismal in presentation; seriously? Throwing ravioli into a bowl and calling it artisanal?The noise level was so high as to prevent audible conversation, especially around oversized tables. Choice of music thumping loud: please Guild, change the genre!! It doesn't work if you want customers to stay and relax over dessert (carrot and flourless cakes that were superb btw) and coffee. So much thought put into Guild's presentation, it was disappointing to end up enjoying the bar MORE at the adjoining hotel next door.

Went for lunch with my husband and toddler son on Friday afternoon. Loved the decor and the hostess was great. Our server came over to take orders, and totally sold us on the cocktails. We placed orders after asking some questions about the different menus on our table. When my husband's burger came out as just a patty with cheese on a bun, and not with lettuce, tomato, and mayo as the menu had described, he asked about it and the server responded that it was just "the most plain burger you can get."  She then informed us that it was the kid's menu from which he ordered the burger. The kid's menu is not labelled as such and has a breakfast and lunch section on it with some basic dishes but also some more "adult" dishes. When we read the menu, we assumed it was a breakfast/lunch special menu and the larger card was the regular/dinner menu.  Our biggest complaint is that our server didn't bother to mention that it was a kid's menu when my husband asked about the two burgers on the different menus and then when the burger didn't arrive as expected, she didn't attempt to correct the situation. The kid's burger was unimpressive but the rest of the meal was alright.

Loved it here during our last visit.We got here early on  Tuesday12/26 (5PM) before taking our son to the airport. : - (It was really nice. Steaks were perfectly cooked. Sides were awesome. Service was great.It was quiet too, probably because of the time and the day. We were able to have a nice conversation and really enjoy our time there.
The Avenue had a decent atmosphere and ambience, but for the prices and food quality, I recommend searching elsewhere in Columbus.

Great steak house! One of our favorites in Columbus, we go for anniversary's or big date nights. My husband loves the shrimp cocktail, pass on the cheese app, house salad is VERY good, porterhouse is a must! Great cocktails, wine list is pretty good.

ENVIRONMENT: We had a great table in a private room because I was there with a group celebrating a friend's birthday. It was a nice setting for a group of 8.STAFF: Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu, which made me feel comfortable asking her questions.FOOD: As a whole, the food was delicious. My wife got the lamb chops, and said they were the best that she's ever had. I got the grass-fed strip steak, which came with an amazing chimichurri sauce. This was interesting because a few other people also got the strip steak and didn't specifically ask for the grass-fed version, and they didn't get the sauce. We all thought it was weird that they didnt specify that in the menu. Actually, the menu was pretty vague all around. You would have never known that my steak was going to come with that sauce unless you somehow knew to ask the wait staff. For dessert, I got the delicious chocolate cake and my wife got creme brulee and said it was good too. Also, I feel inclined to mention the sides. Our waitress gave us high hopes about the sides and they were fine, but I had really high expectations. My mashed potatoes were a little wet and my wife's mac and cheese (which was our waitress's favorite side) was just alright.

Excellent experience through and through. My NY strip and my wife's sirloin were both juicy and flavorful, perfectly seasoned, seared, and cooked to medium rare. The shrimp De Jonghe appetizer was buttery and rich. The Caesar salad was one of the better salads I've had of late. The baked potato was a baked potato--hard to improve upon or mess up a baked potato. Drinks were top notch. I had a great Manhattan and a delicious Queens, a gin drink. Nice wine and whiskey lists. Service was excellent. Our server was extremely knowledgeable and helpful and she offered us useful assistance describing multiple menu items. The atmosphere is very nice. It certainly doesn't feel like an old Panera. Although it's still relatively new, the decor feels timeless. I love the feel of old steakhouses and they recreated that feel masterfully. The room had a constant buzz of activity without ever feeling too loud or overcrowded. Everything was just right.

Last Thursday, I had an enjoyable dinner at the Avenue Steak Tavern. The Avenue is a great addition to the Grandview neighborhood. The charming restaurant is exactly how you would envision an upscale tavern in the 50s and 60s. The dark woodwork and classic red leather seats make you feel like you have stepped back in time. Besides offering a wonderful atmosphere, the Avenue also has great service. Just like all of the other Cameron Mitchell restaurants, service was outstanding. Our server was attentive to our needs, and she kept bringing us freshly hot rolls out of the oven. The only thing the Avenue could improve on is its food. The Avenue is not the best steakhouse I have ever been. The food meets expectations, but does not exceed them. As for price and quality, you do not get a lot of food for your money. I ordered the tavern salad and the Atlantic salmon. The tavern salad was absolutely delicious! There was a phenomenal sweet dressing glazed over the lettuce and beats that truly made the salad. Although I was very pleased with the salad, I was disappointed by my main entre. The Atlantic salmon was smothered in a chardonnay butter sauce which lacked flavor. I also like my salmon to be crispy, and the salmon was prepared a little too soft. Overall, I recommend this restaurant for the experience, but the restaurant needs to improve their menu.

Great neighborhood location in Columbus' best neighborhood. Sit at the bar for a great casual meal or at a table for a wonderful meal with friends.  Old school with a modern flair. Always has a good vibe.  Patio is the best during warmer weather.

One of the newer restaurants by Cameron Mitchell- I was pretty upset about having the local Panera move from this spot on Grandview Avenue, but at least the replacement was worth it! A little later on Saturday night I was restaurant hopping down the strip and found a spot right away at the bar. The bartenders were pretty busy making drinks for the restaurant but were all friendly. I have yet to try a steak here, which is mostly the specialty, but the pork chop was excellent! It was cooked perfectly and came with two sides. The shrimp cocktail was also delicious. *** also check out the happy hour menu!

Loved this place! Great vibe. Very crowded though so I would not go without a reservation on weekends. We had a reservation and we were seated right away.  Service was good - we got our food and drinks quickly. Also a very good wine list. We ate as follows:Steak tartare appetizer - sooooo delicious Shrimp cocktail - good but shrimp weren't that big and prob wouldn't get it againCeasar salad - yummy and light Filet mignon - cooked to perfectionLinguine with clams - loved this dish - will def get it againVeal Milanese - my friend loves this Highly recommend this spot!! They also have valet. Lots of fun bars around the area too.

We LOVE The Avenue and make it a point to come in. The BEST service around and for the price you get the full Steak House experience! Christina is the BEST server and always takes care of her customers. This is has gone from a special treat restaurant to in our regular rotation because of the consistent positive experience. Try the Pork chop and the creamed spinach!

The atmosphere is very relaxing, the service is great, the food...average. I ordered the chopped steak with Caesar salad. The salad was average at best. The dressing was okay, the croutons looked and tasted like they were from a box. I did enjoy the cheese crisps but there were at most 4 small pieces. The chopped steak was served over a wonderful sauce with plenty of mushrooms and onions. It was cooked nicely with a crisp outside and pink middle. My only complaint was it was exceptionally salty. My friend ordered the French onion soup, which was sold as "cooked for 30 hours." She said it was decent but nothing special.I would probably go back for the happy hour and atmosphere but I don't think I would go for dinner.

We had a great meal at The Avenue. Went for my dad's 70th birthday dinner. It was very nice, upscale atmosphere (seemed weird that it was the Panera I used to go to every now and again), open and spacious, nice bar, service was okay.The food was amazing. I had to have a steak because . . . steak house and all, so I ordered the Grass-fed New York Strip which was a little fatty but good. My partner and my mother got the twin filet mignons which melted in your mouth but my dad, God love 'im, got the Ribeye which was hands down the best on the table (seriously, he cut it with a fork, delish!) The sides were great as well. Loaded baked potato and mashed potatoes too (we all traded bites of everything we ordered). Dad got a free dessert because it was his birthday but took it home and we were too full to even think of having any.It is bit pricey ($$$), but worth it for a special occasion.In all honesty I was surprised. I had heard The Avenue was "just okay" so we held off going for almost a year to let the place settle into itself and get its groove. We were all pleased and would recommend a visit! Enjoy!

Meh.It's a very nice looking restaurant and the hostess and bar staff were all very friendly.A bit lackluster on the food side although I didn't order the porterhouse that I was told (by my Uber driver) was spectacular so maybe this is all my fault.Had a lackluster salad. We have some dryish steak and frites. Some dry roast chicken. Some 'hot' chicken that wasn't necessarily spicy at all.Our waitress was friendly and meant well, but a bit amateur. After our first cocktail there was never any inquiry into if we wanted another. The empty glasses sat on the table throughout the whole meal. It became a bit of a game. There was a manager cruising the dining room but they didn't stop by our table and/or notice that there was a four top with empty glasses.Alas. Is this place new? Maybe they are still figuring things out.
Like Mitchell's restaurants, but not this one. Long wait, poor service and food wasn't redeemable.

This is a relatively new Cameron Mitchell restaurant in grandview. I saw some negative reviews here, but went anyway. We had a great experience. Our server (Michael) was super friendly and helpful. My wife and I shared the pork chop and veal entrees. The pork chop was recommended by our sever. I'm not normally a big fan but it was fabulous. The spinach salad was also excellent. We  ordered the cream of spinach and the mushrooms for sides based on our servers recommendation as well. Both sides were delicious! The only dish that I didn't much care for was the veal. It was a little too cheesy. Oh and the dinner rolls are pretty good too. I liked my Chianti very much as well.We had also ordered the oyster Rockefeller but the server forgot them. A good thing he did, because we couldn't finish our dishes. But when he found out, he insisted on bringing them to us to take home on the house. Very classy move. So 4-4.5 stars on food and a definite 5 star on service!

I've had the pleasure of attending this establishment 3 times now. Every time I do, I have the best service, well made cocktails and superior food. Their steaks are so delicious and all of their sides are just perfect. The atmosphere is also just wonderful! Low lightning, spot-on decor and energy. I feel like I'm in a true steak restaurant from the 1950's. The servers are truly knowledgable about the menu and work tirelessly to help at every turn. We'll continue coming back!

Came here for happy hour, there is a small menu for  happy hour but most of the items we got were pretty good. Me and a couple of gfs ordered  the steak bites which came with about 6-8 pieces of steak cooked well-medium & came with a chimichuri sauce I don't know if it's worth the price but it was good. Also ordered the fries, fried asparagus, and shrimp grilled cheese. The fries and grill cheese were awesome! Definitely get them! The fries asparagus were bland and needed some seasoning. We also ordered the Coffee chocolate cake which my friends really liked. Also ordered the creme brÌÈlÌ©e which was decent just a normal creme brÌÈlÌ©e nothing special. Overall food was great and service was even better.

It's been nearly a year since I'd been to a Cameron Mitchell restaurant, so I was excited to get reservations to the newly opened Avenue. I was here on a Friday night on Valentine's weekend, so I expected it to be pretty busy anyway, and it definitely was. I'm assuming it's busy in general, so you're going to want to make reservations. We had 8 pm reservations but didn't actually get sat until around 8:30, which doesn't usually happen at a CM restaurant, but I can overlook it, since they just opened. After the wait, the service was excellent, and our server was extremely friendly and helpful.We split the Oysters Rockefeller here and loved them. The herbs mixed in with a nice buttery sauce made me wish there was more than two to an order, but it was well worth it. I had to go with the ribeye for my main course, and my girlfriend decided on the the pastrami and swiss sandwich after glowing recommendations from the server. The sandwiches come with fries, and the steaks with a choice of a Tavern or Caesar salad as well as a side. I opted for the mashed potatoes.My girlfriend ordered the Wedge salad, and it wasn't the biggest salad in the world, but it was incredibly tasty. The Tavern salad I had was decent, but the Wedge was the winner here.As far as my steak goes, it was cooked a perfect medium rare and was absolutely delicious and flavorful. I haven't had a good steak in awhile, and for the price, it was a damn good one. I wouldn't say the best I've had, but I really enjoyed it. I wasn't as big a fan of the mashed potatoes. I like a little texture to mine, but this was a creamy blend with not much to it other than butter, and I just wasn't digging it that much. I also added the peppercorn sauce for $2 (it comes on the side), and it was good, but the steak definitely doesn't need it.My steak was great, but the pastrami and swiss was amazing! They cure the pastrami in house, and it's exploding with salty deliciousness. The girlfriend loved it. I'd probably come back just to grab this, and it's not too too expensive for a CMR. Unfortunately, the shoestrong fries that came with it left a lot to be desired. They could have used some seasoning or something.Overall, I really loved the old school steakhouse vibe here with the dark woodwork and classic red leather seats. The entrees were great, but I feel like they could step it up on the side dishes. This truly is another great restaurant from Cameron Mitchell with just a few kinks to work out (There's no where for people to wait besides the bar which was WAY too crowded). I'd like to come back in a few months and have a go at some of the sandwiches on the menu, because they look amazing! If I could, I'd give this spot a 4.5 stars.

I'm a big fan of CM restaurants. They're always really pretty, with friendly and professional service, and consistently good food. And as someone with food issues, they're my go-to for when I want to feel special and not like I'm inconveniencing everyone with what I can and can't eat. That's why I'm bummed about The Avenue -- it just didn't feel special at all. It's good. It's totally fine. Nothing was wrong, but nothing was really all that great either. If I'm going to spend $100+, I'd much rather go to Hudson 29, which I think is far superior. First, I thought the atmosphere and the attitude were a bit cold and snooty. We're talking really formal service, super stiff uniforms, every woman with her hair pulled into a tight bun... it was weird and unlike what I have come to expect from CMR. We had a reservation, but we still had to wait about 20 minutes. That would have been okay if somebody had apologized to us, but the attitude was more like -- We're gracing you with our restaurant and allowing you peasants to eat here. Once we were seated, our table was janky. Like, it rocked and rotated the entire time we ate. That's totally fine at a cute little diner, but not at a CMR spot, and definitely not with the pretentious attitude everyone had. I do have to give our server loads of credit though: she was -- although formal -- helpful, fast, and attentive. When the food came out, everyone enjoyed it, but out of the four of us -- no one was wowed by it. For me, I ordered a burger and fries because they offered a gf bun that could make me feel more normal than the sad, salad-y burgers I usually have to eat at restaurants. The burger was tasty, but certainly not anywhere close to the best in the city. And I know I'm being picky here, but the gf bun wasn't even what I've come to expect from CMR. It was like the Udi's 8-pack I pick up at Kroger -- you know, the ones where you can tell two sides were attached to other buns. The fries were good, but they were exactly the ones from Hudson 29. Again, just didn't feel special or unique. Overall, The Avenue just didn't do it for me. Cameron Mitchell Restaurants have spoiled me to other locations by how down-to-earth, yet super professional the service can be and by how special they make every single experience. This place just felt average.

The Avenue has a good oldschool scotch & cigar steakhouse vibe to it, with Sinatra playing in the background. Service was impeccable, as to be expected with any CMR. Food was fantastic, the baked cheese fondue app is a must to start. They have Four Strings on tap and a creative bar menu. Meal was a little pricey, though you're paying for quality & service. There will be a return visit..

Our server Dasia (hopefully I spelled it correct) was awesome! I came with a group or coworkers and we enjoyed this place very much. I ordered "the other soup" (tomato bisque) which was full of flavor. The Staten Island Ferry was an amazing frothy coconut/pineapple cocktail. For dinner I ordered the Atlantic salmon and loaded potato and dammnnn was it good! The salmon was in a butter sauce and melted in your mouth. Perfect death row meal lol

Spilling entertainment guarantee! Not for me though...At dinner, the waitress dumped our drinks on me (see attached picture, taken right after the drinks were spilled on me). I know the waitress did not do this on purpose. The waitress and a manager apologized. But it was embarrassing for me, for my wife. Not to say that I had to continue my dinner all wet (see picture). The restaurant was full, and the customers in the tables around us were encouraging us to complain loudly. They were also saying that the restaurant would give us a free dinner for spilling the drinks on me. We did not want to mount a show. After all, we were there to enjoy our dinner.To my surprise when the check arrived, the manager only gave us a $10 discount (see attached picture, where I took out the name of the waitress for her privacy) for the waitress spilling the drinks on me! I am not sure what are the standards at Cameron Mitchell's restaurants, but these are not the standards in the industry. These are not the standards at a top restaurant. These are my takeaways from this lousy behavior: (1) For the Avenue, spilling drinks on their customers only worths 10 bucks. (2) The Avenue is not customer-friendly nor professional. The Avenue is definitely not a top restaurant for Columbus nor Grandview. (3) If you want to get heard at the Avenue, you should mount a show!It was a very disappointing experience.

Oh Avenue, how do I love thee?  Let me count the ways:1.  Location and style.  I love Grandview and I love the fact that there's ample parking in the lot behind Avenue.  The restaurant itself was a delight.  I first noticed the French bulldog umbrellas in the stand by the door and, frenchie fan that I am, I was already hooked.  Inside, I was expecting to see Frank Sinatra.  The Avenue gives off a fancy diner vibe with class and elegance.  The NYC-themed made me feel like I was really in the Big Apple.  I expected it to be dark but it wasn't and that was appreciated.  Even the bathrooms were exceptional.  2.  Service.  Our server was so friendly and helpful.  He was on top of his game throughout the entire meal and really made our experience top-notch.3. Drinks.  The cocktail and wine list is brilliant.  My friend and I enjoyed the Sloe Tom Collins (so tasty!) while our dates tried the Manhattan and the Bronx.  Everyone was pleased with their selections.4.  Food.  I started out with the Tavern Salad.  I am  usually not a big salad fan but this salad was incredible.  I had to forego the bleu cheese because of my milk allergy but even without it, the salad was perfect.  The vegetables were fresh and the salad dressing was the perfect addition.  I would have been happy with just a giant plate of that salad but I also opted to try their 8oz sirloin and that was delightful as well.  Mine was cooked to the perfect medium rare and the seasoning was delectable.  My steak was complimented by the mashed potatoes that come in this adorable little dish with a tiny lid.  They were delicious!  Everyone in my group loved the food.  Thank you, Avenue Steak Tavern, for making our Sunday evening dinner a success!  We will definitely be back in the future!

Met friends there last week. It was my first time there but they have been there a few times. Nice place. Relaxed atmosphere, not stuffy at all. Grandview Avenue is pretty busy in the evening so the valet was a nice touch. It was $5 to park plus tip. My friends were running late. As I waited by the front door, the person I believe to be the manager stopped by and asked if I needed anything or some water while I waited. The service was very good. The meal was also very good. I wouldn't put it up against some high-end steak places but it was very nice and I enjoyed the food.
Easter brunch at the Avenue!!! Awesome steaks and service!! Colleen was the best!!! She was on top of things and there wasn't long waits for our food!!!! Will be back!!!!

The Avenue has become a go to for me and my wife.Always a great greeting at the door. The steak and fish are always well prepared. The tavern salad is excellent. Can't go wrong w the Oysters Rockefeller or Clams Casino add starters. Love the staff and enjoy their professionalism. Strongly recommend. M Todd Bergdoll.

We went to a restaurant styled as a high end steak house, ordered a simple strip steak, paid a premium price and received an over cooked, dry slab of beef.   That's enough for me to be greatly disappointed.  Everything else was as expected. Excellent salad, side and dessert.   But when you bungle the entree that you tout you get panned.

I've been putting off writing this review for a while, primarily because I love *most* of Cameron Mitchell's restaurants and I really wanted this restaurant to be amazing since it's literally in my backyard. Honestly, I have one word to describe both of my visits here: underwhelming. The food is...ok and the service is good but borderline glib. On both occasions, my dinner companions seemed to enjoy their beef dishes (steaks the first time, burgers the second). Since I don't eat beef, I ordered the half chicken the first time and the hot chicken sandwich the second time. Both were dry and sadly, bland. The things I do like are the tavern salad, the French onion soup, and the fries. Unfortunately, that's not enough to keep me coming back. I realize the restaurant is still in its infancy so I may give it another chance at some point, but it likely won't be anytime soon.

This restaurant has a lot of potential. It's in a great location in Grandview (albeit with suboptimal parking), has a really attractive menu, serves really good steak for a reasonable price, and has the Cameron Mitchell name attached to it. I actually enjoyed my 12oz ribeye steak here more than the more expensive bone-in dry aged strip steak that I had at the other Cameron Mitchell steakhouse in town, The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek,With that said, this restaurant is currently not meeting its full potential. The service/execution of the food were easily the worst I've ever experienced at a Cameron Mitchell restaurant. While my steak was fantastic, everything else that my family ordered missed the mark:-My daughter's kid's white cheddar cheeseburger was served with zero cheese on it. How do you forget to put cheese on a cheeseburger?? Even McDonald's wouldn't screw that up.-My wife's crispy "hot chicken" biscuit sandwich was served almost cold and was not spicy at all. So I'm not sure where the "hot" comes from for the "hot chicken" as it wasn't spicy nor warm. Maybe it's just supposed to be warm but it sat out too long before it was brought to our table?  -I never received a steak knife for my steak. So I ate my steak with a butter knife. I would've asked for a steak knife, but our server didn't come back until we were done with our meal... Fortunately, my steak was so tender that I could cut it with a butter knife. But seriously guys, you're a "steak tavern". You can't forget to give a steak knife to someone who ordered one of your more expensive steaks! This being a relatively new restaurant, maybe they're still working some things out and will improve over time? I'd be interested in trying them out again in a few months for a second impression.

A rare swing and a miss from the Cameron Mitchell folks.We've recently had some success taking our two sons to dinner with us at reasonably upscale restaurants.  Especially Cameron Mitchell restaurants since they have a decent kids menu.  However, our experience at The Avenue was substandard for two reasons.  Our expectations and the restaurant's execution.My wife had the Wedge Salad to start which is a fixture at Cameron Mitchell places and executed well, as always.  She had the "Crispy" Hot Chicken and Biscuit and, to put it bluntly, Hot Chicken Takeover has absolutely nothing to worry about.  She only ate two or three bites before giving up, announcing the biscuit was dry and inedible.  I had the Oysters Rockefeller which were fine.  Slightly better execution of the same dish is seen at Cameron's American Bistro (called the Oysters Bingo) as these ones had a little too much spinach.  My scallops were sort of subpar as well.  Not terrible, not great.  Just sort of there.  I had a house salad as part of my entree as well and I was struck by the appearance of just plain old lettuce in a salad.  Nobody really does that anymore, but I guess that was what was served in 50's?The bread that arrived before the meal was also dry and served with ice cold pats of butter, which essentially made them unusable.  I guess this is a throwback too, but maybe one that should just be thrown back.My youngest was bummed that the Mac and Cheese that is usually on the kids menu at most other Cameron Mitchell restaurants was missing here.In order to appease the other three members of my disappointed family, I cut short our dinner and walked down to Jeni's for dessert.For now, that might be The Avenue's best feature--its proximity to other great food.

Our second visit. As good as the first time!  The Avenue is a beautiful venue with ample parking in the rear. Enjoyed appetizers and a glass of $5 wine before diner. No need to "sit in the bar" like some restaurants. Our table ordered four different entrees and everyone enjoyed what they ordered. I especially like the fact that all the entree come with a choice of salad.  Enjoyed another glass of wine; still $5 because it was before 7:00 PM. Generous pours. Not like Napa in Dublin where the pours are poor. Service was fine. Why not five stars?  I guess I'm being a bit thought on them?  Four and one half would be more like it.
We had dinner last night at The Avenue, our server Rebecca was a star.  The food impeccable, service outstanding.  It's a Cameron Mitchell restaurant through and through.Get HH too!

We had a wonderful dinner here last night. The service was great and the food was very flavorful. The table got the pastrami and Swiss sandwich, crab and avocado salad, ribeye, filet and some side dishes. Everyone loved what they ordered. It is a bit pricey, but I think it lived up to the price expectation.
Terrible. I found hair in my food and they refused to re make my dish. Will not be returning.

FOLKS, WE HAVE A WINNER... !!!We truly loved The Avenue.  Had drinks standing at the bar.  Great drink list, great bartenders, solidly strong drinks that are vigorously shaken with lots of flair.Really nice dining room.  Love the red vinyl booths.Outstanding service utilizing a team approach, so everyone seems to help deliver food, clear plates, refill water, etc.We had Jeanine, who is a truly outstanding server.Great menu, delicious food, decent prices.  The strip steak was especially tender, and the Oysters Rockefeller were truly the best I've ever had.All in all, Cameron has a winner on Grandview Avenue.  In sure we'll return often, and see our friends sitting at the bar when we arrive...

Excellent service from all the staff. Ambience is nifty but lights are so low you can't see the menu or the food and the music was so loud I couldn't hear the waitress telling us about the desserts, since they don't have a printed dessert menu.Prior to my first visit to this highly touted Cameron Mitchell restaurant, i read numerous reviews here and on other sites. I'd decided to order a Caesar salad, the onion soup and the house special chopped steak in order to avoid the possibility of a tough piece of meat. The salad left a lot to be desired. While visually pleasing it lacked flavor. Too little dressing leaving the mouth feel like chilled washed romaine lettuce and the parmesan cheese was little toasted wafer like bits. The anchovies were an excellent addition.The onion soup was the best part of the evening. Literal perfection.The medium/medium rare chopped steak was dry. It had a char on it and though smothered in onions, mushrooms and a sauce, it was just too dry. I advised them it needed more fat content. The sauce and mushrooms while tasty was cold. They offered various solutions and ultimately didn't charge for the dish.Again, the staff and service were wonderful.The chocolate cake was divine.After I got home it all came flying out of me. Maybe they used tenderizer or MSG in something.I just wasn't impressed with this place.

We popped in with no reservations at 6pm on a Saturday, July 8.  We easily got a table on the patio and enjoyed the atmosphere.  The food was great...service was poor.  We spent $206 on dinner for two.  I ordered the 8oz filet medium rare and it came out grey in the center...medium well.  I sent it back and a new steak was returned by the manager.  She gave no apology and simply said I hope this one tastes better.  No compensation, no discounted on the steak, no apology.  Cameron Mitchell prides themselves on service and this experience did not live up to that reputation.  We were constantly sitting with empty glasses before our waiter would pop by to see if we wanted another.  We never got the bread he said he was going to bring.  The manager made me feel like I was wrong about my steak being severely overcooked.  A disappointing experience when we had hoped for so much more.

I was so excited to try this new Cameron Mitchell's restaurant.  The stars of the meal were the tavern salad and the filet.  Everything else was just substandard.  The rolls were cold but did have rosemary baked in.  They were served with 2 cold butter foil packets.  As mentioned before, the tavern salad was excellent and the wedge salad was just average (I didn't care for the dressing).  The steak was cooked to perfection and seasoned very well.  The baked potato was very dry.  Thank goodness for the extra butter and sour cream!  It seemed we had to keep asking for things (felt beggish...not a word, I know, I know) rather than things you would expect to be offered in a restaurant.Overall, the place is beautiful, the prices are fine dining, and the overall experience didn't deliver for me.
Excellent service! I was hoping for a bit more diverse menu and setting. The fried chicken sandwich is the bomb.
I went here for happy hour after work and liked the bar atmosphere and hh prices. Also happy hour goes till 7pm.

I wouldn't return to dine here.  Considering the price and the quality of the cuisine, it's not worth it.  I ordered the filet and to my dismay, it was good but not excellent.  I tried my friend's flank steak (a lower price point) and I actually thought it tasted better.  The waiter recommended the hash potatoes, so we gave them a try.  They were greasy and nothing special that you couldn't find at a diner.  We commented to the waiter about this and he apologized but didn't do anything to remedy the situation.  The decor is great, it brings you back to a 60's steak house that I imagine gangsters visiting in the movies.  I like the attire of the servers as well.  They look very dapper in their bow ties and suspenders.  But as far as the food and quality of service, it didn't meet our expectations for fine dining.

One of my favorite Cameron Mitchell's! The atmosphere is fun with the dark red leather and dark wood. It has a jazz-y feel. My dad and I ordered the filet mignon and it was out of this world. The dinner rolls and mash potatoes were great too. We ended with their ice cream sundae, which sounds simple but was the best ice cream sundae I have ever had! The make the chocolate sauce in house. This is a Cameron Mitchell I would definitely go to again.

New on the block from Cameron Mitchell.The design is beautiful.  Especially cool is the bathroom.   Looks like something out of 60s NYC.  Only thing missing was a bathroom attendant.  Cloth cotton hand towels a real plus.  Wow.  Thanks for the flashback.Service was exceptional, as is usual in CM properties.  Our attendant was celebrating her BD, and we had two BD in our group.  So we all toasted together.  She was well trained and exceptional on her knowledge of the menu.Food choices are all over.  $13 chicken sandwich to $40+ steaks.  You choose, thats a nice price point option range.  The onion soup is classic, very rich.  Salads are on the small size, but very tasty.  My old fashion was well done at $10.  Nice menu options overall; you can eat lite and not spend much, or really duke up the expense.  Again, your choice.I'm sure this will be a Grandview destination place.  They have a nice patio.  Parking in back and also valet.We will be a customer for sure.
Great place! Went here for a birthday celebration and had a great evening. Great service and food. Will return soon.

Critical flaw...The ambiance was nice, sitting out on the patio on a spring night just cool enough to activate the overhead heaters. The waitress did a great job taking our orders and keeping my "The Bronx" cocktail filled. Speaking of the the drinks, they were top notch. "All of these positive comments and you still only gave it two stars?..." you might be asking yourself. Yes, I did. You have one job as a restaurant. Make quality food. In this case, The Avenue did not and it was a critical flaw that ruined the rest of the experience. When the best part of your meal was the side salad, there is a problem. The "hot chicken" sandwich was bland. It should have been called the orange chicken sandwich as somehow they managed to give it a healthy tangerine glow without actually making it spicy. The french fries were ok--they appeared to be highjacked from Steak and Shake.Also, my wife has a thing about butter served in tin foil. So there's that.The real problem were the scallops. I will not get too cute here and just say this. $28.00 for four undercooked, cold sea scallops...You can do better CM. You should do better for that price anyways.

Wonderful meal from start to finish! Our waitress was amazing and helped us choose a perfect bottle of wine. Menu is very straightforward for a steakhouse - no fussiness which is nice sometimes. I had the twin filets that came with a house salad and one side you choose - I got the corn and enjoyed every bite. The chocolate cake dessert was nothing special - would definitely skip dessert next time.
Only complaint is the "ambiance" lighting.  It's only 4:30 and the sun is shining outside. I can see having this for the evening but not happy hour.  Trey the bartender was AWESOME!

Cameron Mitchell does it again!  He and his team have created yet another hip and cool spot that transports you back in time to a classic steakhouse.  Per usual no stone is left unturned which I why I like dining at the newer CM establishments, it seems they really work to create an atmosphere that's cohesive in theme but conducive for the modern day diner. My husband and I went on a double date with friends here last night and loved it.  We all got cocktails and were very pleased.  They prepare and serve them as they would have been served historically which is kind of an interesting twist.  We all got different cuts of steak, all were prepared correctly and were very delicious.  The sides were also good.  I got a blue cheese crust for my filets and it was very well executed.  Most places don't take the time to actually broil the cheese on the steak to make a true crust they just top it with the cheese and send it out.  So I was very pleased that they went the extra step. We had one diner who needed gluten free options and he was more than happy with the options on their GF menu.  It's nice to be able to take the guess work out of picking a dinner spot that has a decent GF menu!Each couple got dessert, our friends were very pleased with the creme brulee and my husband and I had the most delicious piece of chocolate cake we've ever had at a restaurant.  It was soaked in Kahlua with a fabulous chocolate ganache over top.      Service was impeccable, which I've come to expect at a CM restaurant but it shouldn't be taken for granted. Overall, good food, good service and a great vibe, definitely worth returning to.

Started with the French onion soup it was very good but a bit thick, it had a sweet taste that was different but not so much to make it something it's not, I don't like a lot of strange plants in my salad and they were very happy to make me a wedge salad with a house dressing (golden balsamic vinegar) normally I don't care for this but it was outstanding and not tart at all. I had the NY strip it was cooked to perfection but did lack a bit of marbling but was in NO way dry, for desert I had the hot fudge Sunday the ice cream was plain maybe maybe vanilla bean would be better, the fudge tasted homemade and was excellent. I ordered a sangria it was not on the wine list but they were happy to make it for me it was ok but I think sangria has to "age a bit" and I wouldn't order it again. Also the bread was something that could use a little improving they are little square rolls that are a bit dense with a trace of rosemary I think a warm sourdough would be a lot better The service was outstanding, but all of the staff looked like they were on speed, please slow down its a bit disturbing to watch people move that fastAs far as the atmosphere it wants to be like  a NY steak house, but it's not I have eaten at Peter Lugers many times and there are some things you can't copy, like Lugers steak and Lombardi's pizza please turn down the Frank Sinatra music and be yourselfOver all if I had to give you a grade it would be a B and would go back Oh ya one more thing what about having prime rib

Loved the ambiance and the service. My husband and I enjoyed our cocktails. We got the cheese fondue. It was good but not out of this world. Won't order again. Dinner rolls were good but could have been better warm. Chicken sandwich was bland as was biscuit. My husband loved his burger. That was the highlight. The fries were good too!Lots of potential here.
Delicious steaks and sides in a fun, chic setting. Even with a large crowd in the lounge waiting for tables, never felt rushed or ignored by the wait staff. Will return soon!

The Avenue is a neat addition to Grandview.  Our party of five went early on a Saturday night with no reservations.  We were quoted a 30 minute wait, and that is exactly when we were seated.  The service is 5-star: everyone makes you feel welcome and important.  We got the Shrimp Dejonghe for a starter and French Onion Soup for starters, and they were on point.  For my main, I had to get the Steak Frites (it's a steak tavern, after all).  The skirt steak was a generous cut, cooked as I requested (medium rare), and under chimichurri and lime- yum!  The fries were thin, crispy, and plentiful.  I'd probably get this again!

This was our first trip to the Avenue on my birthday, no less.  We started with the Shrimp Cocktail, which I really needed a bit more horseradish.  I love my Shrimp Cocktail where your nose is running and I didn't get it here.We then ordered the Ribeye steak and we split it.  It was very good but very small.  I felt it was a Lean Cuisine of a good steakhouse.  What I loved is that you can have a side with your steak, which I loved.  But the portion size for the delicious side of mushrooms was too small.The best thing about the meal were the hash browns with a delicate scoop of sour cream.  Delicious! Hands down the best of the meal.Still, I left a steakhouse for the first time wanting more.  I left kind of hungry.We should have ordered a dessert but we didn't.  We will be back but we will have to order two steaks, where in a normal steakhouse, we could have split one.Good, not great.

I'm definitely a fan. I have been three times now. I like that the steaks come with a salad and side and you don't pay more for those items. Wine list is good as well. All of their servers are very good, professional and good at sales. We went last night and got Oysters to start and they were so fresh and delicious. Make a reservation if you don't want to wait!

After my first visit I would put The Avenue at the top of my list for Columbus steakhouses.  Ordered the ribeye, tavern salad, several sides and all were really good.  Staff was exceptionally courteous and responsive.

A good addition to Grandview Ave, classy atmosphere, decent food. But, nothing wowed me like the steakhouses in larger cities. I'll go back if I'm craving a steak within walking distance but it won't be my "go to" place.

This is my favorite Cameron Mitchell restaurant!  I love everything about it, but I think what I like most is the value.  I feel that for what you get, the price is right.  I love and appreciate excellent food, but nothing irritates me more than overpriced, mediocre restaurants (i.e.: Hudson 29).  The Avenue delivers excellent food, fair prices, an excellent atmosphere, excellent service, and the perfect location.  The Avenue is in my top 5 restaurants in Columbus for fine dining.  I can't wait to go back!!

I am sparing with my five star reviews, but this place knocked me out. I regret the inadequate capacity of my ample stomach, in that I was not able to consume more of this restaurant's magnificent food. But I must back up...I got here early for a retirement dinner we were having for a colleague. Sat at the bar, learned the 4-6pm happy hours includes $5 glasses of wine, $5 well drinks, and $3 beers. Ask for the list. Also noted the stack of old timey cocktails they whip up in front of you. Old fashioned for one friend, sloe gin fizz esque drink for the other.Got seated in the red leather (leatherette?) booth and got a chance to see the full menu. My God, it's 1940 and the war hasn't started yet. (In the US, anyway.) Steaks, sandwiches, lobster...sides to fight over...appetizers to tempt. Go look at their website, or better yet, go there and look at the menu. I'll have to go twenty times to even begin the sample the items of interest. The specials included a New York strip steak with, and I swear they said this, "sauce made from a Forties recipe..." With so many fine ingredients I couldn't memorize them. Hell, I don't even remember one of them. They were all good. One diner ordered the lobster, I got a filet, we shared sides. Then the waitstaff comped us a bread pudding and ice cream dessert when coffee was served because they knew our guy was retiring.Great service. Great food. With God as my witness, I shall never know hunger again.The coffee was served in little coffee pots with cups and saucers that made me feel like I was just off the train in Santa Fe going into a Fred Harvey restaurant with the Harvey girls. Go look it up.In each life a little rain must fall, so here's mine. Parking is sometimes a problem. Boo hoo. All aboard!

I am not a Cameron Mitchell fan in general, especially some of the new places like Guild House, but The Avenue was delicious.  Let's be honest its a thinly veiled Cameron Mitchell version of The Top in Bexley.  Matt was our server and he was effecient and polite and the filet was excellent.  So it was good overall but I always prefer the original to a knock off.
Not good! The food was plain and very under seasoned. Service was fine and with the high prices I would expected at least a better than below average experience.

Food was great... No problem there But we made a reservation for 5:30 for outside seating... An hour and a half we call and ask about our reservation... They wrote the wrong number down... So we're back on the list... Then we get called for our table ready... Inside... Then we wait... Horrible service.. Took over 45 min for our food. Ridiculous!

My wife and I love many of Cameron Mitchell's restaurants; however, the Avenue Steak Tavern has become our favorite.  As with all Cameron Mitchell restaurants, the wait staff is simply wonderful!  They are so well trained and knowledgeable of the menu items as well as the specialty drink menu.  The bartenders are excellent as well.  Happy hour is always packed and the appetizers are very good.  The items on the dinner menu are amazing including the white cheddar cheese burger on the Tavern menu.  Reservations for dinner are a must Thursday through Saturday.  If you like good steak, seafood, and great service . . . this is the place to be in Grandview Heights, OH.

Newest Cameron, and it's a winner. How I picture a classy speakeasy in atmosphere, great steaks and fish. Superior service, as all Cameron's.  Raves from friends, too, and I love the Sinatra background music.

My 8yr old son has all of a sudden become a steak connoisseur, so I promised him a trip to The Avenue as a reward. I have to say I was a little disappointed. I ordered the ribeye and my boy ordered the chopped steak. I wish I was paying more attention when he ordered because I would have steered him towards the kids filet. He was not happy when his steak came out looking like a hamburger. Woops, sorry buddy. My ribeye came out looking amazing, but was cooked a bit more medium rare than medium and just wasn't as spectacular as I hoped. I ate at The Barn a few weeks ago and much preferred the steak I had there.There also seemed to be 100 servers working. Everywhere you looked there was someone in suspenders. The place was pretty busy and the lack or space to wait and the 100 servers really seemed to make the place feel cramped. I can't say enough about our server Janine though. She was a seasoned pro and treated us like royalty. Thank you!!

One of my favorite places.  The waitstaff is awesome.  I have been here many times.  I had had the shrimp cocktail, the other shrimp app., onion soup, wedge salad, lobster tails. Everything I have had has been awesome.  Awesome place!

Came for happy hour on a Thursday and it was a great experience! The bar tenders were very friendly and came to us immediately after we sat down. The cheese fondue was incredible with honey sprinkled on top. We were also pleased with the wine options during the happy hour, especially happy with the heavy pour! Would love to return for a full dinner!

My wife and I had high hopes for this restaurant,  to be an alternative to the Hyde Park Grill on Old Henderson.   But from the start it was just a marginal experience.  We weren't acknowledged when first entering the establishment.  Valet parking was blocked off so we found another spot.  The hostess passed us on the way in.   Our seat was against the bar partition and by where the employees chatted.   Our server was fine and the food ok,  but when paying these prices you're expecting a whole lot more.  In a couple weeks we'll be back at Hyde Park.

This is a highly over-rated steakhouse. Service was mediocre at best. Our server had very little knowledge of the menu & zero knowledge about the wine list. The atmosphere is casual & feels like a diner.  The prices reflect an upscale restaurant but the atmosphere, food quality, menu items & service does not support it.  Overall, I would NOT recommend this place.

Not the best atmosphere of CMR; tables were dangerously close and it felt cheap.  The parking situation is nonexistent.  I find it odd that valet is $4 at The Avenue and free at The Barn, which is surrounded by parking.  The manhattan was disappointing; didn't taste at all like a manhattan. We ordered a bottle of wine, which the server slammed down, resulting in a spray of red flecks on my CREAM colored suit for which she did not apologize or remark.  I ordered the supposedly amazing "special", seabass.  It was dry.  Dry as jerky.   I very politely sent it back and ordered a medium filet instead, which was good.  I was utterly shocked be charged for the fillet. I have been to many CMR restaurants and have come to expect a much higher level of service.  Disappointed in the staff and management.  This model will not last long.

I love the decor and the idea. Upon entering, one should already be excited about trying a Cameron Mitchell restaurant for the first time, but the decor and, per usual, the friendly hostesses solidify it.  We sat down and ordered a drink. We were brought rolls, and this is the only part I don't understand, they were slightly colder than room temperature and you were given two cold butter pats with it. The were not pleasureable at all. i don't know if this was a mistake or if it's a New York tradition, but that was our first impression of food and it was deeply disapointing. However, things went up from there. We ordered the pecorino cheese and bread appetizer and it was phenomenal!. I would go back just for that. The wife got a wedge salad. It was good, but 1) it's not a wedge, it cut up 2) they put egg on it and 3) the bacon on it was intensely flavorful and awesome. I initially got a caesar salad and was very fishy tasting. I declined to eat it and I like anchovies. They insisted on bringing me out the house salad which was great. I didn't complain and I didn't really need a different salad but the server was great. Wife got a filet and hash brown side dish and loved it. I got a ribeye and added a lobster tail. I loved the steak, but the lobster tail was about 5 oz and kinda tough. It definitely was not worth an extra $20. I got a corn side dish and it was awesome as well.  Overall, I love Cameron Mitchell restaurants and I will go back but there were a few taste disappointments here. I'm curious if others had the same roll issues bc I want to believe it was a one time mistake. Also 4 dollar signs is not quite appropriate to rate this, it should be 3.

My dog has been dying to go inside every time we walk by.  He's apparently not allowed, so my wife and I figured we'd check it out and report back to him.  The restaurant has been open a week and is a very busy, well-oiled machine.  Excellent service (and the price premium) that you'd expect from a Cameron Mitchell restaurant.  The place is a throwback to the old school steakhouse, and the food was truly great.  People like to complain about Cameron Mitchell restaurants taking over Columbus, but this one brings great food and great service.  It doesn't feel at all like a corporate chain, and it will bring more volume to Grandview Ave.  Happy to have them here.  But now my dog is pissed at me...

What ever happened to the days when a $150 bill gave you a dinner you raved about? My steak was burned and tough; I wanted to send it back but nobody checked on us so unfortunately I kept it. Otherwise underwhelmed with my mashed potatoes. Was expecting something special.  Maybe this place is still too new to get it right. I don't know. But for $150 I'm not going to try again.  Go to third and Hollywood instead---it's Consistent, always excellent, and great environment.

We took my father and his wife there last night for Father's Day. I had been here twice before so I thought it'd be ok. We arrived at 6:45 or so and we were seated immediately. We received our food just before 8:00. In our section, there were three booths and a a big table empty so it wasn't packed. It seemed like a very long time to wait for the food and then of course we were late to watch the Cavs game. The server was so great. She was friendly and answered questions. The hash browns had so much potential but they were so incredibly salty! Everyone at our table commented on how salty they were, including me. My stepmother got the French onion soup and she commented that it was too salty. My sister in-law also mentioned the French fries were too salty. Overall, it was ok.
