The family wasn't impressed so I wouldn't bring them here again. I might try it again and get food that is less likely to be so salty. After all, it's so close to my house!

What a wonderful addition to Grandview! The food and cocktails are excellent and a pretty decent value when compared to an a la carte steakhouse. The spicy chicken biscuit is definitely worth a try if you aren't in the mood for delicious steak. I recommend the steak tartare appetizer, the steak frites, and the corn as well. I have enjoyed everything I have had here honestly. I look forward to many a summer evening sitting on their patio enjoying their NYC burrow named cocktails.

Two friends and I had dinner here last Tuesday.  I seldom find that a restaurant lives up to its hype. In the matter of The Avenue, not only did it live up to its hype, it surpassed it.  The atmosphere was lively and loud but not so loud that you could not be easily heard by the people in your party; the trick of the acoustics was interesting. You could hear your group but not overhear neighboring tables.  This made it lively and intimate all at once. The decor is just as amazing.  You feel as if you have walked into a modern version of a 1950's steakhouse, or at least as I would imagine one looked like as I am not that old.  It is clear that corners were not cut and expect was not spared in the decoration and furnishings. The staff was superb. From the hostess to the server and everyone in between, they were friendly and made you feel welcome and helpful with any question.  They did not hover but were there when needed. Now on to the main course. The food was awesome, as in awe inspiring. From the appetizers to the dessert there was not a single misstep.  We split an order of Oysters Rockefeller and a shrimp cocktail.  The oysters were perfectly prepared and the shrimp as fresh as you could want. Next were the salads and soups. The portion sizes were just right. We had the Caesar and house salads and both were great.  The loaded potato soup was perfect. I was expecting a chunky soup but it was a smooth creamy textured soup and tasted wonderful. Everyone ordered the steak frites as their main. Wow who would have thought a skirt steak could have been cooked so well. The shoe string potatoes were the perfect accompaniment. You are given A house seasoning that you can add if desired. After trying it on one bite I desired a whole lot more.  This was an unexpected treat. You would think after eating all of this food there would be no room for dessert. You would be wrong. The bread pudding and hot fudge sundae were split among us and not a morsel was left.  After eating so much I was surprised that I did not feel stuffed to the gills. I really think The Avenue has their portion sizes down perfectly. So many places serve way too much food. Here the sizes were just enough for the particular course and left you so you could not wait to try the next creation to hit the table. I highly recommend The Avenue. I can not wait to go back and work my way through the entire menu.

I really like the vibe inside The Avenue, has sort of a speak easy way to it. I went here for my birthday and the overall opinion from the table was just "ok". I got the twin filets Oscar style with mushrooms and hash browns. The bÌ©arnaise sauce was super thick but good. Steak is steak, but the hash browns were under seasoned and didn't have very much of that golden crispy goodness I was craving (Waffle House has way better). Mushrooms were really good though. My friend ordered the chop steak and said it was like an under seasoned giant hamburger and she regretted ordering it. All of the desserts were good, but not anything to brag about.

We tried this place for the first time tonight and were greatly looking forward to it. We've eaten at most of Cameron Mitchell's restaurants and after the departure of Ruth's Chris from Columbus thought this could fill the void. I will say the atmosphere is quite nice and the staff/service was very friendly. My major issue is that they serve choice cuts of meat instead of prime (except for the filet mignons). I could taste the difference in my New York strip and when I asked the waitress she confirmed it. In my mind, for the price, all of the cuts should be prime. This place is positioning itself as a high end steak house and selling the same cuts of meat you would find at an outback or an Applebee's. I'd sooner buy a prime steak from market district or go somewhere else.

Reservation was made online...two weeks before the official opening on Feb 1st. They were confirmed. Let me tell you...this is one incredible place...from the valet parking attendants to the hostess to our unbelievably attentive server Derrick...OMG! HEAVEN! It was our wedding anniversary, and I had forgotten that I had indicated that when I made the reservation. Well..Derrick knew...I was blown away. Inside, the atmosphere is woodsy and I love the contrast of the dark wood panel walls with red leather booths and chairs. Awesome music too! They need a piano player and saloon singer, lol...but there would be no place to put them. The service here is better than any of the other Cameron Mitchell restaurants...perhaps because it has been open less than two weeks. Everything is sharp...and the food is beyond excellent. We started with the Baked cheese fondue, and Shrimp Cocktail...entrees were New York Strip w/Lobster Tails...Colorado Lamb Chops...New York strip again...sides were as perfect as the entrees. Our deserts...creme brulees were out of this world, and were each decorated with a little chocolate circle with 'Happy Anniversary' written in white chocolate. How can you top that?I highly recommend a visit. We're ready to make a reservation for a special birthday next month. Great job guys! It was a pleasure being there this evening.

First off, we were there tonight and in no way does this seem like a restaurant that has been open 10 days. Everything was top notch, but, Cameron Mitchell clearly does not open until everything is readySince this was our first visit, my friend and I tried everything from soup, salad entree sides and desert. we love fine steak houses and this was among the best.  Our server Scott was personable, knowledgable, always there when you needed and not there when you didn't.  French Onion soup excellent, as was the filet, hash browns and creamed spinach. great menu. I truly wish I could offer some sort of constructive criticism but cannot as I would not change a thing. Enjoyed more than some of our other favorites including Lindey's and Hyde Park.

Last night went to The Avenue and was very disappointed. Our drinks took 40 minutes to arrive. The rolls were rock hard and not edible. Biggest disappointment was the salty scallops. I brought out of town guest there and they enjoyed  the ambiance,  but food was a miss.
Epic food, epic service. From the steaks to the clams casino..home run, yay Grandview!!

Good and not good.  We were seated 45 minutes after our reservation time.  Not God. We did have a nice dink at the bar and the bartender was super. Good. Once seated, our appetizer order was taken right away. Good. It came to the table 25 minutes later. Not good. Oysters were great!  Entres were timely. Steak, Not great. Pork chop, amazing! Deserts, great! Price,  reasonable. Server, nice. Manager, great. Would try this place again.

We went here for my birthday dinner last night. We had a reservation and were seated immediately. The atmosphere and service were phenomenal, and the food was even better!I had the 6 oz. filet (with peppercorn) with the wedge salad and mashed potatoes.  There was a little too much dressing on the salad, but otherwise everything was perfect. We also ordered the hash browns to share since they had been recommended to us and they did not disappoint. Our server was very knowledgeable and prompt as well. I can't say enough good things. I would recommend making a reservation as it was very busy even on a random week night!

This is the restaurant Columbus has been missing since Mitchell's sold their steakhouse! The drinks were amazing...shrimp appetizer was over the top...and the steaks were the best in the city!  We had a delicious dinner and impeccable service from Rebecca; who was charming and efficient.  Can't wait to go back.

The Avenue Steak Tavern is exactly what it sounds like. A neighborhood place featuring basic meat dishes set in a classic, simple dÌ©cor with a busy, open kitchen and floor plan.Like nearly all Cameron Mitchell restaurants, the "concept" is king and the phony New York-style black & white photos (a la The Palm), the server's red suspenders, and the bogus signage all try to get your attention away from the lack of real patina or authenticity. It's all about franchising the concept for expansion. Nothing wrong with that, but like the tacky t-shirts that the servers wear at Marcella's with mob-style mottos like "Fuggetaboutit" printed on them, it takes away from the experience in my opinion.We arrived on time for our 8:00 reservation to find a busy waiting area and delays of up to 40 minutes for confirmed reservations. After 20 minutes we nearly left but I was offered a free drink to hang around, so we waited and were seated about at about 8:35. I have mixed feelings about this. On one hand, the well-oiled CM machine should have better control over the table flow, but it was handled well by the staff and service was quick once we were seated.As we were waiting, we noticed that the wines were stored in an open glass vault facing Grandview Avenue and the morning sun. I hope they change inventory quickly, as this will ruin good wine quickly.After being seated we were greeted immediately and drinks were brought out quickly. Like lots of places these days, they feature trumped up "big city" cocktails. We had wine by the glass (a nice selection and many under $10), so I can't comment on the fancy drinks. My $6 glass of Malbec was excellent.The bread arrived shortly thereafter but I didn't know what to make of it. They were soft, sweet buns with a pad of butter in a foil wrap. Just one small bun each. Kind of diner-like and not real impressive.The menu is short and features the unadorned 1960s style basics- steaks, chops, seafood, potatoes, salads and few desserts. You could say "classic" or you could say, "dated." Up to you. We thought this focus made sense, as nearly everyone we saw was ordering steaks.We started with the shrimp cocktail, which was mid-sized (not the giants you find at Hyde Park) but was perfectly prepared with a small pile of horseradish sitting on top of the cocktail sauce to mix in if you like.This was followed by a wedge salad, which oddly, was not a wedge at all. It was a tiny pile of iceberg, chopped egg, bacon and tomato with very little dressing. It was very fresh and tasty, but skimpy and too small to split. Nothing like the actual wedge cut from a head of lettuce like Morton's or Ruth's Chris.We ordered a NY strip and the large filet, both medium rare. The open kitchen allows you to see the super hot broilers they use to cook the steaks. This is my preferred method, vs. grilling, pan-frying or a flat top, as it sears the meat quickly and holds the juices in.They arrived at the table sizzling and were both spot on, temperature-wise. The meat is obviously high quality (I read that they source it from Michael's) and was super tender. Not huge cuts, but thick and satisfying. There is nothing worse than spending $40 on a single piece of meat and having it botched.The baked potato and asparagus sides were uninspiring.We skipped dessert and our tab was $138 including tax. Not cheap, but fair. This is less a corner tavern and more of a special night out place.The experience is almost exactly what I expected- fake trappings, good service and well-prepared food. With all of the innovation in the Columbus food scene, I'd rather spend my money exploring, so I don't expect to back here soon, but I can recommend it.

Me and my boyfriend went here last night for dinner for the first time.  I got the special punch drink with rum in it (I forget what it's called.)  It was tasty and made right. ;)  For dinner my boyfriend got the special, which was a New York strip with a special sauce on the side, a wedge salad and a baked potato.  The steak was cooked PERFECTLY.  He likes his steaks medium well and that seems hard to attain at most places.  They either overcook it or under cook it.  They did it perfect at The Avenue.  He said it was one of the best steaks he's ever had.  The wedge salad was different than any wedge I've ever seen, but it was really good.  Had a 1,000 Island type of dressing on it, eggs, bacon, tomatoes and was chopped up... not in the shape of the typical wedge salad.  I had the caesar salad.  It was alright... nothing to write home about.  For my meal I got the hot chicken biscuit with fries.  The fries were great and I really liked the sandwich too.  Was definitely spicy!  They were PACKED... which we expected.  We made reservations.  When we got there, the only table they had available for us was a small high top table in the bar area, so we opted to wait for a real table.  It was only about 10 minutes and they seated us.  All in all, it was a good experience.  The server was nice.  We will definitely go back!

Great dinner ! Top Sirloin Steak with Bernaise Sauce , great Tavern Salad! NewYork Steak house atmosphere! Service was good! Server named Scott was knowledgable and efficient! Food was slow getting out ! Definitely would go there again!

Ambiance was nice.  Steak was very good as was the service.  Ceasar salad was made with old lettuce and over-dressed, from a bottle.  The worst was the bread service.  Grocery store quality.  I'm not typically a big carb eater so when I go to a nice restaurant, I have a little (treat) bread which should be high quality (first impression).  Ironically,  the next night I happened to eat at another (Martini) CM restaurant, and the same thing happened!  Horrible, tasteless bread!  Cameron, cut costs somewhere else.  Everyone deserves a second chance but when my friends ask (yes, I'm a foodie so they do) I'm honest.  These things are easily remedied, but leave a lasting impression.

Often times our best qualities, in their extreme, are our greatest weakness. And so it goes with Cameron's service model. Sat at the bar on date night recently, but decided against dinner because we couldn't carry on a cohesive conversation. With zero meaning being ignored and ten as perfectly attentive, the bartender was a 15. The tasty mushrooms and oysters Rockefeller appetizers were damn near perfect. Just wish we could've enjoyed them without the monologue on George Washington's proclivity for rum from Barbados and unsolicited interruptions.

Went with a group of 5 for a business meeting. Service was great. Cameron Mitchell was sitting at the table adjacent to us so that probably helped. The food was perfectly prepared. Steaks were cooked exactly as ordered. Creamed spinach was delicious. The bartender made B&Bs for after dinner drink and they were delicious. Cool environment. Nice for meeting. Good wine selection.

Came on a Wednesday evening. This could easily be a 4-star except: 1) a 6:30 reservation means 6:30 or pretty close. Not 7:15 because you're "new and busy" but 6:30 because you're new and making first impressions. 2) Guests ordered strip steak (not seasoned)' steak frites (cold) chophouse corn (over-salted). My pork chop, on the other hand, was delicious and seasoned and cooked perfectly. Another shot tomorrow night!

The only reason I am giving them 3 stars is because our service was immaculate! I thought the restaurant ambiance was nice and welcoming. We ordered the shrimp appetizer that was basically shrimp scampi. The sauce the shrimp came in was Good, however, the shrimp were SO over cooked, they tasted like rubber. I ordered the 8 oz Filet Oscar style. My steak was very over cooked. I ordered it medium rare and it was slightly over medium. My plate was filled with blood and made the sauce that comes with the Oscar taste watered down and gross. This is the first ever review I have written on Yelp. I decided to review bc if you are going to charge $50 for a filet Oscar, it better be good.... And it just wasn't! Disappointed!!

My husband and I went to celebrate my birthday and Valentine's and it was amazing. First off, I called the day of our reservation to see if we could push it an hour and they were very accommodating and changed it, I was surprised because it was the day after Valentine's. Second our waitress was so great and knowledgeable, she even gave us a little something for dessert to go before we left. The food was amazing and I love that the sides weren't extra. Drinks were awesome too. Definitely going back!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We went for a belated anniversary dinner, and had a great time. I ate what was by far the best scallop of my life -- a single golden scallop with a smoky, buttery flavor I'd never tasted before. The Bourbon Hemingway was absolutely delicious. Our steaks were very good, though my filet was just a touch on the dry side. My wife's ribeye had a fantastic char on it, though.The service was polite and attentive, although I felt our server was perhaps a bit new, and brought more enthusiasm to the description of the dishes than was necessary.Overall we really enjoyed the experience, and would gladly go back for a future special occasion. I'd love to see the building and surrounding grounds in the daytime as we were there after dark.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Went here for my bday dinner with one of my dear friends. I love Cameron Mitchell restaurants and was super excited to try this one. I walked in and was so happy I selected this place. The interior is absolutely gorgeous! I wish I took pictures of it but there were these beautiful rustic looking chandeliers hanging from the ceiling. It was a very unique decor; I'd call it "rustic elegance." Our server was very pleasant and we connected well with her. We got to know her on a personal level; that she was going to school for nursing, was a single mom, etc. I enjoyed getting to know her and thought she was very nice! My steak was absolutely delicious!! Very tender and juicy- cooked to perfection! The steak fries were great as well. Overall a very excellent meal, definitely a birthday worthy location! We also got a bottle of wine that they re-corked for us to take home which I appreciated! For dessert I got the peanut butter chocolate pie (nothing better than PB & chocolate!) It was good, but not quite sweet enough for me. Overall I'd recommend this as a great place for a special celebration. I really enjoyed celebrating my birthday here and had an excellent time!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Christmas Eve brunchThere were 6 adults in our party we were hoping to have a semi quite enjoyable meal The restaurant and staff did and above the Norm job We were seated in a lovely nook in the bar away from all the usual over excited holiday youngsters The food did not disappoint The fried chicken, smoked pork loin and shrimp were some of the best I've tasted Was semi disappointed there was no French toast as I heard it was the best But definitely did not leave hungry I opted to have a waffle for dessert as the numerous toppings made it seem like a very decadent dessert Others at the table raved about The Carmel dessert a bar cookie topped with chocolate I would definitely recommend and return again I felt the food quality equals the price at $30 Thank you Cameron Mitchell again another great restaurant

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Decent food but not my best spot for steak in Columbus. However, I like to hangout here for happy hour sometime. They have a nice patio with fire that I enjoy sitting around with bourbon

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The manager got us in last minute because I messed up the reservations on a holiday. Incredible service (with my high maintenance family) and incredible food. Finally making this our Christmas tradition!!!! Love this place

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Reverse to a few weeks ago when my dad indicated that he was going to get me Memorial tickets for my birthday and that I could pick anywhere for my birthday dinner. Well the Barn was on a list that my girlfriend and I made up for places we want to try.  I made a reservation on a Saturday night for 7:45 seating. We were greeted promptly by the host and she grabbed menus and gave us to another host for him to show us the way to our table, but not without first saying "Happy Birthday" to me. Our server was Austin and he did a extraordinary job!! I even started a talk thread for the best recent service because of our experience. Austin has been working at the barn for a couple of years and it shows, he knows the menu inside and out. Ask for Austin when dining at The Barn. The three of us ordered salads to start off, my girlfriend with the spinach salad, my dad with the house and I ordered the Caesar. The salads were all good and a nice way to start off the night. For our main course each of us ordered a steak- My girlfriend and dad both ordered the Twin Filets both getting 1 bacon wrapped and 1 brie topped with a baked potato as the side. I ordered the 14oz prime ribeye and Austin suggested it medium, which is more done then I like it, but he gave an explanation as to why to order medium and not my typical medium rare. The ribeye was delicious, it was melt in my mouth tender with a perfectly crust and served with housemade steak sauce and my choice of side which also was a baked potato. Being a CMR I knew dessert was going to be on the house, so I ordered a slice of coconut cake and it was delicious, nice and moist and creamy. The three of us had a great night at The Barn and I will definitely check it out for brunch with my meetup group.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The service and experience were great, the waiter was very personable.  The food was good, not great as I expected from a Cameron Mitchell's restaurant.  We had wine and mixed drunks with our dinner, which paired well with our entrees as recommended by the waiter.  The desserts were my favorite part, yummy, with leftovers!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Service was great and food was delicious. I had the fried chicken dinner with mac and cheese. This was the most crunchy chicken I ever had! There were 3 pieces served with a side of mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was very yummy! My hubby had the T-bone steak with baked potato and a Cesar salad. The t-bone was very tender. It was a bit pricey at $44 but he doesn't eat red meat often so this was a really good treat! We tried to share a mud pie for dessert but ended taking most of it home. It was a very enjoyable evening at The Barn!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: This place is great. My wife and I bought condominium on the Preserve in New Albany for frequent visits to our grandkids and this wonderful restaurant it's only one mile away.  I went here yesterday for the first time. On a rainy day the valet parking was big help. I was seated in a moment at 7pm on pre-holiday Friday... Food was excellent (see photos) & my waiter very attentive. Atmosphere was Christmasy and the visiting  people were enjoying them self.Next time I'm planing to bring my wife with me. She had to leave earlier this week for family emergency in California.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: If you're looking for a cozy romantic dinner where you leave full and happy, this is it! We live right around the corner and finally went there for the birthday. Service cannot be beaten, and the food was great! I enjoyed the spaghetti beef bolognese and our server helped us pair it with a really tasty petit Syrah. Big portions as well. The Barn reminds me of a traditional restaurant I would be able to take anyone to. It was on the pricey side, but if you are willing to splurge it's worth it! Next time we will try the bourbon bar

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: My honest opinion???  Great ambiance, great selection of food and great service.  I've had lunch and dinner here, and always satisfied.  However..,,,, I understand it's a Cameron Mitchell restaurant, but $32 for Sunday brunch?  Unreasonably expensive if you asked me.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I needed a nice spot for a casual business dinner, we sat at the bar and got greeted with a big smile. We talked business and the bar tender would check in every now and again before we finally ordered. The salad portion seemed unusually small but tasted great, I got the twin filets medium and they came out perfect. Very good service and friendly staff. I will be back again soon. Went back last night 4/6/17 and it was fantastic, we sat in the main dining area which is beautiful. Love the atmosphere. I had a great strip steak with a side of sautÌ©ed mushroom/onions. It was prepared perfectly

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Decided to try The Barn for restaurant week as I heard great things about it. We made a reservation and were seated 10mns after our time, it took a while for our server to stop over to greet us. The service was good, however, a little slow in coming to check if anything else was needed. We were seated in the bar area, so be prepared for elevated noise levels. The bread is amazing, the calamari could have been cooked a tad bit longer and the main courses exceeded our expectations. I'll definitely be back and recommend adding it anyone's list of restaurants to try, don't be fooled by the "barn" looking exterior, it's a classy joint! Lol

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I arrived in Columbus  with visions of travelling to Marietta Ohio the next day. I was with 2 other work colleagues, of which one of them picked the Barn for dinner. Steak is one of their specialties, and the mark of such an establishment is how well they do a burger. Excellent as it turned out. I loved the atmosphere, the food, and the service. Everything came together well, right down to the waiter complimenting me on my Pearl Izumi tennis shoes and thanking us for dining on behalf of the restaurant in first person.  My only regret is that the Barn is one of those places where I dined on a business expense account and wished that it was date night with Gayle. .

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: My husband and I came here to celebrate our marriage. We had reservations and were instantly greeted as we walked in the door, everyone was professional. The decor was beautiful. Our server, Keith, was absolutely amazing. He was able to make suggestions on both food and drink items- checking to make sure our bloody Mary's tasted the way we wanted. I ordered the shaved prime rib sandwich and was concerned about the bread being too hard for my braces. He offered au jus to soften it up, it was perfect! My family was thoroughly satisfied with their meal. Overall I'd rate it a 4.2, but factoring the price for the meal compared to the amount of food given: 3.7. This is not a cheap place to take your date.In the back they have a special section for (cigar) smokers.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I really don't like steak. Well, that's what I thought before I went here. I don't think I've ever had meat with such flavor and be so tender. The price tag is a little high, but don't let it scare you. You get what you pay for here, and it's SO worth it. Get the filet .. Oscar style :)

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Arrived for 8 pm reservation.  Sat on a comfy leather sofa by the most beautiful Christmas treeI have ever seen!  Atmosphere was wonderful, decor beautiful.  That being said......we were escorted to our table........through the magnificent dining room, through the ancillary dining room, out to the patio....under a tent with the plastic sides zipped down, on concrete, patio furniture and heater lamps!!!! Oh, I forgot to add that it was only 25 degrees outside!!!!!  Food was great and service was adequate.  I don't have a problem paying the price for fine dining.  But really CM???  On the patio??????  Will not likely return nor recommend to others.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: a very nice dining experience.   my first time at The Barn and glad we did.  the servers are especially attentive .  not over the top, on point, pleasant and professional .   started with  crafted cocktails-go with your liquor of choice, match it with some type of variety.  appetizer was a goat cheese ravioli-wow.  i had a flavorful beefsteak tomato salad. we ordered a filet which was great, a huge tasty pork chop that was yummy, the salmon was good perfect and a redfish special that was special. really enjoyed The Barn and we will be back !!!!!!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: This place is very unique. The inside of the restaurant was set up awesome, I love the decor. Valet parking is free which is also nice. This place gets busy! We made a reservation for 6 on a Friday and the place was packed. It took a coupleMinutes to get our seats. The drink list centers around bourbon but there are other choices if that isn't your thing. Two people in my party got the bourbon samplers and really enjoyed that. I had the tea bourbon drink, forget what it's actually called, and it was really good. I will also say this place is great with kids. As soon as we sat down I ordered a baked potato for my daughter and hey brought it out right away, so nice! I had the lobster bisque to start and it was okay. It tasted like a typical lobster bisque. For my meal I had the scallops and they were just okay. They cooked them perfectly for sure but for me the flavors were lacking. 2 of my dining mates got the filet and were in love with it. To them this review would be 5 stars, they couldn't get over how good the steak was. I tried it and thought it was good. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing I don't know? Overall this place is pricey....for me if I am going to pay this much for dinner I would like it to at least somewhat blow me away! I might come back at some point and give that steak a try!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Been to this place before and used to like it a lot. Last time front desk gave us attitude and wouldn't seat outside when there were free tables. Sat us instead inside next to two loud tables with 10 guests and 6 guests . The haughty host proceeded to give us menus without giving the wine list. We sat for 10 minutes without a waiter appearing. I went to get a wine list myself to make a choice to be ready when the waiter would appear. Got a wine list myself by getting up and asking a passing server. That didnt ring any warning bells for them. We sat waiting another 5 minutes without a waiter ever coming, we decided they just aren't giving even decent service. Not going back there when it's busy that's for sure. The manager enthusiastically asked us how our dinner was on our way out. Wow. Wasn't in the mood to be mad or sit and wait anymore or give them any money or time. Dont bother going Wednesday night or when it's busy until the staff changes.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We love Cameron Mitchell places. For your money, you will get more than most places. We have really high expectations  and usually we leave happy. That being said, between atmosphere, service and food, food is the weakest link here and it's not that bad at all. The atmosphere is that of a barn and like a sip of good bourbon; warm, caramel and inviting.  The service and management are wonderful people who care. Now, to our food. My wife ordered steak oscar which had little lobster pieces on top....but fishy juice was all over the steak..not good. I had a prime rib that was aged, but the fat was rancid in spots. I know meats. I know aging and it's an understandable mistake. The management called me later and made it right!  No kitchen is perfect, but how they reacted was professional and I'm sure the food will be right on when we go back.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We went to the Barn to celebrate our anniversary and as soon as we walked past the hostess stand we knew we made a mistake, especially when she called (yelled) our name.  The atmosphere was not what we had expected, especially considering the menu.  It was loud and fast paced, service personal moving quickly from table to table and we were seated in the back next to the restroom and service station which made it worse.  This is not the place for a small celebration but would be fine for a large group party.  We decided to celebrate here because we at in the bar a few weeks prior and the feeling was cozy and intimate, which naturally we thought would translate to the rest of the restaurant.  The food that we had in the bar was delicious, a burger and a shaved prime sandwich.  The servings were ample and everything tasted great.  Not so much in the dining room.  We ordered the oysters (we did discuss it for a bit since we are in Ohio) but figured if it was on the menu in a CM restaurant they would do it good.  Not so much, the oysters were practically non existent and gritty.  The other issue was our main meal, for the prices of the steak dinners two sides should come with the meal.  At any steak house the choices should be carb and veg not one or the other, this is the first time we have encountered this and were very disappointed in the presentation.  Our server brought us a delicious piece of cake for our anniversary which was nice and appreciated.Kind of a disappointment on many levels, however we will go back and eat in the bar again.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Good steakhouse, it's what you expect for an independent, non-chain place.  Good food.Great outdoor bar with fire ring.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: On 7/18/16, me and a group of folks from work went for one of my coworker's birthday dinner.  I made reservations online about a week ago, and when we arrived tonight I was pleasantly surprised that we were placed in a private little room to accommodate us without even asking for it.  This was awesome!  Claire was our server and she was wonderful; when advised that it was one of group's birthday, the guest in question was told she would receive a free dessert.I'll try to go over everyone's orders, but I might miss one or two things, so apologies.  My fiancee had the Bourbon Apple Punch, while one of our group tried the Bourbon Hemingway along with a Bud Light.  Obviously everyone knows what they are getting with a Bud Light, but my friend seemed to enjoy the Hemingway, and my fiancee enjoyed the Apple Punch so much she ended up having two.For apps all we ordered was the calamari, which was delightful again (not overly greasy as my first review mentioned, perfectly done and I love the horseradish aioli).  One of our group ordered the Goat Cheese Ravioli, which she didn't really enjoy too much.  I didn't get a taste so I can't really say what was wrong or wasn't wrong with it, but the Barn was nice enough to comp the person who ordered it upon seeing she didn't enjoy it.As far as entrees go, two folks had the prime rib (both king cut), one had the ribs (looked awesome and huge serving), one had petite filet with macaroni and cheese, my fiancee had the salmon, and I had the scallops again.  I had a bite of the prime rib and it rocked my world, and both people who ordered it thought the same as well.  One had a minor complaint of the horseradish not being spicy enough, but he can be picky.  He also mentioned that the mashed potatoes didn't taste like much other than potatoes, but I don't see how that's a bad thing.My friend with ribs ate about half the rack and said they were great.  They came with fries which he also liked.  Other guest who ordered the filet enjoyed the steak, and was too full to even try the mac and cheese (she took it home to eat as a snack later).  Fiancee enjoyed the salmon but felt that it would have been better if served with a more filling side, as it came prepared with wilted spinach, some peas, and tomatoes.  Scallops for me?  Just look to my last review, they are killer, and that mustard vinaigrette is to die for.  My plate was once again clean when taken away.Dessert time!  I was already pretty full, but birthday guest had slice of peanut butter pie, one of the other guests had the lemon poppy bundt cake, which he enjoyed.  My fiancee had the "Frozen Mudd Pie" which looked amazing but WOW is it a lot of food.  Fiancee loved it but could only eat about half of it, which was still pretty impressive to me.Another great night at the Barn!  I'll mention in closing that as always, the rolls with that maple butter are out of this world.  Also, one final note...please bring back your cheesecake!  Half of the group was craving it and we were told you guys got rid of it...bring it back!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The food and service are almost always very good. For the prices at this Cameron Mitchell restaurant , they should always be. We can't figure out why a $16 cheeseburger at an establishment of this caliber is not a grass fed burger. Are their steaks all grass fed ? No idea. This is a healthier , higher quality of beef , (grass fed. ) So maybe Cameron should  invest in at least the burgers. And The steaks as well. The burger was good , not great. But shouldn't everything on the menu be great ?YES.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Had the Ernest Hemingway cocktail which I strongly recommend. Then moved onto the wedge which I know is a stupidly simple salad, but it's so good (as was The Barn's). Ended on the queen size prime rib with a side of creamed spinach. Asked for med rare and got...med rare. Perfect. Just wish the creamed spinach didn't have pieces of bacon with it. Don't get me wrong--I love bacon but when you're having it with a big slab of beef, it's just a little much. And simple creamed spinach is so so good on its own. Also wish they offered cream corn! My brother had the filet mignon which also looked perfectly cooked. He finished his entire plate and commented on how his side of broccoli was not over cooked--he loved it. It's a steakhouse so be prepared to spend some $$$ unless you get a sandwich there. Pros: perfectly cooked beef and vegetablesCons: cost

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: A group of 12 of UA came here for brunch. The decor is very dark and manly but well designed. They have a main dining area and then a more causal area with a huge bar. The service and attention was great. We all elected for the all-you-can-eat brunch. It wasn't a let down. I particularly enjoyed the chilled shrimp, fried chicken - yes, to the fried chicken. The salmon and fried capers...fried capers! You can dress up your salmon with other toppings. Oh, and their pecan French toast -- to die for! I did have a Caesar salad to begin for my veggie. I have to say they have a lot of options, you know the usual suspects, carving station, bacon, eggs, potatoes, two different pastas, salmon, cod, bread, cereal, soup stations...but I stuck with what was good. Oh, I didn't make it to the dessert station...the French toast was my dessert. The gang said they have an excellent Bloody Mary bar, and bourbon flights...I wouldn't know...tomatoes...yuck! I had a Bellini cause that's what this lady likes! Jordan, our waiter was excellent as well as the other staff! If ever in The 'bus again, I'd go back!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Went last night for our anniversary dinner. We were almost 20 minutes late for our reservation (stupid city traffic) and they held the table for us no problem. Our server was extremely personable, funny, and friendly. We had the crab cake appetizer which was phenomenal. I had the 6oz filet (rare) from the "prix fixe" menu which came with a salad, Brussels sprouts, redskin potatoes, butternut squash, and choice of dessert. The steak and salad were both excellent. My boyfriend had the pork chop and it was HUGE and he said it was awesome. For dessert, the creme brÌÈlÌ©e cannot be beat!! We will be back.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: TBH, I wasn't blown away.  I wanted to be blown away because (1) I love CM restaurants generally and (2) the restaurant occupies the old Hoggy's, which I loved.  Here's what I liked:  The restaurant has excellent decor; everything is subdued and classy.  The bar is a thing to behold (think wood paneling and muted lighting).  The selection of bourbons and bourbon-related cocktails is amazing.  But, the food is what I'd like to characterize as overpriced American steakhouse catering to the rich.  There was not a single, innovative thing on the menu and many were re-purposed CM standbys.  I'm not a huge steak fan and neither my friend nor I were in the mood for a huge meal, so we ordered cocktails, a salad, an appetizer, a side, and bowl of French onion soup each.  I did enjoy my cocktail (Hemingway) and the French onion soup.  However, everything else I ordered was just mediocre.  Also, the brussels sprouts were super oily, overcooked, bitter, and bland.  A shame, especially since it's $8.  Lastly, the service was just ok.  We purposely sat at the bar, where I usually receive consistent service at other restaurants.  But, it was a Saturday night, and the bartenders were extremely busy.  Our interactions with them frequently felt rushed and lacking.I may go back for cocktails only.  If I'm in the mood for dinner, then I'll likely stop by at Hudson 29 or even Cap City Diner nearby.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: One the best restaurants I have been to in years! Trust me, I eat out a lot due to job so I should know! My husband and I went here for dinner on a Friday evening! Amazing food, atmosphere and decor, excellent service! First of all, if you like whiskey this is the place for you. Over 100 different kinds with very knowledgeable staff! Next the food! Yum-O!! I got the pre-fixed 3 course which includes a salad/soup, entree and dessert. I beefsteak tomato salad with red onion. Delicious and super fresh! Next I got the braised short ribs- juicy, mouthwatering, and it came with mashed potatoes. Then dessert I had apple cake which was also excellent. (The menu says only one choice for dessert but you can pick any). My husband got the shaved steak sandwich with onions, peppers and cheese which was also excellent. Highly recommend this place! Hope to be back soon!!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Service to be expected at a Cameron Mitchell establishment. The ambiance was wonderful, and the details were finely crafted. The food itself was also exceptional. The service was great, my only complain is that our waiter was not the happiest person in the world. You can tell, though, that he still was trying to please us. I just wish he had been perhaps a little more peppy. I am deducting one star for that. The second star I have chosen to deduct is for the fact that we were not seated until about fifteen minutes after we arrived - punctually and on-time - for our 7:30 reservation. You know, most restaurants these days don't accept reservations. And for most of us, when we go out to one that does, we expect a table to be reserved specifically for us, when we arrive. And a few minutes is not a big deal. Fifteen, however, is. Shortly after we sat to wait, we were offered a cocktail. In my...audacity, I suppose...I assumed this was complimentary for our wait. In which case the fourth star would have remained in place! But, lo and behold, I was wrong...we were promptly charged for the cocktail upon receiving it. Luckily, the night only got better from there.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: This has become one of our family's favorite places. Sunday Brunch was an amazing experience and food choices during brunch was wonderful. Price for brunch is well worth it and was better then most because of the amount and types of meats. If you can't do Sunday Brunch try dinner. We also had a family member's birthday celebration here. They accommodated our group of 18 adults and 4 kids very easy. The menu choices for all of us was good and the food was amazing. The staff servicing our group did not miss a beat. We love this place!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Meh. This place should be great but it just misses the mark. The prices reflect a place where one would reasonably expect high food quality and superb service. After three visits here I have found that you will pay a hefty bill while the rest is just Ok (sometimes).  Here are the observations from my three visits:Walking in the door you will see 3-4 people at the hostess stand. While there are lots of bodies they are not especially attuned to you the customer as you enter and you must make an effort to engage with them. Service while dining is mediocre. Empty water glasses and bread baskets have been common on all three visits. Lots of people running around on staff but again, not attuned to the customer or the experience. Also on the most recent visit we were on the patio and it took no less than 45 minutes to cash out as the server was also covering tables inside and was gone from the entire patio for at least 20 minutes after dropping off the bill. Food is meh. It isn't bad it just isn't as good as the price. As much as it is hyped up I have found food of equal quality at outback (but at a much lower price point).  For the massive prices sides are extras and also fork over some more $'s for a salad. Just way overpriced. Atmosphere is awesome. Great setting and outdoor area is especially nice. My conclusion is that this place needs a reboot. It should be great but just misses the mark in too many areas for their price point.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Excellent service both at bar and table. Giving 4 stars because my meal was  not up to expectations: Ordered shaved prime sandwich which included fries, asked waiter for baked potato instead, and he charged me $8 for that. The sandwich was extremely greasy, couldn't eat it. But waiter was so nice I couldn't complain. The dessert mud pie was fabulous and huge. Three of us couldn't finish it. Again, in fairness because my companions enjoyed their dinner and we sat at bar for over an hour with exceptional service I am awarding four stars. Just be prepared to spend a lot and choose your meal wisely. Between the bar and dinner we spent near $200 for three of us. Planned another dinner with three friends for Monday night and hope all goes as well. I won't be ordering prime sandwich though!!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: You can't go wrong with a Cameron Mitchell. This place is very high class. It has a very rustic feel, with all wooden decor and dim lighting. There is a nice bourbon lounge with dozens of types to choose from. The waiting staff is very helpful, friendly, and timely. We were told the wait was over an hour for a party of eight, but we probably only waited for 20 minutes. There is complimentary valet, which is nice because this place is PACKED, and so is the parking lot. There is no doubt The Barn is a popular place in town. The food is incredible. I ordered the twin filets wrapped in bacon. When asked by friends how my meal was, I simply replied, "I honestly don't think it could be any better." The steak was cooked to perfection. UNREAL!!The place is pricey, but well worth it. I recommend wearing dressier clothing if you want to fit the atmosphere.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Went there for a Sunday brunch. It was quite expensive. $30/person we spent a total of $90 for two. I do not feel as if the food held up to the expectation that would come with that price. The quality is no where near what you'd expect from a place advertised as such. Their best food item was the French toast. They have a few items that were not great at all. A couple of pasta items I would not recommend. I would not recommend brunch here. Beautiful building but not worth your dollar.Also, we had sat at the bar. We had terrible service from our bar tender. But we could see the entire time she was not busy. Getting a glass of water was the most difficult thing.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Friendly staff invites you upon your entrance into a pleasantly decorated restaurant.  The delicious sweet butter was  paired with simple rolls that insight your tastebuds.  Dinner atmosphere was a tad loud, but a conversation could still be had.  Dinner was presented well and cooked to my request.  High marks here!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: This is a very nice restaurant that you pretty much have to have a reservation to get into on the weekends. I like the bar and it's bourbon collection but have eaten in the restaurant several times too. My wife likes the fish and I usually get a steak. The bourbon drinks are excellent, did I mention that?

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Our server Jordan was great! He knew a lot about the menu and was very helpful. My steak was over cooked. The flavor would of been much better if it was cooked properly. I ordered med rare, and it came out medium plus. Overall prices were high for the value, prob will only go back for happy hour.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Been 4 times since I've moved to the neighborhood. I love this friendly, romantic place for special occasions, just about everything very good. I've had the filet mignon twice, both times cooked perfectly medium rare, with a slight char on the outside (but you can order a heavier char.) The generous pecan trout was flakey and mild. The mac & cheese is our favorite side, creamy and flavorful. Love the sharp goat cheese ravioli appetizer. Shrimp cocktail are meaty and pre-sauced. The crab cakes were good but the aioli scarce. Best dessert is the fluffy coconut cake with dark chocolate ganache. We've tried the crÌ¬me brÌÈlÌ©e, not nearly dark or crisp enough, but some may like it. They have a nice 14 Hands Cab for $36.00. Advice to a few Yelpers here, Columbus restaurant prices are very reasonable compared to other areas of the country. You cannot claim to be shocked when the check arrives unless you're legally blind, as the prices are posted on the menu!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The Barn has quickly risen to the top of our favorite dinner spots. We've visited twice and both occasions were outstanding. Keith was our server both times and we will continue to request to him in the future. He's one of the best servers we've ever met!Our favorites at The Barn:- Oysters bingo- Seabass (if they have it).- The Bone in NY strip- Creamed Spinach side dish* If you're gluten free, they also have gluten free bread that they will make for you. It delicious - highly recommend!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Went there for brunch, the chicken is undercooked at the buffet area, told the server twice that this is not acceptable for the food safety standard, nobody seems care. For the reputation of the restaurant, this is totally wrong. I never went back again.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The Sunday Brunch buffet is worth a try. This buffett is a step above the rest in quality and service. Bring your family or friends and order up a mimosa and stuff your face. Chef ordered omelet with your server and skip any long lines watching and waiting for someone to make it like other buffets. The buffet has your classic breakfast items but the waffles are to die for. They are crispy at first bite and melt in your mouth sweet and savory. Toppings like pecans, strawberry and whip cream round out the deliousness. The fried chicken is also worth a try too. Crispy, not to salty or soggy and full of flavor with juices dripping down at first bite. Yes! Downfall could be the price and lack of variety but don't mistake that for quality. Check it out. We will be back for sure.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Have visited the Barn many times for dinner. It goes without saying that service is uniformly outstanding and food excellent. But yesterday was my first opportunity to sample the Sunday brunch. And what a treat it was!  Although the 'date' was scheduled somewhat reluctantly as a working meeting that I wasn't particularly looking forward to, everything about the experience was thoroughly enjoyable. Service was friendly, efficient, thorough but absolutely unrushed. Although our group "lingered" well after we had obviously finished there was no sense that we were being encouraged to hasten our departure. The food offerings were varied, fresh and well seasoned. I'd especially recommend  the fried chicken and (yes!) the cod. The deserts were outstanding!If I were to make any suggestions it would be to liven up the bread offerings and to offer freshly carved turkey ....because some of us love turkey!!! And it's really, really better for us than bacon. (They say.)

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The lady friend (LF) and I decided to venture over to The barn for dinner tonight. There appeared to be no parking. It free valet ( never really free as you should always tip the drivers) so all is good. We were about 15 minutes early of the res. No big deal, they were cleaning off the table and only had to wait 3-4 minutes. The server, Heather, was Jonny on the spot from the start to the finish. We started off with two orders of oysters and the calamari. The LF had been once before and there were only 6 oysters, when the plates arrived there were 8 on each order. They were small. They were super Shelly. They were mediocre at best. The calamari was prepared perfectly and the aoli was great. That was where the dinner took a nose dive. heather stops by a few times and seems a bit alarmed that our steaks have not yet arrived. The LF ordered the flat iron medium with a baked sweet potato, I ordered the T bone "rare". The meals were eventually served with many apologies for the delays. They didn't really take exceptionally long to me, but the server seemed to think that they should have been ready way faster then they were. Well now I know why. The t bone was a medium. The flat iron was a mixed bag. Well done on the edges and rare in the center. Heather came back pretty quickly to ask how things were. I showed the color of my steak and said the temperature was pretty far off. She asked if I wanted another. Not really, I don't want to wait for another steak. She said to "hold on". I at part of my potato and a few bites of a then chewy steak. Another server comes out with another t bone. Hands it to me and asks if I would like another potato. I had only eaten a few bites of the first potato so I declined. I expected her to leave my first potato but it was whisked away with the offending steak. There was very little sear on the top of the steak. Server waited for me to cut into it and it was red. So far so good and she left. First bite was cold. There was almost no cooking on the bottom side. This steak wasn't even cooked to blue. The bone edge was raw. Raw fat. I ate a small amount of the strip. Asked for the remainders to be packed away. Heather offers to buy us a desert for our trouble and drops off the menus. Loss of appetite left no interest in a desert and none of them seemed like they would travel well so we declined the free desert. Heather then offered to comp the skirt stake (almost half the price of the steak that was the focus of the complaint)You are a steak house. You have one real job. Prepare the steak correctly. I can not imagine ever coming back.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The food was great! The cocktails were almost too pretty to drink, and the service was exceptional.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I would love to tell you about the food as Chef Ho was a favorite at Marcellas but after waiting an hour with a reservation we left.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Wonderful place to take co workers to impress them! Or a perfect date night! Service is great & atmosphere is chill.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I have to start by saying The Barn gets 4 stars for delicious food but I had to cut a star for the overall experience. For the food...its awesome. The rolls and honey butter on the table are amazing and I won't lie when I say I ate two or three before my meal even came out. I ordered the brisket meal which is smoked in house for 6 hours the day you order it. They pile the brisket high open faced on a large piece of Texas toast. The brisket was super tender and delicious, covered in the house made bbq sauce was fantastic. I swapped the greens the meal comes with for Mac n cheese and I don't regret it one bit. I also had a bit of a friend's flat iron steak which was cooked perfectly medium rare and the fried chicken is also of honorable mention. The experience was unfortunately a little sour as we had a 7:30 reservation on a Wednesday and we were not seated until about 7:55. We were placed in the outdoor back patio walled off with plastic tent walls while the temperature was near 20 degrees outside at a table that was still being set. The back patio was not set up for guests, extra chairs were stacked all over the room, and the tables were unorganized. It was clear that they messed up our reservation and were scrambling to set us up as fast as possible. After being dissatisfied with the seating situation we were able to be moved inside and the waiter was accommodating. For being a Cameron Mitchell restaurant, they definitely satisfied me with their food but I expected more out of the experience. Every restaurant has their start-up kinks though so I'm sure I'll be back to try them again.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: My husband is more than just a little obsessed with great bourbon and rye....so when his birthday rolled around I decided to hold a get together at a place where I heard takes their bourbon very seriously - THE BARN.I love the vibe they had goin on in the bourbon bar. Their list was pretty good and it was cool that they had a variety of flights available. Drinks were tasty and strong!Everyone seemed to enjoy their food. I had steak and creamed spinach....delish! The wait staff was kind and friendly but had to be asked several times for a couple of things and didn't visit the table for long periods of time in a few instances.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: It's a really great place!! My husband and I had  a holiday dinner there. We had steaks, and they were sooo great and delicious. A nice atmosphere, great service and yammi food. We love this spot!!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Good restaurant and service. Our waiter Steven was very attentive. I ordered the crab stuffed shrimp and it was delicious! FiancÌ© got steak but it was a little too rare than what he ordered but they fixed the problem right away. Chef even came out to check if the steak was cooked right. For that reason, we will be back!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Maybe just an off night- my husband and I love to eat out all over Columbus (the US for that matter) we try to make sure we've tried every fine establishment in search of the most perfect steak. This was one restaurant we had not made it to- and the doc I work for gave it a great review along with another gal I work with- so it was time to partake. We made a reservation for 7:30 and showed up at about 7:15. My husband let me out and went to park the car.  I walked in to 3 people ahead of me and 4 hostess at a table. They cleared out the folks ahead- and when I got up to the table- not 1 of the hostess raised their head to acknowledge me. This went on for longer than I could believe- to the point my husband had made it in, still no acknowledgement... another guy walks up and one of the hostess raised her head and greeted him instantly. Finally, another lifts her head and takes our info- after about 5 minutes of standing in front of 4 people without any acknowledgement. She tells us we're early and we will be seated closer to our reservation time, which was not a surprise- however, with 4 people, and not one greeting you, well that is unacceptable- and a true pet peeve of mine. We were seated around 7:40- which was fine, the wait was ok with us, but we were seated in the bar area right on top of another couple (shared seating) no one asked if this would be OK... and better yet, we were put at the 2 person seat right next to the door on 12/22. Needless to say, I had to eat our $150 meal... with my coat on?!   It was very loud in the bar area, soooo not what we were going for when we made our reservation. Common courtesy is to ask if the seating is OK- especially when visiting a 'fine establishment'.Now down to the food- our steaks were delicious most definitely- I got the $55 holiday menu that came with the 8oz filet, and my husband got the $49 14 oz prime ribeye- both came with sides. We also got the calamari appetizer. The calamari was fine-dipping sauces were good- but I do prefer calamari to be served with fresh lemon to squeeze over top, not just a fried plate of... nothing special calamari. Our meals came out promptly which was nice- timing for the food was spot on. Our steaks were delicious, the sides, well... for 50$ plates of food- you're paying for the steak alone, we will leave it at that. So all and all, the steaks were delicious, but the atmosphere at the bar and lack of courteousness from your front house staff- is not worth the price tag. Our server however, was exceptional- I wish I could remember his name, we did tip him accordingly for the holiday season as well, but the tip was for his service... nothing more. That is most likely our first, and last visit to this restaurant- we can get delicious steaks somewhere where your price tag comes with a better dining experience.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The food is excellent but the atmosphere is a little stuffy. I would come here for a special occasion but never for a fun, casual evening or a family dinner. I've eaten in the dining room and the bar... the bar was definitely more relaxed and enjoyable.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I love this place typical Mitchels      Ok it is expensive and noisy however the staff is excellent friendly and you can tell they love working here

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We went here for Mother's Day brunch, so it was crowded but they really did a great job! Excellent food (although the ham on the Eggs Benedict was not the amazing ham from The Guild House), great service, exactly what you'd expect from a Cameron Mitchell restaurant.  Maybe because it was brunch buffet the concept didn't come across as clearly as I had hoped, but I would love to go back for dinner (or bourbon room!!!).My Bourbon Mary was A+++++

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Wooowwww. Incredible, from beginning to end. First time dining here and we will absolutely be back. Minor details puts this restaurant above the rest. From the maple syrup butter to simply boxing my left over burger and fries up separately (so the fries don't get soggy), we were so impressed. I highly recommend this place. Our server was Danny and he provided stellar service. He was genuinely warm, kind, friendly and attentive.  Never let my water glass go even half empty (a sign of a good server!) We ordered the braised short rib and burger. The ribs were melt in your mouth; you don't need a fork. The burger was excellent, and hearty - I couldn't finish it! We also tried the barrel aged manhattan flight which was fantastic. So impressed!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Me and my friend went here for the first time last night.  I was very impressed all around.  My favorite part was the excellent service.  The food was delicious.  I loved the decor and atmosphere, too. I had the ribs with steak fries and a spinach salad for an appetizer.  Loved the salad!!!!!  Loved everything really.  I also got a bottle of the Riesling.  Probably the best I've had.  It was half off wine night.  Applies to bottles only. I don't know if that's every weds or what.  I forget what our server said.  I'll def be back. Loved it!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The food, service and atmosphere are great!  I go here a few times a month.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Ok but not the best. I had Prime Rib and loaded potato. Pretty average. But the service was good. The Bourbon bar is very nice. I think you're best bet is a $16.00 burger in the bar.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We came here to celebrate my girlfriends birthday had a party of 9....first let me say the food was good but not good enough to warrant the prices they charge .compared prices to the top but quality to outback ......we were seated in the bar .it was very noisy we had a reservation I expected better seating .the service was good ..all in all not an exceptional experience ...next year we will go back to the top .......much better food for the same price ...

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: My wife and I had dinner at The Barn last night for the first time. We are not Bourbon drinkers normally but thought we would try out a drink since they specialize in them. Our server was Chelsea. She was awesome! Chelsea was very friendly and explained the various drinks with us. She offered her opinion after being asked what we should try. I went with the Barn tea and my wife had the Bourbon Hemmingway. Both were great! You could taste the Bourbon but it was not overwhelming. For dinner I had a New York strip steak and loaded baked potato. The steak was prepared to order and was excellent. My wife had a roasted chicken salad which she said was delicious. My only complaint is that it is very loud inside. That is to be expected with a large open area such as this though. Although it was our first time here, it will not be the last. I would recommend The Barn for a date night out.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I am actually very surprised at some of the low reviews for the barn. We have gone twice, and both times our experience has been five star. Our first time was with our four-year-old daughter and the server was excellent with our child. That is really hard to come by in any restaurant much less a restaurant like the barn. He brought extra treats for her, made different animals and shapes with the napkin every time she had unfolded it, and kept her entertained although he was extremely busy with other tables as well.We decided to return for our anniversary dinner and to say the service was even better is an understatement. Our bartender Paul was not only extremely knowledgeable in all of the bourbons and whiskeys and drinks that the barn had to offer, but he also made a mean old fashion an amazing Manhattan. When it was time to be seated at our table, we were a bit disappointed we had to leave Paul's company due to his great conversation skills even though the bar was busy for a Saturday night. When we were seated, our server, Austin, was attentive, nice, and also very knowledgeable in the food offerings. My husband and I both took the suggestions that he made for our entrÌ©es. They had a red snapper dish they were offering for the holidays but I was able to order it as a standalone entrÌ©e and let's just say it melted in my mouth and every bite was a great one. My husband got the ribeye at the suggestion of the server served medium, and he claims it melted in his mouth! Once again Paul helped in the choice of my wine to accompany my dinner, and he was spot on yet again. If you decide to get dessert, I highly recommend the mud pie! I think we have a new favorite restaurant. Yes, the price is a little bit high, but it is on par with most Cameron Mitchell restaurant, and you get what you pay for. Excellent service, excellent knowledge, and remarkable food! Can't wait to celebrate again for my husband's birthday!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Sounds weird but I absolutely love the spaghetti...it is enough for 5 people, but it's so good. It has bits of roost beef or something in it with a vodka sauce and it's amazing. Service is hit or miss but it's usually okay:)

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: They have a great selection of wines. The bread and butter tastes like pancakes because the butter is infused with maple syrup. It can be a bit noisy by the bar. The decor of the restaurant is very neat. I had the short ribs and I could literally pull it apart with a fork. The mashed potatoes were also very good. My husband had the BBQ ribs and they were so tender he had to eat them with a fork and a knife. The Mac & cheese is also really great. I would recommend it as a side.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: we went there last week on a Thursday nite- it was fantastic! service was great, checked on us enough but not too much.  The filet was amazing and i am a picky steak eater! My husband loved his prime rib.  We went off the beaten path for us and went with French Onion soup- oh my gosh it was to die for! We also had to have them take the bread away it was so good. Also loved the complimentary valet on a rainy evening. Cant wait to go back!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Went to the Sunday brunch buffet this morning. The pecan praline French toast was AMAZING. Truly worth the trip, but for $30 per person I expected more than 1 awesome thing to be served. Everything else was average. The dessert table looked fantastic but everything fell flat except the brownie bites. I would honestly probably return for that French toast alone if there were any guarantee that it would be there, but another review mentioned waffles that were nowhere to be found today.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Four-top dinner on a lazy Sunday night.This former Hoggy's location went through an extensive Cameron Mitchell upgrade.  The look is spectacular.  My first visit.The salad wedge is outstanding and they split per our request.  They always split without any chatter or extra cost.  The creamy blue cheese is excellent.  Nice dish.Our hamburger arrived with cheese.  It wasn't supposed to be, and was corrected immediately.  Prepared to order.  Two orders of roasted chicken were well received by the table.  Their famous fried chicken, however, was less than stellar.  It was dry, mostly batter, and the quantity had to have been a child portion.  I should have commented to the waiter, but we were late for a show.We had no liquor; the iced tea was a very tasty brew.Overall, I expected more.  Growing pains?  I know I will try again, but I'll skip the famous fried chicken. Maybe it was an end of the weekend batch?

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We went for brunch.  Overall it was good.  I was disappointed in a couple of things.  For that price I would expect the bacon to be crisp and each strip fried, instead you get good bacon mass cooked on a sheet in the oven, and they crowded it-  still sticking together when served in the chafer.  Even Frisch's prepares bacon correctly for their breakfast buffet.  The fried chicken was crispy and delicious, if you want breakfast - scrambled eggs, eggs benedict, sausage, bacon, crispy potatoes, french toast casserole and if you want lunch - the previously mentioned fried chicken, pasta primavera, glazed salmon, mac and cheese, freshly carved beef, and a selection of salads and sides.  The deserts- chocolate cake, coconut cake, brownies, key lime pie, peach cobbler, chocolate chip cookies, white chocolate macadamia nut cookies, and warm bread pudding.Expect plate clearing to be a little slow along with drink refills and clean silverware.  I think they are short staffed on the wait staff side of things.For the price - $30 a person - my expectations were set high and they were just short of meeting them.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Just happened to drive past the Barn we thought looks interesting let's try it. Read a few of the reviews before entering some were ok some must be from crabby people. This was hands down the best service we (my friend and I) have ever had. We sat at the bar (full service) Devin waited on us. He was amazing gave us great selections and steered us in the right direction. We had apps and a salad. Apps were the goat cheese ravioli (all I have to say is OH MY! Yummy) and the prime rub carpaccio also delish. Then we had the wedge salad with flat iron steak also amazing. Next time I'm in the area I will definitely stop in again. Wendy the manager was also great. Super job Wendy and Devin.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: As someone who grew up on a farm and had horses, the decor was perfect! Exactly what I wanted my house to look like as a kid. I admit it felt a bit stuffy and country club like. We came here for my birthday dinner. The cocktails were great! As both a tea and bourbon lover, the Barn Tea was a perfect choice and very well balanced. I ordered the Fried Chicken and Mac n Cheese because DUH!  It really was great. The chicken was so moist and tender, and the breading was crispy. The Mac n cheese was awesomeeeee. And I love Mac n cheese more than most things in life. It was creamy and had a great soft cheese taste-not too sharp and cheddar-y.My boyfriend got the ribs. Great St. Louis style cut and the meat slid right off the bones. They give you a super fancy silver bowl the put the bones! The sauce was a good Carolina-style. Light and vinegary. I only had a taste because he loved em so much. They were excellent. We split a Mudd Pie. It was good (how can an ice cream bombe be bad, really?) but nothing to write home about.  And it was complimentary because it was my birthday!The last note. The honey butter for the dinner rolls was an excellent touch. Overall, I left happily fat, greasy, cheesy and a little buzzed. It was a perfect bday dinner for those of us who love good old fashioned, home cooking.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Pretty good, and they fixed a problem  At the spur of the moment went to try out The Barn.  The decor is nothing like a farm barn, very classy.  Went there for Sunday brunch ($30 per person by the way) and it is buffet style with specialty drinks and omelets made to order by the kitchen.  i had an all-meat omelet and tried many things on the buffet including the salad (just fine), mac and cheese (lacked flavor), breakfast potatoes (just ok), roasted chicken (great), salmon (meh), waffles (great), and fried chicken (more on this later).  There were a bunch of desserts to choose from as well, I tried the bread pudding (pretty good), and apple cobbler (excellent).  The fried chicken I tried was not cooked through and had red inside.  I cut open 3 different pieces and they are all this way.  The staff however notified the chef and he made me 3 pieces cooked properly, great service.  I found the price to be kind of high, if it were lower maybe it would have received 4 stars.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Weird place. Prices at the level of an upscale steak house, ambiance of a Cracker Barrel. People in t shirts, kids running around and a lot of confused wait staff. Bringing me salad for desert? Oh it was for the next table. Also waited for 10 minutes for a waiter when we sat down. In all honesty the food was very good but a strange place. The were busy so maybe the figured out a niche.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Perfect meal and perfect service every time we dine there- whether it's for Christmas Eve dinner or just a simple dinner out.  My favorite local restaurant!  Try the peanut butter pie

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Upscale Rusty Bucket -- disappointing. Love Cameron Mitchell restaurants, but our experience at The Barn was sub-par. The food was very good, but our waiter ignored us for a full half hour or more. Almost finished our meal before he acknowledged our attempts to wave him down. The booth area we were in was crowded with wait staff rushing back and forth -- not relaxing. The floor was dirty with salad someone had spilled. Expensive for the experience.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We went this evening for Mothers Day and I admit, I made the reservation with trepidation based on the mixed reviews not only on here but also from friends and family. First, I will say I love the atmosphere. It fits right in with its location. While it is an actual barn, it's beautiful inside. I didn't sit outside but the patio looked very nice and comfortable. It is pretty noisy and it was hard to hear each other at the table where we were sitting. It seemed like they had more tables crowded in the section than they should. We were also right by the patio door and it was a little chilly and a lot of servers back and forth. This is the only reason I'm not giving the restaurant 5 stars. I will say, all of the staff were fast movers and clearly focused on their jobs and the customers. Our salads and soup took longer than I would have expected, but our server (Jennie who was awesome BTW) got her Manager involved before we even mentioned it and took it off our bill without our asking. It wasn't necessary but a nice touch. The French onion soup was probably the best I've ever had. Mac and cheese and corn were to die for. The steaks were all cooked perfectly and delicious. Unlike some of CM's other steak houses, all of the entrees come with a choice of vegetable or baked potato. The additional sides are all large enough for at least 3 people. Overall we loved it and will definitely be back.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I have never been to a Cameron Mitchell restaurant I wasn't impressed with and this concept is no exception. We went on a double date with some friends and had 6:30 reservations on a Saturday night. I knew it would be busy but when we got there, there wasn't one single parking spot in their huge parking lot. Fortunately they have complimentary valet!The restaurant itself is very big. There's a big front room and several others off to the side including a screened on back patio. It has a very rustic feel but I recommend wearing something nice. I wore khaki pants casual Sperry sneakers and an untucked button up shirt and I felt a little under dressed. Ok, let's first talk about the drink selection. They have maybe 20-30 different whiskeys to choose from;mostly bourbons and ryes. They have a pretty extensive wine list too. I didn't notice and substantial beer menu but with all the whiskeys to choose from I didn't mind.We all shared the shrimp scampi to start.  The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the scampi sauce was very light and flavorful.I had the twin filets topped with Brie. They know how to do steak here! The filets melted in your mouth and the Brie was slightly melted but still in tact.For dessert, my wife and I split the chocolate cake.
