column6: The Barn is a beautiful restaurant (it's seriously stunning. CMR did an amazing job on this one.  Every last detail is perfect) that offers a mouthwatering menu. Unfortunately, they just don't deliver on the food or cocktails. My husband and I tried the soul rolls and the crab cake to start.  The crab cake was very salty. It might have been accidentally finished with salt twice bc I saw a lot of it on the plate. The soul rolls could be / should be their signature app, described on the menu as rolls stuffed with brisket and greens and served with house - made bbq sauce. Because my hopes were so high these were  super disappointing.  There was barely any brisket in them, and I didnt like their bbq sauce.  With our apps we each had a cocktail.  I had the Barn Tea and he had the Hemingway.  Neither were great. We also did their Tennessee, Kentucky, and Rye flight. All were ok, none were great. For our entrees I got the kabobs and hubby got a dry agreed, bone- in steak.  My kabobs came with rice pilaf, and we ordered a loaded baked potato, greens, and succotash to share.  My kabobs were kind of lame but out of everything that we ordered they were exactly what I was expecting.  The pieces of beef were big and were cooked perfectly.  I say the dish is lame bc as a composed plate its just lacking something. I could see this one getting dropped from the menu.  It was served with that same bbq sauce, and came with rice pilaf, which was buttery and very underwhelming.  My husband has had steaks that he's enjoyed more, but thought his steak was good.  I tried a piece, but really shouldn't bother weighing in bc I'm not a huge dry aged beef fan. He commented that it was awkward eating his big steak on the small, oval plate. We agreed that the succotash and potato were good, but we were expecting more. He really liked the greens. I agree they're worth trying.  We were both able to find a wine to pair well with our food. For dessert he ordered the Woodford Reserve Double Wood bourbon, I got a Barn Lemonade, and we shared the coconut cake.  The cake was fantastic. Hubby said he'd go back just for that, and he is not a big dessert guy so that compliment is huge.  It really was the highlight. When out-of-towners come to visit I can see myself taking them to the Barn to show off how well Columbus can pull off rustic elegance.  The trip would be just for drinks though.  We'll have to dine somewhere else.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Great food. Great service. Delicious drinks.  The back patio is amazing.  It is a must try if you get the chance.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: This was my first visit to The Barn and I hope it will become a regular restaurant for us. I had the fried chicken and creamed spinach. The chicken was moist, tender and full of flavor. The breaking was crispy and had a nice flavor to the spices. The creamed spinach was excellent. I did not have cocktails but the ones at our table looked well crafted. The service was attentive but not pushy. I highly recommend this new establishment. The prices are well deserved for the quality of food I would expect from Cameron. I did notice that even the smallest cut of prime rib served at our table was enough to feed two. Very hearty portion on that dish.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Just ok. I've been here a total of 4 times now and have been underwhelmed each time. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad; but it's not great either.  Everything is way overpriced and I would rather go to other CM staples. One complaint I have is on the brunch. They NEVER keep the options stocked and it causes you to wait, make multiple trips, or get something you don't really want. My recommendation, save your time and money and go somewhere else.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: This is, sadly, the first Cameron Mitchell restaurant where I've had a mediocre meal. Went for a night out with my daughter and will give high praise for the service and the Bourbon drinks. The food, however, was overpriced and lacking flavor.The Soul rolls were highly recommended. The problem was the barbecue sauce.It had a strong tomato, almost ketchup-like flavor, and not much seasoning. We mentioned it to our server who remarked it was the house sauce but offered us a pork reduction that was much better.Without thinking, we ordered ribs and brisket. The ribs were tender but covered in the sauce we didn't like. The brisket was overcooked and dry. The macaroni and cheese was tasty, but even as a share, very pricey. I will pay for a good meal, but this was a bit much.The ambiance is pleasant, the staff top notch. Just couldn't get beyond the price and limited quality. Again, a big surprise for me as I'm a big Mitchell's fan.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: My husband, son, and I ate here opening week, you would not have known it. Flawless service, a little long but very few kinks. Pros:-Atmosphere: super warm, outside awesome- Staff: Amazing!! Super Professional- Drinks!Con:-Food: Lacked the wow factor! Steak was cooked perfect, but sides were boring, salads boring.  I left feeling underwhelmed-Desserts: Again Boring! Pecan Pie lacked flavor. All in All the restaurant has all the things Mitchell's is known for but for the price we were pretty bored with the food.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: This place is awesome a little pricey but great food my wife and I stopped in for the brunch buffet (every sunday 10-2:30 pm the buffet is stocked with great belgum waffles and scrambled eggs and eggs benedict not to mention all the bacon and sausage you can scarf down, this place will leave your wallet lighter but not your stomach we will be back oh and the staff was very couteous aswell

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Loved this place! My family went here for my sister's birthday, and it was a great experience. The atmosphere is amazing - very rustic, barn feeling (I see what they did there) but still upscale and classy. The service was perfect - I'm not sure where Cameron Mitchell sends their staff, but the training must be impeccable. Food was delicious, we all ordered different items, and all loved everything! The Trout was wonderful, perfectly cooked, and the pecan crust provided a nice contrast to the fish.  Get some of the rolls to take home!!Absolutely would come here anytime, and everyone else in my family agreed as well!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We went for dinner on Saturday night.  We recognized that this restaurant was trying to be a cheaper version of the Ocean Club.  They're definitely a little cheaper but the quality wasn't even close.The highlight of the meal was the onion rings.  They were freshly made and cooked perfectly.  The calamari appetizer tasted more like the batter instead of the fish.Dinner was a big disappointment. The ribs were inedible - overcooked with bones literally breaking apart.  The menu said that the ribs were cooked in their smokehouse.  The only smoke these ribs saw was the steam from the pot of boiling water in which they were cooked.  The prime rib was dry and flavorless, like it had been sitting under a warmer for too long.  The pecan crusted trout was long on pecans and the sauce was indistinct and added nothing but moisture to the dish.The service was very slow with little communication from our server most of the time.  I would recommend either spending the $ to go to Smith & Wollensky, Eddie Merlot's, or Ocean Club or going to a more casual dining spot.  We won't be coming back.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Came here with a group of girls for my birthday brunch and had an amazing time. The service was impeccable, the food was delectable, and the gigantic mimosas were heavenly.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Amazing meal again! Brunch and dinner here have both been fabulous! The service is great. The brunch has so many choices and the dessert and drink menus are fabulous.  Will definitely be back again!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Had an fantastic night out with my husband at The Barn recently. The decor is fantastic and the service was spot on. Even chatted with the GM, who was friendly and appreciative. We started with cocktails, which were great. The baked oyster appetizer was awesome, we both agreed we could have ordered a second plate. Husband had the pork chop, I tasted it and it was awesome. I had the prime rib and would rank it in the top 3 prime rib dinners I've ever had. The baked onion was unique and delicious. Desserts were great, too, cheesecake and pecan pie were a great end to the meal. This will be a date night staple for sure.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I went for the Bourbon Bar and appetizers' with clients.  The flight of Bourbon is a solid choice.  Ordered the Soul Roll and was underwhelmed.  Definitely needs more brisket as you could not even really get much, if any, flavor.  Sauce is blah.  Needs work.  Great atmosphere in the lounge area and service was adequate.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Drinks, oh my the whiskey bourbon selection. Nice move CMR. Great concept for a restaurant. Did I mention the atmosphere?! This is one of the best designed restaurant's ever in my opinion. Upscale dining feel inside, with separated areas. The outside has the best in class choices in the city for "by a fire, OR cigars n scotch area, OR dining with friends outside, OR dining with a party of 20+ outside, OR outside bar people watching area."... and the best part about this overall design (whomever designed this layout knocked it out of the park) in any one of the area, you somehow feel like you're with just your group of people. You don't have foot traffic past you, if you're at the bar side fore pit. You feel completely separated from the sit down dining experience if you're in the cigar area, and did I mention the corn hole boards by the cigar pit, under shade trees?! C'mon, this is like a dream. The inside bar is cozy, and has a very good feel for drinking Old Fashined's till the night wastes away. The only, only draw back I'd even bring up is that they don't open till 4p. If the could open the indoor bar at 2:30 for an "end of business day drink/late lunch meeting" that would be ideal. Well, we aren't done yet - since this is Yelp, and I haven't talked about the food or drinks yet. Wow. This is the best CMR concept I've ever been to. So the drink list is just perfect for whiskey mixing and taste testing. The Old Fashioned was very good (offer a choice of bitters maybe?), and the Hemingway was spot on, as was the Tea with mint sprig which nailed the outdoor dining experience to a "t". Ouch, bad humor. LOL. The citrus was my least favorite, but not bad, just a different option amongst the other drinks. Then we finally get to some food. Oyster's on the half were well priced and delicious. They went perfectly with drinks and conversation by the fire pit (FYI - WiFi was weak outside). The onion rings were spot with seasoning, batter application and doneness. Next trip back, I'll actually try a sit down dinner, since this time turned into drinks n apps by the fire pit and wasted the night away :)Bottom line - go any time (after 4p), with anyone, for any reason. This place truly has something for everyone.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Everthing was great untill the waiter asked me ID for paying the check.I guess he assumed that we were not fitting in his restaurant ,it is the first time in whole my life I have been asked at the fine dine restaurant,If they ask ID for everyone then I will be fine with it and I swallow it .It really made me feel upset since last Sunday

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I'm giving this a 3 out of 5 for one reason.  The way they run their reservations. I don't like games they play and based on my one experience, they play reservation games.  I could not have my preferred time due to "over booking". However there were plenty of open tables from the time I arrived and finished dining.  I suggest you go to a manager and insist on a time.  I should have.  They really do have adequate seating. I give their food and service a 4 star.  The baked onion was fabulous and so was the prime rib and wine. A bit loud but the food quality and service made up for it. I just don't like the reservation game they play.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: This was our second visit, our first did not go well. I would have to say that was the biggest comeback experience I've ever had. We  were greeted promptly with friendly warm and inviting staff. Our waitress was a very sweet and attractive appropriate with the and timing of serving our food. Our food was filet mignon and prime rib excellent food temperature was perfect. We had a great experience! Highly recommend this organization. I think that they've overcome their identity and have taken their service to level it needs to be.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I absolutely loved this place! I picked out this place to go on a date for my birthday because I have always had a great experience at Cameron Mitchell Restaurants. They have the best gluten free menu choices I've ever seen!! I highly recommend that you get the steak. I got the filet minion and my boyfriend got the t-bone and we were both so satisfied. The atmosphere and service were spectacular and we left so happy. They have an incredible selection of bourbons, so if that's your thing you have to get some. I am not a bourbon drinker, but I order a delicious gin drink from their menu. I will definitely be going back there. It has a very sophisticated, rustic feel. I have nothing but great things to say!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I have been back to the Barn several times since my last review.  Excellent bartenders.  French Onion soup is delicious.  Filet was cooked perfect.   Seriously the bartenders are hands down the best servers around.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The decor of this place is top notch! I love the rustic, yet upscale feel. You can't beat the atmosphere and they definitely paid attention to every little detail in the design. A+!The food was ok. Definitely good but, certainly did not blow my mind. I found the food to be really salty for my taste. Portions were enormous - no room to try desert. The bf loved the bourbon lounge. Waitstaff was on point - attentive without being creepy and overbearing A+ to them!The decor is memorable but, the food not-so-much. It's good but, I have had much better for this price range. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt though, we did unknowingly go on their 2nd night of being open. I'd be willing to go again just for the atmosphere but, it's not top on my list of favorites.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Best prime rib I have ever had... and the staff was wonderful. Had a great family meal for my son's going away party. Great place.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I have been to the Barn 3 times now.  Twice for appetizers and drinks and once for dinner last Saturday Feb 27th.   The drinks are expensive, but well worth it.  Appetizers are a good value on happy hour.  Entrees on the other hand are overpriced for what you get.  I paid $45 for a 14oz bone in NY strip and baked potato.  The steak was average at best.  The first half of the steak was chewy.  The second half was more tender, but the steak lacked flavor overall.  My wife got the pot roast which was $32.  The portion was small, the vegetables overcooked and over salted.    Do not go to this Cameron Mitchell location for dinner.  There are several Cameron Mitchell restaurants that we like including Ocean Club, Cap City and Marcella's.  If you want a good steak for a good price go to Longhorn and order the Porterhouse for 2 for $44.  You get a 30oz steak that is delicious, and 2 sides per person.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The service was impeccable...The decor is fabulous...The noise level is that equal to a noisy barn.....but the FRIED CHICKEN and BAKED MAC & CHEESE is to die for. I got sick @ the restaurant but while I was there things were just amazing!!!!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: So, I didn't write about my experience at The Barn yet?  How can this be??  Fortunately, I remember what I ordered and how I felt about it all. I harassed by husband about going here since it opened, and he finally decided to take me--during Lent.  This is a problem, b/c I gave up alcohol for Lent, so was unable to try a cocktail.  My husband ordered one and thought it was great.  As you may have heard/seen, they're big on the bourbon at The Barn.  In short, Food:  delicious.  Service: not up to par w/Cameron Mitchell standards.  Atmosphere: hit or miss.  Hit because it looks cool in there, but miss because the tables are too close.  Impossible to have a private conversation.  So, now for details:  I ordered Barbecue Chicken: chicken pieces drenched with delicious barbecue sauce (which I no longer see on the menu for some reason--upsetting!).  Loved it.  The sauce was almost pink--sounds weird, but tasted wonderful.  It was sweet, tangy, and just right.  It came with a side of greens, which were just awful.  I was very surprised at how bad they were--incredibly bitter & yucky. Not salt nor butter could save them.  I want to say that the other side was mashed potatoes--if I'm correct, they were very good.  Since I was saving money by not ordering a cocktail, I got a wedge salad.  Huge. Creamy.  Delightful.  Fattening.  Needless to say, some of my favorite things.  My husband wanted the Oysters Bingo appetizer, and I allowed it, only because they were covered in cream and cheese.  (I'm not a huge seafood fan).  I couldn't tell that they were oysters because they were drowning in aioli, but that was fine by me--each oyster was like a mini, creamy casserole.  Since I had an appetizer, [fattening] salad, and a good-sized entree, I had plenty of my entree left over to take home.  The server did box up the greens for me, and I proceeded to throw them in the trash when I got home (where somehow, they stunk up the whole house immediately, though they were in a box which was wrapped and buried in the trash!).  Ah, the server.  He was odd.  I'm not sure if one of his beloved pets passed away (not making fun--I know how difficult it is) or he just has a boring personality, but he was incredibly stiff.  He wasn't bad, but he wasn't good.  I would go back here for the food (no greens, though, please) and to try a cocktail.  However, it's pretty far away from us, and I think my husband is only too happy--he doesn't like to drop tons of money on food, anyway.  (He's more of a Skyline kind of guy--another thing he enjoys that I hate--again, opposites attract).  I only wore him down because we received a $100 gift card from his parents for Christmas for any Cameron Mitchell restaurant.  And get this--our bill was $100.25 (before tip).  With all of the food we got? (husband also got French Onion soup, which he loved)--not bad at all.  Service needs to be better.  Bring back the barbecue chicken.  And for goodness' sake, get rid of the greens for good!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Please understand, I am a HUGE Cameron Mitchell fan. I was so let down with the barn. There were some good things and I will close the review with those but for the disappointments:1.) I went on a Tuesday evening around 6:00. Was not busy. I walked in, stood at the hostess stand for 2 minutes before being greeted. This would be totally acceptable if the hostess/hostesses were busy with other guest. Not the case. They both were talking to each other with their backs turned to the door. I finally excused myself and asked if this was the correct please to be to be seated. They apologized and walked me to a table. 2.) I was greeted with by a loud, borderline arrogant/obnoxious server. Went on and on about the bourbons and wine selection. So I decided to try a blend that was specially aged for The Barn. Was told they didn't have that in stock and went on a ramble about why, none of which I care. The point is it was advertised top left corner of the menu, first place you look and the server touted it. But, we are out? What? Out? You just recommended it?3.) food was the quality of fast food. 4.) server was loud and obnoxious. Will never spend another dollar here

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: This was my second trip to The Barn and so far it has not lived up to Cameron Mitchell's standards.  On both visits the "loaded" baked potato came out less than piping hot with the "loaded" ingredients congealed on top - so the tater WAS hot once, just not at the time it was served.  This is an easy fix, so it's unusual to have happened twice.  Also, on both visits either a guest or I had the prime rib and ordered real horseradish instead of the sauce, and both times the entree was delivered without it.  There was also an awful smelling fish/seafood dish served while we were in the bar.  Several patrons commented on it but the guy who ordered it devoured it!The prime rib and steaks were cooked to perfection and served at the proper temperature.  The selection of bourbons was phenomenal and the wine list superb. As a bourbon specialty joint I couldn't believe they didn't have a bourbon-barrel ale or stout.  Seemed a natural offering for this place.  Our service when we dined at the bar was much better than when we had a table.  I believe a waiter was being trained, so no biggie there.I would give The Barn 2.5 stars if it were an option, but they are closer to 3 stars at this time than 2.  Given their relatively new status, I fully anticipate the service and any food issues to be resolved quite shortly and up to the Cameron Mitchell level we all expect from him.  I will give it a few more months and try again before I decide if this is going to be a "regular" stop or not.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Went back again, ordered the brisket.  It was on the rare side and fatty.  I'm used to brisket being cooked all the way through from the smoking/cooking process.  Generally I like it when the fat is cooked off.   This didn't hit the spot for me.  This place is my go to for a drink, but I continue to be disappointed in the restaurant side.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: For all the hype about this place it was a true disappointment. After being seatedit was way over an hour before we saw our food. The filet was cut at the table and shared. The knife they tried it cut it would probably would not have cut butter. I was scared it was headed for the floor. The entire meal was so salty that it was incredible. Yes there is something odd about the butter but could not figure out what it was. The place was extremely noisy and I felt as if we were screaming just to have a conversation at our table. For the experience I felt it was way over priced. Would haverather spent my money some place else.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Perfectly cooked beef stew!  Great bread! Good service and perfect ambiance as always for a Cameron Mitchell group of restaurants.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Disappointing for a Cameron Mitchell owned venue. Nothing memorable about the ambience, menu or quality of food. Preparation not customized... I like well done beef and my steak was bright red. The server didn't ask about the prep as I would expect for such a request. Would NOT recommend to friends. Many better steak house options in Columbus.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The red fish was on point. The gluten free cheesecake is probably the best dessert I've tried in a long time; light, lemony and fresh. The bourbon drinks were delicious and wait staff superb. Can't wait to go back!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Had a great meal. Loved the oysters and the 8oz filet. The steak was good perfectly. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We were a party of 9.  The service was friendly and professional.  The food, on the other hand, was very mediocre.  The Waldorf Salad was probably the worst I have ever tasted.  The apples were fresh, but that;s where it ended.  It was bland and tasteless.  The ribs felt as if they had come out of the microwave.  A few of us had ordered the ribs and the person next to me had a much larger slab with char on it and the one in front of me (although we both ordered the same) was a smaller version and looked smothered in BBQ sauce with not a touch of char on it.  At least serve consistent food, even if its only mediocre. The apple pie dessert was good.  Final verdict: not one bit worth the price you pay.  Go to Cap City instead!!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Service was top notch, atmosphere was great! We sat on the patio and enjoyed watching the ched cool in the oven outside. On cooler nights i cant wait to hang out at the firepit.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Very good. The look of the interior is rustic and comfortable. I am a vegetarian and there is not anything on the menu that is meat free. I asked if they could come up with something in the kitchen, they happily agreed. The sous chef was kind enough to create something unique for me. He brought it out and explained what he came up with. It was very good. The service was excellent. We will surely go back again.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We love Cameron Restaurants.  Let's start at the beginning:  We arrived for a 6:30 reservation at 6:10.  Were told they would text my number when table was ready.  6:45 a waitress come over and asked if we needed a drink.  I politely said yes and you can bring us a free one every 10 minutes until our table reserved for 6:30 is ready.  She came back and said your table has been ready for quite some time.  Well thank you for that one!  strike one.We were jammed into a table in the middle of the restaurant where you had to squeeze by the tables around you.  Very close quarters and very loud.  Strike two.Drink service OK.  For four people they brought two rolls.  Placed an order for an appetizer.  Waitress came back to take our order,  appetizer not here yet, we ordered.  I ordered Salmon.  Wanted to order a baked potato but our waitress said there were potatoes on the side.  My wife ordered Strip steak  and our friends ordered Salmon and Brisket..One of our parties salad arrived before the appetizer.  Appetizer arrived tough bbq shrimp.  Did have good flavor.  Ball one.Water glasses empty.  Our food arrives.  My friend gets a nice looking cut of Salmon.  I love and eat Salmon very frequently, and they bring me the tail.  Barely 1/3 inch thick.  As for potatoes there were 3 small roasted wedges mixed with veggies.  My friend got two roasted potatoes.  My wife ordered her steak medium rare.  It came medium, and was under seasoned and tough.  Our other friend ordered brisket.  Extremely salty and dry.  Strike 3.  At this point I just wanted to get up and leave.  We had way too much invested.  It took long enough to get our food so why ask for replacement.  Half way through the meal still no water or waitress.  Hey we need some water over here.  The floor manager came by and I politely reviewed our experience.  He took 13 dollars off my bill and none off our friends.  It was my birthday so they did give us a mud pie that was outstanding.  This restaurant is OUT. of our plans for anytime in the future unless they get rid of their kitchen and floor managers.  123. dollars later we left feeling like we had been robbed.  One STAR for the dessert.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We ate there for the first time in the service was wonderful they got us I n right away even though it was busy they have a wonderful patio with a cover food was very very good I had the trout that was fabulous and fried chicken which was very good desserts or something you need to try

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: The place looks lively and classic. Lighting a bit too dark for my taste however. And we arrived early to sit on the patio, on a lovely evening and it was closed!? Anyway, we were a party of 6 and were seated in a party type room. Kind of disappointing as we couldn't experience the ambience of the restaurant, nor could we scope out other diners food, sometimes that helps with my own order decision. The menu is large and varied, you can get out of there with a more reasonable tab if you order appetizers or one of the sandwiches. Still, everything is just a few bucks more than most places. The entrees only came with one side, even the 45$ steak. They want you to choke up another 6 or 7 $ for additional sides. The  crab cake appetizer was pricey, but it came with two crab cakes, which the menu only said "cake", so my Dad and I totally over ordered. However, my main complaint is the style of service. Long winded explainations with every question, and long menu descriptions before even taking a drink order. I don't think it is slow getting food or drink from the bar or kitchen, I think staff are instructed to treat the place like a high end seakhouse experience, where people want to spend 2 or three hours at dinner, and have long frilly descriptions of everything. We just stopped asking and ordered. We had a 530 reservation and left at 830. My poor old Dad just got up and left. I don't know if I would go back. Maybe to sit at the bar and have an appetizer. There are just too many more places in columbus where the food and the prices are great.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: There is a lot to love here from the location, to the service, to the food, but stay away from the poor attempt at BBQ. I should probably have been warned off after the server told us that brisket was removed from the menu for quality issues, but I went with the ribs anyway. The portion was plentiful and prepared competently, but the recipe just doesn't work. It is typical of everything that is wrong with restaurant BBQ. Tender meat, but no smoky flavor, and covered in a sweet, character-less sauce. We got fried chicken for our toddler on recommendation from other reviewers and that is the way to go. I am generally skeptical of high-praise heaped on fried chicken, but in this case the kudos are well-deserved. The chicken was moist, very flavorful and not oily at all. My wife also raved about her salmon dish. You probably can't go wrong as long as you stay away from the BBQ. We did desert and thought that the house-comped mud pie (celebrating an event for my wife) was huge and had some high-points (crunchy crust, pops of fresh peanut butter throughout), but is not something we would order again.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I took my grandma for dinner last night. She might be the one person more critical of places than me. I had been to this location many many times when it was Hoggy's, so I had a comparison. The place struck me as New Albany in every way. The dÌ©cor is very confusing but nice. Deep massive chairs with wheels are great for a living room, but not for a nice dinner. Everything is very upscale designed, despite being inside a barn (very New Albany). I can tell how hard they are going for the refined yet rustic look (very New Albany). Food and drink prices are just crazy high for a place playing country music. Servers wear jeans and plaid shirts, yet a steak is $50. I would say it's half way between Hyde Park and a Big Boy type of feel, but that sounds really bad. We were seated in the bar area without asking for it, but that was fine. I had a Caesar side salad and the salmon entrÌ©e. I could tell that there was nothing remotely healthy about this place, so I asked for the butter on the side. I did receive the butter on the side, but the veggies and salmon were literally drenched to the point of being soggy with oil/butter. Salad was also soggy with dressing. Upscale healthy is something deeply missing from this city. That being said, it was good food independent of the price. I'll always pay more to get quality food. They aren't even pretending to offer organic or grass-fed anything though...The service was crazy slow, and it was only 5:45pm. I could tell they were trying, and it was probably the kitchen that was behind. I would give it 4 stars potentially in the future. In summary, after growing up in Gahanna, this place just is overly trying to capture the rural farm/million-dollar estate weird combo feel that is New Albany, catering to very wealthy people who want to pretend they live on a rural farm while paying someone to cut their grass. Cameron Mitchell restaurants in general have slipped pretty far in my opinion from the smaller heyday. I feel like all the places of his that I've visited in the past couple years are just a step above average enough to remain popular. And by the way, the address is Gahanna, not New Albany. Stop trying so hard, please.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: If I could do no stars I would - All I can say this can not be a Cameron Mitchell's  restaurant !!! I'm a regular at ocean club - I went there 3 different times to give it a fair shot!! Consistently bad service, bad food and the manager does not know how to handle when a customer complains. He is like he was a manager before at Macdonalds or something not a pricey medium to high price restaurant. When you have bartenders measuring every pour it looks very amateur. It's obvious they made a Hugh mistake - by not hiring a very experience staff from cooks, waiters, bar tenders and especially management horrible. The last time I was there I waited 1 hour and 15 mins for my dinner and in that time we asked 3 times the bartender where is our meals she keep saying the manager us looking into. Final 1 hour and 15 mins later the macdonalds manager came over and said I do not know when your meals coming we asked is it 10 mins, 20 or 5 mins and he couldn't give us an answer while he was talking with us he had to leave us and hug and shake one if his buddies hand good bye!! not apologising or anything just that they were busy!! Lol macdonald's manager didn't even say I'll pay your bill or a gift card for another visit!! Terrible would be an understatement of our 3 experiences there!!!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Have always been a huge fan of Cameron Mitchell Restaurants as they typically excel in all areas.  The barn is a very nice venue with good service and good food.  My issue is that they are really stretching their pricing at the same time I felt I was only getting very good food when I am used to getting great food at their places.  Ribs were just ok but would never order them again.  You can get better ribs at several other area restaurants for much less.  The filet was prepared correctly but for $48 without any sides I didn't feel like I can't wait to go back.  The dining room wasn't for me.  A loud, open room with tables crammed.  The bar had a much better feel for me as did the patio.  I will go back for the atmosphere and location but was disappointed to see good food being served at phenomenal pricing.  I don't mind paying a premium as it is usually worth the expense but not here.  I felt like I was being asked to pay for all of their current and recent expansion.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: My fiancÌ© and I went to the barn for his birthday.  This place was amazing!  He is a food snob and usually has something to say, but he loved everything.  It is expensive, but you get what you pay for.  Their drinks were amazing too.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who enjoys great food.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Our server, Megan, was awesome! Very friendly and knowledgable! The food was delicious! We had a crab cake to start, crab stuffed shrimp and a filet for our meals. You have to get the crabcake for an app...it was amazing! The filet was cooked to perfection and the side dishes were yummy (Mac and cheese, mashed potatoes and mushrooms). We will definitely go back the next time we are in the area!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I frequent Cameron Mitchell restaurants and for the most part enjoy my experience. I was looking forward to "The Barn" since it is not far from where I live and I like BBQ. Even though it's Cameron Mitchell and the bugs should be worked out in advance, it is newly opened. So, I can excuse sitting in the small waiting area for 15 minutes past my reservation while people seemed to be walking in the door and getting seated immediately. I can excuse them forgetting to bring our salads (we got a free dessert for this slight). I can excuse the high prices. What I can't excuse is the food. I ordered the Rib combo, half rack of ribs + 6oz. beef brisket $32!!! It came with cole slaw. The ribs were tough and neither of the meats had any smoky flavor. The BBQ sauce tasted like doctored catsup. I was so disappointed. I thought if Cameron Mitchell was going to do BBQ it would be great. It was bad. He should go to Texas or one of the Carolinas to find out how it is done. My daughter had an 8oz filet $39!!! It was tasty and cooked properly. The venue is beautiful and large with a big bar area and a nice outdoor area. I hope he can find out how to do BBQ as it seems to be the theme.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: "This long awaited opening proved to be full of disappointments. Went for dinner and we were braced for the prices and fully expected to have excellent dining experience. Decor was nice, staff friendly, food--not so good. Ordered full rack of ribs--homage to Hoggys-- these were probably the toughest ribs I've ever had to cut through. Manager came over and asked how they were and I had to come clean and tell him about my disappointment in them..  He made good on them and replaced them with very good brisket.   Salmon salad was also ordered--salmon was perfect -greens were lack-luster.  This place has potential to be an excellent restaurant but for these prices we expected more than mediocrity.  Will try to give the another chance but in the future will probably just dine in the bar and order the Oysters Bingo (which were awesome) and the Onion Rings (also awesome).

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: I had high expectations for a Cameron Mitchell restaurant as we are new to Columbus and have heard his venues are top notch. While the atmosphere was very nice it is extremely noisy but a great place to people watch. I really liked the diversity of offerings from high end steaks to home style recipes.  I had the roast chicken with stuffing and vegetables- very flavorful and the portion was plentiful. The service was very friendly but a bit on the slow side; not a problem if you want to relax and pace yourself. You have to try the chocolate cake- it was incredible! This is a pricey restaurant especially if you order some dinners where the side dishes are at an extra cost. All in all it is a good restaurant but in my opinion not phenomenal.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: Great new restaurant. It is everything you would expect a new cameron Mitchell restaurant to be. The service was great and the food was phenomenal. I went here with a colleague after after last week. I started with the oysters and she had the shrimp cocktail. Both were delicious. I then had the ribeye. My steak was cooked to perfection and it came with their steak sauce which puts it over the top. I also had their mushrooms and onions, they were caramelized just right and melted in my mouth. My friend had the fried chicken was she loved it came with Mac and cheese which is casserole style and was great. We both had plenty of leftovers for homer I then had the pecan pie which was delicious and she had the coconut cake which I am defiantly getting next time. Overall everything was fantastic. Defiantly try this new place!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: We are a fan of all CMR's, the service and food has always been top notch, especially Ocean Club. They're hands-down the best in food quality, service and atmosphere. Sadly "The Barn" is the polar opposite. First we got seated in their semi-outdoor area and the heaters above was very uncomfortable and it was an odd and terrible environment. When we got moved inside it took 15 minutes before we got water with no server to be found, we got another server to fill our glasses and what an attitude she had too and very aggressive with the water pitcher. When the server did show up, not even an introduction or an apology as I had to ask where our server was at. Then drinks took another 30 minutes to arrive. So overall it was almost an hour before we got drinks. Then we proceeded to the dinner order, she didn't bother to come around to my side to take my order, I had to shout across the table and guest to give my order. When we got our food the steaks were overdone as it was requested med-rare, my Prime Rib was med to med-well as I requested it to be med-rare originally. It was a very frustrating night as our expectation was high. More than likely we will not return and quite disappointed how bad the service and training is...total time was a mind numbing 3 hours long!!!

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: My wife and I go to many Cameron Mitchell restaurants locally and nationally when we are at home in columbus and when we travel. We usually have great meals except for our recent trip to the Barn. We sat at the bar and ordered off the menu. My wife and I split their steak sandwich with a side of veggies, and an order of onion rings which the bartenders spoke highly of.  Maybe it was an off night, but, the steak sandwich was probably the worst Cameron Mitchell served meal we experienced.  Even the bartender shared with us that the other Cameron restaurants had better sandwiches. The steak was dried out, and not appetizing at all. We were completely shocked that they served it. Especially with no au jus. The onion rings had a unique batter as described by the bartender and I think they were sitting around the kitchen a little longer than it should have. I think they could have done a better job with the presentation.  They seemed to be thrown on a plate quickly, sat for a while in the kitchen and served when someone had time.  Plus, the meal and drinks were expensive too.

column1: The Barn at Rocky Fork Creek
column6: My first impression:  amazing building and space and smells nice and woody.  Decorations are welcoming and warm. However, once you get over the glamour and glitz of the new building, reality sets in.  For instance, once we were seated we waited 20 minutes without being approached by a server.  We finally flagged down a manager who took our drink order and apologized.  Comped our drinks which was nice.  Prices for food are high for what you get.  Smallest wedge salad I had ever seen for 6 bucks and I could only eat half as it was drowning in way too much dressing.  As someone else mentioned before, these are Ocean Club prices without Ocean Club presentation or food type/quality.  Closer to Cap City than Ocean Club as far as food goes. For example, French fries are, I'm pretty certain, Ore-Ida steak fries. They need to be sassed up a little bit.  Wine list by the bottle is stupid expensive.  I mean STUPID expensive. So expensive, I would never contemplate ordering a bottle.  I desperately want this restaurant to succeed here but I think once the newness wears off, people aren't going to want to pay those high prices on a random Tuesday.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I took a group to dinner at Cap City, and we really enjoyed it.I had the balsamic chicken but substitued the sides for the ones that come with the rib-eye.  It was a terrific meal.  Very tasty.Service was really good.  Drinks were plentiful.  The complimentary bread was great.  The decor was nice.You have to get dessert when you go!  The chocolate cake is enough for three+ people.  I loved the 24karat cake.All-in-all what I expect for 5-stars.  Great job.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: When you want to go somewhere and know you have solid delicious food this is the place to go..While the ambiance of the place has seen better days their is no doubt you will enjoy your meal to the fullest.We stopped in around 2:30 PM and just caught the tail end of their brunch.My son ordered the torta and it was huge. A nice layer of ham, cheese and egg sandwiched between a large sandwich roll which he enjoyed very much.My husbands eggs Benedict did not diss appoint as he ate every bite.I ordered the soup and salad lunch and added chicken. Wow was I surprised to see 2 large chicken cutlets appear on the side of my plate but they were absolutely delicious and I would do so again. The sweet  Italian dressing is unique and delicious.The white cheddar broccoli soup was The soup of the day and I very much enjoyed this unique peppery version.We also enjoyed a basket of sweet cinnamon rolls a bonus if arriving during the brunch hour.The iced tea cane served fresh brewed in a large carafe for self refills also a nice touch. We will be back!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've been to Cap City twice now, once for dinner and once for brunch. To me, both experiences were good, but I definitely preferred dinner to brunch.For dinner, I had the fried chicken. The chicken was cooked well, but could have used more seasoning. The mashed potatoes were great, but I didn't like the flavor of the green beans at all. For brunch, I had the cheeseburger and fries. Simple enough (and I guess not particularly brunchy haha), but well-prepared and flavorful. Plus, we had a great server for brunch.I think this will probably be a place that I get back around to, but I'll likely stick with brunch.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Another fine meal at this diner! We shared the $6 burger  for the burger and beer week. The burger was huge and the hamburger was done perfectly! Very juicy and delicious! Ice tea was served with a craft on the side so there was plenty of tea! Our server was prompt and delightful! We didn't have a wait because we used OpenTable to make a reservation!Went back the other day for lunch. I ordered the lox and bagel plate today. It was huge! The bagel was toasted and very filling. Half was plentiful topped with lox and cream cheese. I took the other half of bagel and lox/ cream cheese Home for breakfast the next day!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've been here a few times for various occasions and I always enjoy myself. First of all, I have yet to meet a Cameron Mitchell Restaurant I didn't like. This one has a unique feel. Obviously with "diner" in the title, it kind of takes you back to the 1950s era. They have a great menu filled with items that make you feel like you're right back at home in ma's kitchen! I have gotten the burger here before but I would not recommend it. Burger alone would get this place a solid three. It was just very dry, not much flavor, too big of a patty. But luckily I learned from that and progressed on to other dishes. I will say the balsamic chicken is excellent! Probably the best menu item there. It comes with delicious mashed potatoes. Made me feel like I was eating a home cooked meal. Another guest I was with also got the chicken pot pie once and said it was excellent...looked very hearty and delicious! After your meal you have to save room for the chocolate peanut butter pie! I've gotten it every time I've went and it never disappoints. The only issue I have with it is that I'm typically stuck sharing it with someone else :P All in all, I do recommend and think it's a great place to take families and out of town guests.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: As a lifelong University of Michigan fan, it physically pains me to say anything complimentary about the city of Columbus. Good food has a tendency to bridge any rivalry or discord though, and Cap City unequivocally delivers in that respect.This place was bustling on a Wednesday night. I had a nice exchange with the greeters, where they strongly recommended the blue cheese chips for a shared appetizer, and the pecan crusted pork-chops as a dinner entree. Sold.The blue cheese is mixed with an alfredo-like sauce and scallions and then drizzled over freshly cut potato chips. Super rich and not for the cholesterol-conscious, but damn, they were good.As delish as the chips were, the pork chops stole the show. With your order comes two hunks of grilled chops, crusted with chopped pecans that offer a balance of both sweet and crunchy texture with the savoriness of the meat. The mashed potato and spinach sides were solid, but in this case, you won't need to pay much attention to the supporting cast.My boss and I split the banana pudding was which also decisively good. And when the bill came, our server very generously took off the aforementioned dessert (we had mentioned early on this was our first trip to Cap City). From beginning to end, I had nothing short of a great experience, even if I was in the heart of Buckeye country (sighhhh).

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I had not been to Cap City since homeschool..visited the one off olentangy river road. This is a Cameron Mitchell restaurant.  Love him because he is a graduate from my highschool and still proud resident (Upper Arlington).Excellent lunch spot..we arrived around 11:30, the crowd started rolling in around 11:45.We ordered the reuben sandwich which was cooked just right. Fries were good as well. Sweet tea was good as well..i appreciate that they serve in a large jar as well as a large cup of ice.Looking forward to a return trip back and try out more of their menu!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went here for my birthday - food was delicious as always, however, I went to the bar to order my drink because it was happy and because I wanted it made correctly.   I was told that I couldn't order a drink at the bar and I had to order from my table...needless to say the drink was incorrect and I couldn't have happy hour prices.   Really?   A restaurant so cheap that you can't let someone buy a happy hour drink on their birthday as well as ensure it is made as ordered?!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: A colleague and I recently had the pleasure of dining at Cap City during a business trip to the area.  This was my 4th time in the Columbus area in the last 2 years, and each trip lasts about 3 nights.  So, I have tried numerous area establishments during my visits, and have always had Cap City on the radar but never acted on it until last night.  And now, Cap City is on my list of places I have to have every time I'm in town.We were fortunate enough to make it before the rain, before happy hour ended, and before it got slammed.  We sat at the outside bar area and had Michael as our server/bartender, and he was fantastic!  Attentive but not overbearing, made great recommendations, and was always there when we needed refills.We started with a pepperoni flatbread ($5 during HH), a smoked salmon dip ($7) and shared a pretzel w/ beer cheese ($6).  Everything was tasty, and the smoked salmon dip so much so that I ordered a second helping!  With no room for a full meal, we felt more than satisfied with the portion sizes, the taste quality, and the bang for our bucks.  At the end, my colleague had a little room left for their deep dish apple pie, which just as everything else, came out in a HUGE portion with vanilla bean ice cream.  I didn't partake, but my colleague said it was heavenly.Michael filled us in on the history of Cap City and the various other restaurants in the Columbus area that are owned by the same family.  Cap City, keep it up...amazing is the only way I can describe our experience!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The food at Cap City Fine Diner looks better than it actually tastes. However, I have to give them credit for their service. All of our food was cold when served. I am not that type of person who usually complains but since the server asked...I told him about it. It happened when we already finished the food. I am not sure who that is someone looks to be the restaurant manager came and addressed the issue. Quite appreciated at heart that they take customer's word seriously as this is what it really should be.The restaurant gets packed so easily and the parking space could be limited. Thankfully we had an early dinner that day so wasn't quite impacted. I am not sure if they take reservation but I do recommend that if they do because lots of people were waiting outside when we finished.For appetizer, we ordered the Blue Cheese Potato Chips (4/5). It came with scallion and alfredo sauce. I was glad that we were sharing because it did taste great initially but it's that type of food once you have too much you just don't feel great eating it. You know how Blue cheese is...! Appetizer bread looked yummy but tasted pretty average to me. For entrees, we had Pecan Crusted Pork Chop (3.5/5). It wasn't bad - the pork was really tender. However, it was just way too sweet and our food was served cold so the taste probably got downgraded. I personally recommend the pork chop at 101 beer kitchen - great price and deliciously and juicy. Cap City Diner meatloaf (3/5) was also just an okay... I wasn't quite impressed. My favorite part of the meal was the dessert. We got the Seriously Big Chocolate Cake (4.5/5)! Very good flavor and not overly sweet at least for me personally. If you care a lot of the food taste in general, I am not sure how much would you really enjoy here. But if it's just for a meal in a normal day, this place will work fine. Desserts are recommend. Be aware of the portion...everything is huge here and can definitely be shared by at least two people!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Came here for the fiancÌ©'s birthday today and had an awesome time. The "fine diner" concept is super cute - Cap City has a diner feel while still being incredibly classy. FiancÌ© picked me up from the airport and said he was in the mood for mashed potatoes. I did a search for potatoes on our route home, and we ended up here. Food was excellent and definitely hit the spot. We had the strawberry basil lemonade and the peach drink, both were fantastic though I preferred the lemonade. FiancÌ© described the pretzel we ordered at "probably the best pretzel I've ever had". I ordered he spicy chicken rigatoni, and or waitress suggested substituting the grilled chicken with the Romano crusted chicken. UM YES EXCELLENT IDEA THE CRUSTED CHICKEN WAS PERFECT AND AMAZING PLEASE TAKE HER ADVICE PEOPLE. FiancÌ©'s mashed potatoes were up to standard, and we can't wait to eat our leftovers tomorrow. We got the brownie because it was his birthday, and while we didn't finish it it was still delicious.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This place is a nice solid people pleaser. I think of it as that place where you can take your parents who usually like chain restaurants and steak houses. The blue cheese and potato chip nachos are great, and your dad will love the meat loaf.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is literally my first review, so be patient folks. I've been to Cap City before, but it has been 3 or 4 years since I've been back. The initial experience was fine, but I remember thinking it was slightly over priced. This experience was much different...My gf and I stopped in on a Tuesday night and the place was jamming. It was around 7pm and we were surprisingly seated right away. Our server was prompt and very friendly. I ordered the meat loaf dinner and my gf had the reuben and a side salad. The food came out very quickly and everything was very good. The meatloaf isn't the best I've ever had, but it is a strong 7.8/10. The reuben was impressive with a nice portion of meat. We decided to splurge and ordered the pb/chocolate pie. Very very good. Overall, the Cap City was very good and we will for sure be back. It was not near as expensive as I remembered either. I actually felt like it was fairly priced for the portions and quality of food. Enjoy!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar is a Columbus classic! It was one of the first local restaurants I ate at when I first moved to Columbus and has been a favorite of mine ever since. It is the most affordable and casual Cameron Mitchell Restaurant, but you experience an extraordinary level of service and attention to detail from your servers. Although more upscale than your typical diner, Cap City still offers the blue plate specials like Liver and Onions, Chicken Pot Pie, Pot Roast, BBQ Ribs and Beef Stroganoff.  If it is your first time dining here, you must try the Cap City Diner Meatloaf! The meatloaf is PHENOMENAL!!! Actually, it is the BEST meatloaf I have ever eaten. The meatloaf is served on top of toast with buttermilk-chive mashed potatoes and chili onion rings and drizzled with an amazing BBQ gravy. It is the ultimate comfort food dish!Besides offering the best meatloaf, Cap City also has the BEST desserts in Columbus. If you have a sweet tooth, you must try the Seriously Big Chocolate Cake. Its title doesn't lie...it is the world's largest piece of chocolate cake! The Big Cup O' Chocolate, which is a mug of warm, double chocolate lava cake topped with Johnson's Triple Vanilla Bean ice cream, is equally as large and delicious as the cake. If you can't tell already, all of the portions are very generous and can be split...I highly recommend splitting the desserts if you don't want to end up in a sugar coma. As with any diner, you receive classic comfort food dishes. But unlike other diners, you will be left wanting to return for the showstopper-sized desserts and outstanding service.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Huge fan of this place. It's a Cameron Mitchell which means food quality and service are top notch. Cap city has a retro diner feel. Kid friendly but also good for a date night. Great kids menu and complimentary baby food. I love their dinner rolls and Sunday cinnamon rolls. Order: spinach, apple cheddar saladPork chops - !!!Meatloaf - I switch out the sides to skillet beans and chipotle mashPretzels and cheese Save room for pie or chocolate cake!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I had my standby soup and salad. It was ok. The service was outstanding. However, the price and diner feeling seemed a bit disjointed. I don't think of diners or diner food as top rate, but more like comfort food and setting. The food was not outstanding enough for the high price tag. I might still go back with my husband sometime and give it another chance.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I was told by my friend who used to live out here that I had to eat here or my business trip would be a wasted one. He told me that I had to have the chicken wings so we came here on our last day before flying home. For starters, we ordered the tamarind glazed chicken wings and the hot and sour calamari. Let me tell you, the chicken wings did not disappoint. It is served with celery sticks and a dipping sauce. The wings were marinated and tossed in a sauce that was tangy and sweet with a hint of heat. It was so flavorfully addicting, that if I didn't stop eating the wings, I wouldn't have room for my entree. I can almost say the same thing about the calamari. The calamari is lightly friend, tossed with the other ingredients, and then served on a bed of fried rice noodles. This was very tasty as well but I liked the wings more.For my main entree, I ordered the pan-seared ribeye (medium rare of course). It was served with a twice-baked potato cake topped with garlic butter and steamed broccoli. My ribeye was perfectly seared medium rare. It was a very high quality cut of meat and not a lower grade quality of meat. One of my other coworkers ordered the ribeye and was as pleased with his as I was with mine. My other coworker ordered the romano crusted chicken that was served fried on top of garlic buttered noodles and a tomato cream sauce. She was happy with it as well.I am glad that my friend recommended this restaurant to us. We came about 40 minutes before closing time on a Thursday night so it was quiet. I've heard that this is a really popular place that gets packed. Coming from California, I can't say that we have many so-called fine diners that serve such delicious food for a reasonable price. If I have the opportunity to come back to Columbus, I will definitely come back here.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is a Cameron Mitchell Restaurant, but not as expensive.  The Cameron Mitchell Restaurants that I have been to have all been excellent and very unique.  Cap City is like an old 50's diner from the retro color scheme on the booths and chairs to the vintage ads on the walls. It's always busy in here, and sometimes the wait is long, but the food is worth the wait.  Today we visited here for our Sunday lunch with the family.  We got right in, which is always a plus.  Our server was great. He took our order, and filled drinks quickly and without asking.  While our food was being prepared, we enjoyed the complimentary dinner rolls dusted with cinnamon sugar and drizzled with icing.Our food was brought out quickly and we all enjoyed what we ordered. I highly recommend the Cap City Diner Meatloaf! That's what I normally get, but this time I decided to try the Diner Meatloaf Melt (sandwich) - it is $7 cheaper.  After having tried the sandwich I think they are both delicious.  However I would recommend asking for some bbq gravy on the side to dip the sandwich in as that sounds like it would be awesome.  There was also a Fried Fish Sandwich that was ordered that I was able to take a bite of; it was rather tasty.  All of the portions are very generous and can be split if you want to order dessert afterwards. This is a great place to eat, and I can't wait to come back again! Order(s): Diner Meatloaf Melt: muenster cheese, LTO and mayo $10.79  Cap City Diner Meatloaf: buttermilk-chive mashed potatoes, wild mushrooms, broccoli, chili onion rings and BBQ gravy $17.79 Fried Fish Sandwich: beer battered fish, cheddar, pickle, LTO with a sweet pickle tartar $11.79

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've been to Cap City several times, and I frequently order the famous meatloaf. This visit I decided to try the fish sandwich and fries. The fries were well-seasoned, which is important to me because I generally don't use ketchup. I just like a fry that has flavor on its own. These fit the bill!The fish sandwich was huge. I definitely could have split it and been full. Instead I took some home. Enjoyed it the second time, too!The rolls they bring out before your food are addicting...cinnamon sugar on top with a nice glaze.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City was the bomb! Complementary cinnamon rolls?!? Are you kidding me?!?!  We were inhaling those things by the basket (yes, they'll bring out more).We also tried the strawberry basil lemonade and it was delicious.  They even give you an extra jug of it to refill your glass.  That is classy service right there.Our meals came out super fast as well.  It was a less busy time of day, but it was fast even under those circumstances.  I tried the famous meatloaf and my wife went with the spicy chicken rigatoni (crusted chicken substituted in).  They were both fantastic meals.Seeing how everything was delicious, we really want to come back and try their desserts (and more of their food).  Cap City for dayz!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is always consistent and a great place to find comfort food. Their Maytag blue cheese chips are amazing. I always try to order something different every time I go. I've  never been disappointed in any choice I've made. It's reasonably priced and the portions large.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went here for the first time for a work lunch with a group of about 7 people. I was told the meatloaf was the best in town so I went with that. It's a good size portion and it was definitely delicious! The blue cheese and Alfredo pub chips were really good. I'm not usually a blue cheese person but the alfredo was really good mixed in. The server suggested we try the strawberry, basil lemonade. Sounded odd, but it was really good!It's a really cool retro looking place. It's aloe bigger than I thought. We could see a really big patio from the window. There is t much for parking and the lot is tight but other than that, we will be back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great food, great service!Was greeted with smiles when we walked in. We were sat immediately since we arrived about 2 hours before they closed. Our server was so friendly and recommended popular plates to try since it was our first time there. What was great about her was that she recommended something from each section. Appetizer, salad, entree, sandwich, soup, drink etc. We got the chips w Alfredo sauce and blue cheese for an appetizer. My boss ordered the grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup and I went for the salmon salad w blue cheese.Everything was great. Salmon was cooked perfectly and seasoned well. The chips were a little to rich for me, I would ask for a lighter amount of blue cheese crumbles personally.Took a piece of chocolate cake home, enormous piece btw! Cake was good. I personally love Portos chocolate cake and tend to compare every chocolate cake to their Parisian cake, which is the best chocolate cake I've ever tasted.If I'm ever back in Columbus I would most likely come back here.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I was highly disappointed compared to what I expected from my friends and other reviews. We brought applicants here last night for dinner and I was expecting something more. The service was very fast and staff were friendly so that part id give 4-5 stars. But the food was nothing impressive. We had a pretzel and their famous chips for appetizer- pretzel I wouldn't recommend and the chips were different but I could only eat a few before the taste got to me. I ordered the Romano crusted chicken- large portion but still not worth the price. The taste got to me again and I could only eat some of the chicken. For dessert we tried the chocolate layered cake (meh...not very moist or flavorful), chocolate PB pie (good but nothing special) and the apple pie (didn't taste home made but not awful). I have to come back here twice more for future interviews and I hope to try better menu items.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Yesterday (July 14) evening I ordered a cod and crispy shrimp large plate. There was nothing large about it!! The cod was about and inch wide and 5 or so inches long. There were 6 very small shrimp and 6 or so small broccoli fleurets. All of this for $23. When I protested I was offered another entree, but chose not to wait. The server offered to bring me more shrimp. The chef said I could pay $5 for 6 more. I think not!To add insult to injury the food was very oversalted.Will I be coming back? Probably not until the price and/or amount of food is changed. This is a poor showing for a Cameron Mitchell restaurant

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Every time I come here, I have a good experience. You get large quantities of delicious comfort food at reasonable prices. Went for dinner last night and really enjoyed the blue cheese chips appetizer and the cheese steak and fries. If you're hungrier than that, the meatloaf or the pork chop looks incredibly inviting on every visit. My favorite time to come is brunch. Eggs on hash or diner steak and eggs will fill you up all day, and the cinnamon rolls are a delicious way to kick off your meal. Pleasant atmosphere, consistently good service, and a solid drink list all help to make every trip to Cap City enjoyable. Good place for kids too. Unlike most Cameron Mitchell restaurants, Cap City is nothing fancy, and I wouldn't come on some big night out, but it is a consistently reliable place to get good food in a pleasant environment.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Pretty nice dinner spot, with a casual atmosphere and more upscale dÌ©cor than your typical Waffle House. Came with a large group and were seated immediately. I ordered the meatloaf, which had a unique presentation and tasted as good as it looked. Service was quick. I definitely plan on trying their desserts next time, which are huge and probably good for 2 people. Overall, it seems like this is a great place to bring a date or friends for a relaxing evening. There was also plenty of parking outside. Will be back here soon!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Comfortable atmosphere for groups and families, as promised it is a fine diner with tasty food and drinks!  High marks for our waiter - Sean (friendly, fantastic recommendations) and overall outstanding service. Large portions!  Ordered the chocolate peanut butter pie to go.   Half price wine bottles on Monday was a great surprise!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I visited the ORR location recently and it was apparently prime time to do so. I waited for almost 45 minutes for a table though the bar was open and that's where I waited... with ciders!Based on reviews I went with the meatloaf and mashed taters, my fiance ordered the pecan crusted pork chops. We both really liked our food, though I thought my meatloaf might be better. I wanted to be wow'd but I just wasn't. It didn't taste bad.. it just wasn't ah-mazing. We did leave full though, so its nice that the portions are large.The environment is super relaxed and their service is great! I plan to revisit when it's less busy and I will be trying a new item or two.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Was in town for softball tournament and found this restaurant on yelp based and it has good reviews. We sat outside on patio on a beautiful fall day. Our waitress Kelly was outstanding. Short rib, balsamic chicken and Mariano chicken all good and large portions!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This place has decent food, but the prices are overall way higher than the food quality could possibly warrant.  Drinks are on the highest end of pricing in Columbus, which for a diner, doesn't seem to add up to the decor.  Service was good.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Ate there last night! The waitress was great and also informative. The carrot cake was super and dinner was very good! Looking forward to the next time

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great service and good as always . It was Valentine's Day and without a reservation they said it was hard to say how long it would be . We were sat within 20 minutes . Our order came out incredibly fast (10 minutes or so) I'm sure they were trying to turn tables . My order was incorrect but replaced within 5 minutes . We were so happy they were able to accommodate us on such short notice and with no lack of quality or service . Mitchell's got this stuff together !

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We ordered the shrimp cocktail & it comes with good amount of shrimp but, they were flavorless & it was the first time we have ever left uneaten shrimp. We shared the rib eye which was decent but, the broccoli was not cooked & hardly warm. Overall not an impressive first visit & doubt if we will ever return.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: i'm a raving fan :)the atmosphere is great, the service is great & the food is even better!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I never have a bad dish when I come here. My husband ordered the beef stroganoff which was the daily special for Sunday. Unique presentation in that the sour cream was not directly mixed into the sauce but a big dollop on top of the noodles and meat and spinach is added to it. I ordered the crabcake melt sandwich which is delicious and the jalapeÌ±o coleslaw which is not spicy just a tad zesty. My son ordered the fish and chips which were tasty.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Brunch on a Saturday. Menu options less than exciting. I ordered the chili soup.  Nice chunks of beef with beans, peppers and tomatoes.  Toppings of onions, cheese and sour cream. Had to ask for cilantro.  Does not come with.  Soup was ok but cold.  Others ordered eggs Benedict or the omelet. Ok but uninspired. Coffee was likewise tepid.  Gone is the Cameron Mitchell experience of yore when food was great and service was careful.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This place was AMAZING!! The food was delicious, the staff were very friendly, the chef even came out and said hi. The food was very very fresh, everything spot on!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I was impressed by quick seating despite a crowd, but it turned out they just wanted us in a seat so we'd be less likely to leave :-P Actually getting a drink and some water took way longer than it should have, and was eventually provided by someone who was obviously covering for an inexperienced coworker.The food was ok - the meatloaf got good reviews, but the pork chops were kind of boring, with all the flavors on the sweet side without anything to contrast with it. It wasn't bad, and someone who likes their food that way would probably really enjoy that dish, but it just wasn't for me. Overall, it's a decent place, but in a city full of great food, not someplace I'll try twice.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Wow! Amazing burger during burger and beer week in Columbus. Coleslaw was best I've had in this area. Atmosphere was wonderful. Highly recommend.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went to Cap City last Saturday to celebrate our anniversary.  I had made a reservation for two using open table, but our friends decided to join us.  I called the restaurant,  and there was no problem making the switch to a party of four. I had asked for a quiet table, and they put us towards the back near the fireplace. It was very nice. The service was excellent, and the food arrived very quickly.Our entrÌ©es were the salmon, a cheeseburger, crab stuffed tilapia, and the diner meatloaf melt.  Everything was done to perfection, and there were no empty plates. For our anniversary, they comped us a dessert. We carried out the carrot cake, which was huge and so moist.  Thank you for helping us celebrate a special night, Cap City!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went here for lunch to meet up with a friend. I had the meatloaf and she had a chicken dish.Food was wonderful and service was fast as always.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City Diner is my favorite CM restaurant. It's a classic throwback with upscale flair that works. The ambiance of CCD can hinge on where you are seated. Near the door, the decor is bright retro diner/soda fountain. There is a large round bar area which is more classy/elegant, less lighting and dark wood. It reminds me a lot of the Clarmont's lounge area back in the day. The main dining room is open, spacious and clean lines. They also have plenty of patio space, which feels garden-chic or casual, depending on where you are. If you're bringing someone for the first time, make a seating request when you make your reservation.The other thing - the wait times here during busy times (Friday nights, Sunday brunch, etc.) mean reservations are a necessity. I've not had trouble at happy hour times during the week, but the wait can exceed an hour on Sundays. Make a reservation, avoid hanger.ANYWAY. Onto the food. CCD keeps the good parts of the diner experience (larger portions, lots of carbs, traditional flavors, and classic desserts) and refines them into something "better" rather than "bigger." From meatloaf to crab cakes to wedge salad to pecan-crusted pork chops to glazed salmon - the preparation speaks to attention rather than assembly-line. No grease puddles or mushy anything. That I can get behind if I'll be eating a dish for three days (yes, they can be that big).Definitely plan to take a doggie bag home, because you will regret not ordering dessert here. This is where Cap City gets the fourth star from me. (Almost) grandma-level, icebox style diner favorites. Again, nicely balanced - if it is supposed to be sweet, it is - not overbearing, though. You can split the desserts among three people, but you'll really want to try more than one. Back to the other things...they have happy hour, and spending an hour or so on the patio with a drink and appetizer is relaxing. They do have Sunday brunch, but I'm a bigger fan of their regular menu items (and the service on Sundays...maybe it is the customers that change it from fun to frantic). Definitely a place to bring your parents/children/spouse when they refuse to eat a) healthy and b)fancy.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I come into Columbus several times a year for work and Cap City was one of my favorite dining spots but I might not stop there anymore in the future. I'd still give the food 5 stars but I was recently there and had my and 2 others brief cases with laptops stolen out of our car. These things happen but the officer who came told us that this has happened before. The lot is dark and there isn't a surveillance camera. I'm guessing until that changes it will happen again.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Awesome gluten free menu! I have been there quite a few times and still haven't tried it all.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Our initial experience with Cap City was fantastic. We did have to wait for a table since we showed up sans reservation on a Saturday night, but the wait wasn't bad and gave us a chance to enjoy their nice outdoor patio. Overall, we had great service and delicious food, so we were very happy. We loved everything we ordered from the potato chip appetizer to the two apple salad and blue plate special ribs. It was all cooked perfectly. The strawberry basil lemonade was the perfect amount of tart. Oh and definitely save room for dessert. I had the chocolate cake, which was yummy, but there were a bunch of other desserts that looked awesome too.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We scoped out the menu before arriving and were able to get the best deals on our combined meals by eating between their happy hour times.  We were able to dine early, thus avoiding the Friday night crowd.  I can not say enough about the service and our food.I wanted a crab cake and wanted to try their Maytag Blue Cheese chips appetizer.
