The happy hour menu had the chips for $5, a crab cake for $7 and I found a nice Pinot Noir on their Happy hour menu for just $5.  You can't beat that! It proved to be plenty of food.  My husband wanted the Meatloaf, which he had tried before and was not disappointed either.I can't put into words how good those chips were!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Good food but overpriced.  They sat us in the corner next to the kitchen which diminished our experience.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went here hungry on a Saturday night with my family. Menu was full of comfort foods and it was definitely a tough decision, but I went with the pork chops. They were delicious and a huge serving size. Everyone else enjoyed their meals too. Would definitely go back. Service was excellent as well!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The food is outstanding and presentation is just as nice if not better. The outside isn't much to boast about, and parking kind of stinks, but the food is what makes this place great. Quick service as well. We went for lunch on a Sunday around 3pm and our food came within 15 mins of being seated. Highly recommend this place to others.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I read a lot about Cap City's meatloaf on Yelp and was eager to try the dish. I am a fan of Cameron Mitchell's restaurants in general and I've only had excellent experiences at his other restaurants. I was expecting no less from Cap City Diner. However, this was a case of expectations exceeding reality. Overall, I was disappointed with their meatloaf dish. Cap City does get an A for presentation though. It is an impressive plate of meatloaf topped with mashed potatoes and fried onions reaching almost half a foot in height.Taste-wise however, I found the dish to be lacking. To be honest, I think I prefer Boston Market meatloaf. Especially for $17.50, I was expecting some sort of twist on the classic or at least more flavor. I found the BBQ gravy to be a little bland and overly sweet. My favorite part of the dish was probably the mashed potatoes. I could also do without the broccoli.My buddy ordered the pork dish and said it was excellent. Judging from other reviews, that's also another popular dish at Cap City Diner. I'll be back to give Cap City another shot, I just will not be ordering the meatloaf again.***3.5 stars***

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is a solid, semi-upscale diner. By that I mean, it has a sort-of classic diner feel in some areas, but more of a upscale setting elsewhere. People were casual to dressy in attire, which made me unsure if I was dressed appropriately. I think other things made up for this, but I think I'd still rate it as just over 3 stars. I also had to deduct some points for it being difficult to find with lacking signage in front. I circled the block 3 times before finding the place!If you're going on a weekend, I definitely recommend this because the place was PACKED when we left (we reserved for 5 pm, so it was just starting to fill in when we arrived). There's also limited parking spots and the whole lot was totally full with people parking where there weren't actually any spots marked.I ordered off the gluten free menu (I have to be gluten free due to celiac), which I requested when I made the reservation. Had no issues with receiving my meal and ate safely! We ordered the shrimp cocktail starter - Yum! The girl child did not care for the legs still being on them, though. I ordered a Ruben on a gluten free sandwich roll with jalapeno coleslaw on the side. The sandwich was quite good, could have used a little more dressing. The coleslaw wasn't really spicy at all, but did have good flavor. My dining companions (boyfriend and his daughter) ordered a burger and a meat loaf sandwich, which they both quite enjoyed.If we were back in the area and wanted a solid gluten-free dining spot and could make reservations in advance, we would definitely return.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I took my family to cap city for lunch cause we love all the other cameron Mitchell's restaurant..sorry to say it was very disappointing..I order the club sandwich with no mayo when it came it had mayo on..i told the server about it he looked at me and said r u sure..i said yes i am and the sandwich came on it  with 1 piece ham and 1 piece turkey..the sandwich cost almost 14 dollar..my husband had the omelette and it said that it is served with 4 eggs ..the omelette was cold and small..disappointment for being one of cameron Mitchell's.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Service was fast and friendly. Tried the Reuben. Was very fresh and clean. Tasted great. Not the best out there but worth it. The wild rice was amazing. Very sweet. And nuts in it were tasty! Little pricey for what you get but overall satisfied.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Came here with colleagues during a recent biz trip. Cap City was recommended by clients, who raved about the Pecan Crusted Pork Chops and Margaritas with ginger so - off we went. First impressions: popular place with very crowded (and minimal) parking. Without a reservation, 6:30pm arrival guaranteed a 30 minute-ish wait, but the bar had some spots open, and the drinks (French Quarters and the aforementioned Margarita) made the wait fly by. Menu was a little surprising. What's with all the Maryland dishes in Ohio. Not knocking this; I'm from Maryland, so I'll even put Old Bay on pancakes! We ordered Mussels and Blue Cheese Potato Chips as shared apps, with the pork chops to follow. Mussels were plump, perfectly cooked, and beautifully flavored. The chips were far better than I expected: the sauce was wonderfully creamy, blue cheese flavor was not overwhelming, and the chips were hot and still crisp. Portion size was more than adequate for three hungry folks to share...... and then the Pork Chops came out. Two large Bone-in chops on a bed of cheddar-chipotle mashed potatos, served with a spinach side. I had ordered mine rare (in line with the latest USDA regulations), and they were perfectly cooked: juicy and flavorful. The pecan topping complemented the pork without being too sweet.  Overall very, very good, but it could have used a bit more salt and pepper for "pop". After stuffing ourselves, all three of us took home one chop, a pile of potatos, and a decent serving of spinach. In my case, this became a really good breakfast the next day.So, I'll deduct a star for poor parking, but give top marks for the food and drinks and service. And yes indeedie, I will come back the next time I'm in Columbus!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Wow. Today was my first time here and I wish I'd come much sooner. The service was amazing- from the second we walked in until we left. Everyone was so kind and courteous. The food was amazing as well. The menu itself is full of options that all sound delicious. I ordered the French toast that comes with berries, lemon custard and bacon. Very delicious. The best part was how fast the food came on a hungry Sunday. I can't wait to come back!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Every time I've gone here the food has always been outstanding. One of the few places I've never had even the smallest of issues. Our server Vince was lively and upbeat and my fried chicken and mashed potatoes were delicious. I will definately make an effort to come here more often!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is a classic Cameron Mitchell restaurant, and they have been a staple in Columbus for over 20 years now. They have a wonderful menu, an awesome happy hour, and a good location in terms of highway access and being close enough to downtown without being in the middle of the chaos (there is an actual parking lot!). I will say that the restaurant could be about twice the size it is today and it would still be crazy busy. Do not expect to walk in and be seated right away, even with a small party. I personally would recommend reservations, especially for dinner, and even still, I have experienced waits of about 15 minutes with a reservation. The big problem with that is there is a very small area to wait for your table, and chances are the bar will be full which leaves you literally almost nowhere to stand. Once you're able to make it to a table though, the experience improves significantly.At dinner they serve hot, fresh butter rolls which are so addicting, and at brunch they serve cinnamon buns which are even more addicting... they have a variety of great appetizers too. Check out their happy hour M-F 4-6 to get apps for $3, $5, or $7 including pretzel sticks and awesome wings! As for entrees, my personal favorite is the Ponzu glazed salmon, but they have a large variety of choices from sandwiches to their famous meatloaf to a spicy rigatoni pasta dish. They really have something for everyone!And for dessert I have to recommend the carrot cake. It is a HUGE serving, so be prepared to share, but it is so rich and decadent you'll forget that it actually contains fruit and veggies! Also the chocolate mug cake is very good, and the apple pie. In reality, you can't go wrong with their desserts.Overall, aside from a few logistical challenges, Cap City really knows what they're doing when it comes to running a restaurant. I will keep coming back for years to come!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Neat place.  I had a Philly Cheese steak sandwich,  real steak!  My parents love the meatloaf.  Went at about 530pm on a week night,  diverse crowd.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I go here at least twice a week.  I always get the BBQ Chicken Salad and about a million rolls. The wait staff is always very friendly and the ambiance makes for a great weekday vacation during the workday. On the weekends, I always opt for the bloody mary, it is one of the best things to ever hit my tongue.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We've been to Cap City a few times since my first review, and I feel like I definitely need to update it!First of all, I have had food at Cap City that is simply outstanding. Fish and chips? Best I've ever had. Something as simple as a lunch soup, salad, and sandwich combo? Delicious! The food is consistently amazing, no matter what I get.The service is sometimes really amazing. Once, we had a really friendly server, but she got sidetracked with talking to another customer. We were in somewhat of a rush, so it was a little frustrating to be waiting so long. Still, that was only once. Every other time, the service has been amazing!We went yesterday for lunch, and our server was really great. He was funny, gregarious, and generous - when I asked for a box for my little half sandwich, my tiny sandwich was boxed up along with about 6 things of crackers and a little cup of soup! He really went above and beyond at the end of the meal.Overall, Cap City is a place that I really enjoy going to. I took an out-of-town guest and she really loved it too. I would recommend to anyone!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Local favorite and mega-Ì_ber-diner. Kitchen knows how do food. Also some awesome creative drink options (passionfruit fresca, anyone?). Diner favorites come highly recommended (loaf of meat) but the menu also features some serious fish options. Also some midwestern comfort food weirdness (fresh potato chips with Alfredo sauce and other toppings). But a great place to bring a group - everyone will find something they like.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is my second time eating here and both were positive! The first trip was for lunch and both of us had delicious salads - very good salads! This time was dinner - arrived at 7 and there was a 30 min wait. We found seats right away at the bar. Food came pretty quickly after we ordered which was nice. I ordered the Romano Crusted Chicken and I loved it! I was surprised by how much I liked it -The sauce was amazing! My co-worker got the balsamic roasted chicken and she also liked hers! I also tried the Finlanda Infused pineapple vodka and it was also a winner! Fun delicious spot for lunch or dinner!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This Cameron Mitchell restaurant was a nice changeup from their typical fine-dining establishments. It was a fun little throw back diner with great service and great food!!We got two appetizers as we couldnt decide on just one, the crab cake and the peel and eat shrimp. Both were delicious and cooked perfectly. Nothing crazy but considering they are going for a "diner" atmosphere, its better than you would expect!I got the tamarind chicken wings and fries as my meal and they were wonderful. A great sauce flavor that ive never seem anywhere else was smokey and had a good amount of kick, they were delicious with the blue cheese dressing.  My dad got the blue plate special for the night, which was liver and onions, a dish he is very fond of. I had never tried it but after it got his approval, i gave it a whirl and was not disappointed!! Will definitely be going back to Cap City.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I would first like to start by saying that the food was excellent and our waiter was great. It is management that needs some work and that main reason why I am giving 2 stars. We had a party of 6 (including a small child and baby in a carrier) for Easter dinner. We were told we would have to sit in a booth because the larger tables for parties of 7 and 8. Before we even got our appetizer the two tables next us were seated with parties of 6 and 5. We weren't even given the option to wait for one of those tables.My Mom filed a complaint on the restaurant website about this. To which she received a phone call from the manager. He apologized without any empathy. And then proceeded to basically scold her because our reservation did not state that we had small children with us. And that those tables were for 7 and 8 people and it wasn't his fault that the entire party didn't show up. But both tables were specifically set with only 6 chairs and 6 place settings.All that was needed was a meaningful apology instead of being reprimanded. He clearly needs to work on his empathy and customer service skills.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I have dined here several times and still love it everytime! The food and drinks are consistently good and the desserts are the BEST.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great diner/ restaurant! Food excellent, ribs, meatloaf, crab cakes, all delicious. Service excellent. Has a bar where you can wait. Well worth calling ahead to save time standing in line waiting for a table.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is my favorite kind of place--a place that serves all different kinds of menu items, from burgers to kale, and all of it fresh, delicious, and made without shortcuts. They cook the way we cook at home, with real ingredients. No "dairy flavoring" in the baked goods, fresh not granulated garlic in the pasta sauce, and the person who came up with the recipes knows what delicious is all about. All too rare in affordable restaurants.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Really good food, really great service.  Amazing deserts.  This is not a "diner" it's way more.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I ate here this past weekend while in town for a concert and was very pleased. We got seated right away, even when it was 6pm on a Friday evening. They had happy hour until 630pm, so many people were at the bar. As the name says, it is very much a diner inside, but a little more modern and definitely a lot more space. They gave complimentary dinner rolls that were brushed with butter on the outside, which were pretty good. For my dinner, I got the crabcake sandwich, which was on an English muffin and the waitress allowed me to subsitute in garlic and chive mashed potatoes as my side. The crabcake was definitely made fresh because of the way it fell apart when I bit into it and the crabmeat was soo good. The mashed potatoes also were very fresh and had a nice, potatoey texture and a tasty, but light flavor. My boyfriend got the Philly Cheesesteak sandwich, which I had a bite of, and it was very very good.. especially that horseradish sauce that it came with.. sooo so good. Despite how stuffed we were, we had eyeballed the Big Ol' Cup of Chocolate,  which was chocolate lava cake baked inside a mug and topped with vanilla bean ice cream, whipped cream, and a pirouette. This was absolutely delicious and was not in the slightest too sweet or rich,  which was what I was a bit afraid of.I feel like this place would be one of those where you could order anything and it would be pretty good and I'll definitely come back again whenever the opportunity arises.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Took my dad here for Father's day. Large menu and large servings. All good. Definitely get there early as they fill up pretty quick. Love their strawberry lemonade cocktail.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Average food. High price. The maytag chips are delicious but not sure it's worth the cost.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I picked this place because it was close to where I was staying.  I was seated immediately, had a local beer and ordered the meatloaf.  It came out literally a minute later with my beer.  It was amazeballs.  Server was Ariane and could not have been nicer.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We had a mixed experience.The waiter was outstanding. He was knowledgeable, great advice on selections and attentive.The food was superb. Good portions presented well and timely.Weak points:1. Reservations were for 6:15 and seated at 6:35. Saturday is always busy, but a reservation should be closer to the time or at least a comp (water) for the added wait.2. I slipped on a lemon and fell to the floor. Not seriously hurt, probably more about the pride. It was crowded, I wasn't looking down to avoid the citrus obstacle. The manager didn't come to the table for 15 minutes and then gave a half hearted apology. Not even asking if I was OK, just "we are sorry you fell".3. The water glass was cracked. However, the waiter noticed it and replaced it right away.In the end, we had our appetizers comped. Albeit, they removed it from my check and put it on our guests check which had to be changed.All and all, we would go back if someone suggests without bringing up the experience. However, there are too many other Mitchell restaurants which we enjoy.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I knock off one star only because of the noise level but is that really their fault? They have become a top five pick in Columbus for me. I never get tired of the meatloaf. This weekend I had already eaten too much when my wife wanted to split the banana bread pudding. They had to roll me out the doorMy heart stopped a couple of times but there was no way I was going to leave any behind it was sooooooo good.   Excellent Rueben also  kraut is mild and does not overwhelm the corned beef

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This place is always busy, and you'll have to wait a little while, but that's a good sign! Dress code is anything from relaxed jeans to a bit dressed up - goes along with the upscale diner feel. Our waitress was knowledgeable and courteous. The meatloaf is highly praised so I tried the sandwich version - so flavorful and smooth. I would agree it lives up to the hype.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: If your looking for a really good place with excellent food you must come here. The entire menu is A++ and prices are very reasonable.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The bartender was awesome.  Waiter, not so much.  The crab cakes that are the special on Friday were dry and over cooked.  Hubby and son had the ribeye, very fatty and overpriced at $29.  I've been here before.  Good sandwiches and salads. The chocolate covered peanut butter pie is excellent.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My husband, our son and I went there for brunch this early afternoon. We ordered the pecan crusted pork chops, chicken tenders kids meal, and French toast. Absolutely delicious. However our experience was not up to our standards, considering we are both servers for the Bravo Brio Restaurant Group. Our server Kayla, greeted my husband at the host stand and immediately made unnecessary conversation with him, then she conveniently seated us in her section, much to my frustration. She noticed I was frustrated, then added to it by serving me the dirtiest coffee cup she could find. Upon taking our order, she continued to make unnecessary conversation with my husband.... made recommendations only to him, asked only him how his food was, etc. As an experienced server, it was extremely disrespectful and unprofessional. She also forgot his salad even though she only had two tables, us being one of them. I feel like Cameron Mitchell has much higher standards for their staff and I was thoroughly disappointed by the experience, the only saving grace was that the food was good. We won't be returning simply because we were not impressed by the service and I definitely wouldn't recommend Kayla because she is forgetful and careless.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is a cute little restaurant in Columbus The hostess was rude and chatted with a friend instead of seating us. The waitress is curt also. Other than that the bread was delicious, the ambiance is ok. Art Deco style with homage to late 40's early 50's automobile diner. My beer came quickly. Ribeye tasted liked they added too much butter to give it flavor. The meatloaf was really good but probably because the bread it was on had added sugar and butter.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: So disappointed after reading reviews.  It was my birthday lunch with Mom.  Server Lori gets 5 stars - she was great. The carrot cake was all I wanted it to be. But, Mom's cherry pie was mediocre and skimpy for 7 bucks. The "award-winning, signature-dish-meatloaf" was a complete fail. Both of us ordered it. We were hungry and didn't complain.  Served on an unnecessary slice of bread that soaked up the scant, tasty BBQ "gravy," the meatloaf itself was surprisingly bland with no real "meat taste" and no sign of onions or peppers.  The texture was soft, and there was no caramelization on top.  I wanted to ask for ketchup but didn't. Making the dish worse, the "buttermilk chive" mashed potatoes on top of the meatloaf tasted like mashed potatoes you would get at a cafeteria. I've had better at the hot bar at Giant Eagle.  All in all it was a very "soft" dish - no textural contrasts - perfect if you have no teeth. Or tastebuds.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Not great this time.  I had the Southern Fried Chicken, and it was bland and the breading was a bit soggy.  Not terrible, but not great.  The accompanying mashed potatoes with gravy and veggies were very good.  My spouse had soup, salad and half sandwich.  The soup and salad were excellent, but the chicken salad sandwich was a bust.  Way too much mayo, to the point that it shot out all over her sweater, and made much of the sandwich inedible.  I've really liked this place in the past, but today was not a good day for them.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I have to give the bartenders a hand for doing double-duty on Sundays. If you sit at the bar they're essentially being your wait staff and taking care of all the drinks for the restaurant. They're really busy. So don't sit there if you want great service.Took my parents here one Sunday (their first visit) and it was so busy and packed we decided to eat at the bar. I've been here several times and this is the first time I've experienced subpar service: (1) we were given hard, overbaked room temperature rolls for starters, (2) only checked on twice during meal for refills, etc. and (3) had to wait a bit to close out the check. While there were two bartenders and both were always there it seemed they were just stretched too thin. If a third person was there I imagine they would be stepping on and over each other.If you're going to be served a quick bite and drinking then the bar is the place to sit.The meatloaf is one of their famous items. It's a standard done well. It's meaty and juicy. The balsamic roasted chicken is an upscale version of your basic roasted chicken. Very yummy.The spicy chicken rigatoni has a spicy cream sauce with just the right amount of heat. It's not so strong it overpowers everything else.If you're a chocolate fan than the chocolate cake is a good dessert choice. It's large enough for one person to eat on for days or to share amongst everyone at the table.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went there for Easter and have been many times in the past.  I think this restaurant has went downhill and is overrated.  The meatloaf used to be outstanding and is now full of fillers. Mashed potatoes were lumpy. Probably won't be back and this used to be one of my favorite restaurants in Columbus.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The food is pretty good. We tried the maytag blue cheese potato chips- these were heavy, after a couple I couldn't eat anymore. The hot and sour calamari is just average, not really memorable. Entree- the meatloaf is pretty good. Dessert- 24k carrot cake and creme brulee are both delish

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The food, atmosphere, and service are all top notch. I don't really know what to say except that you should try it! The burger, fish and chips, meatloaf, parmesan chicken, everything is so good. Our daughters love their milkshakes. We just keep coming back!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We stopped on Thursday night.  I ordered the Harvest Salad. The menu  describes the the protein as "oven roasted turkey".  One would think that the turkey is roasted in house and looks like fresh roasted turkey meat.  I received something that looked like uniform slices of processed turkey breast.  When I commented to the waitress that the turkey looked and tasted like processed lunch meat she stated that when they used fresh turkey,  people complained it was too dry. My spouse's Southern Fried Chicken was also mediocre.  The chicken was a boneless breast that was very dry and tasted of slightly old oil.  The menu should say "boneless breast of chicken." We have eaten there before and enjoyed our food-not this time.  Cameron Mitchell-Cap City is slipping.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Love this little diner.  Service is excellent, and so is the food.  As a Cameron Mitchell restaurant, customer service is at the top of their list.  Whatever you ask them, they will make it happen.  Get the house chips with alfredo sauce - sooo ridiculously good.  The triple decker grilled cheese is also really good, and I haven't tried a salad I didn't like.  Molten chocolate dessert is also the best.  Don't miss this place.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Being from diner world back in PA/NJ area I was missing diner food so we decided to head to Cap City. I keep seeing people lining up outside this place so I'm thinking: man they must be good.Went in, got seated, saw the prices with some raised eyebrows ("it is a Cameron Mitchell place after all") since prices are much higher than what we expected from diner food, but hey, we're up to try new things. Our waitress was very nice, you can tell she's young, maybe working her way through OSU, and a great waitress.Got the romano crusted chicken. Generic and bland... there wasn't anything special about it. I got calamari (cooked well - not rubbery at all - that's the only star they get for food) and it was served over a bed of "fried rice noodles" which were just ridiculous. It's basically fried pho noodles. We also got a pretzel with cheese. A cup of soup and a drink rounded out our "meal."Grand total: $50.00Fifty smackeroos for generic/subpar diner food? No thanks. Definitely won't be back. Ever.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Tried Cap City with my girlfriend and was pretty blown away in our first visit.We decided to split a pecan pork chop because it was lunch time, we knew we'd be getting dessert, and we weren't looking to eat too heavy. Even after splitting, the pork chop was fairly large. The pecan topping was amazing, the meat was very tender, and the whole thing was extremely flavorful. The spinach and mashed potatoes on the side were very good as well. For dessert we tried the Big Cup of Chocolate, which is essentially a bottomless pit of chocolate lava cake topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Both my girlfriend and I dug in on the super delicious cake and kept eating scoop after scoop of ice cream and cake...but that big cup of chocolate was truly BIG! We weren't even able to finish; however, the taste was amazing. Our server was friendly as well, and everything about Cap City was very pleasant!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I really enjoyed dining at this retro diner styled restaurant!! Tons of menu options for whatever you're craving! I love peel-and-eat shrimp and they have yummy ones here!!! The crab cake is on the small side especially for the price.. I ordered the black and blue salmon salad last time and really enjoyed it.. With great service! No complaints and will return.. Just a bit pricey for this grad school student.. But I guess it is a Cameron Mitchell restaurant!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: 3.5 stars. I ordered some kind of blackened salmon salad, and while it was delicious, it didn't really live up to the hype about this place. I did hear that their dessert was good and I would be willing to come back though!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I scheduled a business meeting which lasted longer than expected. The server was kind and continued to offer refills long after we had finished lunch.  It was the first visit for 3 people on the party. And the staff took time to explain and answer questions. More restaurants should train heir staff like Cap City. Food was fabulous and atmosphere was great.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: How long have I been living in Columbus and I've never tried this place? Too long, my friends, far too long. I chose Cap City as my family birthday dinner location, and I'm so glad I did. We were seated on the patio, which was quite empty as it was a bit hot outside still. No matter, it was a nice patio! The inside looked really neat and I love that retro diner style, so I will probably sit inside next time. Our server was friendly and helpful without being overbearing. They have a solid menu here! It's large enough that you get a nice diversity of flavors and prices, but not so large that you become overwhelmed. I chose the steak noodle salad, which was more of a noodle dish with some greenery instead of a salad. This was fine by me, as it was actually quite filling. The portions here are substantial- 4/6 people took something home with them. To be fair, part of this is because we were saving room for dessert, but I'll get to that in a sec. My mom and sister both had the salmon with rice and veggies dish, and it was SO GOOD. I tried a bite and it had this tangy sauce drizzled on it that almost made me hijack my mom's plate. My blackberry bramble drink was strong and just the right amount of sweet. I was told by my parents to save room for their creme brulee, and I was so glad I did! It's a nice dessert choice because it's delicious, but not so massive that you feel miserable after eating it. I hope to come back to check out more of their tasty-looking menu, and I feel confident that I'll probably add another star with repeat visits.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Happy to have discovered Cap City while in Columbus over the weekend. This place has the NYC/Miami diner charm with a polished feel. We came on a Sunday during lunch, and were pleased that we were able to order from an expansive menu of brunch options in addition to the traditional menu. I opted for a tried-and-true cheeseburger, which didn't disappoint. The burger was cooked to medium rare perfection, and the toasted sesame bun was buttery and warm. French fries were delicious, too. One of the most enjoyable surprises were the complementary cinnamon buns. They were warm, fluffy and had just the right amount of sweetness to them. I'm drooling just thinking about them again now. Our server was great and the dining experience was one I won't quickly forget. I'll certainly be back on my next visit to town.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went here for lunch with my boyfriend. I had the pecan crusted pork chop and he the meatloaf. Both excellent and juicy! We've also tried the Cup O Chocolate and Big Chocolate Cake and can easily say some of the best desserts we've had! Cute little diner and service was great as well.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Best pork chops, Our waitress Lynn recommended them and they were great! Lynn was very nice and helpful.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cameron Mitchell has some chutzpah to call this a "fine" diner. Seriously. I visited from NYC on Friday, and my parents were excited to take me to this restaurant. With CM's name on it, they assumed it would be fantastic. I did, too, having enjoyed his restaurant in the Renaissance downtown in 2007. Either the mighty have fallen or are happy to slap their name on any old slop. My dad and I both agreed that the Southern fried chicken sounded great, so we ordered that. I was expecting something that matched the description. What I got was two dry pieces of paillard-style chicken - cheap cuts pounded very thinly and coated in something soggy and slightly sweet. This disappointment was accompanied by mac and cheese (which wasn't macaroni at all, but cavatappi), which I wasn't told was garlic mac and cheese. Avoid it if you're not a fan of inhaling entire bulbs of garlic. The mashed potatoes were some disturbing substance that seemed to come from a powder. It had none of the flavor or texture of actual mashed potatoes. A pale gravy with skin already formed on top was supposed to entice, I guess. It failed.Thing is, living in New York, I've frequented a fair number of diners and a fair number of fine dining establishments. Cap City Diner doesn't even rate in comparison with the greasy spoons in the average NYC neighborhood. It takes a breathtaking amount of arrogance to call this a "fine" diner. Either somebody doesn't care about quality or is truly deluded as to how awful this is. One thing's for sure: The manager couldn't be bothered to take care of customers. He hung out with a couple of regulars the whole time, never checking on tables to see if people enjoyed their food or otherwise attending to the restaurant. Seems like he had his hands full hanging out and shooting the breeze.I feel sorry for the waitstaff here, because inevitably they are the ones who have to deal with the disappointment of customers. They didn't cook the food or make the "fine" diner promises, but they bear the brunt of the consequences as the restaurant fails on every count. In case it's not obvious, I won't be returning, and I've already warned my friends in Columbus to avoid this place at all costs.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is another place I don't go to alone or regularly. I seem to always end up here for work related lunch or dinner. The food is always good and consistant for the price. They also have a gluten free menu for those who need it. I cannot think of anything stellar or outstanding that I have had and need to go back for sadly. I do know some people go back for the desserts but that isn't my thing haha.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Always good, dependable, and reliable. Service is usually excellent.  I've never been disappointed. I like a good stand by!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Came in for lunch on a Thursday at noon. Parking was very hard to find and a wait for 4 was 20 minutes, luckily we found 4 "counter seats" overlooking the kitchen, which were available for immediate occupation. I was between the Ruben and the fish sandwich, the waitress told me the Ruben is popular but she personally adores the fish sandwich. So I went with the fish sandwich and fries. Our meals were out in what felt like 5 minutes or less! My fish sandwich was amazing, huge, crispy, so amazing. The best fish sandwich I've had since moving to Ohio!One friend got the philly cheese steak, I tried it and it was a great flavor! Also a great choice. Another friend got the fish and chips, smaller pieces of fish than my sandwich but also crispy and wonderful. The fourth of us got a cup of soup and a key lime pie, which was a very large portion of pie. There was a lot of crust to it, but it was good none the less! It was its own individual very tall pie. We did have to hunt the waitress down for water refills, which a few other people on Yelp mentioned. The waitress did take care of our checks in lightning fast time. And like other reviews on Yelp said, none of the staff standing around the door tells you goodbye when you leave (which is fine by me.) I'll be back for sure, for $11 that fish sandwich was huge and amazing and I can't wait to bring my mother here to try it!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Had out annual office Christmas lunch here. Ordered the Romano crusted chicken. It's incredible. The cheese is perfectly crusted onto the chicken. The flavor of the Romano has that perfect bite. And the chicken is always cooked perfectly. I have had the meatloaf here before and can say that it is equally delicious. I can't imagine a bad item on their menu.Only downfall is the parking situation and maybe the seating in the building when busy. Gets a tiny bit cramped.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Simply amazing food. The best I've had in awhile and not the worst prices either. My only minor complaint would be the noise level.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Really good.  Breakfast burrito was outstanding.  Good draft beer selection.  Good service.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great experience! We brought a group of 14 people (with a reservation) and were seated immediately when we arrived. Our server, Vince, was fantastic. He made recommendations on food, drink, and dessert throughout the evening. He was also quick to respond to requests. We were all surprised when we realized he was also taking care of other tables in addition to ours.Food was great. We started with the Alfredo chips at Vince's recommendation. A few people also ordered hot pretzels and shared those too. I had the fish and chips for dinner -- super tasty! The 14 of us shared a piece of chocolate layer cake for dessert. Would definitely recommend trying. It's a Columbus staple.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Fantastic as always. Pork Chops are phenomenal. Vince the waiter is awesome. Been to this location at least  a dozen times and never had a bad experience. Will continue to go here for as many years as they are there.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Brunch/lunch and dinner at Cap City Diner are great. I love their quiche for brunch and their wraps are also very good. Otherwise, other dishes are pretty general American dishes, i.e. meatloaf, salads, steaks. Their cinnamon buns I had during brunch are a nice change from the normal biscuits/buns you normally get at other restaurants. Portions at Cap City are big and I almost always end up taking quite a bit of food back to eat. Because I generally enjoyed my meals at Cap City, I thought I would also enjoy their happy hour. However, I was pretty disappointed. The drinks are pretty standard, nothing too special. Their happy hour menu was very limited and quite expensive. I split an order of the pretzel, calamari, and wings with someone and we both felt that they were only alright, and not particularly worth the price. Also, happy hour is only at the bar so it's difficult to get together with a group there if that's what you want.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Came here with my boyfriend and his family. Cap City has good and solid food. Everything has huge portions (one entree is like for two people). I ordered the Fish and Chips. The beer battered fish was cooked very well with nice breading. I could even slightly taste the beer part.  The coleslaw was well done and everything was nice and crispy. My boyfriend ordered the crusted chicken and it was great as well. My boyfriend's dad ordered the cheese burger and his mom ordered the Club, both solid and delicious choices. We ended the night with chocolate cake and it was huge and delicious as well.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City always delivers. Tonight it was the 2 Apple Spinach Salad and the Romano Crusted Chicken (pro tip: they have a kid's version that is the perfect size!) I've not had a bad meal or experience here...ever. Cinnamon glaze added to their rolls for Sunday brunch is a great touch- CM really hit the nail on the head with this one . 'Upscale diner', prices are on point, food is consistent. Also, this is one of my go-to places to sit at the bar when I don't want to cook at home! Has a nice outdoor space, too- while it lasts!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Of all the Cameron Mitchell restaurants in town, I believe Cap City is my wife's favorite. (I would say that mine is the Ocean Club) She really likes their relatively down-to-earth menu, where you don't have to have any culinary knowledge to figure out what's in your dish. It's nothing fancy (meat loaf, fried chicken, pork chop, etc.) but they do it very, very well. Their bread basket is delicious, and we love their carrot cake... if you have any room for dessert. Compared to the other Cameron Mitchell restaurants, the price here is also comparatively reasonable, so that's another plus.Another thing that I love about this restaurant is their wait staff. They are so attentive, polite, and just delightful to interact with on a consistent basis. Our waiter during our visit tonight actually remembered us and exactly where we sat from our previous visit almost 3 months ago.My residency program used this restaurant for pre-interview dinners, so we used to go here 6-8 times per year for 3 years. Never once did we have a dish that was bad, nor have we had a bad experience with the staff. One point of caution though, is that on busy nights, the wait time can be ridiculous. Save yourself the trouble and book a reservation ahead of time with OpenTable.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Nothing bad at all about this spot. But nothing is great either. Consider it a step above a chain brunch joint. Friendly staff and good food make me think that people keep coming here because both stay consistent. The is a huge line to get in- which should spell superb. But in this case it spells- "Arby's isn't open yet" or "my sports coat won't allow me to go to Denny's"Not worth a wait. But if you can sit right away you might as well come in and take part in a group yawn.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Outstanding diner located right next to the Ohio state campus. Growing up I hated meatloaf but i read the great reviews on yelp and decided to try it out. It did not disappoint. Great flavor and very filling. The beer flight was also good. My only suggestion would be to avoid their "famous chocolate cake". Yes it's huge but I thought the actual cake was dry. Might have just been an off day. Overall highly recommend this place

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I'm WAY picky... ive ordered the cheese steak and am waiting for it now. $15 im dropping here including a pepsi and a side of slaw... 6/10.Mine is a 10... Everyone was very nice. I like this place.The sirloin I had a while back here blew Morton's and Ruth's Chris into outer space.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I rate Cap City a 4/5. The meatloaf is definitely a dish to try. It is prepared on top of mashed potatoes with fried onion strings and some really good sauce. Honestly I've never had anything like it. However, make sure you bring a wallet as big as your appetite, as this restaurant is expensive! I went because I had a gift card. Otherwise, as great as the food was I don't think I would have spent the money. Nothing personal!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great breakfast, atmosphere and service. Skip the Bob Evans up the street and come here.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Happy hour on the patio is hard to beat. Live music, Great drink specials ( CBC IPA ) for me but the wine bottles at 1/2 price great deal too. Then there's the appetizers. Shrimp, crab cake, Calimari. Well, the "Sweet?Sour sauce ruined it for me but you might like it. Sweet/sour seafood ? Then again I'm in Ohio ordering seafood. Still everyone food looked very well prepared & I would recommended it.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Arrived at 7:20p after TSO concert, starving.  Wait was 55 minutes for a table.  Scored 4 bar stools overlooking the kitchen.  Amazing!   Very accommodating to two in our party with dietary restrictions.  Food was outstanding and watching the kitchen was like the show after the silhouette.  This is my new fav in C' town!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Rated this place, need to do it again.Our experience for Mother's Day brunch was perfect.Had reservations, got seated promptly.  Waiter was attentive and knew his stuff.  Food tasted great and portions were pretty big.  All at a reasonable price.Could not have had a better experience.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went there the other night with my son on a Thursday night. Had a martini it was a little more than half full. Service was not good at all. The food, is not worth the money. I would not go back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Another great meal at Cap City! Our waiter, Vince, was hilarious!!! Great waiter with a wonderful sense of humor and exceptional attention to detail. I had my usual Black and Blue Salmon Salad...always wonderful. A friend had the steak and said it was one of best she has ever had...I had a bite and indeed it was wonderfully marbled and tender, cooked to perfection. The other person in our party is vegetarian and Vince took it upon himself to order a special entree for our friend. We were all very pleased with our meals.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I'm really going to base this review of the last experience I had here. 5 stars for service and 3 for the dish and pricing. I would like to give it a 3.5 overall really.For the last week I was really looking forward to some good fish and chips. I've heard from a couple people that cap city had a pretty decent fish and chips but decent was kind of an exaggeration. Our service was great and the waitress was super attentive and friendly. Our shrimp appetizer was muy bien but the fish and chips was a flop. The fries were hot, but soggy and far from "chips". The fish were more like the spherical chunks we ate in grade school. Flakey but a bit too soggy and unnatural in shape (Especially for the price).The Cole slaw wasn't anything to write home about either. Overall:Great ServiceFriendly staffClean and crisp atmosphereSpotty menu / prices

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My boyfriend and I were in town on a day trip and we wanted to stop somewhere to get food. Nowhere on their website does Cap City state it is upscale or that you should dress more formal than usual, so we thought we'd be fine with jeans and leggings. Once we entered, we were greeted with rude glares and poor service. We were seated in a corner out of sight of everyone else. The food was great, I will give them that, but extremely over priced. We ordered the crab cake appetizer for $12. We expected at least 2-3 cakes, but we received 1. It's never acceptable to charge $12 for one crab cake. The business needs to figure out what they want to be. Do you want to be an upscale fine dining restaurant or a diner? There's no inbetween. You can't have elegant lighting and expensive food but claim to be a diner. When we left, not a single person said a word. The four waiters & waitresses that were  standing by the door continued laughing loudly as we walked out the door, no goodbyes or anything. Overall very disappointing trip. Poor service and overpriced food.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Choose to eat at Cap City based on the varied menu and its location to OSU campus. I generally I am not a fan of American fare food, but Cap City surprised me. I went with two others and we all got three sandwiches and each tried them all. We tried the Philly Steak, Fried Fish sandwich, and reuben. I got the wild rice side and my friends got the fries. First, the food was quick it there was no wait with our food. All of the sandwiches were incredible. My favorite had to be the philly steak however. It was served on the proper bun and was packed with flavor. My wild rice salad was light and very enjoyable. The fries were seasoned and salted to perfection. Lastly we had to finish with dessert. We all split the chocolate cake and still only ate one third of it. It was very good and huge. The cake was moist although I have had better frosting it was still way above average. I would definitely return to try more of the menu.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I don't believe I've ever had this good of a casual dining experience in Columbus. I'm kinda shocked I didn't know it existed until now.The menu was thorough with all the American favorites, most with a special twist.  They had things like burgers and meatloaf, but went further to offer pastas and great entrees. Their salad selection was big. (Though one of my coworkers advised her take away chicken in the Greek salad tasted rubbery).The meat loaf looked great, I had the Romano Crusted Chicken and loved it. It was paired with an angel hair pasta. Not a fan of their meat sauce, but it was a nice try. Cap City really shined with dessert. Their sweets were generously sized and tasty. Loved the chocolate lava cake. Parking's a pain at lunch hour.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Stopped in during the HH specials, and what a treat!  Great prices and really good food.  We ordered Pretzels, blue cheese chips, and I got the Crab cake appy for dinner and a Pineapple Vodka to drink.I know pretzels and Chips for a starter--if I had to choose one I would say the chips with an extra side of cheese/sauce.  Both were really good.Pineapple vodka was strong--don't forget to eat the pineapple think it is stronger than the drink.The crab cake and the tomato salad that comes with were so good, honestly surprised bc seems more like a diner but they put out a really good crabcake.We ordered the Carrot cake for dessert--soooo good wish we saved some for breakfast the next day :)

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went on Friday night -- this place is popular!  Had reservations and only needed to wait about 5 minutes for our table.  My husband ordered the southern fried chicken.  We should have asked how it was prepared.  We were expecting real chicken on the bone with skin that was fried.  What arrived was essentially breaded chicken tenders.  Big disappointment.  I had meatloaf, which was good (and a lot) and our two friends had the crab crusted tilapia, which they enjoyed.  The caesar salad dressing is phenomenal.  The desserts, which others raved about in other reviews were "meh."  Our friends shared the cherry pie special and said it was ok.  My husband and I shared the molten lava cake -- there was nothing molten about it, the cake was over cooked.  Not sure that there was enough value for the price we paid.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Gotta love this place. I love the spinach and apple salad, but try to change it up sometimes. Service can be a bit iffy at the bar, but was pretty good this time.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: No picture today but this place was very busy for lunch.  I went for lunch at 11:15am.  15 more minutes and I would had to wait.  Sat at the bar because of faster service.  Our  waitress was awesome.  Multi tasking and very fast all by herself.  Meatloaf is what I had.  Good, but My wife makes better!The rolls that come out before the meal us awesome.  I will go back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've never had a bad meal at Cap City - ever. The ingredients are fresh and well prepared to your liking. I've never gone late at night either and it was great service to be less than an hour before closing. Definitely one of my favorite CM restaurants!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Pecan crusted pork chops are huge enough to split. Didn't think I'd like the pecans and sweet sauce on top but it's great. Blue cheese chip appetizers are good too. Downtown location is a little too loud.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Awesome food! The restaurant itself has a good atmosphere. Whenever I am in Columbus, I go to the Cap City Diner. The Fried Chicken is a must have! If I am not completely stuffed after that, I like the Big Cup O'chocolate. I have yet to have a bad experience here!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The five stars are for the superb service my mom and I received when we popped in about half an hour before closing. Although I feel a little guilty coming into a restaurant that late, knowing that some of the staff will be working later than they might like as a result, no one at Cap City expressed any frustration or weariness about it.Our server, Jeff, was a doll. He came over and was in the middle of telling us the specials. Soon as he started talking about the meat, meat, meat, my mom broke in, pointed at me, and said, "Vegan." Now... there are more animal products I avoid than those I eat, but I never claim to be a vegan. My mother knows this. I think she was trying to make the moment funny by stopping the server in his tracks. Unfortunately, it wasn't very funny, and it made it too awkward for me to order the very non-vegan shrimp I had my eye on.But what it did do was give Jeff the chance to show how considerate and helpful he and the diner as a whole could be when faced with a customer with dietary restrictions. The menu has a few things on it suitable for ovo-lacto vegetarians but literally nothing ready-made for vegans (y'know, aside from beverages). Anything one might want would need to be modified in some way. As we discovered, they're more than happy to modify. Jeff checked on the contents of the black bean burger for me and reported back apologetically that it has egg in it. Not easily modifiable. But (he noted)! ...the dish uninspiringly called "Seasonal Vegetable Plate" gets its dousing of dairy after the food is prepared, and so it might be a good option.My mom and I decided to split this dish. What's more, Jeff asked the kitchen -- and the kitchen complied -- to make one half vegan and one half not. So mom's was slathered in butter and goat cheese and mine wasn't. And let me tell you about this dish. Ok, so if you saw "Seasonal Vegetable Plate" on a menu, would it grab your attention and shout to you, "Order me!" in a plaintive plea? No, me neither. Despite being the one item on the menu that sounds critter product-free, the name would fill my brain with visions of bland steamed carrots and broccoli, and I would pass right by it. But that's not what this is.It has veggies, yes, but it also has some really tasty hummus and plenty of pita bread. It has a fluffy wild rice side with bits of everything in it, including some flavorful cherries that complement the wild rice perfectly. The veggies are anything but bland and certainly not steamed but roasted and juicy. And if you're not me dining out with my overzealous mother, you get goat cheese, too. This "vegetable" plate, which is more like a vegetarian feast, is a secret in plain view on the menu. (As a side note, the lack of butter did not deter from the dish one bit, as far as I could tell.)And the strawberry-basil lemonade was pretty kickass, too.So:* Polite service despite our late arrival.* Server bent over backward to help customer find something she'd be happy with.* House happy to not only split a dish but prepare it differently for each half. (My mom picked up the check, so I don't know if they charged a split dish fee.)* No one rushed us out when we finished past closing time; in fact, our server offered us dessert.If this isn't five-star service, I don't know what is.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: never disappointed at Cap City!! It had been a while since I had visited and that will change from now on. I asked for a gluten free menu and was impressed at the choices they had.I ordered the gluten free philly cheese steak and was not disappointed. There were four of us and we split the huge chocolate cake. ;)Great place anytime...love the atmosphere, service and food.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Order Maytag Chips and the meatloaf and you won't be disappointed.I prefer sitting in the main dinning area which is straight ahead when you walk in. The small seating area to the left feels a little secluded. Overall a solid experience.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I am a very regular on Thursday afternoons here.  I just received the very worst, most inattentive service ever from the male bartender.  I want to compare that to the absolute very best service I've ever had anywhere from the blonde female tender that is usually there.  This man should be fired and the lady given a significant raise.  If I walk in next Thursday and he is there I will walk out.  Staff is everything.  Or in this case, nothing.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Very nice place. Staff was very nice and on top of things. Even had a trainee waitress and didn't seem to slow anything down. Also went on a Tuesday at 5 so not sure what it is like at busier times. Ordered the ponzu glazed salmon and it was amazing. Fish, vegetables, and rice was all cooked perfectly. Honestly no complaints other than I thought the AC was turned to high, but was also near a vent. Definitely will visit again.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is a short walk from the Spring Hill Marriott. I stopped in the first night of my business trip. Ended up eating here every night!All 5 of the wait staff were excellent (Ryan upped it a notch)Great selection of craft beers!Food:The Walleye (on Mon night special list) was my 1st prize choice. Seriously amazing!I have never been a fan of fresh water fish. THIS changed everything!The meatloaf and Parmesan Chicken tied for 2nd place and were both amazing as well. They easily deserve to be in anyone's 1st place.The Pot Roast (thurs night special) got 3rd place. Honestly, it kicked butt, but the others are just kickin' butt harder!Last, to my surprise was the pork chop. All recommended it. Personally, the candied walnuts were WAY too sweet for me, and the meat was a bit dry. I suspect it is normally great, I just got one a bit over done.The tomato soup is superb. Perfect blend of acidity and sweetnessThe wedge salad also kicked butt. The blue cheese dressing was perfect!On my last night, Gabby surprised me with a huge piece of chocolate cake!Be warned. If you are trying to watch your weight.... Stay far away from this cake. It is AMAZING! I travel constantly, I can honestly say this was one of the best eateries I have encountered. So much so, that I saw no need to explore any further for this trip. It was close to my hotel, and offered enough variety to engage me.I did go to Cameron Mitchell's Steakhouse last visit. That was superb.When I return to Columbus, I will be back to Cap City!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Exceptional food, superior serviceI've eaten many Sunday brunches at Cap City. Best part - starting off the meal with warm cinnamon rolls, fresh out of the oven. I order their iced tea, which is fresh-brewed and never runs dry or without enough ice. For an appetizer, we ordered the calamari - exquisite with an amazing sweet chili sauce. For the main course, I ordered the chop salad, but substituted shrimp for chicken - very large, well-seasoned shrimp. Also, they have the cleanest and cutest restrooms with mouthwash and other amenities available. Finally, the retro furnishings and art makes for a fun/cool atmosphere. Overall, beautiful presentation and attentive waiter. You get what you pay for, but it is worth it 100%.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Pro Tip: However hungry you think you are, subtract one dish (including an entree) for every two people and you'll likely still emerge from Cap City a few inches thicker. While the vegetable plate came with warm, grilled veggies, melted goat cheese and fat, scrumptious pita, the hummus was a tad salty...especially when paired with smushy, warm olives. But the rice pilaf is something to bring back to your local diner and suggest to Flo...it's not greasy and is delicately topped with crunchy almond slivers. The pilaf itself is cooked al dente (if it's possible to describe rice that way) and loaded with dried cranberries and raisins, which add a nice sweet kick to compliment the nutty rice. But the real star of Cap City is its bavarian pretzel appetizer. The pretzels are slightly doughy, with a nice, dark amber crust sprinkled with just enough kosher salt. For dipping, these pretzels (two per order) are served with the most amazing beer cheese  - melted, with a hoppy, earthy flavor - and homemade mustard, which retails a bit of the crunch from mustard seeds. The salads are alright.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: As a gluten free diner I don't often find restaurants that offer variety.  I had the cheddar cheese potato chips and the Philly cheese steak.  It was amazing.  The bun for the cheese steak was so soft and almost gluten like.   I would recommend this to any gluten free diner.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We really enjoyed our dinner at this diner. Very cool vibe, clean, very friendly service and good food! Good for the whole family.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I need to get out more.  I absolutely loved this place. It has been a columbus mainstay for many year, but i just now have discovered it.  We got the chips and bleu cheese for an appetizer.  Man am i glad i got that!   I Would have licked the plate had my wife and child not been there.  I got the reuben as my lunch/dinner along with a side of fries.  I was dipping my fries in the bleu cheese dressing from the appetizer... OUTSTANDING!!  I really liked everything.  It was simple, clean, and very family friendly!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Big ol' piece of goodness  Ordered a carryout chocolate cake dessert last night.  Was ready by the time I arrived.  The piece of cake almost fills up a to go container it is so big.  It is very rich with a mousse-like icing.  Hits the chocolate spot with more cake to spare.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Buttered rolls are a great starter that is offered. My first time here and I loved the atmosphere and service! I ordered the black bean burger with cottage cheese. My food was fresh and full of flavor. My peach palmer drink of iced tea lemonade and peaches was very good as well. I will be back and I highly recommend this diner style Cameron Mitchell restaurant :)

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We had the southern fried chicken dinner it was good, but not great. The chicken was moist and the mashed potatoes were good, however the skillet beans were not good. They were steamed green beans that were lacking any flavor, and definitely not southern style. I would order the chicken again but try another side. The reason I gave the restaurant 4 stars was the service which was excellent! The server was very attentive and was so polite. This is something so simple that is not found in many restaurants anymore. It made the whole dinning much more enjoyable.We will be going back again soon.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This was actually my second visit to Cap City and I wasn't really excited prior to arriving or looking at the menu, but I was pleasantly surprised by the experience and by the end of our stay it had me thinking why we hadn't been back here sooner. The one standout from our otherwise forgettable first visit was the Prince Edward Island mussels in a white wine sauce. Absolutely delicious both times and any time we come back in the future they will always be the go to appetizer. The mussels are served in a large bowl and while the portion is definitely generous, mussels are only so filling, but on this occasion, the fact that they weren't terribly filling was perfect. For my entree, I had the eggs on hash which ended up being two eggs fried over medium (but they can be cooked however you like them) over breakfast potatoes and short rib tips coated in vermont white cheddar - the short ribs weren't really hash by the true definition - but, I liked it more than if it would have been true hash. I am an ever increasingly huge fan of breakfast, and I could definitely foresee this being a craving. My girlfriend had the fish and chips which she liked. I am not a huge fan of cooked fish outside of salmon and trout so I didn't try it, but as a non-fish eater, it looked pretty appetizing and I regret not trying any now that I am thinking about it. The presentation on the plate was very visually appealing  (for my dish as well) and if you are a fan of fish and chips, it seems like you'd be satisfied both in taste and portion. Not to be forgotten, but not worthy of higher billing are the cinnamon rolls, a nice homage to what I would consider "classic" diner dining, and very reminiscent of my childhood in New Jersey where diners are everywhere. If you are expecting bakery cinnamon rolls or even pillsbury cinnamon rolls hopefully this saves you some disappointment. BUT, the rolls (and when I say rolls I mean dinner rolls) come out nice and hot and the cinnamon topping/glaze and cream cheese icing are more than sufficient to call the finished product a cinnamon roll, even if it doesn't exactly comport with tradition. I have yet to see the dessert menu, but I am anticipating it being good and will probably get something when I come back. The service was good. The waitress was friendly and prompt and the only delay was in bringing the check and this wasn't for lack of attention but simply because she was conversing with other patrons. Overall, this place is definitely solid and we will more than likely be back, and almost definitely so if we're hungry and in the area. I say four stars not five because my first experience was pretty lackluster with the standout disappointment being the blackberry sage lemonade and because I haven't had dessert or a drink (alcoholic) yet. Regardless of this review accounting for past sins, I would definitely recommend this place, especially if you are a fan of diner food or american food with a fine dining twist.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We came here for dessert one evening a couple of weeks ago, and wow - am I happy we did! We sat at the counter overlooking the kitchen, and I could see all of the restaurant staff working hard and making some amazing food. Our server was very friendly and efficient. The "24K Carrot Cake" was out of this world. The frosting was perfect. My friends also tried the "Warm Banana Bread Pudding" and the "Big Cup O'Chocolate," and they raved about both. I cannot wait to come back and try their dinner menu!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I have been a Cap City regular for years and have taken all of my out-of-town friends and family here. They offer a superb menu of well-crafted and reasonable-priced dishes.It is without a doubt a Cameron Mitchell restaurant and that feeling is echoed throughout. They have a very friendly staff who are usually more than happy to accommodate their guests (within reason). I have never; and I mean Never, had a sub-par dish here. Between my friends, family and myself, we have probably tried everything on the menu. The apps are good, the entrees are fantastic and their deserts are to die for! Although we have quite a few options in Grandview area; I would have to say that Cap City Diner is my favorite Brunch spot.BIG kudos to Brian who is our regular bartender. He has consistently offered great advice about the menu and is a true asset to your company.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Still a favorite in Columbus! Hubby and I grab the Blue Cheese chips EVERY time. Had the fried chicken, it's plentiful and delicious, paired with green beans and mashed potatoes, you can't go wrong. The rolls are always fresh, the service is spectacular, I'd make reservations for a Friday or Saturday...today was our first Sunday visit and they weren't that busy.  This is my favorite Cameron Mitchell restaurant without a doubt, and the only one I haven't tried yet is Cameron's. Do yourself a favor and visit.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Pretty underwhelmed by this place. I'd heard great things about the meatloaf and decided to try that. He portion was huge, but unfortunately it lacked a lot of flavor. All I could taste was the sauce which wasn't very appealing. Also, the beer they served me was very flat. My favorite part of the meal tho was their chips. Now I could eat those allllll day. But as for the rest of the menu, I think I'll pass.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Excellent service and food. Catered to my allergies. Very friendly and fun. Great atmosphere.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is one of my first fibs of Columbus.Another great experience tonight. Shared the calamari and blue cheese chips for starters. Then had the Diner Meatloaf sandwich. I guess one trip I'll get something other than the meatloaf. Nay!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've lived in Columbus for a little over a year and had never visited Cap City until last night, for my birthday dinner!   The staff was all very friendly - something that's not always given these days.  Our waitress was awesome, and we were a group that asked a lot of questions.  I wish I had taken the time to read the Yelp reviews before I visited, but I will definitely be back to try some of the recommended entrees.  We knew we were having dessert so we opted for salad entrees.  the BBQ Chopped Salad was good, but not great.  I like my protein served warm on salads, and it was cold here.  Didn't think to ask, and I'm sure they would have served it warm for me, had I.  Greek salad was also delicious - love the balsamic dressing they use.   Dessert was glorious - carrot cake with white chocolate cream cheese frosting and the Tennessee Mud Pie tasted like a Dairy Queen birthday cake, with coffee, and much better quality.  I'll definitely be back - it's a cute spot for a date night, group of friends, or somewhere to take visiting family, if they like homestyle cooking with a twist.  *Was a bit surprised that some items were not on the menu - no form of mac and cheese for example.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: A lot of my friends raved about this place, which is why we decided to check it out.  I'm sorry to say, but I was rather disappointed by the food.  It tasted, for the most part, ok, but given the price label on them, it just wasn't worth paying that much money for.  The environment is nice and family-oriented, but I would probably not go back.  I don't mind paying high prices for food, but they really have to be worth the price, and this just wasn't up to par.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Not sure what the big deal is about this place. I had heard so much about Cap City from friends and colleagues, yet when I came here with a friend I was disappointed. Everything I ate seemed like perfectly average American food to me. Nothing horrendous, but nothing spectacular either, and certainly overpriced for very normal menu items.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Columbus is fortunate to have the Cameron Mitchell restaurants.   They are locally owned restaurants that offer great dining experiences.   I had not been to Cap City in quite a while and had a couple gift cards from the holidays that were burning a hole in my pocket.    I have never had a bad experience with the restaurant.  Cap City focuses its menu on what I would call "comfort food".   Menu items are very reasonably priced.   Usually, when I go out to eat, I am looking for something that I likely would not  have at home, but I enjoy their meatloaf.   It is a nice portion of meatleaf, served on a thick slice of Texas toasted bread, covered with mashed potatoes, straw onions and gravy with a small side of steamed broccoli.   It was just as tasty as all the times before.  The menu has a daily blue plate special.   My dining partner tried out the cola braised short ribs which were very juicy & tender.    For all you chocolate lovers, I have to give a "shout-out" for the "seriously big chocolate cake".   I always get one "to go" because I love putting it in the refrigerator and having it the next day - total chocoholic paradise!Service was good, but maybe spread a little too thin.  He definitely had multitasking down to a science as I could see him waiting on other patrons across the waitress.  My water glass went empty a couple times, but he was quick to respond once he realized.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Is it weird that my only complaint of this awesome restaurant is the food quantity? My friend and I split the blue cheese chips soooo tasty, as well as the pecan pork chops and holy cow amazing and we we didn't eat nearly half of our appetizer or all of our entree. Seriously the portions are insane. Alright back to the food. The chips were great and crisp. The Alfredo sauce was velvety and lovely, making me wish that I ordered a pasta dish. The blue cheese crumbles or should I say chunks were  a great addition. When I said we split (my friend doesn't care for blue cheese so her's was topped with cheddar) this appetizer they gave us two salad bowls filled with chips. We could have split this appetizer with two or more friends, it's that big. We also ordered their vodka strawberry lemonade and it is dangerously good. Sweet and flavorful but with enough alcohol you can tell you are getting your money's worth. As for the pecan crusted pork chops...... Well it was certainly in top 5 best ever. Once again we split this meal which consisted of two chops, sautÌ©ed spinach and a spicy cheesy mashed potatoes and left enough on both plates for left overs for one of us to take home (sadly we weren't going straight home so it had to be left behind ). I even forgot to mention that every employee that we came across (the host/ess and waitress) were incredibly sweet and personable. Needless to say that if I lived in the Columbus area I would be a regular.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I travel for work a lot, and I have to say that this place hosts the nicest bartender ever! I'm new to a gluten-free lifestyle and Mike was not only accommodating to my needs, he also informed me about affiliated companies that offer gluten-free options around the city! Definitely the kind of service that I would expect from any bartender but don't receive as often as I would hope! Thanks Mike! You rock!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is a Columbus staple.  If you have not been then shame on you.  The food is outstanding and the service is top notch.  This is the perfect place for a date night or to take out of town guest.My favorite is the meatloaf but the Romano crusted chicken is excellent.  I have taken out of town clients and family that were here for a visit.  I have yet to get a complaint of anyone.  The drinks are good, the wine list is adequate as well as the beer menu.  It can get busy on the weekend so I would recommend making a reservation (I used open table).  The one thing that is a drawback is the parking situation.  I shares a lot with a medical office and there have been times that I had to circle the lot to find a spot.  There is talk that the restaurant and surrounding businesses are being redeveloped.  This will eventually cause a temporary closure of the restaurant in the future.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Consistently good. Seriously, people, don't hate on Cap City. It's a very solid choice for both dinner & brunch. Try these things: Maytag Blue Cheese Chips, calamari, Philly cheese steak sandwich, Romano crusted chicken They are great for kids, groups, celebrations big & small--very versatile & CONSISTENT! They will customize food for you, they have a great shaded patio & even delicious craft beers.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: An all around classic. I've been going here since they opened probably 20 years ago. It's a rip off of a concept in San Francisco but I'm not complaining, I love both places! The menu hasn't evolved much which is a good thing. Just good quality comfort food like meatloaf and mashed potatoes. Get the chips topped with the Alfredo-blue cheese nonsense, you won't be sorry. Service is friendly enough, drinks are good. The patio is nice, otherwise the seating/dining room  is pretty boring but it's a essentially an upscale diner so it is what it is.This is a super solid pick for lunch or dinner. They serve brunch on weekends but it's just so-so. Bloody Marys are great though!
