column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: It's a good place, food is good, service is nice, and it's elegant yet casual.One thing that rubbed me the wrong way right off the bat is that their "happy hour" pricing is only good if you sit at the bar. This is the only restaurant that I recall did not honor their happy hour prices in the entire restaurant. It would have saved us $5 on our two beers, but alas, no discount was to be had. (to add to this, the sandwich board in front that toted their happy hour had no mention of bar only).The jalapeno slaw I had did not have any jalapeno flavor at all, it was still good though. The shrimp banh mi wrap I had was good, although the wrap was too big to dip into the ponzu sauce so I ended up deconstructing and reconstructing the wrap to sauce it.They could also stand a refresh of their beer selection, with our craft renaissance currently happening in Columbus, a large local selection is a must for a restaurant of this supposed caliber. Rather than some odd import selections (EG Palm?)Bill for two (one drink and one dinner each) was $50.50 after standard tip, not winning any hearts on the price scale here either. Overall a solid 3-3.5 star place, nicer service and atmosphere than other places in the area, but definitely could be improved.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: When I walked into the place, I was trying to figure out if it was a diner, restaurant or bar/lounge? To avoid any confusion, head straight for the patio dining area. Service was great, food was on point. Ended up ordering the Shrimp Banh Mi Wrap and it was good choice. Craft brews on tap as well. All in all, good first experience.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Never had luck with this place.  It's fine.  That's all I can say.  There are plenty of other restaurants that the food stands out and is memorable.   This place is not one of them.  WAY over priced for the food you get.  Desert eight bucks?  Really?  Fish and Chips 15 bucks?  No thank you.I work in the area so we've had people order it for us...everytime I've gotten something to go the bread is soggy and gross (when I called they suggested ordering the bread on the side...how's that my responsibility?)  I ordered the fish and chips once to go and it was literally dripping with grease.  The batter wasn't crispy but soggy and fell right off.  I ordered an expensive martini there once and it came to the table half full as if the waitress spilled it on the way.Even when I've had something not bad there it was just that...not bad.  The other restaurants in his group are much better.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This was our first visit and it was a great one. As we recently moved to the Columbus area from Oakland/San Francisco, we immediately were reminded of one of our favorite Bay area haunts, The Fog City Diner. We sat at the bar and enjoyed Happy Hour prices with big smiles. We watched plates go by with the flat bread pizza, the calimari and the chips covered with blue cheese and vowed to come back to try them all. My wife had a shrimp wrap and I had the rueban, both were perfect. The beer was cold, the atmospere was friendly and the place was all around delightfull!We will be back soon, with friends in tow.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've been to Cap City maybe 4 or 5 times in my 5.5 years of living in Columbus.  The first time I ate there I had the triple decker grilled cheese and loved it.  The way it's made (with fried egg, tomato, and a light sauce) was unlike any other grilled cheese I've had... it was the "finer" aspect of the fine diner.  Tonight, we sat at the bar and we shared the grilled cheese and tomato soup; it was perfect.  The bar became packed as the night went on so our server/bartender wasn't as "attentive," but when the side was incorrect he immediately went and got the correct one and when we didn't have the piece of cake we ordered after 10 minutes he immediately went to get that as well... we just had to ask/remind him.  The meal was served on separate plates for my friend and I, so they had already split the meal for us rather than bringing out an "extra" plate for us to split ourselves.We were very lucky as they were still celebrating chocolate cake day, so we also split a piece of chocolate cake, which was richly decadent AND HUGE! We ate maybe  of the cake and my friend had to take the rest home.I agree with other reviewers, the drink prices were a little high. I had 2 drinks and they were $12 of the bill... usually they would be  1/2 that price at other restaurants.My bill was about $30 and everything we ordered was split between 2 people (soup, sandwich, and cake), with the exception of my 2 drinks. So, our bill was easily $60 (without tip).Overall, I would definitely go back for the food and atmosphere, but be prepared to spend more than "diner" prices... the food is well worth it though.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Amazing!  I have had the stunning tamarind encrusted wings, the tasy creole tomato soup, the meatloaf dinner (best ever- sorry Mom!), amazing beef stroganoff, now I tried the pork chops.  THE best pork chops I have ever had!! They come perfectly cooked, pecan encrusted with apple cider glaze (Executive Chef Larry gave me a little bit extra, yummmm!), super tasty cheddar chipotle mashed potatoes and the most awesome spinach ever.  Topped it off with Creme Brule to die for.  Crusty, creamy, fresh, ripe strawberries,  incredible!  I will be back!!  Thanks to all the staff for making me feel so welcome. I was traveling alone so I sat where I could see the action in the kitchen.  Larry really sets a mean pace back there,  multi-tasking, calling orders, sending runners, and talking to everyone with admiration, respect and a passion for simple but elevated food with a few twists that make me want to keep coming back.  Wish I had something like this in the Pittsburg area.  Great food, wonderful service,  and a friendly vibe.  Thanks guys!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Holy moly this place absolutely rocked! Everything about it was faboo! Food, service, atmosphere, everything. We went on a busy Friday night so we decided to eat at the bar. The bartenders who served us were awesome! My husband and I split the corned beef  sandwich and the burger. Both were insanely delicious!!! The corned beef was fresh, just like mama makes. The marbled rye was awesome. The burger was just as delicious. Don't miss out on the bleu cheese coleslaw. Even if you aren't a huge bleu cheese fan this slaw will not disappoint. I thought it was totally awesome that they cut our sandwiches in half and not only served them to us on our own plates but they also split the sides for us. Little things like that really indicate that a place is on point.If you are in the area this place is a MUST! Worth the wait.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I have been to Cap City many times since moving to Columbus, and I have never been disappointed. Everything I have tried has been delicious! My favorite meal is the southern fried chicken. Words can't even describe how wonderful the chicken tastes. The blood orange margarita is a must. The best dessert is the banana bread pudding. Man, I could eat three of those things. It is SO good. The caramelized banana with the candied pecans and warm bread. Just get that dessert if you go. You will not be disappointed. The service has always been wonderful. The food is always good. I love Cap City!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City Fine Diner eases all my troubles. Here's why I love it:- Comfort food- A 2-page gluten free menu- Their wait staff is extremely friendly- Gluten-free bear- Gluten-free bread- They accommodate for weird food allergies like corn (canola oil), black pepper, etc.- Not too expensivePS: order the gluten-free chip appetizer. alfredo sauce + cheese. win.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Slim pickings for vegetarians. Unless you want meat meat meat, don't bother. I asked for the Pinot Grigio, only one on the menu, I was charged an extra two dollars for a different glass of Pinot, with no mention. Just kinda need to get it together there. Ambiance is pretty cool, casual however.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great service, food, and atmosphere. You can't go wrong at either location. Start with the Maytag blue cheese chips then either get the beef stroganoff, meatloaf, or fried chicken dinner. All taste great!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This location is so crowded, but it is a great place to grab a casual lunch or dinner with family or friends. The wings are a favorite with my family. As well as the pork chop and the meatloaf.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Ambience and atmosphere was lovely. Food was really just ok. Seemed more like an overpriced diner. We did appreciate the local beer on tap and local soap in the bathroom! It would be a nice place to take people visiting from out of town for some sturdy, consistent American food, but not I place that I see myself frequently going.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Raucous atmosphere? Almost.  Eclectic ambience. I'd go with that. Different strokes for different folks in terms of seating environs? Oh yeah!  Cap City Fine Diner and Bar on Olentangy River Road near 5th has all sorts of things going on inside and, with its patio in spring and summer, out too.My first visit last night was an eye-opener.  So let's get rid of the 5-star simply by stating parking is not appealing.  I had to shove my Chevy behind the Just Energy building next to the railroad tracks at 6:45PM... so the place is busy but you'll be taxed to lock & load.Upon entering the greeter was gracious; they had my reservation (Open Table - yes indeed).  I took a seat in the nearby bar to wait for friends running 10 minutes late.  This little nook was not comfortable with its naugahyde bar stools but it sufficed as the diner's staging area.  My Crown on the Rocks - splendidly full.  A whopper of a pour for under $10 - nice....!Our party was seated inside (temps outside were steamy; good choice) and we received a booth.  It was cramped as the bench seats angle towards the back so you're pinched.  Naugahyde... again.  Sticky wickets.But then came the service and the food.  Waiter Craig was the man with the plan. His verbal repetoire was impecable - the specials flew through the air even while he was taking drink orders.  In the end the selections were; Ponzu Glazed Salmon with stir fry veggies (yes - mine; and delicious and hot); Crab Crusted Tilapia with roasted veggies (my friend never looked up and smiled upon completion); Jake's Famous Reuben with Maytag Blue Cheese salad (his favorite).  All three of us were completed satisfied with the food prep, presentations and taste.  And all this for under $100 including tip.  How dee doo!I'm quite sure I'll return as I'd like to try the outdoor patio bar and seating.  It looked like folks out there were very much enjoying themselves.  But naugahyde?  Man, that's just too much diner-style for me.  Cie la vie.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: There's really not much I can say that hasn't been said already. The meatloaf was amazing and I left feeling overly satisfied. No really, I couldn't stand to leave any of it on my plate so I ate the whole GD thing. The two hour drive back to Cleveland was a tough one.Service was great and the dÌ©cor was fun. Diner with a hint of class. Loved it all around!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We were desperate to find a good solid dinner, not just bar food after a football game last September.  We were here touring OSU with our Seniors, and just happened upon this gem fairly close to the football stadium.  To our surprise, the menu was quite extensive, our food and drinks were fabulous.  My son'g girlfriend ordered the rib eye steak which was served with melting garlic compound butter, and said it was one of the best she's had.  Now that this is their school of choice, we're back for orientation, and it's our first stop for dinner.  The food, drink and service are top notch!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: A great restaurant stop on our trip to Columbus. The oyster appetizer was huge and came with about two dozen oysters. The Chicken Romano was thin and crispy with a delicious cream sauce and plenty of pasta. The two-tiered kids menu was an especially nice touch and the kids Fish and Chips were just a smaller portion of the excellent entree.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: If you're gluten-free or have dietary restrictions, this place gets you. My in-laws have an absurd list of food allergies and this is the only place we take them. The staff has been remarkably helpful and has had the kitchen take special precautions and even modified their prep of some foods to make sure everything was safe. Order anything, there's nothing that's not fantastic. Or ask your server - they're operating at another level here. For me, there are a few special things: 1. Appetizer Chips - it's some concoction of cheese and alfredo sauce or something that is delicious. 2. Iceberg Wedge. Their blue cheese is delicious. 3. Key Lime Pie - It's a thing of dreams. Love this place. Can't recommend it enough and you could be wearing a suit or jeans and a t-shirt and you're not going to feel out of place.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap city has a very good, unique atmosphere that I was glad to get a chance to see as I've been meaning to go there for a while. The vegetable plate was very good as was the club sandwich. The beer flights were great and well priced. Patio seating is available and there is an outdoor bar as well, which I was surprised to see wasn't very busy.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've come here when I'm in the area for years, and I'm continually impressed with how consistently good it is. I was here a few days ago for lunch, and the simple Chicken Milanese Caesar Salad was great. I think it's not as easy as it seems to make a really nice Chicken Milanese filet. ( Plus, I had enough for a second lunch at home, which is nice, right?) Today, I'm having a perfectly prepared Ponzu-Glazed Salmon, with pineapple sticky rice and lovely stir-fried veggies that perfectly accompany the dish. On both occasions, I sat at the bar, due to time constraints. The bartender, Joe, was awesome! So nice, so personable, yet without feeling cloying or hovering. More importantly, he got me out the door with an almost-fast-food-like efficiency, without ever making me feel rushed.  He anticipated every need, didn't bother me -- it was like being back in NYC with a truly professional wait staff. Great work, C M!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We had the  Cod , meatloaf, and goat cheese apppetizer.  It was all greasy and bland. The other Cameron Mitchell restaurants have been much better.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The food was ok dinner food I think it's over price for what it was the service was ok but in the end it was a Cameron Mitchel experience ! If your a small biz check yelps bbb standing before you advertise!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: One of my favorite spots for brunch/lunch. The tamarind wings, meatloaf, and romano crusted chicken are all winners. AND THAT STRAWBERRY LEMONADE...HOLY. I've gotten multiple people addicted to this sweet, tart, and refreshing drink. Even the bread basket makes me happy, especially at brunch. You're presented with these warm, cinnamony puffs of dough that are drizzled in icing. I could eat these alone and be extremely satisfied.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I absolutely loved it here! We were in town moving my boyfriend into school so we were staying at the Marriott right down the street and decided to walk to the restaurant which was about a block away. For drinks I got a cucumber chiller which had rye in it and it was very different and refreshing. My boyfriend got some sort of grapefruit Alcoholic drink and his was good too just very sweet! For an appetizer we got pretzel & beer cheese. The pretzel was amazing. I've been to Germany and it tastes a lot like their pretzels. Paired with the beer cheese was so good! It also came with honey mustard which was pretty good but I'm a honey mustard enthusiast so I've had way better! For dinner my boyfriends dish was by far the best one we ordered. He ordered the spicy chicken rigatoni. It came with mushrooms, peppers, onions, spinach, and tomatos in a red pepper sauce which was to die for. I ordered their famous meatloaf and I liked that as well. The presentation was great it had Texas toast on the bottom then meatloaf, mashed potatoes and topped with fried onion flakes. It also had 2 pieces of broccoli with a sweet sauce around the plate. It was good and I would order it again, but last night the pasta was just the winner! I really love coming to Columbus and trying out all of the food places they have to offer! Next time I come back I will definitely be getting the spicy pasta!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The chicken pot pie is fabulous. Our waitress was super nice, and gave us some great recommendations, including one of the best desserts I've had. I don't remember the name, but it had peanut butter and was made in-house!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I really enjoy eating here because the food is always amazing. We end up going only a few times a year though because the prices are just too high and parking really is awful.Best days to go are days no one else wants to be out. We went when all the snow was on the ground and I got a spot right in front of the door. Try going later at night during a week night too.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This place has a great atmosphere that has a really fun, unique and lively flare. All of the dishes are delicious, the salmon, the steak salad, meat loaf, and peanut butter pie are all incredible. There is occasionally a wait to be seated and the place is always busy but you can usually find seats and quick service at the bar.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is a wonderful introduction for me to the Cameron Mitchell restaurant group. I assume this is the most casual of the bunch, but the service was still very good and food was great! Mom had the meatloaf, which she loved but said it wasn't as good her her moms, Dad had fish and chips and I tried a veggie shrimp wrap sans the shrimp. I would love to see a better selection for vegetarians, but the wrap was good. My favorite part was dessert! The peanut butter pie, chosen by my father, sounded bland and unappealing but I was so wrong! Creamy and rich, this pie really finished off the meal. It had a chocolate (maybe oreo) crust with a mousse like filing. I'd really love to come back and try some more items off the menu, especially in the summer to check out the patio!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Our experience was great! Our server JJ was very nice and knowledgable. He made our night with his positive attitude! The food was awesome too. We got the pretzel and cheese appetizer and they gave us complimentary rolls.. We were were full before our real meal! We had the triple decker grilled cheese and the fried crab cake melt. Both were amazing and worth the price. It's definitely comfort food but next level comfort food. Highly recommend checking it out!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've been coming to Cap City Diner since I first moved to Columbus five years ago (has it really been that long?). What I love about CCD is the consistency/taste of the food, the five-star service, and the outdoor patio.This is a place full of comfort food-- think butter-covered rolls, meatloaf, heavy pasta dishes. My favorite item on the menu is the gigantic basket of fish and chips, incredibly light and crispy every time with homemade tarter sauce. Their bleu-cheese coleslaw is amazing. Their iceberg wedge salad is so tasty and crisp, covered in insanely delicious bacon and the most magical bleu-cheese dressing I've ever tasted. I also love their "Black and Bleu" salad, which is basically the wedge salad with blackened salmon. Are you noticing a trend here? Their meatloaf is also spectacular and their desserts are ginormous and rich. I love the carrot cake and the chocolate cake (big enough to share with 3-4 people).The outdoor patio at CCD is so fantastic for summer lunches and cool evenings. They have a great list of cocktails at somewhat reasonable prices. Their white sangria is one of my favorites. The service is perfect-- the waiters are respectful, friendly, knowledgeable about the food, and always on their game (and refills)-- pretty awesome for a so-called "diner."My small complaints for the menu echo other reviewers. Firstly, the menu has remained relatively stagnant for the past few years. I think it would be great if CCD could add some more seasonal foods to spice things up. Secondly, most things on the menu are extremely heavy-- lots of red meat, fried foods, heavy pasta dishes, salads doused in (albeit delicious) creamy dressings, monstrously-sized pieces of cake. I'd love to see some lighter, more healthful items on the menu. If anyone can make healthy food taste amazing, it's Cameron Mitchell.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Bruh, their meatloaf gives me life. Chocolate cake is so good too. Just excellent. And service was awesome too. I think his name was Vince. He was chill. I recommend.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The 3 star rating is composed of 2 stars for the Southern Fried Chicken and 4 stars for everything else.Cap City's "Southern Fried Chicken" is not any kind of southern fried chicken I have ever had, and I have had plenty of truly excellent southern fried chicken.  Cap City should call it "Honey Fried Chicken Tenders" because that is exactly what it is.  If you like that sort of thing, Cap City has perfectly cooked, boneless fried chicken breasts drizzled with honey that will make you happy.  It did not make me happy.I have had homemade and restaurant southern fried chicken in Arkansas, Florida, Georgia, Louisiana and California.  Southern fried chicken is savory, juicy and bursting with flavor.  You want to eat every bit of breading and chicken possible.  It makes you happy, it is decadent, and dark meat plays a key role.Cap City, for $16.99, will give you two pieces of boneless chicken breast, breaded and deep-fried, along with skillet green beans, buttermilk mashed potatoes and pan gravy.  The only flavor profile is slightly sweet - not savory at all.  The taste profile is clean and light, where southern fried chicken should be filthy with flavor.  The beans are fine, and the mashed potatoes perfectly adequate.  The gravy was a dollop restricted to the potatoes, not nearly enough to appropriately complement the chicken.Everything else lived up to Cameron Mitchell standards. The service was excellent, the restaurant warm, spotless and inviting, the salad, bread, beer and my wife's Reuben simply great.  Do not avoid Cap City, it is a great restaurant.  DO avoid the "Southern Fried Chicken" if you are in the mood for southern fried chicken.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: 5 stars for dessert and a Manhattan.We stopped in here around 8 and grabbed cocktails and dessert.  The Banana Bread pudding here is out of this world fantastic.  I am tempted to come back in the next month just for dessert.  My Manhattan was also pretty good.  I have never had a meal here but my wife has and she enjoyed the place.  I will come back someday to try a meal but for now this is my new favorite non ice cream dessert spot.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The food was delicious and the service was excellent.We sat at the inside bar because it was a Friday and the place was packed -- no one was there! You got to look over the kitchen and see the food prep in progress. It was wonderful. We got the pepperoni pizza for an appetizer, wedge salads, the reuben and the meatloaf sandwich. It was all so good. It was also SO much food that there were leftovers the next day... which still tasted delicious. The blue cheese coleslaw was also quite good.The ONLY disappoint was that the fries tasted out of a frozen packet... just wasn't as up  to par as the rest of the food. It wasn't so bad that it would effect the rating ... just worth noting. But, hey, they're fries -- they can't be bad... right?As for drinks, two of us got the beer flights... which was wonderful. We could sample all the beers for an unbelievably reasonable price. I love beer... and testing new ones out!HOLY GOD. I almost forgot the DELICIOUS bread that came before the meal. I could eat 900 of those rolls in one sitting.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: YUM! Yum! Yum!I try to hit this place up every year for my birthday.  It's perfect, because it offers a menu selection for both the child and adult palette (the child-like palette belongs to me).  Using Open Table you can reserve a table in advance for a big party.  The big bonus of going here on your birthday is FREE B-DAY DESSERT (I suggest the Big Cup 'O Chocolate or Chocolate cake).My two favorite dishes are the meatloaf and the triple decker grilled cheese....delicious.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I love Cap City, but only at the bar.I am the first to admit that I am not a huge fan of finer dining experiences- this is perhaps why I have only made it to one of Cameron Mitchell's restaurants. My husband and I ate in the dining room once and while the food was scrumptious I didn't really find the "experience" worth the marked up price. All this understood, until we spent time at the bar. Oh, the bar.I get everything I love about the restaurant- the yummy food and drink. In addition I get fabulous, friendly, witty and incredibly knowledgeable bartenders. No waiting in line for a table, HAPPY HOUR with half priced appetizers (their loaded potato chips are freakin' amazing- Alfredo needs to come on all chips!) and the other people around the bar are quite jovial. *Great wine & beer selection.*Favorite dish: Pecan Crusted Pork Chops - best I have EVER had*Come for happy hour!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: It really is a fine diner. You aren't overwhelmed with the diner motif in the main dining room. It is a bit more noticeable upon entry, but again not overwhelmingly Johnny Rocket style. The place was busy at around 3 on a Sunday, but service was fast both from our waitress and the kitchen. The portion size was large. I tried the crab crusted tilapia which was cooked perfectly. It came with a veg mix and red skin potatoes. The flavours were all good however the entire plate had just a bit too much oil on it - from which food in particular I'm not sure.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is a staple in the family rotation for birthday/anniversary dinners. The menu has a wide variety of options from good sandwiches to diverse entrees. The meatloaf is always and excellent option (if you're not up for the full portion entree, the meatloaf melt is also great). At times, the service can be slow. During our last visit, we had multiple people at our table ask for ketchup several times before it was actually brought, and refills of water never came. Thankfully this isn't something that happens every time (or I'd stop going). In the end, it's a great diner environment for family dinners and the menu has the potential to satisfy anyone's cravings for that day.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My daughter is visiting from New York City and we thought taking her to Cap City Diner would be a wise choice. She and I both ordered what the menu said was Southern Fried Chicken. Who knew that meant thin, flattened patties. We were expecting plump breasts, drumsticks, or thighs. Nowhere in the dish description did it mention boneless, thin patties. It was a huge disappointment. A manager never appeared to ask about our satisfaction. He stayed by the kitchen chatting with apparent friends. We're not sure why this restaurant is so highly rated.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Well this is an awesome place you just have to eat here. When we sat down at table the waitress gave us delicious hot buttered rolls yummy. Then for dinner I had the crab crusted tilapia and it was delicious. The crab and tilapia had such a nice flavor.  The crab crusted tilapia had season red skin potatoes and grilled vegetables. Yummy. Some of the others pole at my table had the crab cakes and blacken salmon salad and everyone said it was really good. After our yummy dinner we had desserts and we really enjoyed the chocolate covered peanut butter pie and the lava cake and it was so so so delicious. You have to eat here, truly you do.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Pretty good food but Vince is a dear. We really like him. He makes the experience worth the while.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I went here once for dinner when I first moved to the area and wasn't impressed, but recently some friends wanted to meet up for lunch so I thought I'd give it another try. While I felt the brunch/lunch selection was good, overall I still find this place to be overpriced for the quality of the food. Maybe it's just the Jersey-girl in me that's used to a real diner experience, but I was disappointed in my food. I ordered the Lox & Bagel and was actually surprised to see that it came out disassembled. I guess this is for "presentation" but if I wanted to build my own lox & bagels I could've gone out and gotten the ingredients myself and had a few meals worth for the price instead of just one.  The actual lox part of the meal was really lacking. I basically had two thin pathetic pieces and a mound of cream cheese that was enough for two full bagels. While my friends dug into their meals, I was sitting there building mine. On top of that, our service was really slow and it wasn't that crowded. I don't seem myself going back again.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: came here last night with my mentee and had a nice meal. I had the meatloaf that everyone has been raving about and my mentee had the pork chops. The portions were healthy, but the pork chop ones were REALLY big.The meatloaf was very good and the components (toast, mashed potatoes, broccoli, etc.) were all tasty. I would have preferred that it was not all lumped on top of each other in a tower, but I suppose I will have to let that go for the sake of culinary aesthetic appeal. All the flavors played very well with each other and I didn't have to reach for the ketchup!I had a taste of my mentee's pork chops and they were very good! Moist and flavorful, they had a great candied pecan crust that had a nice sweet taste.  The greens and sweet potato mash were also very good.The only down side to this restaurant is the parking and proximity to other tables. The parking situation is pretty difficult so we ended up parking on the back side of the Ohio Health facility, not sure if that's ok, but I didn't get a ticket, so that's good.  Also, the tables seem to be pretty close to each other, or at least I felt like the table next to us kept staring at our food, which was a bit weird.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Nice patio and I like their beer selection but the service was not fast or friendly.   One of the servers came up to ask the bartender about a customers lost phone...I don't think I've ever witnessed a more lack of caring...it was rude.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My wife and I love this place. Their menu has something for everyone. They have great seasonal cocktails. The food always comes out fast and the staff is very attentive to their diners. Try the Maytag Blue Cheese chips as an appetizer! They also have a good brunch menu. Reservations are a must on weekends and evenings, otherwise you will wait a little bit because they are always busy. They also have a gluten-free menu. My wife's cousin was visiting and has a gluten allergy. She was able to choose from a nice selection of gluten-free items.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I brought a colleague to Columbus for a meeting recently and we grabbed lunch here on the recommendation of a local.  It was very good.I had a chicken BLT and it was spot on.  It was one of those situations where you look at the sandwich, you start to eat it and you're thinking, "There's no way I'm gonna finish this thing."  Next thing you know, you're 1/3 of the way in to the second half and you figure, "Well, so much for that plan" and down it goes.  Yum!Cap City strikes a good balance between classy upscale lunch spot and good old-fashioned diner.  Plenty of comfort food and unhealthy stuff on the menu.  I was definitely NOT the only person in a suit and tie, too, which I always appreciate.One negative - there were fruit flies.  We had a table by the front window, and maybe there was a little crack or it hadn't been cleaned in a while or something, but there were fruit flies buzzing around us pretty much the entire time.  It wasn't that many but still, it was a bit gross.The quality of the meal and the experience make up for that, though.I'll be back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is a really great dinner spot.  Sadly, I was with a special breed of asshole while dining at Cap City, but I made a much better decision about my food choice. I ordered the night's special, crab stuffed shrimp with a side of asparagus and mashed potatoes. It was seasoned incredibly well, and not too heavy. Most of the items on the menu looked like good twists on old diner favorites. There were also more gourmet like options for those feeling fancy. I topped the meal off with the hugest apple pie a la mode ever. What I really liked about this place is the food is a lot more snazzy than the atmosphere. It's easy to get what feels like a fancy meal in what's really a casual dining restaurant. The place, however, is not a diner. It's more a good American style restaurant with diner decor to match the place's name.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Time and time again I find myself impressed with the food and atmosphere. Excellent food and superb prices. The meatloaf is not to be missed. They can be busy so having a reservation never hurts !

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Consistent and okay, but I could make most of the food at home. It's very overpriced for what you get in my opinion. The inside of the restaurant is also extremely loud so it's not romantic for a date what so ever - I felt like you had to scream to be heard across a table in there.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: As I've said in other reviews I have a love hate relationship with Cameron Mitchell Restaurants. This is one that I love!My wife and I stopped here after catching a Noon movie over at Lennox. Even though lunch was well would down the greeter was prompt and even came out to open the door for us. Our server was training another server and it was clear as to why. He was very professional and very friendly. So friendly I even took the time to fill out one of those stupid comment cards they always bring with your check.To start I had one of their non-alcoholic beverage concoctions, basically a pomegranate/lime sparkling water. It was pricey, but fantastic. For our lunches my wife had soup and salad and I had the much raved about meatloaf. The food came out fast and hot. My wife thoroughly enjoyed both the soup and the salad and I really liked the meatloaf. Naturally the meatloaf wasn't as good as mine, but it was definitely good and it's easy to understand why so many people like it. Despite being pretty stuffed we ordered the three layer chocolate cake we'd heard so much about. If anything ever lived up to the hype it was this cake. My wife loves anything chocolate or anything cake so her raves don't mean too much, but I on the other hand am not even a big chocolate fan and this was the most moist delicious cake I've had in a long time. Most of it ended up getting saved for later though as it is truly enormous.Lunch prices were totally reasonable, if a little high, but not as overpriced as some of the other restaurants in CMR group. To sum up, it's not the greatest place in Columbus, but it's definitely worth a try.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Straightforward: what I wanted was what I got. My dish of fried chicken was really good; my boyfriend ordered the balsamic chicken, which was kinda bland--just poached chicken breasts with a balsamic glaze drizzled over it--but it certainly wasn't bad. And the portions were huge, so I just gave him a third or so of my chicken, and a good amount of my sides.I don't think this is, y'know, subtle and nuanced food that you write poetry about, but damn, it does its job. And anyway, it's a diner; it's not supposed to be poetic. I wanted fried chicken, crisp on the outside, juicy inside, and lots of crisp bits--and that's just what I got. So I will be going back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This was the top recommendation from the front desk at my hotel. I grab a seat overlooking the kitchen, which as a nice option for a solo traveler/diner. Had the Sunday blue plate of Beef Stroganoff...very tasty.And as I sat watching all the massive nummy looking desserts go by, I had to take a key lime pie back to my hotel room, traveled well and tasted fresh and light. Perfect.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Came to the Cap City Diner for the second time (first time - drinks, second time - eating) last Friday for my girlfriend's birthday and loved it! The atmosphere, decor, and FOOD are great! I had the Meatloaf dinner ($16.50) and thought it was pretty delicious with a Bell's Oberon to go with it. The rolls they provide are also quite heavenly!  I will try my hand at something new next time: I am thinking the Pork Chops because it looked really good from glances. Dessert: Since my girlfriend received a free piece of the triple-layer chocolate cake, I ordered the Big Cup O' Chocolate...and it was awe-inspiring. Chocolate lava cake with vanilla ice cream on top. Who could go wrong with that!Also, the men's bathroom has mouthwash, lotion, and hair spray in case your date is going sour and need to spruce up a bit! The only pitfalls are: recommendations are highly advantageous, and the parking situation can be a nightmare if the lot is full.Definitely check out Cap City Fine Diner and Bar for a rockin' good time!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I tried Cap City for brunch, and was not impressed by the menu options for healthy, paleo, or gluten-free diet.Given, I have paleo diet restrictions that can be easily messed up by a "typical" meal.  I ordered a salad, specifically noting things I did not want on it because they would make me sick.  When the salad was brought to me, it had all sorts of things on it that I could not eat.  I should have said something, but instead tried to eat around.  I ended feeling really bad after the meal, and it made for an overall inconvenient and expense experience.At most restaurants, I can find straight forward salads that are easily to spin into a healthy option.  At Cap City, the menu is much more complicated, perhaps due to the "fine dining" aspect.  Perhaps my diet is not meant for fine dining?  Either way, when I walk away from a $13 bill wishing I had gone to Chipotle or Pita Pit instead, my buyer's remorse tells me this is probably a two star experience.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I'm a firm believer in truth in advertising so when someone asks how I am, I tend to spout off the truth. When my server Ryan opened with a friendly "What brought you in today?" I gave him the truth: my day sucked. And it did. My partner and I both wanted cheering up so we found the closest restaurant that would meet both our needs. Here's your spoiler: our dinner did cheer me up.My lover is a Midwestern farm boy and loves a traditional Midwestern diner; I'm an urban foodie who likes high concept, high taste food. Cap City rolls on both counts. The look of the place made me squeal a little bit; everything is the right mix of old and new, open and closed, shiny and matte. The formica table tops didn't feel cheap or gimmicky with the rest of the room. I consider that architectural balance something important because the type of space we're in changes how we feel about our time there. This is just a general human fact, and this human likes spaces with balance. The opening note at Cap City is a basket of rolls. Hot damn. They butter the tops just perfectly for a butter fan like me, but I suspect that could be an overboard experience for someone else. Butter fan makes good, though. The light, fluffy dinner rolls disappeared with enough alacrity that I can assume my partner also loved them. Here's where the service takes a turn from "pretty good" to "amazing team." My partner has an MSG allergy. Asking about MSG in a place like this is an insult, but we subscribe to a "better safe than sorry" policy. The kitchen team knew that their house-made sauces and broth didn't have a hint of MSG, but they checked all of the bases just to make sure. Everything came back clean except the perpetual offender (ranch dressing). We were surprised by the depth of their check, and I am impressed by how seriously this restaurant takes food allergies and sensitivities. (They have a full gluten-free menu, too. Wow!)Ordering was easy. Our server described some of the dishes with ease, and the menu was clear and precise enough that we didn't have many questions. It was obvious that the food was well thought out and heavily considered before anything was added to the menu. He got the meatloaf, and I went for the old appetizer/salad dinner with the Maytag blue cheese chips and a blue cheese salad. We also mixed a beer flight in because why not? Trying four regional beers is more fun than one! Here's where the diner part loops back: not only does Cap City look diner-ish, but they do the "food, fast and good" part of a diner. In a traditional diner, food should appear pretty darn fast. There should not be a huge wait, and I like that. The food came a lot faster than either of us expected, and we were delighted by the timing.All three dishes were more than enough: dense, tasty, comfort food done really well. High concept comfort food? Not over-thought, not under done. My partner was impressed with the meatloaf, although he didn't love the slice of bread it came on. When meatloaf is more than just "shove ground beef in a loaf pan and bake", it generally goes well. This meatloaf is more than just ground beef in a pan. My meal was indulgent to the max. The chips were filling enough that I could have eaten just the chips. Take that in for a second. This fat girl with a side of gluttony could have eaten JUST the chips. Angels are sighing in gratitude for these chips. The blue cheese melted decadently into the alfredo, which didn't make the chips soggy with my steady nibbling. Yum-o. From here on out, the service was present without being intrusive or clingy. We were offered dessert and our bill in a timely manner, and the dessert conversation was a no-pressure experience. Ryan offered it with a smile, and he took our full bellies with a smile. I didn't feel bad for being too full for more. I do rather wish I'd saved room for dessert, but I have incentive to return. Plain and simple! Would I recommend this place? Of course. It's not perfect, but it's a lot of fun. The food was great, the service shined, and people seemed happy to be there. It brightened my day immeasurably, too. Accessibility notes: no Braille menu or signage. Can get loud at peak hours. Tables are far apart for mobility devices, but many booths also populate the dining room. High bar.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I really rather enjoy Cap City. The menu has those classic comfort food dishes I find I crave and some interesting originals too. The portions are ginormous, so come prepared to take a box home or share with a friend. The desserts, if you manage to have room to try them, are worth every penny. They are massive and taste like heaven.The prices are on the high end, but that's how Cameron Mitchell does it. It's a great place for a "fancy" family dinner or a casual date after work.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is the utility player on my long list of decent lunch places.Cap City's decor is "upscale" 50's diner-esque.  No, there isn't an overdose of Marylin and Elvis, just a decent amount of chrome and checkerboard motif. If I need a decent place not too far from downtown to meet a client for a business-casual lunch, Cap City can play that role.  The Ponzu Salmon absolutely rocks.  I've personally witnessed at least ten friends, colleagues or clients down this dish with nary a complaint.  If you can eat a giant slab of meatloaf for lunch (I can't, without ending up on the floor under my desk with a pillow), Cap City's is top notch.When I'm dipping into my own coffers for lunch, I'll often end up sitting at the bar at Cap City (especially during winter).  The soup/salad combo is fantastic due to the broad range of salads to choose from (I like the spinach/apple/bacon number) and the KILLER sirloin chili (huge chunks of steak in there).  An extra $1 will get you the upgrade to the full bowl of chili.  Want to toss on half of a very decent chicken salad sandwich? Go for the Cap City Trio.  All of this can be yours for around $10 (but leave a decent tip for the bar-keep - he always provides excellent service while he dances, spins and sings his way through the lunch rush - high energy that dude is).My one ding on this location is the parking.....they seem to have five spaces which are always full during lunch.  Yes, there's ample parking all around, but it all has the "Medical Center Only - you will be towed or killed or really need our services if you park here" sign.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: One word: meatloaf, yes, meatloaf. It is all you need at Cap City. I love the meatloaf, they do it good. Meatloaf sammies, meatloaf meatloaf, meatloaf fudge, meatloaf shakes, meatloaf ice cream...mmmmmeatloaf... *shakes head and wakes up*Yes, I threw my vegetarian ideals under the bus again cuz I just love the meatloaf. Oh, did I mention I love the meatloaf? Anyway, just about everything I've had from CC is delish. I love the turkey burger and the Monday special which is...wait for it...yes! you got it! MEATLOAF! Meatloaf gone wild, with gouda cheese, red onions and special mayo.I think the pastas are very good also. The desserts like cup-o-chocolate, key lime pie, apple pie like my granny made, and my fav of favs, creme brulee are to die for. Try creme brulee. I am a flan lover and creme brulee is very much like it. (Barnyard noises? What barnyard noises?)At the end of the meal our server asked if she could bring us anything else whereupon I remarked, yes, a bucket, some pepto-bismol and maybe a wet towel :)The service is wonderful. The staff is courteous and attentive. A nice casual joint. Now, for that bucket...

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is such a solid choice for me. It's not extraordinary, but it's always a consistently good experience. When I'm looking for good food, good drinks, friendly service, and fair prices, I can always count on Cap City to fit the bill.If you're going for dinner, get the pecan-crusted pork chops. Do it. Trust me on this one. Also amazing are the meatloaf and the romano-crusted chicken. And if you're there for brunch (my favorite!), then do yourself a favor and get the burrito. It's big, full of eggs, peppers, and cheese, and it's topped with a delicious red sauce.As for drinks, I'm partial to the Pine Fin. It's just Finlandia vodka that's been soaking for days in a big jug full of fresh pineapple. No sugar, no crap. And I prefer it "up" as a martini.Parking can be a bit of a bitch here, but just suck it up and do it. I promise it'll be worth it.Tip: Make a reservation on Open Table!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The restaurant is quite deceiving from the front. It really looked like a small place but it was much larger inside. We had the crab cake appetizer and it came with a tomato,salad and a balsamic reduction and olive oil around the edge of the plate. The crab cake was delicious. Not too much filler mostly crabMy son ordered the pecan crusted pork chops and the serving was huge. 2 giant bone in chops. Cheddar mashed potatoes on the side. Very tasty. I ordered the fish and chips. Thick batter and 4 large pieces of cod with thin cut fries. Good, not great. It was very hot but the cod didn't have a lot of flavor on its own. I would still recommend it if you like thick pieces of fish. The best part of the meal was dessert. Warm banana bread pudding. Quite the mouthful of awesome sweetness. Honestly one if the best desserts I have ever had. The meals around me looked good too meatloaf and a crusted chicken dish with pasta.   Definitely will eat there again if back in the area.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I really like Cameron Mitchell restaurants but this one isn't managed as well as the others. The Maytag Blue Cheese Potato Chips are really good and so is the Peanut Butter Pie. I've tried a few different entrees here and haven't been totally crazy about one yet. My friend and I split the ribeye and the tilapia once, which was a good choice. The downside was we had pieces of broken glass in our water. I kept picking pieces out of my mouth before I realized what they were. We told our server but no one did anything but bring us new waters! The manager didn't stop over and no one talked to us about it. I went out to the bar on the patio and got new waters from them. Parking can be tight and there is usually a really long wait. Sometimes work dinners end up being here because it's a centralized location, but if I don't ever go back that's okay, too.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Today was my first time at Cap City. I ordered the lunch trio which came with half sandwich,  soup and salad. I really liked the soup which was chicken tortilla. My coworker ordered the Black Sage Lemonade and it was very good. He also had their meatloaf which looks delicious.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This has to be one of my favorite Cameron Mitchell restaurants. Their brunch is incredible. It's always a good time after work to go have a few drinks. The bar staff couldn't be better.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Had a fantastic brunch here last week! Service and food were 5 star all the way. I had the steak and eggs and the steak was melt in your mouth perfect and the hubby had short ribs and eggs, and we loved the cinnamon and sugar dinner rolls. We will definitely be back for the dinner options.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I got taken out to Cap City with my wife as part of our wedding weekend and I wanted to compliment them not only on the food, but on the way they handled the event, including providing us with complimentary flowers for her. The meatloaf was as spectacular as I remembered, we loved the blue cheese chips, and the monstrous wedge of chocolate cake they gave us to take home was simply incredible. I keep forgetting how good they are, and I'm pleasantly reminded every time I return.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Had a great experience here with Clay as our server. It was a Saturday brunch menu with amazing choices. Even manager Dave stopped by our table and gave us special attention. Will be back for sure!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great place for brunch. Very open and classic. Fun for groups.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My go to place.  Casual and fun.  I always get the BBQ chicken salad.   Big cup of chocolate for dessert.  Consistently good.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Those rolllllllllls! Everything here is always yum. The new jalapeÌ±o slaw is delicious. Comfort food with a twist. Service is generally pretty good, except our waiter last night (Monday) failed to tell us about the half-priced bottles of wine, so we ended up spending the same for two glasses as we would have for the whole bottle. Otherwise, always great.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City was walking distance from our hotel, and we had a very good meal there, while enjoying one of their "wine nights." This involved some really good prices, and if you didn't finish the bottle, you could take it with you! My dining partner partook in some of their excellent microbrews. They have a beer flight option where you can taste 4 of their beers on tap.Service was very friendly, and we took suggestions on what to eat.  The Maytag Blue Cheese Potato Chip appetizer is an indulgence for sure, but delish. The dinner menu ranges from traditional comfort foods like meatloaf and fish and chips to typical diner burgers and sandwiches to more modern selections like a Thai Steak Salad. Prices are more expensive than a regular diner, but this is not a regular diner, it's a "Fine Diner."   My meatloaf really hit the spot after a long day on my feet working at the State Fair!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My mother, sister and her three little kids were in town and we wanted to find a place that had food that everyone could enjoy while not breaking the bank. Cap City delivered! Our server was very friendly, and offered plenty of suggestions for picky kids. Some of the lunch highlights included the knife and fork chili dog, the mashed potatoes that rival my mom's, and the potato soup loaded with cheese and bacon.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went to this place on a busy Saturday night, and it was packed.  None the less, the food was great and the service was great.  I'll definitely be back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My new favorite place in Columbus to eat.  The wife and I will be returning!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This place doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside is nice enough. I went here for lunch recently and had the Harvest Salad. It was okay..I meant to ask for it on a bed of spinach instead, but forgot. (my fault, but I suggest doing that unless you like mediocre iceberg lettuce with the occasional piece of spring mix.) The salad had a nice variety of toppings, but really wasn't worth $13 in my opinion. I want to like this place because it has so many good reviews. The service was good too.  Maybe the next time I should order something other than salad. I saw a table order a giant piece of chocolate cake, which looked amazing. I don't really get an 'upscale diner' feel from this place, but either way, it's fine for lunch.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I went in for dinner with a few new coworkers.  The waitress recommended the meatloaf.  I'm usually not a huge fan of meatloaf, but I gave it try.  It turned out to be pretty good.  It was very moist and had a lot of flavor.  The mashed potatoes were decent.  Overall, I enjoyed it.  The dish is pretty huge.  Unless your BMI is greater than 30, you'll probably have some leftovers to take home.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Love it.  Came with family and friends for a small celebration.  Large portions, great price and nice environment.I'm not sure if reservations were required but we came on a busy night so I made reservations and we got right in.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Made a reservation and will likely abandon this place after an hour wait..  What's the point in making a reservation. Anybody can take a reservation, but you have to keep the reservation.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Every time I go to Cap City life just seems to get a little better. I seem to be a creature of habit here but maybe it's because what I get is sooooo good!  Always start with the Blue Cheese potato chips followed by either the pecan incrusted pork chops or the meatloaf, ending (if I have room - which is very rare) get the strawberry shortcake if in season.Love love love!!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Love this place!  Casual intimate atmosphere, great food and service.  Great table service from Gabby, and Molly at the bar is a gem.  Will definitely be back!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I love Cap City.  I hadn't been in years, but it was exactly as I remembered.  It's a "Fine Diner," so it is a little more expensive than a typical diner, but it's also a significantly better fare than your average casual dining restaurant.   I believe they're known for their meatloaf, but I've never tried it.  I usually just get a burger or sandwich, which are reasonably-priced, but I know I can get a proper martini as well. (Something I woudn't consider ordering at most casual-dining restaurants.)They get busy at dinner, so expect a small wait.  I usually head to the bar to avoid the wait.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Yes, Yes, Yes!!So in big news, we have decided to stay permanently in C-bus and we wanted to celebrate with some friends (but don't quite have the salary yet to go all out) and then we found this GEM! I must have driven past it 100 times and never even noticed this small, dark building filled with one of the best dinners I've had in a long time.Ryan, our server, was fantastic! He made great recommendations and had a lot of fun stories but still gave us our privacy to have a nice time with our friends (plus, bonus points for a man who appreciates Bells Brewery in K-Zoo, Michigan and Cap City still had a keg of Winter White, super score!!!)Everyone's food was amazing and the portions were enough for lunch! My chicken romano (per the yelp suggestions!) was fabulous - I'm writing this review as quickly as possible so I can go broil my leftovers!  My fiance's meatloaf was so intense! Our friends ordered the pork chops and Reuben and said it was the best in C-bus.I also hadn't had lunch that day and really appreciated the rolls that come with dinner.  They were a little buttery for my own liking, but the table gobbled them up.Cap City...you are the icing on Columbus's cake for me this week :)

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is a unique place with a unique menu. And it is well done.I had the meatloaf, which was described by the waiter as the best in Columbus. I couldn't argue with him, because I don't remember having meatloaf in Columbus before, but it was very good. It is the cinnamon rolls that they gave us pre-meal that will bring us back though.Great setting with a unique diner car feel, even though you are not in a diner car.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City used to always be a solid choice for me but I think its fine dining food concept is fading. It's hearty and yummy, but this last time I went (first time in a few years), I found the portions unnecessarily outrageous - 2 massive pork chops! And then the pieces of cake that may as well be called just cake. I left Cap City looking like I had gone to the grocery store as I had a paper bag stuffed with leftovers (cake uneaten...to be eaten later) The service was kind of dramatic like the food they serve. Our waiter was so enthusiastic about every dish that it got uncomfortable.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Yeah, Cameron Mitchell is kind of like "the man" and I hate giving props to "the man," but what can I say? I can be bought with good food and excellent service.As a disclaimer, I really only go here for lunch. Cap City has my second favorite salad in the city- the Two Apple Spinach Salad (not to be outdone by Greenbeans and Goodness at the TipTop). And they serve chicken pot pie on Tuesdays. Chicken Pot Pie! I love how they keep food simple, but innovative. I have actually never had a bad meal here.So that gets me in definite 4 star territory, but today did it for me. I had one of the most satisfying service experiences of my entire life... and I know that sounds kind of dirty, but in a strange way I do feel a little afterglowy. I was a waitress for 3 very long years and though I was fairly darn good at it, my waiter today put me to shame. He wasn't all up in my business, but always there when you needed him, incredibly anticipatory and exactly the right amount of friendly.Mitchell's restaurants do put a heavy emphasis on service and rightfully so. Though I am not in love with the food at many of his restaurants, I have always been treated well and dining is always a positive experience.The parking here does suck though--So overall today, the man won.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I took my parents here when they were in town visiting. Everyone loved their food!The place is a "diner" in name and style only, this is very fine dining at its best. Cap City is very well kept up and clean. We got in pretty quickly despite it being very busy. I had the legendary meatloaf on a sandwich and it was pretty darn good. Best restaurant meatloaf I have had. The parents got the meatloaf sandwich and grilled tilapia and both commented that it was very good. Even the kids liked their food! Some places really skimp on the kids meals, but not Cap City. I ended up eating the leftovers.I also recommend the maytag bleu cheese chips as an appetizer. They are pure salty goodness. There is lots of good stuff on the menu and I would like to come back to experience some more of it.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: wife and I visited the other day and we shared their fried chicken dinner and I also had a bowl of chili both  very good.  it was a pleasant atmosphere casual and fun place we will be back

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The food is great and the portions are more than generous. But the reason I'm giving this restaurant a five out of five is because of the service. Todd, our server, was the best waiter I've ever seen in town. His gregarious personality and willingness to go the extra mile makes this a place I am definitely coming back to.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: By the reviews it appears we all know of the high quality menu and service that Cap City has provided over the years.  Having said that, I was unpleasantly flummoxed by the deficiency of my waiter " Jon" working the back bar area. I don't go to Cap City to be entertained by the staff, but it appeared for the most part I went unnoticed.  Had to flag Jon down for service from the appetizer, ( crab cake, and recommemded ) to the Key Lime Pie, also recommended.  I'll write this off as a bad night, it can and does happen.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This place is okay. A little pricey for standard American fare. Supposedly the meatloaf is really good, but I don't like meatloaf, so I don't know.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I have been here 3x and have not been disappointed.  The meatloaf and pecan crusted pork chop are great, but the last time I dined here (4/16/14) I had the pulled Reuben sandwich which was easily the most outstanding Reuben I have ever had. The corned beef, which is made in house, was tender and full of flavor. It had just the right amount of sauerkraut and thousand island dressing. Regarding the bar, they have a decent beer list and a nice selection of top shelf spirits. The service at the bar was great and the ambience was a typical diner so it was kinda loud. I am definitely going back next time in Columbus.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Finally made it to CCD with the husband last night for dinner. It was our belated Valentine's Day dinner since he was a little 'under the weather' on Valentine's Day. We made reservations (highly recommended) and arrived a little early.  Given that it was around 5:30 pm when we arrived, the people who were coming in behind us were told there was at least a 55 minute wait for a table. Not too many were happy. Um, hello people, its a CMR restaurant and you expect to get straight in on a Saturday night?!?!?  I had the Romano Crusted Chicken and it was delicious. The hubby had the cheese ravioli with the humongeous meatballs. We both could not finish our plates, and here we were hoping to save room for dessert!!!The waitress that we had talked us into taking a dessert home with us. Fair enough. When we received our bill, I noticed that she took the cost of the dessert off of our bill given that it was my hubby's first time there. (Oh, yeah, if I didnt say so, he fell in love with this place!!!)  We chose the peanut butter mousse pie, which we had later on at home. Very good - you can taste the oreo crust,  peanut butter mousse and chocolate ganache without one flavor overpowering the other. Yum!!  We will definitely be back again!!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Came here for a work lunch and had a great meal.  The service was outstanding and we received some chocolate cake lollipops from our server which I took to my kids and they enjoyed them.  I enjoyed the soup of the day which was chicken tortilla and the grilled cheese sandwich.  If I am ever in town again I will definitely come back here.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Excellent food and service. Good beer selection but a great wine selection! The bar tenders were really helpful and were not shy to make a wine selection if you would tell them what style your into. The place is a little expensive if you are just looking for a "late night, grab a bite to eat" kind of place, but if your looking for a decent dinner, this place is spot on!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is a great place to check out if you have a gluten allergy or gluten intolerance. Not only is the gluten-free menu extensive and varied, but get this: they have gluten-free hamburger buns! (A rare find when dining out.) Although I haven't tried other sandwiches (I assume they use the same GF bread for all, though), Cap City also has gluten-free options ranging from ruebens to BLTs to chili dogs...and salads, of course. My GF bun was a tad soggy, but considering it's the first burger I've bitten into with a bun in 3 years, I was perfectly content. I'd say my favorite part of the meal was the Tamarind Glazed Chicken Wings -- it's been awhile since I've found GF wings. And, might I mention, my friend & lunch date who isn't restricted by a gluten allergy also loved the wings and noted that he'd never guess they were GF. The fries were tasty, crisp, and JUST greasy enough to be addicting. The ambiance was nice, although I would have liked for there to be a TV in view so I could watch whatever sports games were on. It was a cold day when we went but the patio looked really comfortable, with a bar and heated outdoor seating. The service was decent -- our server was overly friendly in using terms of endearment, which is much preferred to a negligent server. I'd definitely dine here again and recommend that anyone with a gluten intolerance considers checking this place out as well!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Dined here for the first time last evening after having heard good things about it for a long time.  Cap City delivered in every way.  (Side note: for anyone familiar with Cincinnati's old Diner on Sycamore, several things about Cap City reminded me of The Diner circa mid-late 90s)My wife and I and our 3 kids - 16, 14 and 7.  Full but not overly crowded, a couple tables waiting when we arrived 7:30-ish; made reservations an hour before arriving and got seated right away.  No problem parking but it was obvious that on a much busier night, parking could become an issue.Service was outstanding.  Hosts/greeters were prompt and friendly.  Our server was prompt and friendly.  Additionally, our server was informative without being pushy - she only offered her recommendations after we told her it was our first visit and murmured the usual "everything sounds good" plea for help.  A manager briefly popped by to see how things were going but didn't hover.  Drinks were refilled, plates removed, etc., in a timely and almost rhythmic manner by multiple employees.The food was very good.  We tried a variety of items and all were well prepared, generous portions.  The wings - crispy & meaty, not too spicy for most in my opinion.  Blue Cheese Salad - nicely dressed, fresh and crisp, and a very above average blue cheese dressing.  Meatloaf (sandwich), pork chops, and chicken all prepared spot on.  Chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes were excellent.  A nice beer selection also.All in all, this was a 4 - 4.5 star dining experience.  Kudos to Cap City!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Visited here last week for a birthday dinner with a small group of friends. The food was great, the service was not. We requested to sit in a corner as not to disturb the other guests; my group tends to be a little loud . We were sat in the middle of the restaurant though there were open seats in the back/corners. I was hoping to have a few drinks, as it was my birthday after all, but the waitress left our drinks empty for the majority of the night. We were there 7pm-10pm and our waitress came by the table 3x including when food was brought. You'd think you'd get better service when a 4 person party totals $250+ on a Monday outside of busy hours. As for the food, I had the ribeye and it was delicious. The mashed potato cake was awesome. My friend who has special diet restrictions was able to get a beautiful off-the-menu meal.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: An infrequent misfire from the Mitchell Group.  We were a group of six close friends who dine together every two months or so.  This time, we were seated in the covered terrace, lovely on a Monday evening; that is, until an amateur, middle-aged group proceeded to plug-in their electric instruments, complete with deafening screeches, and to sonically assault us making it impossible to sustain casual conversation.  Intolerably loud, the performances were just shy of on-key.  Let's give them that they were lusty and spirited as if they were young tyros just freed from their parent's garage.  I'd have forgiven them had they been in their teens-to-early 20's.  Sadly they were not.  Our far-too-infrequent-group-dinner was figuratively taken hostage by a gaggle of middle-aged rock wannabes.  The good food and excellent service, that night, was overshadowed by cacophony.  Back to the garage, boys, and don't emerge as a group anytime soon!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I accommodated the other half by attending an OSU hockey game last night. Since I was promised dinner afterwards and college hockey doesn't keep my attention, I spent the majority of the game playing with the Urban Spoon app, looking for just the right place to eat.   After a few 'shakes' of the iphone I realized that I had been dying to try both Alana's and Third and Hollywood which were pretty close by.  While trying to decide which place to go I looked down and realized I was wearing yoga capris, a tshirt and a fuchsia sports bra.  Yes, a sports bra on a Friday night.  Facts established, I decided something something more casual was in order.  A few shakes later and Cap City was locked in as the dinner destination. The atmosphere is playful and nostalgic with a large gumball machine and an upscale diner feel.  We sat at the bar and had plenty of room at 9:30 on a Friday which was nice.  I was a little underwhelmed by the drink selection because they only had 2 beers on tap: Stella and Yuengling.  And the wine prices seemed a little high (most glasses around $9-$10).  We settled on a Yuengling and the cheapest glass of red I could find which was $7.50.  While reviewing the menu the bartenders (yes there were 2 of them for a pretty small bar which was really nice). . . asked if we'd like some bread.  Really, do we look like the kind people who turn down bread? Bring on the basket! Unfortunately the rolls we got were a little dry like they'd been sitting under a heat lamp too long but regardless it was free bread so no harm no foul. The boy and I decided on the Ruben and the Philly cheese steak both served with fries.  Sandwiches were both good but I asked for mine to be served with cole slaw instead of sour kraut (yes, I make Sally from When Harry met Sally look low maintenance, when ordering food) and they forgot the slaw. Problem was quickly fixed though.  The 'blue cheese' slaw didn't really seem to have any trace of blue cheese flavor, but overall it wasn't bad.  The meat on the Reuben was really good and I think they make it 'in-house.'  The Philly meat was of the prime rib varietal and was really good.  The highlight of the meal was the banana bread pudding.  The bartender remarked that he had waited 3 years for Cap City to put this back on the menu and it was worth every second of the wait.  The dessert was huge of course, served in a large ice cream bowl.  A generous heaping scoop of bread pudding covered in caramel sauce, whipped cream, banana, toasted nuts.  This thing was the culinary equivalent of a snuggie- so warm and comforting it was hard to stop eating.  The bartenders were really attentive and friendly, food was more than mediocre and priced right, dessert was excellent.  I'd come back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: If you're craving a classic, American-style brunch menu, this place is right for you! I ordered the Classic Eggs Benedict, which comes with poached eggs over rosemary ham, toasted English muffin, scallion hollandaise, and fried red potatoes. Needless to say, it's a very filling meal! The chef did a solid job. On top of that, they serve complementary baskets of addictive cinnamon buns - I suggest limiting yourself to 1 of these...otherwise, you'll find that it was pointless to order anything else! other pros: retro atmosphere & super chill, nice waiters

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I have so many fun memories from Cap City when I went to college, so I was so thrilled that going back ten years later, I find out that this establishment is just as top notch as it was then!  I went with two friends from out of town and we all got something different and all three were amazing.  Definitely recommended are the Ponzu Salmon and the Cap City Meatloaf!  I hope to make it back the next time I am in Columbus!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've been to Cap City twice within a week of each other and both times I have had an excellent meal. The food is very good and the atmosphere is pleasant.The first time I was introducing a friend to Cap City since he had never been there. We were sat in back in the greenhouse like section and my only real complaint there is that it was a chilly day and the baseboard heater along the wall was cooking my left leg as much as the kitchen was my chicken.I made it a point to stray away from my usual meatloaf ( which is excellent there) to give some of their other dishes a try. First visit I did the Romano Crusted chicken, that was so good it must have gave my stomach a high five once it got there. The second visit I went with the Philly Cheese steak which I enjoyed. It was served open-face but amount of meat, cheese and toppings made it impossible to close it and still be able to eat it like a respectable human.The new appetizers I tried were the quesadilla and the blue cheese chips. Both could almost be a meal in themselves if you don't share them. Each are delicious in their own style of cheesy goodness.Normally Cap City's main dishes leave me too full to try a dessert but this time the server must have been an expert in the "upsell" because I couldn't say no to trying the Creme Brulee. Despite the overly full feeling I was left with, I was glad I tried it because it was excellent. Well worth checking out if you get a chance.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: A yearly stop. Food and staff are top notch. Never have experienced any thing less.  Save room for desert!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is sort of a conundrum for me. I feel comfortable and I enjoy the food overall when I eat there, but when I'm outside thinking of a place to eat, Cap City is rarely on my list of places to grab a bite.I've been here a couple of times, so the last time I was here I grabbed a couple of Cap City staples. For my app I munched on the maytag blue cheese potato chips. I despise plain chips, but smothering blue cheese on top of plain chips is almost a "noble prize" worthy contribution to the world. It's hard eating just 1 chip.Main course I tried their blackened tilapia po' boy. Very tasty, but the bread is a little thin, so much so that when you grab the sandwich  it became a smushed mayo/remoulade/tilapia sandwich mess. I ate it nonetheless.For dessert I had their creme brulee. Still very good, but it's starting to become pedestrian based on some of the creme brulees that I've tried in other restaurants around the city.Cap City is good food, but for me not always memorable.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Was visiting friends in Columbus last weekend and we went here on Sunday around 11 to grab a bit of brunch. I was less than impressed. The brunch menu is really, really limited. And what's with so many things made with ham? Our waitress was very kind, but the kitchen staff got my omelette wrong not once, but twice. I ordered an omelette with cheese, tomatoes, and green peppers only. The first time it came, it was LOADED with onions, the second time it came, it had ham in it.
