I decided against sending it back a second time and just picked around it. Although I don't live in Columbus, I do visit every so often, and I doubt I'll ever visit this place again simply due to the poor selection and that my food was done wrong twice.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I'm a huge fan of Cameron Mitchell...Capt City and Marcella's are on the top of my list. I've never had their famous meatloaf, but I've heard nothing but great things! My go to dish is the Romano Crusted Chicken with the pretzels to start. The portions are huge so I recommend asking them to box half to go. The prices are a little on the high end for diner/comfort food, but definitely expected with CMR.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I really couldn't decide if I should give this place three stars or four stars...  and I'm still undecided.  We've been here a few times, as we used to live in Grandview.  Maybe it's just me, but I think it's just diner food all gussied up.  I wouldn't call it a gem or fine dining at its best, but it's definitely interesting to see how they gussy up their food.  But personally?  When I want comfort food, I go for the real deal at home or in a greasy spoon diner.  I'd like to try their brunch sometime...  maybe that would bump me up to the 4 star level.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Stuff White People Like #4356Cameron Mitchell RestaurantsDiners are supposed to be a egalitarian affair.  It's where blue collar workers of all races, shapes and sizes converge before and after a hard day's work to indulge in hash browns, eggs, and strong black coffee.  The fact that I did not see a single coal miner or prison guard at Cap City belies its label as a Diner.  Oh sure, Cam will insist, we put "Fine" in there in order to justify the high prices and the yuppy clientele.  Stated another way, Cap City is the gentrification of diners.  Cam has taken a piece of original classic Americana and transformed into a place that serves a $19 rainbow trout with risotto.  What the fuck is this shit?Nevertheless, I felt compelled to give this place a try.  And it's pretty damn tasty.  Cam is a professional.  The service at his restaurants is excellent and the execution is on point most of the time.  I got the Philly Cheesesteak with fries for $10.  The cheesesteak was fantastic and far better than what I had from Geno's and Pat's in Philadelphia (talk about worst all time tourist trap.  Anchor Bar is up there too).  The fries were nothing to write home about, which is kind of disappointing given how easy it is to make excellent fries.  Take potato, cut potato, put potato in hot peanut oil, take out potato, salt, serve.  I think the peanut allergy lobby is ruining french fries in this country.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I really don't like top give places a 5 star rating because once you do, they have no room to improve.  However, in contemplating our recent visit to Cap City...I have zero complaints.  The wait was short, long enough for us to have a nice drink at the comfortable bar. The server was very smart and courteous.  The food came out fast, and was flawless. I mean, every aspect of our experience was great. If you want a laid back, diner type atmosphere with a friendly vibe, you can't beat Cap City.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I had the black and blue salmon salad.  It was very light and fresh tasting.  The New England clam chowder had a kick from the crushed red pepper without a heavy cream broth.  This left plenty of room for the chocolate peanut butter pie, awesome.  Great find on yelp, nice vibe nice people great diner

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is pretty great.  I first checked it out when I was in town for a day over the summer looking at apartments.  I was with my girlfriend, who is gluten-free, and being from out of town (Boston), I had no idea where we could go for good, reliable gluten-free food.  A cursory search of Yelp suggested Cap City, and so, cautiously and hungrily, we made our decision.Turned out it was a great decision.  Our server was tremendously knowledgeable about the menu and what could be made gluten-free.  As it turned out, the tamarind-crusted chicken wings were gluten-free (!), and they were FANTASTIC.  Perfectly crispy and spicy and flavorful.  For our entrees, we both got the pecan-crusted pork, which was equally fantastic - sweet, juicy and tender.  It came with chipotle-cheddar mashed potatoes, and some delicious spinach with shallot reduction or something.I went a second time with my parents when I moved to Columbus, and it was equally good.  I definitely will be going again, and will check out the other Cameron Mitchell restaurants.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap city diner had a lot of good food choices to choose from. I ordered the Apple salad which was very good but ask for the dressing on the side because they drench the salad in dressing. They have buttered bread for an appetizer which was also good but drenched in butter. The restaurant is huge and has a great atmosphere. I would definitely go back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Lunch yesterday was great.My dad and his wife were visiting from Florida for my son's high school graduation.  They told David he could pick where he'd like to go for lunch, and Cap City was his first choice.We went for lunch, but this was to be the main meal of the day.  Graduation was in the evening, so we figured we'd just have too much going on to worry about dinner.Everybody loved their dinners.I had the pecan crusted pork chop.  It came with spinach and chipotle mashed potatoes.  I've had it before and it was as good as I remembered.  The pork chop was tender and juicy.  I love the sweet pecan crust on it  The spinach was delicious.  The bright green just made the plate look so pretty, and made me feel virtuous.  Wish I could make spinach like that!  The chipotle taters were the perfect addition.  Since the pork chop had the sweet crust, the spicy kick in the potatoes was the perfect complement.My step mom, Judy, ordered the Ponzu Glazed Salmon with sticky rice, stir-fried vegetables and pineapple ginger sauce.  She tends to be a light eater, but she finished up all of the salmon and vegetables.  She left some of the rice...but only to make sure that she had room for dessert.  I'd say that was a "yum" for her.Son David had the Spicy Chicken Rigatoni (mushrooms, tomatoes, spinach, poblano peppers and roasted red pepper cream sauce).  He's had this entree before, loved it...which was why he ordered it again.  And, I might add, polished it off.     Dad went for the Friday special, "Joe's Shrimp and Slaw- battered fried shrimp and mustard slaw, with cocktail and tartar sauces.  It was right up his alley.  He was a little disappointed when he asked the server what "went with it", just to find out it was nothing else.  I think he expected at least some fries with it.  However,  when his dinner arrived and he saw how many shrimp were on the plate, he understood why he didn't need to fries.  They looked beautiful and he ate every single one of them.    Martin had the Crispy Fish and Chips (beer battered fish) which was served with Maytag blue cheese cole slaw, sweet pickle remoulade, and  French fries.  Again, the fish looked wonderful.  Like the shrimp, it looked lightly battered and golden brown.  Martin likes his fish and chips and said this was some of the best he's had.We all got dessert. David and Judy both had the peanut butter pie.  Said it tasted like peanut butter.  Wonder why.  Gone in seconds.  Okay, Judy's wasn't.  She's too well mannered.  But it still disappeared.Dad had apple pie with ice cream.  Also polished it off.  We tried to warn him about the size, but it didn't deter him.Martin and I knew better.  He ordered the carrot cake and had them bring it to the table already in a box.I ordered the banana bread pudding, which they kindly divided in half in the kitchen for us,  and I split it with Martin.  That stuff is so good...I'm not a banana pudding fan.  I'm not a bread pudding fan...But, somehow, I am a totally devoted fan of this dessert.  It doesn't make sense, but it's awesomeness is not easily surpassed.Go there.  It's good.Oh....and the carrot cake we polished off today.  Really good.  Almost as good as mine, but I didn' have to lift a finger.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Always busy, and for a reason.  Food is very good, whatever you order.  We always try to get a table outside.  Always served bread or rolls, just great food, not just comfort food, can't go wrong with a nut crusted fish entree or the meatloaf or the meatloaf sandwich.  The mashed potatoes are awesome.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Beware:  all these good recommendations are misleading - they seem to be about the bar, rather than the food.  If you're looking to just have dinner, go elsewhere.  We had dinner at Cap City Grandview while in Columbus for an event.  It was conveniently located near our hotel and came highly recommended by the hotel staff.  Friends had also recommended "any restaurant by Cameron Mitchell"  - and Cap City is one of them.  The restaurant was very busy but we had a reservation and were seated promptly.  The server was friendly and we followed his suggestion on what to order.  Surprisingly, however, when our food arrived -it neither looked nor tasted up to our expectations.  In fact, it was significantly less impressive than the random pub food we had for lunch in downtown Columbus (if you're downtown, go to Mac's in Short North -simple, casual pub/bar with great sandwiches).  Overall, Cap City was very disappointing.  I would not recommend this restaurant.  You could have better quality food - and less expensive - at Applebees / Fridays.  I assume based on his good reputation, that the other restaurants in the Cameron Mitchell brand are better...  but we decided to skip those after this experience.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Excellent!  Perfect service.  Ridiculous food.  Truly worth 5 stars.  Chocolate cake the size of your head!  Next time I am in C-Bus I will make sure to go here.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We had to wait 20 minutes past our reservation time, but other than that it was fantastic. I had fish and chips and it was flawless. My wife and daughter had the meatloaf and mentioned it was "the best meatloaf they have ever had". They had a small, but very good selection of micro-brews as well. The Columbus Brewing Co. Pale Ale was money!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The other reviewers are right! Great meal. The blue cheese chips are a MUST! Meatloaf was tremendous. If you are near don't miss this great spot

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Fun, family diner atmosphere.  Delicious food, great service and a variety of menu choices!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Oh how I love this restaurant! Lots of parking, lots of seating...indoor and covered patio dining avail, and offers a full bar. Service is awesome - staff is great! The food - home style cooking! It's the only place in town where I can go get a turkey burger, fries, and a damn good milkshake, and I mean good!! Their brunch is delicious as well - they bring out these cinnamon rolls  to your table that are so addicting! Too good! If you are looking for great food for a great value - this place is it!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: True to my word, I went back! This time for lunch with coworkers. Food was much better all around. I had the soup (cream of mushroom) and salad (blue cheese) deal. Everyone else said their meals were good: shrimp wrap was "excellent" said one. One negative was that one of my fellow diners asked whether he could have the sticky rice (which came with the ponzu salmon) with brown rice, but was told no. I think as a substitution this would have been simple, even if they weren't able to prepare it as "sticky," and pretty common for customers nowadays to ask for brown rice and other healthier options. Re: my last review, I still contend that this isn't a good place to go for brunch (or for bloody mary's), but it's a safe bet for lunch and always packed.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Why have I not been going to Cap City for my Saturday brunch fix? Sure as hell beats me, but this is my new go-to!When we arrived they were relatively busy with a 20-25 minute wait, but it only seemed like a mere 10-15 and then we were seated. Score.After already browsing the menu while waiting and reading Yelp reviews, I basically already knew what I wanted. Thanks, Kate H. As you can guess, I ordered the Two Apple Spinach Salad with a cup of the soup of the day (Southwestern Black Bean, I believe). I could not stop raving about the salad the whole way home. I'm still salivating. May I go back and have another?I know when I go back, I'll be tempted to order that again, but I must branch out, I must! The person I went with had the meatloaf and it looked de-lish! So. Much. Food. So. Little. Prices. Oh and can we discuss the cinnamon rolls? Yummm....And the service, just as you'd expect for a Cameron Mitchell restaurant. She even offered to bring me a fresh cup of soup since I chose to eat my salad first, but both were brought out at the same time, so the soup may not be that hot anymore. :) It's the little things, really.Oh, and on a random note, we were seated at a two person table, and it was actually really big! It was nice. Typically, it's a cramped table where your plates are only a mere inches from each other, but these tables provided plenty of room.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Maybe it has a lot to do with enjoying the company of my co-workers, but we stopped at Cap City after work on a Friday and I looooved it!The bleu cheese potato chips were EXACTLY the way I've always dreamed of dying of a heart attack.  Delicious!  Actually, all the appetizers we sampled were delish...and I'm pretty sure we got two or three of everything.  I enjoyed the selection of beers on tap.  I also delighted in a white sangria, which was A-MAZING.  I couldn't decide on white or red so I got  a white, but the bartender gave me a "sample" of red as well.  I really appreciated being treated like an important patron.  The patio atmosphere was relaxing, with comfy patio furniture right by the bar where we could sit down and talk.  Overall, I was really impressed!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went here with a friend today for brunch. After seeing that it was so highly thought of by the Yelp community, I was really looking forward to it. It was good, but I came out a little underwhelmed. I had the omelet of the day, which was ham and tomato, and it was ok.The food seemed reasonably priced and the service was really good, but the place wasn't particularly memorable. Perhaps i'll give it another shot sometime and try something else.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City rocks! I mean, the food is consistently good and though simple and comforting, is also so varied that everyone I take there can find something they like. It's also a cool place to just hang at the bar and partake of their yummy speciality drinks (or just wine, beer, or other stuff), and stuff your face with their homemade chips with blue-cheese sauce. People are generally in a good mood, and the service is rarely lacking. Mix all of this with a trendy, retro atmosphere, and really- it's a generally good time that can be had.Their portions are huge; thus, their prices (which aren't astonomical to begin with) are really fair. My faves are their blue cheese potato chips, tamarind wings, chicken milanese salad, black and blue salmon salad, pecan crusted pork chops, the Thursday blue plate special roast, chocolate peanut butter pie, banana bread pudding, and pretty much the rest of their menu if I feel so inclinedMonday nights they have had really good wine specials, and their happy hours offer discounts on their apps.If you're in the mood for a solid meal in an upbeat atmosphere, then Cap City's the place to be!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My expectations were immediately lowered when I found out this was a Cameron Mitchell restaurant. That being said, overall, it was ok. The pretzel with beer cheese was quite tasty. The complimentary buttered rolls are nice when warm, but not so much when they get cold. The pecan crusted pork chops were fine, nothing spectacular though. The Southern fried chicken arrived as two thin, boneless, pounded, fried chicken cutlets. We were so perplexed. How was this fried chicken? What was Southern about it? If this is how they're going to make it, chicken fried chicken would be a more appropriate name. At least include a better description on the menu. The chocolate cake was a large slice, as it should be given it's priced at $8. It was good -- nice and chocolatey.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City has a fun diner atmosphere and always seems to be packed, so there is a bit of energy in the air.  The menu features a variety of food, ranging from salads and sandwiches/burgers to home-style entrees with fun twists, as well as daily blue plate specials.On my most recent visit, there was a group of 6 of us.  We had a reservation and found ourselves seated promptly.  The server was helpful, attentive and upbeat, despite the number of people and tables on her hands.  All food was enjoyed - sampled were: the All-American Cheeseburger, the special Lobster & Shrimp Macaroni & Cheese, the Southern Fried Chicken, and the Romano Crusted Chicken.  The presentation was really nice, and the portions generous.  The sandwiches and burgers were large and filling, and came with choice of side ranging from the usual fries to a wild rice salad.  The mac & cheese special came in its hot skillet, still sizzling, on the plate with a side of mixed veggies including carrots and brussel sprouts.  Both chicken dishes looked fantastic, and came loaded with a generous serving of chicken.  The fried chicken arrived atop mashed potatoes and gravy, served with skillet beans, while the Romano crusted chicken was served over pasta.The gluten free menu had plenty of selections, and includes a beer offering, Red Bridge.  I opted to try the Cheddar Chicken BLT, as I was extremely interested in having an excuse to try the locally made gluten free buns Cap City offers.  The bread had a nice flavor and held up pretty well considering the chicken juices and BBQ mayo at work.  There are several sides to choose from, but I went basic with some fruit which came in a nice mix of melon, pineapple, grapes, etc.  Quite satisfying.Cap City is a solid place to get some good diner-style food with a twist and a great gluten-free menu.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Had dinner with friends before a concert in the Arena district last night (as did many other diners!).  Should have made a reservation, but only waited about 5 minutes without one at 6pm, so not too bad.Happy hours goes until 6:30 so we were able to take advantage of Happy Hour pricing on a drink at the bar while we waited on our table. We were a little disappointed that happy hour pricing was only available in the bar area, not the entire restaurant.  The bar is on the smaller side, so it would be difficult for a group to head over after work and take advantage of the happy hour deals.Once we were seated, our waiter brought over waters and introduced himself.  We already had drinks from the bar.  After some discussion and a bit of a wait for our waiter to return we ordered, service was a little on the slow side we thought, for that time of night.  For appetizers we ordered the calamari and the warm pretzel. I did not try the calamari, but the others at the table must have really enjoyed it as there was none left.  The pretzel was delicious. Warm and soft, lots of salt. The mustard dip was spicy in all the right ways and the beer cheese dip was excellent, smooth and creamy.For dinner we each ordered something different, with varying degrees of satisfaction.  The grilled cheese sandwich was a big surprise for us. A generous triple decker, fresh bread, with a perfectly cooked fried egg. I tried a bite and was surprised at the flavor in that simple dish. The sandwich was accompanied by the jalapeno slaw which was excellent, but I wouldn't have minded a bit more jalapeno kick to it.  The All American Burger absolutely lived up to its name. Nothing fancy here, which was perfect.  A quality bun that held the whole thing together was much appreciated. Nice size beef patty, cooked to perfection at medium rare (one of the few places that will cook a burger to order) and all toppings were fresh and plentiful.  The burger came with fries and those were a bit of a disappointment.  With the quality of everything else, I was hoping for something a bit more memorable.  The pork chop came highly recommended and lived up to the hype.  Large cut of meat, beautifully prepared, very very tasty. The cheddar potatoes served with it were perfect.  The only dish we did not enjoy was the fried chicken which made all of us sad as that is the dish everyone was looking forward to.  First problem for us was that it was not whole pieces of chicken, it was two chicken breast fillets, pounded thin and breaded. The breading was a little heavy, the chicken was dry. The accompanying mashed potatoes and  gravy were quite delicious.  We had no room at all for dessert, but saw some great looking items go by.  We have dines here before and we will be back. Cap City is a solid Columbus staple,. definitely worth your time.  One thing to note, for those with handicap accessible needs, the parking lot is quite limited with handicap parking, but once inside, the wait staff is very accommodating.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I went with a group of girl friends and was so looking forward to our visit b/c I hadn't been to cap city in ages.I got the sea bass, garlic mashed potatoes and sautÌ©ed spinach and cherry tomatoes.     The sides were wonderful and the sauce really tasty but the bass was over cooked and dry so that was a little disappointing.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This place was awesome! the food was great and the service was perfect. We started our meal with the house made potato chips that are topped with blue cheese and alfredo sauce and they were very tasty. My husband had the meatloaf which was well seasoned and served with house made mashed potatoes. I had the shrimp linguine, it was very creamy with perfectly cook vegetables. When you go here bring your appetite because the portions are huge including the desserts. We had the carrot cake for dessert and it's a good thing we decided to share it between us because it was so big we couldn't finish it. this place is not cheap but they don't skimp on the portions it was a great value for the money.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Pretty good, accessible restaurant from Cameron Mitchell's.  If I were looking for a safe choice to introduce out-of-towners to local fare, I would think about going here.  Most of the time I get a variation of their meatloaf, which tastes as good as mom's!  I've had some of their other items on the menu but they're nothing I would get overly excited for given what else is in the city.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Really enjoyed the food here and the price was outstanding.  The service was extreme professional and the wait staff came back by at exactly the right times to ask if we needed anything.  I didn't feel as if I was being hounded by our waiter while eating.  This is a must when visiting Columbus Ohio.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great service, excellent food, price is a bit more than I like to spend, but for great service and wonderful food, this is the place I am willing to spend!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Not only do I work at Cap City but I also love to dine here. For starters, the blue cheese chips are a must! Kettle chips, Alfredo, and blue cheese all put in the oven to create a tantalizing treat. Also, you can't go wrong with the pretzels and cheese. It's not your average appetizer as it comes with TWO HUGE pretzels paired with a beer cheese fondue and honey mustard. My favorite salad has to be the black and blue cheese salad which comes with blackened salmon on top or the BBQ chopped salad that includes yummy corn and cilantro ranch dressing. For sandwiches, I will always recommend the tender Reuben (pulled corned-beef?!) or the meatloaf melt and for a side dish the cottage cheese with applesauce topping. My favorite entrees are the spicy chicken rigatoni that is very rich with a little kick and the ponzu Salmon which I always finish.I'm absolutely in love with the salmon here in general because it is perfect every time. Any dessert will do as they are all huge and awesome but the banana bread pudding and milkshakes will always be on top. Service is great because out motto is 'The answer is always yes!'

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: When I go back to Columbus, this will be a stop I make.  A great concept, upscale diner food.  We walked in and it was packed to the gills.  I got our name in and it was going to be 30 minutes +.  That was fine we were in no hurry.  So we headed to the bar to get a drink.  And there it was, the red sea parted and 2 people finished their food and got up as we walked over.  My buddy grabbed a seat and I took our name off the list.  The craft cocktail and beer selection was fantastic.  Lots of local Columbus brew options.  I got the tilapia po boy with fries and a side of the blue cheese cole slaw.  It was perfect.  The menu was packed with lots of things I would like to go back and try.  No doubt, I will be back.  Great experience.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Highly recommend trying Cap City at least once. The pecan crusted pork chops are delicious, it's what I usually end up getting. Portions are huge so I get two meals out of it. Strawberry lemonade, both alcoholic and non-alcoholic, are a favorite of mine too. This is a good place to bring out of towners (my dad was very impressed). Prices are a little steep in my opinion but it doesn't stop me from going!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is a standard favorite of mine.  It can be busy on the weekends and typical dinner hours, so make a reservation.  I like sitting in the front booth part for lunch and the back booths at dinner.They have a nice bar if you have to wait for a table or want to grab a drink first.  Since it's a Cameron Mitchell you can get my favorite, PineFin and sprite.  They have a big glass container that is filled with slices of pineapple soaking in Finlandia vodka.  Then you get a chunk of the pineapple in your glass.  It's delicious.My standard meal is the Romano Crusted Chicken.  It is so good.  I've made it at home (you can get the recipe off their website), but it's always better when they make it.  If you start with a salad or want to save room for desert, bring half of it home.  It reheats well in a broiler/toaster.I sometimes mix it up with Spicy chicken Rigatoni, which is also really good.  Thumbs up on the super buttery rolls as well.A couple of years ago they tried to change their menu and add a bunch of meals for 8-12 year olds.  I don't think it went over well, and they changed the menu back.  Thank goodness!  I like some variety, but I love the old standards.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Always good food and atmosphere. Great food!  The Roasted Chicken Romano is fabulous-pork chops are out of this world! Meatloaf is fantastic!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I really like the food here, but the service if not good Also we had a confirmed reservation which seems to mean little because we had to wait 30 minutes after the reservation time to be seated. Then had poor service

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This was a birthday dinner for me and since I am done celebrating them after this year a trip for the famous carrot cake was in order.Always good satisfying food with great portions here. While they are never going to knock it out of the park in food originality service is always impeccable. Husband got the famous meatloaf and I a salad. Both promptly served. After a few seconds I realized the turkey on my smoked turkey salad was awol.  a quick head nod to our server Katie --many apologies and a few minutes later a brand new salad with mia turkey appeared. I had a white sangria that was delicious. Just enough bite, not too sweet. I believe this is seasonal but they may still have!And of course the gigantic piece of deliciousness in the form of carrot cake. yummy flavor, smooth icing and

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great experience. First time we ate at Cap City the waiter could tell so he coached us through the menu. We got apps and fish sandwiches. Everything was unbelievable. We mentioned to our waiter we were interested in the chocolate cake but were to full at the end of the meal. He gave us complimentary cake to take home...

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: One of the best pork chops I've had. Everything was great. Wife had the short ribs which were perfectly cooked and well seasoned.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I recently ate at Cap City while in town visiting my sister. We had a reservation on a Friday night and the place was packed! We sat outside for maybe 5 minutes because we were early, and were seated right on time.Our waiter was a little...odd. Nice guy, but odd. We put in our drink orders, and I ordered a regular coke. He came back with a rum and coke. My mom saw that as a good thing and kept the drink, and he said he would return with my coke. He didn't, so when our app came out, my mom reminded him.We went to put in an order of the pretzels and the waiter just kept walking past the table and said "I've taken care of that!". We all looked at each other, a little puzzled. I guess its a popular item and he just assumed? I don't know, but we hadn't ordered it yet. Regardless, they were SO GOOD. Thinking about them now makes my mouth water. Every place should have soft pretzel apps. I did not enjoy the cheese dip on the side, but I can be picky about both cheese and toppings. Everyone else liked it.I ordered a chicken ceaser salad, which wound up being really big. The dressing wasn't my favorite - it wasn't too fishy or anything, but it was lacking in flavor. But overall the salad was yummy. One friend got a pasta dish - I can't remember which - and loved it. Everyone at the table tried it and wanted one of their own. I believe my mom got the Harvest Salad - I remember it had cranberries - and she loved it. I can't remember what my sister got, but she also loved it. She goes there often.For dessert, the 4 of us decided to split a piece of chocolate cake. Just do it. JUST DO IT.Wish I could visit this place regularly. I will be heading to Columbus again next year for my sister's wedding and will DEFINITELY stop in again.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Always great service and food, expecially Sunday Brunch!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I go here for a variety of occasions from cheap lunch dates to business parties and romantic dinners.  The food is consistently good and the service is superb, as it always is at Cameron Mitchell restaurants.  My favorites are the Meatloaf and the Pork Chop probably like a lot of people have already mentioned.   I also like how some of their fish and veggie dishes have a slight Asian flavor to them.   The only thing I'm not a fan of is their desserts.  I don't understand what people are raving about because they are obnoxiously big and too sweet.  Other than the desserts, everything is delicious!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Are you kidding me... I have never... Ever... Had bad service or a bad meal here... Probably some of the best food in Columbus is served right here... If you haven't eaten here... Then you're missing out on one of Columbus's greatest landmarks...

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Despite living around the corner, I had never ventured to this Cap City before I went on a Monday. I had no idea what magic Mondays held.Monday specials: - Half off any bottle of wine. Prices range from $23-$58 at full price, mostly on the lower end.- Blue Plate Special: Chicken and Apple Meatloaf Melt with smoked gouda, bacon, red onion, spinach, pecan mayo on toasted buttermilk bread, served  with a mountain of redskin potato salad; more-than-you-can-possibly eat for $11.95.(Also, the chocolate peanut butter pie was boss.)So that means you and a friend can split a bottle of wine and each have the best damn sammich ever with leftovers for lunch for under $40.Who's free next Monday? :)

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The menu is huge! I love the Reuben here it is delicious! I also got the Bloody Mary which was not to shabby. I don't recommend sitting outside in the very back though there were a lot of flies in that particular area.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Local recommended this place while visiting, and my daughters and I were excited to give it a try. Nice atmosphere. We were there in between the lunch and dinner service, so it was not crowded at all. We ordered the Southern Fried chicken platter with mashed potatoes and green beans. Chicken was moist, and food came out quickly. However, our particular server ruined dinner. HE knocked over an entire glass of soda when he was putting our to-go desserts on the table. Accidents happen. No problem. I am still in a reasonably good mood. He immediately ran off and came back with towels. I stood up because my clothes were drenched. I foolishly assumed he was going to hand me a towel to attempt to dry myself off- especially since we were about to trek out into the snow. Nope. He used all of the towels to start cleaning the table. Shocked, I stood there a moment with my hands in the air- thinking he would notice that I needed something-anything- to dry off with. He just looked up from the table and said, "You're ok."Beyond rude. Truly horrible service. No apology. No help. Good food. Bad service. Avoid.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I generally have pretty high expectations for CM restaurants. Not because they have the best food or anything but they tend to be run well and consistent , generally not amazing but good places if you don't want to strike out on a meal. Especially true with a big group which can be a pain at some places. Cap city fits the CM framework of kinda trying to be everything to everyone. bar, diner, fine dining and casual comfort food. Nothing wrong with it nothing amazing, but it sometimes fills all those things surprisingly well.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Ate @ Cap City last night. Met a friend there...I had the balsamic chicken and sauteed spinach w mash potatoes. It was very good, except the thin pieces of chicken were overcooked. It's easy to when they are sliced that thinly. I'd keep them fatter so they end up juicier and not tough. We shared the banana bread pudding ala mode for dessert...very tasty. I totally forget what my friend ordered...we were having too much fun. It's always a fun, comfortable place to eat.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: It's a family affair!Whether it's for a post-college graduation lunch with the family, or a table for 6 friends for brunch...even 2 lovebirds, Cap City Grandview accommodates just about anyone with an appetite for creative dishes, but lacking deep pockets. For a light & sweet brunch, devour the complimentary cinnamon rolls & pair them with a very affordable mimosa.If you're looking for an award winner, don't leave without munching on the Maytag Bleu Cheese Potato Chips. Others have tried, but these are by far the best flavor combination of cheese & salty chips.But, my favorite entree has always been the Diner Meatloaf Melt with muenster cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion & mayo. Not at all like grandma's meatloaf, it's better when it's fresh & sandwiched. To top off this extravagantly affordable meal, I'm still a sucker for a Cap City Mohito.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: YUM YUM YUM!Kudos to you, Yelp, for helping me choose Cap City as my most recent "business" lunch with the one-and-only Christina C.A few reasons to note why I'm giving five stars:A. I wanted everything on the menuB. Perfect for "champagne taste on a beer budget"C. Quick, friendly service who happened to be my neighbor as a kid!D. Balsamic chicken that was TO DIE FOR (seriously, note my "About Me" profile section) and the best meal I've had in a long timeE. Great atmosphereI will be back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The entrees are a little pricey and not all that great but the sandwiches are reasonable and fantastic

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I'm actually pretty sad to give Cap City only 3 stars.  While we do end up going there on an occasional basis (mostly for the gluten-free menu and ease of Paleo or specialty ordering) I have to admit that when the main dish comes out....I'm oftentimes filled with a sense of, "Really? That's the best you can do?" To be fair, the dishes I get are different...but they should still be good!  The basics of a great meal are on the plate!!    I would hope that a Chicken BLT (no bun) would still be pretty tasty....but each time I find that the chicken breasts are thin, overcooked and dry.  They're exactly the kind of chicken breast I'm sure GFS delivers frozen, in bulk.   I always order it without the cheddar cheese, so clearly the chef is counting on THAT to mask the stringy, dry chicken.  Couple that with the veg of the day - which has clearly been sitting in butter (not much of a healthy option, eh?) and the meal leaves me wanting.  It'd be pretty easy to amend, though. Fresh chicken! Steamed veggies! Come on!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I always forget how much I enjoy Cap City and often forget to go.  I met my dad there the other day for lunch and had my typical Soup and Salad combo... I love the BBQ Chopped Salad... So many different things going on in that salad! Love the BBQ chicken and ranch dressing combo. I had a cup of Chili... The taste was great, however, it wasn't very hot. I have never been disappointed with a meal at Cap City... Great spot for lunch, brunch, dinner and take-out! Brunch on the patio is a must!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I'm assuming the food Is probably fine, but I haven't gotten the chance to try it yet because they haven't seated us... Even when we put in reservations an hour before our time was... We are still waiting nearly a half an hour after our reservation time. Seriously, we put in a reservation for a reason. Disappointed.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've never been to Cap City Diner, mainly because I drove past it once, and on it's sign it read "Milkshakes and Martinis" which sound disgusting together. I know they meant that they had milkshakes and they had martinis. Combined, it sounded like a really really terrible alcoholic drink.When I first walked in, I wasn't really sure what to expect. The crowd was a little older, and at first I felt under dressed although I'm not sure why. Maybe it is because I'm younger, and I get oddly conscious about these weird things. We had a brief wait even though we had a reservation. We were seated by the windows. Outside looked like a very nice patio that would be great for a summer evening. The light fixtures remind me of Saturn, and the decor mildly evoke a city scene without being "Oh look it's called Cap CITY and we have CITY things!" It didn't strike me as particularly classy nor particularly casual so neither too fancy nor super casual. I guess you could take it either way.Looking over the menu, I wasn't overly impressed. On the other hand, my dining companion is gluten free, and they have a gluten free menu, which is really awesome. The service was sort of odd. As a general rule with people and with servers, you shouldn't touch strangers. I've heard it several times, read it several times, and generally try to follow it as a server myself. Our server had a thing with touching our shoulders, which sort of weirded me out, just in general. This might just have been specific to our server. Also, when I received my coffee, the rim of the mug was encrusted with old dried up food, which was kind of gross. The coffee wasn't really impressive.My dining companion ordered the pork chops was very good, and I had the chili dog, which was fine. It wasn't very filling for my enormous appetite so we had dessert, which was fine. I don't generally have a huge taste for dessert anymore for some reason. I suppose I would try Cap City again, maybe a milk shake no martini, but I wouldn't have very high expectations.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The food is great even for the pickiest of eaters. The cheese steak sandwich was delicious and the fries were great even for someone that sees fries as a so-so side dish. The beer selection is lacking.The atmosphere is fairly noisy at lunch so it's a little difficult to have a serious business conversation. The wait for tables at lunch time is a pain.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went at the recommendation of the locals.  Went at lunch time, place was crowded, but we were seated immediately.  There were five of us, and we were seated in a middle booth, which was slightly crowded.  We ordered the blue cheese chips for an appetizer, which was good, and different.  For my entree, I had the meatloaf plate, which included mashed potatoes.  The gravy was a red gravy, which I don't normally care for, but otherwise, the meatloaf was very good.  Our server was very attentive, however, the entire service was a bit long, which resulted in us being late getting back to work.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Good happy hour in the bar.  Draft beer choice is horrible though.  The appetizers are pretty good.  We had the flat bread pizza.  I have had their "chips" but I don't like blue cheese so they made them with ranch which was yummy.  We will return.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The food at cap city is usually wonderful, and I'm especially fond of their meatloaf.  The portions are very large, and for the money you put down, you get a lot of food!  The only bad meal I've ever had there was a crab cake/shrimp special that tasted like it could have come out of the freezer at Long John Silver's.My only beef with the restaurant is that it's always slammed, and the parking lot is small.  Be prepared to wait for a table, and expect it to be very noisy, as the acoustics are not designed for quiet dining.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Dear Food Hounds... I do believe that I have found a treasure... a diamond in the rough!  How often do you get a mixture of an upscale Restaurant, Diner, Bar and Gastropub all wrapped up into one?  Well, Brimstone is here to let you know; at Cap City Fine Diner and Bar in Columbus, Ohio - you've hit the jackpot!  At first glance, the front of the restaurant is set up like a Diner... well, a FINE Diner - offering patrons a clear view of the kitchen.  The high ceilings and art deco style of the architecture throughout the rest of Cap City offered a unique, open and comfortable vibe in the form of a high-class restaurant.  The booths are almost as big as the meals themselves as they fit five Hounds with ease!  We started with few drinks from the bar that were out of this world!  The Cap City Sangria (RED of course) was sweet and exploding with fruity flavor; possibly the best Sangria I've ever had - smooth and terrific with no aftertaste.  The Asian Pear Cooler tasted like a non-alcoholic orange-aid, topped with a small slice of the exotic Asian Pear.  The Strawberry Lemonade with Stoli Strasberi vodka, Cointreau, strawberry puree & freshly squeezed lemon had a secret weapon - basil; a fresh and different taste.  The Pineapple Finlandia had more than just a hint of pineapple... in this particular drink, huge chunks of cold pineapple soaked up the vodka flavor for noshing on after the drink was gone!On to the starting line-up... Cap City has a plethora of different items on their menu that are unique and equally as delicious!  Also, ALL the dishes are generously proportioned; nobody goes hungry here.  We were given a basket of their homemade Buttered Rolls which were fresh, warm and soft. Maytag Blue Cheese Potato Chips are a 'Cap City original' - crunchy, lightly salted chips drowning in a delicious river of Alfredo sauce and fresh green scallions!  Who'd have thought that Alfredo and Bleu Cheese could work in such harmony?  Thumbs up - WIN!  We had the Maryland Crab Cake which was a hearty size; more of a fishy flavored crab cake - but not overwhelming.  The slight spice came from the chili flake as the creamy basil aioli evens out the overall flavor behavior of the broiled lump of crab cake.  All hail the Tamarind Glazed Chicken Wings... WIN!  The crispy wings are stacked high, juicy and delicious while offering a light spice and a blast of sweet goodness - not Teriyaki; but similar.So, my WIN... the Blue Plate Feature; Cola Braised Short Rib!  No knife needed fork tender beef short rib to die for.  The meat literally just falls off the bone and melts in your mouth... I fell in love after the first intense bite!  The sauce is BOSS (especially over the cheddar mashed potatoes) and tasted like a blend of Cola, Dr. Pepper and grrrravvy to create a concoction that would please the masses.  The Balsamic Chicken had a beautiful presentation; a visual masterpiece with epic flavor behavior!  The breasts of chicken were SO soft and easy to cut with a tangy twist in every bite.  The buttermilk-chive potatoes were smooth, creamy and smothered with onion strings!  Talk about BIG... the Cap City Diner Meatloaf was off the proverbial hook with a little taste of home.  A thick slice of meaty awesomeness drizzled with an INCREDIBLE BBQ gravy that was paired with delish chili onion rings!!!  Next, crispy Romano Crusted Chicken with moist garlic buttered noodles drowning in a roasted tomato cream sauce.  The Romano cheese encrusted chicken patties were thin and unbelievably flavorful, crunchy and tasty.  The Southern Fried Chicken sported a perfectly deep fried, crunchy, battered breast of poultry that was juicy, tender and moist in the middle.  Also, the sweet fresh veggies were brightly colored and uber-good!  I LOVED the NY Strip Steak with cheddar-chipotle mashed potatoes and chili steak sauce.  Hint - dip the 'tatoes in that sauce... YUM!  The sauce is BOSS; sweet and tangy - utterly delicious.  Lastly, the Knife and Fork Chili Dog turned out to be a big, bad and killer concoction of yummy goodness... a Cap City tradition; this sliced hot dog is stuffed with shredded beef and/or pork, and then drizzled with cheddar, red onions and bright green scallions!  WIN!Everything on their dessert menu is housemade & GINORMOUS!  The Seriously Big Chocolate Cake; a 3-layer chocolate cake that was twice the size of my head!  SO scrumptious I could hardly contain myself!  The Cap City Diner Pie of the day was a kickin' Pumpkin Cheesecake that was smooth and creamy.  The Warm Banana Bread Pudding came in a goblet-sized bowl and was filled to the rim with caramelized banana, candied pecans, fresh whipped cream and a beautiful bourbon sauce that we just couldn't get enough of.  To top it all off... the 24K Carrot Cake - hands down WIN!  This thick and rich flavored carrot cake was sweet and moist; probably in the top three best I've had in Food Hound history.  They deserve a round of applause for this winner. VERY recommended.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I went here with a group of friends a few weeks ago hearing really good things about their food. It wasn't worth it at all.None of the food sounded appetizing and what I got (I will admit it was only fish and chips) wasn't worth the extra price. The appetizers we ordered weren't that great and neither was the dessert. The atmosphere was nice but the food isn't anything special. You'd be a lot better off going to a real diner.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: If I have friends in from out of town I always take them to Cap City to let them know that Columbus does it right.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City earns four stars from me for one main reason, the strawberry basil lemonade. I don't usually rate restaurants based on beverages... but this was pretty amazing. It doesn't taste like any of your processed stuff, it's real, sour, sweet, delicious lemonade. If you're into that, this is your place.I ordered the meat loaf because of recommendations from yelp and the waitress. They told me it was their signature dish. It was pretty good. The mashed potatoes on top were delicious and the meat loaf itself was good and moist.I would say the meat loaf earned 3.5 stars...but the lemonade pushed me over the top. Service was good. Too bad I was too full for dessert.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We had a really nice dinner here tonight!! I was excited to finally get to eat at Cap City - last time we tried, I believe it was a Friday and there was a 45 min wait to be seated, so we bailed. Tonight it was busy and bustling, but we were seated right away. As it turned out, our waitress was a friend of the boy's, and so our treatment was stellar (not that it wouldn't be anyway, but it was nice to have a friendly and familiar face). We ordered the mussels, even though I am slightly scared of Midwest seafood - and I was pleasantly surprised! They were actually quite delicious. What was really nice was the amt. of time we were given to mull over the dinner menu, giggle and chat, and chomp on some well-seasoned and not overcooked (two things I worry about in Ohio) mussels. When we finally ordered dinner, we were relaxed and happy, and decided to share the meatloaf... because, not gonna lie, we watched some elderly lady, bless her heart, consume said entree and decided we wouldn't be able to finish it alone. It is ginormous. Even more adorably, it was brought to us split in half, on two seperate plates - a thoughtful touch that not all restaurants will do. And it was very delicious! The gravy in particular sticks out as nom-rific. YUMMM. Oh and we took some to-go chocolate cake with us to O'Reilly's to share with our friends, who all loved it (it is also HUGE and DELICIOUS)! Overall, a lovely experience - excellent food, service, and company. What a good night. I'll definitely go back to try the chicken pot pie once Lent is over (Jesus told me, no bread!) :D

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: One of my all time favorite restaurants. They have amazing food and excellent service. They are more of an upscale restaurant but they will fix you just about anything you order. My favorite meal here is the Maytag Blue Cheese Potato Chips for an appetizer, the Shrimp Wrap with green beans as a meal, Creme Brulee as desert accompanied by their amazing mojitos. Delish!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City fills a nice niche, a casual spot serving good food without being a bar spot.  It a bit expensive if you're thinking Denny's, but the food probably warrants it.  Typically pretty busy and bustling inside.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: So yeah ....Good food .... BUT Sometimes....Ive had...sadly .....poor service at times .....and ....I think ..... there could be more choices on the menu ... Kind of boring at times ...they need to add more ...or update it .....3 Meooows

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Everyone was very nice when we came in. The atmosphere was super fun, albeit a little overwhelming. The food was really good, very rich. The lemonades were seriously good, homemade and very flavorful. I got a burger and it was very good. The apple pie dessert was also very good, filled with apples and topped with ice cream. I definitely plan on going back!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Oh how I miss the meatloaf and buttery buns!  The service, food, atmosphere, is always great.  I love their house salad dressing - so light yet never a too-dry salad.  Try the pineapple dream cocktail if it's available.  Also, always make a reservation! Thanks yelp.com for help with that.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Absolutely yes times a million to this place. Cap City is perfect to celebrate special occasions like birthdays, graduations, etc. with a large group. The prices are reasonable. My favorite menu item is the meat loaf with mashed potatoes and Texas toast. You really can't go wrong here. The decor is stream lined yet still cozy. The wait staff are professional and quick. Make sure to get reservations because this place is usually quite crowded.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City used to be a staple for me. I'd take my family there when they were in town and we'd always really enjoy what we ordered.However, the last couple times I've been there both the quality of the ingredients as well as the portion sizes have both gone down. Cap City is far from being horrible, but it pains me to have to put it in the category of "Columbus institutions that have lost their edge due to their use of cheaper ingredients and becoming too big of a franchise for their own good". (Try putting THAT on a T-shirt.) One of the best examples I can give would be the Maytag Blue Cheese Potato Chips: They used to taste like fresh potatoes had been sliced and deep fried, and the blue cheese was of fairly high quality. Now they taste like they're frying frozen potatoes in oil that's been sitting around all day, and the quality of the blue cheese seems much less desirable and cheap. There are a couple dishes that haven't changed much. One of them would be the "Knife-and-Fork" Chili Dog. It was never a spectacular dish by any means, but the spicy dog/sausage always hits the spot whenever I order it. If the restaurant was the way it used to be about 7 or 8 years ago, I'd be happy to give it a higher rating.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: They take the "50's diner" concept and try to make an "upper-scaled" restaurant out of it. Still casual, though. No need to wear your church clothes, come as you are. Food is good and although the prices are on the "high end of affordable", they are suitable for what you get on your plate. Overall, we had a good experience there and may return again next time we're in town.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City fine diner takes its inspiration from the classic 50's soda pop diners of yore and twists it with modern flare. Cameron Mitchell brings comfort food to a whole new level from his blue cheese and Alfredo sauce topped potato chips to his version of the classic molten chocolate cake. Even though the prices can lean towards the fine dining end of the spectrum, he kicks the small gourmet portions out the window. The portions are large and once you hit the point where you think you cant eat any more, you find your self ordering desert. For residents and visitors of Columbus alike, Cap City fine diner and bar is a must for any one with more than an abstemious appetite.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Came here with a large group and was pretty impressed with the food the first time around, but then when I took my out of town friend and her parents here, I found the food and service to be subpar. It wasn't even a busy day. I ordered the same thing I had (Thai steak salad) and while the first time it was delicious, the second time my steak was quite burnt and tasted like charcoal. Unpleasant to say the least! I wish Cap City were more consistent because it has a lot of potential to be a good restaurant for large groups and strays from the common chain restaurants.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: It's been a while since I've been here.  And it didn't disappoint, just like I remember.  This is a diner, spruced up Cameron Mitchell-style.  Great service.  Great food.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This was my first time dining at Cap City.  Ive heard fantastic things so I was please to finally be getting to give it a try.We had a reservation but arrived early to have a drink at the bar-the bartenders were attentive and friendly.  We both had a Bulleit Rye manhattan, something we order regularly, and i must say at $11 a piece it seemed sssslightly over priced considering there was nothing amazing about it. Not as good as some manhattans we've had other places. but hey, no big deal.Our server was ADORABLE and very good at her job. The poor girl probably thought I had a crush on her because I think I told her 12 times how freakin cute she was.We had the Calamari to start and I will say-I wasnt overly impressed.  It was tossed in a sauce, and I would have much rather had the sauce on the side. Im weird about sauce.  Beyond that, an average plate of Calamari.For our main dishes we got the meatloaf and the philly cheesesteak sandwich.  The meatloaf was OUTSTANDING!! Im sure those mashed potatoes had more butter and salt in them than I'd like to know-but my heavens who cares. they were SO good.  The philly was dubbed by the fiance "possibly the best one in the city," and I must say I enjoyed it very much as well.  I also had 2 glasses of wine and the man had 2 beers and we were very pleased to get a bill under $65.They also have an "open kitchen" with seating where you can watch all the magic happen.  Next visit im going to grab one of those spots and try something else!  All in all a great experience and we will be back!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: As a soon to be senior at OSU, I'm trying to hit up as many Columbus favorites as possible before I graduate. The other night, we decided to go to Cap City. Walking in, you're greeted by a huge gumball machine (which is purely decorative to our dismay). The decor here is a-ok. It feels like a diner, mixed with your typical slightly upscale chain restaurant. Once you're seated, an average sized menu awaits you. You can get appetizers, salads, sandwiches, or large plates. I ended up getting the meatloaf sandwich and it was QUITE good. Very sweet meatloaf, on great bread with cheese...how can you go wrong? My friends got the Balsamic Chicken (great) and the Fish and Chips. Although I didn't try them, my friend noted that the mashed potatoes weren't all that great.We ended up trying desert too. Our Peanut Butter Chocolate Pie was excellent. It's definitely big enough to share, so I would recommend that any chocolate peanut butter fanatic like myself try it!Now the negatives. Our server was downright bizarre. He said maybe three words to us and was constantly creeping around our table. The only time I saw any emotion out of him was when my two companions ordered $8 mixed drinks. He also didn't tell us the specials, which we all agreed we probably would have gotten had he provided us with them.  Also, I felt like the entrees were slightly pricey for what they were. My sandwich felt like a good value, but my friend paid way too much for her Fish and Chips.Overall, I did enjoy Cap City Diner. If I could give it a 3.5 stars, I definitely would. But nonetheless, if you're looking for a typical American restaurant that's a step up from the likes of Champps, give Cap City a try.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The Place: Cap City is a fairly large restaurant. There are several different sections: a traditionally styled diner-type area with a counter near the front, and large dining rooms on the north and west sides of the building. There is also patio seating available in the warmer months. Aesthetically speaking, the interior is fun. It's got elements of the diner atmosphere, and elements of the fine dining atmosphere. It's comfortable and pleasing to the eye. The Food: I've been to Cap City twice, and both meals I've had have been very good. The only appetizer I've tried is the Maytag Blue Cheese Potato Chips. I was a bit dissapointed in them because the chips seemed straight out of the bag. I've had blue cheese chips at The Olde Mohawk and Bodega that tasted twice as good because the chips were (or appeared to be) fresh and homemade. In terms of entrees, I've had both the Jake's Famous Reuben and the Meatloaf Melt. The Meatloaf Melt came on rye bread with meunster cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and mayo. I wasn't crazy about the meatloaf, as it was a bit too sweet for my tastes. Overall, though ,the sandwich was pretty good. The reuben was probably the best I've ever had. It was piled very high with great-tasting corned beef, and complemented with delicious sauerkraut and dressing. The sandwich was huge, to boot. I ordered both sandwiches with fries, and they were good, but nothing to phone mom about. I have yet to try it, but it should be noted that they have a HUGE piece of chocolate cake on the dessert menu. (It's appropriately named the "Seriously Big Chocolate Cake") All of the desserts I've seen pass by have looked amazing, and I'm looking forward to trying a few in the near future. The Drinks: comments after next visit. The Service: The servers at Cap City are fantastic. They know their stuff, and are attentive to your needs. Your glasses are full, and they take care to make sure you are enjoying your meal. Two thumbs up!The Price: I like the prices on the sandwiches. By virtue of being huge and delicious, a $9 price tag is a-ok with me. I think the dinner plates are a bit overpriced, but for the service and the atmosphere, the over-pricing is admissible. Overall: Cap City provides a fun atmosphere, fantastic food options, great service, and fair prices. I had a hard time deciding between 4 and 5 stars, but I went with 4 because of my dissapointment with the Blue Chips, and the pricey dinner plates. If I could give Cap City a 4.5, I surely would. Highly recommended.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Best Happy Hour in town, period.  The bartenders are the friendliest and most knowlegable around.  Happy hour specials are fantastic.Bue chesse chips, mussels and flat bread specials are a must.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The Maytag Blue Cheese Potato Chips changed my life.  They have to be one of the most unhealthy things I have ever put in my body, but I love them.  This is my go-to place to bring out of town guests who want something low-key but still a "Columbus" restaurant.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is one of our favorite restaurants. We come often and are never disappointed.  The service is always awesome!   They have accommodated us beautifully in a variety of situations.  The food is excellent!  The 2 apple spinach salad is a favorite, as is the tomato soup.  The Romano crusted chicken is delicious as well.  We always start out with their famous maytag blue cheese chips and even though I don't like blue cheese, I love them!  And for the grand finale, the seriously big chocolate cake is the best cake ever!!  It is moist (especially if you ask them to warm it up! ) and is large enough for a good 4 people to share.  The icing is rich and delicious.  We love Cap City!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Came here for lunch about a week ago.  Service was standard, food was pretty good (had the knife and fork chili dog), and there was a decent beer selection on tap.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is a pretty nice place, although expensive for a "diner."  I had the "two apple" salad which was pretty good.  It came with a mustard vinegrette which I asked for more of it.  For my entree I had the meatloaf.  There was a LOT of it.  I didn't even finish it.  Probably could have skipped the salad.  The asparagus (which I requested instead of broccoli was either undercooked or the stems needed peeled, depending on how you looked at it.  All in all, not bad, but nothing to write home about.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great restaurant! Only had one "bad" experience but I've been there over ten times and was gauging it against all the other excellent meals I had in the past. My top recommendations are the pork chops and the Ramano Crusted Chicken. Also, the desserts are inexplicably gigantic!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Chips with Alfredo sauce and blue cheese crumbles are amazing!Fish and chips were really great, fries were a little soggy.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My fave is the meatloaf...i've never been a fan of meatloaf until I tried Cap City's! Very good!! I also love going there for brunch, the cinnamon rolls are yummy.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I was here once in late 2005 for Sunday lunch. Fancy place back then. Haven't been back since, but I remember a polite and friendly waiter, salmon cooked to perfection, and my dress shoes pinching my feet. I really liked it and wouldn't mind going back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've never been here for dinner.  This is more one of those places that you go to for lunch to get away from the office for a bit.  Its quick service means that you won't be missing too much work but its still a nice relaxing visit with some pretty good food.  I also like to come here when its someone's birthday because dessert for the birthday boy or girl is free.  That makes it nice to treat someone to lunch and still feel like your getting a treat in return.If possible, try to get a seat outside on the patio.  Its just nice to eat outside and not be inside where the open kitchen causes a bit of hustle and bustle.  The meatloaf is an especially favorite dish of mine and anything with chocolate on it in the dessert menu is worth trying.  I have heard that they have a wonderful brunch menu that I hope to be trying next.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: To begin; the rolls that are covered with fake butter....yuk is really all I can say. I ordered the reuben for my meal and I got the cole slaw to go with it. The slaw was ok, but nothing really special, but the corned beef was the best part. It was really tender, and if I could hijack the meat and place it on another rueben that I enjoy so much at another place out of town, then this sandwich would have been perfect for me. The bread is just eh, and if you like sour kraut as much as I then you will be sad upon tasting what I feel is just plain and tasteless cabbage. If/when I go back I might try an entree, but for a few more dollars I can go right over to high street and hit my favorite restaurant.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Second time at Cap City yesterday.  Service and atmosphere great again!  Cinnamon rolls are awesome, crab cake delicious.  Unfortunately I chose the Southern Fried chicken and it was beyond bland.  The green beans and potatoes were good though.  Will definitely try again.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Took the family to dinner last night 1) Service was great- Nicky was very attentive waitress 2) everyone loved their food, mother in law had their special,  liver and onions, she said it was very tender, I had the Thai steak salad- nice dressing, steak was fillet tips, they were a little chewy, was served cold, chicken wrap, philly cheese steak and Caesar chicken salad were all very good.  3) only complaint- minor, was the noise at our table was very loud from other conversations, could have been because we were sitting in the corner of the restaurant with walls and a low ceiling around us.  Would go back again and try a different table.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great dinner before our flight out of Columbus. Our waiter Derrick was awesome. Our food was fantastic!  Great food, even better dessert. Great service too! Check it out.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I love Cap City. I can never pass up the two apple spinach salad.  My favorite main dish is the pecan crusted pork chops. If you save enough room for dessert, there are some great options, but plan to share or take some home because they are huge.The service is consistently wonderful. That is pretty standard across Cameron Mitchell restaurants, and really does make them stand out.  I'm very tempted to give 5 stars, but I'm holding back because of the prices and because I have had a couple dishes here that missed the mark (the tilapia sandwich was a bit dry).

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Very very very good.  I have tried both the meatloaf and the Romano chicken on 2 separate occasions.  I was impressed.  The meatloaf is alot, it is their specialty and if your into meatloaf, I highly recommend it. However, I must say that that I enjoyed the Romano chicken better.  It's lightly breaded with a killer a la vodka sauce accompaniment.  I've had apps here, highly recommend the wings and the blue cheese alfredo chips.  The chips are decadent but delicious you have to share them.  The wings are very good as well and goes great with a beer.  If you go at happy hr the apps are half off.  Now for dessert...get the CARROT CAKE...amazing in all honesty and its so big you'll eat 1/3 and take the rest home.  If your a chocolate lover I hear the choc cake is very good its 3 layers like the carrot cake and stands a mile high.  The only other dessert that I tried was the cup o chocolate which is a warm lava shaped double choc cake in a large bowl that comes with vanilla bean ice cream.   Very very good and a smaller choice then the gigantic cakes.   I have not had a bad thing off of their menu.  Highly recommended restaurant; one of my favs in Columbus by far. They also have free wi-fi and great happy hr specials during the week.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: One of my favorite places to eat for a fancy dinner. The Romano Crusted Chicken is to die for. If it's warm, try to sit outside, because it's very pleasant.Let 'em know it's your birthday, and they'll usually bring out a complimentary piece of cake.If you do get cake, understand that you alone will not be able to finish it. So bring a friend.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: As I continue to experience "Yelp", I am utterly amazed at the educated people here who think that a Cameron Mitchell restaurant will be offering diner grub at a bargain price.  If you simply drive up to the place, and view the extensive patio area and the bar, I think you may be able to figure out that this is no "Nancy's", "Chef's House" (a Hilliard favorite) or the "Goody Boy".  I do not know of a diner with alcohol service either - unless it's a "pub"....In my opinion, you can get a great meal here that is imaginative, served with flair. it is a coffee shop turned finer diner with the front dining room resembling a dining car, while the back room is large and open with high ceilings and a very cozy fireplaceA quick run down on the pricing and the menu:Appetizers - Maytag Blue Cheese Potato Chips to Boiled Shrimp - priceed between $6 and 10.00.  Big portions - easy to share...Salads - cool, fresh ranging from side portions to entree sized, priced from $5.00 to 10.00 - Next ttime, why not share a side salad with your entree - no one says you have to have a whole one for yourself, especially if you have another big food plate coming?  I suggest teh 2 apple/spinach salad.Sandwiches - Burgers, Ruebens, Clubs (with salmon if you like), Turkey Burger, Meat Loaf Melt - priced between $6.00 and 10.00.Entrees - Romano Crusted Fried Chicken, Pecan Crusted Pork Chops, Ponzu Glazed Salmon,  Meatloaf - thick sliced, piled high with potatoes and vegetable - not your typical 80/20 hamburg here....Daily specials.  All entrees come with two AMPLE side dishes - if you don't like the sides listed, feel free to ask for a substitution.  Entree prices are $12.00 to 20.00.  To me - the portions are AMPLE - I eat half my entree and take the other half home for the next day - that usually doesn't happen at the other diners for me.  Fantastic sides - sticky rice, pasta cake, buttered noodles, various mashed potato blends with cheese and peppers, skillet green beans (steamed with pecans and red peppers), spinach saute with shallots and tomato - excellent, FRESH preparationsEven better - you can ask for the "Lunch" portion - half the entree  priced between 8.00 and 14.00.Deeserts - wow - huge portions once again - really "BIG" chocolate cake, carrot cake, apple pie with almond crust, cherry pie, ley lime tart, Bananas Foster, Bread Pudding..  Most are priced between $5.00 and 7.00.  I guess I don't take offense to the pricing for this eclectic food like others do.  In my opinion, their prices are not out of line with any casual dining chain restaurant you might flock to - and there is the opportunity to eat cheaper with a side salad and an appetizer, a sandwich, a shared entree, etc.  I find the alcohol pricing to be comparable with any other restaurant with a full bar - if that's too prohibitive - maybe drink before dinner?  I assume you must have some disposable income - because you are eating out.  Even the 5 star chicken finger place charges you $8.00 for a sooped up meal - and you likely feel hungry after eating it.As for your dress code - I wore jeans and a sweater tonight.  I saw jeans and tennis shoes,  If you go on Sunday morning for brunch - yes you will see some people dressed - likely because they are coming from Church.  I can say the same thing for First Watch or my local Bob Evans...The menu is creative - stretch your limits - order something fun instead of the entree salad - there are plenty of healthy offerings without having to resort to the salad like other posters.  Stop your whining, order something interesting, enjoy the excellent and accomodating service, and full bar if you've got the cash.  Great outside dining when the weather is nice!  Just enjoy the very reason you go out to dinner - great tasting food.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The blue cheese potato chips are sinfully good along with the Romano Crusted chicken.  The Roman chicken is a very large portion - so it is best to share to save for a meal the next day.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: By far my favorite all around restaurant in Columbus.  The food is moderately priced for the quality.  Larry, if he is still the head chef (he is!), is great at creating amazing comfort food of outstanding quality.  If you order a plate you likely won't spend over $17, and if you go the sandwich route, you'll be walking out under $10.  Cameron Mitchell isn't a self-made millionaire for nothing.   Unless you catch your server on a terrible night, you will probably get some of the best service you've ever had.  Cap City has the same standards as Cameron's or any of CMR's other locations, but with a slightly better price because it is, after all, a diner.  The Sunday brunch is the highlight of Cap City, in my opinion.  So many amazing omelet options, fantastic cinnamon rolls (instead of dinner rolls), great fresh fruit, specials, I could go on.  Each night has a blue plate special, as well as a nightly special.  Furthermore, I don't even like meatloaf, but Cap City has, and I absolutely mean this, the best meatloaf on the planet.  Yes, it is better than your mother's.  I'm sorry, it's true.They usually feature a few seasonal beers at the bar, nothing too fancy though.  Like all CMR joints, it has a drink menu, amazing desserts and a dessert drink list featuring coffee drinks and ports.  It is also great for large parties and kids.Oh, also, for summer months there is a great patio that features live jazz on Friday nights.I take all of my out-of-town friends here at least once.  They walk away full and happy.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This place has a diner feel and a nice casual atmosphere.  It's a little loud for me, but fun place to go nonetheless. The food is moderately priced and I can't say I've ever had a "bad" meal here, but I have not had a great one either.  The blue cheese chips are outstanding, and worth getting every time.  The meatloaf is also worth getting. The place is always full, but I have never waiting very long to be seated.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Alright, so obviously this is a Cameron Mitchell restaurant which means you should walk in with high expectations. You won't be let down here. Cap City will serve up all of your favorites that you have had prepared with the lowest quality ingredients and with a mind towards speed and price, except you will find that they use high quality ingredients and care to transform them into something more special! I have been here about 5 or 6 times and the only disappointment I've had is when they first opened, I had some grit in my salad. But altogether, they have great service, great food, and a great atmosphere!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I LOVE LOVE LOVE Cameron Mitchell restaurants and when I lived in Ohio this was one of my favorite restaurants. I don't think I've ever received bad service here and I have been here on quite a few outings! (birthdays, dates, luncheons, get togethers) I love that it isn't to pricey but an upscale diner. If you ever stop here and get dinner, lunch or breakfast I would suggest the Maytag Blue Cheese Potato Chips and Old Bay Peel and Eat Shrimp as appetizers. The chips seem like an odd combo but they are soooo delicious and the shrimp comes with this delicious sauce. If you are in the mood for a sweet salad get the two apple salad. Finally for the main coarse the meat loaf is out of this world!yum

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Awesome atmosphere and really good food. I hope my great brother will take me again.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
