column6: This place is as good as it gets.  Keep in mind it the word "diner" in its name...its an upscale diner, not an upscale restaurant.  I go twice a week and sit at the bar, the staff is very cool.  All of the daily specials are right on the money and the Reuben and meatloaf kick a%%.  I go after work, jeans, tshirt and ballcap while others are in suits and ties....the staff doesn't give it a second look.  Probably my favorite casual dining experience in the city.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I visit Cap City often for lunch meetings at work or dinners when we have people in town from other offices.As far as a fine diner concept the place delivers. As with all 'fine'dining you get what you pay for.I would not consider cap city fine dining but the quality ingredients are superior to what you would find at a traditional diner.The interior is fun and a bit kitschy. The menu is a crowd pleasure as well as the cheese covered chips as a group starter.I like small plates so I always USED to get the corn and chees risotto that was recently dropped from the menue with a side of vegetarian chili.There are not many vegetarian options but if you ask, like I do with the chili they will accomodate.Deserts are huge and delicious. I usually split the apple pie with a partner.Don't expect a greasy spoon at cap city or a check under $50 for two, but it is well worth it.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The dining experience Saturday afternoon was better than the previous. We went for lunch and two of us selected the Meatloaf melt, delicious.My mom had the meatloaf and loved it along with the crispy onions.Jon chose the Philly Beef and said it was not authentic but good for a gourmet diner sandwich.We all shared the chocolate cake, one slice was enough for four.The ambiance was better than before, we were sat by the fire.  But our server didn't smile until he asked us if we'd like dessert, not until we said yes did he make small talk.  I don't desire small talk, but don't engage when you're turning over the bill.  Will I be back, Yes.  I can't totally blame him it was during an OSU game.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: What makes Cap City Diner so great is how owner Cameron Mitchell gives you a high-end service experience in a super-casual setting.  It makes you feel like you're a great meal without the uncomfortable formality of an upscale restaurant.  You can feel the value for the dollar.Get the Romano Crusted Chicken.  It's pan-fried chicken breasts on spaghetti with a tomato sauce.  The sauce makes it great.  I don't know what they put in it, maybe a bit of cream?  It has this punch to it that's absolutely addicting.  The lunch portion is smaller than the dinner portion (two chicken breasts vs. three).  It makes top-shelf leftovers.The peel and eat shrimp are excellent appetizers, and the Long Island Iced Tea is the wife's drink of choice.  Either the deep dish apple pie (how do they do that?), or the seriously big chocolate cake are musts if you still have room (get 'em to go if you don't).

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Would I ever not give this place 5 stars? Is the Parmesan chicken one of the best dishes I have ever eaten? Does the chocolate covered peanut butter pie make this my favorite eatery in Columbus? Will I stop asking rhetorical questions that you probably already know the answer to ? No, Yes, YYEEEESSSsS, and not in this review.The only time I had a "bad experience" at this restaurant was when a waiter forgot to take our order and ended up waiting 20 minutes to place our order. The reason I put sarcastic quotes around bad experience is this only happened once and because the waiter gave us two free desserts in the restaurant and begged us to take something else home. 99 out of 100 times I get the Parmesan chicken and the other one time I got the meatloaf and 100 out of 100 times I am very satisfied. The chicken is fried and lays over buttered noodles and i think there is some type of creamy dressing in between the chicken and the fried layer. ( This is not a complaint). The meatloaf is a little heavy for my taste especially on top of a thick piece of bread and comes with broccoli (Really?) but when you want a solid meatloaf, pull into cap city and then tomorrow whilst running on a treadmill think to yourself it was worth it.To summarize,is this the best restaurant with the finest quality ingredients, probably not but I have gotten a great meal every time  and is perfect if you want slightly upscale dinner food.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Wow.  What happened to this place?  I hadn't been here for several years but I was back in Columbus to see my family and I thought it would make for a nice place to take my mom and sister for lunch.  The place was packed so i thought it had to still have the same quality of food that I had known several years ago.  I was wrong.  Everything was bland. Greasy and just not worth it.  I would put it on the same level of Cheesecake Factory.  All the sandwiches taste the same and they appear to be going for more "quantity" than "quality".  This place has fallen far.  I have no desire to return.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I love Cameron Mitchell restaurants across the board, but of all the concepts, this is my least favorite. It's not a reflection of the food or even the popularity with so many others, but it's just my personal opinion. A diner is an interesting American concept, yet I can't connect with the idea of an 'upscale', somewhat overpriced "diner". It's hard to leave Cap City with a $75 bill, feeling like you had a diner experience... but ahhh... remember the name is Cap City FINER DINER. That's the catch! The food is awesome and WELL worth the $75 bill, which we just had last night. I may not patronize Cap City as often as some folks, but I'd say once a quarter is enough to recognize I drop a pretty chunk of change every time I eat here. But I'm OK with it. Just be advised... it is not your greasy spoon diner. The booze, on the other hand is overpriced (especially, when I just want a casual dining experience), but Cap City's happy hour is another thing. Certain appetizers are on sale, as are a handful of drinks. Not the most generous discounts, but if you like the atmosphere, it's certainly worth a visit between 4 and 7. We just had dinner here last night and were seated in the "original" diner section (as opposed to the dining room), which we speculated could have been inspired by the original hotel diner previously located in the same area of this building. We also thought the 80's-ish music, which is not what one would expect to be playing at a "traditional" diner, was nostalgic enough to evoke a newer "diner ambiance". Interesting and updated idea. I like that Mitchell takes what could be an outdated concept and gives it a new and modern twist. My only complaint: The tableside service (including last night) wavers between mediocre and good, but I've always had great bartender service. Our server last night more or less tossed our food on the table and ran off, but everything came out piping hot and tasted great. I stand firm in my three star review based simply on the fact that I have had five star service at other Cameron Mitchell restaurants. I will continue to come to the Finer Diner when I am craving stick-to-the-ribs comfort food, spare no expense.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Had lunch here the other day and I really enjoyed it! I've wanted to come here for brunch for a while now but the menu looks so ordinary--boy was I wrong about the ordinary part. Yes, Cap City has an all-American menu, but they just do it better. Lunch hour was pretty busy and we were seated in the "3-season porch"--it was pleasant and quiet and warm too. My dining partner had the Philly cheese steak and it was huge. He couldn't fold the sandwich together so ate it open with a knife and fork--I have a feeling that all of their sandwiches will be like this. I had the salmon with rice and it was delicious. The sauce was sooo good and rich--I think there was a ton of butter in it, very un-Asian (as it was supposed to be Asian salmon), but it was so good that I don't care. I ate most of the rice in the restaurant and had only fish left so when they packed my box, they put extra rice in there for me! Now that's great service :) The bread came out after the main courses did but I didn't really mind--the bread was good but smothered in butter. The reason I give this location only four stars is because parking is a b****. They share a small front lot with Ohio Health offices and the back lot is precarious. I can't wait to try some of their more populat dishes next time.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is one of those places that is worth all the hype it receives. Cap City Diner is a perfect combination of classy ambiance and approachable food (tamarind glazed chicken wings, steamed mussels, their famous gourmet meatloaf).The prices, particularly at lunch, are very reasonable for the serving size and presentation. The atmosphere is great. You feel like you're eating at a much nicer (and more expensive) place than you really are. Crowds can get out of hand at the Grandview location. The Gahanna location is much easier to get into. Enjoy.Of all the Cameron Mitchell restaurants, this is my favorite.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City Fine Diner bills itself as a diner that's also upscale. Wait, what?That's not a very good concept to me. The whole reason for diners is to get bad food, hopefully fast, some bad coffee, hopefully often, and a touch of class from sitting in a greasy, cramped little dive where the locals are loud, the regulars are rude, and if you're lucky, a few truckers will offer to give you Bibles- it happened to me!None of that's going to happen at Cap City. It's all way too much. It's too dark to be a diner. The booths are too high backed. The music is too obvious. It's really nothing like a diner, even in passing- at least visually. The menu does have some sort of semblance to diner food- I guess I've seen a few diners serve meatloaf (eggs are fare more common, right?). It's just kind of nothing like a diner. The food- it's not bad. The meatloaf I had didn't strike me as anything all that more extravagant than any other meatloaf I've had. The onion rings were a nice touch, but - well, for a few less dollars it'd have been pretty awesome, actually. But the prices are far more north of diner fare than the actual fare offered.But at the end: a huge cup o' chocolate. I'm pretty sure that's fairly close to the real name on the menu. It was huge. It was o' chocolate. And it was delicious- I had to share it three ways, but we finished it. And I wanted more, although I knew it might kill me.Cap City, you confound me. You creeped me out the whole time I was there with your weird, gothic take on a diner. But I liked your food. Even loved dessert. Couldn't you make this easier on me?

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This is, by far, my favorite restaurant in Columbus.The lunch prices are amazing when you take into account the amount of food you get. The food is also fantastic. I don't think I've ever had anything I wouldn't eat every bite of if I had the stomach capacity. The meatloaf is of course incredibly note worthy. And I've always been impressed with their appetizers. The potato chips are wonderful, just enough blue cheese to give it a little bite. The wings are fab. I really love the sauce they use on them.I'm a huge fan of Cameron Mitchell restaurants. I wish I could find something like them in Boston. The service is always fast and friendly, the atmospheres are cute and always appropriate and the food is to die for. I love me some Cap City!!Oh, and if you need somewhere to listen to jazz, sit out on a porch and drink a beer, you've got it at Cap City. Their outdoor seating area is rather fantastic, especially if you get a wedge salad to nom on. Mmmmm.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Firstly, don't come here expecting diner prices.  My boyfriend and I once spent $70 here for two drinks, an appetizer, two entrees and a piece of pie.  Cap City is an "upscale" diner and is priced accordingly.I've had both the vegetable plate (which i do enjoy, since I tend to get bored with a big entree - the plate offers a few different things like pasta, veggies, and a spring roll) and the huevos quesadilla and while both were fine, neither was particularly impressive.  The brunch dish did provide a lot of food between the quesadilla, the included side of fruit, and the yummy rolls that are on every table.  Cap City's brunch has a good mix of breakfast food, sandwiches, and heartier entrees - sure to please any group.Service has always been very good here.  This was an excellent choice for my family when they were visiting - it's close to campus but not overrun with hungover undergrads, the service is good, the food is better than cafeteria food and in my experience you'll get a table faster than you would at Bob Evans.Overall, not my favorite restaurant in Columbus (or even my favorite Cameron Mitchell restaurant) but the brunch is probably the best of the restaurants close to campus.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I heart this place. It's awesome for parties big and small. The food comes in enormous portions so that you can always take the leftovers for lunch the next day. I can't say that I have had a bad meal here. The chicken parm is great; you get like 4 chicken cutlets! The chocolate cake is gimormous. I also love the Sunday brunch menu. They serve it with glazed cinnamon rolls that are gooey and to die for. The servers are super accommodating. My bridesmaids had planned a shower on the patio for me during GRADUATION week, so you know it was super busy. Well, it ended up raining so they moved our entire party inside without blinking an eye. (Sorry for everyone that had to wait because we took up the entire restaurant.) The servers were nice enough to split the checks for people with differnet meals and stuff. Super food, super service!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: This isn't your ordinary diner. The food here is high quality and comes in good portions. The meatloaf comes highly recommended but everything here tastes great! Their burgers are good as well.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: While visiting a friend in Columbus, she took me here for dinner after a long day of shopping. What better way to end a day of endless walking then with some good old comfort food? I ordered the Basil Lemonade for my beverage and it was very tasty, a different twist on the typical lemonde. For my entree I ordered the Romano Chicken which was your typical crusted chicken but very good nonetheless. For dessert I had the bread pudding which was excellent, I had to restrain myself from licking the dish. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the experience in general and our server was very attentive and honest regarding menu suggestions. I wouldn't rate this high on the "value for price" scale. Our bill was hovering right around $100 mark for three of us including tip and not one of us had cocktails! If your looking for comfort food and don't want to head to your local Bob Evan's, give it a go!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The food was just OK, and I'm not a huge fan of the Cameron Mitchell style of high-budget intentional contrived atmosphere. Not the authentic experience I look for when going out to dinner. The location doesn't help either, as it's located off the highway on the side of the road in a weird section of town.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We've eaten here 4 or 5 times, and never had a bad lunch at CCFD&B. I love diners, and I love that this place offers traditional American fare but with a bit of an upscale twist. Admittedly, I've only ever had the meatloaf (delicious!), but he's had the fish sandwich, the Romano crusted chicken, and the Reuben, and always been extremely satisfied. I recall the steamed mussels being really good too. Prices are definitely reasonable imo. Service has always been excellent - super attentive but not annoying.  One thing I like about the Cameron Mitchell restaurants is that the websites include recipes for many of their dishes. Kinda fun to try and recreate the stuff at home!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Usually I would give this place another star, but on this particular occassion we had the WORST server ever. I wish I would have gotten her name so I could warn everyone, but she was so off putting I didn't really care.Drink orders wrong, empty glasses at the table, not caring about us, etc... which would have given any other restuarant a much lower scale, but here despite the fact that we had some bitch serving us we had a good time amongst friends and the food was excellent. Keith dined on his usual Balsamic Chicken. He expects them to mess it up each time he gets it because it is such a great dish for him, but they never do. Todd ordered the Raviolli, which was something I was considering doing, and it is large cheese filled squares with huge meatballs. Matt had the Meatloaf sandwich- an open faced sandwich that is served with mashed potatoes on top. It is a mystery to me how he does it. I had the Oriental Salad, which was very good, but I suggest that you order the dressing on the side since they seem to drown the salad in it. A fact that I have learned that a lot of Columbus restaurants do.Atmosphere is nice, Causal dining. I am not sure why some family decided to bring their small children out at 10pm, but I am not Children Services so I can't really comment on poor parenting now can I! So, all in all, despite lack luster service we had a great meal, and a nice time.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: To be honest, being a Cameron Mitchell Restaurant, I had higher expectations. Food was okay. For the price, nothing spectacular. Definitely wasn't blown away. This place is always busy on the weekends, though, so maybe I'm way off base. Be sure to make reservations if you're going on a Friday night, the wait can be brutal! Love that you can reserve a table via Yelp. Made dining a lot easier!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I guess I had pretty high expectations for Cap City. You always hear such great things about Cameron Mitchell restaurants and I had never been here before. A couple of friends and I decided to come here one Sunday afternoon for lunch.It's located in a good spot - right on Olentangy River Rd so it's easy to spot. It's also kind of big and hard to miss.We went in and sort of felt out of place. This place was a bit fancier than we expected. I think the word "diner" in the title through us off. We were all hungover and wearing our clothes from the bar the night before. Yeah, it was one of those Sundays. To sum this experience up, I'll just say that we would have been better off going to our regular First Watch.But we were seated anyway. I guess we didn't look too bad. It was really pretty in there, but also very bright. One of the walls was all glass, and that allowed you to see right onto the patio where many people were seated outside enjoying the weather. I bet the patio is really great, it just wasn't for us that particular afternoon. The tables were covered in white table cloths and the napkins were cloth as well.Our server filled our glasses with water which we all drank very quickly. They were pretty good about refilling the waters. When I looked at the menu I was quite surprised with how expensive everything was. There was no way I was getting a meal under $10. I didn't want too much to eat, but I wasn't wanting to spend a fortune, either. Again, the diner thing fooled us. I wanted something light so I went for a salad. I got the BBQ Chopped Salad. My boyfriend got the mussels and one of my friends got the meatloaf. Apparently they are famous for their meatloaf, but I had never heard of it before.We were waiting quite a while for our food. They might have been pretty busy but it didn't look too bad. Of course, I couldn't see how many people were out on the patio. When our food finally came we were anxious to eat. My salad was pretty big, and it was good, but there was nothing about it that really stood out. It was sort of plain compared to other BBQ salads I've had (see BJ's or Surly Girl's! - the best!). It was about $12 for my salad. Most other places manage to keep the salads under $10. My boyfriend rather enjoyed his mussels and my friend devoured his meatloaf. This meatloaf looked ridiculous. It was in layers. There was a layer of mashed potatoes, a layer of onion rings and the meatloaf itself. It looked really good. Maybe I'll have to give it a try sometime.They had a pretty extensive menu and there were a lot of choices, I just don't think that I went with the right one. This salad seemed so unexciting compared to what most people got. The service was pretty good, but if you ever feel like checking this place out, maybe dress a bit nicer and prepare to spend a little more money than what you might normally spend at a diner! It really seems like they are going for a sort of casual elegance here.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Definitely recommend, especially if your gluten free!  Largest gluten free menu that I've ever seen!  Food is very good! Service is quick. Definitely going back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Gourmet meatloaf. They even have the billboards all over town to prove it. That should serve as a perfect indicator as to what this Grandview "diner" really is all about.The first time I ate here was before I had any idea who Cameron Mitchell was, but once a friend that worked there explained his MO and a few of his other more well known restaurants to, everything here made perfect sense. Basically, this is a yuppy white guy's take on the prototypical neighborhood diner of the good old days- the kind with a neon "Eat at Joe's" sign outside and a table full of lazy cops on the inside. It reminded me a lot of a place Bruce Wayne would meet Commissioner Gordon in "Batman: The Animated Series" before he mysteriously disappeared in to the night to fight crime. Subtle, this place is not. A willful suspension of disbelief is definitely a prerequisite to enjoying your dinner here.As for the food, the menu is a charming mix of gourmet classics (like that Meatloaf) as well as other Cameron Mitchell twists on American cuisine. Expected favorites like grilled cheese sandwiches, BLTs, and pork chops get modern updates for the Volvo-NPR set, and they sit quite nicely amongst more inventive dishes like the Blackened Tilapia Po' Boy and the Blue Cheese Kobe Burger. With the latter being the exception, most of these dishes are under $10- not bad at all!Once you get in to the "Famous Large Plates" section, however, things take a sharp turn in the pricey direction. That meatloaf plate I keep talking about will run you $15.95, and although it comes with some of the best onion rings you'll ever get to taste this side of the Mississippi, I still have a hard time believing anyone would spend almost 16 bucks on a piece of meatloaf. Herein lies the essence of Cap City Diner, and Cameron Mitchell's entire chain of restaurants for that matter- the prices are needlessly dressed up to give you the impression that your dining experience truly is "upscale". This is Grandview, after all- you don't need to tack a few extra dollars on to every dish in order to keep out the riff raff. If the food wasn't as good as it is, I'd refuse to eat here on principle. Luckily, there's plenty of great sandwiches that you won't find anywhere else that are sure to keep you coming back whenever you run out of better ideas for dinner. The word "diner" might be something of a misnomer, however. Besides the subtle aesthetics and the obvious neon lines on the exterior, Cap City has precious little in common with places like Tee Jaye's or Denny's. That's definitely a good thing, though.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is another one of Cameron Mitchell's creations. Its upscale for a diner, but casual clothes are just fine here. You'll find many comfort foods made with quality ingrediants. There is a mix of diner style booths, contemporary tables, a bar area, and even a handful of barstools facing the kitchen to choose from when you are seated.The signature plate here is the Cap City meatloaf. It is famous around the city and even referred to on the menu's of other restaurants where they claim to have meatloaf, "cap city style."The meatloaf is primarily made of veal, pork, beef, and shittake mushrooms. Served open face as a 1 inch thick slice on a slice of bread. On top of that comes a scoop of buttermilk chive mashed potatoes. It is covered with their own homemade bbq sauce. The top is sprinkled with some fried onion straws. Broccoli comes on the side. This is must try item makes Cap City worthy of making a special effort to try. The BBQ sauce is absolutely delicious and my favorite component of the meal. The quality of service here is excellent. The staff here is top notch and quick to resolve any issue you might have. I'm a big fan for good service and I'll give them an extra star for this alone. My only compliant is the size of the desserts. They are enormous and if your not going to share one you will need a to-go box. After a meal, I like a nicely portioned dessert.. Most items on the menu are going to fill you up. Afterwards, there's no slight way to just satisfy your sweet tooth. Desserts here are just too much.Going above and beyond. If you find a menu item you enjoy, their website has a recipe section where you can find out exactly how to make it.TIP : Seek out the Grandview location over the Gahanna location. I think there is more character and diner feel at the Grandview place.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Very good food, but not a lot of vegetarian options.I've had good service and sub-par service, so like anywhere else, it just depends on the server.  Sometimes there's quite a wait, but the dining rooms don't feel incredibly crowded.In general, the style of the food (upscale diner) is not my thing, but it's good for what it is.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Went there for Mother's Day and it was pretty good.  We ordered the smothered chips for an appetizer, really good!  I had the chili dog which was good, nothing to go on and on about and my hubby had the meatloaf, which was excellent.  The only complaint I would have is the food was somewhat cold.  We received excellent service, and we will be back.  Almost forgot to mention the Cinnamon rolls, so good, best I've ever had, no joke.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I used to take dates here all the time. Place has decent food and respectable prices and service was always good. Don't go as often these days but will be visiting as soon as patio season hits.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Not bad but wasn't amazing.  Started with the Maytag blue cheese potato chips, which initially were awesome but went downhill pretty quick.  It became kind of like eating blue cheese with salt.  I had the meatloaf and my fiancee had the crab cakes -- good portions and well-made, but nothing special and on the pricier side.  Also had the huge chocolate cake for dessert, which was a little dry and unremarkable other than the large size.  Service was great.  In the end, a decent meal but don't know if I'd go back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: While I have no problem with Cameron Mitchell restaurants, they are usually not first on my list of places to go out to eat. I don't know what the stigma is - or maybe it's just that they never cross my mind. At any rate -Cap City is a "fine" diner, meaning its comfort food, but at a premium. While we didn't spend as much as some others have commented on their reviews, it isn't a place to go when you're trying to eat diner food for cheap (that's what the dube is for, people!)We had about a 20 minute wait, but for a saturday night that was understandable. In addition to the excellent rolls (i love bread, i will slay any bread basket in front of me), I had the lobster bisque (very rich, very tasty on a cold night) and the salmon salad. the salmon was cooked well although the portion was small, but the salad itself was very good. I also had the Great Lakes Nosferatu on tap.Our server was extremely friendly and funny, and while she was very busy, her banter gave us a few laughs. When a server is obviously busy, I'm not one to get upset unless it's really a ridiculous situation, so the fact that we had to wait a little bit was no big deal. Overall, it was a good experience. Didn't blow my mind, but I'd go back for the rolls.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City Diner seems to be a bit confused to me.  Not really a diner at all, but with sort of a mod-diner feel and little to no diner food.  Cap City seems to be trying to to dress up basic American semi-classics such as the much-Yelped meatloaf.I cannot be the judge as to whether or not they hit the mark on the meatloaf, as I have not yet gotten over my childhood disdain of the dish and have never tried it.  I always fall for one the sandwiches, pork chops or occasional chicken dish.The front of the restaurant and hostess area looks an awful lot like a diner but that is where the similarities really stop.  As a Cameron Mitchell joint it is not cheap, making the price-point over standard diner fare.  The bar area is nice but the TV's are small, too small to really get any good sports watching done.OH, and the blue-cheese chips.  Yes please.  Love 'em but they cannot be good for you.  The old "Steve's afternoon delight" chips at Betty's are the only ones better.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We went to Cap City for dinner and had the Blue Plate special...  It was FANTASTIC!!!  The Cola Braised Short Rib was so much better than I could have imagined.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: One of the best places to eat in all of Columbus! I haven't been to this place since I've been back home in a year. Still I had to write about it, this is easily one of the best places to get a decent meal in all of Columbus. The Cap City Diner near campus tends to be a little more crowded than the one in Gahanna, still both places of a great atmosphere and definitely good grub. The meatloaf and buttermilk mashed potatoes can't be beat and finish it off with the 24k carrot cake..OMG!! I miss that cake.Cameron has a bunch of great restaurants in the area but this was one of his first and I'd have to say personally speaking best ideas of all the restaurants. Simple concept, good service and great food.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've been here two times now, and I can foresee going more in the future. The first time I went, it was with my boyfriend and his parents. Their lemonade and raspberry tea were both delicious. I was trying to be health conscious and got a greek salad, which was okay, but I instantly regretted it once I saw everyone else's food come out. My mother in law got the meatloaf... it was great. The mashed potatoes were some of the best I've ever tasted. (they have two types there, butter and chive, and chipotle cheddar, and both are great)As other reviews have said, for the prices, the portions are nothing spectacular, but it's the quality and service you're really paying for. I can tell they make their food fresh everyday and nothing comes from a bag. The service we've gotten both times were wonderful, both servers had personality and paid very special attention to our needs. The second time I went was with my boyfriend on a date. I got the steak this time and it was well seasoned and perfectly cooked. My mashed potatoes were perfect and garlicky and my green beans were hot and crunchy. My boyfriend got the Reuben, and I've never been a fan of reubens but if i had to eat one, it would definitely be from here. The meat was chunky and tender and the sauerkraut was actually sour and crunchy.Their soups there are also pretty amazing. Too bad they only have one soup per day (which I can understand since it is made from scratch everyday), or I would order multiple soups everytime I go! I've only tasted the Buffalo Chicken (which is spicy, I love it!), and the Southwestern Chili (with tender chunks of beef), but I'm looking forward to tasting more of their soups in the future. As for desserts, definitely try their huge chocolate cake sometime- it's enough to feed 4 people, but you can always take some home! The cup o' chocolate was good at first, but as you get deeper into the cup, it gets less chocolatey. All in all, I'm looking forward to future trips. The food is fresh and delicious. The prices are good for the quality and service that you get.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The concept here - upscale American greasy spoon food - is not especially interesting or original.  This does not prevent Cap City from being a very good restaurant, and one I really enjoy.  The service is excellent, the food consistently pleasing.  I have found it a great place to enjoy a meal with parents and grandparents, as their uncomplicated menu has something for everyone and delivers value for your dollar.  My favorite entree is probably the Romano-crusted chicken.  The meatloaf is a lot like my mother's: delicious, but not exactly difficult to make.  My grandfather says you can't go wrong with prime rib (which I believe they have every Saturday) and Cap City's made him a happy man.  I got prime rib hash as a blue plate special there one Saturday morning: strips of prime rib, shredded potatoes, and two eggs all fried in a skillet that was upended on my plate.  It was as good as it sounds. The desserts are deservingly praised, while the bar is too often overlooked.  They use fresh juice.  There aren't enough bars in Columbus that do.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is a Cameron Mitchell take on American diner fare.  While you can get some of your old favourites, most of the menu features items that would be expected to be found anywhere but a diner.  There is a small area at the front that has been made to look like an old diner with the white tiles and formica tables.To your right, as you step in, is the bar area but it is small.  Don't expect to find a seat here easily on the weekends or game days.  They take reservations but I've never had a problem with getting a table within a few minutes.The fish and chips are always good and no matter what you order, the portions are large.  Salads, and the rest of the food for that matter, are always fresh.  The meat loaf is also a must try dish.  The bread that comes out at the beginning is piping hot and always delicious.  Apart from the main dining area, there is a patio out back that features a bar area and some lounge seats.  This area is perfect in the Spring, Summer or Autumn and there is occasionally live music, depending on the night.  Food is priced well, as are the drinks.  Parking is relatively easy to find as there is a lot out back.  On weekends, parking can be a hassle but I've never had to wait long to get a spot.  Not far from downtown, campus or Grandview, you always get a wide range of people through the door from the young to the old.  Good place to go when the parents are in town to visit OSU.  Also a good place for a relatively inexpensive date or dinner with friends.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I've been to this place many times mainly because I had some friends that work there or used to work there. I wanted to love it because the menu looks solid and I like the atmosphere, but I could never get past how pricey it is compared to how average the food is. The meatloaf has been my go to dish because I know what I will be getting, but I was severly disappointed with the salmon BLT, which came to me with soggy bread on top and bottom. The drinks are also quite pricey and the bar service was bad considering there were only 5 or 6 people sitting at the bar. I will give it A-OK because I have had good times there and I like the meatloaf, but I would hesitate to recommend it.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: One of Cameron Mitchell's earliest concepts, and still one of my favorites.  Cap City is basically slightly higher-end diner food, but all very well prepared & presented, with a great variety of options.The Maytag Blue Cheese chips are excellent, and the Calamari appetizer (the same/very similar appears at other CM locations around town) is excellent.The classic favorites have already been mentioned - the Meatloaf (and it's cousin, the Meatloaf sandwich) are perennial favorites - though the sauce is different than what some might be used to, and can be a bit off-putting for folks expecting the standard ketchup or brown gravy.   Also see the Romano Crusted Chicken (with angel hair & a good version of vodka sauce).  Daily blue plates are available, and brunch options on Sundays... though I'd steer clear of the beef hash & eggs - it's strips of thinly sliced steak-style beef instead of the standard corned beef, and just comes across as too bland with the potato hash.Atmosphere-wise... well, it's a diner theme, though with a LOT more table seating than bar/counter seating.  Service is decent, but given the location, beware arrival times on weekdays, as lunch especially fills up VERY fast.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: delish, this place is great.  really high quality food.  Between mid and upper-mid when it comes to price, but totally delivers on whatever you order.  one of grandview's best

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My wife and I have eater here several times and the food gets better and better every time! The meatloaf is to die for and the Bleu Cheese Chips are great for an appetizer.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I liked the idea of an upscale diner, but once I ate at Cap City I realized that this concept just doesn't carry over well in reality. It's not that Cap City isn't a nice place. It's really beautifully designed with great lightening and interesting seating. But the addition of diner music and neon signs doesn't figure well into the equation.The food is the saving grace of Cap City. Our table started off with the Maytag Blue Cheese Potato Chips, and while the concept was good I think the Alfredo sauce made the appetizer too heavy. For dinner all I had to do was look at the giant neon sign on the wall the proclaimed "Cheese Steak". Their version of the Philly is piled high with shaved prime rib and topped with veggies and white cheddar cheese. This was one helluva sandwich, and this might sound strange but the mushrooms on this Philly were the freshest and best tasting mushrooms I've had in a long time.A friend ordered the Knife and Fork Chili Dog and while they were good he remarked that they were not worth the $7.25 for two dogs. My boyfriend ordered the meatloaf and devoured it in record time.Of course we had to try dessert and whenever I see Crme Brle on a menu I dive for it. "Topped with fresh berries" in this case meant strawberries and I was a little disappointed because I really craving some raspberries and blueberries. Somehow in our dining orgy we also ordered the Big Cup O' Chocolate. The warm chocolate lava cake and cold vanilla ice cream does not disappoint. I recommend this.So with all the great reviews on food, why am I giving this place only 3 stars? Service was slow, and I mean really slow. I felt under dressed as well, which adds to my confusion of "upscale diner". I just don't think this concept works.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Simple review:The food is delicious and well made.The seating is plentiful and the atmosphere is nice.The bar is large and well stocked.It's Cameron Mitchell, so it feels noisy and busy, but that can be fun.I've been here several times. Meat loaf is wonderful, as are the sandwiches.This is the best place near OSU for family visits. You get a good meal, and everyone has a good time. Recommended.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I wish that I lived close enough to be a regular. Food was awesome. Beverages were artistic and delicious. Staff was friendly, professional and fun.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Brunch 4-5 stars, dinner 3The blue cheese covered chips are amazing.  I don't even like blue cheese and I go there just for them.  They fry the chips just right too.  That's a great way to start a brunch, mix in some nicely done coffee, and follow it up with a wonderful entree (I'm partial to the desert-like French toast), and you're off to a good start on Sunday.  FYI, they don't open until 11am on Sunday (I've shown up early and was rather disappointed).Dinner is hit and miss, alternating between good (but certainly not great) to very good (but never remarkable).  I'd go back,  but I'm not sure I'd go out of my way to do so (unless I really want those blue cheese chips).

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: We were visiting in Columbus so I don't want to be snobbish about this place, but our food and dining experience was just okay. Had the prices been a tad bit lower, I think I would have been more pleased. The one good thing is that the portion sizes were huge so we were able to split an entree. We had the fish and chips ($14.95) and I had high expectations for the beer battered fish fillets. They were good, not excellent, but good. The fish wasn't cod, but it was another white fish (that I can't recall). The batter was okay, but I've had much better and more flavorful beer batter before. The tarter sauce was also okay, but I expected more flair and not something that tasted as mainstream. The blue cheese coleslaw was better than most coleslaws that I've tasted, but I didn't get any of the blue cheese flavor. Most appalling was the 2.50 tea, which is on the high end for regular lipton brews. The fries were also decent, but not fried properly so they were squishy instead of crisp. The fillets were also greasy and oily which I wish they would have been drained properly before serving. The restaurant was very nice to split our entree onto separate plates and we left pretty full but still had room for desert. Coming from the south, I was amused at the dining experience because it seemed so akin to home. The sweet rolls were traditional but I would have preferred them not to be slathered in butter. In short, I've had much better fish and chips for the same price, or even lower. Like I said, the meal wasn't terrible, but it wasn't anything to really write home about. For the entree costing 14.95, I expect more flavor or other interesting components (like better tarter sauce or a flavorful beer batter) to justify a $5.00 (in quality) meal. Personally I would much rather have small portions of something very flavorful instead of greasy large portions of "okay" food that one could gorge themselves on.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My husband and I met a friend for dinner last night and had an absolutely weird and totally uncomfortable experience with our server. Things seemed fined at first we were greeted (I was the last to arrive) and provided waters. Then it came time to order our meal. I attempted to order half of the Two Apple Spinach Salad and our server stopped my order right then and stated that they do not do a half portion of that salad. I said ok and moved on and ordered the rest of my meal without the salad. Then I asked if this was a new policy because I had just had half of that salad last week (it was actually just 4 days prior to this). He stated he had been there for 7 years and they had never done it in all that time. He stated they only do half orders of the entree salads. Was the server trying to bully me into allowing him to pad my bill? I was puzzled and starting to get angry and uncomfortable, it seemed like I was going to have a confrontation with the SERVER! Whaaaat?!!! Anyway the rest of the table ordered their meals. When it came time to remove the menu's the server stood in front of me and just looked at me until I HANDED my menu to him. That was the last straw, now I was definitely angry. We left. I advised the hostesses that we were leaving and we were leaving because our server was so rude. We went next door to The Fish Market and had AMAZING service and food. The lady who served us there was a breath of fresh air after our experience at Cap City.  It was the most bizarre restaurant experience I've ever had. Incredibly embarrassing. I've never had bad service EVER at a Cameron Mitchell restaurant until last night. I've been eating at his restaurants ever since Cameron's opened in Linworth.  I won't be back and I'm spreading the word. Sorry guys but gesh that guy does NOT belong around people.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My favorite of the Cameron Mitchell restaurants.  Cap City is a traditional diner with a slightly trendy and upscale twist.  It's a place you can dress up and go to, or just roll up in jeans and a sweater, and not feel out of place either time.  The patio is absolutely fantastic, especially in the spring and fall when the weather in Columbus is conducive to eating outside.The Maytag blue cheese chips are the number one reason I go to Cap City.  I've tried blue cheese chips at other restaurants and they do not even compare to Cap City's.  I think the reason they are the best at Cap City is that they come with alfredo sauce and have just a slight kick of blue cheese without being overwhelming.  The sandwiches and salads on the menu are delicious as well.  Of course, you have to save room for dessert, which are awesome.  In fact, just order one dessert for the table because they are huge!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My fiance and I have gone here quite often in the past 5 years since we discovered it and we always love it. I've never had a bad time there or bad service. There was maybe one time where we had a server who wasn't as talkative as others, but that's it.My fiance always orders the meatloaf, which is wonderful, and I usually order the Balsamic Chicken. One time I ordered the Romano Crusted Chicken, it wasn't terrible but was rather bland and I'll probably never order it again. Also, if you go during the morning/lunch time rather than dinner, the Triple Decker Grilled Cheese is a great choice. As stated by many others, the Blue Cheese Potato Chips are heaven and if you've never tried them, you have to order them!As for drinks I will usually order a strawberry lemonade (the alcoholic one), which is delicious!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The pork chops are ridiculously good and well worth it! Served with chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes. So good! Will be back for more!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I am a big fan of diners and this is one of my all time favorites.  This is one of very few restaurants that can pull of both quantity and quality at the same time.  If you want huge portions and great food this is the place to go.  The only negatives are that this place is always packed and for a diner the prices are kind of high but it is a "Fine Diner".  If you live in Columbus and haven't been here yet it's worth your time.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Cap City is a great staple restaurant to have in your dining out repertoire. I have been to both locations but usually choose this one as it is closer to where I live. The atmosphere is that of an upscale diner which is a nice change of pace and since its Cameron Mitchell you know the food will be great. Over the course of my visits I've tried and tasted many different things. Some of my favorites include the PEI Mussels as an appetizer, and for entrees Six Cheese Ravioli (with meatballs!) and the Smoked Turkey Reuben. I am not a meatloaf person (I know--what a sin!) but from my friends who die for meatloaf Cap City's is hard to beat. Their desserts are huge and great for sharing if you so desire! The bar at Cap City is also nice--try their Pineapple Infused Vodka! I also love eating out on the patio in the summer if the weather permits. Overall Cap City is a great place to have your fill of some fine dining in a relaxed, casual atmosphere!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Great place to go for any meal, especially lunch and brunch. Dinner can be a little pricey, but is still very good. I have dined here numerous times and only disliked one dish I've ever tried. Best key lime pie!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I will always remember this place for many reasons. I embarked on my 3,000 mile journey with my late grandfather in the Fall of 2005 from Boston and after 15 hours of driving we settled in Columbus to stay the night. We had no idea we would end up finding one of the Best diners i have ever eaten in. It was a good sign when i walked in 5 minutes past close and the manager said to come on in. It was first class from the folded cloth napkins to the decor and the plates and silverware. I order to this day one of the best fried chicken dinners with a side of mashed potatoes that i would have again in a heartbeat. Cap City Diner will always be remembered. 93/100

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I should start off stating that I am a Cameron Mitchell fanatic and this is one of my favorite places in Columbus.  My friends and I frequent the restaurant, mainly due to the amazing dessert options...  The "diner" food is fantastic, I definitely suggest getting the meatloaf sandwich for a smaller meal or the meatloaf entree if you are extra hungry.  Recently my friend split a half order of the maytag blue cheese chips (you can get a half order, just ask the server), the meatloaf sandwich, a carafe of sangria, and the piÌ¬ce de rÌ©sistance, the big cup o' chocolate .  In the end we couldn't finish the chocolate since it was too much food for the two of us.  Word to the wise, don't be naive and try to finish the cup by yourself, it is so rich and delicious that you might get stuck.  They have a huge seating area, during the summer I suggest opting for a seat on the patio and enjoying the sun.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The maytag blue cheese potato chips are amazing and so are the desserts.  The actual food is just ok.  It's not like the main food is any better or worse than any other place.  I would go for dessert.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Meh. That's about all I've got. The greasy spoon thing is cool in theory and if that is your white whale, maybe you will love this place. The vegetarian selection isn't that impressive. The mac & cheese is very good but not enough to make an effort to go here on a regular basis. Now if my friends wanted to go there I wouldn't make a fuss either.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: My Husband and I have been here twice now and have a great experience both times we went.  Both times that we went we got the blue cheese chips which are to die for but are also full of calories but totally worth it.   I tried the Philly cheese steak which was not my favorite but good and also the Romona chicken which was amazing.  The service that we had both times was awesome.  The servers gave us recommendations when deciding between different options.  I was not going to have desert till I saw a cup of chocolate go past, then I just had to have one.  The cup of chocolate is amazing but with two of us eating it we still can't finish it.   I also did not have to wait to be seated .  If you are ever taking a shopping trip to Lenox i recommend this as a great spot for lunch.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: It wouldn't be my first pick on the CMR list, but when it's the boss' treat...I went to Cap City today for the first time. I wasn't very impressed with the menu. It's lacking in vegetarian options. So, if you're a veg head, beware - the only plates you can have are the vegetable plate or the omelet (which sometimes has bacon or ham). I actually went with the vegetable plate, a heap of baked spaghetti with a slight bit of marinara sauce, two stalks of broccoli, a pile of spinach with onions, a mix of green beans and carrots, and a spring rolls featuring portabella mushrooms. The spaghetti itself was delicious but left me with unbearably bad breath. If you get it, be sure to pocket some mints on the way out. I'm a fan of semi-crisp steamed veggies, but the broccoli was barely steamed at all, way too crisp for my tastes. The spinach was totally opposite - total mush and not the most pleasant flavor, which is odd because I usually like spinach. The green beans and carrots were very good, well seasoned and perfectly cooked. The spring rolls were the stars of the plate. I could have eaten about fifty of those spring rolls. Oh, and the entire expanse was littered with wonderful soft goat cheese.Before the entrees came, we munched on the hot and sour calamari. One of my coworkers was worried about it being too spicy, but she was happy to find it was much more akin to sweet and sour sauce, not at all hot. The calamari was good. The Maytag chips we had were unremarkable - despite some rave reviews from other people at the table who apparently eat at Cap City all the time. The chips were kettle cooked. The cheese was a bit salty but otherwise pretty tasteless. There was a lot lacking there.The dÌ©cor was okay. It felt very warm, and the huge hanging lights were fun. But other than the entryway and the design of the menus, it definitely didn't feel like a diner - not even like an upscale diner.The service was very good. I noticed the bus staff clearing the empty table of a large group that had been behind us. They didn't let the dirty plates sit on the table at all. They were there as soon as the group walked away. Our waiter had a good sense of humor. The best thing about the meal was the short wait time. Despite the restaurant being packed, we were seated immediately, ordered quickly, and were brought our food in record time. I couldn't believe my eyes when the entrees came out seemingly minutes after placing our orders. And the food was at a great temperature, not scoldingly hot like it had just come straight from the oven onto my tongue.Very wimpy drink menu. I liked the calamari, wasn't blown away by the entrÌ©e, but would go back to try the dessert, which I hear is amazing.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: AMAZING FOOD.  Hands down, this restaurant is my favorite place in Columbus.  The food is not your typical diner food.  Their pecan encrusted pork chop and the balsamic chicken are incredible.  We ended up moving out to New England for the past 6 years and took the Cameron Mitchell cookbook with us and used it frequently to get our "Cap City" fix.  The recipe for the Buttermilk Mashers and the online recipe for the Maytag Blue Cheese chips helped us survive until we returned to Ohio.  It can be thought to be a bit pricey, but the quality of the food and service demands the price.  They also allow you to order the lunch portions for dinner (which cuts down the price and still gives you plenty of food).  I have ordered most of the things on the menu at one point or another and have NEVER had anything that I was disappointed with.  Cap City Diner ROCKS!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Very cute, upscale, diner themed restaurant. Food was decent, but the descriptions of the food were tastier than the food. However, food was decent. Balsamic chicken is a little lighter and has lots of starch adn veggies to round out the meal.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Slightly above average food and slightly below average decor.  I don't like meatloaf and that is what this place is kind of known for.  I would put it on par with a great meal from Fridays.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I give Cap City 4 stars, because they just aren't what they used to be. It is still one of my all-time favorite restaurants. I do miss Cap City the most since moving away. My husband and I used to eat here almost once a week. The Philly Cheesesteak is probably my favorite dish. The sauce is incredible. I have the recipe, but haven't been able to replicate it. I love the melted white cheddar cheese draped over the tender steak and bell peppers. Yum yum! The chocolate cake is also great. They did change their cake though since we moved. I've been absent from Columbus since January 2007. We visited in November 2007 and they had changed their menu. They also changed some of their existing menu items. The cake no longer stands up on the plate. They lie it down on the plate. Also, the icing is not nearly as thick as it used to be. I'm also bummed they took the corn risotto off of their menu. That was one of my favorite side dishes. I still would frequent Cap City if we lived there, but like some of the other reviews: They have switched for less expensive ingredients to make more money. I'm all for making money, but when it affects the taste/quality of the product or food, I disagree.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I'm not was wild about the meat loaf as most people, and I hate the Maytag Chips.  The prime rib special was average, and I once had a heart stoppingly good chicken fried steak. The desserts are also good, and quite large.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: The perfect place for a business lunch or a good meal with friends, Cap City always delivers. When I'm trying to go for lighter fare, Ill opt for one of their amazing salads, but if you are looking for a splurge, try the maytag bleu cheese chips. Worth every calorie, this appetizer will be gone long before the meal comes! All the food and drinks at Cap City that I have tried have been outstanding, and I have always had excellent service. Highly recommended!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: I love this place, great meatloaf :)  . Menu is a simple diner menu with a little flare. Everything I have had on the menu has met and exceeded my expectations.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Columbus
column6: Let me just say that I was anxiously awaiting the Meatloaf Diner Plate. I could have kept on waiting, I was not impressed. The potatoes were great but the sauce on the meatloaf left me  underwhelmed. The fact that you only get two broccoli spears was also making me feel like $16.95 was way too much, for what I received. The other people I dined with got the Philly Cheese Steak and they enjoyed their meals. I ordered a Peach Palmer and it had a wonderful flavor, it just isn't that sweet. For some that may be okay, but for me and my sister we needed some sugar to sweeten things up. I would order that again. Now another reason I did not give this restaurant more stars was because when I got my glass for that delicious Peach Palmer, I ran my fingers down the outside of the glass and felt the worse case of "unwashed glass grit" on its surface. After making sure the very nice waitress felt what I had felt, I asked for and was given a much more seemingly cleaner glass. Service was timely and the staff seemed friendly. Even though we were warned by friends there may be a wait, the wait wasn't as long as we thought it would be. For a diner the place had a nice look to it. For a supposedly upscale diner it was just okay. I can't honestly say I would go back again. I don't mind paying a little more for my meals, but only if the food and the whole experience is included in that price. Sadly, for me, it was not in this case.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Blue. Cheese. Chips. They don't sound like much but for some reason I am totally addicted to these things. Sunday night: came in around 7:30. Had a reservation but probably didn't need one. First time at this Cap City location and to be honest I like the ambience here better than the original location. Also ordered the bbq chopped salad: huge portion size and very good. My group also finished dinner with the chocolate cake which was huge!! Reliable as always.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: This is the place that people fawn over non-stop. Everyone has a "great food you have to try" and well...åÊI was horribly disappointed (at this time).I came from brunch, and while they score points for the cinnamon rolls and blue cheese chips - my order was...åÊlackluster.I did a coffee, which tasted like shitty diner coffee.I got a mimosa, to counteract the shitty diner coffee.I ordered the "Eggs on Hash" - and it was a burnt mess. Not like charcoal briquette (a la most places kids' burger) - but like, overcooked everything (except the eggs - they were perfect).I mean, this by no means was a "oh god, the entire experience was awful!" - our service was decent, and the rest of the food was good - my date ordered the breakfast burrito, and *that* was tasty - just this item...åÊI had higher expectations for it.So...åÊI will have to return and order something else!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: As a big fan of Cap City, I was excited to check out the newest addition to the family. This one has a fantastic location in the exciting new Bridge Park development in Dublin. Parking is available in a free garage across from the restaurant. There is a very nice patio, filled with plants and flowers that makes for a nice location to eat when the weather is nice. I have visited twice now, and on both visits, the staff was friendly and helpful, and we've enjoyed all the food we have sample so far. These dishes include Tuesday's chicken pot pie and the Southern Fried Chicken. I greatly enjoyed the crispy fish and chips from the gluten free menu, which were flavorful and perfectly cooked, and thanks to the recommendation of the server on our first visit, I always check now to see if the gluten free dessert of the day is the delightful cheesecake. It comes in a huge, rich and creamy slice with fresh strawberry sauce and a dollop of whipped cream. (Hint - they will pack this beautifully for you if, like me, you are not ready for it at the end of the meal but need it for later!)This new location definitely upholds the Cap City name. Great place to visit if you're in the Dublin area.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: I really want to give a higher rating but can't. I love Cameron Mitchell restaurants but this one is always average. Great decor. The diner atmosphere is there. I ordered the cod and crispy shrimp. The cod and shrimp were cooked nicely. It was the sauce on it that was disappointing. First some how it was searing hot. Hotter than the fish some how. I could not eat my dish for awhile. When I did the sauce was salty and had a greasy feel and taste. I enjoyed the fact that it came with steamed broccoli but some how a whole shallot was used in the cooking of the broccoli and was too much. My husband ordered the signature meatloaf. Presentation is wonderful but we almost sent it back to warm it up. His dish was just warm enough and my was searing hot. The server was attentive and professional.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: New place in Dublin.  I am very excited about all the new places that are opening up here.  Went here with a girlfriend and thought the place was very nice.  I had the meatloaf and loved it. The fries there are so good. I highly recommend the fries.  They had outdoor seating, with a nice view, great for the warmer days. Management there was also very nice.  Came out to check on us several times.  I'll be back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Atmosphere: The Cap City Fine Diner has three locations and we stopped at the newest in Dublin our way home. It's attached at the bottom of high rises so it's not the stereotypical, big metallic diner, however, the inside is shiney, metallic and everything you could want in a diner.  Service: The waitress was one of the best we've had in a while.  She came to our table, refilled beverages, and was just extremely friendly.  She was in the top 5% of waitresses I've ever had the pleasure of having.  Coffee: The coffee wasn't the greatest.  It wasn't as hot as I hoped and there were grounds in a couple of the refills.  It wasn't terrible but having grounds in the coffee is a turnoff.  Food: There are plenty of menu options at the Cap City Fine Diner.  The menu isn't overwhelming but they have the standard breakfast, lunch and dinner options plus a few unique options.  We ordered the salmon spread to split.  It came with salmon spread (almost like a cream cheese), hard bagel chips, a deviled egg, and pickles.  The salmon spread had huge chunks of salmon which I appreciated.  I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the app. I decided to order the fish and chips and it was one of the better fish and chips I've had lately.  It wasn't the best, but it was good.  The fish itself was cooked well with a crispy outside.  Personally, I like a lot of crunch without being burnt.  The French fries tasted good, they weren't overly cooked or soggy. Dessert: I went crazy and ordered both a milkshake at the beginning of the meal and my husband and I split the carrot cake.  The milkshake was good.  It was thick and she brought the extra in a mug to continue to refill.  It had banana, caramel and vanilla ice cream.  My husband wanted to try the carrot cake.  Since he ran a marathon, he got to choose.  While carrot cake is not my first pick, I do like it.  This was one of the best carrot cakes I've wver had.  The frosting was tangy and the cake had plenty of actual carrots and raisins cooked in.  It made me a recent carrot cake convert! Would I come Back:I enjoyed the Cap City Diner.  Next time, I probably wouldn't order the coffee but other than that I enjoyed it and will probably go back every time I'm in Dayton.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: When I lived in Columbus I would go to the original cap city and just loved it. I was so excited to hear that they put a location in Dublin, which is close to my parents home. We came on a Friday night with reservations. I strongly recommend that you make reservations ahead because it was very busy. There is a parking garage right across the street and also street parking. The initial lobby when you walk in is tiny and uncomfortably crowded. We were seated quickly but unfortunately were seated in the closed in patio. It was cold. We had to ask the server several times to turn off the fan. My mother had to put on her coat. It was also incredibly loud. It was impossible to have a conversation without shouting. The service was prompt and friendly. The dinner came out within a good period of time and our drinks were refilled quickly. The food was overall disappointing. The pork chops were good. The meatloaf was about as I remember it- good but only if you really like meatloaf. My dad got the walleye special and it was bland and dry. Would definitely not get that again, and it was the most expensive thing that we got. I got the carrot cake for dessert and that was totally outstanding! I think that I you want to come for overpriced diner food in a trendy/ loud restaurant then this is a good bet. There are many more intimate restaurants in the area that I will go to instead. If it is cold ask to sit inside because the closed in patio was not comfortable.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Cap city diner  opened in Dublin relatively recently, and I finally managed go here on a late Friday evening last week. I was actually returning home from a long trip back from China earlier that same evening and wanted to go out with my wife rather than fall asleep on the couch, so had made reservations enroute in Chicago. Turned out to be a good idea. The place kept me awake as it was quite busy (good) and had fun music playing throughout. We were promptly seated in a nice booth and the service was pretty good overall. For appetizers, we got the wings --- they are sweet, not spicy --- but very good and the portion size was large. We also shared their meatloaf, which was sufficient as a meal, unless you're really hungry. Their alcohol selection is not bad, although we just had wines I think (can't recall, I'm blaming it on jet-lag).  Good ambience, decent food. Would love to come here again.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Service was awesome.  Food was very good and reasonably priced for what I got.  I had the Romano Chicken, two thin sliced and lightly breaded chicken breasts with a delicious red sauce.Will definitely be back when in town again.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Have only been to one of the other CC's once so was thrilled to find this one closer to home.  Be warned that it is right off a very busy street and parking can get dodgy.  There is on the street parking but that goes quickly but there is a garage behind it.While in the spirit of things it has the accoutrements of a diner it is, you could say, upscale diner as in no older than old grease or stains on the counters and while there are diner specials (seriously, the meatloaf was flying out of there) there are also not so typical diner foods like smoked salmon spread and pecan crusted pork chops. Plus there is this big bar in the front with happy hour going on.It is a beautiful place but the mood was dampened by the wait and buss staff hanging out in a space right behind our booth and yucking it up while they waited to do their jobs.  There was about 6 of them standing there to the point that some of the "overflow" was standing practically next to us.  Told our server this was not cool and they moved.  Managers and hosts came and apologized.Even though it's not classic diner food I had the salmon and that was pretty darn tasty and hubs liked his chicken.  The rolls on the other hand were so dry I let them be.  Was bummed that they ran out of the pie I wanted but my root beer float substitute was great; that red and white striped paper straw was a nice touch.  Prices are reasonable and will have to return when it's a daily special I'd like.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: We love this place Eric is awesome !! Always sit at the bar and ask for Eric Best Guy around!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: This new Cap City is fabulous!  We have have been in five times since they opened.  We have tried their lunch, dinner, happy hour and carry out.  There is a majorly professional crew running the place!  We feel like VIPs every time we visit.  The food is spectacular.  Amazing salads, blue plate specials, salmon, veggie plate, gourmet and simple kid's meals.  We tried out the Tuesday "beer and burger."  That's any burger on the menu, and a beer for $10!  They even custom made a portobello burger for me.  We have had many special requests while dining here.  All of them were met with a "can-do" and eager willingness to please their guests.  Chris, Eric, Lindsay and Amanda are all top notch.Very elegantly designed and decorated retro diner.  Check out my pics.We will be back soon and often!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Cameron Mitchel does it again!  This restaurant has fabulous atmosphere and a great menu.  Tonight, there were 5 of us. We got the BBQ chicken salad, balsamic chicken veggie platter, fish and chips and the salmon salad.  Each of us enjoyed our meals, the servings are large and there were a couple of doggie bags!!  Mondays are Margerita Mondays so 2 of us ordered margeritas... very nicely done.  I love the restaurants that Cameron Mitchel owns.  They are all so distinct and all so well done, they make you want to eat there over and I very again!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Needing a dessert fix or some comfort food? I've found your place! The meatloaf is excellent, but I really just want to brag on the desserts here. I live an hour away from Cap City and I will continue to make the trip back just for the peanut butter pie. It's seriously that good. Service has been excellent every single time. The restaurant itself is gorgeous. Last time I checked GPS will take you to the back of this restaurant. It is in a new development and you will want to turn on the side street just up from the restaurant. That will take you to a parking garage that is free.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Cap city has great food and service, never have had a bad meal any time I've ate here. It's a little busy at times but it's always worth the wait.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Our waitress was great and the restaurant has a cool vibe but my meal was horrible .  I ordered the meatloaf meal and there wasn't much taste to  the meat. The mashed potatoes were cold and a piece of the broccoli was  partially frozen.  I have had this same dish at the other Cap City and it was amazing, unfortunately the Dublin location isn't up to par. My friend ordered a salmon appetizer, took two bites and couldn't finish it. The waitress noticed that she didn't eat it and without asking removed the charge from the bill because she said many people didn't like the appetizer.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Had the meatloaf and it was ok. Not great and not worth the wait to get a table. The mashed potatoes were fine. Gravy was ok. Crispy onions were good. Overall not that impressed.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Was very disappointed with my experience in Dublin.  we all felt all staff members needed more training and manager was not helpful. Sat with a table of 3 near the bar - service was very slow. Our waiter was nice but seemed totally unsure of any questions we asked him . MY SALMON SALAD WAS A JOKE SALMON WAS TINY ( child sized) portion. Also we had a leaking pipe over our heads.  I ended up with my hair and dress wet - we asked for the manager -when he finally arrived -he said  it  was from the humidity and maybe I needed an umbrella -we all felt he was condescending  with that comment. I was Very disappointed and think the Grandview location is far better than this. Will never go backone.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Had brunch here on Saturday and it was so good I came running back after church on Sunday. No wait either day. Food and service exceeded my expectations. Love that the iced tea comes out fresh in a carafe. The meatloaf sandwich is their claim to fame but I think their French Toast is even better. So many interesting things on the menu that I can't wait to try!! Patio is beautiful and I did not find any street noises to be a distraction. Happy to have this great spot in Dublin!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: We finally checked out Cap City @ Bridge Park this past Friday. And while the food was good the service was disappointingly below that. A group of 7 of us went around 8pm. 2 of us ordered appetizers, 1 a salad and the blue cheese potato chips for the table. Salad came out first then about 5 min later the chips. While the chips were delish we were slightly surprised by what seemed like straight out of the Kettle's bag kettle chips. We were expecting homemade potato chips. For the entrees we ordered roasted chicken greek salad, romano crusted chicken, ponzu glazed salmon, thanksgiving day sandwich and 2 of the walleye special.  1 walleye came out then 12min later 4 more entrees and another 5min later the last 2 entrees. By the time we all had our food the first walleye that came out was cold. No complaints on the taste of the food (pretty average) or the service itself (very friendly staff) but just bad/long/poorly timed service. Overall the atmosphere was lively & we loved the music that was playing. Since we were in no rush & enjoying each others company we still had a great time despite the poor timing on delivery.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: So, aside from having perhaps the best meatloaf in town, and definitely the best slice of apple pie, this is just a darn good spot. Just as good as the original and a little cooler with the new decor. I feel confident that no matter what I order at this place it will always be a good meal. The staff is always attentive and competent or better. I'm not a fan of the parking, that just seems to be life in Columbus nowadays. Other than that, I can't think of a single negative thing to say about this place; fantastic.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: We experienced growing pains last night. Waited 20 minutes to be seated even though we had a reservation made four days earlier. Only after asking the manager for help did we finally get seated. But then we sat at a table with a leaky a/c vent overhead. It was like eating in a rainforest. Asked the manager for help once again and was told they are aware of the problem and it will be corrected - thanks for nothing. As a positive four of us ordered dinner salads and we all enjoyed them. Two salads, a glass of beer and a glass of wine - $46 before tip.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Loved it !Went for brunch today and was amazed....so proud to live in Dublin !!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Got the Philly Cheese Steak, holy cow. That's was delicious. Very nice place, we are outside on a colder night and the heaters helped but the wind didn't. Service was friendly, but slow. Overall, I recommend this place if you want to sit and hang out for a while and enjoy the ambience and yummy food!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: We love Cap City in Gahanna and on Olentangy - we were excited to try the new one close to our home in Dublin.  Great location - friendly staff nice seating BUT what happen to my favorite dish?   Meatloaf.  It looks - feels and taste like they added filler to the hamburger!   I didn't even eat 1/2. And no I didn't take the left over home.  Sad! Hope they make the meatloaf like the other locations.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Best in Dublin, IMO. Been here four times. Every dish is solid and done well. When your reuben comes crisp - and not soggy, with the right amount of kraut, a schmear of russian, and a heap of moist corned beef minus the gristle... you know it's a keeper.
