The crew is friendly and mingle up the crowd. It's nice. They're always looking to engage. I can't figure out when to go as they're jammed, not jammed, jammed... with no pattern I can figure. Basically, when I see no line, I divert in. This place aint cheap, but they respect the eater with an appropriate heap of food. We've hit most of the menu at this point and haven't come across any misses. It's like the diners back on the Island or in Jersey - but classier.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: I went to Cap City in Dublin on a Saturday at around 4:45(I had to set a reservation and that was the only time slot due to homecoming). I can't say enough about having a great waiter to make a dinner experience good.  Our waiter there was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed and than some.  We had the meatloaf and it was good. My daughter had the ribeye and it was more fat than meat(I know ribeye is more fatty but she got two small bites of meat and it cost almost 30.00). That wasn't worth the money.  The dessert was fabulous and made up for the ribeye. Apple pie, brownie sundae, and the big chocolate cake were ordered and they didn't disappoint!! I am rating it four stars because of the over priced ribeye, otherwise everything was good.It can be pricey but it would be nice to go to for a birthday dinner etc...

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: We dined here in the Mid-afternoon recently.   Despite being practically ignored by the host station we were seated in the bar area where a bartender waited on us with grace and patience.   I had the Romano Chicken (always a favorite) and my sister had the Vegi Plate (hope you like peppers if you order this).  I love Cap City, but am always disappointed when a vegetarian companion has such limited options.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Had a great experience here. We made reservations through Open Table but when we arrived our table wasn't ready. (The wait was 45 minutes on a Friday night.) The staff informed us the patio had a table available and confirmed it was enclosed and heated so we went with it. After being seated the staff provided us with two glasses of champagne for our inconvenience which was a huge surprise and just demonstrated the quality of service there. We got the pretzels for an appetizer-- they were okay but not the best. I ordered the meatloaf which was delicious and huge. I was able to take home half. My fiancÌ© got the meatloaf sandwich and liked it too. We got the carrot cake for dessert and loved it! So amazing! Very sweet and decadent like I never knew carrot cake could be! I'd highly recommend Cap City Dublin-just make reservations.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Went a few weeks ago with some family. Place was a zoo. Great deal with the half off wine Wednesday. Server was very nice, although I think he was extremely overwhelmed with his section. He struggled to open the wine bottle, and we really didn't see him much after that. Shame, because my mother's food came out wrong and it took 30 minutes to find someone to fix it. Food was pretty good. Took awhile to get our bill and he sent another server to drop off our card and apologize for his absence. Was a little odd. Overall, food was good and service was mediocre. Do wanna try this place again eventually. Maybe during lunch or happy hour

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Food was great but service was pretty poor compared to even a chain restaurant, nevertheless a Cameron Mitchell restaurant

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Food and service is great. They have an extensive gluten free menu and a great deal of knowledge about preventing cross contamination. It's a busy semi noisy place. So be prepared to wait if you don't have reservations. This is by FAR the best Cap City in town. If you're gluten free/celiac this is a wonderful safe place for a great meal out!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Came here for my anniversary. Sat outside and everything was great, from food to service. Would definitely come back. Had a great selection of food, especially salads.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: So we wanted to take my mom out, for just being her awesome self, and we thoight we would check out cap city. The grandview one is awesome and this is closer. Plus i am a fan of Camron Mitchell food in general.    There was a wait which was expected and they quoted us at 30-50 min which is cool....an hr and 15 min later we get our table which is still fine. The server was friendly enough but clearly was super confused and overwhelmed....he had no clue and couldnt answer questions....about anything....it was super awkward to watch him struggle and almost cut off his thumb opening a bottle of wine w his wine key....the struggle is real....but bro you need your thumb... I almost asked to show him. Well food came eventually from a runner and all was well until they bought my mother the wrong food out first minus ours......then never came back. Finally ours comes but before we can ask them to fix the runner runs off. Food was terrific but then not a single person came back for 30 min...so then when i ask for dessert menu to try to push the fates i took that time to ask for her food to be fixed.So then me and my sis polished off the bottle of wine we were gonna save waiting for our server to come back and let us order a delicous slice of choc cake....never happened bc by the time he came back we were over it. It was 9:00 we had been there since 6:30!!...so to his apology he finally brought our checks. Oh and dont worry those didnt come out right away either. Again 22 min later bc i timed it he came back and dropped our checks off....we felt like we were being kidnapped....then after he took our checks he had another server drop them off and tell us he would be by to say goodbye. Oooooook yeah thanks but no thanks, he didnt anyway. So all in all on a positvie note he brought us bread twice....but thanks but no thanks service was terrible and food wasnt even worth how awful the service was.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: I'm very happy with the new Cap City in Dublin.  There was plenty of parking in the new Longstreet Garage across the street from the Diner.  Our server, Samantha was wonderful! She knew the menu and kept our drinks full.  I had the Romano Crusted Chicken.  It was very flavorful and the portion size was perfect.  One of our group raved over the Pecan Crusted Pork Chops, huge chops! That may be my next meal at Cap City.  The Seasonal Vegetable Plate and the Southern Fried Chicken at our table also looked great!   We ogled the meatloaf at the next table over as it was delivered and demolished by the happy couple. The four of us sat on the busy large patio that faces west.  They had sun screens that let in plenty of light yet blocked the sun sufficiently.  The ambiance was great and you could easily hold a conversation without raising your voice even being next to busy Riverside Drive.  I'll be back for sure!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: This was an uneven experience- bar service was good, got seated promptly close to our reservation time. The premeal bread was tasteless, very disappointing. I'm not sure why this is hard for anybody . I got the short rib special and it was very good. My partners harvest salad  faired poorly to Wendy's. Actually that's an insult to Wendy's . The turkey would disappoint a high school cafeteria and ended up being comped due to its appearance as a grey gelatinous blob. My meal was worth going back for- but I'll give them time to work out the flaws first for the rest. A firmer hand in the kitchen could solve the ills. I wished it to be better as it is walking distance away but....try harder!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: service was OK. i got my order on time  and the place looks nice and clean. not my favorite restaurant but its worth the money.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: Food tasted good while eating. Waitress was phony. Hours later, all 3 in my party had diarrhea. We all ordered different meals which means the cook was probably cross contaminating.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: A few bumps in the service but overall I am very happy with the Dublin Cap City. Sweet and sour calamari was cooked perfectly and delicious. Definitely enough for three of us to share as an appetizer. I had the Greek salad with chicken, dressing on the side. The vegetables were perfectly crisp and the chicken was nicely seasoned, sliced, and served warm on the side - which probably helped the lettuce stay crisp. Genius. Iced tea was freshly brewed and served with plenty of ice. The absolute best thing was the banana bread pudding. I loved it. The bananas were amazing with a thin carmelized coating on one side. The bread pudding was both creamy and substantial. The best texture I've ever had in bread pudding. They must have used magic bread. Truly amazing. Atmosphere was stylish and eclectic. It was a fun place to take my teenage boys and would be even more fun for a grown up date night. We didn't get the promised rolls but didn't remind the server because we were saving room for dessert. There was a little mix up with the dessert order but it was handled perfectly by the wait staff and I left very happy. Tips: I found street parking on Riverside but the entrance on that side is a back door so we had to walk all through the restaurant to find the host stand. The giant gumball machine didn't work right. It took our quarter but no gumball came out. Luckily the host had a container of gumballs and gave us one. So no loss. I'll be back for sure.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: First , the hostess (Roxie) never looked up or smiled even after prompting. Server (Elaina)was ok but slow. Water glasses were never filled. Food was good but nothing extraordinary.  Pricey.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: A diner with upscale twist. Worth the 25-20 minute wait. Romano crusted chicken, cheese steak, kids salmon and kids cheeseburger were delicious. We all left very happy.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: So glad to have another restaurant in Dublin. It still smells brand new!!! Ate here during brunch. Our server Lisa did a awesome job! I got the pork chop and it was cooked perfectly. We got chicken tenders for the little one and my wife had a sandwich. Ate the warm pretzel and cinnamon rolls before our meal. They have a very nice patio which we did not sit at but we will next time. Kid and family friendly  restaurant.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Dublin
column6: I've been a big fan of the Grandview Cap City for years and was excited to try this location for the first time since it's close to home. Have to say I was disappointed. Perhaps it was because we stopped in after 9:00 on a Saturday, but our waitress disappeared for long stretches (she did inform us she was taking some extra tables on the patio), the potato soup was watery and lukewarm, as was my meatloaf. On the plus side my wife enjoyed her salad, the portion sizes were good, the prices were reasonable and the atmosphere was nice and clean (which I would hope for being less than a month old).  The hostess asked us how our dinner was but seemed uninterested in why when we told her we were disappointed. Based on our overall positive experiences with Mitchell restaurants I'm sure we'll try again and hope for a better result.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: This is one of those super cool places that you go to when the kids are away. My wife and I stopped by for a bite and I ordered the Romano crusted chicken that comes with angel hair pasta. Very very good. My wife always gets the meatloaf and that's great too. 4.5 stars for sure. Now, what I'm about to tell you all is a bit of a secret between a friend and I. Beer and chocolate cake go great together so I went with a brown ale and a piece of their chocolate cake and holy cow it was better than dinner I think. Cake slice is massive and very very good. Definitely enough for 2 if not more. I have previously had the calamari and it is bad to the bone!  Get that also. Look, bottom line is the place isn't cheap but not ridiculously expensive, super good food, good for date night, good chocolate cake! Go forth and enjoy!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Wow, ok. I knew people loved this place for a reason. But I didn't really understand until I visited. My parents were in town and we wanted to take my uncle out for his birthday. It was my job to find a place for us to have a nice dinner together between Bexley and New Albany. I'm so glad I settled here. The atmosphere is fun, a little more classy than average but still welcoming. I was happy to bring my family to a place that had a menu we could all enjoy. I followed my heart and got the meatloaf platter. Friends. This meatloaf. Is the meatloaf of meatloaves. So good. So tasty. I nearly licked my plate clean! I was tempted to order a second helping to go! My family had a lovely dinner and enjoyed our time together. My mom said she wanted to come back every time she came to town! I highly recommend coming here if you want to show off how awesome Columbus can be!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I love Cap City for the consistency, no matter which location you go to. I get the same thing every time I go, Romano crusted chicken, a house salad with sherry mustard vinegarette and chocolate cake. I know and trust it's exactly the same every time I go. The salad dressing is like no other, very unique and delicious, tangy and sweet! The Romano crusted chicken is the perfect portion of crispy chicken pieces and perfectly dressed pasta so it doesn't stick together. It's also perfectly cooked, never mushy. It's a must have. Lastly the chocolate cake is TO DIE FOR. Three large layers and the perfect ratio of frosting to moist cake. I love this restaurant!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Can't go wrong ever here. Staff is always great, food is top notch and what else is there to ask. It's a Mitchell restaurant and like every experience I have ever had at one of his restaurants, Fantastic. Get the meatloaf or pork chops every single time and don't even look at the menu. There's no need to. Great place..

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I imagine that if you ever wondered how a 1950's would evolve up to the 2010's it would be cap city.  They serve the home style food but with a city flair.  Their portion sizes are diner sized(hearty) and the quality of the food meets city-like standards.  I had the fish sandwich the flavors were good, the fish big and flakey and the fry on the fish was just right.  They could have more of a variety on their draft beer selection but it's winter and I'm not a stout fan.  I will be back

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: This is when it would be nice to be allowed to rate a half a star. If I could I would give this place 3.5. Context is hard here: it's a diner, but an upscale one (and Cameron Mitchell owned), so how do you judge?First the food...very good. The meatloaf, as noted in other reviews, is hard to beat. Everything about it is great: flavor, portion, composition. We also tried the Romano crusted chicken, which was tasty. The creamy tomato sauce it came with had a lot of flavor.The service is what was lacking. First off I my silverware had food crusted on it. Not a great way to start the meal. The server apologized but didn't really seem fazed by it. She was busy with a lot of other tables and we didn't see a whole lot of her. If comfort food is your craving this is a perfect choice. But maybe not the comfortable service.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: This place has really great food and a fun ambiance. Everything I've ever tried is delicious and happy hour is awesome!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: This place was amazing!  The general manager for our local location mentioned he had made reservations for dinner at a place that we may consider out of the ordinary.  He mentioned it was a diner, but so much more.  So perhaps a bit wary, we made our way to Cap City which is tucked into a strip mall in a suburb of Columbus.Perusing the menu, I saw quite a few of what you would consider "diner standards".  Pork chops, meatloaf, fish & chips...they even have a nightly blue plate special!  So I mainly heard rave reviews of the meatloaf, but I decided to break the mold a bit and went with the pecan crusted pork chop.  I've been on a pork kick lately...so I figured what the heck.  Dinner started with warm, yeasty rolls that reminded me of what is served at O'Charley's...which is actually a good thing...they're some of my favorites.  Oh my goodness...one of the best pork chops I have ever had.  Two huge perfectly cooked chops crusted in candied pecans and drizzled in a bit of apple cider glaze.  They were perfectly complemented by some amazing chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes and lightly sauteed spinach.  This was so much more than greasy diner food...not that there is anything wrong with that, it has it's place.  But this place was delicious and I'm glad the general manager overlooked our dubious expressions when he mentioned where we were eating.  You have to visit this place or one of it's other locations in town if you visit Columbus!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: One of my favorite restaurants in the Columbus area. Consistent good food, drinks, and service. I recommend the salmon but I've heard the meatloaf is great. There is sometimes a long wait, especially on weekends so I would recommend calling ahead or making a reservation for weekend nights.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I grew up around the corner to this restaurant and it holds a very soft, dear spot in my heart. I think it was the first Cameron Mitchell I had ever dined at and it really exposed me to how comfort food can also be elevated. Honestly, I've never had a bad meal and I continue to bring out-of-towners here to showcase food in Columbus. Vegetarian options are few, but usually very well done, so a great spot for a larger gathering which includes people with dietary restrictions. Service is always excellent; attentive without being pushy. First time? Go with the pork chop, the meatloaf or even the vegetable plate. Yum!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Was looking forward to this place based on the reviews and food photos.  Cool atmosphere and I chose to sit on the bar.  Really attentive bartenders who were friendly.  I opted for the deli club sandwich with bacon.  Unfortunately, the bacon was limp and cold.  Sandwich was a little on the soggy side.  Fries were solid.  Maybe I ordered the wrong food item.  If I come back in the future, will probably try a diner entree such as the pork chips or ribeye.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Love Cap City! My boyfriend and I have come here with family for brunch and just by ourselves for lunch and happy hour. Each time has been pleasant and we have been taken care of. The food is fantastic and happy hour has some great deals on great apps and drinks. You will leave full and happy

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Top notch takes on diner fare, served with the flair of a finer establishment.  The meat loaf is flat out the best in town. The fish and chips is reliably crispy and moist. The kitchen is in open view and the hustle adds to the diner atmosphere. Servers are nearly always knowledgeable and informative Always a good choice

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Yum! The gluten-free fish and chips keep me coming back for more! I miss the gluten-free chocolate cake. I also like the balsamic chicken (gluten-free). My husband swears by the pecan crusted pork chops, and also likes the fish and chips. My husband recommended the pork chops to a visiting friend and he said they were incredible.I love that they bring me gluten-free bread when they bring my husband his regular bread. The best thing about Cap City is I can order off the gluten-friendly menu and not worry about getting sick. I am grateful for Cap City! Tip - Reservations are always a good idea.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I have had many things on the menu and they have all be great. They have a wide assortment of food from sandwiches to pasta to hearty dinners. They have the most amazing desserts as well. Be prepared to share because they are huge. Great service and professional staff. I frequent here.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Cap City is one of those places where you go to get a great experience every time.. I recently went and our reservation was about 30 minutes or so off from when myself and friends had called for.. And they completely made up for it by offering us each a complimentary drink or dessert and of course we each chose dessert;) the porkchops and salmon salad and wings are all my go-to's but every time I try something new I am still impressed.. Cameron Mitchell fine dining but at a great price! My favorite dessert is the key lime pie but the carrot cake is equally amazing:)

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Not overly impressed. Food was meh. Service was HORRIBLE. A bit pricey for average food. Will not be back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Annual Mother's Day brunch visit.  Reservations made months in advance.  Food was outstanding, but the way they handled us not liking our original table was genuine outstanding service. That seems to be a theme at Cameron Mitchell establishments.  Jeremy one of the managers sent one of their staff members to Kroger for Hot Chocolate after he heard my daughter order it and the server tell her they did not have it in summer months.  Nicely done Cap City!  See you next Mother's Day if not before.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Fiancee and I decided to head to Cap City tonight for dinner.  Food was good, service was meh...let's go deeper!We arrived a little after 6:30 PM.  Didn't have to wait for a table, which is always nice!Seated by the host (didn't catch his name, but he was extremely nice); he advised that our waitress Candie would be with us shortly.We were seated a bit too long for my taste before Candie visited us.  When she did, she took our drink orders (Diet Pepsi for me, Sangria for my date).  Drinks came out quickly.  At this point, we also put in an order for calamari (everyone reading should know this by now!) along with our dinner orders; Ponzu Salmon for me and Fish & Chips for my lovely bride to be.After this, we didn't see our waitress for 20-30 minutes.  The host brought our calamari to the table (which was delicious, still not as good as Ocean Club's, but that's a tough dish to beat).  We munched on that for a bit, along with the awesome rolls that Cap City provides.  Probably 7-10 minutes after the calamari came out, the same host (again, I wish I knew his name, he was great) brought out our dinners.  Salmon came with a generous portion of rice along with some stir fried veggies (peas, mushrooms and peppers I believe) along with a ponzu glaze; date's fish and chips was a HUGE portion ( I think four pieces of fish) with fries, slaw, and dipping sauce.I finished my entire meal without receiving a refill on my drink; I finally received one about five minutes after I was finished.  This kinda stinks because I tried to position my empty glass to be as visible as possible, but this was to no avail.  By the time I received my refill I was already somewhat irritated about it.  My salmon was great, veggies were crisp, and rice was tasty...couldn't even finish it because I got so full.  My date (as is the norm) ate one piece of fish along with fries before she was done.  She really enjoyed the food, she just becomes full way too fast!We sat at our table for at least ten minutes after we were finished before we were approached by Candie to ask if we wanted dessert.  We declined as we were too full, but I witnessed several AWESOME looking dishes going out that somewhat make me sad that I didn't order anything (Strawberry Shortcake, Chocolate Cake especially).  When the check was delivered, I immediately had my card placed with it; Candie serviced nearby tables without grabbing it for about 10 more minutes.  She eventually came and retrieved it and we paid up.  Unfortunately, due to the timeliness of this (along with her not showing up at all throughout our meal despite seeing nearby patrons being visited quite a bit by their waiters) I ended up taking five dollars off the tip.It's a shame; we love Cap City, and the food was great, but tonight the service left more to be desired.  I hope this is just a fluke, because we love the menu there!Give it a shot!  As I said, the food is great!  Hopefully you receive a little bit better service then we did, but we still will be back.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: My husband and I went to Cap City for dinner a few days ago, and it was an ok experience. Essentially, I found the whole visit neither underwhelming nor particularly stellar. We were seated pretty quickly, and the service was good. I always appreciate free bread, but I felt like this bread was a bit on the dry side and could have used a little assistance (perhaps a butter or jam). I had the fried chicken dinner, and there were a couple things I really enjoyed about it. The mashed potatoes were great, and the crunch on the fried chicken was delightful. I'm always concerned that people will overcook boneless chicken to the extreme, but that wasn't an issue here. My only complaint with the chicken i that most of the flavor seemed to reside in the breading rather than penetrating down into the meat. The meal also came with green beans, but I didn't particularly care for their sweetness (this doesn't mean they were poorly prepared, but rather that they just weren't a hit for me). One cool thing about their food is that they have great portion sizes, so I was able to have a sandwich made with a leftover piece of chicken for lunch the next day. All in all, I'm not sure that I'll be returning for dinner, but I will perhaps visit to check out the brunch options.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: The only annoying part of our meal was at the outset. We'd taken care to make reservations, but it didn't seem to make much of a difference and we had a long wait for our table while it seemed that seating went strictly as first-come, first-serve, reservation be damned. That was extremely annoying and, as the place was VERY busy with limited waiting area, it was a difficult wait for a woman with a cane and arthritis. The restaurant has a faux-50's diner decor with a large open kitchen. As I said, it was extremely busy and so it was both loud and the food smells from the kitchen are very prominent, so expect to walk out with it all over your clothes and in your hair. The booths are large and comfortable and the service was good. Our waiter was friendly and diligent, going so far as to make up to-go cups for me and my husband. The portions sizes were VERY generous and the food was AMAZING. I had the pecan crusted pork chops. The chops were enormous, cooked perfectly (bone in) all the way through, juicy and the pecan crust and apple cider glaze complimented the meat perfectly. The house made drinks were excellent; we had all three, the strawberry-basil lemonade (a little heavy on the basil over the strawberry, but grassy and fresh), the peach palmer (lemonade, iced tea and peach puree that was just sweet enough without being cloying or sour) and the passionfruit fresca (which is a little sweet for some but was delicious and sparkly). The drinks come in carafes from which you can pour your own refills; a generous size for the price and taste! We didn't have room for appetizers or dessert, but looking at them on other tables, they're definitely a group activity; they were much too large for a single person to go it alone. I'd definitely go again--hopefully at a time it was less busy.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Came here on a suggestion from a friend before seeing a show at the Newport. Food was great! The chips with bleu cheese appetizer was delicious. The burger ranks as one of the top 5 I've ever had. The Reuben was good but needed extra dressing. It's more of a roast instead of shaved or sliced. Atmosphere is busy but we were seated very quickly and service was fast and very friendly. Convenient that this eatery is so close to high street so we could eat and make it to the Newport easily.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: The best. Highly recommend blue cheese chips, pork chops, fried chicken, balsamic chicken, and BBQ chopped salad. A little expensive but you get a lot of food. One of CMRs best restaurants. Excellent happy hour too!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Nice time with my partner my brother and my niece to celebrate the birth of my brothers new baby.   The server did well with all the request from a small but picky table, LOL. It's always nice to have a Manager stop by your table to check on how the service and food is.  One of the best Chocolate cakes ever!!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: The food was fantastic! The romano crusted chicken and pasta was very good and so was the meatloaf. If you like comfort food, get the meatloaf. The service was average and at the time they were struggling with fruit flies. I would definitely go back but I suggest making a reservation. We had reservations and still had to wait about 15 minutes for our table.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: So they say they are known for their meatloaf. Maybe I don't know meatloaf but this was not their best. Ours came out in about 2 min and was just ok. A very solid block of meat with some ok bread underneath. Dinner rolls were also kind of dry and not fresh. They did make up for it with their walleye and pork chops. Both were great followed by a very good desert. Would love to give 4 stars but the oversight on the meatloaf seems unforgivable.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I must say this was a wonderful experience from the waiter to the food everything was excellent. This was my first visit here and i must say it was a good one. Our waiter cody was excellent he recommended things, he also keep our drinks coming. Also continue to check on us the atmosphere was a nice change of pace what i mean by that is look like an modern day diner. I got the fried chicken and my wife had the fish sandwich both of them were tasty. We had to top it off with a strawberry short cake i have to say this is one of the best short cakes ive had. If you are looking to change it up a lil i say check this place out and ask for cody.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Loved this place! Great menu & atmosphere!Everything we ordered was fresh & delicious-tried the fried calamari, meatloaf, fish & chips, & reuben (with the best corned beef!). Will definitely go again!Went back again for Sunday brunch-was wonderful!!!  Had short rib hash & my daughter had  eggs Benedict-everything done to perfection. We are lucky & considering going back for dinner!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I had the fish, which was somewhat dry, but that's not the specialty there. Will try the diner food next time.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Their happy hour is very nice. You definitely have to try the calamari and the liver and onions served every Wednesday. BTW, the bartender Matt is the incredible. This is my go to casual scene.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Good place with reasonable prices. Service is really nice. Atmosphere is cozy. The food is delicious. Definitely, we should come again.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I eat at Cameron restaurants because of the great gluten free options. The food quality at Cap City, Gahanna has always been consistent and the management staff is excellent.  Cap City will continue to be my go to joint.  Well done!!!Heads up for folks with food allergies: the gluten free lemon cheesecake has an almond base. Unfortunately, the creme brulee (I think the safer bet for nut allergies) was removed from the new menu.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Awesome diner! Has some amazing classic comfort food as well as some eclectic options. My wife is gluten free and was so impressed by the gluten free menu as well as the warm gluten free cinnamon biscuits that were brought by. Great service as well from our waitress, Hannah.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: They've done it again. Once again they've changed the Balsamic chicken to the three dry medallions and left at the same price. They did this once before and it was terrible and I did not return to the restaurant until they changed back to the original Balsamic chicken which was an  airline breast , this was always  Juicy tender and wonderful and I love that dish. The three medallions are always small dry tough no flavor and nasty. They also got rid of the muscles which for a diner they always made wonderfully and it happy hour it was the best appetizer ever. Once again money overrides taste and flavor, the things that bring you back to the diner. I will not be back until they change back to the original wonderful Airline

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Went with my boyfriend and another couple.  Was the first time for most of us.  Was seated immediately.  Our waitress, Lisa had a great personality and took great care of us. We were brought dinner rolls that were dry and there was no butter brought out with them.  2 people at our table ordered the Meat Loaf, one ordered Chicken Romano and I ordered Fish & Chips.  We all pretty much had the same comment about our meals....common.  Our meals had no "KA-POW" to them.  My fish was not crispy battered.  It was limp like it was in a styrofoam container for a while.  The fries were just warm and blah.  The jalapeno cole slaw was pretty good.  For dessert my boyfriend and I each had Creme Brulee and the other couple shared a piece of the pink cake for breast cancer month.  They were all fantastic!!  I think if we come back we will try other meals or just dessert since it was fantastic!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Going to Cap City at Stoneridge?  Get ready to fight for your complimentary cinnamon rolls. We had to ask twice today before the server would bring any.But the food was all good and we were enjoying the meal until we all ran dry of drinks. How hard is it bring a glass of soda? The server then brought drinks after we had finished eating. Finally we bought three overpriced deserts and the banana bread pudding came in a bowl less than half emptyI guess that was not the servers fault but it just left a bad taste which is not why I spent 100+ for Sunday brunchThis CapCity should not be confused with the one in Grandview  It had always been good.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Batman and Robin was on the move @ Cap City and our service was great and our server Magic made it a wonderful experience. We had crab cake appetizer ginger beer drinks with salad and a wonderful chicken pasta dish and capped of the evening with strawberry cheesecake yum! Put this spot on your always a good choice side and ask for Magic he will help make it special!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: What a waste. The food is basic at best and way over priced. Nothing special about their burgers & fries but you'll pay $25 for it. Skip it unless you're feeling like impressing a date with your money.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I have always been a avid Cap City Diner fan.  Today for lunch my wife had her usual Meat Loaf dinner.  I tried something new to me, the Shrimp Banh Mi Wrap.  This is where the the lunch went south.  Our dinners set under the warming lamps for 13 minutes.  I had to go to the gentlemen at the front counter to inform him of this situation.  No one had picked up any food for over 15 minutes until this gentlemen brought us our dinners.  Then there was a flurry of servers picking up food.  My wife's dinner was luke warm.  Mine was the same, but I ate mine.  The server came by after one bite of the Meat Loaf and returned it to the kitchen.  She returned in a few minutes with a hot dinner.  My wife's dinner was what we come to expect.  I ordered a scoop of Vanilla Ice Cream for desert.  Thinking that our server was totalling our bill.  We waited about 10 minutes for our server to return, only to ask if we wanted anything else.  She immediately tallied our bill and we paid and we were done.  Taste of the food was great.  Temperature of food and service, not so hot!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Underwhelming dining experience all around.  Spent 100.00 on dinner for family of five and was very disappointed and wish we went somewhere else.  Froze in our booth from the door opening and closing (poor design) which was perpetuated by very slow service.  From the offer of bringing "hot fresh buns" which were cold and average to food taking entirely too long, we sadly wished we went  to Asian Gourmet next door.  Very disappointing Cameron Mitchell experience.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: After some of the worst service at an Easton restaurant, the staff and manager at Cap City turned a disappointing anniversary diner into an evening we will not forget. We called after walking out of another restaurant and Cap City told us they would be waiting with a secluded booth. They greeted us with flowers and a champagne toast at our table. Our waiter, Magic (sp?) was thoughtful and gave us all the time we needed to turn the evening around. Our food, blue cheese chips, a chicken Milanese Caesar salad and the pork chops were outstanding. The manager came over to wish us a happy anniversary and make sure everything was great! That is an understatement. We cannot be more thankful to the caring staff at Cap City for their delicious food and their commitment to making our night meaningful. We will definitely be back to this location even though it is farther from our house.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Disappointing birthday experience. My husband and I, along with our 2 children went here last night to celebrate my birthday (which was yesterday Sept 27th).  My husband made a reservation and noted it was my birthday.  When we arrived, we were greeted by the hostess who wished me a Happy Birthday and was very friendly.  I would have assumed the birthday message was relayed to our waitress, but we came to find out that it was not.  Our waitress was not very friendly.  She never acknowledged my birthday or anything.  The food was pretty good, as we do love coming to Cap City for milestone celebrations.  The waitress asked us at the end if we'd like dessert, and I asked for the Carrot Cake (which is AMAZING!).  When she walked away... I said to my husband, I bet it won't come out with a candle. He said that he was sure it would because he had noted it in the reservation.  Well... she walked out with no candle in the cake.  When she placed it on the table, my husband nicely asked if she could please bring a candle.  She took the cake back, and returned a minute later with a candle.  She never said Happy Birthday or anything.  When we received our bill, the cake was on there!!  We did ask if birthday celebrations are still acknowledged with a complimentary piece of cake.  She did end up taking it off... it was just a disappointing experience, and not what we've come to expect from Cap City. We may think twice before having a celebration there next time.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Always a great place for a casual easy dinner. We were greeted and seated promptly. We had the chicken wings and calamari as appetizers. My mom and aunt shared the pecan crusted pork chops, which looked really good. My aunt said they were very tender. The meat loaf was good as well and very filling. It is always a treat to come here for dinner whenever I come home to Columbus.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: They are GREAT!! They accidentally gave my order to the wrong person. But they compensated by giving me a soda while was waiting and to top it off they gave us FOUR pieces of chocolate cake. And the ponzu salmon was outstanding! Thanks!!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I love this place so much. A lot of variety and my daughters favorite thing to order is the chocolate cake. You can't wrong with Cameron Mitchell restaurants .

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Starting with spicy Bloody Mary never been here looks great looking forward to mussels and quiche

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: They do the diner classics better with a few different items thrown in. Had a birthday lunch celebration with a few coworkers.Went with the crab cake melt (no melt). A good crab cake with a great English muffin and fruit. Indulgence and some health.Our waitress, Dana was very friendly and attentive. When we asked more questions on the soup of the day (Carmelized onion with mushrooms) she offered to bring a sample. My coworker wanted to take the rest of her ice tea and asked for a to-go cup, then realized we needed to get back for a meeting and to leave without the tea. Dana found us in the parking lot with ice tea in hand. (That alone deserves a star).

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: We went here for a nice dinner before heading to the theater and we had a great time. The pretzel and beer cheese appetizer wasn't the best I've ever had, but it wasn't bad. The table rolls are pretty bland. I ordered the classic cheeseburger and fries and it was AWESOME. Very juicy and tasty. My date ordered the grilled cheese which was also really really good. Lot of food so we were too full for dessert. It's a really busy place so I recommend a reservation. Our waiter was hard to find by the end and we ended up having to find someone to pay our bill. The atmosphere is noisy and busy so this wouldn't be the place for a romantic date. But the food was good!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: We've eaten here pretty often, always good service, great food!  Clean, friendly atmosphere.  We've also never left here without a homemade dessert to go!    Hot, buttered rolls, homemade soups, salads,sandwiches.,.one of our favorite spots!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Cap City Diner in Grandview is one of my favorite Cameron Mitchell restaurants. As the Cap City Diner in Gahanna has pretty much the same menu, you would think that I'd like it just as much. That unfortunately was not the case.First, the building is sorely lacking in natural light and makes the interior look drab. Second, they have less than half the draft beer selection of the Cap City in Grandview. Third, their buttered rolls tasted a little stale compared to the fresh out of the oven fresh that seems to be the standard at Cap City in Grandview.But the dinner entree were still just as plentiful and yummy. We had their pecan crusted porkchop and the southern fried chicken-- both just as good as the version served in Grandview. So if you live on the east side of Columbus, this location is likely still a good dinner option. If you live anywhere else in Columbus however, go to the Cap City in Grandview. It's not that Cap City Gahanna is bad... it's just the Cap City Grandview is exceptional!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Love Cap City ! .... Great Menu .... Great Staff . I also love the decor & environment . Excellent Meatloaf , Fish & Chips , Salads , Chili , Desserts , etc .They do get busy . I prefer to get here early if I can before 12 am . And before 5 for dinner .  Check out Cap City ! Also please look at my other reviews & check ins , you might find someplace new or someplace we both enjoy .  Cheers :)

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I swear this place never fails, great

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I had their Eggs Benedict for brunch and it was pretty tasty. They serve cinnamon rolls before your food comes out and that was exciting. Their coffee was good as well. Was it incredible? No. I'll come back though.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Yes my family and I love this place as it's pretty consistent with quality and flavor. I do have to say I miss the ravioli and the grilled chicken sandwich but the meatloaf and Romano chicken remain so I'm happy!  I got the good old meatloaf as it never disappoints but my hubby got the BBQ chicken salad and he said it lacked chicken.  My son got the triple decker grilled cheese and he thought it lacked in size and the amount of French fries he received. Our server was nice and quite capable but due to the overall experience I can't give it s higher rating which makes me sad.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: This is one of two Cap City Diner locations in Columbus.  It is part of the Cameron Mitchell restaurants that are locally owned.   This local chain began more than 20 years ago.This location is situated in a large strip mall shopping center.   Although plenty of parking around, the location is quite busy, especially on weekends.   I do recommend making reservations on weekends to minimize long waits.  I'd describe the interior as a contemporary looking diner with silver plated doors and red vinyl seating.   It was pretty noisy inside with all the sounds of families celebrating special occasions and a hustling kitchen staff.   Same great menu selections as available at her sister location in Grandview.  I love the "comfort" food, especially their meatloaf.   Portion sizes are generous.  Either come with a hearty appetite or take home what you cannot finish in one seating.  A couple of us had their meatloaf and the others had their pecan encrusted pork chops.   All enjoyed their meals.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Sub-par at best.  This place not only had several fruit flies all over, but the food was underwhelming.  We were hoping for a nice dinner, and ended up not eating at all.  The soup was incredibly salty.  So much, it was inedible.  My husband's burger was pretty greasy, and pretty tasteless.  No spices nor did it contain any flavor.  The fries were pretty salty as well.  It was very disappointing.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: This place is a good standby, whenever we can't think of any place to go we end up here. Yes it's close to home, but it's also got something else going for it: it is consistent! Service is good, food is good...you know what you're getting every time. I highly recommend the mac and cheese and the meatloaf! The shrimp wrap is delicious also :-) if you save room, the mile high chocolate cake is delicious too!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Having relocated to Columbus, I was told to try this restaurant. First time was ok. 2nd time was our last. I had ordered the Reuben on both occasions. The Reuben  I ate last week was dry and stringy. Rather than complain, I left it on my plate. Atmosphere was nice and our server  was attentive. Unfortunately, we will not be returning.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I have been a fan of Cap City for several years... but this visit really took the cake.Less than 30 minutes prior to our arrival, we got up and left from another restaurant down the street...We walked in and were immediately seated, and within 5 minutes, we had our drinks and had placed an appetizer order... and less than 30 minutes after being seated, we had our entrees.We started with the Old Bay Peel and Eat Shrimp - these are enough to bring you back!  The crab louie sauce just adds that extra something... they're also served with the typical cocktail sauce.My husband ordered the meatloaf - he loved it!  The presentation was spectacular.I had the triple decker grilled cheese... it was awesome, but next time I will order it with mayo instread of mustard.The food and our sever, Byrnaise, really saved our evening!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I came here to get the blue plate special: Walleye.  I admit I'm a fish snob;  living On the east coast does that to you.  However, tasting walleye years ago in the mid west changed my mind about buying fish in the middle of the USA.Well, I just finished dinner and I'm already making plans for next Mondays Walleye special.  Service by Chad was great and the manager was very engaging. Ambiance chic and cool American diner.  Definite thumbs up .

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Well, yeah...it was ok.Would I give them my first born child? Eh, not really.Service was "ok", I've had better. Several tables seated around us were seated after but served before we were. Both of which had larger parties, so it didn't make sense. The server was very nice but nothing I haven't seen before. Our dinner started with the Maytag chips. I'm normally a big fan of Maytag chips, but I just didn't really care for the sauce here. My appetizer was also accompanied by a wedge salad which was very tasty with the right amount of toppings.For dinner, I had the short rub which was a blue plate special. Great flavor and you could basically eat this with just a fork, it was THAT tender. The side was carrots and parsnips which is not terribly common. The carrots were as expected and the parsnips were very crisp and light with a sweet flavor. They paired well with the short ribs which are richer and heavier.The better half had the New York Strip which was so so. The flavor was decent but could have used more salt. The vegetables were enjoyable, crisp and decent flavor, nothing over the moon. All in all it was an $80+ dinner, and we walked away asking how. Would I recommend it? Well, I'm fifty fifty I guess. It was good, just seemed a bit overpriced for what we got.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Just dined here tonight with my hubby and 2 kids. A little slower to bring out our entrees but did get regular check ins about the status from the manager. We received 40% off our final bill for the wait and the creme de la creme was the manager waiting at the door with 4 pieces of chocolate cake. Great service great food and fab for families!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: We've only ever been for brunch, and it's terrific... from the complimentary basket of glazed rolls, to the bagel and lox plate or the breakfast burrito. The teenager ordered the stuffed French toast, and it looked incredibly decadent. The Eggs Benedict is perfect with one (or two!) of their delicious mimosas... although they no longer use or serve freshly squeezed orange juice. I do wish it opened a little earlier than 11am on the weekend, but I can usually hold out to make it to Cap City Diner.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: We planned on going here last tuesday and had a reservation for 6pm.While we were on our way, we got a call due to a kitchen fire they were going to be closed that evening.I was dissapointed and expected something to make up for the trouble they offered but nothing other than an apology.Saturday we were in the area again and made a reservation for lunch.It was my husbands birthday and the manager came to apologize about last time and invited us to dessert.Good start, I had asked for a nice table but we were seated right at the kitchen which made it unavoidable to watch and wait for our food being made.We sat right at the screen with the orders which was annoying to watch and hear the time pass and see our order ready under the heatlamps, and moved by 3 different servers, plate wiped, put back again and so on.Sometimes I don't want to know what all is going on before I get my plate or how long it is actually sitting there before it is brought out.About 45 minutes later the food came, romano crusted chicken and breakfast burrito for the birthday boy and the BBQ chicken salad with salmon instead for me.All of it tasted great, was warm, no complaints other than a different table next time.I'm actually pretty glad tuesday dinner got cancelled since saturday and sundays you get the fabulous cinnamon rolls instead of regular rolls, they are probably my favorite thing about Cap City Diner.For dessert we got the chocolate cake, the carrot cake and the peanut butter pie.I don't agree with the other raving reviews of the chocolate cake, sure it is a huge slice but tastewise it is your usual rich devils food cake with chocolate frosting that you can just as well make at home.The carrot cake a bit too "healthy" too many carrots, pineapple, too moist almost raw tasting.Now the peanut butter pie is where its at!Now you won't get a whopping slice like with the first two but the taste will blow you away!Real oreo crust, not the premade grocery one, smooth and silky super peanut buttery, chocolate, whipped cream and peanuts on top.Yup, this was the winner of the day!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I always get the meatloaf and my husband says their liver n onions is the best he's ever had!  You MUST order an appetizer and it has to be the Blue Maytag chips!  To die for!!  Never have a bad experience here!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Cap City is great!  Service is friendly and attentive, and the manager stopped by to see how we were doing.  The decor and menu reflect the fine diner atmosphere very well, with a retro look to the place and a menu that includes blue plate specials and diner favorites.My husband had the Fried Chicken, which is his favorite dish at both locations.  Portion size is generous, and the chicken is moist and juicy with a nice crust.  He especially likes the addition of nuts to the green beans.  Mashed potatoes and gravy round out the meal.The gluten free menu here has more options than at the other location, and they also offer gluten free rolls - including with the delicious cinnamon topping during weekend brunch!  That was a nice touch that I very much enjoyed.  My goal in traveling out to try this Cap City was to try the Crispy Fish & Chips off the gluten free menu, which is not offered at the Grandview location.  It was well worth it!  The fish is moist and flavorful, and the coating, made from Red Bridge gf beer and Bob's Red Mill gf flour, is light and crispy.  The fries were golden and perfect, and the slaw was delicious (and I'm not normally a slaw person).  The serving was quite generous, and I brought half home.Located in a shopping center, this Cap City also wins on ease of parking... it was plentiful, and easy to get in and out of this location.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: True story: A long time ago, this was the first Cameron Mitchell restaurant I ever ate in.More years later than I want to admit, they haven't changed much, but I don't think that's so bad. You go to Cap CIty because you want the upscale diner atmosphere, the drinks, the well executed comfort food (dat mealoaf!!!) and going to a restaurant where the "experience" has been carefully crafted and polished over the years.I've never had a bad meal here, and on the rare occasions where I felt there was a problem, the staff was quick to respond and correct it. Aside from the meatloaf, some of my favorites here are the maytag bleu cheese chips, the crab cake sandwhich (stuffed to the brim with ACTUAL CRAB!), and their blue plate special Beef Stroganoff - fantastic, creamy, and almost overloaded with mushrooms!Somehow, despite going here again and again, I've never been for brunch - always lunch or dinner - but I have no doubt that it's just as solid. Oh, and don't forget to leave room for the truly massive chocolate cake...

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Get the meatloaf. Yum.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Why have a table in bar area if one cannot get service. We sat there for 15 minutes- asked about service, given menus. No service. Not going back. Ever.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Went here the other night to celebrate a birthday and eat before a blue jackets game so it was pretty early.  Reservations were definitely not necessary at 5 pm...  However by 6 pm it was packed so I would definitely recommend reservations for normal dinner time.  It was early so there wasn't much ambiance.  We got stuck at a corner table.  I can tell they tried to give off a 50s diner vibe but it really isn't working at this location.  The one on Olentangy feels much more like a diner.  Something about the darkness of this spot reminds you that you are literally sitting next to a grocery store.We ordered pretty quickly and the food came out eerily fast.   I had the pork chops.  They were tiny if you were Hagrid from Harry Potter (honestly, I shouldn't have to explain that reference).  Okay, so they were massive.  The meat was super tender, but the glaze topping was too sweet and gave me Charlie and the Chocolate Factory flashbacks.  The cheddar mashed potatoes and spinach were  delightful.  I would order this again just for the sides.  That's how good they were.My friend ordered the meatloaf.  It was a massive pile of food that Hagrid couldn't even finish (2nd reference).  Needless to say, we needed boxes after about 5 minutes because we were stuffed full (this is a good thing).We knew we had to get dessert and ordered the key lime pie.  The pie was a work of art and it was pretty tasty.  My only complaint was it needed more lime.  I think everyone who has been falsely accused of opening the chamber of secrets would agree with me (hat trick).The service was excellent but I think I left a little disappointed overall.  I feel like for the price, you should get so much more.  But I would probably go back again if in the area because there isn't much else around here.  Stick to the sandwiches and plan on getting dessert.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Probably the best gluten free fish and chips anywhere!! They really take care of the gluten sensitive with many menu options available.  Service was attentive and timely. I come here every time I'm in Columbus.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Well, the rest of the group settled on Cap for our 200th birthday  (two of us just turned 70 and another 60; add it up).Tad over priced, but pretty decent beer and cheddar soup with bacon crumbles.  JMO, but needed diced green onions too.  I had the meatloaf and I rarely order commercially made meatloaf but had it at the Grandview site and it's pretty good, one other joined me in ordering the meatloaf. Another had salmon, one a veggie plate, one the eggs benedict,  one chicken Caesar, one the Cap City Trio, I believe.Didn't hear any complaints.  We did get desserts.  (they put candles on our celebrant's) and I obviously ordered the wrong dessert, their Big Cup'o Chocolate.  About all I can say is that it was in a big cup, dark brown, warm and sweet. I even saw a couple chocolate morsels but no chocolate flavor at all.I used a credit card.  I do not sign my cards, I put "Request ID" on the signature line.  Obviously never looked at the back, so ID wasn't requested.    Wonderful to see people again.  We all worked together at one time.  Took our time and at no time felt rushed.  Other than the CC, our server was fine.  Fun and food, what can you complain about.Just not someplace I'd go far out of my way to go back.  YMMV.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Great food and fast service.  Went there for lunch and quickly got a table and ordered food.  I would go back anytime.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: As I'm fairly new to the Columbus area, I'm never short on suggestions from co-workers and acquaintances on what restaurants are the best in the area. I've heard from several people that Cap City is a Columbus-must, so we finally gave it a shot last night. They take reservations, which is always a plus on my list! I made a reservation for 7:30 on a Friday night - but we were just too hungry and made it in about 20 minutes early. It was busy and bustling with people, but there wasn't a wait and we were seated right away! I was surprised when we walked in the door... nothing about the restaurant screams "Diner" to me, outside of some diner-like options on the menu. Maybe it's just me, but when I think of "diner" I think of the atmosphere more than I think of the food. It's supposed to be a diner/artsy mixture, but I really didn't feel the diner vibe at all. Not having my expectations met wasn't a bad thing - I loved the decor and the vibe of the place, it was casual but not too casual, full of a variety of ages... there were couples and families and big groups.Our waitress was excellent. She made us feel the "fine" in Fine Dining & Bar. She was professional and polite, knowledgeable about the menu, available throughout our experience, friendly, and efficient! Now, the food! If you're looking for super cheap drinks, you're not in the right place. The cheapest beer on the menu was $4.50, which for a Bud Light, is not impressive. I ordered the non-alcoholic Peach Palmer and it came with an adorable little pitcher of its own, which ended up being about 2 1/2 drinks worth. Not bad for $3.49. Your meal starts with BREAD, which for some is an unwanted temptation and for others the most exciting part of the meal :-) These do make me think diner, if by diner you mean cheap and bland. Not great. Definitely not up to par with the menu items they offer.My husband got the Romano Crusted Chicken. It was good but not spectacular. The sauce was delicious, but the chicken didn't bring anything special to the table. I don't know that it's worth $17.29... but then again, it's one of the cheaper items on the "large plates" menu, so maybe if you spend more money you get your money's worth ;-) I got the Crab Cake Melt for 13.49 and it was AH-MAZING. The jalapeno remoulade really made the difference for me. I was unsure about the English Muffin when I ordered it, but I wouldn't have it any other way. I loved, loved, loved it!! Cap City really is a great experience with delicious food but I'm going to have to take a star away for the price. I don't know that I'm a fan of a casual atmosphere with a non-casual menu and price tag. If I want to spend a little more money on good food, I'm usually up for more of a "date night" atmosphere with a little bit of fancy in the mixture. There were kids everywhere, which is appropriate in the atmosphere, but I don't think I want to spend the money to eat at a place that has a mother and young son in a bit of a verbal brawl at the next table. Great experience, just not my style.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Great food, fantastic service!!! The romano chicken is one of my favorites and I finally tried the Carrot Cake after hearing so many people rave about it. I have to say it was pretty good.. but doesn't compare to mine!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: It was our first time here - my wife and I decided to take our daughter and my wife's parents here for dinner. They like meat and fish, I am a vegetarian (not vegan).Your meal starts with buttered rolls for everyone at the table. They were pretty good, my wife says she's had better.Two veggie options that I saw: 3-cheese grilled cheese or black bean veggie burger.  I do love black bean burgers, but since I'm quite familiar with them, I went for the grilled cheese. It had tomatoes, fried egg, scallions, and a dijon mayonnaise sauce. It was very good, as were the fries. You get your choice of fries, fresh fruit, coleslaw, or a couple of other things with any sandwich.My daughter had the kids' mac and cheese, which I also sampled. Very tasty.My mother-in-law ordered the fish and chips and my father-in-law ordered Philly Cheese steak. They both enjoyed their meal.We all agreed that the fries were very good. The service was great too, the waiter was on task the entire time, although it was pretty slow (Friday at 5pm).Plenty of soft drinks, wine, beer, and other to choose from. I was surprised that just offered "coffee", but nothing like a capuccino or special coffee drink, which I was sort of craving. But they are going for a standard diner menu, so I guess this makes sense.The decor and atmosphere were great. It was sort of a classic diner meets swanky restaurant type of feel. Kudos to the designers for the look and feel.I would recommend this place. If you're a meat eater, you have so much to choose from. Everything sounded pretty good, although a bit pricey. We're talkin' $10-20 a plate if you get anything more fancy than a grilled cheese. You're also paying for the experience of dining here. Even as a veggie, I was pleased. I'd go again - I don't know whether I'd get the grilled cheese again, the mac and cheese (if there is an adult portion), or the black bean burger!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: One of my favorite places. Cameron Mitchell doesn't disappoint. Try the cranberry crush cocktail. Its a must!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Love Cap City!! Food is excellent!! I haven't had anything I didn't like, plus their gluten free fish & chips are super great. My brother in law has Celiac disease & has never had gluten free breaded fish like theirs! Service is great! Nothing negative at Cap City!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I give Cap City Diner 4.5 stars.  This restaurant has been a consistent player in excellent American classics since opening day.  Great decor, dining area, and energy!  The food is consistently good or better and you always know what to expect.Came in for lunch and ordered the Cap City Meatloaf.  It's a great, consistent product and a fan favorite.  Before the entree, fresh, buttered dinner rolls were served.  Pillowy, soft, fresh, and rich.  You can't eat just one!After a few short minutes the Mile High Meatloaf arrived.  The presentation was excellent and looked very close to Cameron's cookbook, "The Art of the Meal."  A garlic bread base, mashed potatoes, the ground veal, beef, and pork meatloaf, BBQ gravy, and crispy onions on top. Surrounded by a few choice pieces of steamed broccoli seasoned with butter.  To me, a rich, flavorful "special occasion" dish that is meant for mild indulgence.  Risked my life in "white out" snow conditions on 315 and I-270 for this meal!  Haven't had this dish in a few years, but as good as I always remembered it.For the most part, a great dining experience.  Great food, decor, and for the most part service.  My only mild complaint was that I ran out of water before the server offered to refill.  Everything else was excellent!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I think this might be my brunch spot for the forseeable future. I need to explore the myriad of lemonades on the menu. There were 3 of us at brunch yesterday, all sleepy and starving. This place hit the spot. The other 2 had mimosas while I went for the strawberry basil lemonade. The only thing I liked better than the lemonade was the rolls they set out; they were the usual Cap City rolls but with butter, cinnamon/sugar and a drizzle of glaze. The boyfriend was away from the table and we had to force ourselves to leave him one. I ended up with the breakfast burrito which was spicy, yet flavorful. It was stuffed with chorizo sausage and a light smattering of eggs (perfect proportions, IMO). The boy had the steak and eggs which looked good, although he wasn't impressed with the potatoes on the side. Our third had the stuffed french toast which looked amazing. She said they were sweet but not too sweet. Overall, I was pleased. We walked out of there a little lighter in the wallets but pleasantly full and happy.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: We purposely planned our Fathers Day dinner the week following the holiday, so they would not be super busy. Our plan was perfect. Our waiter (I think his name was Cody or Cory) he was FABULOUS attentive super friendly knew enough about the food to discuss it! The food was amazing. we started with the flat bread pizza and the maytag chips of course, both of those were WONDERFUL.  I had the blackened salmon salad just PERFECT!!   no issues with not wanting onion on my salad and dressing on the side.   My mil had seared salmon on her salad again a little change not a problem!!!   my daughter had the chicken ceasar  again just the way she likes it.   my husband had a burger a Fabulous burger just the way he ordered it.  and dessert....   big chocolate cake chocolate covered peanut butter pie and carrot cake.   absolutely perfect!!!   we had a wonderful family meal and as always lots of left overs .....

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: The crabcake along with the tomatoes salsa was great crabcake could use just a little more broiling time. Liver and onions the Wednesday special was Excellent I would have to give it five.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I was a frequent customer at their older location near campus, this location is in a strip mall, but it is much less crowded, same good food. A great place to grab lunch before heading out to the mall

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Triple Decker Grilled Cheese?  YES, please!  I love me some Cap City.  I'm a simple girl.  I don't want to branch out and try new, fancy dishes, and that is why I love Cap City.  It's a place where I can go to order an upscale grilled cheese, while friends order "fancier" dishes.  I typically visit the Olentangy location, but I met some friends for dinner at the Gahanna location last week.  Our service was fantastic.  The waiter was attentive, friendly, and fast - which ended with him getting a nice tip!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: First of all, six people do not fit in a booth. Period.  I have always really enjoyed Cap City, however, it has been several years since our last visit.  So when we planned to visit for a birthday celebration I was excited to get back there.  We made a reservation for six and were seated fairly quickly when we arrived.  I was extremely disappointed to see the hostess walk us to a booth built for four and expect 6 adults to squeeze in.  If this meal was going to cost me $50 instead of $150, I still would have been disappointed with crowding in.  I couldn't say anything because I wanted to be sure I didn't ruin the mood.We all ordered interesting meals and they all were served professionally and looked great.  The part that really surprised us was that there is zero flavor in their food.  The pork chops were tough and bland.  The best thing on the plate was the cooked greens.  What did I just say? That's crazy.  The crusted chicken didn't have flavor either.   The southern fried chicken? Same thing.  What goes in this stuff? It all taste the same.  How do they make it look so good?  But can't give it a flavor or seasoning that makes it special?  I really thought that this food came off of a healthy recipe menu being pushed by Dr Oz.One of us were lucky and ordered the popular meatloaf and it was as good as we remembered it.  For that I give it the three stars.  The restaurant looks great and it is filled with people.  Makes it an interesting place to go.I did forget how bad their cheese dip is in the pretzel appetizer.  Don't order that.  The rolls that are served are as plain as a cheap piece of white sandwich bread.  Don't waste the calories.  Order another drink instead.We had a really awesome waiter so it was an OK dining experience.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I have never been disappointed in a Cameron Mitchell restaurant so I was not surprised I love this place. it is the perfect place for lunch or brunch. It has a laid back come as you are kinda vibe. If you come with kids they will give you a little metal lunch box with toys to keep them entertained. As a parent there is nothing better than content kids who aren't complaining about the wait. The maytag potato chips are craveable.  The meatloaf is so good and the potatoes are amazing. I love that, like all Cameron Mitchell restaurants, the have a fresh bar. No crappy bottled sour mix here. Maybe one of these times will actually save room for carrot cake!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: great food, always top notch service, one of the best all around places for a good meal in columbus. get the carrot cake!!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Absolutely love the food & excellent service. Always consistent & leave happy & full everytime. Love the pork chops & pretzel appetizer. Staff is always super friendly & accomodating no matter our party size. Brunch is amazing & love the cinnamon rolls.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Hubby found this place on yelp and we stopped by for HH. He had beer and I had a cucumber cocktail. Most I tried has a hint of cucumber, this has strong taste of it. Just what I was looking for in a cuke cocktail but never found. We started w HH muscles then had 2 more orders after that. They were delish. Also had the crab cake, was very good too. I definitely will come back to try dinner if I'm ever in this neighborhood again.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: We dined for Easter.  We sat at the bar where the service was fast and attentive.   The meatloaf was outstanding.  The fried chicken was good but a little much on the honey for my taste.  We also had a slice of apple pie for desert where  the meal took a turn. We really did not like the pie.  I prefer a flaky pie crust made in the classic way with shortening.  The pie crust was made with butter and was the texture of a croissant.  It was very bad tasting and the texture was awful.  The seasoning of the pie was also poorly flavored.  I think they are trying too hard.  Use the home cooked inspiration you got for your meatloaf, fellas and apply it to you apple pie.  The slice was large but 8 bucks?  Not close to good value.  Cap city is good but  I'd avoid the apple pie until they get a new recipe.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: The hostesses were rude when directing me where to pick up a to go order. After two words I was interrupted by " at the bar." Well there is no pick up order here sign directlijg me so I didn't appreciate her rudeness. good food, bad service.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I really feel something is lacking at this location compared to other restaurants with the Cameron Mitchell name.Service seems very slow and generally lacking. I was disappointed overall.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I love this restaurant and its menu, but I prefer the Olentangy location over the Gahanna location.The staff here are very slow, and not as friendly. I came here at 5:30 on a Wednesday evening for dinner. By the time we ordered, ate our food, and paid for our bill, it was 7:45 PM. We didn't have to wait for a table when we arrived, nor were there people waiting when we left.If I'm desperate, I'll come to this location, but from now on, I plan on staying in one place.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I really liked Cap City, and my service was great both times. The crab cake appetizer was rather small, but I had the Lox the next time, and it was a better portion, and very good!

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Usually have a good experience here but feel like it is going down hill. Last experience was just lack of service. We ordered an appetizer which was taking awhile, when I inquired about it our meal was being delivered. Definitely watch what they charge. I ordered a $38 bottle of wine and when I looked at the check they charged me $46. They did correct after I brought to their attention. Definitely left a bad taste in our mouth.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Great decor. Great food. Interesting concept with the "fine" dining diner. Won't be back though. Way too pricey for this environment for me. If I'm going to spend on the higher end then I want to be in a higher in restaurant. Good selection, good food, and service was excellence.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: I was a little skeptical before we chose this place however as soon as we walked in it was like a time warp of the 60's. Reminded me of a real diner back in the day but very contemporary. I was very impressed by the dÌ©cor. You just don't see places like this anymore. I wanted a cheeseburger and fries. Now I can only eat homemade burgers so I was a little worried. I ordered it medium well. Let me tell you, this was probably the best burger I ever had. It was cooked to perfection. The cooking area was extremely clean and organized. After dinner we ordered dessert.  Not wanting a large slice of cake that I would never finish, the waitress split the cake slice into thirds. That is how big one slice is. We took it to-go because we were so full. Later while in my hotel room I ate the cake. OMG, this chocolate cake was amazing. Very moist and the chocolate wasn't overpowering. Make sure you try one of their desserts.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: My mom and I came here for lunch after getting pedicures for a girls day out last weekend. It was a Saturday in early afternoon and there weren't many people. Cap City is a Cameron Mitchell restaurant, so the decor and atmosphere feel fancy, but the food is good diner eating. I tried the blackberry and sage lemonade and it was very good, but sweeter than I normally like for lemonade. To eat, I got the chicken Milanese salad, which was a very delicious (probably the best I ever had) caesar salad with chicken Milanese on top. It was a HUGE salad and very tasty. I don't order salads often, but I would get this one again.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
column6: Great food and pretty good service. Had a most excellent veggie burger and chocolate cake was the bomb. Only issue I have is price. Just a bit too much. They are not the high end joint they are pretending to be.

column1: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar - Gahanna
