The food here is amazing... We went for brunch and everyone loved their food.Sadly, the kitchen was very slow.... Took a very long time to get our food. And the restaurant was not at all busy.

Came here on a recommendation while in town for work.  The grilled salmon with mashed potatoes was really good and reasonable priced.  Nicely seasoned salmon which was cooked to perfectly.  Service was solid.  I will certainly return here again before the year is over.

Brunch is fantastic! It's not cheap, but the dishes are very elevated and delicious. We were there with a party of 20 and everyone really enjoyed everything they ordered. I'm excited to visit for dinner sometime soon!
We enjoyed several incredible items from the appetizer menu!! Wow!! Wonderful!  The ambience, the service, the food...were perfect!!  We will be returning soon!! :)

This is Cameron Mitchell's Napa themed place with numerous vino choices-loved the 14 Hands cab. We heard they have a short menu here, and that's true. You can't get a steak and they've a lot of soups and salads. We started out with the Dip Trio app, loved the oily chips and the fresh tasting guacamole. The hummus and the trout seemed a little off. Had the red pepper soup with croutons and a teeny-tiny (seriously eency-weency) dollop of goat cheese in the middle, what I tasted of the cheese was delicious and a tad more (please?) would've made a perfect soup course. Entrees were a moist roast chicken with colcannon and a heavenly tangy reduction. Companion had the French Dip. His roasted cornwith tomatoes, avocado and radish slices was surprisingly distinctive. A well toasted bun for the sandwich would've been perfect. The toffee bread pudding? Sweet and salty and I almost fainted.  A staff suggestion, don't be afraid to admit you don't know how to mix a particular cocktail, just ask the customer.

This was our second time here, first was for Valentine's Day and I neglected to write a review at that time for whatever reason....Anyways!  Went tonight for dinner.  Started out with the Cheese Rolls and the Shrimp Taquitos (they are KILLER).For entrees, my fiancee ordered the cheeseburger with coleslaw as a side, and she said it was pretty friggin awesome.  The fish of the day was swordfish, so I went for that.  Came out very good, but not the best I've had; that's not really a knock on it because it was tasty, but I've had better.  I swapped sides for the roasted corn/avocado mix and it was awesome.  No dessert this time because we were full.  Overall, pretty good experience.  I think I will try the scallops next time, or a sushi roll to see how they are.

I stopped for lunch. The bar tender helped me out. He had great amount of knowledge about what they were serving and was able to explain them in details. I had a soup  and salad, which both tasted well and fresh. They had a warm dessert with date that was really good. Definitely a good place for food
Great food wonderful staff especially the bar tender Colin! Highly recommend this place

Second time visiting Hudson 29, both times quite good, hearty portions whether you're getting a steak, cheeseburger, sushi or salad. Recommend the chicken sandwich, cheeseburger, surf & turf roll, volcano roll. Great attentive service as well from all staff!

Service was great.  Preston was very interactive and very friendly.  True hospitality.  Hence the three star, otherwise it would have been two.  The food was good, bordering on very good, but WAY over priced for the quality and presentation.  Atmosphere was solid; good lighting and music volume.  This was a good meal and experience at $20 a person, not $35 a person.The more I think about it and the family talks about it, it was overall disappointing.  My Blood Orange margarita tasted like a cheap pink grapefruit carbonated soda.  Zero alcohol taste.  It just stinks that 20 mins after leaving, no one has anything nice to say about the experience,  besides how nice Preston was.

Picture this:You're hanging out with one of your besties and begin to feel the hangry pains surfacing. It's Saturday, and not quite in the mood for breakfast yet lunch doesn't seem appropriate just yet. You want to try a new place but don't feel like driving all over the city. Easton is going to be a mad house, and it's a game day so downtown is out for what you're looking for. You head to the Yelp app hoping for inspiration and then you see it. Hudson 29. You've heard great things from Bryant M. and Keith M. about the bottled cocktails and dinner entrees. You quickly download the menu, anxiously anticipating the results. You examine the menu hastily. And then - you see itPineapple upside down donuts. You swing the car in drive and take off!______________Hudson 29 is beautiful restaurant that is perfect for fancy occasions and weekend brunches. After crushing over the bar with high cushion sits, bitters, and bourbons, we were lead to our booth with wine bottle openers on the outside. Our waitress was an absolutely perfect - courteous and quirky. She answered all my random questions, and surprised us with a bottle of the soon to be released Manhattan. We ordered our drinks, donuts, and entrees. I selected the chef's omelet which was filled with shrimp and goat cheese - delish. My drink was every bit of delightful and I was pleasantly surprised by the smooth flavor the bottled cocktail provided.And the donuts, oh these sweet morsels were accompanied with a delicious housemade caramel sauce that should really have a dedicated day to honor the greatness that it is.

Relatively frequent patron of several of the Cameron Mitchell restaurants in town. Maybe I am jaded to expect more out of the CM family. This was just OK as far as we were concerned.  We had a party of 6 adults finally enjoying a night out without kids before the insanity of Christmas reached Defcon 1. The service would have been fine if we were at Longhorn, I expected a little more finesse from a restaurant of this caliber. The food too was just "goods" not great. I will say that the cocktails were great and the service we received at the bar before being seated was great. Next time we will go to The Barn or another CM location or save a ton of money and have Mellow Mushroom next door.

Hudson is ok however it's like anything else in New Albany everything is just kind of overpriced for average food . If you drive like 10 minutes you can get equal food if not better for a lot less price. however I understand if I was putting a restaurant in the middle of a lot of rich people I would do the same thing
The cocktails are nice. My wife enjoyed the Blackened Snapper. Or friend's printer rib was good. The sushi can be described as Insipid and tasteless.
Really have no idea why I continue to come here. The wait and greeting staff are rude and we do not get treated the way we expect to from a Cameron Mitchell's restaurant. Terrible!

Good experience in a great location.  Not an everyday eatery but a nice upscale dinner at best. The service was amazing, the food was delicious, the ambiance was amazing and the patio was perfect for a nice day. We ordered a few hand crafted drinks that we both enjoyed. We got an appetizer that was unique,  shrimp Taquitos.  Usually I think of Taquitos as a corn tortilla rolled with a filling but not here, it was lightly breaded shrimp with a pop of flavor. Interesting and a huge risk with that name. I ordered the Salmon.  It was served with a couscous salad of kale, raisins,  almonds and radish.  The salmon was perfectly grilled but paired with the couscous salad it made me want a sauce. It was rather dry.  My husband got the prime rib that was initially overcooked for medium. It was very tough and hard to chew. We get prime rib medium at other establishments and got a slightly pink throughout and the server made us know that the chef said it was medium rare we wanted. Either way, they quickly resolved our concern and happily enjoyed the prime rib thereafter. I am looking forward to my next experience at Hudson 29 and ready to try something new.

There were four of us on a rainy Wednesday for dinner. I had read the reviews of people who have written more than five (I never bother with the "one and done" reviewer.  We had a very good server **** who explained that the restaurant was named Hudson for the Hudson River. If you go you will hear it all. We shared the outstanding three dip appetizer recommended by the server. A scoop each of guacamole, hummus and smoked trout with crisp tortillas. Since the portions are large we chose to split the misnamed Reuben * ($17.00) with a side of roasted corn & avocado salad *. The corned beef is house made and rather dry with an unpleasant strange flavor. The bread was a marble rye. The braised sour cabbage was a disappointment in texture and flavor. I never found the swiss cheese. There was generous amount of corned beef. It looked good. The corn in the salad was not fresh and sweet. Our friend tried the Cantonese Chicken & Noodle Salad, she found it quite oily and mentioned it to the waitress. So, go for the good service and ambiance. It is a sports bar and the tvs are on. From my seat in the dining area the tv was obvious. I might go back for happy hour to have a drink and the $12.00 dip trio. Stick with the appetizers.

Our family loves this place. I like that you can get a sandwich or a steak or sushi. The drinks are always on point and sometimes you can snag a last minute reservation on a Saturday or Friday night. We come here for birthdays and get a free dessert which is nice. The chicken sandwich is fantastic and enough for two. I like the sushi and my wife likes the fish special whatever that is. We will keep going here. It's a great addition to New Albany.

Beautifully kept restaurant with top quality service. I will admin I'm not a fine dining kind of guy and this place calls for elegant meals paired with a good wine but it doesn't have to be. They also have creative menu options for a nice quiet meal. I had their house made ginger beer, roasted corn and Avocado with a Black Bean burger. The Black Bean burger was made from scratch and was really good and really big. It was kind of messy to eat but was filling and I really enjoyed it.Good experience. Overall I would say this place is more for formal business meals or family gatherings. Not so much for a meal on your own as it is pricey.

Food and service is always consistent at the New Albany location. Ambiance is a little dark for dinner, but I enjoy this. I have enjoyed the trio of dips as well as the prime Rib on visits. Good Gluten free menu. All Cameron Mitchell Restaurants do goi with this though. Hudson 29 has become my go-to spot now.

This is a nice Cameron Mitchell restaurant. It is on the expensive side. The food was delicious. The breaded chicken sandwich was very good. The corn and avocado side is light and refreshing. And if you save room for dessert, the pineapple upside down donut holes are absolutely amazing! While it was an expensive meal; the food and atmosphere outweighed the cost.
Soooo good! :) Had brunch here, loooved that it was still being offered at 2:30pm! I ordered the french toast, and it was seriously unbelievable. Service was also top notch and great ambiance.
Only been twice but it's right in line with what you'd expect from CMitchell. Really good food for a price. I would really recommend the cheese burgers. It's their specialty and holy cow it's good.

Always a great experience.... add military friendly.We recently had dinner to celebrate the home coming of our daughter that is active duty service person. The staff made her feel welcomed and expressed their gratitude for her service. It was the perfect topper to a great dining experience.

My friend and I decided to go try this place for Restaurant Week and to try out the pre-selective menu. I chose the sushi roll appetizer. Itself was a meal. Then I chose the salmon with spinach and fennel. This was hands down The Best seasoned and cocked to perfection piece of fish!! Applause to the Chef!! It was amazing!! And the chocolate sheet cake with ice cream was u believable. To die for!! Over all can I say this is a top notch establishment. Our server Lauren was new to the staff but she took care of us with exceptional service!!! We will definitely be back!!

I expected the food and service to be great as this is in the Cameron Mitchell family, and my husband and I have dined here before. However, our server Erin, was absolutely wonderful. You can tell she really enjoys her job and made our celebratory Thursday night out wonderful. Thank you Erin! You are lovely!

Went to Hudson tonight sept 21 -- the food was good. The bartender whom I think is the manager because it takes him forever to make a drink -- I had a martini that was half full -  no - you pay $12 for a  you need to fill it to the rim. Okay service.  Will go back.

My favorite cmr restaurant ever. Have been to the lane ave location a few times and am happy that this location is closerTo my neck of the woods! The scallop dish is so amazing. It is served over greens with golden beets. I also love the King Kong sushi roll and the trio dip. Great to share. Another must try is their carbonated drinks they used to have a bourbon cola (didn't see it on the menu last time I went) but I ordered the grapefruit and margarita drinks last timeAnd they were just as great! Pretty much something for everyone on this menu

Our second time after a soccer game with our kids and my mom - one of our favorites! The quest dip is a must and the steak and enchilada is delicious. Kids meals were great too. As was the chicken sandwich!Service can make or break an experience and review - we had Erin and would give her 10 stars!!!!We even had dessert because we didn't feel like leaving

To begin, I rarely bother writing reviews for places I eat at. Just don't normally ever get around to it. This place however has compelled me to leave one! Is it kinda pricey, yes. Is it worth it, absolutely. Everything we had was fantastic!! From apps, to mains, and lastly dessert, it was all on a higher level than what I had gone in expecting. I cook for a living and take pride in what I do, and this place left me wondering how the hell they created some of the flavors I was enjoying. Our waiter was terrific and attentive as well. I will definitely be returning in the future and recommending friends and family to try them out as well. I went in expecting pretty good gastropub style food based on the menu, but in actuality the food, plus the ambiance, delivered so much more. If you haven't tried Hudson 29, you absolutely should !

Four of us ate at Hudson 29 last Saturday night for my Birthday dinner.  The food was wonderful and the waitress was attentive but not overbearing.  We enjoyed the sushi for an appetizer.  We ordered the pan seared scallops, center cut filet, blackened snapper and the slow roasted prime rib.  All the meals were perfect!

Nice ambiance great bar set up. Meal was a bit expensive with each person getting two glasses of wine...our fault. Most meals were good, scallops and sushi very nice. St Louis BBW ribs were horrible unfortunately I talked my friend also into this selection. Ribs were over cooked  to begin with  and served dry and tasteless. Comped one of our dinner not sure why not both, we could only eat about 40% of each dinner, oh well Not again when there are other great restaurants near by like ELLA bistro right up the road.

Had lunch their today.  Ordered the chorizo con queso app and it was decent.  However, the two stars were for a very disappointing cheeseburger and side of colcannon potatoes.   The burger was cooked fine but it was almost inedible due to the sodium dumped on it.  And the potatoes were Sahara dried out.  One bite is all I could do.  Didn't make fuss being in a business meeting but felt I got far less than what I paid for.

As a concept Hudson 29 borrows a lot from Houston's both in menu and in atmosphere. We've been there several times and the best way to describe it is "predictable", except for the service.  An occasional nudge to the manager may get someone to your table, but be prepared for the awkward apologies. There's a decent drink menu with cocktails, a nice wine list and a few draft beers that rarely change. Speaking of change, don't expect the menu to do so. If I had to guess, the soup today is carrot ginger. The rest of the menu can be recited from memory after only a few visits. The special features often rotate and re-appear. The menu is eclectic (code word for trying to be everything to everyone). You like sushi? We got sushi! You like Carrot Ginger soup? Yep, we DEFINITELY have that! The problem is if your menu is going to be written in stone tablets you better do each dish really well. That's where Hudson falls down. Their signature burger is greasy, the burger-to-bun ratio is all wrong, and it lacks seasoning. Unfortunately other dishes follow suit. Given the diversity of offerings they should embrace the ability to mix up the menu on a very regular basis. If not they will surely lose customer interest.
Second time at this location. Service is great without being over the top. Food is awesome and prices are not out of line with the quality of food versus other restaurants.

Stopped by for lunch. ...we had scallops and the marinated flank steak....Both were amazing though I would love more scallops...only got 3...sad face...the steak was out of this world... desert was the pineapple upside down donuts. ....ouch...insanely good...worth the trip

These were the things I noticed and appreciated about my Sunday Brunch experience!-Beautiful patios, one covered, one with umbrellas, depending on how much sun you desire. Beautifully planted flower pots overflowing with spring flowers.-Superb menu, nice variety, fairly priced, big selection, delicious & beautifully prepared.-Interesting & diverse range of customers.The staff was gracious and very attentive. Everything you would expect from Cameron Mitchell.My only request: I would like to see his restaurants include "organic food selections". It surprises me that he is slow to join the organic food movement, when it's clearly growing so rapidly. More and more people want to know where their food in coming from and what's in it, including me.

Nice little restaurant in New Albany....a step up from the typical mid-range chains.  I had the black bean burger.  I was hesitant to order it because most BB burgers are made with cumin and I'm not a fan.  I was pleasantly surprised when I took my first bite and there was no cumin!  Fries were good as well.  I will definitely return for lunch or dinner when I'm in town again.  Looking forward to trying some other things so I can hopefully bump them up a star.

I went for the Brunch on Easter Sunday... Started with Bloody Mary, pretty good... Comes with grape tomato and mozzarella ball.. Cost was $10 which I thought was high for the quality of the drink..appetizer ordered pineapple upside down cake donuts... Best thing we experienced... Come out hot, with a chocolate/caramel dipping sauce... Reminded me of a beignet.., please order as a desert or appetizer.. You won't be sorry. I ordered for brunch a Crab Benedict, basically eggs Benedict with a very small portion of crab... Portion size of dish was small, I think it was $15... Not worth it.. Came with a small salad - Tasty but small.. And a really small cup of Fruit... My girlfriend ordered the Short Rib Hash, it was better than my dish, again small portion, served with tortilla chips.. Service was very good... Overall I would rate the experience as disappointing for a Cameron Mitchell restaurant ... Maybe the Hudson 29 in UA is better...

We visited on a Sunday for brunch, were able to sit at the bar and watch football while enjoying some delicious (Cameron Mitchell standard) small plates. I got a very creamy tomato bisque that was exploding with flavor and exactly what I was hoping for along with the corn and avocado salad (I highly recommend this combo- YUM!).  My husband got the crispy chicken sandwich- he said it was great, it was gone before I could snitch any of it!  I did snag a fry from his plate- delish! Nice ambiance, very accommodating staff who make you feel right at home, and a fantastic location.
Our experience was fabulous here. The wait staff was more than attentive and helped us pair wine to our meal. We got 2 sushi rolls and they were both fantastic. This is a must try place

My husband took me here for my birthday on a recommendation from a friend and co-worker. OMG was this place amazing! It was just a romantic dinner for two. This was no problem with how the restaurant was set up with fluted glass dividers, very manly sheik looking. The atmosphere was beautifully done  Kuddos to the designer! Our server was amazing, she was very friendly and attentive but not overly. She gave great recommendations for drinks, appetizer's and dinner.... We were too stuffed to eat desert. We started with a Fresca which was vodka and grapefruits, OMG was it delicious. Then we had a trio nibbly that included homemade guac, humus and smoked salmon. This was to die for! For our meals we had the Gerber Chicken and the Seared Scallops. It was melt in your mouth good. Even though I was full I did not want to stop eating it was so good. What an amazing birthday! Thanks Hudson 29!Just in closing, my husband is very critical of food locations and his parting words as we left were, "I really hate dropping a great deal of money on a dinner for two unless it was a great overall experience and this is one of those places that fit the bill all the way around. We will be coming back here!"

We went for the first time to this restaurant and it was terrible. The table had crusty food on it. The mojito was all ice and the server had to be told to bring me a frosty glass with my beer. The meat was so over cooked it was like eating bark. My husbands sushi was no good either. The server did not know what to do when I answered her question about the quality of the food honestly. I had to ask to see the manager. We will never return. Cameron Mitchell has failed here.
Outstanding food, amazing service! The waitress was very knowledgeable of the menu and very helpful and friendly. The food was perfect!
Chef Wayne was very accommodating and crafted a tasty vegan rigatoni with marinara and veggies for me off menu. Thanks a lot guys

Another cameron mitchell restaurant.  Nice atmosphere.  My favorite cameron mitchell restaurants are Ocean Club and The Pearl. This one has an eclectic assortment with about ten sushi rolls, five salads, 7 sandwiches and a random assortment of main courses like scallops, ribs and chicken.  I tried the dip trio, shrimp taquitos and mashed potatoes.  My friends tried the french dip and gerber chicken.  The chicken dish looked good and was well received and the sandwiches were huge, no one could finish more than a half.  I think next time i'll try a sushi roll, salad or fried chicken sandwich.  The two appetizers were overpriced and otherwise unremarkable.  Theres ample parking behind the restaurant.  I was here on a Sunday evening and the service was slow, we waited for our waitress to order and to get the check more than would be expected at a cameron mitchell establishment.  I've heard the cocktails are good here so will try another time.  A nice touch was that the cream for coffee was served warm.

Service is absolutely outstanding! We had dinner/drinks in the bar and it was apparent that this restaurant is properly run. Our waitress was so smooth and quiet. We had a few sushi rolls which were outstanding as well as several craft cocktails. Will definately be back!

Good, but definitely pricey for what you get. We ate lunch there and had the cheeseburger and the buttermilk chicken sandwich. The cheeseburger is apparently the chefs special he developed the pickleMayo specifically. Honestly I wasn't that impressed. The Burger was ok- not great and the fries were really greasy. The buttermilk chicken was AMAZING. This should be a meal by itself. But it was placed on a boring bun with the usual toppings and .... Kale. Yes no lettuce here just kale. I'm all for some good kale chips but on my burger and chicken sandwich? I'll stick with some bib lettuce, romaine, ice burg, anything. Dessert however is a different story! Sheet cake was amazing! Next time I'll skip the entree and just do apps and dessert

Hudson's bar is spacious and nice with many choices of cocktails and nice wines.  I enjoy sitting there for dinner.  The restaurant is small but they have an outside dining area.  For the most part the food is quite good,

I decided to have a few small dishes instead of a large meal for lunch.  Everything was very good!  The shrimp taquitos were so good I almost canceled everything else so I could get two more portions of shrimp.  I also had salad, corn chowder, and sampled my moms sushi all of it was great.

Had the prime rib sandwich.  Very good.  My wife is gluten free and she was able to order the same thing but with an actual, fresh-baked gluten free bun.  She said it was great.  The venue is very cool with good parking.  Happy hour specials were so so.
Cheese bread rolls, queso dip, Caesar salad, house bottled cocktails, donuts and Andes mints on the receipt. Love this place!

We dined here on a Saturday March 19th. We had a reservation and were seated quickly. I could see coming here more frequently for drinks and appetizers if we lived close by because we enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant, . We tried the Shrimp Taquitos and the Dip Trio. Both appetizers were excellent, the Taquito sauce was delish and the trout dip from the Dip trio was outstanding, we were all raving about it. Mix a little of the guacamole with the trout dip with the tasty lime tortilla chips! We ordered a variety of mixed drinks, I had the Blood Orange Magarita, other ordered the El Presidente and Daisy, some ordered two drinks! They use high quality ingredients they were well worth the $10. I ordered the Prime Rib with the colcannon mashed potatoes. 3 of us ordered the prime rib all at the recommended medium rare which was perfect, mine had little fat and was cooked perfectly. The mashed potatoes were full of flavor and left you wanting more! Another had the fish of the day which was Mahi Mahi which was cooked perfectly. Another family member order the hanger steak and enchilada. All meals were bursting with flavor. We decided to have dessert based on the recommendations we had the pineapple upside down donuts and the carrot cake. The donuts were unusual, caution as the pineapple in the middle is hot, still sweet and worth ordering. Though the carrot cake was one of the best we have all had, everyone raved about it and wished we had more. We will be back to Hudson 29! It was a bit pricey but the food quality is worth treating yourself!

I always want this food to be slightly better and about $5 less per entree.  Scallops ordered last time were good, but $30 for just the scallop and a small salad below them?  Pasta Bolognese is so-so and for $20 should be the best pasta with meat sauce I ever had.  Appetizers are good, but pricey (3 dip trio for $12 or so)?  I thoroughly enjoy their white wine on tap.  Service is usually attentive.

Worst burger I have ever had at a premium price.  The bun was cold as if it had just been taken out of the refrigerator and the meat was two pre-formed thin patties with a little bit of mayonnaise and a few chopped red onions between them.  It did not taste like high quality meat although my dog liked it. There was shredded iceberg lettuce on top and no pickles.  Server was fine but always in a hurry and not what I would expect at a Cameron Mitchell restaurant.  Lindey's or J. Alexander know how to serve a high quality burger not this place.

Ok, a little pricey for lunch!  Three of us and only two had one drink, the bill was around $80 bucks.  I may go back for dessert but wasn't too impressed and I typically love Mitchell restaurants.  Great atmosphere and cool factor on location!

How's this for fulfilling the Cameron Mitchell reputation for being a chain restaurant? My friend bragged about her "favorite" bartender and took me there, reassuring me that I would love the experience, despite the fact that she hasn't eaten well or drank in two years because of a pregnancy. So I asked politely for my drink of choice, knowing that all the listed "craft cocktails" would be watered down Cameron Mitchell money-makers, but reassuring her favorite bartender that I will happily pay any extra that he might want to charge, more bitters, more herbs--exactly how I want my cocktail. What I got, expectedly, was a watery cocktail with standard watery ice, nothing like what I ordered. I felt like an alcoholic asking the bartender to add more PREMIUM alcohol and bitters. And reminding him that I didn't mind whatever price he had to charge. He VERY begrudgingly added it. So much for going to a BAR. I would have ordered a French Bordeaux with my medium rare steak, but I'm afraid it would have put him out too much... So I continued to eat my medium WELL steak and watery cocktail with no complaints for the sake of my friend...
Great Service at the bar.  Excellent wine selection.  Carrot cake is hands down the best I have ever had.  Corn chowder is delious!  Decent fish dishes.  Black bean burger is not that great.

I had brunch recently. The omelet of the day was the southwest omelet. Myself and a friend both ordered it. It was bland and a small portion, nothing special. My husband had sushi which was pretty good and the Eggs Benedict. The Benedict was good but again nothing special. Our son had the children's chicken sandwich which was DELICIOUS. I appreciate a kids menu that isn't your typical garbage food. This was quality food and a huge portion for a child. We actually thought the server had accidentally ordered him the adult portion. We also really enjoyed the cocktails. The service was great as well as the atmosphere.  I would go back to try the dinner menu but there are better places in the area for brunch.

Absolute wonderful experience. Great service from Mindy. The atmosphere is very relaxing. Garlic cheese rolls are delicious, the scallops were cooked perfectly. The carrot cake is a must. Served warm with a wonderful icing. Will definitely be back.

This is one of my favorite New Albany restaurants and it's great to have a place like this in downtown NA.  I've been to this location multiple times and have had great service and food every time.  Very consistent overall.  The menu has a nice variety and you can always just get a burger, which is actually one of the best burgers I've ever had.  The roasted corn and avocado is a great side too. A++ in my book!

The yak yak Sunday gang had,10 in all, dined at this establishment last night. The Mitchell group does a great job of making you feel welcome. Food was good and the wine list was fair but oh the prices were high. Other area restaurants that complete beat them on price. However like I said service service service  that's where Mitchell beats the competition. They had workers running into one another. One note: didn't ask but I don't think they have a children's menu. Not good at those prices. We did see families there. They must rob trains for a living lol.  We'd go back just because of the friendly people

Good but not great. Chorizo queso was tasty but $11 is pushing it. We had a seared tuna special and prime rib. Both were good but not sure if they lived up to the price. With 1 app, 1 beer and two entrees, a $100 meal is a bit of a stretch. Decor/ambiance is great and service was Cameron Mitchell quality. Worth the visit.

Finally, New Albany has a neighborhood fine dining establishment of tremendous quality!! Will be coming back for sure. Had the to-die-for chorizo con queso and the prime rib as my main dish. Excellent service and attention to detail. Cameron Mitchell does it again!!

My wife and I have been there 3 times now and we have been very pleased each time. The service is very good and the food was exceptional every time.  The salmon and the blackened grouper are our favorites.

My friend recommended I take the family here for a nice dinner over Christmas break and I must say, I was very pleasantly surprised. Driving up to the M, we passed through some odd neighborhoods and pulled up to what looked like luxury condo buildings. Seemed the only option for parking was valet, and luckily it was only $7. Entering the restaurant, we were greeted by a nice young hostess who took our coats. Immediately, I felt like I was in a fun restaurant in Vegas. Dark ambiance with classy lighting, soft house music in the background, well dressed young people at the bar having cocktails. We were welcomed by a very nice woman who first took our drink orders. Do yourself a favor and get one of their signature cocktails (Black Orchid tasted like a fruit juice). We started with a couple appetizers; the Hamachi and Fois were both on point. For entrees, we ordered the Salmon & Lobster w/ Risotto (by far my favorite), the Chilean Sea Bass (a bit salty), the Steak in a Bowl (which came highly recommended. I felt the steak was a tad bit overdone but the concept was cool), and the Chicken (a bit dry). For a side, we shared the Lobster Mashed Potatoes which were terrific. Overall, I'd give the food 4 stars, some dishes outshining others. We finished with the Triple Layer Chocolate cake (which was to die for) and the Lemon Creme BrÌÈlÌ©e (also very tasty). The service was a bit slow at times, but the warmth and friendliness from our server was on point. Honestly, probably a top 3 dining experience in Columbus for me, and I'll definitely be coming again next Christmas.Enjoy!

I enjoy M once in a while and generally dine at the bar. You can get some good happy hour specials including select food items and drinks, even on Saturday. The bar does fill up quickly. Cris, the bartender, makes a mean cocktail and has good banter with guests. This trip I had the surf and turf sushi which is one of the few sushi's I do eat. Then I had my usual, steak in a bowl. This is a butter poached filet served with some small potatoes and blue cheese sauce, it is always excellent. They allow you to get half orders of sides and I had the truffle Mac and cheese.

Great ambiance and uber tall ceilings give it a great feel. Food quality and price matched the feel of the place. My only slight gripe was that the food was a bit lukewarm. Service was excellent and overall a great place for special occasions.

RecommendedThe bartender here is literally one of the best in the country - award winning!!Not a cheap night by any stretch. But if you're going to pay for food, this food is worth it. Amanda was an EXCELLENT server. She was attentive, friendly, adorable, absolutely perfect. The steak was cooked perfectly!! They are SO gluten free friendly - a whole separate menu, fresh baked GF popovers .The only cons - martinis were a little small, I hate when they don't fill the glass...just get a smaller glass and trick me. Ask, the decor was a little dated, but the restaurant is getting a full makeover soon.

We had a reservation August 3, 2017 at the barrel room for 8 people. We asked the manager to ask the chef to pre-fix the menu, we would choose the wine. Chef Jeff Rabold did such an amazing job, I don't even know how to describe how excellent the entire evening went. I wanted to make sure the general manager, Joe Haun and Jeff knew how much we appreciated the food, wine and excellent service we received.The food was prepared to perfection. The service was excellent and the atmosphere amazing.

Dined tonight. Food was good. Jared our server was great. M would have received a much better rating if they chose a better valet service.Left after our meal to be told "We can't find your car keys". First the valet accused my husband of having them, then I got the accusation with the man pointing at me, "You, Da Wife, you have them."  (People, remember to give valets an extra key and not the set with house and office keys on them!) Maybe women are spoken to differently in other countries but I am not going to give business to a company that allows me to be spoken to like I am about to be stoned b/c a man working at a valet lost our car keys. After 15 minutes of trying to find the keys with the valet company, I approached the restaurant to explain the situation. Restaurant manager asked, "Are you really sure they said they lost them". I responded, no, they have just accused the Da wife of having them multiple times. Finally, the general manager of the restaurant comes out to help and voila, the missing valet and missing keys appear (Just enough time to have copies of the keys made..).Thanks for a wonderful night out and next day having to change our locks. I'll stick to the Refectory.

Great location and an elegant ambiance! Pull up to 2 Miranova Place and await for valet prior to entering into the restaurant. The only parking option unless you are a lucky resident to this beautiful urban living space! $7 valet, which I believe has increased from other late yelp posts. M at Miranova is a fine dining establishment with excellent service and cozy seating arrangements for a couple to a large party. The cocktails are deliciously crafted and carry a premium price but well worth it. I ordered the Marquee and glad I did. Belvedere Citrus Vodka, cointreau, agave, blood orange puree and lemon juice. $12 and 3 down to ensure this review gets the quality words it deserves. It had a clean refreshing taste. They topped it with a beautiful letter "M" that tasted like the blood orange puree. Gets an A++ and a must try! A crusty bread and soft butter was delivered to the table prior to dinner.  I love a crusty sour dough bread. Crunchy on the outside and warm and soft in the middle with a slight bite. Slopped that alcohol right up. For the main course I felt adventurous this evening and didnt review the menu and went for the special of the day. I was lucky to find out it was a hanger steak, medium please, with fingerling potatoes, mushrooms and a small garnishment of a mixed green salad. The steak was perfectly cooked with a slight purple to a dark red with a nice sear on the outside. The dish set me back $46. Quality over quantity is the theme here. Good I didnt get overly stuffed since I got to order coffee and donuts off the "sugar" menu. I was pleasantly surprised to find out the coffee is not coffee but coffee ice cream. The donuts were benign style that were bannana flavored. Slightly warm, soft with a crunch of the cinnamon sugar coating. Wow! A side of strawberry puree to dip these guys into. A little sweet but gives the donuts a complex taste. The food gets the bulk of this review, however, the staff was amazing! Attentive but not overly annoying. Why not the 5 star you ask, I had a hang over after I saw the bill. Portions could have been heartier and my drink a little stiffer. It would have distracted me from the bottom line and had me skipping out the door with a smile on my face.

One of the best restaurants in Ohio! I love the atmosphere, service and the food is consistently impeccable! I always get the Lobster scones as my appetizer, they serve you three each topped with a small taste of different caviars served in a cone. My favorite dish hands down are the lamb chops!! Theres nothing I would change about this dish, the lobster mash potatoes are rich, buttery and filled with  bites of lobster. Its hard for me to choose any other entree all though I have tried, the lamb is my favorite!

Can't believe I've never reviewed M - it is my favorite restaurant in all of Columbus. Love the ambiance.. very swanky, think South Beach Miami. The black orchid is my favorite cocktail in the city. They have a great wine list too. You really can't go wrong with anything you order from here! The burger sliders or sushi to start are sure to please anyone you're dining with. I typically go for whatever the entree special is because it usually can't be beat. But the pork chop, salmon, and steak are all amazing as well. And don't forget dessert... the coffee and donuts are amazing!

M is one of the best restaurants in Columbus. Great atmosphere, great food, great drinks, and great service. It's a great dining experience for a special occasion.On the flipside, M is the most expensive restaurant operated by Cameron Mitchell, and therefore, is one of the most expensive restaurants in Columbus. You can easily drop $100/person here if you get drinks, apps, salads, sides, and dessert. I dined here last weekend with my family for father's day. We ordered 1 beer, 1 cocktail, 1 kid's meal, 2 salads, 2 entrees, and 2 desserts. After tax and tip, we paid $150-ish... and that was AFTER we used a $50 coupon that we got via email! So yeah, without a coupon, it's $100/person. You could theoretically get away with $50/person, but then you'll leave feeling like you didn't get the full experience. At this point, I'd like to take a detour and make an analogy between Cameron Mitchell restaurants and the Porsche 911 sport car. The base 2017 Porsche 911 has 370 horsepower and costs ~$90k. Even with "only" 370hp, it's a sexy car that's likely too fast for your own good. Or you can pay ~$190k to upgrade to a  911 Turbo S with 580 horsepower. So while the 911 Turbo S is clearly more powerful, whether you're willing to pay an extra $100k for an extra 210 horsepower... is another thing entirely. And that brings us back to M. M is clearly the best Cameron Mitchell restaurant in Columbus. But is it worth their cost premium over some of the other nice, but less expensive, Cameron Mitchell restaurants in town? That's a conversation you'll likely want to have with your wallet. Some people want the best, regardless of the cost. Some people would rather have something that's still really nice, but much more affordable. If I was a millionaire, I think I'd be the type who wants the best regardless of the cost. But alas, I'm not a millionaire. So I'll likely have to wait for the next $50 coupon to come along before my wife will let us splurge at M again.

Best food I've ever had at a restaurant! The duck was to die for and steak was cooked perfectly. Wine went down like water and the front of house is amazing too! Best customer service you can find in Columbus. This place is worth the expense for a great night out!

I will start by saying we had a lovely time and I would return again but for a different entre. I had the halibut special which was overcooked and under-seasoned. The Caesar salad, however, was wonderful. It is hard to find a Caesar with anchovies (optional of course) Our server, Linda was attentive and personable. Initially I did not get the second cocktail I ordered but it was finally brought to me and also removed from my bill. The decor is a little strange and made getting in and out from the table a challenge and the restroom is very far from the restaurant. It also was louder than I typically enjoy. All in all I would recommend M, it is pricey, but other than me all members of my party found their meal to be wonderful (steak in a bowl and the lamb chops).

First of all, I've read a couple of reviews that were complaining about how long the food took to come out.  This ain't that kind of restaurant: do us a favor and go somewhere else, and let people in that appreciate atmosphere and excellent service.This was my second time here.  First was a business dinner that was excellent.  When I was here that time, I spied the outdoor area, kept that in mind as a place to take the wife later.Fast forward to this past weekend, it was our 10th Anniversary, and I have ZERO regrets turning our dinner over to the wonderful staff at M.  If you take your time to dine, and let the staff take care of you, you are in for a treat.  The menu is FULL of surprises and little quirks, including a Root Beer Float (you wouldn't expect at a restaurant like this, but damn.. if it isn't the best on you'll have). I was just enjoying watching other people read the menu and then order it, and watch their delight.  I think that's what CM was shooting for here.Wife had Salmon (superb!), I had the NY Strip.  When my steak came out, it was a slightly overdone for my taste, and the staff immediately took action to correct it, even though I thought I could get by.  They were insistent on it being perfect, and the correction was.I can't wait for my next opportunity to go back.Staff and food was excellent.Thank you Phil and crew for a memorable evening. --D

This is an upscale restaurant. As you drive to it you go through an impressive gated community type of entrance, and the restaurant sits in the building on top of the long curvy driveway. Valet is probably your best bet at parking here, and like other places in Columbus, valet is cheap ($7). You then enter through what looks like a high-end corporate building (actually, I think its a residential building), and the restaurant is on one end. The ambience is  upscale and swanky. The view of the bridge in the back at night adds to the appeal. We waited for about 15-20 minutes at the bar while our reserved table was being made ready. I didn't mind that too much since there was plenty of seating at the bar. The bar table top had illuminated lights underneath, which gave it a very modern chic look. Once seated, the server was very attentive and helpful. We ordered the foie gras (for some reason they call it only foie) and the spicy tuna rolls as appetizers. The foie gras was delicious, but very tiny, difficult to share among four. There were 8 spicy tuna rolls, good but quite ordinary (nothing that you can't have at an ordinary sushi place). For dinner, my wife ordered the Ahi tuna and I ordered the steak in a bowl Rossini style (which was a 10 oz fillet with foie gras on top). Our friends also ordered the steak in a bowl. I ordered my steak medium rare, and it came out close to medium well, so I sent it back. One of my friends ordered her's medium well, but it came out well done, and she was too hungry to send it back. They re-prepared the steak for me, and this time around it was done perfectly. The fois-gras on top went really well with it. My wife's tuna was tasty but we've had better. When the bill came, they didn't charge me for the steak, which was a very classy move, but one they really didn't need to do. Still it was pricey --- over $200 a couple, but we did have two bottles of wine. So, based on just the food alone, I wouldn't  give it very high marks. However, the ambience, the service, and the overall atmosphere is well worth a visit.
You want to treat yourself you have to go to M. This is a special night restaurant. Favorite dishes steak in a bowl, cones and any of their desserts. This place is special.

I have attended a few events in the Ivory Room at Miranova, but I had never tried M outside of the bar at HH until last night. I made my reso on Open Table about an hour in advance, which was clutch. We pulled up to valet, only to be ignored. After a few minutes of waiting, we got out of the bar. The valet apologized, saying "I'm sorry, I thought you were an Uber." I am left to believe this is due to the fact that my Jeep Patriot is unlike the sports cars parked out front. We were sat at a table with the previous table's credit card receipts and paper trash. The restaurant didn't seem busy at this time. None of this is a huge deal, except for the pricing of the menu - I expected a little more. We started with the scallop appetizer; I had the Branzino and my boyfriend had the Seabass. All of the food was excellently prepared and our fave was the Seabass - highly recommended.Unfortunately, the questionable service brought down the experience but overall, a good time.
Anita was my waitress and she was amazing made my birthday a night to remember the scenery was very classy and the food was perfection this is a excellent place to eat truly was amazing !!

Sooooo good! Service was on point. The food was interesting in a good way! Desert was thoughtful!  Bring plenty of money cuz you can easily spend lots of money here.  Left a little hungry but that's ok.

Went here for my girlfriends birthday. We had the scallops for an appetizer. Easily some of the best scallops I've ever had. I don't even know what was on them but they were incredible. We split a bottle of wine over some sushi and lamb chops. Did not disappoint. Worth every penny and will absolutely be back soon.

Didn't quite live up to expectations. The service was horrendous and we waited a very long time for food, waters, and drinks. He forgot about my desert and gave us the check. Our entrees were very good but the service really ruined our experience. Will not be going back.

I came here during restaurant week about a year ago. We made a reservation, but we weren't seated until 30 minutes after our reservation time. This could've been due to the influx of people  for restaurant week, but I would still expect a place like this to be better about seating people on time. Overall, the experience was good. We ordered the tomato soup with a small grilled goat cheese sandwich on top. This was absolutely delicious--especially the grilled goat cheese sandwich. For the entree, we ordered the salmon and the short rib. Both were delicious. We had the chocolate cake and the lemon creme brulee for dessert. I was a little disappointed the chocolate cake came with a caramel drizzle as opposed to the caramel crisp it was supposed to have on top, but I won't be too big of a diva about that. The chocolate cake itself was moist, rich, and delicious. The lemon creme brulee was to die for. The creamy texture was rich, sweet, and delectable and the tartness of the lemon cut into the richness of the desserts perfectlyOverall, a  great experience despite the slight wait in the beginning.
The service was very good.The king crab (appetizer) was delicious!The salmon entree was not as great as I expected.

I came here with my VP and her husband for dinner on Thursday night for restaurant week and M didn't disappoint. We were greeted promptly and seated promplty in David's section. He went through the restaurant concept and allowed us to peruse the menu. When it came time for ordering David made several suggestions and they were home runs. The bread that was brought out was a sourdough with softened whipped butter and smoked red sea salt. First course for me was the tomato soup with a mini goat cheese sammy in the bowl, the soup was very good, it had great tomato depth. My vp ordered the sushi and loved it and her husband ordered the Caesar and proclaimed it was one of the best he has ever had and he wanted to buy some of the dressing. Main course I ordered Salmon which is what David suggested and it was delicious, perfectly cooked with house made gnocchi and more, it was the perfect portion and paired greatly with the wine David suggested. My boss and her hubby ordered the short rib and it was so tender accompained with roasted root veggies and mushrooms. Dessert was divine two of us ordered the Lemon creme brulee and the other ordered the chocolate cake. The lemon creme brulee had a nice size portion was cooked perfectly with a nice burnt sugar crust and accompained with a linzer cookie. I had parked in the garage since no street parking was open, I asked if M validated parked and even though they didn't David found a card to get me out of the garage free. The regular menu reads very well and we all commented M is a gem in Columbus. I highly recommend M to everyone.

My husband and I came for an early (5:15) dinner Saturday night for restaurant week.  We arrived a bit too early so we waited a few minutes for valet, but had no problem with that.  We were seated right at 5:00, which is when they open.  They have a patio but we forgot to ask for that.We had been here once before, for an anniversary several years ago.  It's very pretty here.  We were fairly dressed up, since it is an upscale place.  Side note:  It's always disappointing to see other patrons in a)  shorts and t-shirt, and b)  a ball cap.  Bill E. had the same meal I did, and his food descriptions in his review ring true.  My husband and I enjoyed our meal very much.  Our cocktails and wine were delicious.  Our server (I am sorry I cannot remember his name) was wonderful.  We enjoyed talking to him and he did a great job. I posted pictures but unfortunately ate the creme brulee before I remembered I wanted to take a photo.

M was terrific. One of the best restaurants in Columbus for sure. I'm a bit of a food snob having lived in NYC for a few years and spending significant time in LA and Vegas. Places in Columbus that people rave about are really at best second tier restaurants in other cities. NOT the case with M. It was hands down one of the best meals I've had in Cbus. I'll be back soon and I'm telling everyone about it.

When a place has 1 letter for a the name you know it's fancy AF! The meal I had was amazing the cocktails perfect and they have a great staff. Little pricey so if you want to eat cheap then do not come here. Just know that it is 100% worth the $

Came here for our 26th anniversary dinner and it was amazing. Definitely in our top 5 in columbus. Where do I start?...great unique cocktail menu (sadly I only managed to try two of them) the food was great also. We had the duck and the lamb chops... need I say more?  However I am haunted by the fact that neither of us tried the butter poached filet ( next Time for sure).

M was a perfect experience for us.  We went there to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary and they did not disappoint us.  We we're greeted by many of the staff with anniversary greetings.  The food and drinks were fabulous. We had the Caesar salad, duck, scallops and lobster mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes were the best we ever had.  I'm gluten free and they offered a very nice selection nad served gluten free rolls, which was the best I have ever had.  For dessert we had the root bear float, which was absolutely decadent!  We look forward to returning.

Frankly one of the better restaurants in the country.  You heard me and I eat in LA a lot.  This restaurant is as good as it gets.  So how in the world does it get only 4 stars???  Really? Creative cuisine, superb service and stellar ambiance.  The hallmark of outstanding restaurants is consistency and signature items.  I had not been here in several years and the dining experience is as good as ever.  I had the lamb chops and the poke ... I am already craving them again.  The little touches, like giving you a black napkin or constantly refilling your side of ice without even having to ask, is effortless service that's found in only a few establishments.  Not sure Columbus recognizes the level of cuisine that M consistently hits.  I do and I appreciate it.  A must if you're living in or visiting Columbus!  Definitely 10 stars in my book!

We went here for a celebration dinner. Its a little bit outside of downtown. Just follow your GPS. There isn't much else around it so you aren't likely to get lost. We went in. Its a very pretty place. More typical for a place in a city like New York or LA to me than Columbus. It was almost completely empty on a Thursday night. The bar area was very nice and we want to back to try happy hour.The good: Our table of five was seated in a little area that was surrounded by white curtains so we had some privacy. This was awesome. We also had a view of the river and city. Also awesome. The drinks were very fun. My fiancÌ©s had a flower inside of a giant ice-cube! (Its their signature drink) and everyone at the table tried a different cocktail. All were good and all were fun. We split sushi appetizers. Typical sushi but actually a reasonable price. The entrees were all very pretty (see pictures).The mediocre: My ahi tuna was in cubes. It was over seared on every side so to get to the rare/medium rare tuna in the middle (the good stuff!) I had to get through a lot of wasted over cooked fish :(. Entree was still good though.The bad: When we parked ($7 Valet... I think this was the only option), they said they were so non-busy they would just park in front of the restaurant. He took my car and literally drove it 100 feet to park. Literally. Convenient to get out, but still cost $7. Its an expensive place. Expect to pay. Also, the bathrooms are outside of the restaurant. Not a big deal. Just odd.Great restaurant for a special occasion or if you feel like you want to splurge. Probably not worth the money for me to go back outside of happy hour (and by not worth the money, I really mean, I don't have the money).

This place was. so. delicious. My boyfriend took me here for Valentine's dinner and everything was excellent. Started out with a glass of Sauvingon Blanc that was excellent while my boyfriend had the vanilla old fashioned (which I refused to taste, but he said was great!). I had the dragon roll as an appetizer and it was very good. For entrees, I had the salmon with gnocchi and lobster. It was probably one of my favorite meals ever! My boyfriend got the chicken which came with two ginormous chicken breasts and was also very delicious. For dessert, we had the chocolate lava cake with caramel ice cream which was a perfect end to a wonderful dinner. Absolutely love this place! If you are looking for a fancy night out in Columbus, I definitely recommend this!

The setting and locale of the establishment is great, I wasn't a fan of their food. I had their beet salad and sushi both of which had 0 flavor. I went with a party of 5 they all chicken or the steak in a bowl which they said was great. Perhaps I'll get that if I ever go again.

Tonight is an example of expecting something great and then being greatly disappointed.  My husband made a reservation for my birthday months in advance as I had always said how much I wanted to try M.  After specifying a special occasion and requesting a private booth, we were put into a table approximately 8 inches away on each side between two other couples.  I felt uncomfortable even discussing menu options with the lack of privacy.  As he could tell how unhappy I was, he requested that we be moved to another small table in a slightly more private area.  Instead, the hostess suggested we could sit outside.  While the weather was quite nice, it wasn't the ambiance I had wanted.  I also noticed that of the four couples on the patio, the manager came up and had long personal conversations with each, we felt ignored.  Our server clearly forgot our salad and to refill water and bread after she asked us and we confirmed that yes we would like her to do so.  The food was good, but the lack of service and feeling like less than valued customers was more disappointing.  I think once was quite enough here- not one of Mitchell's better offerings.  We won't be back here.

Spectacular service at The M! I ordered the veal, which was exquisite. My dad got the scallops and loved them. I also got the signature orchid drink, which was phenomenal. The waiter gave us complementary lobster Mac and cheese because we were "so lovely to serve." Such a great Cameron Mitchell experience

We dined here during restaurant week. We waited about 40+ minutes for a table past our reservation time. We found a table at the bar to wait and the host was very professional in checking back with us and apologizing for the wait once a table became available. We ordered from the prix fixe menu with wine pairings with some additional items from the full menu. Ambience - The place is a little swanky. I felt like we were in Manhattan  or Los Angeles, not Columbus. But that's okay. It is nicely finished and it is great to have this type of "escape" once in a while. Great views of the city as well. Food - Ahi sushi roll. Okay, good, nothing special. Can order similar many places, should have selected something else from the menu. Roasted tomato soup with goat cheese sandwich. Good, nicely done. Salmon entree with gnocchi and haricot vert. Great flavor and presentation.Beef short rib with red wine reduction. Again, great flavor and presentation. Cameron's always does this dish nicely. Lobster mashed potatoes. Highly recommend sharing this side dish. Lave cake with caramel ice cream. Great. Lemon creme brÌÈlÌ©e. Great presentation and taste. Yum. Service - The host, server at the bar, and our server during dinner were all very professional and get two thumbs up. The wait however for our reservation and somewhat slower service during dinner take this review down a star. Please note that our server during dinner provided impeccable service, very well trained, very cordial, it was none the less slow due to the number of tables he had. This place is a must see for the Columbus foodie. I recommend putting on your bucket list and checking it out at least once.

Great place to experience fine dining if your looking to splurge a bit. Late posting but I wanted to rave about this place. Favorite appetizer is the Three cones and the king crab is delish!! Wife had the duck which was amazing and I had the Colorado lamb chops which is my fave to get here ... for sides the lobster mash and the asparagus with truffles was cooked to perfection !!!

Yikes. I do not know if I came on an off night or what but my experience here was an absolute joke. I made a reservation 2 weeks in advance and showed up and had to wait a half hour for my party to be seated. Once we were seated, our server tried to connect by thinking she knew someone in my party but she just continued to call him by the wrong name. Our entrees took an hour to come out which made our total time at this restaurant about 4 hours. Not to mention a girl kept coming to our table asking if we had any drugs and our server had to ask her to return to her table. The hosts also asked us to find our own coats in the back despite the fact that we checked them in and had tickets. Unfortunate night.
They have the best happy hour in town with very good selections.  The bartenders are friendly and know how to make a good drink.  LOVE their concoctions and they know how to make me a dirty martini!

Absolutely delicious! Started with the scallop sushi appetizer and we all had fish entrees. The salmon entree was fantastic - presented perfectly and had a very light sauce which I appreciate. Really good special halibut entree as well. We ordered the Mac and cheese side to share and added lobster to it - definitely recommend. Ended dinner with the beignets which were warm and fluffy! Perfect night on the patio with a perfect meal and view of the city!

Very nice atmosphere and the menu has a large variety for everyone. We had two waitresses and they were both very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. They were very attentive as well. I ordered the ahi Tuna and it came out perfectly cooked but it was only warm, even though the plate was very hot. That was the only downside of my experience. The sushi here was delicious as well!

It becomes increasingly hard to impress her on her birthday thanks to all those great restaurants we enjoyed around the world. But M Restaurant is the one in Columbus.Noticeably, a birthday notice was spread from the host to the server and then to the kitchen as well. AmbianceAs part of our late night privilege and their hospitality, we were seated in a private circle booth with gentle pink lighting and romantic long curtains from the ceiling. We arrived at 10:00pm, and it was expected that the restaurant was quiet and spacious, which provided a better mood to enjoy the night view of Scioto River and Columbus skyline.ServiceOur server Josh was definitely an exceptional guide and help. He offered excellent recommendations and pairing suggestions. An birthday dessert and a personalized birthday message were also delivered to our table by him. Great knowledge and hospitality!FoodIt was obvious that chef made each plate with care, details and creativity. Sea scallops were undoubtedly among the best we've ever had: fresh ingredients, perfectly seasoned and cooked. Veal were also well prepared, cooked, sliced and served. Creme brÌÈlÌ©e with a gift dessert and birthday card was her favorite! Menu was clear and efficiently highlighted. Ask their knowledgeable servers for wine recommendations, and make sure you try their signature blossom cocktail, ladies!OverallM is truly a fine dining in Columbus, with romantic and artistic touches. I'll definitely come back and will spread the word.

Superb service. Mildly pricy for content but it's worth it for a special occasion or a treat.Tuna is amazing and the Chilean sea bass is to die for. Subtle and tasty as hell.Cones for starter - very varied and a nice light option. Drinks are varied and the cocktails are truly impressive. The margarita is spicy and the smoked salt on the rim is worth a mention on its own.Valet parking or a garage two floors under. Go. It's worth it.

COLUMBUS, OH: Excited to try this innovative New American restaurant with soaring ceilings and intimate details.  Greeted by a friendly hostess and server.I had the fortune to try several menu options:Foie: (4.5 stars) This was a pairing of foie and pork over lentils.  The lentils were nothing special, but the foie and pork were exquisite.Scallops: 5 Stars-perfectly cooked large diver scallop on a spicy ratatouille and pea purÌ©e.Three Cones: 5 star presentation/3 star taste, like a seafood salad in a sweet wafer.Lobster Mash Potatoes (3 stars): these were buttery and very plain whipped potatoes with a generous helping of lobster on top.  Felt a little lazy.Truffle Mac and Cheese (5 stars): These were delicious, but I didn't taste any truffle; the rosemary overpowered any other seasoning.  I like "rosemary Mac and Cheese" so I enjoyed the dish, but I didn't detect any truffle taste.Service and ambience were 5 stars!  Excellent!

This review is long overdue. I actually went here, or should say was happily taken here, for my birthday a couple months ago. It was amazing!! From the moment we walked in, we had a fantastic experience. The maÌ¨tre d' knew it was my birthday and asked me how my day was. He then escorted us to a private booth with a great view of the restaurant. We ordered a medley of dishes and were not disappointed. Each dish was better than the next. My favorites of the night were the black orchid martini (beautiful to look at and wonderfully sweet) and the coffee and donuts dessert (which was complimentary for my bday!). One of the donuts fell during transport and the server brought us two more!! We were beyond stuffed by the end of the meal but in the best way possible. It's a bit pricey but this is one of those places where I can, without reservation, say that you get what you pay for! Some of the dishes are probably more worth it than others (the king crab, for example, was delicious but probably not worth $29 for an appetizer). Overall though, I give this place a solid 5 (+).
One of the best happy hours in town. Their bartenders now how to make great cocktails and the food on the menu is reasonably priced and delicious!

Absolutely phenomenal. Started with a Black Orchid martini and a shrimp cocktail.  Even my husband ended up ordering a Black Orchid because they are so good.  (He's a beer kinda guy). We both had fish dishes and just about licked our plates clean!  We can't stop talking about this place.  Good thing we live out of town because otherwise we would spend way too much time and money here.  Service was top notch also!!!

Celebrated our 7th anniversary here. It was amazing. I ordered the lobster mashed potatoes (and licked the bowl clean) but the truffle mac and cheese that my husband ordered was out of this world! Dessert was on the house and we ordered the donuts which were really really good. We will definitely be back.

Dined here recently for dinner and then again for happy hour. Food was amazing I highly recommend the king crab and steak in a bowl. Great service and great wine list and cocktails (black orchid martini is a must). The only bad thing I have to say is the valet, they were not very courteous at all and it was a disappointment.

Ok this has been my Cameron Mitchell's go to place for years. I love the ambiance and the whole awesome vibe of this place. I mean I can't say enough about how awesome the bartenders are and they have my favorite martini the Black Orchid. One if the things I love is that their menu is ever changing so I'm never sure what treat I'm in for.  I pretty much get something different every time I go. It's a place where I can have illusions that I'm in the upper two percent of income earners if only for a night. I've never had less than impeccable service and the food is always out of this world. Celebrating my birthday and Veterans Day we outdid ourselves once again.  We started off with the lump crab meat and crostini appetizer and it was off the hook. Omg the crab was so fresh and tasty as was the perfectly toasted crostini. I ordered the sea scallop dinner and my hubby got the salmon dinner. We also got the lobster mashed potatoes. We both enjoyed our entrees but the lobster potatoes were off the hook. I mean the best I've ever tasted in this city and that's saying more than a mouthful. Yup my taste buds will be leading me back here in the not too distant future!

My husband took me here for my birthday. The ambiance was so romantic & sexy. Such pretty drapery. The valet was perfect, we checked our coats, the food was amazing & the service was superb. We are impressed. We got the ravioli for an appetizer. I got the black orchid cocktail & salmon and my husband got surf&turf sushi. Wow! Soooo good. Then I got a delicious lava cake Bday dessert with a candle (on the house!) I felt like a princess. Nicest restaurant!

Went here for restaurant week and was VERY impressed! Great service! Great food! Very respectable wine list and excellent drinks. The red wine is served at "cellar temperature" which I find is more and more rare - though IMHO should always be served that way. This was the first time my wife and I have been there and will surely be back! I'll add more specifics post next visit.

One of the best restaurants we've been to in Columbus. The atmosphere is relaxed and upscale, the service is attentive and friendly. Our server gave us detailed and accurate recommendations based on our questions and all the food was well thought out and perfect. Everything is made in house down to the ice cream and bread. Even the bartender was creative and made a delicious a virgin drink for me on the fly that tasted just like my favorite pair martini!For an appetizer we had the foie gras which was perfectly cooked and a delectable Fetty pillow of deliciousness. For salads I had a smartly paired goat cheese mousse and red beet salad with pistachios and my husband had a classic Caesar salad that was well done.for dinner my husband had the Seabass that was perfectly salty from the Mirin and was moist and melted in your mouth. My on he tuna was rare in paired with a delicious reduction that was complex and even the mushrooms in carrot ribbons were perfectly cooked had deep levels of flavors. For dessert we had the honey pie which tastes similar to a pecan pie without the nuts but a dominant honey flavor that was complicated by homemade vanilla bean ice cream and apple compote. It was a perfect portion and not too heavy after a lengthy meal.Overall, exceptional, genuine service, upscale atmosphere, thoughtful, well-crafted and skillfully prepared food. Not the absolute best meal of my life but very delicious, and the best I've had in Columbus. We will definitely be back.

This place is just beautiful. Very upscale and relaxing. The service was great. Me and a good friend of mines went there for restaurant a while back. The food was great. Let me just say the Lobster mashed potatoes were out of this world. That alone will make me go back. It's in a great area. We ended up walking around the Scioto mile afterwards and got to enjoy a free concert.  Amazing entree with great presentation. Our waiter was so great.

I had high hopes for this place. The biggest disappointment was the lobster mashed potatoes. They came out with puddles of oil on top. Kind of gross actually.  The appetizers were decent. Service was friendly. Some of their drinks are actually quite good. I was neither impressed nor disappointed with my snapper or my girlfriends sea bass. My rating reflects price versus quality. In general, I think the seafood is mediocre for what they charge. I dont mind paying a lot for dinner, but I expect to be impressed.

M is one of the few very high end "luxury" restaurants in operation in Columbus.  The type of place that exudes exclusivity and opulence.  A dress code enforced type of place where you expect to see a dining room full of business people brokering deals, and old money "blue hairs" eating their routine Friday dinner.It's very upscale.  The cocktails are outstanding.  Top notch crafted mixology offerings utilizing creative ingredients.  Yes, the price point is high, but you have to expect that before walking in the door.The food really is great.  A blend of modern American techniques with some classical French.  A food program operating in this format demands excellence, and they deliver on the payoff to the guests.  There is a small room for improvement, but nothing egregious.The service was close to the best I've experienced in Columbus.  Nigel is one of the finest severs I have had the pleasure of dining with.  Extremely knowledgeable on all aspects of the menu.  A very professional and pleasant delivery in communication.  The young man takes his craft seriously, and I appreciate his skill.  M is lucky to have him on staff.  Overall, it really is a very nice restaurant and consistently meets expectations.Highly recommend.
Weeknight Dinner.Cool ambiance. Manager came around to say hello.Best cocktail: The Billionaire. Makes you feel like a billionaire swinging on a million dollar chandelier.

Amazing filet mignon and the Macaroni & Cheese is to die for!!  I was looking for a great place to take my fiance to dinner for our anniversary and this was highly recommended.  When we first got there we were not sure we were in the right place (can one truly trust a GPS in this day and age?) but a valet came out and verified we were and parked our car.  The place is beautiful and they really do a great job of making sure you are taken care of here.  It's nice but just as important it's intimate and not too loud.  Tables are not piled on top of one another.  The food was incredible and of course a bit pricey but it's well worth it if you don't mind paying for quality!

Celebrated my birthday with dinner at M, and overall it was a good experience.Our reservation was a 8pm. When we arrived at 7:57, I joked with my boyfriend that they wouldn't seat us because we were 3 minutes early. Turns out, they were having a busy night. They asked us to have a seat in the bar, and they would come find us.10 minutes at the bar and we finally got a drink menu. 10 minutes later and the bartender returned to get our order. An additional 10 minutes go by before our cocktails are delivered, with apologies. So...we're 30 minutes behind our reservation time and still not seated. I ordered the Black Orchid, and it was very sweet but perfectly delicious. He ordered a bourbon concoction from the menu which he also enjoyed.40 minutes after our reservation time, we are asked to follow a hostess to our table. Our server was with us promptly, and proceeded to give fantastic service the rest of the night. I ordered scallops, he ordered the "steak in a bowl". I also ordered wine, requesting that the staff make a pairing to go along with the scallops - it was spot on.The "steak in a bowl" was phenomenal. The scallops were better than OK, but not the best I'd ever had.Desserts were fabulous as well. I had the chocolate lava cake, and my boyfriend ordered the coffee & donuts. Overall, the service was fabulous and the food was very good. Negatives were the 40 minute wait past reservation time, and the super bro-tastic douchenozzle berating his wife all evening at the table next to us. While that's not the restaurant's fault, it certainly didn't help the evening along. The review is short of 5 stars because of the extended wait past the reservation time and the slow bar service to start the evening. A perfect place for celebrations, and we'll likely consider going back in the future.
Came here on a dessert tour. Their cocktail killed it. I'll definitely consider to come back for their actual meal.

If you want to splurge for an amazing date night this is the place. The food was amazing from salad to dessert to drinks after. The service was spot on and o couldn't find a single thing to complain about. I will be back again.

I had been waiting to try M for three and half years now so my expectations were high. The dining room is beautiful. Sheer curtains divide the larger room into smaller spaces. Our table of 6 had its own space overlooking the river. Spectacular! Our waitress was very friendly and helped us decide on cocktails. I had to try the Black Orchid. The cocktail was tasty but very sweet so be prepared. I had the salmon feature which was the traditional menu salmon prepared with bamboo rice and frisÌ©e salad. It was full of flavors and textures that lived up to my expectation. The chocolate lava cake with in house caramel ice cream was divine. What a great way to end the meal! Will try happy hour next time I visit.

A wonderful place to celebrate a special occasion!I ended up in Columbus for my birthday because my fiance was traveling for work and I wanted to celebrate with him. He made the reservation and refused to tell me where we were going. M is an absolutely beautiful restaurant. It has corner booths, large white sheets hanging from the ceiling. It was a beautiful place. We walked in and were created by the hostess who found out it was my birthday. Unlike others here, there was no other mention of it later in the meal, but since we were going to Jeni's afterward, that was alright with us. My fiance and I went with a grazing approach as opposed to appetizer, main, sides, etc. Overall, I would say that the food was hit or miss. First, the complementary sourdough bread was nothing special. I'll admit, I'm a bread snob, and since I eat bread so rarely, I really want it to be good. This was just alright. Next, I ordered the caterpillar roll, which was spicy tuna, tempura shrimp, cream cheese, avocado? onions?- I can't remember the veggies. It was good, especially with the sauces on the side, but we had more coming so I paced myself. Next, we got the wagyu burgers, which were good. The waiter spent a while talking about how special the fries were- they are soaked for a day, etc. Then they turned out to be just ok. Next, we ordered the mac & cheese and the asparagus while my fiance ordered the tuna (which is flown in fresh every day). The mac and cheese was great. The asparagus, not so much. It was overly steamed and mushy and the egg on top was not exactly what I was expecting. The tuna was good, but nothing special, especially after the waiter built it up. All in all, a pleasant dinner at a reasonable price.
