Are you kidding me!? Sure give me a $8 aaptzr that cost you $3 to make. We walked out the door and walked into Hyde Park Steakhouse and got a table immediately. They'll be glad to take my $400-$500
I went here for my birthday. It was delicious! I would definitely recommend the chicken Parmesan! Also I got free dessert because it was my birthday!

If you recall, I'm a bit of a snob when it comes to Italian food, having lived in Italy for 4-years. I'm happy to report that Marcella's did not disappoint.  Admittedly, I did stay away from ordering pasta or pizza (I'm most judge-y about those two) and stuck with apps. I had the melted pecorino and prosciutto & melon. The cheese dish was delicious! Warm and melty, served with bread, apples and truffle honey -- it was a great sweet and savory combo! The prosciutto and melon, while admittedly hard to screw up, was also yummy... A nice, light treat on a hot summer day. The real delight came at desert though, when I noticed they had afogato on their after dinner drinks menu! One of my favorite treats in Italy, this is a scoop of gelato smothered with espresso. The perfect combination of sweet dessert and after-dinner pick me up shot of caffeine.Service was attentive and quick. I appreciated the care they took of our large group of 10 teenagers and 5 adults. It would have been easy for them to tack on an 18% gratuity and phone it in all night. They did neither!

Happy hour 4-6pm has appetizers half price. The pizza is nothing but ordinary, but the chicken parmigiana was awesome.  Servers are incredibly polite and attentive.Environment is a little loud but once you start eating atmosphere become very pleasant.

To find a place to eat, I checked out YELP and it lead me here.  With my boss beside me we sat down and discussed our options. Both of us have the same habit of ordering one specific dish to find out if it's good food... From the moment we entered, listening to the 80's tunes playing on the over head, to the wines lining the walls and being seated next to a bottle of Luna di Luna (my nick name is Luna) we knew we were going to enjoy this place.. and we did.  The service was amazing, and the food.. YES!!! So good.  From the aparatif of a Lemoncello drink to the caprese salad we split.  To our entrees, both of us gave this restaurant thumbs up.

Celebrated a birthday here! I've been wanted to try this place for so long and finally made it happen! Food-wise, we had calamari and veal meatball as appetizers, crispy potatoes and shrimp pesto pizza as main dishes. They were all very delicious!!! My favorites were the calamari and the crispy potatoes pizza! I like how the fried calamari was prepared! It is true that it is fried food; however, the way how they fried it didn't make me feel as unhealthy as I normally would feel. Crispy potatoes was surely a hit! It was a bit salty but I really enjoyed it! Restaurant was pretty packed and a little loud. The only minor complaint is that the seats are overly close to each other, which made me feel a bit uncomfortable. Service was okay - I can tell that they were busy so kind of slow at times. I would still gladly return because of the food!

I started with a 3 meat selection...something to gnaw on while I was waiting for my group. All 3 were wonderful. For dinner, I had the Penn Alla Arrabiatta. It's spicy and delicious. Overall the meal was great. My only nit pick (and it's more this location) is that it is a bit noisy, which make casual conversation more of a shouting match. But overall, a great place to eat.

Disappointing. We have been here a couple of times and have come away came here for dinner now in the last few months and the food really hasn't gone our way. Let me say that the service has always been fine. However, during our most recent visit, the calamari was really terrible. Super fried and pretty tasteless. The kicker was that this was recommended by our server when we were debating between a few appetizers :). The main course was better. The  gnocchi came in a red sauce and it wasn't bad. In the past we've tried the cheese board and the charcuterie and they've been okay. Given the reviews, we've been somewhat underwhelmed.

I went to guild house for a birthday the waiter didn't bring me scallops dinner he had forgot I guess. U was starving so I walked over to marcellas and I'm so glad I did because the spaghetti was sooooooo good. Maybe because I was intoxicated lol but fast welcoming greeting, bartender was fast and friendly with my order and he even came out w cheese block and shreddeded it on my spaghetti. 5 stars from me.

It was a Thursday night, it was raining and had been raining all day. People were standing in the rain waiting to get in.  The place was standing room only, obviously. I was by myself.. Snuck in the bar area, lots of OSU students and businessmen. I had the linguine w/bianca clam sauce with the veal meatball as an app and I really do not know what to say.  The entree had some onions and pancetta which is not the way it is normally made, plus, there wasn't a lot of clam sauce. I never tasted anything like it.  I am used to the standard garlic/oil/butter/wine clam sauce, this was just different, in a great way.  The veal meatball was so good, I ordered another one to go. Stacy at the bar was on top of everything.Highly recommend..

Marcellas may well be my favorite "happy hour" spot in the Short North! The atmosphere, the amazing aricini, the pizzas, and my personal favorite the calamari are all half off along with select wine, beer, and cocktails!!! It's a win-win when you go, great food and excellent servers plus atmosphere make it an outstanding time every time!!!

I've only been to Marcella during happy hour, and based on those experiences alone, I love the place.  1/2 off practically everything during HH.  Can't go wrong with the grapefruit basil fizz cocktail, pizza, melted pecorino, and chopped salad.  Their gluten free pizza is pretty good as well, but their gluten free bread is even better (great for dipping in the various appetizers).

Had the pleasure to spend Mother's Day with my partner....decided on lunch at Marcella's...This is my 2nd trip to Marcella's, 1st review...Let's start by saying it's on High St. closer to W. Goodale Ave in the Short North...Parking can be difficult, volume of traffic was amped up today, lots filled up quickly...Lucky enough to snatch a table in the faux patio area...(doors open and table faces street - perfect for people watching)...Started off the luncheon with a couple drinks...I had some type of Lemon Drink with Vodka, Limoncello, Lemon Juice, Lemon Zest...if you like lemon highly recommend this drink...tasted wonderful and definite zip in there provided by the vodka : )My partner had some type of Strawberry Cocktail which looked and tasted wonderful, maybe be a bit Fufu for you guys but it was delicious. After drinks came up we ordered the Calimari, another strong recommendation on this dish...Lightly breaded, dish comes with deep fried lemons, a thin slices of zucchini( taste like zucchini potato chips)...the dish was accompanied by Aioli dipping sauces and Marcella's homemade sauce - both are winners....I ordered the Chicken Parmesan, large piece of Chicken lightly breaded thin and covered in cheese and sauce...dish came with a side of pasta...If you like Chicken Parm, you won't be disappointed ordering this dish....My partner ordered the ravioli's which had a light goat cheese filling, with a hint of garlic....She said the dish was wonderful...We  enjoyed our lunch so much and didn't want to leave so we decided on dessert...many quality choices but decided on chocolate almond cake with chocolate ganache...again another winner, think chocolate amaretto cake with a thick chocolate sauce...delicious....Our server Karen was awesome, very helpful and filled our drink glasses several times during our lunch...If you haven't been to Marcella's treat yourself to a wonderful dining experience...the happy hours are some of the best in the city and the Italian Cuisine will put a smile on your face : ))

One of my FAVORITE restaurants in Columbus - definitely my favorite Italian restaurant.I take all of my out of town food-snob friends here and they are always impressed.The melted pecorino is a MUST have appetizer.  It's a hot little skillet of melted pecorino with toast points, apple slices and truffle honey that turns into magic in your mouth.Their potato pizza is amazing and is one of my favorite dishes too.Try the strawberry balsamic martini too!  It's unique and delicious.They have a great happy hour but it's a little early but quite a deal if you can make it!
I came here for a bachelorette dinner and had a wonderful time! Really great service, good food, and a cozy atmosphere. I'll definitely be coming back!

Marcellas was one of my favorite places when I first moved to Columbus. I spent my 23rd birthday there and it was a blast. The veil meatball and fried calamari are my personal favorites. The pizzas are just OK. Great wine selection, and servers are always very accommodating and helpful! Hard to get a table on a Thursday, Friday or Saturday night.

Yes! Yes! Yes! Marcella's gets a loud and resounding YES on all levels.I've tried many things at Marcella's but I think that the fettucini meatball cannot be beat. The pasta is cooked al dente, the meatball is the size of your head and absolutely spectacular.. and it's enough for two meals. Now mind you, I am new to Columbus. I have lived here only seven weeks and I've probably been to Marcella's more than any other restaurant. While my expanding waist size would like for me to stop, I am certainly having a hard time doing so because it is so delicious.I am definitely looking back to trying new things in the near future :)

Very good food with service to match. Don't miss the Pecorino Melt - an Italian fondue.  Bread crisps that accompanied were weak, but cheese was amazing!! Calamari & zucchini mix was excellent. Tender calamari. Nice idea on the mix for diners that prefer only one or the other. Meat app (charcuterie) was weak.....salami & sopresseta not great quality. Chicken piccata was delicious.....nice balance of savory & garlic. As was meatball over alfredo. MUST get meatball. Tender & flavorful. Nice gentle marinara.

Trust those who Yelp regularly.Waitress Sophi  [from the word go] took the initiative and introduced me around the menu for my 1st visit. As if she owned the place, I was cared for like family.She brought me a 1/2 order of Nocchi, broccoli I, and a housemade meatball to accompany my draft Stella (large glass - $5.50).So far, so good. Check back for the results...

Always great food and good drinks. The meatballs are amazing. Definitely try them out! Usually very busy on the weekends. Reservations recommended. Nice staff as well love the bartenders! A must see in the Short North.   Added an extra star. Food has been great at both location recently!!!!

I am a creature of habit. Their carpaccio is exceptional. The bottom unseen layer is warm ricotta blinis and a bit of salad.  Yum!!!!- 1/2 order of gnocchi bolognese ( more like a ragÌ¼) and I'm done. Great rainy night dinner

This location is THE location to go for Marcella's. You're in the Short North, it's always busy but the ambiance and service is enjoyable. It's a different environment from the Polaris location.It's a great way to start a weekend evening off or to gather with some friends and break bread. Despite this place typically being packed I have found the entire staff (hosts & servers) to be personable, knowledgeable and friendly. My food comes out in a timely fashion and it's made the way it's listed on the menu and it comes out hot!Love coming here with my girlfriends or hubby. Congratulations on your 10th anniversary! :)P.S. They have a bomb Happy Hour!

Came in for dinner and drinks with friends. Started with some tequila cocktails that were fantastic at the bar. Waited about 40 minutes for a high top table, but was not disappointed when we finally got a seat. Started with a few apps that gave us an indication that our dinner would be fabulous. I had the meatball and fettuccini to my absolute delight. I rarely "win dinner," but we all shared our plates and mine came out on top - the lasagna was second and the gnocchi came in third. The profiteroles perfectly capped off the evening. I will return!

My fav pizza place in short north! Our server was very polite and attentive. They allowed us to do 2 different toppings, drinks are pretty good! Great pizza and drinks! Be ready to take some left overs with a buzz!

Marcella's is always a 5-star experience. While I have no problem paying menu price for a romantic sit-down dinner, the happy hour specials are the way to go! There is amply bar seating and the service is always fantastic. The wine and cocktail specials are great and never disappoint. The salads are fresh and flatbreads are flavorful and make great leftovers. Our favorite dish is always the calamari which includes parmesan zucchini and a special lemon sauce. The tiramisu is great as well. You can't go wrong with Marcella's!

Time and time again I am just continually impressed with this place. All the way from the atmosphere to the what's being served. Environment:5/5I love the old Italian feel and the imperfection this place has to offer. It's dim lit and a very romantic atmosphere. It's awesome that they have an open kitchen because it feels more like "family dining" that way.Service:4/5People are always on top of their game here. A few times I've had servers who were very dismissive of my table, but everything else makes it easy to ignore. Prices:4/5I think the prices are just right. Yeah, it's pricey - but you are paying for a different kind of Italian cuisine experience you can't quite get anywhere else. Although their portions are on the smaller side for the prices. But, No "bone app the teeth" here! LOLFood:5/5Everything I have tried here amazes me! I recommend the Pecorino melted plate they have here! It's toasted bread, apple slices, cheese, and delicious truffle honey that makes for an odd combination, but tastes amazing. Their carbonara dish is amazing and is my favorite! Overall: 5/5I will always return here! It is one of my favorite places on the Short North and I never leave disappointed!
Had a group of eight share a meal here after an OSU game. The booth was a little tight for our party and the restaurant is loud but we all LOVED our meal choices and would definitely return.

Marcella's is delicious and the service is impeccable. I do feel like it's a little dark and noisy (hard to talk to my boyfriend), but everything was delicious. I wish the portions were a little larger but I cannot complain about how everything tasted.I recommend Marcella's to all of my gluten-free friends who miss Italian food, I love that CM restaurants have such extensive GF menus!

We've dined in here quite a few times and have enjoyed the experience. However I ordered a Togo order tonight that was absolutely horrible. The chicken they gave me had been boiled and bitting into it was like rubber, it also had a very FOUL taste and was strung together by fat, I feel like I had gotten an old slab of chicken. Very gross. I had been excited for the breaded chicken fettuccine Alfredo that I ordered but ended up with a meal I had to throw away and feeling sick to my stomache. They need to check the food before its served to customers!

I ate here for dinner while I was attending a trade show at the convention center.  If I lived nearby I'd probably eat here once a week.  Everything on the menu looked delicious. I ended up getting the meatball and fettuccine.  Omg!!  It was so good, I'm still thinking about it.  The meatball (which is huge), was tender and perfectly cooked. The marinara sauce was wonderfully seasoned - certainly seemed home made and not canned.  The alfresco sauce in the fettucinecwas just right - light and flavorful and even the linguine was cooked perfectly (I wonder if they make their own pasta?  It seemed like they do).  It's moderately priced and the service was excellent. My only complaint is that it was a touch noisy but the place was packed (even though I got seated right away), which you'd expect for a place this good.

Most days I don't believe in Italian food because I have this philosophy that most Italian restaurants aren't any better than something I could make at home by myself. I have been to Marcella's on several different occasions and have always had a good time and I think Marcella's is an exception to my usual philosophy.The bread isn't very good to me in comparison with other restaurant's free breads, but no worries because there are better things to come. We always like ordering the calamari - it's tasty and a decent size to share. I've also tried the chicken parm, linguine and clams, and spaghetti. The big meatball is just fun because yeah sometimes I just wanna eat one large meatball so wut. I think portions are fair on the most part - especially with the three entrees I've tried (but the ravioli looked a little small to me). I've also tried the cannoli and tiramisu I would recommend both! They have a variety of coffee/espresso drinks (both alcoholic and non) for your post-dinner pleasure. I've had the affogato (a shot of espresso and vanilla gelato) which I think was a bit small for the $, but omg I'm about to have that every morning instead of my normal coffee. Nothing is earth shattering good but the ambiance is good, everything is quite tasty, service is good, and it's a good spot for a dinner that's whatever you want to make it (on a scale of casual to classy). Marcella's to me is consistent, and is a safe place to bring friends, family and visitors because I think everyone can find something to like that will be delicious! Sundays are 25% off bottles of wine. Hopefully I can make it to a Happy Hour soon for the dealz 4-6PM on weekdays.

Overpriced because of location though. Came here for a date. Was treated very poorly by the staff probably because of my age I'm assuming. Service was terrible food was only above average. I've had better Italian. Don't go for the hype. There's better places you can go.

Great Italian food. BEST VEAL MEATBALL EVERRRRRRRRR. If you are ever making reservations for a big party, make sure you are as specific as possible with the #. AND ON TIME. Otherwise, it can be stressful for both the host/servers and the party.

I had a delightful dinner at Marcella's last Thursday evening. This was my first time visiting the Marcella's in Short North. I had previously eaten at the Marcella's in Polaris, but I did not have a positive experience. During my visit at the Marcella's in Polaris, I ordered spaghetti and it was very bland. This time, I ordered the spaghetti and meatball. The meatball was the largest meatball I had ever seen! Marcella's gives you a lot of food for your money. The portions are HUGE! The meatball and spaghetti sauce were homemade and loaded with lots of flavor. The restaurant also gives you bread to go with your meal and olive oil. The bread could use some work. It is a little hard. Besides the delicious food, the ambience is pleasant. The restaurant is small and can get loud, but the dim lighting and candles make up for the noise. Overall, Marcella's is a great casual restaurant with authentic Italian food.

I ate dinner at Marcella's last night and forgot how fancy it is. Like, they serve you bread before the meal and there are table clothes. And yet, the portion sizes are so small.  Last night, it was a typical busy evening so we had to wait fifteen minutes so we grabbed a drink at the bar. I ordered a Rhinegeist beer (I think it was Cougar) and thought it was an easy to drink beer.I learned that when you order a drink at the bar before your meal, you are supposed to close out your tab there. For some reason I thought I could take the receipt with me to the table and pay the waitress for our bar tab. Nah, doesn't work that way.We sat at a granite tabletop next to the window facing High St. so it was fun to watch all the people pass by. There was a yoga class going on at the Joseph hotel so that was unique to watch a yoga class while eating dinner.I ordered the Tortellini Alla Manzo and thought the beef, mushrooms and tortellini was delicious but I wish there was more of it. For what I paid, I expected an Olive Garden-esque portion and enough that I could take some home for lunch the next day. There were maybe six tortellini pieces in total.My boyfriend ordered the Linguine and Clams. The pasta had a really nice flavor. This was my first time trying clams and I would definitely order them again.I still like Marcella's but I wish the portions were larger.
Excellent. The giant meatball is amazing! This is a great place for date night. They also have a great happy hour.

Came here on a Friday night with my boyfriend. We made a 6 o clock reservation and arrived maybe 15 minutes early. We were seated immediately and loved the atmosphere of the restaurant. There was dim lighting and it was full of noise from everyone talking, but we loved it. I got the chopped salad with balsamic vinaigrette and my boyfriend got the Caesar as well as the bruschetta appetizer. Everything was amazing and we couldn't wait for our entrees. I ordered the penne alla arrabiatta with a veal meatball (I heard they were amazing), and my boyfriend got the gnocchi with lamb and a meatball. It was honestly some of the best Italian food I have ever had, and believe me, I eat a lot of Italian food. The meatball was so moist and tender that it literally melted in my mouth. The pasta was spicy and perfectly al dente. I've already made reservations to come back and carboload the night before we run the Columbus Half Marathon. I 100% recommend Marcella's. Absolutely amazing.
Chicken parm was good, came with alfredo on the spaghetti which was not normal. Tasted great, straightforward meal.

Just ordered from here. Pizza is good but small. The calamari was the only thing I was impressed with and a good portion. The sausage and peppers I ordered was my biggest disappointment. It was 1 sausage with very little peppers. Are order was for delivery courtesy of postmates.

The dim atmosphere makes Marcella's an excellent date location. Personally I think the menu is slightly limited and prices slightly high. However, the quality and location warrant these small exceptions. I have eaten here twice and both meals were delicious. My date was very happy with the decision. Overall, it is a good place in the Short North....but there are many other close by options you might wish to try first.

We've been to Marcella's at Polaris and most recently on Tuesday PM in the Short North.  The Short North was a disappointment. The food, drink and ambiance are all wonderful. Three pasta dishes and one chicken.  Wine, beer and cocktails were perfect. Even on a Tuesday night for dinner with friends the place was busy which gave it a great vibe almost as if it were the weekend.  Where this location disappointed was the server.  It must have not been a good night for her.  Our experience of her wasn't warm rather robotic.  When there was an error on a salad she brought out to the table and as it was called to her attention (and it was provided politely) she argued with us repeating what she heard vs. what was truly ordered. At the end of the meal she didn't ask any of us if we wanted coffee, dessert or another round of drinks.  Our experience was she couldn't be bothered and was anxious for us to move on.  Upon sharing our thoughts with corporate we received a canned response.  Not the best dining experience which is sad considering this is a Cameron Mitchell establishment and that was surprising and unfortunate.  We're open to trying other fine dining establishments and are open to suggestions.  We'd much rather write winning reviews were we can share about positive experiences.

Made a reservation and that was a good idea, it was packed on a Monday night. Arenchini was very good as well as the house bread and oil. Ordered the chicken parmesean and meatball with fettuccine. Both were good but not the best I've ever had.

I had a wonderful dinner at Marcella's this past weekend with my rowing team. We were in the area for a competition and had heard good things about this restaurant, so the race coordinator got twelve of us a reservation. Marcella's is in a popular part of town and it was an Ohio State football game day, so we were lucky to be seated at all and didn't mind a few separate tables. The staff were accommodating about some members of the party arriving later as well, which was appreciated. The atmosphere inside is dark wood with Italian accents (maps, loaves of bread in baskets, etc) and the effect is very charming. The ladies room had mouthwash with little disposable plastic shot glasses for rinsing next to the sink, which was nice touch. I can't help but wish more places did that!I'm unable to eat dairy, so I was confined to ordering some of their delicious cured meats and eating that with the bread and olive oil at the table, but this was plenty. The beer list was small but high-quality and very reasonably priced, with craft drafts for $5 and bottles for $4. Definitely a better deal than one typically sees in Pittsburgh. Overall I was very favorably impressed with Marcella's and will make a point to come back if I'm ever in Columbus again.

I still really enjoy the food and the ambience, but the service continues to slip. Went there a couple of weeks ago, and the server we had not seemed disinterested to the point of being annoyed by us. Each time I asked her a question about the menu, before she finished addressing me she would look  toward another person in my group to the point where I could not hear her. I'm not sure if she thought the older members of my party were more worthy of her time. Whatever it was, it was weird It was weird and unsettling. Servers at Red Lobster do a better job, its a pity because I really enjoy the food.

I'm not a huge happy hour person because most happy hours are centered around alcohol and that's just not my thing. Some restaurants include limited small bites on their hh menu and then there's Marcella's with their crazy amazing hh menu. Not only does hh include specialty cocktails, but they also include glasses of wine over $9! Now, I don't drink that much, but when I do, I'm all about craft cocktails and good wine and when they're 1/2 off?! Who's with me?They have so many selections of food to choose from and while I wanted a pizza, I opted instead for the melted pecorino cheese and fennel salad with pan seared salmon medium rare....OMG! Every bite of everything was so delicious and I see why their were people lined up outside at 3:50.

Absolutely love this spot! Particular diners from LA. Great attention to detail as displayed in the ribbed water glasses and rock wine glasses. The risotto was spectacular and the lasagna authentic. The atmosphere and overall vibe warm and fun with just the right amount of background noise. Service was a bit inexperienced but capable and willing. Great overall experience that contributed to a fun start to our evening.

This place is pretty overrated in my opinion. Multiple people have told me it is a must try in the short north, but all in all it was very average.  My girlfriend and I try the calamari at every restaurant we visit and this place currently ranks last out of 15+ restaurants in the Columbus area.  Their Tuscan limonata tastes like floor cleaner, even Diane Amos would be proud.  And the gnocchi con bolognese wasn't very good. Martini right down the street is much better (owned by the same people). Despite the average dinner, our service was very good. Our waitress was visibly very busy juggling other tables, but was able to check in periodically to make sure we had all that we needed.
The meatball alone is worth 5 stars. A Columbus classic, inventive Italian menu showcasing a delightful tour of Italy. Feels great to eat and drink wine at Marcella's.

Nice looking with a warm yet elegant vibe. Pretty busy on a weekend. Choice this place bc of their Vegetarian and Gluten Free options. While there are actually plenty of options the taste I'd say is just alright.

This is one of my favorite places in town. I met my husband here on our first date and the restaurant graciously allowed us to have our rehearsal dinner near the back when we got married. The happy hour is one of the best in the Short North, imo - half price apps, beers, and wines - and the service is always wonderful. Gluten free diners like myself have a very large menu to choose from. Now that I've moved I REALLY miss the gluten free penne alla arrabiatta!
Nice place - friendly bar staff - lasagna was very good. Worth a look for sure.

Good atmosphere--very busy on a Sunday evening, good food, nice people, fair prices, and quick service. We were in and out in just over an hour.The caprese was standard, nothing special. Its presentation wasn't the best, came out like a deconstructed dish on a very small plate. Not sure if that's how it's served here or if the busy crowd meant fewer large plates were available?The chicken piccata was good though not typical since it wasn't flattened, breaded boneless chicken breast. I had 2 pieces, one with a portion of a bone sticking out. Different but the aroma and flavor were great. A little on the dry side but the crust was good enough to make up for it.One thing that was frustrating is despite having had a reservation and arriving on time, we were still given a pager and made to wait before being seated.

Food was AMAZING!!!! We came here from out of town to compete in the Ohio Star Ball. We danced all day and needed a great meal and beveeaaaage! I recommend everything on this menu! YUM! Also a special shout out to our servers: ALEX and KRISTA! We had an outstanding time!Thanks again. We will be back ;)

So I live across the street from marcellas. I come in here regularly and never have I had bad service. EXCEPT it takes ONE time to ruin my favorite place across the street from where I live. We came in on a quiet night and sat at the bar, where we were promptly greeted and had waters which was great. Our server who was a bartender asked us what we wanted to drink and everything was prompt. The issue is - she never offered us another drink, she never checked on us, and we had to get her attention to order anything we wanted. Every time I've come in, I've been offered dessert or another drink or anything else. This girl handed me my check at the end of my meal AS I WAS STILL FREAKING EATING (handed me my check as I was eating like what the heck???) and a box. I have never boxed my own food at this place and always have gotten dessert. But nope. Not this time.  This girl was extremely rude. Way to ruin my marcellas outlook. Cudos to you ma'am. But Ty and Anthony are probably the best servers there so they have that going for them.

We were running late and called to push our reservation - no problem they said. Upon our late arrival we only waited minutes for the table to be set. We started with 3 antipasti,  calamari, mushrooms, and rock shrimp. Yum yum! The calamari was so tender, almost ordered seconds. But we controlled ourselves for some scrumptious lasagna, chicken parmigiano and a sicilian pizza. This was our first time and we were very happy with everything. The service was good considering the packed house and folks waiting to get in. There were some delays but nothing to get worked up over. My daughter was taking us out for her mother's birthday and spotted their special offer of a $25 gift card with the purchase of a $100 gift card, so she's coming back with her friends next year. A double gift for mom and herself.Great food, noisy ambiance but we would be back on our next trip to Columbus.

This place is great for a date night, especially couples that like to share. My fiance and I shared multiple appetizers and a main dish, including my favorite... melted pecorino dip. It is SO GOOD, I would come here just for that. Wine list is good, I enjoyed the portion sizes, and the service was wonderful. We will be back.

Jumped in here on a Sunday whim whilst passing through the Short North. The nice dimly lit ambiance got me. Pizza also sounded good. Fancy pizza. Yes please. So that's what I got! I'll cut to it- it was fantastic. Best fancy pizza around. I wanted a beer...maybe a fancy one ... To go with my pizza. They had some, but very limited. All the usual kitschy ones you'd find anywhere. I guess it makes sense being quite an Italian place; the wine list was huge. I ate my delicious fancy pizza at a nice corner table by the window and all the while the service was great! Ambiance was great. Another great spot I'll have to come back to. Helps the parking garage is right behind it for those weekend visits!

Sorry. Had such high expectations too.Noisy but inviting ambience. Friendly and accommodating staff.Ok food. Meatballs were a first - practically nothing there. Really?Sauce seemed not fresh.Pizza good but nothing exceptional.Not cheap.Whew!

The service was great!  Great atmosphere and the food was delicious.  It's very kid friendly.  They gave the kids a bag of various noodles and tied it up with string.  When we got to the table, they knew just what to do.  They made pasta necklaces.  It kept them busy until the food got to us.  Genius!  The menu had a nice variety.  Something for everyone.  I would definitely go back when visiting Columbus.

What eating connoisseur would avoid this fine dining experience? Sheik, elegant, delicious, are just a few words that come to mind when I think of this local Italian eatery. The first time I sampled their cuisine I was taken aback, I thought, this a fluke, I picked the one thing they do best, but to my pleasurable suprise, they do everything great. If you have not tried this real Italian dining experience your mouth has been cheated out of a religious taste experience. I highly recommend this establishment to anyone who loves to enjoy a wonderful atmosphere, great service and a meal that would make you tell every secret you know. Happy dining.
Great authentic Italian. Went during happy hour all the food was great the drinks were great and the bill was great. Waitress was also great

This may be one of the best happy hours in the city! From 4-6 PM, you can have half off of most of their menu -- pretty much all of the food except the signature dishes and main entrees. So, you can get half price pizza, half price salads, half price appetizers and small plates, half price COCKTAILS and half price on any wine that is $9 a glass or less! This means that I had a pizza, a salad, and two glasses of wine for $20. WHAT?!?! I also sampled some of the calamari and the arancini appetizers, and they are both delicious.I do think that some of the items I ordered would have been a tad overpriced if they hadn't been part of happy hour. For example, while the pizza was pretty tasty, it would be overpriced at $14. If I had only ordered the pizza, I could have eaten it all by myself. I think $10 would have been a more fair price. Anyway, it was still really good and a steal at $6.50! My beet and goat cheese salad was so good; a nice balance of flavors and the dressing wasn't too overpowering. This place has a clean, swanky atmosphere, and the price point of the regular food is still low enough to enjoy a nice night out. The service was friendly and accurate, and the bathrooms are super nice. Your best bet is the happy hour, but it's a great place for dinner if you have people in town or want to celebrate a special occasion.

Disappointed everytime I go! This place is pretty, servers are wonderful but food is NOT good at all. I have been here 4 times hoping for better quality food but highly disappointed every time. For a Cameron Michel restaurant, Much more is expected. The tiramisu also isn't very italian for an italian restaurant. I think whole foods has 20x better and more authentic tiramisu than this place.

Assuredly a top 3 restaurant in Columbus. They nailed it: food is delicious, decor is warm and inviting, service is attentive and knowledgable. Started with the melted pecorino which was nutty & buttery. Delicious with honey and apples provided. My truffle mushroom pizza was great. More than enough to feel satisfied. Only drawback was the noticeable amount of grease permeating through the crust. Boyfriend's lamb gnocchi was EXCEPTIONAL. I was food jealous.

I came here and to be honest I was like this okay for columbus. Its a step above an olive garden.  Then I found out it was a Cameron Mitchell  restaurant (which I should give him 1 star as a result). I have eaten at Ocean Prime in Denver and Martini's a few blocks away so I know he can do way way better. For someone that knows food his choices were abominable. I admit I only had two appetizers and a grapefruit spritzer and sampled their sangria.I will go in order step by step.1) Sangria.  I always tell people you can tell how good a place is by trying their sangria.  I would drink a wine cooler any day then drink what was put in front of me.  Apparently they put soda water and ginger ale. Really.  Okay I am going to say again really?  Sangria is not hard.  Let me give you a simple recipe  I found 30 second on-line the kind I grew up with that my mom made that she adapted from her travels in Spain.http://minimalistbaker.com/easy-traditional-red-sangria/2. Eggplant rottini -  This was good.  I can see how it can be messed up being oily, smoothered in cheese, or tomato sauce.  They however messed up because it was served warm to room temperature and their was a weird after taste which I think was the tap water they were using instead of filtered water with the breadcrumbs.3.  bruschetta with ricotta.  With this, the bread was a little thick, the bread also had a weird after taste, I think it was the water again but my biggest complaint is the tomato sauce totally adulterated the dish.  Classic example of where a chef does way way too much.  The best ricotta dish is by far the most simple.  Please please go to another restaurant Michael Smith's extra virgin in Kansas City and get their home made ricotta and bread.  It is better than sex. It's that amazing. Yet I never tasted the ricotta at this restaurant. All I tasted was tomato sauce, a lot of salt (from the porcuitto), and the after taste of the bread but no ricotta.  If you are fixated on the tomato maybe a fresh slice of tomato but no tomato sauce mess.  Please do check out extra virgin  in Kansas City you will know instantly what I mean. Pure heaven.4. Grapefruit Spitzer -  Good but not great had better at the Le Meridien bar across the street.I forgot to mention my server was excellent.

This was amazing! It is a great spot for a romantic evening or with a small group of friends. It is more of an intimate setting with a dimly light environment/candles on the tables. I tried a Manhatten from their cocktail list. It was the perfect amount of bourbon and sweetness that made it very enjoyable to sip on as a pre dinner drink. The Melted Pecorino was delicious. I layered the bread with some of the thin apple slices with cheese and topped it with honey. It was a light appetizer that is great for sharing.For dinner I ordered the tortellini. I felt that it was heavily saturated in sauce. However, I thought it had a lot of flavor. Next time I go, I want to try their Chicken Parm. Our waitress said it was one of her favorites!I thought the prices were reasonable for the type of restaurant and location in the Short North.

We went here on a Friday night and the place was hopping with students and family.  The service was efficient and he made good recommendations..  if you are gluten free this is the place for you.  They served gluten free bread which was served warm.  My family told me that this bread tasted better than the regular bread served for the table.  The flatbread pizza were large and very good.  The gluten free chicken Parmesan is a must.  The sangria was very good and served with a lot of fruit.  The noise level does get very noisy but the ambiance is wonderful.

So, we visited this spot on a Saturday early afternoon. It is a hip spot, has the huge window/doors that open to the outside. It was busy, but our server was awesome (I wish I had his name).  The food is good - The menu is typical of Cameron Mitchell.  I guess you would say it is authentic Italian fare.  I had heard of the huge meatballs and they are correct!  The meatball is humongous and I can't wait to try it the next time I go.  Overall it is a good spot to go to people watch, have a good meal or have a great time with friends.

No. Absolutely not. This place was such a let down in every conceivable way. We waited 2 hours for our table after being told we would have a 45 minute wait. Once we sat down we got over it and got excited for some nice Italian food. The menu was very basic as far as Italian goes, with nothing extraordinarily different from other Italian restaurants. I got spaghetti as I heard good things about it, and my girlfriend got the chicken parmesan. Our table was incredibly small and right near their drink station so we were constantly being run into and asked to scoot in so the employees could get through. After an hour of being pushed and shoved we finally got our food and were once again optimistic. Despite the long waits and horrible table location, we really were excited for the food, but it let us down. The pasta was dry and under cooked, while the chicken was over cooked in the chicken parm. Our waiter never once apologized for the bad food or table, and I guess he doesn't have to but it would have made things a little better. Horrible service, horrible food, completely overrated.

never disappoints! Not too often downtown for happy hour but I made it today and went right over to Marcella's. Sat right down and ordered the carbonara with the egg yolk (not sure of the correct name on the menu). It was just as amazing as I remember it. service was awesome too

Great spot on high street, excellent wait staff, the pizza is wood fired, zesty but not too hot , if it's warm try to sit at the windows open to the street. The chicken piccata is excellent - bone in not a prepackaged boneless chicken breast wonderful dinner spot and great wine selection. We will come back-  that about says it all doesn't it?

Our party of 7 went here around 5:30 on Monday, August 28.  The place was already crowded, but we were seated promptly (we had a reservation).  The service was excellent; our server could not have been any better! She was very personable, and treated us as if we were her only customers. I watched her with her other customers, and she was the same with them. The appetizers we ordered were plentiful and delicious, the wine was excellent, and the food was superb. I had to send my lasagna bolognese back because it was not as hot as if should be, and instead of just reheating my dinner, the chef prepared a new serving - and it was perfect. Desserts were wonderful and really big enough to be shared by 2. Even though the restaurant was very crowded and very loud, we were all very happy with Marcella's, and we will be back.

I'm not really sure why this is a popular spot in Columbus. The atmosphere is always dark, loud, and cramped. The tables feel too small and it's a hard place to enjoy a conversation. The meatball I ordered was so rare I was afraid to eat it.

Amazing food and even better service. When seated at the table, the server brought a gluten free menu larger than most restaurants provide. They offer gluten free pasta as a substitute and brought my own personal fresh baked plate of bread as an appetizer. The staff was very knowledgeable and informative on gluten-containing ingredients and even offered letting me talk to the chef. They explained their chefs graduated from Columbus culinary institute, one of the best in the country, and is very educated in celiac and gluten free cuisine. They were able to confirm that all of the sauces, seasonings, and dressings used in all items on the gluten-free menu were safe. I ordered the penne and clams, which was out of this world and even had some crab. I was able to split my meal with a friend where they made her half with regular pasta. Overall amazing experience and extremely gluten/celiac friendly!

Amazing food, amazing service very fresh!  I go to Columbus twice a year and look forward to trying new restaurants- however Marcellas will always be a staple in my trips! I am never disappointed by the food, amazing service and drinks.  I have tried many different things on the menu but would definitely recommend the meatball pasta or sea-food penne.  Great gluten free options. A must try for everyone!

What a nice surprise! My wife and I brought our son and girlfriend here for dinner last night and we all really enjoyed our experience. Our appetizer was the melted fontina with apples and crostini. This was delicious. The beers were local IPAs and very good. The wife and I had chicken parm, very tasty!The ambience is old school amazing and very cozy. Service was impeccable! I highly recommend!

Outstanding food as great service!!!   The only reason I don't give it 5 stars was how incredibly loud the place is.  It may seem petty but it did diminish our experience here.  We made reservations which I STRONGLY recommend and had a good evening but did have a hard time having a conversation without feeling like we we were shouting.   But if you can deal with the noise it is definitely worth at least one try.  Our food was great and the waitress (can't remember her name) was wonderful.  Would go back again for sure but would bring some ear plugs (only kidding).

I like this place. Although the noise is a bit too loud for me I rated it as average because I was seated in the bar area.  In any case the food was good. I had The bresaola as a stater with a glass of proseco. As a main dish I had the linguini with clams which was very good.

I'm very disappointed in Marcella's.  It's a great restaurant but their pick up process definitely needs work.  I had a simple meatball and fettuccine order and I was told it'd take 20-25 minutes.  It ended up taking 51 excruciating minutes for me to get my food.  I waited in the restaurant for 30 of them.

Great service at the bar! Our bartender was super nice and helpful in deciding which pasta to get. I never had to ask for a refill for my drink, she was very attentive even while the restaurant was packed on a waiting list. I had the penne arrabbiata and added a meatball.  The meatball was tender and full of flavor. I recommend their beet salad to start. I'll be coming back for sure.

Stopped in for a casual dinner meeting with a colleague. Thursday around 7 and the place was hopping. Waited about 20 minutes for a table but that was fine as the bar was a welcome pit stop after a long day. Got seated in the bar area at a high top where it is open air to the street, cool! Had a few small plates, the eggplant was really good as well was the broccolini.Main dish was Salmon and was cooked just the way I like it with a medium center and the flavored were not overdone. All in all a cool spot with lots to right around here. It's comfortable and a bit on the load side but that works for me!Nice spot!

In the Short North, Cameron Mitchell has 2 Italian restaurants-- Marcella's and Martini. Of the two, Marcella's is much more casual and affordable. I also feel that Marcella's is closer to an actual Italian restaurant whereas Martini is more of a fancy Italo-American fusion. The food is great, the service is great, and the price is reasonable. On the flipside, it being the Short North, there's not a lot of space inside the restaurant. If you're seated at a booth, you'll have plenty of space. But if you're seated at a table, you'll feel like if you scoot your seat back too far, you'll hit someone else. So from the perspective of personal space, the Marcella's in Polaris is superior.

Is delicious! The cured meats and cheeses, yes! Had a fondue style pecorino with apples and honey truffle, yes! Not sure if it was just the night we chose but the place was packed with females so this just made the view that much better but back to the food, pizza looked great, huge meatballs. I'll definitely be back!

We've been here a few times. Pros:Good classic but modern Italian menu Table is ready upon reservation time Food can be a bit salty for some Cons:Cramped seating arrangement - you'll either be too close to your neighbor or the walkway where the staff come through Service can be a bit spotty at times

When going to Columbus Oho, there are two things you hope for:  1) to see Cardell Jones on or off the field  2) meatballs from Marcella's So delicious!   Making a reservation is recommended, as the place is always hopping !!The only negative is, it's pretty tight quarters... But most good/casual Italian restaurants are loud and crowded ~ Marcella's is perfect.When your finished... Jeni's is across the street

We went here after a day at the Zoo.  Gregg M picked us a spot (I was in the mood for pasta).  It didn't disappoint.  We started off with the arincini:  Perfectly crispy on the outside with the right amount of oozy cheesy goodness on the inside.  For dinner, I got the Lasagne Alla Bolognese.  It had a wonderful sausage marinara sauce - just the right amount of spicy, and the pasta was perfectly cooked.  We decided to split a half bottle of Amarone della Valpolicella Classico which was also pleasing to the palate.  To finish off the night, I got the Tiramisu - I have to say, this is probably one of the best ones I've had (and I've had a lot!); even my mom and hubby liked it! I only have one criticism from our whole meal:  I wish the bread served would have been warm.  All in all a great meal and if we are in Columbus again, I'm could see us checking out their pizzas (they looked really good!)

"JAPAN... why you giving me heart attacks every time you shoot a goal and miss?!?!"*sips on my Tuscan Limonata* ahh... much better.Marcella was my prime spot in watching Japan take on Greece in World Cup fashion. I was meeting a friend here for supper in what I know call Italian Chic. The bougie restaurant bar has everything going for it and I couldn't have had a better dining experience here as I watch my team play football (soccer kids) compete and sippin' on some drinks to quell the stress.The must-drinks (Happy Hour is before 6PM on weekdays it seems- nearly half off most items!)- Tuscan Limonata - Fantastic, citrus vodka drink!- Red Sangria - OMG one of the best sangria I've ever had! Real raspberries at the bottom. Order a liter!As for the bites, I must say I am in love with both items of consumption that we ordered.The calamari was BOMB! I've never had calamari be fried so lightly that it masked any unhealthyness that came with it. On top of that, the dish had a helping of other fried veggies to compliment the squid. I was in love with this and wish we had gotten another dish!Finally, the Sicilian Pizza was to die for! Plenty of meat for the carnivores, and the crust wasn't too thin nor thick. It was just the right amount for the ingredients on top!The drinks and food weren't the quickest to come out, but our lovely waitress made sure that our waters were filled and our bread basket was replenished. Considering how busy it got in the early evening (and the overall quality of the food and drinks), I'll let that slide.Loved my experience here at Marcella's. The only thing that would (and should) have made it better was Japan finally scoring a goal. Ahh... zannen. I'll be back for more game watching and calamari eating for sure.

I went to Marcella's on a Thursday night to celebrate my birthday and I was SO glad that Yelp pointed me, yet again, in the right direction.  We made reservations which was good because the place was packed.  The only downfall of this restaurant is that it is very loud.  If you are looking for a quiet, romantic Italian dinner this probably isn't the best place.  If you want a super delicious Italian dinner, read on...The service we received here was top notch.  The manager seated us and offered a few different table options.  He was so welcoming.  He knew we were there for my birthday and asked about what brought us to town.  Our server was just as great.  She had a lot of ordering recommendations which I always love.  We started off with a bottle of wine and the arancini (risotto balls).  For dinner we had the Fettuccini Meatball and the lamb gnocchi.  The food was out of this world good.  The best part was I though the gnocchi was the best dish, my husband thought the other was the best- this never happens... I got to eat of the gnocchi.We got a free dessert of our choice for my birthday and we somehow managed to fit a piece of tiramisu in our very full, very happy bellies.  We were shocked when we got the bill how reasonable everything was- we actually thought they forgot to charge us for something.  I will be thinking about this meal for a long time and you can bet I will be back the next time I find myself in Columbus.

Well, we tried this place again and once again left somewhat disappointed.Came here on a gallery hop Saturday night. Sat close to the bar. The noise was deafening, but that didn't bother me. Just needed to mention it in case it might bother someone else.The good: Sangria was good. Chicken parm was really good. Fettuccine alfredo was ok.The bad. Wife got a gluten-free four-cheese pizza. Now, since it was gluten free we didn't expect much from the crust. But the rest of the pizza was horrible. Hardly any taste. And the four cheese seemed to be some chunks of ricotta. That's it. VERY disappointing. Quite possibly the worst pizza I ever tasted.Service was good, of course.If you come here, don't do it for the pizza. This place has great appetizers and decent drink/wine prices. I think that our visits in the future will be limited to these things.

having just returned from italy a week prior, i was ambivalent about eating italian food again so soon, but marcella's is the real deal! and speaking of deals, the happy hour 1/2 price on all cocktails, salads, appetizers, and pizzas was an incredible deal, especially with such reasonable prices to begin with! (living in the sf bay area, it's always nice to travel to more sanely priced places.)the ambiance is friendly and casual, yet classy. our server, laura, deserves a special shout out for her patience with us first-timers. she explained every dish in detail, made solid recommendations, and didn't even blink when we had a special request for wrapping our leftovers. and the food... well, here's the breakdown of our meal:the calamari & zucchini was delicately fried and served with marinara and a lemon, garlic aioli for dipping. very tasty, but i would have enjoyed a higher ratio of calamari in the mix, as it was perfectly tender.the melted pecorino arrived sizzling at the table, with crostini, shaved apple slices and truffle honey. an absolutely mouth watering combo!i had marcella's chopped salad, and should have asked for the dressing on the side... the flavors got lost having been drenched in too much creamy peppercorn.my friend had the fennel salad, and really enjoyed the light, fresh balance of flavors.we finished with the pesto shrimp pizza. all hail garlic and goat cheese! the tangy bite of that cheese really set this pizza apart and the chewy, flavorful crust elevated this pie to perfection!the bill totaled around $44 for all that food, plus two cocktails and a soda.next time i'm in columbus, i'm making a beeline to marcella's! good food, great service, and incredible happy hour prices!

I got the Mushroom pizza, it was quite delicious.  The atmosphere was good, but it was super busy and we had to wait to get a table.  I think if you were going to try and go to happy hour here, you will be there with the rest of Columbus so get there early

I wish I could give more than five stars. Last night was the first time I've been in over two years... and I've spent the last two years daydreaming about how good there meatballs are!!! Great atmosphere, and more importantly the most delicious Italian food.

I love the vibe and decor, but more to the point  I loved the spaghetti and meatballs.  Or more accurately, meatball. It comes with one extra large, super-sized meatball that is easily the best in the city. Nice and tender. And they offer to grate fresh parmigiano right onto your plate, at the table. The house bread with the olive oil is also nice. Though I'd have liked it if there was some balsamic vinegar to further complement it. The only real complaint I have is that if you get a table in the front, you need to sit on a backless bar stool, which was very uncomfortable on my back.  Also, the candles at a lot of the tables had gone out. They're a really nice accent, so it'd be great if they were kept going.  But overall, it's great!

This restaurant was recommended by a colleague as amazing so I thought I would try it while in town. I ordered a Caesar salad and a gluten free pizza along with a glass of wine. My colleague ordered a beet salad with a potato pizza. The salads were really fresh and delicious. I was excited to see that they had gluten free pizza! Upon ordering, I was able to customize my pizza which was also nice. I like to consider myself a pizza "expert" and was not thoroughly impressed. Might have to try again and try something other than pizza! Nothing wrong with this but just was a run-of-the-mill Italian restaurant in my opinion.

I left the Nationwide Stadium starving!  I search for a Gluten free restaurant around Columbus on the  "Find me Gluten free" app. Marcellas got a few great reviews on their gluten-free pizza.I called and ordered take out. The gluten-free four-cheese pizza with mushrooms and a side of garlic bread with cheese. Now, since it was gluten free I didn't expect much from the crust. The crust was horrible and the rest of the pizza was horrible. Hardly any taste. And the four cheese seemed to be some chunks of ricotta barfed in globs and a few shaving of another cheese.  It was VERY disappointing. Quite possibly the worst pizza I ever tasted. The crust was like wet rawhide, very hard to chew. I snarled down one piece and went to bed with hopes of a better breakfast. The garlic bread with cheese. What a joke! This was not gluten free.  I knew this, when purchasing for my daughter. $10.50 for four slices of bread, the size of a mans thumb. And it missing the garlic taste.

What a fabulous restaurant!  It was the best Italian food I've had outside of the North End in Boston and Providence RI. They prepared linguine with clams just the way I like it - in marinara. The portion was generous and the clams were fresh. My husband had the lasagna. It was delicious and beautifully prepared. Save room for dessert - it was very difficult to decide! All the choices were made fresh on the premises. I had the cannolis - you get two, so plenty to share!  The restaurant was a little noisy but it was full of people having a good time. The decor was beautiful and the service was great.
Delicious and sweet staffs. Their meatball is so moist and tasty. I wish their portion was a little bit larger though. And it's very very hot in there.

Came here because I heard they had gluten-free pasta and pizza.  Decided to try the gluten-free pasta with arrabiata (spicy tomato) sauce.  I asked if it was super spicy and the server said it wasn't.  I'm not someone who can eat super spicy food but I do like things that are medium spicy, so I ordered it.  The pasta was done correctly, just the right al dente, which is not easy to do with the GF variety.  Unfortunately, the arrabiata was extremely spicy, so spicy I really could not eat it.  I ended up eating a bite of gluten free bread (which was delicious) with every bite of pasta, that was the only way I could eat it.  If I could return I would probably try the carbonara but I cannot recommend the arrabiata.

Good food, slow/poor service, loud and dark.  With all great reviews, I was expecting better.  Not a place to try and have a nice conversation over your meal.  Our waitress was pretty much non-existent.  Took nearly 1.5 hours to our food, fortunately it was hot.  Unfortunately, they decided to bring it out piecemeal.

Amazing food, wonderful atmosphere, and nice staff. We were sitting by the open window when a man came up to us asking for money. The manager was there in a heartbeat and sent him away. He wanted us to have the best experience we could there, and we did. We will definitely return

One of my favorites in Columbus. Spectacular spot for great Italian food. Ambiance is on point and there is always a roaring crowd.. regardless of time or night of the week. Perfect for a date night, ladies night or a group dinner. Prices are reasonable for upscale Italian and portions are also as expected. Nice Italian wine list. Boyfriend and I frequent here and have yet to find something we don't like.

Best happy hour in Columbus, and one of my go-to places to bring friends! The happy hour is every weekday from 4-6pm (including Fridays!) and includes 1/2 off all drinks, apps, and pizzas. Between many visits and coming here in large groups, I feel like I've tried most of their happy hour menu items - here are some of my favorites:- Apps: melted pecorino cheese w/ apples and crostini (so simple yet delicious!), braised veal meatball (super tender and flavorful), calamari (crispy and I like that there's 2 dipping sauces), prosciutto bruschetta (but I can't say no to prosciutto lol)- Pizzas: four seasons (prosciutto, zucchini, mushroom, olive), pesto shrimp, and crispy potato w/ pancetta (you'd be surprised how well the potato works on pizza)- Drinks: both sangrias (although I preferred the white over red), grapefruit basil fizz, tuscan limonata - I've only ordered off their regular menu once, but the linguini & clams I got was really yummy and seafood-y Protip: for the happy hour, you just have to order your items by 6pm (not finish eating), so I've literally gotten there at 5:50pm before and ordered everything at once lol. So good, and I will definitely be back!

I've only been to Marcella's once, but I had a five star experience.Note: I paid with a giftcard, so maybe this is slightly biased. Our server was highly attentive without being bothersome or pushy. He knew the menu well. When I asked if a specific pasta dish was vegetarian he said, "Yes, it's actually vegan!" He went on to say there is a vegetarian eggplant parmesan the kitchen can make that isn't listed on the menu. I got that. Every component was well-executed. The citrus sangria was bright and refreshing. The sunchoke salad came out on an ice cold plate and truly was the best salad I've ever tasted. The recommended eggplant parm was everything I want indulgent Italian food to be. It would have totally been an appropriate portion to share, but I ate it all. I rounded out the meal with a martini and tiramisu (I did share that). Side note: Their bathroom soap is amazing! Make a special trip to try it out. 2 salads, 2 entrees, 4 drinks, 1 dessert rounded out to about $50 per person before tip. Too pricey for me on a normal day, but definitely a fair value for what I got. I'm told their happy hour is a great deal, but I've never been.
Every app, salad, and entree I've ever gotten here has been delicious, and their happy hour discounts can't be beat. I stop by for an pancetta, arugula, and tallegio pizza anytime I'm in Columbus.

A Columbus staple!  If you are here as a visitor, it is a must-try.  If you are a Columbus resident and have not tried it, what are you waiting for?  The meatball alone is worth the wait time, and even the salads are amazing.  Go on a Wednesday or Sunday for 1/2 your bottle of wine.

This is the "Go To" Italian restaurant in Columbus. If you are in the mood for Italian this is a no brainer. The Chicken Parmesan is usually my choice, and it never disappoints. The risotto balls are an awesome choice for an appetizer. All the apps are great though.If you are going to drive here, anticipate using the valet. Also, I would plan on making a reservation, especially if you have a decent sized group. If you are just a twosome you can usually walk in with no problem. Careful about ordering too many bottles of wine or cocktails, because your bill will explode before you even realize. The only food I can complain about is the bread... It is a little bland and boring. Bottom line: If you looking for a spot for date night, Marcella's is the perfect choice... Every time.

Good solid Italian restaurant with great service and good food. I would return.As mentioned in several of the other reviews, the atmosphere is loud, lively and packed. Definitely make reservation. Upon arrival we were seated immediately.The server appeared right away and took our drink and appetizer order. Both arrived very quickly. The calamari and cheeses were very good and served at the right temperature.My wife had the Chicken Marsala which she rated as good, but not the best she's had. My seared salmon was also good but slightly under cooked. Good, but still slightly under cooked.The desserts were excellent. So overall, we felt the appetizers and desserts were excellent and would return for these as well as try the small plates.

Decent to middling food, great service, way over rated. Not worth the price.THE FOODThe salads were middling. The calamari was quite good, especially the add of the fried lemon rings. The salmon and lemon veal were very good indeed. But the sausage pizza and the pasta carbonera were pretty uninspiring. Tiramisu was quite well done but too sweet, the canolis were crazy good, but the tart with ice cream was passable.THE ATMOSPHEREThe over use of parmesan makes the place stank like olive garden. But otherwise a lively and well appointed place.THE SERVICEThis is where all the Cameron Mitchell places shine, super courteous and gracious, even if a bit syrupy.Not worth $150+

I like this place. Nice atmosphere. Reminded me of some bigger city restaurants you find in places like New York (only twice as big). Full, but not crowded. Service was good. Pasta dishes were good and the wine selection was reasonable in size and price. I heard happy hour is amazing but haven't been. I hope I can get back for dinner.

Read all the GF reviews (I have celiac) and thought I'd give it a try... Ordered gluten free carbonara online and even called the restaurant to make sure that my order would be gluten free. Was surprised when I got my food and there was VERY gluteny bread in the bag. Thankfully, I didn't eat it. Celiacs beware ordering online! Make sure to note gluten free (or no) bread.

Marcella's was one of the very first restaurants I visited after moving to Columbus. My initial dining experience was positive. This made me excited about the Columbus food scene, hoping Marcella's was an accurate representation.  I've been back a few times since and I still believe Marcella's is one of the better Italian restaurants in town. There's something formulaic about Cameron Mitchell restaurants, but the formula works so i'm not hating. You can always expect a certainly level of aesthetic in a Cameron Mitchell restaurant. The atmosphere is chic with a bar-restaurant atmosphere.  The lighting is dim and the  waiters are uniformed and polite. Marcella is a busy and noisy restaurant, yet still maintains an intimate and romantic ambiance. It's a good date spot. The food, drinks and service have been consistently good. The prosciutto and melon, melted pecorino cheese and braised veal meatball are all great appetizers. Get the prosciutto and melon if you want something light and get the meatball to share if you're more hungry. The pecorino cheese is a fun dish in that you self-assemble your own crostini with apple, honey, cheese and small pieces of bread. As far as main dishes go, i've only ordered their pasta. They have all been good. I've ordered the ravioli mezzaluna, penne alla arrabiatta and the gnocchi con bolongese. Out of the 3, the penne arrabiatta is my least favorite and most bland. The gnocchi con bolongese is the most flavorful, but at the same time the most rich and filling. It comes with melt-in-your-mouth braised lamb and a generous amount of parmesan reggiano. Not for the fainthearted though. The ravioli mezzaluna is a good compromise in terms of taste and quantity. The goat cheese ravioli, bacon and mushrooms will satisfy your tastebuds without leaving you uncomfortably full. My date ordered the chicken marsala and seemed pretty content with it. I usually don't have room for dessert (order too many appetizers), but on one occasion I did have the Tiramisu and it was good. Overall, Marcella's is a excellent Italian option in the Short North. It's busy and trendy for a reason. The food and service are consistently good.  There are definitely quieter spots out there, but if you're planning a night on the town afterwards, there are not too many better places. I will be back.

As if to commit a cardinal sin, I don't care for pasta--YET I found myself at the Italian restaurant. Tonight, I decided to check out the Short North district for dinner. After sharking around for a place to park in the neighborhood, I followed the tide down to the main drag. I stopped at Marcella's window to surf the menu and was greeted with an on street recommendation that the pasta + meatball was "to die for". Me, not caring for pasta, was looking at the pizza, but decided to take her word for it. The place was busy, so that had to be a good sign. I sat at the bar and was served immediately. A drink that was en route to a table caught my eye, and when I asked about and decided to order it, the bartender subbed me the one meant for the table right on the spot. I ordered the margarita pizza, and it was good. I've been spoiled by the Yia Yia pizza gods, so I can't say it's the best I've ever had but would definitely order again.Finished up dinner with a glass of red wine & left very happy that I followed the flow into Marcella's.

Not gonna lie I wasn't a huge fan of this place.  I thought overall the food was just mediocre, and definitely not worthy of the price.  We were able to try their veal meatballs, the arancini, and their gnocchi.  Of the three, I was most impressed with the gnocchi which was cooked well and had a nice flavorful meat sauce.  The other two dishes, though, felt a little flat and could have used more seasoning.  I will say that the portions were pretty good though, as those three dishes were more than enough for two people.Service here was a highlight and the servers were very friendly and helped with any questions we had.  This place gets crazy busy during peak times though, so I would highly recommend a reservation.  And parking is not fun here lol.  good luck.

The braised lamb gnocchi will make your eyes roll back in your head - what more do you need to know?!  (Maybe that the chilled broccolini is awesome, there's a reason the shirts say "holy cannoli!", and they openly encourage sharing so bring a bunch of friends.)

Staff isn't as welcoming as they could be. The places makes you feel like you need to be someone to be in line there (and there is going to be a line and there won't really be anywhere comfortably to stand so be prepared for the awkward by standards).The place does have that Hoboken feel- you know that feeling where they have enough business so don't care how they treat you. Didn't really appreciate the lack of smiles and general unenthusiastic, brisk attitude of the hostess'. Expect 45 min wait times on a Friday evening if you're willing to wait. I wasn't. Two stars just for being popular despite inability to be diplomatic. 1 additional star for drink variety/selection. I'll update if I ever feel like being treated rudely and decide to actually try the "service".

Shitty service.  Bartenders and waitresses on cellphones.    Totally disgusted.  Tried to come here twice and same issue.    Video to follow showing staff on cellphones.  Sad to see a beautiful physical place become a hostage to arrogant self absorbed employees.  I predict this establishment will fold in a year.    I have been writing Yelp reviews for years.  This place needs to stop letting employees control the establishment.   SMH.

We went Saturday April 23 2016. I had a red sangria and he had a draft. Drinks were good. A little pricey though for their sizes. My sangria was pretty small but still $8. 20-30 min wait for a table but luckily there was a space at the bar for both of us. I had chicken Parmesan and he had chicken giardenara and I really liked the pasta with mine (Alfredo!) but my boyfriend wished there was something else with his besides just chicken and the vegetables. Especially considering the price!It was pretty busy, looked like there were a couple birthdays and maybe a prom being celebrated. Nice atmosphere. We are from a suburb in Chicago and definitely would like to see a Marcellas go up in the city. It would fit perfectly!

I had a great experience at Marcellas. I went during happy hour with some friends and I will definitely be going again. Happy hour is 4-6, and all cocktails and beers on tap (which there are only two on tap) are half off. Small plates, salads, and pizzas are half off too. We had an excellent three course meal; our salads were $3.50 each, $5 dollar drinks, $7 pizzas and $5ish dollar melted cheese dish. The cocktails were well worth $5, we had the lemon one and the strawberry martini one; both a little on the sweet side, but so refreshing. Salads aren't too fancy, but the pizza was out of this world. We had the mushroom pizza, which had truffle oil on it. It was one of the best mushroom pizzas I've ever had! We had sausage too and I'd have to say it was one of the best sausage pizzas I've ever had!

Two words: Happy Hour. You'll leave feeling stuffed and not wanting to eat again for the next three days, but your wallet will only be at most $15-20 lighter, if even. I am a huge fan of their mushroom pizza, which I've ordered 2 out of the 3 times I've come. Just the thought of that thin-crust truffle-oil covered mushroom and taleggio cheese makes me salivate. Easily one of the best thin-crust and/or mushroom pizzas I've ever had. I've also tried their calamari multiple times, and while my friends all rave about this appetizer, I'm not too sold on it. Rest assured, it's not bad by any means, but it just doesn't really stand out to me. Moreover, I find myself preferring to nibble on the fried veggies rather than the calamari itself. Their caprese salad is spot on in terms of flavor, although the cheese and tomato slices are a bit bigger than I'd expect. With regards to dessert, I've tried both the Tiramisu and the Profiteroles, and you really can't go wrong with either. Personally, I found the Profiteroles a bit more unique and enjoyable, partly because you can find Tiramisu just about anywhere, but their Tiramisu is nonetheless still a solid choice (just not as memorable as the Profiteroles). My favorite aspect of the profiteroles is probably the fact that they're literally bite-sized, so you can just go CHOMP and enjoy this delectable treasure.

Marcella's was an amazing experience!We went here after the travesty of dining at HP, on our first trip ever to Columbus Ohio.  (Shout out again, Columbus - you are a super neat city!)Huge link to my HP review:  (http://www.yelp.com/biz/hyde-park-prime-steakhouse-columbus?hrid=yn3FM25YC7vHbcbIp2cBSw)  After the aforementioned dinner, we wandered the Short North for a bit, grabbed a drink with Theron's parents, then said our 'goodbye's for the night as they returned to the hotel and we went dancing in the streets.Literally, there was music coming from all the open restaurants and bars, and we danced while waiting to cross the street.  We happened to be in front of what appeared to be a delicious ice cream shop and made a whole lot of kids laugh. Good times! :)We went to Marcella's first and foremost because it was still open, not loud, and yet was still crowded - as it had been all evening and night with well-dressed Columbus(ites?).  My first question at the host stand was, "Are you guys closing soon?  Because I don't want to be one of those guests that comes in right before close."Answer? A very friendly, "No, we don't close till midnight!"  (It was a Friday).An amazingly friendly waiter made our trip to this establishment all the better.  He suggested three of his favorite red wines (all their wines are from Italy, so really, if you know which Italian wine you like just get that, or if you don't, maybe study before you go.)  We didn't really care for any of them, but ordered a carafe anyway.My husband kept saying Marcella's reminded him of our favorite pizza spot back in Chicago - where we first fell in love.  It was easy to see why, as it is dimly lit, with a lot of red touches, and a cozy atmosphere.A big difference, however, is that wine is served in carafes here, and the pizza is served on a stand, with stacked plates under it.When our gregarious waiter came back to take our order, I was pretty bummed already as I didn't see the option to make your own pizza.I asked, "what is the spiciest thing you have?"  He replied, "well the penne arrabiata for sure."  I asked, "but nothing pizza-wise?"And then he said such magical words:"Hhmm... not specifically, but we can make it anyway you want."A kitchen that doesn't mind making something *any* way you want? I tested that theory.  "Can we make the sauce arrabiata sauce instead of your typical pizza sauce?""Of course! I don't see why that would be a problem!"(Say what?!)"Um.. well.. I don't see jalapenos listed on here, do you have those for a topping?""Sure!  We should be able to scrounge some up for you!"(Hello?  Is this place for real?)Then we went about ordering our other typical favorite toppings: pepperoni, mushrooms, onions, and sometimes black olives.  The waiter graciously took our order to the kitchen while my husband and I stared at each other, smiling in disbelief.When the pie came out, no lie, it was made exactly as we'd asked.  The spice of the sauce grew hotter the more you ate it, the jalapenos were perfect, and the crust was just between thin and medium thickness - and crunchy, of course.He also gave us a side of arrabiata sauce in case we wanted more.What a great salvation to the dinner we'd had earlier, and what a wonderful way to end our first (but hopefully not last) night in Columbus, OH.I wish I had gotten the waiter's name - but if you see this and remember a pink-haired girl and dark haired guy ordering spicy pizza, thank you!And thank you, Marcella's!I would love to come back and try your small plates ^^

This definitely was not the best Italian meal I've ever had, but the service was great. There was a fruit fly in my Manhattan, and when I brought it up, they immediately gave me a new one free of charge. Their drink selections are also a plus.
