The sangria is great, and I would recommend getting the pitcher rather than just a single glass.I was a little bit disappointed however because I had high expectations from reviews and referrals. I really didn't think the food was great for the price. It sounds dumb, but I was also not a huge fan of how dark it was in the restaurant. I think our group all agreed that it was sort of like eating in a cave, though I do appreciate that many people might enjoy that kind of ambience.

Awesome place for a night out with friends! We had a party of 6 and thoroughly enjoyed dinner. We ordered a bunch of starters, and different things from the menu from the lamb pasta special, to the pizza and salads it was all a hit. The potato pizza was insane!!

Marcella's was one of the first real restaurants I went to when I moved to Columbus, and I loved everything about it. Over time I think it's lost a little bit of charm for me (hence the 4 stars and not 5), but I can never complain about the service or the quality of food I've had there. I try to order something different every time I go, but I always get sucked into happy hour deals if I'm there from 4 to 6, you can't say no to half price pizzas! Also their beet and goat cheese salad is one of my favorite foods on the planet, I would highly recommend it.The environment at Marcella's is very cozy, there's dim lighting and the tables are VERY close together, but if you're into the romantic vibe it's nice. If you're not prepared to be surrounded by 100 couples on first dates and another 100 girls' birthday dinners, then I wouldn't recommend it.

I visited Marcella's for dinner on my last trip to Columbus. We'll start by saying that a reservation is recommended for this place; otherwise you'll be waiting all evening for a table.The best part about this place is the warm bread and oil/balsamic served before your meal.  I ordered the fettuccine and meatball as me entree, and was disappointed after the glowing reviews. The meatball was good, albeit lukewarm, but the fettuccine was average and the sauce tasted a little too much like ketchup. I will say that I tasted my friend's calamari, as well as the linguine and clams and was impressed. Might need to reconsider my entree selection if I make it back here again.

Though I'm not a big fan of Italian cuisine, Italian restaurants are notorious for serving up delicious calamari, so when I explained my Calamari Quest to the locals, they all suggested Marcella's. Now I know why. This calamari was as close to perfect as I could ever expect. It was fried and seasoned perfectly and the sauces complemented the dish perfectly. I'm a believer that calamari shouldn't NEED sauce, but the garlic aioli that they serve with it took it to the next level. I'm also not a fan of fillers in my calamari, and was disappointed at the presence of zucchini in the dish. To my delight, the zucchini was also fried and seasoned perfectly, I just don't think it belongs in my calamari. Great calamari needs no fillers and this calamari was great! Because of this, I rate the calamari at Marcella's a 4.5 tentacles out of 5 on The Calamari Quest page. That's a big deal, and I have a new entrant into my top 5! With me, it's all about the calamari, but I must mention the lamb gnocchi, which was also delicious! All if the elements of a great experience were present an I would strongly recommend Marcella's to anyone traveling to Columbus.

Saw the reviews and said it was a must try while I was in OH. Our hotel was across the street so it was very convenient to go to. We got seated by a table that was very loud asked to move it was not a problem. Our server was very nice and funny. The food was good-I do ask for a better dessert selection though- the ambiance was great ( once we moved) aside from the storm that night, it was a great date night with the Mr.

The three of us shared 2 courses. Here is how I would describe them:Course 1:Truffle oil slick with rock salt, garnished with shaved rare beef, ricotta hockey pucks and a wave of celery over the dish.Over dressed Cesar salad.Course 2: Truffle oil soaked pizza crust with white Italian nacho cheese and a few potato chips on top.Tortellini with hide-and-seek beef in salt broth.A surprisingly good linguini and clams.This was my second visit to Marcella's. I was excited to take my wife and daughter here after my first visit. The chef needs to rely on more than chemical laced "truffle" oil and salt to win me back.

GET. THE VEAL MEATBALL.I don't think I'd ever tried veal before, nor have I ever been a big fan of meatballs, but I would order a thousand of these appetizers and make that my meal if I could. Our group was in town for our girlfriend's wedding shower, and 10 PM was the earliest they could take our size group (7) when we made our reservations at 5 PM that same day. It worked out perfectly, since we were drinking wine and snacking before we went out for food. Our waiter was such a good sport for dealing with us loud and tipsy women. We had an absolute blast, and all our food was delicious. However, that veal meatball sticks out in my mind like the afternoon sun in July...it was seriously SO GOOD.

I was underwhelmed.   Some people at my table loved their entree.  The people that split the chicken parm for example.   I got the capellini pomodoro and it had enormous hunks of tomato in it which took over the dish.   One guy ordered pizza, they didn't remember to make it so he finally got it to go.The waiter had a unprofessional vibe and the manager was missing.  Also the place can't figure out if it is fancy or jeans and t-shirts.I just thought it was okay.  There are better spots....so given another chance I'd go elsewhere.

Most people would agree that Marcella's has the best happy hour in Columbus. Every item on the menu is so delicious and flavorful. Pizza, apps, snacks and drinks are half off Monday-Friday from 4-6 but you have to sit in the bar area. You can get drinks for two, a pizza and two apps for about $25! Some menu stunners are prosciutto and melon, veal meatball, pecorino fondue and of course, margherita pizza. Because it is such a popular happy hour it does get crowded so be sure to get there as early as possible!

The bruschetta is out of this world good!. So authentic and yummy. Very good service at our table to a friendly staff in general. Thank you for making my birthday so special marcellas! I will be back!.

I love this place so much. They have an amazing happy hour. Of course, most Cameron Mitchell restaurants have amazing happy hours. It's only for two hours though so get here between 4-6pm to partake.First of all, half off everything on the menu except entrees...including wine and cocktails. My friends and I each got the medium sized pitcher of wine for around $8 (regular price $16). It ended up being about 2.5 glasses of wine so a GREAT deal. For my meal, I had a chopped salad and a pepperoni pizza that had red onion on it too. It was DELICIOUS! Thin crust, perfect toppings, and I took my leftovers home. Again, half off my whole meal. Bam. We also shared some apps like calamari, arancini, and the fried zucchini. All perfectly cooked and delicious.I also love this place because it feels fancy but without being overpriced. It reminds me of a 60s restaurant with low lighting and cool decor but it's not kitschy. It's just a relaxing place for a nice night out with your friends and/or family. I mean, you really can't go wrong with a Cameron Mitchell restaurant.

I bought a group of 25 to Marcella's for a new professional's dinner. The server, Emily, did a great job making sure everyone was taken care of. Marcella's went out of their way to accommodate our group for this event, even at the last minute. The food was AWESOME! I had the RAVIOLI MEZZALUNA, which was so good. The goat cheese was not too much and made a great dish. It was not that pricey, either. The calamari was great; maybe one of the best plates have had of Calamari. Everyone enjoyed their food. I would highly recommend coming to dine here. The place was packed, even on a Monday so make sure you come to dinner early or make a reservation.

After reading many, many reviews on Yelp, I also asked a local which restaurant I shouldn't miss while in Columbus and Marcella's was the first one he mentioned. I remembered the 4 stars received on Yelp so I headed this way.1. Melted Pecorino Cheese with Crostini, Apple and Truffle honey ($10)One on of the first reviews I read noted this was a must have so it was the first item ordered.OMG, it was worth all the rave. Deliciously melted cheese with an awesomely crispy 'crostini' which is actually perfectly toasted or fried or baked toast, who cares! It was so crispy delicious. Then you dip it in cheese and then truffle honey, and add some fresh green apple slices, BAM!, what a mixture of texture, sweet and salty and freshness! It's a definite must have. Do yourself a favor though, once it is served, take the apples off the crostini. Beautiful presentation but if you leave it on, the bread will get soggy and you will lose the texture.2. Braised Veal Meatball ($9)Forgot I wanted to order this so I ended up ordering the beet salad and then had to add this. I must say it is one of the most moist and tender, flavorful meatballs I've ever had. Served in a cute mini cast iron pot, it's one of the definites here.3. Beef Carpaccio ($11) with shaved celery and warm ricotta pancakesWell, for $11, they gave a pretty good portion of carpaccio. It was good but the 'dressing/oil' was salty. I forgot there were ricotta pancakes underneath which I discovered a 1/3 into eating. It was a better balance of flavors with the pancake but still too salty overall. The quality of the carpaccio and quantity were great for the value though. What j didn't see much were the shaved celery.4. Beet Salad ($7.50): Roasted Crimson and Golden Beets, wild arugula, goat cheese and candied walnuts.Overall tasty beets and goat cheese. The candied walnuts were the Bomb! Again, however, went overboard with the dressing so things were too vinegary. Overwhelmed the naturally beautiful combo flavor of the beets, goat cheese with the spicy arugula and the texture and sweetness of the candied walnuts. A bit less dressing and it would be fabulous. But then again, a goat and beet salad for $7.50? No complaints, huh?5. And by this time I was stuffed but since my time in Columbus was limited I asked which one, lasagna or the risotto of the day ($17) she said shrimp and saffron risotto so knowing full well I was only going to take a bite and rest to go, I ordered. The portion that came out was especially huge and I had some cheese shaved on top. Again, the dish was overly salty but the flavors were flavorful, especially the charred garlic slices which added a nice depth. Until this juncture, I was a bit disappointed with the service. Granted the restaurant was extremely busy, even on a Monday night so I sat at the bar and the two bartenders seemed overwhelmed so the attention to service I was now expecting at Columbus wasn't there, i.e. no smile to be found on the face. But when she asked how the risotto was and I said it was salty, she asked whether they could do it over and I said it was fine but then she said she'll have them add more risotto to mix in and so I said sure. She brought the adjusted dish out and suggested I try it before I take it to go and I did. It was still salty but the extra effort is all I needed to be satisfied and happy. So the continued wonderful service of Columbus wait staff isn't tarnished after all!Now the biggest Tip ever is to go during happy hour!! I could kick myself for not realizing this before I came. I could've double the number of apps I could've tried for the same money!! ^^Okay, wish there was a way to give it an extra 1/2 stars. The waitress just to the risotto off the bill. Kudos for service!!

Hands down best happy hour in Columbus. The happy hour is 4-6 pm Monday through Friday so its pretty extensive. It's pretty unusual to have a happy hour on Friday, so this is usually my go-to place if I'm looking to go out to eat Friday after work. Many of the drinks, appetizers, and the pizzas are half price and everything is super delicious. I've had their apple/cheese appetizer, their big meatball appetizer, and many of their flatbread pizzas during happy hour and was never disappointed. Their sangria is also pretty good and at a relatively good price for a pitcher to share at a table. They are also pretty accommodating for groups. I love Marcella's and will continue to go back as long as I am in Columbus!
Good food.  Douchey crowd.  Overpriced.Been twice.  Been a little disappointed both times
The food is always AMAZING! However, the last time I was in, the bartender was so rude that it prompted me to say something on yelp.

My favorite place for happy hour, they always have great craft cocktails. They're always happy to recreate something not currently on the menu if possible (Milan Manhattan and Strawberry-Basil Martini are particular favorites). Get the big meatball. Just do it, even if you just stop for drinks, get the meatball. Soft and unctuous and amazing. And the pizza, perfectly crispy bottom, just a bit of char. Pasta is always very well done, anything doused in chicken and wine is a-okay in my book. I love all of Mitchell's restaurant's but I have a big ol' soft spot for Marcella's. I never leave disappointed.

We had a WONDERFUL night at Marcellas! Every... Single... Thing was amazing.We started with the melted pecorino, calamari and bruschetta appetizers. The biggest surprise was the calamari and the fried lemon hidden in the mix! Surprisingly delicious. My main course was the carbonara with gluten free penne. They served it with an egg yolk on top and it put this dish over the top. Unbelievably yummy. My sister in law had the fettuccine with a meatball ... Everyone agreed that this was the best meatball anyone had ever had. So tender and flavorful. Hubby had the veal saltimbocca... Cooked perfectly. There were no leftovers. I also loved the Tuscan Limonata cocktail. They make their own limoncello in house. So good. I am going to venture to say that you can't get a bad meal at Marcellas. Every dang thing we tried blew us away. The atmosphere was cozy and fun. Staff was very attentive. Kelly our server did a fantastic job! Made us fee like VIPs!Definitely one of my favorite restaurants of all time.

I was at Marcella's about 2 weeks and I wasn't not impressed with the meal. I got the pasta carbonara, it literally had no flavor. My freind got this chicken special wrapped in prosciutto, she also said the meal didn't have any flavor and it didn't taste fresh. The arancini was good though.

If we'd gotten our food within the hour of ordering it, I would have given this restaurant 5 stars, but alas, I and several other patrons had to complain to our server and the manager about the time it took to get our food. I even jokingly told my friends that they can't call themselves a restaurant if they don't serve any food.It took more than an hour after placing our order to get the food. We were starving by the time it got to us. We all scarfed the food. It was delicious, but I can't say that the delay didn't color my opinion of the restaurant. The manager had to be asked to make some accommodation for the long delay. It was not offered up front.

Huzzah! Another top notch happy hour in Cbus! Met the ladies here last night for a cluck fest and had some amazing snacks to boot! All at half freaking price. Yassss. I've been here before for dinner and wasn't totally blown away, but happy hour is a different story. During happy hour, drinks, snacks, apps, salads, and pizzas are all half off and it is not nearly as crowded as it gets during the dinner hours. We had a delightful server named Alex who kept the drinks flowing. Our snacks included the assorted olives and 3 cheeses: fontina, goat, and a creamy semi stinky number that started with a "T". All fabulous. I ordered the beet salad and the other ladies had the caprese, then we had the crispy potato pizza. All outstanding. For drinks we split a "litro" of red sangria (yum) and I had the Milan Manhattan. A little too sweet for my taste, but it's beautiful and I could see someone making that a favorite go to cocktail. Walked out of there for $25. Great food and service to match. Make this your next happy hour destination.

Decent place. Overrated meatballs. Mushy and seems like a lot of bread in them. Nothing special you can't get in any respectable family owned Italian restaurant.Otherwise fine Italian food and in a great location.  Staff is professional.
Horrible seating. There is hardly any room between the tables. The lamb gnocchi dish was OK but drowned in sauce. Terrible plate presentation for a CMR.

I'm going to compare this restaurant to Sotto in Cincinnati, which I feel for the price point is a much better restaurant. Marcella's is really just a glorified Magianos with edible food. We went here when staying in town and had reservations at 8. The service and host were great. We were seated quickly on a very busy night and our server was on point.  Food was the sad face. The bread is brought out cold and is nothing special, something you could get at Kroger with the label of Italian anything. We had the  zucchini appetizer which was also brought out cold and saturated with oil. The wine selection was fine.  Our entrÌ©es were good, we had the gnocchi and then clams. These were great but nothing that you couldn't get anywhere else. For dessert we had the cannoli, which the filling was runny and sloppily placed. The shell was stale, no crunch to it. Would have been okay if we were at an Olive Garden for some horrible  reason and everything was free. Overall this place is very "eh"  maybe they were just busy that night but if I was blindfolded I would have thought this was any Italian chain restaurant.
Very good martini. Cold, dirty, 3 olives. I will definitely have another. 5 OLIVES!

This was the best place I ate at while we were visiting Columbus. I had the Veal Meatball over the fettuccini and it was absolutely amazing! One of my most favorite meals ever. We also had the bruschetta appetizer, which was fresh and delish. My husband got the Tiramisu and I got the Cannolis for dessert and they blew our minds!! The portions were a great size (personal and tapas) and the prices weren't expensive, especially for the size and quality. Bottom line- If you are visiting Columbus and can only eat out in one place, EAT HERE!

Marcella's Ristorante sets a very nice atmosphere for group of friends or for a nice dinner for two in the Short North area of Columbus. My first visit was a Friday night with 3 others and for that we made a reservation at 6:15PM.  Seated finally at 6:45PM, being told they were a little behind, was understood.  Marcella's had our reservation and that's half of any good restaurant battle.The entire place was buzzing and I like that when out with friends.  To our left was a table of 6 with women out on the town really having fun. Behind me were two couples. To my opposite side was a family of 4 with one being a 10 or so year old child.  All good so Marcella's is equally comfortable with anyone.  Style and apparel was not in question either; folks dressed up and dressed down.  Hey, it's a nice Italian restaurant that's comfy.Meals.  Our table had chicken piccatta, linguini with clams, lasagna and chicken marsala.  I had the linguini and clams - pasta was perfectly al dente and the clams, while smallish and few (4 - 5 clams) they were tasty.  Paired with a pinot grigio made a nice meal.  Pals said their meals were good albeit the lasagna eater claimed too much sauce that had a acidic taint to it; he had to pull off most of the topping.   The table had calamari as an app and it was good.The pricing was moderate for being a Cameron Mitchell place.  I found the restaurant to be fun, lively and ready to build most any meal and environment it could for the customers.  Our server was prompt, cordial and had a consistent method of visiting and filling water glasses.Yup - I'll visit again.  I would like to try it on, say, a Wednesday or a Thursday with a friend to see if it's quieter, to take more of Marcella's in with my 5 senses.

One of my fave Columbus spots. It's a can't miss when I'm in city for work trips. The penne arriabiata is delicious and spicy. Get it with a meatball!! Also the pecorino is delicious the honey, apple, and hot melted cheese is delish!

My 5 star rating is solely on the merit of Marcella's ridiculously awesome happy hour.Something kinduv weird happens when you become a parent.  Well, a lot of weird things happen, but this is one that no one really mentions but should be pretty obvious:  happy hours will become ABSOLUTELY SACRED.  And i mean sacred in the truest sense of the word.  I don't consider myself a religious man, but if you take away my happy hour, God help you.Anyways, so basically since moving back to Columbus, my wife and I have frequented quite a few different happy hours.  What we're looking for: good price points for drink and food specials, an accessible and diverse menu, and an attractive environment for us to feel like we're a lot less responsible than we should be.Prior to coming to Marcella's for happy hour, our go to spot was The Pearl, pretty much next door (which is a really brilliant business model), namely because my wife is a sucker for fresh oysters, and I'm a sucker for their amazeballs fried cheese curds (no, seriously, hard to screw up fried cheese curds, but the curds here are something exceptional).  But the rest of The Pearl's food specials, while decent, are a tad uninspired.We sat at Marcella's bar, wife was thrilled with her martini (and ultimately ordered 3 more #YOLO), and when I asked about the food specials, the bartender pointed out literally half of the menu.  HALF OF THE MENU.  HALF OFF.  incredible.So, five drinks, one pizza, and like 5 other dishes later, we rang out to the tune of something like $40 all told.  remember me talking about not being a religious man?  maybe my perception is skewed from east coast living, but sans angels singing and the heavens parting, that is truly a miracle.

We went in and had the best dining experience yet in Columbus!!!  We recently moved here from Detroit.  What a great city.  We walked into Marcella's on a Tuesday night at 7:30 with a reservation at 8.  The place was busy and had people waiting.  We were early for our reservation and told that they still had a few 7:45 reservations to seat.  Perfect, I needed a cocktail!  Right at 8pm our buzzer went off and we were seated at a table near the kitchen.  My guest and I had a great time.  All the energy from the parties around us made the night and we want to return again soon!!  Thank you for everything

You've read it a thousand times on here... But the braised veal meatball is a must have!!  I also got the lasagna, which was equally delicious, and my girlfriend chose the linguini and clams, which she enjoyed!The place is packed, so definitely try and get a reservation. Luckily we got in without much of a wait, but a reservation will save you time. If I lived in Columbus, I'd definitely make this a regular stop for dinner!

I am a regular at Marcella's but clearly this is one of the best Italian restaurants I have been to at this neighborhood. I am a huge fan of their meatballs, grilled shrimp pizza, and strawberry basalmic martini. Their service is always on point and I have never felt less than welcome there either with family and friends or alone on a weekday afternoon.

Hands down one of my favorite places to eat in Columbus!! There is nothing better than a glass of house red some small plates and sitting in the window watching the greatness of the short moth happen around you! No matter what I order I always start with the eggplant caponata and finish with some raspberry thumb print cookies! The meal in between rotates depending on the chefs specials. There is no way to go wrong! The spaghetti and clams reminds me of my mothers, that's saying something! Highly recommended!
Good food, great prices, amazing and extremely polite service! ANY time we are in the area we eat here its definitely one of my favorites. .

I've heard great things about their happy hour, and finally had the chance to stop in around 5pm on a Thursday for some great food and drink in the lounge area. These were some of the items that we tried:1) Veal meatball - there's only one in each order but it's ginormoso. This was my favorite thing that we ordered, the meatball is so tender and veal is among my favorite proteins. If I was dining alone I'd probably just nom on a bunch of these little monsters.2) Fried calamari - pretty standard as expected, but good since you can't really go wrong with this dish in most places3) Crispy potato pizza - just okay, I wish there was more meat on it maybe. It's supposed to have pancetta but I don't think that I found a single piece. The crispy potatoes are kinda just really crispy artisan potato chips, which give it a cool texture I guess. Overall it was just a tad saltier than I like as well. 4) Citro Fresca cocktail - lovely! I adore refreshing drinks that aren't too sweet, and this fits the bill. I nommed on the grapefruit garnish at the end of my meal and it was a great palate cleanser too.5) Grapefruit Basil Fizz - bf ordered this, he liked it but it's a tad too sweet for me6) Milan Manhattan - bf ordered this, it's too strong for meWe were absolutely stuffed after our meal, and the prices are reasonable -- like what I'd expect dinner to cost at a regular restaurant, but this is a Cameron Mitchell so it's almost a steal. Our server was great, as he was just attentive enough to make us feel like we were taken care of but not at all overbearing. The vibe was fun and I liked this place a lot, so I would love to try the regular dinner here eventually.

Stopped here after a disappointing experience at another restaurant down the street for a do-over dinner. The spaghetti and meatball dish was delicious. The meatball was huge and melted In your mouth. The four cheese pizza was good. Our server was also fantastic. We will definitely be back.

I don't write reviews after one visit, but this place was AWESOME! We were a group of 8 and we were all very impressed w every aspect of our experience. Our waiter was superb - completely knowledgeable and helpful but not overly excited nor overly involved in our food choices nor dining experience; he discreetly checked-in w us w.o interrupting our conversations and flow. (I wish I remembered his name. I gave a generous tip and filled out the comment card.) The food was YUMMY. The environment was GREAT. The hostess could have been better. The owners have thought of every aspect of your experience, down to the bathroom. I am looking forward to future visits to Columbus just to dine here again!

Delicious Italian food. We made reservations online so the wait wasn't long. Got the meatball to start with. It was super moist and went well with the bread. I got the gnocchi with lamb and my boyfriend got the tortellini with braised beef. Very good pastas.

I got take out from here and was very impressed, I was a little taken aback at first at the portion but honestly, who needs to eat a shitload of pasta late at night. I was ordering for a bunch of people and didn't want to be an annoying asshole and make a custom order from the menu so I went for the "spicy spaghetti arrabiata". Like the disgusting slob that I am, I didn't even sit down like a normal civilized adult to eat. I stood up and wolfed the carbs while taking breaks by shoveling oily bread in my mouth.Overall, if you find yourself in wonderful Columbus, Ohio, give this place a swing.

We walked in at 7 pm, were seated promptly and got service immediately. Drinks were good, although maybe priced a bit high. The food was really tasty and fresh tasting. Portions were normal and not enormous. I was able to finish my ravioli no problem. My friend got a half serving.

Probably the best happy hour in the short north. The mushroom pizza always a good choice and their drink selection is quite good. You can ask for drink that might not be on the menu and they will try to make it for you.However if you're looking for dinner I would say this place is over priced and not really the place for die hard foodie.With that said the atmosphere at this place is ideal if you're just looking for a central place to hang out and dine casually.

All these years wasting my time at Happy Hours other than at Marcellas's.  I could KICK myself!  By far the best happy hour I have discovered in the short north.  Pretty much the entire menu is half off and that includes alcohol.  You have to sit in the bar to participate in this wonderful deal, but who cares.  The bar area is cozy and inviting.  I didn't mind that at all.This is what 3 of us ordered:1) Meatball (gigantic and fantastic)2) 3 cheese sampler (i LOVE cheese)3) Margherita Pizza (great crust and flavor)4) Calamari (don't like it so can't judge but my two friends loved it)5) Caprese Salad (yummy)6) Bottle of Pinot Nior (very tasty)All of this was $45.  I almost fell off my stool!  Plus we had lots of leftovers because it truly was a TON of food.  Trust me and GO for the H.H.  You'd be foolish not too!The end
It's a great restaurant! I love the food here. Spaghetti with the meatball looks so awesome. Other pasta dishes are great. It's an excellent Italian restaurant.

Every time I come back to visit Columbus, I make sure to make a trip to Marcella's in Short North. It has to be this location, and it has to be Marcella's. It's almost tradition among my friends and I, and that's really a testament to how awesome Marcella's is. It might seem like it has a chain restaurant vibe to it, but the quality of food is far better than most chain restaurants, and the service is always very friendly and attentive. Happy hour specials are pretty awesome here. I might be a little biased since I'm used to New York prices, but we always come here for happy hour and load up on drinks and happy hour food. The arancini (fried rice balls) are pretty killer here, and they're a lot bigger than most I've seen at most Italian restaurants. I've also had most of the pastas and pizzas here, and you really can't go wrong. I'm a big fan of the Sicilian and the mushroom pizzas, and spaghetti carbonara is pretty great. The portions are pretty big in my opinion, and I always leave feeling full and satisfied. The usual crowd at Marcella's consists of mostly yuppies, so if that's not your scene, then this might be a place to avoid. But regardless if you're sitting for a meal or chilling at the bar, it's always very lively and hip. I think it's hard to feel uncomfortable here. Overall,  I'm definitely looking forward to my next trip to Columbus, which means my next trip to Marcella's.

do yourself a favor...get the melted pecorino cheese appetizer. It's just perfect.Their risotto of the day never disappoints, nor does their pizza.Great wine list & cocktails!Tough to get in on a weekend, but always worth a visit. They have great happy hour, but it ends early at around 6 so I can never make it :(
Love their italian themed small plates and tapas.  Great for a drink and a light (or heavy) meal.   Good service and the bartenders looked like they knew what they were doing.
This review is purely for the Melted Pecorino appetizer. Most things at Marcella's were delicious. But this... this was sublime.

Absolutely love this place. Been here so many times and we came here for different occasions such as birthdays, girls night out, friends visit in town, etc. Food: For appetizer, my favorites are Calamari, Beef Carpaccio and Parma Prosciutto Bruschetta!You can never go wrong with Calamari. If you like tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese, highly recommend the Parma Prosciutto Bruschetta. the tomato sauce is sooooo delicious and cheese is very fresh. Perfect combination! For entree, the Spaghetti & Meatball is always good. EVERYTHING about it is good. A lot of time I will have left overs and even microwave it the next day still tastes delicious. I also enjoy the Linquize & Clams. Not many restaurant offers this dish and Marcella is one of them.Price: The price for entree is between $13-$20 and appetizer is between $9-13Environment: It has a great dine in environment. It gets pretty loud on the weekend or at least dinner time but that's why I like about the restaurant. It is hard to find a parking spot around there especially during dinner time. If you are exploring short north before or after dinner, I recommended do the valet parking so you don't have to worry about finding parking sport and meters!  Staff: Every time I go there, the staffs are always pretty nice.Marcella's is one of my favorite place in Columbus and it has never let me down. If you are only here for visit. Marcella's is a must go!

Marcellas is not the typical place I'd eat at. The atmosphere is pleasant and the staff was very attentive. The menu is not what I'm used to when eating out, however we gave it a go. The food was alright, but a bit eclectic; so if we return, I'll probably just stick to having a glass of wine and skip dinner.

We found this spot in the part of town we were planning to grab drinks in and it did not disappoint. The ambiance was great and the staff was friendly, attentive, and suggestive. I told our waiter I was thinking of ordering the gnocchi and that the best gnocchi I had ever had was in Atlantic City. He told me I would not be disappointed, and I was not! The braised lamb was melt in your mouth tender, and the gnocchi was light, pillowy, and delicious. My wife had the spaghetti and meat ball (one large one) and it was solid. 2 others in our party had pizzas. The pepperoni was good, the mushroom was a little light on sauce. All in all, we enjoyed our meals and the prices were fair and the wine list was extensive. If you are ever in Short North and looking for very solid Italian that wont hurt your wallet, you are sure to enjoy Marcella's!

I have been to Marcella's several times and I absolutely love it. As far as I'm concerned, it is the best Italian place in Columbus. I would feel a little pretentious if I said the place was "authentic", so let it suffice to say that I grew up speaking and eating Italian with my two immigrant grandparents, and this place reminds me of a dinner at home with my family. The littlest things, like serving water with no ice? Really, just as if it were a restaurant  in italy!The setup is intended so that you can easily share your meals with the rest of your party, and it makes for a wonderfully comfortable atmostphere. Every dish I've had has been expertly balanced in flavor and memorably delicious. The linguini with clams is my favorite, and even the espresso exceeded my expectations. The service has always been excellent and the servers knowledgeable. I can't think of a single thing I dislike about the place.Go visit and enjoy a true Italian dinner experience!
The food here is Amazeballs I cannot wait to get back to Columbus to come back here for dinner!!! PS do your best to get Tylon as your waiter!!!! Also get the Linguine and Clams!!!!

Went in for dinner after the gallery hop. We had to wait less than 15 minutes for a table. Our server was great! Service overall was very good. But the Risotto! OMG! The dish is different each day based on what the Chef decides. Last night it was served with sausage and broccolini with Parmesan and sprinkled with Gorgonzola. It was incredible! I've never had anything that wasn't good, but this dish took it to a whole new level.

Very close to an actual Italian experience with the exception of the pop music being played. Great bread and olive oil served in the beginning. I would avoid the olives (extremely salty). Carbonara is best I've had in the U.S. Margarita pizza is authentic. Drinks were great. Although our table felt a little cramped because much of the food was spread out to be shared, the ambience is excellent and doesn't have a "chain restaurant" feel. We would go back and defiantly recommend it to our friends.

Meatball and fettuccine is so good! I asked for penne instead. The white sauce mixed with the marinara with the meatball - turns into a vodka like sauce. It was delicious! I've been here on plenty of occasions.

Simply fantastic dining experience. From the friendly waitstaff to the absolutely delicious cuisine, this place is a true gem of Columbus. Truly the best Italian food I have had stateside. Will continue to come here with any excuse to celebrate.
Great service, amazing gluten free menu. Loved the lamb shank bolognese with gluten free penne.  3 cheese platter for an appetizer can't be topped.

Five stars is for the Marcella's happy hour (dinner is great too, but the prices and atmosphere of happy hour make it the ideal time to check out this restaurant), which is a MUST when looking for an after work cocktail and delicious early dinner. The appetizers are half-off, including the amazing HUGE meatball that comes soaked in a delicious house made red sauce. Now that it's getting warmer make sure you get there early (happy hour starts at 4pm)- you can snag a high top table by the large, widely-open windows in the front the of the restaurant. Warm breeze, a glass of wine, and delicious arancini- best way to spend a weeknight summer evening in columbus!

The best meatball you'll ever eat is served here, also the best chicken parm and the some of the best pizza's in town... Are you starting to sense a theme? I'm no expert but this is some of the best Italian food I've ever had. It's reasonably priced and their decor and atmosphere are always enchanting. It's the kind of place right out of magazine. Cameron Mitchell strikes again and again and again and again. =)

Overall, the service was okay. Myself along with two other friends were visiting from Chicago during Thanksgiving weekend. We booked a table the day before on OpenTable.com and when we arrived, we were immediately seated in the bar area at the high tops where it was extremely crowed. The whole point of us making a reservation was to reserve a great table which did not happen.Also, our server seemed like he was in a rush the whole night as if he had too many tables and was not personable. Additionally, the air temperature in the restaurant was extremely cold and after hearing other patrons complain about the air temperature also, we requested a new table which was much better. When our food arrived, my partner's entree seemed a bit cold but we did not complain as, we were already experiencing issues and it was busy. A manager never came over to our table to offer an apology or to see what was going on which was a little disappointing after we had heard such great things about the restaurant. Overall, everything was just okay but could have been better.

MEATBALL APPETIZER, FRIENDS. Made a res for Valentine's Day about a month in advance--decided to go at 9 hoping it might be a little less crowded, but it was still totes packed. Also, there's valet which is so crucial when it's negative a billion degrees outside and Wizard of Oz-style winds. The valet serves about four restaurants all in the same area, so we had to wait a few minutes for spots to open up, but it was pretty quick and the guys were moving at light speed to get to everyone. Once we got inside, we were seated right away. The gf and I both had cocktails--I went for the Grapefruit Basil Fizz and she opted for the Strawberry Balsamic Martini. The fizz wasn't fizzy, but was freaking delicious so I had to have a second. We started with a cheeseboard--pretty standard, comes with some kind of apricot thing and truffle honey, which is really easy to spill on yourself if you've consumed two cocktails at a Usain Bolt pace. We also went for the veal meatball--the waiter went out of his way to check whether or not it had pork in it for me (it doesn't) and it was so worth the extra checking. It may be weird to say this about meat, but it was the size of a softball and melts in your mouth (that's what she said). Tomato sauce was delicious. The gf and I split Chicken Picatta and the gnocchi feature. Both were great. I ordered the panna cotta for dessert and she chose the profiteroles. Overall, it was a delish din, loved the apps, could have done without the 'zerts. I held back the fifth start because they didn't have any soups on the menu, and since it was so cold, it would have been nice to have the option. Also, our waiter was extremely attentive, but we didn't order our entrees until we were halfway done with our appetizers. We'll be back for the cocktails and the meatball (appetizer, not Snooki).
We come here every Mother's Day for lunch and Marcella's never disappoints - another great meal and day at Marcellas!

Italian can be really boring and uninspired.  Marcella's avoids those pitfalls with delicious food and drinks and a wonderful atmosphere.The veal saltimbocca is incredibly delicious, as is the gnocchi.  The cheese plate has some wonderful choices.  The drinks are strong and delicious.  Holy crap, can they make a Manhattan!  Good bottled beer list too.I love the atmosphere.  It's always busy, crowded, loud, buzzing--not a great place to go for a quiet evening, but it is nice if you want an interesting atmosphere.  It reminds me of restaurants in busy areas of New York and Chicago.  Good service with friendly bartenders and servers.Probably the best Italian food I've had in town.

Marcella's will always be crowded (like a line forms at the door at 4pm) because it has good Italian food and a lovely atmosphere. But I think you can find that at a lot of restaurants in the area. What you won't find at those other restaurants is AWESOME service! That's what gives Marcella's an extra star in my book. The hosts and hostesses are friendly. The wait staff is not only on top of service, but they know their stuff. They are able to make wonderful recommendations based on what you like and what works together. Coming here is more of a dining experience compared to other Italian restaurants around. You know without a doubt that the food is consistently delicious and that your dinner will go off without a single hiccup (unless you drink a little too much Chianti!).

Wow, so this place rocks...be sure to mix up the appetizers the onion with the veal meat balll...the melted pecorino cheese with truffle honey..oh ya!  Just come here and spend your money you won't be disappointed.

Now don't get too excited by the pictures. The theme of the two places I've been in the two nights out on High Street bare the same small portions at average prices. After looking at the menu I thought I would control myself from ordering a big pasta dish, so I decided on the Meatball and Caesar Salad with white anchovies. First off the sauce with the meatball was excellent, the size of the Meatball was great, but I sense a bit of filler not all meat hence why it was so light. The salad was most disappointing. Long strips of lettuce that required too much cutting, two small pieces of anchovies hidden under the cheese and no offering of fresh ground pepper. When the order was delivered I even asked where are the anchovies and the waiter said they are under there somewhere. Interesting. He remarked that he hated anchovies so much for pleasing his client.Seems like a nice place to have a glass of wine and a light dinner at reasonable prices. The place was full and it had a good vibe.

Wife and I were in town for Garth Brooks show and stopped in for dinner. Great atmosphere on a beautiful day (sit by the big open window in front for great people watching on a sunny day.) You must order the melted pecorino with apples and honey appetizer - if i could give it 6 stars i would. Also a huge fan of the brick oven chicken piccata. The piccata sauce was wonderful over the pasta and the brick oven made the chicken skin crisp while leaving the bird itself juicy. Great wine selection. Overall a wonderful place...wish there was one in Indy!!
Prices are goodService was greatFood is Great!Place is very popular. I recommend getting a reservation before .One of the best places in town

Wow.  Yes, wow. This is the best Italian that I have had in North America.  The freshest prosciutto and salamis.  Getting the caponata is an absolute must.  Trust me on this. You will be so glad you did.  The beet salad was delicious with leaves as soft as butter and beets roasted to perfection. The potato Calabrese's had more flavor than a potato should ever have. Absolutely incredible.Tiramisu was amazing.  Our server Jodi was so helpful and thorough and took care of every detail.This place is a gem.  I highly recommend it to the world!

Good food overall. Server wasn't super friendly but he did his job for the most part. I would typically give this a 4 star review but overall service was poor. The pizza with mushroom and tellagio cheese was awesome as was the meatball with fettuccini. I also liked their anchovy and their chopped salad was good too. Drinks were meh.

I came here with my partner while visiting Columbus on the recommendation of a friend and we were not disappointed. We started with cocktails which were delicious. We had the melted pecorino cheese for our appetizer which was delicious. For our main course we had the meatball with a mixed red and white sauce and risotto which was on special that night and they were amazing. The meatball is incredible. The service was wonderful as well. Will definitely be back!

Oh. My. Goodness.Marcella's. My favorite restaurant in Columbus in more ways than one. Let me break them down for you, simply, here.1. The food, of course.I've been to Marcella's quite a few times in the past few years, and I can say that everything I've had from there has been ah-mazing. From their pastas to their pizzas to their appetizers (you MUST try the melted pecorino cheese app) to their sangria, everything is just fantastic. A lot of the dishes are sharable, which makes for a fun experience if you choose to go that direction.2. The ambiance.I feel like I'm being transported into a restaurant in NYC's Little Italy or to Italy itself (assuming that this is what I IMAGINE Italy to look and feel like). The Short North is already a great environment, and I feel like Marcella's ambiance just takes it to a whole new level. This is a fantastic place to go for a date or a girls' night... or really just any time. Note: I've been to the Polaris location, too -- still amazing food, but ambiance is a little more family-oriented. Another note: You can get away with as dressy as you want. I've seen little black dresses and shirts and ties. I've also seen jeans and a nice shirt. Fun to just go with whatever you're feeling for the occasion. 3. The prices. After No. 1 and 2, one might assume that this place would be very pricey. But the good news is that it's super affordable for the quality of food and atmosphere that you are getting here. My typical trip here consists of dinner for two: 2 glasses of wine or sangria, two apps and an entree or three small plates. And we usually get out of there at around $50. For a really nice dinner and drinks for two, I feel like that's a steal. In my opinion, Marcella's is a must-try in Columbus.

Marcella's is a great place to go for a date or a dinner with friends.  They have an entire gluten-free menu and the gluten free pasta is very good.  The staff are always very friendly and helpful.  There are two locations and I once made the mistake of making a reservation at the wrong one but they were gracious enough to make space for me and my seven friends.  I have never had a negative experience at Marcella's throughout many years of dining there.

Marcella's is my favorite restaurant in Short North and easily my favorite Italian restaurant in Columbus. This Cameron Mitchell restaurant will not fail to satisfy. The braised veal meatball is phenomenal. The spaghetti and meatball is huge and equally as appealing. I also recommend the lamb gnocchi. Best for last...the cheese pecorino appetizer. It is easily my favorite thing on the menu. The mix of melted cheese with apple is perfect. The service is excellent and the atmosphere inviting. However, it is a very popular place and you should be prepared for a wait during peak hours.

I'm looking forward to visiting Columbus very soon. Specifically, to patronize Marcella's once again.  Cameron Mitchell...you've got my vote and you've got my business.Marcella's is dark and intimate, with a rambling sprawl of chatter exuding from the lengthy bar that runs along the side of the establishment.  The banter, chitchat, giggles and guffaws (yes, I did just say guffaws) are reminiscent of the soundtracks of jovial celebration (and, yes, I did say jovial) from the television shows of the eighties.The service here is second to none.  After being seated, we were given bread and water (kind of sounds like prison...but I doubt the bread is this good in prison).  Our waiter took our drink orders and only managed to approach us when we needed him to do so.  This was remarkable considering how busy Marcella's was.To start off, we had the prosciutto and melon.  This is an incredible appetizer as it warms you up with a sweet and savory combination.In the batter's box was the crispy potato pizza.  Yes, I realize this isn't an appetizer...but we decided to make it one.  This is without a doubt, one of my favorite pizzas ever.  The Tellagio and Parmesan onions combined to do a little dance on the taste-buds, while the Pancetta only deepened the flavor.  The arugula in combination with the pizza's thin and crisp crust, brought out a lighter side of the heavy combination that was already happening with the rich flavors of its predecessors.Which brings me to the main course...my favorite.  The Veal Saltimbocca!  Amazing...just plain amazing!  Let me start with the underlying addition of a Parmesan polenta.  Perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned.  The veal itself was covered in a rich, velvety marsala sauce accompanied by delicate mushrooms and prosciutto.  This dish is the type to make you lose your manners and lick the plate.  Yes, it's that good! Marcella's is a topnotch experience and will continue to get my patronage every time I'm in town.
I'm always happy with this place.  The mushroom pizza add broccolini and chic parm are my go to choices.

My husband and I have been here twice, the first time we took his mom for her birthday dinner, and the second time for happy hour. Wow, the happy hour is where it's at. All the appetizers and pizzas are half off, same with the cocktails and wines that are under $9 a glass. Such a great deal! My favorite things here are the arancini, melon and proscuitto, and melted pecorino, which they are unfortunately not able to serve right now due to the cheese being stuck in customs on its way from Italy! Hope it's available next time we return. The service has been fantastic both times we've been here. Very attentive and friendly, but not overcrowding. Can I just say, I feel so taken care of at a restaurant when a bathroom has free tampons? Nice touch. Also, mouthwash with cups; perfect for a post-garlicky meal rinse on date night.

First time here. Traveling on business. Service is great and the food is even better! Calamari, beet salad and special request angel hair with bolognese. All was wonderful. And do try the Milan Manhattan.

Definitely a great place for a date night! Be sure to make reservations. As you could imagine, it gets packed on the weekend because it is a Cameron Mitchell restaurant and it's in the Short North. HIGHLY recommend the Chicken Parmesan! It is a relatively big portion (easy to split) and no other chicken parm compares! The Alfredo on the linguine tops it off with a creamy flavor. I've tried a couple of the other pasta dishes but I was always unimpressed which is why I'm not rating it any higher. Service has always been great and I love the atmosphere! It is loud and it definitely feels like you're right in the city. ALSO, they have their own valet which is about $5 I believe...easiest way to park for sure.

One of my good friends took me here for a happy hour on Wednesday. Food and service was so good, my wife and I went back on Thursday! Definitely have to try the meatball, so delicious! Arancini is equally good! Had the potato pizza on the second trip and was impressed by that as well. Service was excellent the first day (sat at a table) slightly less so the second day (at the bar).

My favorite thing about this restaurant were the seemingly home-made ingredients, and that everything can be made to order and fully customized. The waiter was super-friendly and accommodating to our neurotic questions.  Every time we asked, "Can we...?" he said "of course!" Which we found quite encouraging. We ended up ordering a bottle of red wine that wasn't that great, though not terrible.  Next time we'd make a better selection. Then again, I don't like Italian wines in general, but I did like the traditional Italian wine glasses.  The custom pizza was very good, spicier than you would typically get from a pizza place when you ask them to make it 'very spicy,' and I loved the cast iron skillet used to keep our extra sauce warm.  Everyone inside seemed happy, and it was nice that it was open late. Will definitely go back.

A great place in Cbus--one of the more established short north restaurants.They set a standard for service (as one usually finds at a Cameron Mitchell) and fantastic wine. Mostly small plates, try the Sicilian pizza--you won't be sorry

This is one of my all-time favorite restaurants. I'm not a fan of the noisy atmosphere, but I don't even care when the food is this delicious. We usually get the four cheese pizza and the olives to start with. They're both wonderful. I had their beef carpaccio for the first time today and it was flawless - I can't wait to get it again. My husband is a fan of their meatballs. I love all the pasta I've ever gotten. Sadly I live about 3 hours away from Marcella's, but we make sure to hit it at least once every time we come to Columbus (I've been twice in the last three days this time around). You really want to eat here. Trust me!

First more "upscale" restaurant I've been to since moving to Columbus.  Started with the veal meatball appetizer which was recommended.  Oh my stars was that thing tender.  Girlfriend and I split it and it was perfect.  For our main courses we ordered the Pasta Carbonara and the potato/parmesan pizza to split.  Why we decided to go with the heaviest and creamiest dishes, I'm not too sure.  Either way, both were fantastic and really sat us down.  The pasta was cooked perfectly the fresh cracked egg in the dish was a great touch.  Additionally to the food, the service was fantastic and the atmosphere is great.  Even though the weather was frigid, the restaurant was bustling and everyone was enjoying themselves.  Would 100% recommend to try!
This is the best Columbus can do for Italian? Maybe as mediocre as Martinis.  Had penne  arrabiata. I can make better sauce...from a jar. Rao's. You can get it at Target. Will not go back.

I'm huge fan of their happy hour selections for firsts! I've had the Chicken Parmesan (my favorite), Melted Pecorino Cheese and Calamari (appetizers), Fettucine and Meatball, and Pepperoni Pizza. The portion of all dishes are beautifully crafted and filling. The dining's lounge ambiance is perfect for a date night or group gathering.

After hearing great reviews, I was excited to go to Marcella's with my boyfriend for my birthday dinner. However, I was pretty disappointed by our experience. The pizza was good, but wasn't the best I've had in Columbus. We also tried a pasta dish, which was mediocre. Maybe we didn't try the right dish, but I'm not sure if we'll spend the money to go back again.

Overall rating: 4/5Food: 4.5/5Environment: 3/5Service: 3/5Pros: - The food was excellent. We had fettuccini  with a (very large!) meatball, Sicilian pizza, and an arancini appetizer. Everything was cooked to perfection.Cons:- The water was warm. It was a hot day outside, and I was looking to a tall glass of ice water. I was sorely disappointed. - The service was slow. However, we did go on a busy Friday night. - The restaurant felt cramped (barely enough room on the table for our food!), and it was quite loud.
Good food but, they Lie to client on the phone. Even if they say "no wait" expect to wait 30 minutes or more .
Cool vibe.  Sangria is awesome.  Everything on the menu we tried exceeded our expectations.

Second visit as a traveler. It's a lovely room for someone, like myself, who believes that dining aesthetics peaked in the 1930s. Solid service. Solid pours of wine by the glass, from a decent offering of wines by the glass. My companion's lobster cannelloni was generous with the lobster, but a bit too generous with the salt. My gnocchi with a lamb (braised, plenty of it) ragu was impeccable. No time for dessert, alas.

My first experience at Marcellas was pretty good. I started with prosciutto. All tho they give a good portion I have come to the conclusion that I just don't like it. The calamari is a definite must and their chicken parmesan is really good as well. Would definitely go back

Food was delicious across the board. Brought a large group while in town for a sporting event. Friendly and workable with our party. Portions were just right, pasta fresh, and seasoned well. A huge success for everyone that as there.
Food is Nothing special but great atmosphere!! Cesar salad w anchovies was the only best thing for me... Spagetti meatball with over sized meatball that was more like a piece of meatloaf

The manager that was on duty the evening of August 30th definitely saved the night (also the reason I'm rating a 3 versus a 2). Things started off great. We could tell they were busy, but drinks and 2 of our 3 appetizers came pretty timely. Then 3 of our 5 entrees arrived. About 20 minutes went by and the other two still did not arrive. Our waiter did not check on us, so we finally called him over and explained we still had not received two of the entrees. He pretty much said, sorry, not my fault. Maybe I did not hear the whole conversation, but my jaw about hit the table. Someone else in our party went and got the manager and she apologized profusely. She put in our whole order again and everyone got their dishes again. She said, for those that had already received their entrees, we can package it up and have lunch for the next day. She also did not charge us for any of our entrees. I can appreciate that things get mixed up in the kitchen, but a little communication and follow up goes a long way.

Another great place in the Short North. This busy Italian place has reasonable prices and great food. My friends and I shared a pizza and each had a chicken entree. Everything was great and we look forward to eating there next time we are in Columbus.
Came in for happy hour. Good vibe, nice service, decent food, and reasonable price. We had a good night!

I really love this place, especially in spring when their bar windows open up onto the sidewalk. I believe this was the first Cameron Mitchell place to open following his long hiatus after selling his concepts to Ruth Chris. He came back strong with this one. Since then, he's essentially taken over the entire block with the opening of The Pearl, The Guild House, and of course Martini's down the street. We dub this part of the Short North, "Cameron Mitchell Row" and haven't been disappointed with any of the new concepts.Food is solid and the drinks are very good but what I love about the place is the space itself and the vibe. The service is typical Cameron Mitchell Restaurants: friendly, efficient, sterile. It can be noisy so it's more of a hang out spot and it's great for people watching. Avoid coming on Gallery Hop, the wait times are ridiculous. We try to hit it during the week when it's more locals and more relaxed.

Absolutely amazing food. I was referred to this place by the hotel I was staying at and it certainly did not disappoint. I sat at the bar and was promptly greeted by both bartenders. I started with a beer and the melted pecorino cheese app. It was amazing! Served with thinly sliced apples, honey, bread, and the pecorino cheese. The cheese is served hot and in a small cast iron skillet. Moving on, I was told to order the Fettuccine meatball entree. It too was amazing. The meatball has an amazing flavor...kinda smoky, very soft, and cooked to perfection. I will certainly return when back in Columbus.

Being the frist black Italian I must say  Anybody visit Ohio must try this place no sweet tea but everything else was 4 stars 6 deep and everybody at the table was happy........  I highly recommended it you willnot be disappointed

FABULOUS! Holy mother of God this place was incredible. I'm in town on business and a co - worker and I ate dinner here on a Wednesday night. It was busy, but we were quickly seated and quickly waited on. I got a glass of moscato which was delicious. I ordered the salmon with glazed carrots on a bed of arugula. I'm usually not a carrot fan but these were so sweet and tasty that I ate every single one. The salmon was moist and flaky. The arugula had a very light dressing on it, you couldn't even see it but the taste was divine. I was so pleased I literally ate every single morsel. My colleague ordered a pizza because he's a very picky eater! He said that it was great. He mentioned that it didn't have much sauce at all, which to him was a good thing. Definitely worth a trip. Oh, price wise, my salmon was $19 and his pizza was $13- definitely very reasonable prices!
Just discovered this gem (don't know how I missed it).The calamari is to excellent, easily the best in Columbus. Attentive staff and a perfect spot for a romantic dinner.

The spaghetti and meatball is the best!  Moist and tender not like any other meatball I've ever tasted. I would go back again and again to this restaurant.  Trick is.. get a reservation first. oh and ask for balsamic vinegar and add that with the olive oil, salt and pepper for dipping their amazing bread.

The food and drinks are excellent.  The service is great.  The only issue i had with my meal was the cocktail.  I order a Manhattan and was presented with a short glass with rocks.  I asked for a traditional Manhattan and was presented with a glass 2/3 full.  The drink was good but short poured.

Had a nice dinner with the wife on a busy Friday night.Happy Hour is definitely the time to make it here.We had the chance to try several apps the pecorino and apples was delicious and the calamari was good although the app was mostly zucchini.The pizza was meh,I'd much rather go to harvest.The atmosphere and service were both excellent.

This place had such appeal and potential. My friends took us out here after we admitted a craving for Italian. It's their favorite place so we really were looking forward to it.The restaurant has that dark romantic atmosphere that would be perfect for a date night. We really enjoyed  the decor.For our first course we opted to skip the antipasto and settled on a "drink course". I had the Grapefruit Basil Fizz, a unique drink that combined these flavors into a wonderful treat for the tastebuds. The rest of the party enjoyed their drinks as well.For dinner my friends had the spaghetti and meatball (yes just one, but the thing is the size of your face!) and I went with the chicken marsala. We all enjoyed our meals, I personally am won over by an Italian restaurant that knows there is more to Italian cooking than just pasta, and served the chicken marsala with a side of polenta. My wife however did not fare so well in the food department. She ordered the Salmon, and it was burnt on the outside while still raw on the inside. She returned the meal and ordered a salad - the waitress was helpful in making a quick change so she wasn't stuck watching us eat.Overall the prices were reasonable for a quality Italian dinner date locale, but the execution was off on the meal.

With great service, delicious food and a comfortable atmosphere, Marcella's is well worth your time to visit if you find yourself in the Short North area of Columbus.The chicken parmesan I had was delicious and the Abita Amber beer made for a great accompanying beverage.  But as wonderful as the food was for a reasonable price, it was the service that really put it over the top.  Our server, Megan, was spot-on with her work, and the professionalism of the entire staff was impressive.  Even the gentleman who shredded cheese for our entrees did so in first-class form.Parking is not easy to come by in this area, but don't let that stop you from paying a visit to this wonderful restaurant. Highly recommended.

If you want fantastic food and are wiling to get hit or miss service, then stop by. I saw some of the waiters paying extra attention to their tables, while the waiter for our table disappeared for the majority of the dinner. The place was very crowded and loud when we went, so we didn't catch our waiter's name. He was African American and waited our table at the high seats right across from the bar.There was a short wait time before we were seated with reservations. Normally moments after being seated the waiter would normally stop by and get you drinks. No one came by for like 5-8 minutes. We were beginning to wonder if perhaps they had forgotten about us or if they were confused about which waiter was assigned to our tables. We were able to figure out what we wanted to eat and look up pictures of the dishes on Yelp in the time it took him to finally come by, and this usually takes awhile. He finally showed up and gave us some water and took our order. I had a chicken parm, my sister got a chicken piccata, and my mom got the tortellini. The food was fantastic and the portion size for the chicken parm was very filling. The tortellini on the other hand looked more like an appetizer. They gave maybe 5 tortellini? We also had some dessert, which was good. The food was great overall.The one thing that did ruin the experience for us was the terrible service, which quite possibly was the worst service I have ever had. We aren't demanding with our waiters. There are just some unspoken basic expectations that we all have. Even at places where I've had poor service the waiter at least fills our glasses with water without us having to ask.Throughout the entire dinner, we only had our glasses of water refilled once and this was because we had to ask despite him walking by several times. They had accidentally given us 4 glasses of water instead of 3 because they gave us an extra menu. I finished my water and waited for a refill, which never came. So I took the extra glass and it was less than half full when he walked by and looked at our table. I thought he was going to refill our glasses, but he didn't and  so I had to flag him down and ask him. We honestly spent more time sitting there waiting on our waiter than anything. It took him over 20 minutes to come over after we finished our entrees and he didn't even offer a dessert menu. I had to ask. Then it took him 5-8 minutes to bring the dessert menu and 8-10 more to take our dessert order. Then it took 15 minutes for our order to be brought out and at this point, we were tempted to just walk our then and have them keep the dessert. We were there for almost 2 hours and all of it was us waiting for service. A couple that had come in after us and were waiting for a table left an hour before us. They were seated across the divider where they had a very attentive waiter who was always running around with a bottle of water.The one thing that came out the fastest was the bill.

Decided to visit Short North while here for a wrestling tournament. It was a Saturday evening and everything was PACKED and we had no reservations. The windows were open and the great smell of garlic and olive oil was too much to pass up. We approached the hostess and was told the wait would be at least an hour and a half... but we were hungry and decided to find a spot at the bar and wait. Let me just say every single server we encountered was incredibly  friendly and accommodating. And for a restaurant that was literally packed out the doors the service was quick and the food was fresh and hot. We got the fried risotto as an appetizer. It was delicious and piping hot.. very delicate flavors for a fried food.. tasty and cooked perfectly. My wife got the tortellini with braised beef and it was unbelievable.. again very  subtle flavoring but perfect... Not over seasoned or a salt lick like some places. My son and I both got the pizza, the pepperoni pizza was excellent with red onion and fresh garlic. The pizza sauce was great and flavorful with a hint of sweetness. It accentuated the pepperoni perfectly. My son had the 3 meat pizza and it was just as flavorful.I also want to mention how amazing the bartenders were. Since we never got our seats we ended up ordering at the bar.. and as you know, on a busy Saturday night the last thing bartenders have time for is full dinner service. Not once did we get the feeling that we were putting them out or annoying them. Even making sure my son's Shirley Temple stayed full, and taking the time to listen when my 12 year old requested something. At the end of the evening they even went so far as to comp us a delicious Tiramisu because of our wait.The next time we are in the area we WILL be back! Thanks again. Try the Tuscan Limonata.

A few of the girls and I made reservations for last night to kick off my friends bachelorette party... This is her favorite restaurant and I can see why! Although we had a reservation, we still had to wait about 20 minutes for a table which was annoying; they felt bad though and brought 2 appetizers to our table on the house.  Each one was incredible! We had the meatball which was packed with flavor and melted in your mouth. Hands down best meatball I've ever eaten. We also got the cheese and crustini, and the cheese was gooey and perfect. There was a truffle honey dipping sauce next to the cheese and we dipped the apple slices in it (delish!) For my entree, I got the risotto. It changes with the fresh ingredients available at the time, and yesterday's was chicken and artichoke.  It was perfectly cooked and the flavors were exquisite... I would definitely order it again.  This was the perfect start to our night out!

My husband and I went here on a whim during the week and loved it. We are new to Columbus and have been working our way around the Short North to try all of the restaurants. We enjoyed wine, pasta, delicious bread and a great atmosphere. What we ordered: Lamb Meatball - one of the best things I have ever tastedLinguine & Clams - fresh, fresh ingredients and a light dish that hits it homeVeal Limone -  Large portion and cooked perfectly Wine - yes. it's great. it comes in the traditional carafe style.This place would receive five stars if their bar drinks were better. The signature mixed drinks were very sugary & not matched the how great everything else is.
I always have a great time here! They have an excellent happy hour and my favorite dish is the lamb gnocchi con bolognese. You won't be disappointed! The whiskey rosso is a fine cocktail as well.

Not a bad plate came to our table. Jordan was very helpful. We have teenage kids and he helped make the experience fun. We ordered lots of different items and shared them. I had never done Italian tapas, but it was a great idea. Tortellini, the meatball, and the cannoli were our favorites. Service and timing were spot on. Short North area is a fun area to walk around before or after.

Wow! This is the best Italian I've had. We started with the melted pecorino app and prosciutto. Kind of made little sandwiches of honey, crisp apple, prosciutto and cheese. Delicious! I had the linguini and meatball. The meatballs just melt in your mouth and are falling apart. They're so yummy. My boyfriend ordered the chicken parm and a side of carbonara. OMG! The carbonara was the best pasta I've ever had. The chicken parm was a good size portion and tasty too. Too bad we don't live in Columbus because a lot of my money would be spent here lol

Went here for my birthday dinner and it was a great choice!We ordered the meatball and sausage appetizers and wow, that meatball was probably the best meatball I've ever had. The sausage was cooked perfectly and surrounded by veggies that were absolutely delicious. We also ordered a cheese platter of 3 cheeses. Somehow our order got mixed up and the server was not only apologetic but immediately brought out the correct cheeses while letting us keep and try the other cheeses we hadn't ordered. Finally, for dinner everyone ordered an entree and was very pleased. I don't think you can go wrong at Marcella's! Everything we had was delicious. Finally, when checking my ID for our bottle of wine the server realized it was my birthday and offered me an on the house dessert to finish off the meal. I ordered and shared the Tiramisu with my group and it was perfect. I will definitely be going back to Marcella's again soon!

Mamma mia... Tha size of thata meatbolla!!! Great location, and great happy hour. The veal meatballs are to die for. Their signature item really. The arancini was also real good and fresh.Huge wine selection, including vino della casa.Their pizza pies are thin new york style and always fresh. Margarita is a favorite.Parking can be an issue but valet is available for $5.Ambience is perfect for dates or groups. It can be very loud. I am not a big fan of anchovies on pasta but they do it well here upon request. Have I mentioned the wine list. Primitivo and Montepulciano are both highly recommended.Buon appetito! E che vediamo a presto!

Get here early unless you don't mind waiting at the bar. Warm exposed brick interior, long bar with dining optional, open kitchen at the back of the restaurant. I ordered the Chicken Piccata. Delicious bone in tender perfectly seasoned and flavored. Pasta Cabonara  was out of this world. The pizza look delightful. Desserts yummy!!

If you do not read any other review read this one - order the fettuccine and meatball and you will not be disappointed. This is the single greatest meal I have had in Columbus and I have had it over 50 times. Their meatball makes those who live in Boston, and go to the north end, dream about the meatball. One of my co-workers planned a visit to Columbus around having a meal here.

Though this was my first time at Marcella's, I have long been a fan of Cameron Mitchell restaurants.  Arriving with two friends to Marcella's, we quickly observed a nice ambiance where we could hear each other and enjoy each other's company over good food.  We arrived around 4:15 PM for an early dinner during Happy Hour (Mondays through Fridays from 4-6 PM).  In fact, the Happy Hour specials will be tough to beat as all of the small plates, appetizers, salads, pizzas, and many of the drinks were all half price.  We ordered two pizzas and a salad for the three of us to split and the final bill was only about $15 total.  Amazing!!The food itself is definitely worth mentioning.  Even the bread had its own unique taste, especially when dipped in olive oil or balsamic sauce.  The salad was presented very well and my friends both enjoyed the beet salad.  We ordered first one "classic" pizza that was the Crispy Potato, half of which had pancetta.  The second "classic" pizza was the Margherita D.O.C. pizza.  While we ordered one to be with whole wheat crust, we made the mistake of not clarifying that we really wanted both to be with whole wheat.  It turned out delicious (and very filling) nonetheless.  In fact, we could have gotten away with a filling meal with only one pizza and one salad to split for the three of us.  Another great restaurant with some fabulous deals!

My friends and I have been coming to this place for the past few years for random happy hours.  Absolutely love their appetizers here. Would highly recommend the meatball here as it just melts in your mouth.  The pecorino fondue might seem somewhat intimidating at first, but it is absolutely delicious, just try to eat it while the cheese is still melted.

Came tonight for happy hour, at the bar we got drinks and waited for a table. I got the citro fresca, it was margarita like but not as mind numbingly sugary. Quite good, and a generous portion too. My friend got the whiskey rosso, let me tell you that tasted like sweet sweet candy juice! I'd definitely recommend that and will be getting it next time!We only had to wait 10 minutes before being switched to a table. Where we promptly ordered our meals to share. We got the fondue, which is amazing, if you have more than three people consider ordering two, everyone will love these!!!! So gooey and mild and perfect. We got the beef carpaccio, which was lovely and tasted like a rare salty steak. There were only two ricotta cakes underneath, which felt like a bit of a jip there. But the salad underneath was great. I did expect the carpaccio to have a preserved quality (which is what I've had at other restaurants), but it was really just thin sliced raw steak, very good but different than I expected. We ordered the pesto goat cheese shrimp pizza, this was amazing! Not overwhelming in the least and the goat cheese is just the perfect addition! You'll regret not getting this. Also the beet salad; very good! Great healthy option that's tasty enough to not make you jealous of everyone else. Our food allergic friend had the sun choke salad and seemed to like it but I can't report much on that. The waitress kept our water glasses suspiciously full and service was great. Be sure to check out the powder soap in the bathrooms, really fun touch!!I'll definitely be back!

What a delicious and memorable dining experience.  We were there at Happy Hour -- between 5-6 pm on a Mon night. All the small plates, salads and cocktails were half-price. So we were able to sample a delightful array of dishes.  Amazing.  The service was good and the ambiance was perfect. Too bad I don't live in Columbus -- I would be a regular.

Amazing romantic setting with my husband for our anniversary. We had two amazing Italian meals :We started at the bar and waited a few minutes for our resverations because we arrived early. We got two drinks and decided to get an appetizer ! MELTED PECORINO CHEESE is what we ordered and a few others and it hit the spot with some wine !!!  My husband got the chicken parm and I got the seared salmon ! Two great dishes. What a romantic setting inside ! definitively saw a lot of couples !

We came to Columbus to drop our kids off at OSU and needed a good meal out. As New Yorkers we're a little snobbish about food and restaurants, and did't want to eat at one of the many chain restaurants near campus. Marcella's was recommended to us and it was awesome. Great atmosphere, great food and pleasant staff. The drinks were a little slow but we compensated by ordering two at a time. Small tapas plates and largest ones too and everything was great.
