Try the onions with melted parm cheese and the meatball, calamari, fresh prosciutto and cheese - all great.

I absolutely love the food and atmosphere at Marcella's this is always a top pick amongst friends when looking for a location to dine downtown. The Veal Meatball is AMAZING, and the prices are actually very reasonable for the quality you receive. The service is very professional as if you were in a high end steakhouse which is refreshing. I would recommend this place to anyone looking to have a great Italian meal and great drinks!

This is definitely the number one Italian restaurant in Ohio. I've only had better food one place ever in my life and that was in NYC. The meatballs here are probably the best thing that I have ever tasted in my LIFE! The are super tender, moist, and flavorful. They are also gigantic and almost a meal in themselves. I would also highly recommend the chicken parmesean, though the alfredo spaghetti with it was lacking flavor. That's ok because the rest of the food definitely makes up for it! The chicken piccata was pretty tasty as well. All of the staff were so helpful and nice too. I would recommend this restaurant HIGHLY!!!

I absolutely loooove this place! It's always my go to place, when I can't think of a place to go. I am always in the mood for their food and everything I have had out of the 4 or 5 times I have been there, has been amazing.I recommend the Melted Pecornio Cheese and the Arincini for appetizers. As for their dinner entrees, I can always go with any of their pizzas, but the Gnocchi Bolognese is  an awesome meal! If you don't want something heavy, I would stay away from it.Marcella's is a great place for friends and groups as well as a great place for a date! The ambiance is the exact definition of the Short North. They also have another location up North by the Polaris Mall.

My husband and I had the Sicilian pizza and the seared salmon, both pleasing. This place has a nice ambiance and a very professional, friendly and sweet waitress named Krista that I think deserves a promotion :)

I had a great experience at Marcellas. I met a friend, she picked this place and it was my first time here, I will definitely be going again.  We got there right at 4:00 and got a really cool table that opened up to the outside, so we could people watch while enjoying the Short North ambiance. Happy hour is 4-6, and all cocktails and beers on tap are half off. Small plates, salads, and pizzas are half off too. We shared the crispy potato pizza which was excellent!  The drinks were very refreshing and good.  I had two sangrias which were delish and she ordered a martini that she enjoyed too.  The appetizer we ordered was arancini which was also good.   The price is right too, a lot of  restaurants in the Short North are way over priced but not here.  Great place to bring a date.  Check this place out, you won't be disappointed.

We love coming to this place for casual dining and decided to have our wedding rehearsal dinner here; it was a fantastic experience!! Wonderful service, incredible food, and very reasonably priced!! Everyone had a great time and the manager and wait staff worked very hard to make this a wonderful experience for us!! We'll be back soon!!

Highly disappointed!!!Marcellas puts more effort into trying to remind you of Italy with decor, than making quality Italian dishes. Marinara sauce was bland and tasted like store bought and the pasta was slightly over cooked. Tortellini alla manzo was too salty for my liking. Had three hostesses that were busier gossiping than sitting tables; making the floor manager focus on seating. Why have a shirt that say "All about the gnocchi" when you only offer one dish with gnocchi?

This place has a very friendly atmosphere. The waiter/ waitresses are very professional. Good knowledge of the menu. Very romantic atmosphere. Great for groups. Great wine list even though I didn't order any tonight. The Ravioli was awesome and the soft ball sized meat ball my girlfriend got with her Spaghetti was sweet and so tender and was amazing.

After living in Columbus for over 4 years, I hadn't been to the famous Marcella's! A friend was visiting from out of town so I decided we should have dinner there and both experience it. Honestly, I was a little disappointed. Oh, it was good enough. It was fine. I didn't dislike my meal at all. But it didn't live up to the hype I'd always heard.We had a prosciutto and melon appetizer which was interesting. I had the Fettuccine and Meatball - because, you know, the giant meatball is supposed to be a thing. It was good, but not particularly special. My friend got the gnocchi, which was also one of the things we heard raved about. I think she liked it, but was not blown away either.Anyhow. Now I guess I can say I ate there. I might end up here again, which would be fine. But, you, I might just move on too.

I got the Carbonara which was good - a little bland, but my boyfriend got the Chicken Parmesan and I was eating it off of his plate! It was delicious - the sauce actually tasted a little like pizza sauce which sounds weird, but really worked. This is the first time I've gone to Marcella's and gotten something other than one of their pizzas - I think I'll be sticking to their pastas from now on!

I went here on the recommendation of a local coworker. She said they had some of the best Italian food in town. Though I don't know if it is the best it is definitely really good. I ended up having the zucchini and parmesan chips for an appetizer. This was really good and fairly light for fried food. The zucchini is cut supper thing and deep fried. It is covered with shaved parmesan cheese. For an entree I choose the braised lamb and gnocchi. This had some nice rich flavors and was a nice departure from your traditional tomato sauce and gnocchi dishes I have had.  It was a great dinner and I am looking forward to going back and trying their popular meatball pasta.

Love, love, love Marcella's. The atmosphere is great for cozying up with the boyfriend or a small group of pals and sharing rounds of small plates, carafes of wine and that feeling that I never want to leave. This may be an odd thing to review, but Marcella's has, by far, the best olive oil I've tasted in Columbus. Served with a loaf of crusty bread to start your meal, it's a perfect amount of rich and fruity. Add a little s+p and I'm in heaven. I've never had any of the pasta or main dishes, but have found my go-to order is Marinated Olives (served warm in a little cast-iron pot), the Arancini/Risotto Balls (served with the best marinara ever), the Escarole & Sunchoke salad (a perfect way to cut through the rich, saltiness of everything else) and a pizza (I usually go with the Sicilian. Like I said, I like to share! I have had a bite of the infamous meatball and it is everything they say it is. Definitely one of my favorites in Columbus. Plus, Sundays are Wine Enthusiast days - 25% off bottles!

Great environment for a date, girl's outing, business dinner, so on! Amazing food options and good cocktails. Servers are very good. A little noisy but not in a way that diminishes the experience. For people who love different kinds of pizzas, perfect place to go!Had the bruschetta for an appetizer (AMAZING) and a cool version of a meat lover's pizza. Easy to split between two people. Food is great quality and at a reasonable price, especially for Short North area.

Melted Pecorino BEST start to any date or night out w the girls! Food is all fantastic, never a disappointment and I've been coming regularly for about 8 years of living downtown Columbus. This was the original spot to trailblaze the "small plate" phenomena, and though known for the meatball, Marcellas really has a great all-around Italian menu. Gnocchi and Pesto Shrimp Pizza top my fav list. Expect a LOUD atmosphere, though I feel is perfect for the casual-luxury ambiance. With the awesome newness in food scene that the Short North is constantly offering, Marcellas continues to be a constant for my group and guaranteed crowd pleaser each visit.

Love Marcella's. Great food, great service. Unfortunately, there is a good chance you'll find a parking ticket waiting for you when you return to your car...  Happened to me the last two times I was there. There are apparently 60 different ways to get a parking violation in the city of Columbus --- and an army of enforcing officers focused on that part of town and eager to get you acquainted with them all.  It'll be while before I visit again.
Good clean facilities. Dry powdered soap... A nice change from the norm. You definitely have to try the mouthwash. My only gripe is the size. One sit down one stand up. But overall great atmosphere!

Happy hour 4-6 every day. Half off pizza, cocktails and appetizers. The pizza is amazing! It's a really nice date spot if you're looking for a nice place that won't break the bank. Must try. I would highly recommend coming here!

My sister and I went in to Marcella's, per recommendation, this past Friday and had a wonderful experience. We sat at the bar and had a couple of beers with 2 appetizers and a 4 cheese pizza. the atmosphere was very fun and social, great service from the bar and great quality food from the kitchen!! I would come here again!
Horrible pizzeria. Just go to little Cesar's pizza and get one same quality 1/3 the price and double the size

I've been here a few times for happy hour - gotten the Italian sausage pizza, crispy potato pizza, parmesan zucchini, bruschetta, veal meatballs, parmesan onion.Italian pizza - eh, the sausage was so crumbly and tasted like ground meat. Everything else about the pizza was good though. Love their crust.Potato pizza - mmmm, so good. I forgot what was on it exactly, a white cheese, arugula, and potato chips. Loved everything about it.Zucchini - super oily. Super thin slices of zucchini deep fried and then sprinkled with parmesean.Bruschetta - great, big slices of mozzarella.Veal Meatballs - it's one meatball, but it's one BIG meatball. It's well seasoned & tender. Onion - SUPPPPER oily. Onion slices baker/roasted in the oven and then covered in an oil/parmesean spread or something.Service is pretty decent. They give you bread to start off with. For two people, we only got 3 slices despite the shelves of bread they had. I asked for more but never got it. Other than the apparent stinginess with their bread, the service was fine.Everything there is pretty oily, but it's tasty if you wipe a lot of it off. It's a lot of food, and we took a bunch home. Happy hour is great - everything is half off. I felt the pizzas were a great value at that

Amazing food, great service and fantastic wines. We always come here for date night and you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Their pizzas are amazing and I love their classic Caprese salad. Such a fantastic restaurant we love it.

This is the kind of place where everyone knows your name.  Well at  least it appeared that way to me.  Everyone sitting at the bar or surrounding the bar knew the bartenders and staff and it seemed to be a Columbus It spot. I know I should have tried something a little more exciting but I was in the mood for pizza so I ordered the pepperoni and had a lemony cocktail to go with.   Both were quite tasty and I wish I could remember everything that was in the cocktail besides limoncello and vodka.  Oh well, next time.If I go back to Columbus for work , I am unsure I would back there as there were so many other interesting places I would like to try.  So, as I enjoyed my experience it wasnt so great that I need to rush back on my next trip up that way.
Stopped in for quick snack & glass of wine.  The atmosphere is very nice, open street seating & good wine list. Had the anchovies appetizer & it was delicious.  I would definitely come back for more.

I've only been here for happy hour (twice) and will probably be back 50 times more by the time I leave Ohio in 2017 but hey, now I know why they call it the best happy hour in Columbus...Because you eat such great quality italian food and your bill comes out to be under 10 dollars. What I've tried:1. Veal meatballs--soft and moist and delicious. comes in a cute pot with tons of marinara sauce2. Cheese platter...we have pretty much gotten everything and all the cheeses were wonderfully portioned. Comes with honey which you should liberally spread on your bread before topping it off with the cheese and maybe a drizzle of olive oil if you please. I personally like the gorgonzola the best3. Tried the proscuitto. You really can't go wrong with that. 4. I don't remember the salads well, except that it was great in between my devouring of cheese5. Pizza was good, not exceptional. We had the veggie pizza and it had a good number of different veggies. Granted, we were pretty stuffed at this point because all the other dishes came out already.6. half off wine that are priced under 9 dollars/glass. Whazzza7. We had 3 baskets of bread8. I'm probably going to make time to go again this week.9. Yum Toasted bread with the marinara sauce. The bruchetta was so so so good. Soft, but crispy baguette, but tangly but sweet marinara sauce/tomato goodness on top. I think there were other things on the bruchetta but the main characters out shined everyone else.Bottom line? Grab you friends/acquantainces/family/strangers and come here for happy hour. Best would be a group of 4-5 because you can split the dishes reasonably (you only get 5 bruchetta, so don't invite so many people or else you'll have to fight for them)

Marcella's is a fun place with a variety of good food on their menu.  The little touches like mismatched small plates for sharing on the table are great.  Grandma loves it when we take her to dinner here, as she says it makes her feel "just like [she's] back home" (Europe).The specials like Happy Hour (small plates, appetizers, salads, pizzas, and a lot of drinks half price) and Sunday Night Dinner (salad, spaghetti & meatball plus dessert for one price) are our favorites - we go early so we haven't had a problem with wait or crowds (although it does start to get crowded as the evening wears on -- which also makes it quite a bit louder).Key food notes from our favorites: the meatball is HUGE.  You don't get spaghetti and meatballs, you get spaghetti and a giant meatball of goodness.  The tiramisu is delicious and comes in a large piece that is easy to share... or not!  There are some interesting and delicious combos of toppings for the pizzas.  The parmesan crusted onions are delicious - warm and flavorful - and the calamari is tender and comes with wonderful additions like zucchini, lemon slices, marinara sauce and roasted garlic aioli.There is a very nice selection available on the gluten-free menu - most of the pizzas and pastas are available with gluten free crust and pasta.  The server explained that they use different colored notepads to record the gluten free orders, which the chefs than initial as the work on the food in the kitchen in order to track the gluten free orders.  The gluten free bread provided at the beginning of the meal is delicious - love the use of herbs on top.Fun place with good food!

Had a great time and meal with my friend here. We are from Detroit. It was recommended by the hotel.  If you are looking for quiet/intimate, this is not the place. Pretty noisy but that was not an issue for us.  Highly recommended.

Stumbled across this place about 5 years ago wen we were looking to did something new and it has since been one of our favorites! Great wine list and cheese boards! We have heard the fondue is amazing as well, but have yet to try it.  Split a pizza if your looking for a cheap date or order any of there entrÌ©es for something more. For dessert you must get the profiteroles!

Easily one of the best Italian restaurants that I have ever been too.First- try to go before it gets too crowded.Second- Check our their wine selection. Starting with some of their dry meats and cheeses might be a good idea! Third- Order yourself a full entree! I had the lamb gnocci, and it was unbelievable. Portion sizes are also pretty large.Last- Can't go wrong with some tiramisu.On a side note, Marcella's is in a great location so stopping for dinner and walking around Short North makes for a perfect date night.
Awesome vibe and phenomenal happy hour specials on food during the week. Try the margherita pizza, meatball and calamari for half price!

Went here for one of my best friend's 30th birthday. We made reservations for 7:30 pm on a Friday night. Arrived there shortly before 7:30 and had to wait about 15-20 minutes to be seated. Then we were put at a small round table in the corner by the bar. Clearly they had either forgotten about our reservation or didn't care, though we had put on the reservation that we were there for a birthday. Luckily we were planning on sharing food because there would not have been enough room for all three of us to have our own entrees. Food was okay, but nothing special for the price. Our server was great, but other than that I'm not sure I would return here for more than some wine at the bar.

I loved everything about this place. I was thrilled to hear they had happy hour specials. Their drinks were delicious and the pizzas were a perfect pair to go with the drinks. The bar staff was friendly and quick with our orders. I will be back whenever I'm in Columbus!

I've been twice, the first time was good. A bit overpriced but good food so I handle it. My second time, I went for happy hour with my girlfriend and another couple. I had a so-so experience. We were told the happy hour specials, which included the beers being half off. Our table asked what the seasonal beer was and the server said Mad Elf from Troegs. At no point did he mention that this beer was NOT half off because it was a higher alcohol content and served in a snifter. When the bill came, we realized that we did not in fact receive the happy hour price on those beers. When we questioned the server he mentioned the above reasons for why the beer wasn't apart of the happy hour deal. How was the situation rectified, well it wasn't because the table paid full price for those beers. TIP! Make sure to ask your server specifically which items are included in the happy hour offerings, that way you don't find out when you get the check! Also, it's kind of sad for a restaurant to only offer two draught beers, one being Stella (which was half off), the other being Mad Elf (not half off), and then saying beers are half off. Not a pleasant experience.

I like this location better than the Polaris one.  The food and service has always been very good when I have eaten here.  I love there Calamari.  The pastas are tasty, and love there meatball!  My favorite thing to order when I come- Its so big and very filling.  The Eggplant was delicious as well.  One of my fave spots for Italian in Columbus.  Its such a competitive market in the Short North, but Marcella's stands out.

This is my favorite happy hour in the Bus! When I make plans for dinner here, I struggle to focus on work the whole afternoon. As I sit at my computer, I try to void the thoughts of the savory 4 cheese pizza and those 3 plumply-soaked gorgonzola stuffed olives in my cold and extra dirty martini. Maybe I'll go back tonight.

Literally the best happy hour in town. Go from 4 to 6 and their menu is almost exclusively half off! For dishes consisting of beef carpaccio, smoked meats, awesome pizza and fine Italian wines to complement; the regular menu prices are a good deal. I'm not sure how they make money serving these items at half off but I don't care. it's delicious and you can enjoy a 4 course meal with wine for 25 dollars; enough said.

Visited on a Thursday night at 8pm with a reservation for a party of ten and were seated immediately.  Inside ambiance is quite noisy, so be prepared to lean into the conversation or wear discreet foam earplugs.  Ordered a  variety of dishes.  The appetizer of fried calamari was just okay and we have learned over time that America's Heartland maybe isn't the best place for coastal seafood.  Online reviews often mentioned the giant meatball, which was ordered with fettucini (comes red and white sauce, the pasta dressed in white and the meatball red).  The meatball was disappointing. Mushy, undercooked and lacked the requisite crust that a proper hot oven provides. The fettucini was a delightful surprise, light as a feather and not drowned in alfredo (which was a light cream sauce).  We also give high marks to the baker both for the high quality pizza crusts (recommend the Sicilian Pizza) and the outstanding baked bread provided during the appetizer and salad courses.  The dessert menu best choice is the Profiteroles (cream puffs) with ice cream and sauces.We were pleased with wine list and the prompt attentive table service. Another plus is the restroom where complimentary mouthwash is provided to neutralize any garlic you don't want to share with your date. If Marcella's was a boxing match, we would call it a split decision.

First of all, it kind of pains me to write this review.  I have to clarify that this review reflects the service and not the food.  The food is 4-5 star and has ALWAYS been consistent and delicious.  Whenever I have guests in from out of town, I take them to Marcellas's without fail.  The best meatball in town, best bruschetta, and an AWESOME happy hour.  One of my favorites, if not my favorite in the Short North.  Now for the part that has been stuck in my craw for quite some time.  There is a bartender that has been there for years and she is absolutely dreadful and RUDE.  Her friends usually sit at the far end of the bar in the back and you can tell she loves them, but is just nasty to other patrons.  She acts like we are lucky that she is gracing us with her serving skills.  She made two smart a*s comments to myself and my other two guests and this is not the first time she has been this way.  All of the other bar tenders are great!  It is really sad.  I don't know if she thinks that she is entitled because she has been there for so long or what?  This has happened to us on at least five occasions and we are by no means lousy tippers.  So this review reflects her attitude and not the food, dÌ©cor, ambiance, menu, etc.  Worst review I have ever written.  Go here and sit at a table!

I truly enjoyed my first experience at Marcella's. This is a very classy, but casual restaurant with top-of-the-line Italian meals. I was impressed with the unique way they serve wine, and it's not from a typical wine glass. They serve it in a mini-carafe that you pour into another small glass. The wait staff is very friendly and knowledgeable if you need suggestions. And there's also many friendly regular's at the bar who can help you pick a good meal when it's busy. I tried the linguini with clams and was impressed with the quality of this meal and the way it was presented with delicious Italian bread. Plain and simple, if you want to pig out on Italian food around the Short North/Arena District, go to Buca. But if you want to enjoy a classy Italian meal with a great crown, go to Marcella's.

Marcella's is so solid. The place itself is really lovely, the service is always good, and their specials are so worth checking out -- Sunday evenings are full of specials. I think their half-off bottles of wine thing is now 25% off wine, but still, since you can always get wine by the half-bottle there, really it's never a bad deal. And in spite of the fancy ambiance, which often scares me off from places (as I am somewhere between a cheapskate and a food snob and I hate paying a lot for food I can make at home), Marcella's is really not too pricey for the experience they provide. But here's the kicker for me: Marcella's has a gluten free menu that almost exactly matches the regular menu! I'm not kidding -- you can get almost anything gluten free! They will even bring you gluten-free bread & oil before your meal -- how cool is that??  LOVE.

Mamma mia! (Not the ABBA song & movie, the actual cliche phrase uttered by people like me that know about 12 Italian words.)This place was great! A swanky red couch right inside the door beckoned me to sit in it and look debonair. (I failed.) We were quickly seated and the hostess even walked me to the bathroom when I asked for directions. Great customer service. And speaking of customer service, our server Brandon was on top of things the whole meal. He was there with a water refill before I even realized. I appreciate that. Onto the food. Holy cow; the Braised Veal Meatball ($7) is o-mazing! Now, it is veal, so I consumed with a guilty conscience, but dang it was really really good. You can also get this meatball with some of the pasta dishes. We divided it by 4 and it was a nice appetizer.The next scrumptious dish was the Melted Pecorino Cheese app ($10). It contains Crostini (toast), Apple slices, and Truffle Honey. This killer combo is fantastic and also a good app to share. The only bump in the meal was our Cheese Plate. The first time it was brought to us, one of the cheeses was wrong. No biggie, but anytime my cheese addiction is delayed, I start to unravel. Another problem was the cheese pieces were too small. Oh well, I don't need the extra calories. Skip the aged provolone, it was rather flavorless.Our party also ordered the Pesto Shrimp Pizza ($13). It has roasted tomato and goat cheese. They said it was awesome. I looked at it with "Hungry Eyes" (quick go watch the video: http://youtu.be/rI4fzajz3Ok ). I might have too get it the next time I eat here.We washed all this delicious food down with a bottle of the Citrus White Sangria. It's a fruity and light drink that hit the spot. Fortunately we were here during early dinner time, as I could see this place getting real busy in the later hours. Definitely get reservations if your party is large or your dinnertime needs to be specific.

I was in town for a 10-day work trip at the nearby convention center.  We ate at Marcella's for the last two nights.  I wish I knew about it earlier.  Very child-friendly.Great food, but even GREATER service by their staff.  There was a miscommunication about the order from our end (not the server's fault!) and the server was absolutely cool about it, and immediately fixed the situation for us.  After a long, stressful day for us, this was a great evening spot.We immediately made a reservation for 8 for the following night!  Thank you, we will be back!

This restaurant is an absolute gem. I was looking for a vibrant, but romantic spot to take my boyfriend to dinner for his birthday. He loves Italian food and it takes A LOT of food to fill him up, but this place did the job. We got fried calamari to start (it also came with fried zucchini which I thought was an awesome little bonus) with mixed drinks from the cocktail menu and they were very tasty. He got a pizza for his meal, with shrimp on it and it was delicious. I got the gnocchi de bolognes and it was amazing! I love gnocchi and had been craving it and this dish hit the spot. I highly recommend this restaurant. One little note, however, is that it doesnt seem like there is a ton of room for big groups.. it seemed the restaurant was fit more for groups of 4 or 2.

I always bring out-of-town friends and family to Marcella's for dinner.  The salads, flatbreads, and lamb gnocchi are my favorites to name a few.  It can get busy because of it's popularity but there is usually room to get a drink at he bar while we wait for a table. Highly recommend!

I've made reservations at Marcella's for the past two years to celebrate my birthday. That should say a lot! I am a huge fan of evrything I've ordered, from the drinks to the appetizers, the entrees to the desserts. Service is always amazing and the ambiance is fun/romantic.Favorite drinks: white sangria, strawberry balsamic martiniFavorie entrees: carbonara, gnocchi bologneseFavorite dessert: tiramisu (legit tastes like it was just brought over from Rome)I go here once every month or so and I'll keep going back.
The best chicken Parmesan I have ever had. The service was as good as can be. About 15 dollars per plate. My wife got spaghetti and meatballs and enjoyed her meal as well.
Excellent! Came with a group of people... ordered several appetizers and meals and shared them around. Great service! Awesome food! Meatballs are incredible!
The veal saltimbocca was delicious!!!!! Love the Caesar salad!!! Awesome atmosphere and service.

Was here last year for drinks -- this time we did dinner.  I was in town for work and a dear friend (and local) chose Marcella's for dinner. - Great location in Short North (if you're a visitor, spend some time in this area)- Yum cocktails, decent wine list, would like to see some more beer choices, though- Potato pizza is a WIN - super fresh, homemade potato "chips" on top -- also has some hints of truffle - but his may have been the wishful thinking of my tastebuds- Lasagna, in my opinion, leaves a lot to be desiredI think this is a good spot for a big group dinner -- the atmosphere is very fitting.  Also the place if you need a date spot that isn't so quiet/calm it breeds awkwardness.

If you want a quality Italian dinner, this is the place.  Certainly has the american flare, but great quality and good tasting food.  Highly recommend the bruschetta and any of the flat breads, but the pasta is great as well. Decent bar but lacking on draft selection and short on craft beers.  Specialty martini's are on point and poured well by the very sharp bartenders.

Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Columbus. First, the atmosphere is great. The restaurant is always bustling without feeling 'busy' Part of the credit has to go to the staff who always seem chill and willing to answer questions about the menu. They never make you feel rushed, even though I'm sure people are waiting for my table that I may just be relaxing at after finishing dinner. The food is also very very good. Is it 5-star fancy italian? no. If I have to nitpick, it always bothers me they use canned tomatoes on pizzas, but it doesn't strike me as a huge deal. If you go, definitely order the fried mozzarella balls. Order them! Thank me later! Their selection of house original pizzas are great. I try a new one every time I go and have yet to be disappointed. One of my favorites is the margharita pizza and the four-cheese pizza. Both are fantastic. WINE! They have the customer friendly way to order wine I have ever seen. You can order wine by the glass - 1/4 bottle, 1/2 bottle, or of course, full bottle. The awesome part is there is no savings by ordering a bigger amount. (i.e. two 1/2 bottles cost the same as 1 full bottle). So you don't have to worry about ordering too much just in case you drink a lot. If you have the opportunity to check this place out in the summer, it's spectacular. They open up the walls (hard to explain) to make the front of the house a virtual indoor patio where you can eat and look out on the short north district. this is one of my favorite places to go on a date and i see it being a favorite restaurant of mine for a long time.

I'm sorry, I'm just not on the Marcella's bandwagon. The Polaris location is light years better than Short North. I'll compare the two and you can deduct your own thoughts:- SN: no patio  - SN: abbreviated HH specials (by an hour!)- SN: less expansive menu (even the menu is different? Hrmph.)- SN: the place to be seen vs. the place to be/hang/enjoy/chill- SN: the high-boy tables in the bar area don't have hooks and the chairs are round-backed; hello, bags/purses. Accommodate your clientele! I know it's always chock full, especially on weekend evenings, but I'd seek out many of the other, superior options in the Short North. There are plenty where you'll find a more pleasant experience!

I came here with my parents and sister before driving back to Cleveland this weekend.  The restaurant was bustling for 6 on a Sunday, which is a good sign if you ask me.  Our server, Marco, was great and had good suggestions.  I got the veal meatball for an app and needless to say, the entire table loved it.  My dad and sister also enjoyed the sausage app.I ordered the Penne Alla Arrabiatta for dinner and holy spiciness.  It was good, but will definitely be lasting me a few meals.  I tried the ravioli mezzaluno my mom got and it was also delicious.  The spaghetti and meatballs my sister got will definitely last her a few meals!  Definitely come here, it's amazing!!
Outstanding food! Once it hits your lips it tastes so good! The gluten-free options are amazing. Great service and awesome experience!!

Both this location and the one at Polaris has a very nice weekday happy hour. $5 drinks (we get sangria and martinis), and half price certain apps.Try the zucchini appThe gnocchi is consistently good - Martin P enjoys the carbonara done authentically with the raw egg on top to mix in.

My husband and I took my parents here for dinner tonight (they are both 100% Italian and Buffalo natives). We were excited to show them one of our favorite spots downtown but were also nervous about how they'd like it. We sit down and my dad says, "I thought you said there was eggplant parm on the menu? I'm not seeing that." So we ask our waitress about it, and she says that we must be thinking about the Polaris menu, and that they don't serve eggplant parm at the Short North location anymore. "But," she says, "I can ask the chef if he's got all the ingredients in the back and he can probably prepare it for you." My dad was ecstatic, and that's exactly what they did. He and my mom began raving to our waitress how amazing it was, so she says "I can try and see if our chef can print out the recipe for you." The next thing we know, the manager is coming over with a recipe for chicken parm (because they don't have eggplant parm in house, so she explained to swap the eggplant for chicken) and walks my parents through the ingredients, how to get the breading extra crispy, etc. We were blown away!!! My husband and I are so proud to live in a city with service as good as what we experienced tonight. The food here is amazing, and the service is over the top wonderful.

My boyfriend and I are known to treat ourselves there, what we hide from our friends is that we will find almost any reason to treat ourselves in order to go.  "What?  You walked the dog today?  Congrats!  Let's go to Marcella's!"   Once you go, you'll understand.  Marcella's has the best happy hour I've been to in Columbus (4-6 M-F), hands down.  If you get there early enough, you can get a seat by the window, which in the summer opens up the full length of the wall letting the breeze seep through the building.  During the happy hour all appetizers, salads, pizzas, meats, cheeses, olives, cocktails and most wines are half off (essentially, 2/3 of the menu is half off).  Foods I would definitely recommend: the veal meatball, potato pizza, parma prosciutto bruschetta and if you miss happy hour the chicken parm is excellent.  Their specials are always worth consideration and are typically delicious, though I would shy away from the ravioli as you don't get much.  The only thing I've had that could have been a bit better was the arancini; it was a bit dry.
Had an absolute blast there. Really good margaritas. And amazing pizzas. The ambience is really nice for a casual night out. Kudos!

I LOVE Marcella's! This location is fantastic due to the downtown setting...grab a seat by the window and it's perfect people watching :)I'm upset that they don't have the stuffed mushrooms here but the chicken parmesan is delicious, as always, so I always leave satisfied. The bar selection is awesome...be sure to stop in for happy hour!

I had a fabulous dining experience here tonight. Met an old friend for food and drinks, our server michael was attentive, fast and had a very fun personality. The prosciutto was phenominal and the pizza we ordered was out of this world. I will definitely be coming back soon, and l hope  Michael can take care of us again. Five star service, and stellar food.

Over the past two visits I had made to Marcella's, I have really started to form a feeling of attachment to it, much like Cap City (although certainly not to the same extent). Both times I went here were for celebrations, one intimate and one social, and both were very enjoyable, with the restaurant making a nice contribution to the experience.Depending on what time of the time one is walking in, the atmosphere will change with it. If one comes during the day, because of the large windows in front of the restaurant, there is a lot of natural light, and provides a very comfortable, lively feeling. At night, the lights are dimmed and small candles are lit at every table, making it very romantic. Tying everything in is the decor, which is excellently done, and not pretentious at all. I should also mention that Marcella's has the most uniquely designed menus I have seen at any restaurant, and is my favorite to look at.The food is of course up to par, and fortunately enough, I was able to experience a handful of dishes between the two visits. My favorite was on the first, when I had the Veggie Pizza, which is simply one of the nicest pizzas I have ever had. It certainly did not skimp out on the greens, and humorously enough had a pile of greens of almost salad proportions, but it was deliciously done. On the second visit, I was able to try the Calabrese Potatoes, the Beef Carpaccio, the Veal Braised Meatball, and the Chicken Giardiniera. In sum, the potatoes were tangy and delicious, the carpaccio made me realize that I did not like the texture of raw meat (although the flavor was enjoyable), the meatball was alright, and the chicken was excellently done, reminiscent of something my Italian grandfather would make.When combined with reasonable prices and polite, attentive staff, it certainly is a restaurant to try out, and I know I shall be returning when the occasion presents itself.
Definitely worth going. Delicious pasta and pizza. Linguine Alfredo with meatball is a must.  Very kid friendly menu and atmosphere.

While you can complain about Marcella's just being another part of the corporate Cameron Mitchell machine, you gotta' admit, they do a great job with most of their restaurants. And Marcella's was no exception.The location is great and fits the neighborhood well. We started off with the cheese and olives. I loved the variety of cheeses.  I'm not a huge fan of olives but they were okay. Better than the ones at Barcelona in GV but not something I would order again. However the shining star was the veal meatball. Put all your politically correct BS away and order this ball of pure baby cow heaven. Served in its own little "crock pot", the amazing flavor will stay with you forever.  I swear I have dreams about it to this day.  We completed our dinner with pepperoni pizza and the Sicilian pizza.  Both were very good.Marcella's will definitely be on my list next time I'm back in Columbus.

I've been here a couple of times - and I've dug it. The food has all been good, from the appetizers to the pizza. The drinks are decent, the dessert, as expected.It's different from most places I frequent, so that's probably why I like it more than other places - it's different, but the service is great, the food is good, and it's always full. Make reservations.

Food: 3 stars.The Italian tapas idea is pretty unique, the menu is appealing, but overall the taste / execution and plating overall is just ok.  Everything was pretty good, but nothing was memorable. Atmosphere: 5 stars.The vibe is a cross between casual, family style room and loungey, dimly-lit, sexy cool trendy.  Oxymoronic, I know, but somehow they manage to pull off the intersection of the two.  Nice choice whether for a date night, a group outing or a business meal. Service: 4 stars.Our server was friendly and food came out efficiently.  Our party happened to have not asked for suggestions, but I was surprised she didn't offer up any of her recommendations or favorites.  I do love it when servers do that, as they're the experts, you know?

We came here first because we got bumped on our flight back to NY. Now we purposely schedule flights so we can come here. The food is outstanding. Start with rustic olives and cheeses and cured Italian meats, prepared expertly. Slide into inventive appetizers--the meatball is its own food group, as are the risotto balls. Our tables main courses--ranging from a chopped salad to veal to the special of the day apple & chicken risotto to pastas were uniformly superb.To top it off, the service is professional, warm & friendly; these people care about their jobs and your meal.My only suggestion is to please not go when we are in town--I don't want to be shut out because they're fully booked!!
Best Italian in the 614; hands down. The meatballs will literally melt in your mouth. The pasta is great, the pizza is awesome. A fun place to split apps with a group of people.

I'm pretty sure the secret to Marcella's is simple food done well. I went to Marcella's on a Friday night with a large party. They had us in the far back at a long banquette style table. I was so surprised how extremely busy it was on a Friday at 6:30PM. It must have been everyone jamming in for the happy hour of half price pizzas and discount drinkies. Being that it was so busy, it was very loud in there. Again, the decor was not my style and the tables were super crowded with the pizza holders and plates and olive oil decanters everywhere. They really have the tables set up so they can cram as many people as possible that restaurant. We were seated right in front of these display cases that sort of mask the floor of the kitchen and waiter station. The display cases were kind of gross as they had a bunch of old veggies in there. Get somebody one that, please! Very Unappetizing. With all that said, our server was pretty good. Plus 1 for being extremely good looking and a good sport with our group. He did OK with refills and drinks at first but slacked off as the nite went on. Overall, efficient enough for a large party. Again, the food impresses. I had the caprese salad (simply prepared) the tomatoes were fresh and flavorful and there was plenty of mozzarella, but not enough basil. Maybe only two or three shreds for the whole thing. I got over it. I also ordered the Crispy potato pizza, which was fantastic. The cheese, onions, and pancetta were perfect with the fresh lemon olive oil tossed arugula and potato crisps. Definitely a win! They did a cake service for us at no extra charge. How sweet! I walked away paying $21 for food + generous tip. I would definitely return if I walked by during happy hour and they weren't slammed. If that ever happens.

Marcella's has a lot going for it.  Nice vibe, really good appetizers, and great service.   It also specializes in handling large groups and so is a place to keep in mind if you are looking to have a party of some sort, whether it be a birthday or bachelorette event.  However, if doing so, I suggest reservations and arriving more or less on time since the waiting area is a bit cramped.It was Saturday night when I went, and like probably half the people in the place, it was as a member of a large group.  Not all of our members arrived on time and our table wasn't quite available when the first of us entered, so about six of us ended up waiting.  Originally we stood near the hostess stand in the designated waiting area (which has a very awesome looking couch) but found that we were impeding the entry of other patrons, so we instead squeezed in around the bar.  Or rather, since the bar was full, squished into a tight little circle between the full tables near the bar.  The other people there didn't seem to mind but it did feel a bit claustrophobic to me.    We didn't have to wait too long, though, and soon were seated at a long set of square tables.  Hearing wasn't too bad for me since I was seated in the dead center, but it wasn't easy for the person at one end to hear what someone at the other said. Even after being seated, a few members of our party had not arrived, so we started with drinks and appetizers, namely the Italian sausage and calamari.  Both of these were excellent.  The sausage is one long, flavorful link, with some creamy and delicious goat cheese and peppers.  The calamari, meanwhile, is beautifully fried and served on a bed of paper thin fried zucchini reminiscent of homemade veggie chips.  These appetizers, for me, were the best part of the meal.  The main course though...I ordered the gnocci con bolognese, a decent sized helping of potato dumplings in a lamb based sauce.  I was very excited as gnocci and lamb are two of my favorite foods, and the combination sounded great.  The result, though, was almost too salty for me to eat...and I'm not a person who normally has issues with salt. If there were other flavorings, I could barely make them out from under the saline quality, and both this and the sheer amount of the sauce completely overpowered the small, mild gnocci.  The chewy texture of the meat in the sauce was a strange mix with the soft gnocci too, being more akin to pulled pork or roast beef, complete with sections here and there that were tough and dry.  Based on this experience, I would not order this again nor recommend it to anyone.  I do understand that the pizzas and pomodoro pastas were very good, though.  Drinks were another highlight of the meal.  Our server explained that with a few words or a vague idea, the bar would be able to mix up some sort of beverage that we were sure to like, and that seemed to be true.  I am told that the strawberry basalmic cocktail is particularly good and it certainly looks it.  I myself didn't want to become inebriated, though, so I went simply with a glass of passionfruit puree...sort of a passionfruit smoothie really...  That was excellent!  I also ordered a "cafe caremelo" which consists of espresso, sweet cream (like a condensed milk), and whipped cream.  It's an odd combination but pretty tasty.  The only thing I'd say is that you really need a tiny spoon so you can either stir it up or just get all of the tasty cream out of the bottom.  Service was very good, especially considering the size of the group and how busy the place was.  Our waiter was attentive and happy to make suggestions.  He also had no major issue splitting up the check so that we were all able to chip in a bit to pay for one of the party members for whom we had gathered to celebrate.  With this and the drinks, the bills could get pretty high, however.  Nothing here is particularly cheap, though prices aren't too much worse than other Italian places of the type.  The menu also does have a lot of interesting items that make it a bit unique, including a long list of tapas-style appetizers and cheese sampler platters.  I am also intrigued by the profiteroles on the dessert menu...  Overall, I can't say I'll be running back here based on my experience, but I will keep it in mind, perhaps for drinks and tapas, if I ever have a large group to entertain.

We went for happy hour and it was great! Happy Hour lasts from 4-6 (M-TH... I think?), anyways they have great deals. Appetizers and drinks are cheap and the veal meatball is the bomb. Our waiter accidently dropped my drink on my jeans (partly my fault too), and the manager immediately came over with soda water and a towel and an offer to get the jeans dry cleaned on the house. Above average appetizers, great service, and cozy setting all make for a great restaurant experience. I recommend this place, especially during happy hour!

Great upscale restuarant in shortnorth area.  Very friendly inviting atmosphere filled with yuppies and trendy people.  It is fairly loud in there on a friday or saturday night.  The one thing I remember throughout the night was the meatbal, we had to order 3 of them for the table cause they were that good!  We didn't try the pizza but i had the veal marsala which was sweater than I would have liked but tasty.  my cousin had the beef tenderloin filet which melted in your mouth.  Amazing food and I would definitely come here again.

I've never had a bad meal at Marcella's. Their crispy potato pizza is to die for! As are all of the pizzas on the menu. The braised lamb that comes with the gnocchi con bolognese is so tender and savory. The braised beef tortellini is perfect. The apple, honey and cheese appetizer is fantastic. I'll return as often as I can.

One star ding for the fact I made reservations in advance and still had to wait about 20 minutes for my table. But other than that the place was great! Atmosphere was relaxed yet classy, you could drink a plethora of wines and watch the NCAA tournament. Who could ask for more? Plus the food was great, and not too expensive!

This place is my favorite restaurant on Columbus. As everyone says, the veal meatball is amazing. The bruschetta is fantastic, as is the chicken parm. Their carbonara is heavy and cheesy and wonderful! And desserts! The chocolate almond cake is sooo good. The profiteroles are excellent. I've only ever had them here and they are fabulous.

We had a GNO for my sister's birthday here and it was awesome. I had called the day before to add a person to my reservation and they were more than friendly and accommodating to my request. My sister likes tapas/appetizer portions and Marcella's did not disappoint. I ordered so many plates that the girls didn't really have to order an entree meal. My sister's favorite was the margherita flat bread, though I was partial to the braised meatball, but everything was delicious. My only complaint would be the noise level, though no fault of the restaurant's...the atmosphere is lively and boisterous, and not the easiest for table conversation, but we managed. All in all, we had a great time, and will be back!

I've  been to Marcellas in the Short North and for the most part enjoy my experience there. Last night, I stopped in for their 3rd Thursday specials when pizza and wine are $5 each. Marcellas has a great Italian ambiance - lots of high energy people eating and drinking in a lively space. Like actual Italian family dining, Marcellas can sometimes feel a little too crammed in the Short North location. However, I really enjoy their happy hour appetizers at Polaris - my one meal outside of last night at Short North was okay. The Short North dining areas though are perfectly lit for an evening date.

The Marcella salad was good, but it had too much dressing and the portion size is small. I believe the salad prices are $6-8. The soda is $2.95 and the dessert is about $9.00.  The dessert I ordered was really good. I forgot the name but it was 3 cream puffs looking bread with ice cream (pistachio, vanilla, and chocolate) with a chocolate syrup on top. I don't care for chocolate but the syrup was really good with the ice cream.

Potato pizza was to die for. Some of the best pizza I have ever had.  I sat at the bar, which was pretty full for a Tuesday, but there was room for me and my shopping bags. The bartender (dark hair with glasses) provided great service. There when I needed her and not when I didn't. Brought me a box without my asking because I obviously wasn't going to finish. I pretty much always get the lamb gnocchi here, which is great, but I'm glad I tried the pizza today. Just awesome.

I really like Marcella's.  And I love their happy hours.  Why? Because I get to order my favorite dishes for a discounted price.  Most happy hours limit you to appetizer-y items.  But here you can get the flatbreads/pizzas too and those are the best parts of Marcella's menu, if you ask me.  I'm not a huge pasta person and, after tasting my honey's dish, I don't think Marcella's does pasta very well.  I recommend the Caesar salad and the Shrimp & Pesto flatbread.  Thank me later.  The service was blah and, if I recall correctly, the service is always blah when I visit this place.  Try to look past it-- just get the salad and flatbread and you'll forget all about that pesky waiter.  :)

Marcella's is one of my favorite places in Columbus. Here's what I love:- GREAT gluten free menu - THE MOST DELICIOUS POTATO CRISP PIZZA EVER- Lots of options for wine (and sizes)- Amazing staff. SO friendly and sweet.- Wonderful happy hour - Free bread baskets (regular and gluten free)- Awesome locationI pretty much eat at Marcella's once a week. So should you.

Marcella's is a go-to spot for post-work happy hours and group dinners.  They have many different dishes that are easy to share among others, as well as a nice wine and cocktail list.  Cameron Mitchell knows how to execute a theme well - and Marcella's is a great authentic Italian atmosphere.

I loooooove the happy hour here! All their drinks are half off as well as apps and pizzas. Food is awesome, especially the calamari which comes with fried zucchini which is just as good as the calamari. Drinks are tasty and consistent and their wine selection is great. Although it's a bit pricey for me normally on my teacher's salary but at happy hour I can live it up! One of my favorite spots in Columbus.
This place was just ok. The pizza is good but not great and the menu was nothing special other than your regular Italian food. The server was nice but could have been  a little more attentive.

Just a quick tip to amplify what other have already said - WHAT A GREAT HAPPY HOUR!ALL drinks and food are 1/2 price till 7 (I think).  Get the meatball (it comes in its own little dutch oven!!!), white anchovies, flat-breads, any other app!  Good looking people, Short North vibe, great food! Get your happy hour buzz and grub ON!!

Loooooove this place!  -melted peccorino is amazing-veal meatball melts in your mouth-sangria is great-all pasta dishes I've had have been great-good prices and appropriate portion sizesOnly con I can think of is that it's usually crowded and LOUD.  Not optimal for a romantic evening out.
Portions are small given the prices. $8 to park? Good service and drinks though.

We went for dessert only. The tiramisu is about as bland as they come. Could hardly eat even a few bites, absolutely no flavor. Surprising given it is an Italian restaurant. Not too long ago I had the tiramisu at the North Market and it was incredible! Marcella's should think about sourcing their tiramisu from a new supplier.

This place surprised me, in a very good way. Red sauce and relentless doses of carbs do not really constitute my favorite cuisine, but this is the kind of food that most people like, including my brother. Since I was treating him to a birthday dinner, he chose Marcella's. This is Italian-American fare done really nicely. There were five of us, including a toddler, so we tried and liked a bit of everything. The service was excellent. On top of handling a toddler with aplomb, our server took care of a kitchen error and made us feel quite welcome. It's easy to see why this place is filled all the time.
Found this place on a buzzfeed list. Lives up to the hype. Great food, even better service.
Chicken marsala with polenta... Un-fucking- believable. Nice, cozy and awesome for date night.

Great trendy place on the strip of Columbus. A lot of young professionals for a good environment. Food was great and presented well. The service was excellent also with a good knowledge of food. No local beers available, but had a pumpkin beer that was pretty tasty. Only 4 stars out of 5 because it was loud and dark, so it's good for groups but not for soft talkers!
Delicious and great authentic Italian! Olives and sweet Italian sausage were fab and pizzas are for real.

Several days ago, I went to the Marcella's, a very amazing traditional Italian cuisine. I tried something I never heard before, like Risoto Del Giorno. It is another to cook rice. It was really soft, sweet and looks not very well. To be honest, I cannot stand the taste of the cheese there. But the desert was very delicious, I love the chocolate almond cake there, it looks very nice and taste fabulous! I really wanna eat it again! Moreover, I really like the nice and quiet environment, with some special decoration and light music. I would like to go there again!

Great food! Went here for dinner and it's a very busy place, luckily we made reservations. I had the chicken parm and it was great but a big portion. My friend had the 4 cheese pizza which was really good as well. The place is really loud and fast paced on a Friday night.
Great food, but very busy and loud. Would suggest the olive sampler. Great environment though with friendly staff.

This is my second visit to Marcella's and was consistent with my first visit.  Good service, food was as described and served fresh and hot!  For a Saturday night and after an OSU game, they kept things moving and were able to accommodate the reservation on time.Will be back!
Love this place!! Great pizzas and pastas. Highly recommend the melted pecorino appetizer and the spaghetti alla carbonara.

My wife and I dined here last night with a friend from out of town. The atmosphere was very nice. Dark, like an Italian restaurant should be, with a nice lively crowd. The dark woods and rustic paint looked great, and the kitchen, outfitted with large old fashioned white tile, was visible from the dining room. Our server wasn't overly chatty, which is nice. Maybe she was a little under-chatty though. Didn't ask if we had any questions about the menu, even when we were perusing it thoroughly for 15 minutes.We started with the grilled pecorino cheese with crostini and apple slices. This was a pretty outstaning appetizer. I'd recommend a few more toast points though, as there was some extra cheese at the end (which we took care of anyway).My wife got the spaghetti with meatball. She said the pasta was fine, as was the sauce, but she was not a fan of the oversized meat hunk. She said the flavor was not what she was expecting, and was not pleasant. Our friend got the cheese ravioli, and said it was wonderful. I got the lasagna. It was a little heavy on the sauce. It actually wasnt very hot either, and the sauce had that coagulated look to it, as if it had been made a little too far in advance. It did taste very good though, once I scraped the excess sauce off.Overall, Marcella's gets a solid three stars.

A may zing. The food is so good. They offer gluten free pizza dough?! What! Give me 2 please. Now. Here, take my debit card, bring me food.Went here for new years eve with some friends and had a wonderful time. And the food...it was ok.

I have heard so many good things about Marcella's so I was very excited to try it when I was in town. Very, very, very disappointed. The service was completely absurd and food wasn't much better.  We ordered a bottle of wine which was brought to the table already opened and then poured into a carafe without anyone being offered a taste before pouring...which by the way we had to pour our own wine out (with a dirty glass provided to us to boot). We ordered two appetizers for a table of five but only received one. The second came after the food, and after we reminded them. Our waiter was no where to be found. Our food finally arrived close to an hour after we ordered and was brought out separately leaving some with cold food before everyone's arrived. The flavor was severely lacking. Bland is the best word I can use to describe it. When we finally finished, we had to stack our own plates and ask for the check. And instruct the waiter on how to divide the check because he clearly didn't remember who ordered what. I am extremely disappointed in this place and will not be returning.
Meatball appetizer is phenomenal. Pizza and drinks are also great. Nice place to grab some food and drinks.

Great experience!  I had the Chicken Parmesan and it was amazing. Also had the Prosciutto and Melon and found it well worth it.  Vibrant atmosphere, good service, good value relative to quality and portion size.

In my humble opinion Cameron Mitchell can do no wrong. For those who don't know he is a local entrepreneur with a few local (awesome) restaurants.Marcella's is the Italian flavor in his portfolio.  It was one of the first places my brother a long time resident and foodie of Columbus took me too.We stared with the Pecorino cheese plate which comes with truffled honey, apple slices and crostini.  You build a little sandwich of heaven with bread, melted cheese, apple slice and honey.  I was a skeptic at first, but have never looked back and order it often.You must do the braised veal meatball!  It is falling apart tender and comes served in its very own pot with lid.  The Polaris location claims the meatball as the 8th wonder of the world.  Yes, I have been to both locations.  The Polaris location also has a patio!The best time to strike is happy hour when drinks and bar menu are discounted.The staff are very well trained and seem to genuinely care.  They open up the windows during good weather and there is no better spot to people watch or grab a drink.I can not recommend it more highly.

We walked in at 950pm, right before closing, on a rainy Thursday night.  Couple drinks, plate of spaghetti, and some warm bread were what we wanted; and what we got.  We were gone by 1030.  Management and staff were very gracious; thanks Lindsay.  They could have turned us away, but in true Cameron Mitchell hospitality, they didn't!  Way to Go!

It was super busy (Saturday at dinner time). We sat in the bar area since we were so hungry and didn't want to wait. Our server was very friendly. We got our food quickly and damn it was good. Fried risotto. Amazing. Chicken parmesan. Amazing. The breading was out of this world. Tortellini. Amaz balls. And to top it all off: tiramisu. Best ever.

This place is crowded loud and crampy. But it has the most amazing food, attentive staff and good prices. Too bad I can't take the whole restaurant home with me....  Did I mention the guy at the next table is actually sitting in my friends armpit??

Second time coming here (was here about a year ago) and it was wonderful again. Fairly casual place but great atmosphere and was wall to wall people on a Friday at 7:00. We got a hightop table right at the window which provided lots of people watching opportunities. I can imagine how nice that spot would be with the windows opened up on a warm day.Service was excellent. Very attentive wait staff.Wine: nice variety of Italian wines. Really like the way they provide the option for a 1/4 or 1/2 bottle for most selections. This allowed me to get a 1/2 bottle of the red I wanted while my wife continued with white.Lots of small plate/sharing options and the way to go as there are a lot of good choices. As in our first visit I started off with the small, warm pot of olives. And again we went for the large veal meatball in a marinara sauce. This is also served in an iron cast pot and is amazingly tender and just melts in tour mouth. This is a meatball like no other and highly recommended.We also enjoyed the parmesan crusted grilled onions. Big slices of onions topped with cheese and broiled. May be a bit on the sweet side for some but it goes really with the meatball. We then split the chopped salad which was really good but a bit small to share. Suggest one salad per person.And finally we had the margarita pizza. Big chunks of tomatoes are the highlight and overall good. Only complaint here is the crust could have been slightly thinner, a bit crispier and could have used some cornmeal on the bottom.Overall really like this place and will definitely be back again.

Giving this another great review because there was something very minor off with my friends dish (they just added sausage) and the manager came out and talked to us personally and was so nice and comped the food. Laurie was an amazing bartender. I believe the managers name was Dane.

I have been to Marcellas twice now. The atmosphere is nice. Sometimes it can be crowded. The service is consistant and good. Know that I am not a big fan of italian food, but the food here I would say is good. One thing I can say, is that the gellato is yummy.

Marcella's is the perfect place to go for pretty much any occasion! Their menu is full of delicious options that will impress anyone. My boyfriend and I have been there numerous times and have always had an amazing experience. The service is always very attentive and helpful, and the food is always well worth the money spent! Although sometimes the menu can get a bit pricey, the cost is worth the quality of the food that you get. Not only are the portions large and will fill you up, they are also delicious. The drink menu is also just as impressive as the food menu. Five stars all around for this restaurant, I would absolutely recommend to all my closest family and friends!

3.5 stars. I like this place, I do. But it's not "the best" and I have a few issues with it that just take it down enough for me.  The food is good the atmosphere is fun and generally casual.  It's the best in the summer when they open up the front of the restaurant and those first few rows of seats become patio seats essentially. Now, the crowd and the wait is awful here.  And it is not spaced out well so everyone is on top of each other.  It's not terribly expensive but it's not cheap either.  The drinks are average at best. My suggestion would be to go early in the summer so you can get a primo seat. Grab a glass of wine or two and try a risotto.

Having been to all of the Mitchell establishments, I can safely say that Marcella's is my least favorite in terms of the food, as well as the atmosphere. (FYI: For a stunning atmosphere, go to M. For deliciousness, head over to Ocean Club.)As I've come to expect from Mitchell restaurants, the food ran the spectrum. A few spectacular dishes and several duds. The beef carpaccio was superbly (lightly) seared, and the texture contrasted quite nicely with the ricotta pancakes. Equally delightful were the two flatbreads ordered: Crispy potato and Veggie. The calamari and bruschetta, however, failed to impress. Digging around for the calamari, I instead came up with fried pieces of zucchini after pieces of zucchini. The bruschetta arrived limp, sodden, and destitute of flavor. Desserts -- much like the small plates -- were a hit-or-miss. The cherry crustada was hard enough, it's more aptly suited as a protection weapon. The chocolate almond cake was pretty average and nothing out of the ordinary. The show stealers, however, were the ricotta cheesecake and the profiteroles. Small in portion, the cheesecake delivered a density and lusciousness that is unique in its own ways. The profiteroles were not your typical cream puffs either. Adorned with a myriad of fillings, the pistachio was, by far, my favorite of the night.Food aside, the atmosphere fits right in with the rest of the Short North, with a tinge of pretentiousness. From a bachelorette party gone wrong (let the sounds of the obnoxiously loud ringing voices lead you to the party) to the family wanting to enjoy a wide array of Italian dishes (usually found towards the back of the restaurant rolling their eyes at the aforementioned party), Marcella's draws a wide and diverse crowd and for different occasions. While that may be suitable for some, others who are looking for a slightly more intimate and quieter environment may want to go elsewhere -- like Z Cucina.

great date spot.+1 for good location (short north)+1 for accepting reservations via open table.  big win for me, especially since this is a busy spot.+1 for great atmosphere.  good, dim lighting.+0 for small seating area.  really close to our neighboring table.+1 for our appetizer and bread coming out late (actually with our meal).+1 for great parma prosciutto bruschetta.+1 for decent, but busy, service.  always rushed.-1 for bad gnocchi con bolognese.  the gnocchi tasted overcooked, and the sauce tasted like it had been reheated.+1 for my girlfriend's ravioli mezzaluna.  fantastic.recommended.  we will return.  next time i want to try the olive assortment as an appetizer.

My daughter and I are in Columbus visiting friends and they brought us to this place that they've been a couple times before. Firstly, the strawberry balsamic martini we had while waiting at the bar for our table was absolutely amazing! The wait for a table was only 20 minutes and they got us seated in a timely fashion. The cheese, olive and cured meat boards have a great selection. Our server was knowledgable and had passionate feelings about some of her favorite items on the menu as well. My friend who has dined here before said she usually has the chicken parm because it's so amazing but tried the chicken Marsala. I thought she was going to lick her plate clean! My daughter had the goat cheese ravioli and she cleaned her plate as well! I was so full from the drinks and pecorino cheese, apples and honey  app that I barely had room to finish the mushroom and truffle oil flatbread I ordered! Can't wait to come back to Columbus to go back to this rustic Italian tapas themed restaurant!

Turning into one of my favorite Columbus spots for dates. My wife, siste-in-law & mother-in-law are all Gluten Free. Marcella's gives one of the most enjoyable dining experiences for Gluten Free eaters I've ever experienced. Their gluten free menus is robust and looks nearly identical to their regular menu. You're not going to feel like an alien here. Their flatbreds have amazing flavor. Happy hour pricing is sweet. Great ambiance.

By far my favorite restaurant in Columbus. When any out of towners ask me for recommendations I send them here! The atmosphere is casual romance. It's always crowded but you don't feel on top of the the next table, which is important.  When I say it's always crowded, I mean just that. Even if you make reservations you will likely wait 20 minutes for a table on the weekends. The servers are usually on point, typical for a CMR. They are knowledgeable about the food and drinks so ask for recommendations!  I love all the food - you must try the meatball!! They have a lot of different appetizers, my favorites are the mozzarella cheese or the calamari. My go to entree is definitely the fettuccine meatball. The pizzas are great as well!
Great place, tasty everyday Italian fare.

Very busy Thursaday night in the Short North so I made a reservation. No point, still waited longer than most, so not a great start. Rather noisy, but still able to hold a conversation. Good took a bit, but was delicious. Calamari was light and fresh, sausage pizza was tasty and flavorful. The veal meatball was excellent. The risotto was a little al dente for my taste but still flavorful. The wait staff were all very nice and helpful. It is a very good Italian restaurant but not one that I am eager to return to.
This is the best meal I've had in Columbus so far. I've been here for three weeks and everything was fantastic. Food and service were above and beyond exceptional.

It's a sad day when yelp disappoints me.  Not our first choice for dinner, but still well reviewed so we tried it.  The waiter's idea of relaxed dining was more like poor, inattentive service.  As for the food:  Calamari was tasty if a bit too salty.  Bread was dry and dull. Sicilian pizza was "pedestrian " in the word of my uberhot date. Lasagna was mush with Hamburger helper.   Need I say more?No need to ever go to this place again.

Pros: Great location in Short North, trendy atmosphere, good food.Cons: Noisy, salad and bread are extra (a la carte menu), waitress hardly came around.No plans to go back. Plenty of other great options in the city.

I was pleasantly surprised that Marcella's was part of a chain (Cameron Mitchell).  There were so many personal touches offered.  We were visiting Columbus, celebrating my daughter's 18th birthday.  I chose Marcella's based on TripAdvisor and Yelp reviews.   I made reservations a few days ahead, thru Open Table.  The restaurant is located in Short North, which was bustling on a chilly Saturday night in November.  There was valet parking adjacent to the restaurant.  Our party of 4 arrived at the reserved time and we were seated withing 5 minutes of arriving.  The restaurant was PACKED with patrons.  I would describe the atmosphere as casual italian, kind of a laid back vibe but the food and service was AMAZING.  Dinner started with our water glasses being filled with filtered water artfully served from glass bottles.  We were then served fresh sliced ciabatta bread (there is olive oil and plates in the center of each table for dipping).  We place our food and drink order.  I ordered the red sangria, which arrived in a carafe, along with a separate glass of ice and cut-up fruit that had been soaked in sangria.  I thought that this was a very nice touch and the sangria was very good.  I ordered the Fettucine & Meatball which consisted of fettucine noodles (perfectly al dente), lightly dressed in alfredo sauce served on a bed of marinara sauce and topped with the most flavorful and tender meatball.  The meatball was easily the size of a baseball.  The entree portion was very generous and reasonably priced at just $13!!!.   My husband and 2 daughters had the chicken parmesan and spagetti and meatballs and were equally pleased with their selections.   My daughters and I opted to share a dessert.  The profiteroles were outstanding and proved to be the perfect finale to our dinner.   There were 3 profiteroles, 1 each filled with pistachio, chocolate and honey vanilla ice cream and then drizzled with warm chocolate ganache.  I opted for the pistachio was SO good.  The service was great.  Our server was attentive to our needs and there were several managers that help with service to make the experience seamless. Total bill for 4 entrees, 2 cocktails, 2 soft drinks and 1 shared dessert was $84.   I would definitely return!!!

my rating has been improved only because of the food quality. We went there last Saturday night and the service was really bad. we made a reservation for 8 people and one more turned up. so we had to wait despite arriving on time. that's fine, it is what it is. however, the staff was very lukewarm in their service. I guess our waiter was very busy, but I don't know why he was not showing up at all... we had to remind him to serve us bread, water, etc. from time to time. we didn't get a single smile: not from the front desk, not from our waiter, not from the other waitresses who occasionally brought out some items. I thought it was incredibly rude, and it seems like they only had a problem with our table, since tables adjacent to us were served quicker and more efficiently. was it they were frustrated because we turned up with one extra person? I don't know but it hardly seems fair. Whenever we asked for a refill of our waters, or to see the dessert menu, it seemed like it was a chore for them.can't complain about the food, it was fantastic! however, the behavior of the staff in general put a damper on our spirits for sure. I can't say I will go there again, which is a pity, because I really did like the food.
Great place and ambiance.  The meatballs were delicious as well as the spicy risotto.  The service was good. I couldn't decide what I liked the most, the dessert or the meal.

Love the food and wine and atmosphere. Oh and the pricing!  The cheese tray with a nice Cabernet is always welcome!  My only problem is I have to avoid the weekend night crowd because it's too hard to talk with the crowd there.

What a day!  I no sooner pulled up to Marcellas when a parking spot opened up, right across the street.  How's that for luck!  And I went inside and Happy Hour was in full swing, making most of the food, and a lot of the wine, half price.  So I started off with a meatball and an order of sliced onions parmesean.  Those onions were great.  I'll have to try making them at home.  And the meatball was as tender as I've ever had one.  I also had a carafe of Reisling.  It was half price also.I was going to order a pizza but I didn't have enough room so I settled for an order of Proscuitto.  What a great meal, and my tab before tip was only $12.81.
Everything from the service down to the meal was excellent.  I will no doubt be returning to this restaurant the next time I find myself in Columbus.

Wonderful find passing through Columbus. Fantastic service with atmosphere to spare. Very food allergy friendly with gluten free pasta and pizza. Wonderful appetizers served tapas style. The arancini were perfect and the caponata was a treat. Generous portions at very reasonable prices.Only downside was the noise. Quiet this place isn't.Overall, highly recommended.

Such a great place to go for a fun night out. The location is great, right in short north, and the ambiance inside is trendy. The food is always delicious, and the portions perfect. Not your usual Italian restaurant, they really stand out in terms of what they offer on the menu.
My favorite Italian restaurant in Columbus!  Their bread is insanely good!  The gnocchi, and all pasta dishes are amazing!  I always enjoy a great dinner at this restaurant!

On a recent visit to Columbus I decided to give Marcella's a try. I noticed right away that I was in time for happy hour which not only included 1/2 price drinks but also a good selection of 1/2 price food options. I had an order of zucchini chips (good but some what greasy), a veal meatball (tasty and tender), 2 specialty cocktails (both great), and very large square of tiramasu (more like a moist cake but very good. All this and a tip for under $25. I sat at the bar and enjoyed the conversation with the bartender who was very nice. I will most definitely return again!

Homemade pasta that isn't going to cost you an arm and a leg? I'm there.I first visited Marcella's when we dropped off my sister for her freshman year at THE Ohio State University. I've eaten there on almost every subsequent visit. I'm a big fan of their arrabbiata sauce. It's the perfect amount of heat with a great garlic finish. I also loved their arancini. The risotto is fluffy inside and not gummy like some "balls" tend to get. I can't wait until my next trip to Ohio to eat here yet again.

Wow, what a disappointment!!! I always adjust my expectations when dining in Columbus, but after reading the great reviews, (a few even from Bay Area Yelpers) I was expecting more... We had dinner with a friend here, who had enjoyed his food on previous visits. Our friend recommended the zucchini chips...Yuck, maybe if they hadn't been soaked in grease they would have been better...Seriously, though, there is a proper way to fry things so they don't end up leaving the plate looking like an oil spill. We also shared a margherita pizza...This was actually one of the better things we had here, and after I ended up with a hair in my mouth, (that wasn't mine) it was taken away, and we were brought a fresh one for free. I had the salmon with carrots, and some kind of greens. Once again, there was more oil used than needed. The fish was slightly overcooked, and had no flavor at all.
