It was completely bland. The carrots and the greens were tasty, and cooked properly. I did have a very enjoyable drink with strawberries and balsamic, (don't remember what it was called though.) Now for the service....Wow, it was really awful. Our server seemed like she was from another planet. When we needed her, she was impossible to find. I actually had to get out of my seat and track her down to tell her about the hair. Surprise, surprise, when i found her, she was chatting with a co-worker. Waters were kept refilled after requesting a refill at the start of the meal. Really though, what a total letdown. This meal was a waste of money, and calories.

Mark this as my favorite Italian to date in Columbus.  This is a big deal.  When people ask me what my favorite Italian in the city is, I am the snotty Italian girl that says "my house".  But for Marcella's?  If I'm going to  change my mind, it's for this place.  This is a little more pricey, but what you get for your money (to me) is so worth it.  Drinks have the right amount of alcohol whether it's a manhattan or sangria.  Entrees are delish in all my experiences (I especially swoon for the lamb gnocci and the goat cheese ravioli).  Mostly I go here with people I want to catch up with, so the only thing I can say for the service is I never wonder where they are.  I know I usually have a drink and never wait too long before having someone to ask for something.  The thing I do love is the noise level.  It's a busy place, but I never feel like I'm shouting to talk to my friends.Sigh.  I fall in love all over again just thinking about this place.  Maybe I'm ready to take my Italian business out in the city after all.

One of my favorites when in Columbus. Great Chicken Parm, Lasagna, and Gnocchi.   Marg. Pizza is good, but ask for some balsamic drizzled on it when cooked. Good wines & GREAT staff! Stop in and enjoy, but it will be busy!

This CM restaurant is so beautiful.  I love the decor and the bar is quite nice.  The food was just ok.  The meatball appetizer was the highlight of the night.  The pizza was like take home and bake it was less than average the salads were quite small for the price and the drinks were really overpriced.  Topped off with the horrible service it's not a place I would go back for the food, maybe just drinks maybe?!  Sorry much better places to eat around c-bus & there are tons of better places to have a cocktail.   Don't waste your time at this overpriced CM place.  Two stars for great decor that's it.

I don't know why people seemed to like this place on yelp. The food is not much better than what you can get at Olive Garden (that is not a compliment). I got the risotto of the day and it was luke warm and a little cold in the middle, maybe they didn't microwave thoroughly enough... The service was great though and the atmosphere was so so

I forgot to factor in the hour time difference traveling from Chicago to Columbus so we missed the happy hour, but doesn't matter.  It was a relatively inexpensive meal and I was satisfied with the meals.  The linguine with clams had a spicy kick to it.  But the real sleeper was the veggie pizza.  It felt like Larry the Plumber Gambino shot me in the back with a silencer and revived from cardiac arrest.  I can't even remember the last time I had pizza this good, maybe it was another life.  If I was living in Columbus, I would go to happy hour for pizza and drinks every week.  FYI, happy hour is M-F 4-6pm and half price everything on the menu besides some pasta dishes.  BTW, I came up with the mafia name by typing my name into the name generator at:  http://www.quizopolis.com/mafia_name.php
Excellent food! Outstanding service. Atmosphere was perfect. We will definitely return!

this place is crazy popular, but it's just mediocre italian food - tastes like a chain. the pasta is heavy and most of them don't come with protein. let's just say i wouldn't go out of my way to eat here (as in, wait for a table). the bustling ambiance and the location in the short north are the best parts about this restaurant.

It's a great spot in a great location.  I'm actually pleasantly surprised by the food.  Not that's it's incredible, but it's good and than the average stuff I expect from a Cameron Mitchell joint. It's busy.  All the time.  Even with a reservation, I'm pretty much resigned to the face I'll be facing a 20 minute wait at minimum.  I also tend to think it's pretty inexpensive.  Which isn't bad.  So overall, not my favorite spot, but nice to stop in a couple of times a year.

I really want to like this place, because it's a beautiful restaurant with some very friendly, knowledgeable staff. Our server was very patient and answered all of our questions. We asked a lot of "would you choose A or B?" type of questions. But unfortunately the food my girlfriend and I received just were not up to par. Now for starters I got the prosciutto de parma. This was actually very tasty, perfectly thinly sliced cured pieces of goodness. Great way to start the meal. Entree wise, I got the veal saltimbocca and my girlfriend got the seared salmon. My dish was nothing special, very average in taste, presentation, texture, etc. The polenta was also a little dry and gummy. It was very much a letdown from the prosciutto de parma. My girlfriend's seared salmon lacked seasoning, aka salt. Again very average. I will have to return during happy hour as I've heard they have some incredible happy hour specials (and pizzas). But sadly as of right now, I'm not impressed.

One of Columbus' best restaurants. I would recommend anything on the menu! Chef driven and very hip atmosphere. A must try restaurant if you haven't already! Great job Cameron Mitchell Restaurant group!

By far my favorite place to go in the short north. Delicious food! The gluten-free menu is to die for! Their gluten-free bread and pizza is the best! Everything is just delicious! It's a litte crowded and loud, but other than that it's awesome!

Went for Sunday dinner - everywhere else we wanted to go was closed Sundays, so we gave Marcella's a shot. Although I feel like Cameron Mitchell restaurants may as well be thought of as a local chain. So we went not expecting to be blown away. Pros: -lots of side plates- more than you will use- to use for sharing-OK decor-Valet ($5)-pleasant staff-Good for family dinners- not many dates or singles going onCons:-entrees are pretty non-filling- need to order a pizza + appetizer as well-pretty noisy- good for ambiance, bad for conversations-tightly packedOverall OK food. Just OK. And don't go to the trouble of dressing up- the staff even wear jeans and a black tee shirt.

I naturally rebel against the "in" crowd trends as a rule but Marcellla's has been calling my name for YEARS.  Yesterday I answered that call with a happy hour visit. I don't like the happy hour, hours, a bit cocky and teasing, seeing that the happy hour extends to the bar and front seating area only. If you don't arrive at the restaurant at 4pm exactly the odds of you enjoying the happy prices are slim.  As for the food, "bella messio!"   My friends and I began the event with a sangria of some sort of citrus deliciousness,  moving on to salads where in I allowed my tongue to dance over a tart granny smith and gorgonzola spring mix...funky cheese heaven.  Ending with cured meats and yes, more cheese.  I'm not a beef eater but I'm now a lover of the cured. and there is no such thing as too much cheese. I think I see more trendy in my future.

The place has great decor, nice french doors that open up onto High Street, friendly wait staff, great selection of antipasti, simple yet tasty pasta dishes that are just the right size and portion (no endless pasta bowls in sight).

Overall I would give this place a 4.5, but there are no half stars.  We ordered the fettuccine and meatball (it's the size of a baseball), the chicken parmesan, and the crispy potato pizza.  The pasta dishes were excellent. We loved them. I particularly liked the fettuccine and meatball. The potato pizza was ok, but I wouldn't order it again...ever. The waiter was attentive and the atmosphere was nice. I would definitely eat here again.

When I first came to Columbus a month ago a friend recommended that I go to Marcella's, but I didn't follow his advice and left town without stopping by. OH MY GOODNESS was I missing out. When I stopped by today to dine I found that I was greeted by a comfortable and respectable atmosphere with staff catering to my needs wholeheartedly. The ambiance? Fantastic, making me feel right at home in this new environment. The price? Not expensive, and not cheap, but for the food you get you might as well have paid a stick of gum to enter the gates to heaven. The food? Even better than everything else around me. I wish I could rate everything at Marcella's individually, because then I would literally give everything about it a five out of five! Don't do what I did the first time I heard about this place, if you haven't been already, GO NOW!

Marcella's is the perfect place to catch up with friends and grab a bite to eat, particularly between the hours of 4 and 6 on weekdays.  The happy hour special is amazing and allows you to order a ton of food and drinks and pay a little.  A few of my favorite items:Sausage pizza - great combo of toppingParmesan crusted onions - if you like onions, a mustCaprese salad - just the perfect amount of spiceVeal braised meatball - melt in your mouth perfectionThe red wines we had were very good as was the citrus-y white sangria.  The martinis are very strong and some of the flavors are just overwhelming.  Those are just the top of the top, everything I have tried at Marcella's has been great and you can't beat it at those happy hour prices.

As with all other Cameron Mitchell restaurants...fake and trying too hard.  Average food, very overpriced...not sure what else to say.Also, this place is at least indirectly responsible for putting Burgundy Room (a place I actually enjoyed) out of business.  Not cool.

I really wanted to like Marcella's, but I have to be honest and say that I was underwhelmed. I went for the first time on New Year's Eve, so that may be part of the issue. They were incredibly busy. I will plan to go back on a non-holiday night! We had a group of 11 people. I made the reservations nearly a month in advance on OpenTable.com for 10 people and they were nice enough to let me add another person the day before! The drinks were awesome! I got their special called Berries and Bubbles, which had berries and champagne and something else. It was delicious! As for the food, maybe I just chose the wrong menu items. My husband and I started with the calamari. I found it to be a bit too salty and there was way more of the zuchinni than the calamari. The marinara sauce that it came was good, though.I played it safe and got the chicken parm for dinner, with a red sauce on my pasta rather than the alfredo. I did not care for the red sauce and I thought the chicken was a bit greasy. On the other hand, I tasted a lot of my friends' dishes and really liked them! The veal meatball, the risotto special (lobster, lemon, etc.), and the gnocchi were all pretty awesome. Dessert was great, too. We had chocolate almond cake. I'll probably get that next time! Yum!Overall, as busy as they were, the service was quick. Our waiter was really nice- he even split the checks up! My food choices may have been the wrong ones, but I'll defiintely give it another try.

When you can get a meatball as big as your fist that can practically serve as a whole meal on its own, you know you're in good hands. Marcella's Ristorante offers said meatball either as an appetizer or as a whole meal on top of pasta. It's the most tender and flavorful veal meatball I have ever had. It's what the restaurant is known for. I highly recommend it!I have also had the calamari appetizer and the chicken parmesean, which are also both right up there with the glowing recommendation I had for the meatball. I can not speak for the rest of the menu, as I have only been a couple of times, but everything that is listed at least LOOKS like it'd be amazing.What is also great about Marcella's is the decor. It is an enormous restaurant with dark, sleek wood, cool spherical hanging lights (lit dark, but not too dark), and an impressively long fully stocked bar. The coolest feature that Marcella's can boast of is its large window-front that actually folds in and opens completely, transforming the enclosed restaurant into an open patio in a matter of seconds. It's absolutely perfect on a cool summer or spring night.This is a top notch Italian restaurant, and I would go as far to say it's the best I have had in the Short North (far better than Black Olive, and just a notch above Martini and Rossi...which are both pricier even). Mama mia!

I have been here twice and I don't think it's really all that impressive! The first time I was here..it was supposed to be a romantic date, but we were seated next to the kitchen and the trays where waiters collect the dirty dishes. The clanking of the dishes was sooo loud that I could not hear the conversation we were having. We had to ask them to be moved, and the staff acted as if it was an inconvenience. I don't they they should be seating anyone near the kitchen and those dirty dishes in the first place, and we had a reservation, so I dont know why they would seat us there! Anyways, we both had pastas, and I can't remember what I had (maybe it was spaghetti and meatball), but I remember the portions were kind of small. The food was delicious but if I am paying 13+ dollars for pasta, I would like it in a slightly bigger plate! Also, the waitress messed up on our wine; she gave us a litre, when we asked for half litre. It was nice of her to just let us pay for the half litre since it was her mistake, even though we were happy to pay for what we drank.The second time we were here, it was in a party of 4. We came around 11 pm for a late night meal and sat on the high table in the bar area! It was hard to get a waiter's attention, but all our needs were met. I do love the bread here. I ordered linguine and clams and it was very very good, but again, small portion. I would only come back here if i'm asked to by friends, but I would not come back here on my own choosing. Overall, it's not bad, and it's really not that great! I can make better pastas at home for much better prices!

Ok, I'll start off by saying I'll try to be as objective as I can in this review due to my complete disdain for American Italian food (OMG pasta and pizza fuck yeaaaa.... no). This is a typical Cameron Mitchell joint.. meaning that it's generally overhyped and slightly overpriced. If that's a concern go during happy hour. They do have a bomb ass happy hour which is why I'm even giving this place 3 stars. Drinks are half off and so are the pizzas and apps which is super clutch. Don't get me wrong their pizzas are good.. but it's fucking pizza, this isn't some complex Top Chef creation of duck liver souffle with black caviar topped whipped potatoes. The pasta is... just that, pasta. You get noodles you boil that shit, add some sauce, spices, veggies, and meat and BOOM... that's a wrap. Even someone with lukewarm temperature IQ can accomplish that. This is the point where you might say "but Srebrina!!! the sauce is housemade!!" No way, they boiled and pureed some tomatoes and added spices to it.. get the fuck outta town! The salads and apps are good and I would stick to those hence why you should make full use of the happy hour. The meat ball is tasty (meat ball... har har har) and the antipasta salad is very good. As far as drinks go I haven't found one that has been a go to. The Tuscan Limonata is pretty much just a sprits of belvi with enough sugar to make a pitcher of kool-aid jealous. The strawberry balsamic martini is just... weird. It's mostly "foam" that looks and tastes like cool whip left out in the sun (and looks like well... think something else that's white and gross) and strawberry flavored sugar. I'm not a fan of brown liquors so I can't remark on those.. hopefully they are more on point. The wine selection though is good so that's a solid go to.. once again, *cough* go during happy hour *cough* The interior of the place is good.. not a crazy fan of the 0.5 square foot round top tables because I'm short and I feel like I'm Dr. Evil's Mini-Me with my feet dangling like I'm cruisin' town on the short bus. The bathrooms are nice.. only beef is the soap they have, it's white and powdery (I get it it's suppose to be "authentic".. whatever.. I never saw don Corleon use this shit in Godfather!) I feel like my hands are at a Lindsey Lohan/Charlie Sheen party... powdered out, sticky, and still dirty. Overall this place is ok, for American-Italian food it's one of the better ones. Not sure if I mentioned this before... but go during happy hour. Apart from that you'll find yourself wondering why you paid $20 for some basic ass pasta and what that white froth on your upper lip really is.

Wow, am I surprised to see these 5 star reviews!I had the spaghetti and meatballs when I came here after the Jane's Addiction concert last year.Yeah the meatballs are huge, and soft, because they have enough corn flakes in them as a filler to kill a horse.  Meatballs, made of ground meat, should have roughly the same consistency as a hamburger.  For a more tender meatball, mix in some ground veal, not half a box of corn flakes.Maybe I am too hard on Italian restaurants because I can turn out such high quality Italian food myself, but this is yet another example of a sorry ass Cameron Mitchell restaurant.  I have yet to eat at one I have liked.

I'm going to start with the fact that I don't frequently give 5 stars; however, Marcella really impressed me so I see it fitting to give the max stars. I travel frequently for work and use yelp to help me find good places to eat. Mostly I'm seeking spots with a good vibe, good food & reasonable prices...stranger things have happened.. I know these places exist... And in Columbus, Marcella hit the nails on the head. We were referred to go here by the counter staff at Chocoholic a few stores down (another awesome place that really impressed me!) Luckily it was happy hour when we arrived (4PM to 6 PM) 50 percent off most of their menu, which is Italian tapas style of small plates, cheeses.. Meats.. Salads and pizzas...  Everything was delicious. Veal/Beef meatball, beef carpaccio... cheese plates but I forget which ones.. all very good. All wine $9 dollars a glass and under was also Half price for happy hour. Such a pleasant surprise to stumble in here during their awesome special. Our server Lindsey was very nice and attentive. Great ambience. Just overall how a restaurant should be in my opinion. I feel like we ordered a million things to try.. we left very satisfied for under $50 bucks for 2 people (including 3+ glasses of wine.)  I wish Marcella was in my city. It would become a regular spot to frequent.Great date spot (esp during HH) great for groups.
Stopped by this restaurant last month. It was a great experience. I will definitely go again if I go to Columbus again.

Marcella's = Happiness!To quote Cheryl H, I love, love, love Marcella's!  Anytime we want a special night out, this is our no-brainer.  It's cool and casual, and I feel at home in a t-shirt and shorts or all dressed up.  The service and the food are always great, and that's surprisingly hard to find!  Here's what I love:* Pineapple Vodka straight up as a martini - Trust me on this one! It's amazing!  The pineapple has been soaking for days in the vodka, and it makes the perfect cocktail!  But beware, the pineapple chunk is not for the faint of heart, err, liver.  * Melted pecorino - This is heaven!  The cheese comes in a little skillet with toasted bread, honey, and apple slices.  Mmmm!* Beet Salad - If you're a beet lover, then get this salad!  It's my favorite beet salad in all of Columbus!* Flatbreads - Any of them. Just get them.

THE best happy hour in Columbus. I have easily been here over 50 times in the past 2 years! As prior reviews have detailed, select wines and beers are half off from 4-6pm on weekdays, as well as appetizers, salads, and pizzas.  Marcella's really is perfect for all occasions! The atmosphere is unique: very dim and a bit noisy, yet intimate. I try to steer clear of this place on weekends, though, because it is always packed and meter parking is a nightmare (valet is available).  It is a big step up from places like Bravo and Carabba's, and there are some very creative dishes that I have never seen at an Italian restaurant, in addition to classics such as chicken parmesan and lasagna.  If you go during happy hour, you can walk out of there with a full stomach, a buzz, and a $15 tab...that is worthy of 5 stars in my book!

Excellent food, atmosphere, service and prices. I have to say that up until now Carrabas was my favorite Italian restaurant. I love this place. I am in Columbus for 7 days and I see myself eating here at least 3 - 4 days out of 7.

Had dinner here last night, it was busy for a Sunday night but still had a good service. Our server Lauren was great and friendly. We ordered the veal meatball for appetizer, fettucine meatball and ravioli messaluna for dinner. Delicious! We wanted to purchase one of their shirts but they didn't have any however they were kind enough to get our information so they could let us know once they ordered them.

If you're in search of a yuppified hotspot to drink wine and oggle at overdressed women in their early 30's, Marcella's will serve as a satisfying end to that quest. If you're looking for a simple, hassle-free Italian dinner, however, you're in the wrong place.As opposed to Martini, local-hero restauranteur Cameron Mitchell's attempt at more conventional Italian dining, Marcella's feels more like a trendy big-city tapas bar than it does an actual restaurant. The menu consists mostly of small a la carte items like meatballs, pasta dishes, and salads, with the idea being that you and your party go berserk and order everything on the menu to piece together the ultimate smattering of Sicily's finest offerings. Throw in a few bottles of wine and a frantic atmosphere in a busy section of town and you've got yourself the perfect beginning to a night on the town.With the way the aforementioned menu operates, the blame for assembling an uninspired meal rests squarely on the shoulders of the consumer.  The alfredo pasta I ordered on my first visit was firm and creamy, but did not bide well with the meatball I ordered to accompany it. After much deliberation and confusion, my finally dad pieced together a spaghetti and meatballs combo that did not put a smile on his face, to the least. I sampled the wood-fired pepperoni pizza that my sister unadventurously decided on and was pleasantly surprised with both the texture of the mozzarella and the zest kick of the pepperoni. For what looked like a burnt slab of cardboard, the crust wasn't bad either.Eventually, my family and I became incredibly annoyed with both the waitstaff and the overall scene of the restaurant on the Sunday evening that we stopped by. People were constantly coming and going behind the table we were seated at, and our waitress interpreted our confusion with the menu as the mark of true yokels that were unfit to be seen in such a place. I've heard the same complaint for a handful of friends that went through a similar experience when they took their family to Marcella's, so at least it's comforting to know that we were not alone.Needless to say, I would not recommend this place for a casual dinner with a large group of family or even friends. There are way too many power-business types and the gold-digging floozies that they attract to make the environment in here inviting enough to merit my recommendation of Marcella's as a favorable alternative to, say, Martini, which happens to be two blocks up the street. So unless you're with a date and are in the mood for a lively atmosphere to sip a glass of wine or two (almost forgot: the sangria here was the one part of my meal that I DID enjoy and asked for seconds of), do yourself a favor by skipping this place.

Taste: 3Value: 3Service: 4I came here with a group of 8 coworkers around 8pm last night since it was my birthday, and one of my coworkers is getting married this weekend. Despite making a reservation on opentable.com for 8pm, we ended up having to wait until 8:30pm before we were seated.1. Melted pecorino cheese, $10A bit overrated. The pecorino cheese was all right, but really it's just a small baked tray of the cheese, some slices of semi-crisp bread, thin apple slices, and some honey. Good, but not worth $10 in my opinion.2. Risotto of the day (chicken with mushrooms and mozzarella), So-so. The rice was cooked well, but the other ingredients in it didn't really stand out. However, it was pretty creamy.3. White sangria, $25/literI normally drink red sangrias, but this white one was actually quite tasty. Wasn't able to get any of the fruit out because of the vase though, which was slightly disappointing.4. Veal meatballsAll right. The veal was cooked well, but they're still just meatballs.5. Tiramisu, $6Free bday dessert, and pretty good tiramisu. My friend asked the server for a candle, which she actually brought over. Service overall was pretty spot-on, although our server referred to me as the birthday boy like 5-6 times.Total was $33 before tax/tip. Overall, decent Italian, but I'd rather go to Basi Italia.

Pre-celiac, this was one of my favorite restaurants in Columbus. Luckily, I can say the same even now! Pretty much their entire normal menu is gluten free and they have a separate gluten free menu and SEPARATE OVENS/PREP AREAS! An italian restaurant with gluten free everything options?! Amazing. Pizza crusts are crispy and everything else is delicious. Loved the cheesy onion app and the chicken parm. They even have GF bread that they bring out to the table and it's actually really good. Great wine selection and lovely ambiance - dim, spacious yet intimate. Great date spot, drinks with the girls, group dinners, etc. Also, the service is always phenomenal: Our waiter let us try a bunch of wines before we settled on one. Then, when my friend left her to-go box of pizza at the table and came back for it, only to realize they had tossed it...he made her an entire new pizza! Can't think of a better restaurant for delicious gluten free finds, and great service.

Marcella's is an amazing Italian restaurant! The waitress we had was friendly and precise with our order. Our drinks were never empty and our food was delivered fresh. We ordered the veal meatball, tortellini, and lamb gnocchi. All were flavorful an delightful. Marcella's atmosphere was nice with some local color. Overall, I plan on returning to Marcella's whenever I'm around downtown Columbus.

I went back to Marcella's with some friends for Sunday evening drinks and dinner... We had a fantastic time! There were three of us, so, we decided to share a few small plates and a couple entrees...The Seafood Risotto was awesome and the Chicken Parmesan was really good too (I usually don't like Chicken Parm either). As usually the melted pecorino was excellent. We sat in the bar area (I prefer to sit in chairs with backs) and our server was really sweet and accommodating... One of the carafes was a little warm when she poured our wine and she took it back when she realized it warmed up our wine. A very good evening out with the ladies!!!
Great Italian food, quick service, friendly staff. The food was well seasoned and authentic. The food is between $12-25 per entree. You won't leave hungry or dissatisfied. Definitely coking back.

Went for a special night out and they did not disappoint. Every time we are there the service is always top notch and the drinks are always prepared perfectly. The specials are always worth a shot if you are into something different. Overall, atmosphere and food are blended together perfectly for a fun and enjoyable experience.

All the food was great and the Strawberry Balsamic Martini is the best martini I've ever had. The desserts are amazing. The service was fantastic. We got to try new things. Prices are great. A great great anniversary dinner.
Great wine and beer.  Small plates and flat bread pizza delicious.  Bar stools at 4 tops very uncomfortable.

I want to take a bath in Marcella's risotto or the meatball sauce. Ok...maybe that's a little gross...but that is the level of love I feel toward this amazing Italian restaurant. I am a bit hard-to-impress when it comes to Italian food, but Marcella's does it for me. You can tell they use high-quality ingredients and everything from my cocktail to the Crispy Potato pizza were perfection. I took my mother and her partner when they visited Columbus and am planning on taking another out-of-town guest next weekend. Everyone who passes through and visits me will have to stop in to Marcella's (can I have visitors every day now?). My mother and her partner both raved about the place and - as proper as my mother can be - I think she may have considered licking the meatball pot to get more of that perfect tomato sauce. My risotto was creamy, rich perfection with house made sausage and quality mozz. If there is a heaven, I am convinced that Marcella's food will be served in the mess hall in the sky. Additional notes: Our server was very nice and knowledgable and this place has great ambience. Also, for the quality of food, Marcella's was very reasonably priced.

I have had two good experiences at Marcella's, but wow... not this time. Dirty water glasses... hand prints all over, dirty beverage glass... the classic lipstick goo, dirty appetizer plate.... just plain dirty. Seafood Risotto... I asked if they had it... turns out it was a feature, but the server didn't know about it. Gluten free bread.... 50% soaked in bad tasting oil... tasted like a dirty grill. The risotto was WAY undercooked and the seafood COMPLETELY overcooked and rubbery. The manager was very apologetic and comped our meal after trying to tell me I was mixing up the menu from their location with the one at Polaris (don't know how that entered into the conversation, but okay). What a disappointing and colossal waste of time.

A week later and I am still torn as to how I feel about Marcella's.  The space is nice and open, there is a vibrant bar scene, and the staff is incredibly friendly.  However I am torn on the food....I started off with some grapefruit drink which was beyond awesome.  We started out with the beef carpaccio, it was a big serving and I loved the ricotta pancake.  For our mains, I ordered the crispy potato flatbread and my date order the gnocchi.  The flatbread was good, but the potatoes were literally just potato chips on top.  I picked them off.  The gnocchi were perfect little pillows of awesomeness , but as other reviewers have said, the sauce was quite salty.  One point that I found annoying is that my flatbread took five minutes to come out after the gnocchi.  Luckily I have no problem eating off someone else's plate, but I would expect a CM restaurant to be able to produce two entrees at the same time....The experience was good, not great.  I won't turn away from Marcella's, but it won't be in my top recommendations either....

I have eaten at Marsella's a few times and its always a great little place to grab dinner. Its a real nice date spot, especially if you can snag a table up front with the walls opened up to high street. (yes I said the walls open)The food is always consistent with a nice menu. The drinks are creative but a little pricey IMHO.I have always had good service but if you are looking for an Italian restaurant where the servers are "excited" about the food and truly have a passion for what they do, then you might be in the wrong place.Ill keep coming back for a casual night out!4 stars

Salt city bitch, salt salt city bitch....Okay, seriously, this was the very last stop on an 11-day roadtrip from Pittsburgh to Austin and back, and we may or may not have been so delirious at that point that we made up a rap about Marcella's. To the tune of Rack City, of course...But that basically says it all...salt, salt, and more salt. This Italian girl was not impressed (and very thirsty by the end of the meal).The calamari was too salty. The fried zucchini mixed with the calamari was even saltier. About 30 seconds after our calamari arrived, our pasta dishes appeared. Our server said, "Your pastas are ready already, is that okay?" My reply: "No, it actually isn't. We haven't even touched our calamari yet." She seemed mad. I mean, she asked if it was okay, and it wasn't. Sorry girl, don't be mad at me! Be mad at yourself for not either waiting until you put in our dinner order to the kitchen or just telling the kitchen, yo, wait a minute to start those pastas. I mean like, what? I just didn't want my pasta to be cold!So the pastas. My friend's gnocchi was decent, but the bolognese sauce was again, salty. My carbonara was not at all what I expected. Carbonara is my absolute favorite pasta preparation, and theirs was pretty terrible. There was no flavor really except...you guessed it...salt. The dish was topped with a single egg yolk. While this makes for a nice presentation, it doesn't do much for flavor. The size of the serving would have needed 2 or 3 yolks. It also needed more onion or garlic or butter. Basically, more of everything, except salt.I had a massive Italian craving after my roadtrip through the land where my people had not settled, and this did not satisfy it at all. I hope this isn't the best Italian food in Columbus, you poor souls. It's better than the Olive Garden, but not by much.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday upon request. There are just so many things to love about this place that I couldn't help myself.I am a lover of Italian food. I swear, Jersey girls are all raised on a diet of Italian food, strip mall Chinese food and ice cream (+chicken noodle matza ball soup if you're Jewish). Growing up, we could only pray that our metabolisms could handle it. So it's no surprise that Italian food is deeply comforting to me. There's nothing more that I want for my birthday than those warm and fuzzy feelings that you can only get from your friends and some delicious birthday food. Once we arrive, the place seems relaxed and informal. The windows are open and the food smells divine. Although, I feel as that this place is having a bit of an identity crisis - it wants to be hip and 'business' casual but also wants to be relaxed and informal at the same time. I wore a dress (that I had also worn to work, mind you) but that seemed to over do it, but shorts would definitely under do it. Baaaaaaah! Over thinking this...Anyway, we order a plate of fried calamari, a favorite of mine as you can tell from my other reviews. It came with a red sauce (meh) and a spicy mayo/ tartar sauce (yum!). I love that you could tell that it was fresh, none frozen calamari. You can tell because squid is not supposed to be too rubbery - the longer its chilled/ frozen, the more rubbery it is. It came out piping hot and totally delicious.I had gotten the Risotto of the day - a Aborio rice tossed with shrimp - my favorite. Let me just say that risotto is HARD and I mean, really HARD to make. Believe me, I've only tried to cook it a zillion times.  Marcella's did it perfectly. It was warm and delectable. Also compliments on the fresh shrimp in it. Seriously, it was unbelievable and probably some of the best risotto I've ever had.The service that night was great as well. I did however feel a little bit rushed. The appetizer came out lightening fast as did the main course. Sure it was done perfectly but I like savoring my food. Slow down Marcella's, where's the fire?! All in all, thanks for a delicious birthday dinner Marcella's!

Veal meatball and crispy potato pizza were tasty. Used complimentary bread (more like French than ciabatta) to sop up chunky tomato sauce meatball was sitting in. Arugula went well on the pizza. Carbonara was subpar though. Spaghetti doesn't go well. Should have used angel hair. Flavors were lacking as well.

Marcella's is good. That's all. I don't love that it's a Cameron Mitchell restaurant (I am a fan of independently owned eateries). But that being said, the food IS pretty good. The mushroom truffle pizza is the best. The gnocchi is To. Die. For.  The wine selection is incredible (albeit expensive). My biggest pet peeve? It's always so damn crowded. Don't go on Friday or Saturday night.

I give Marcella's 5 stars because the food was delicious, the prices were reasonable, and the staff was so friendly! My boyfriend and I ordered 2 appetizers, a sample of cured meats, a pizza, and a pasta, which was more than plenty to fill us up.  The braised veal meatball was so tender and flavorful.  The seasoning wasn't overpowering, and the texture and simple tomato sauce made this one of my favorites.  The arancini - fried risotto - was crispy on the outside and came with a tangy marinara sauce.  Though good, this was not as impressive as the veal meatball appetizer.  We ordered the crispy potato pizza, The fried potato slices, we thought, actually took away from the rest of the pizza, but the crust was delicious.  We will probably try a different pizza in the future.  The gnocchi con bolognese was absolutely fantastic!  I had heard that this would be a flavorful dish, and it certainly did not disappoint.  I was afraid the lamb ragu would be too gamey for me, but it wasn't.  I thought it was spiced well and was tender without completely melting into the sauce.  Overall, a wonderful experience and I can't wait to go again.

I took my girlfriend to Marcella's for her birthday and got to see first-hand what all of the fuss is about. one word: Meatball. If you go there and don't order it, you are a fool! The service was relaxed and friendly -- which made the evening perfect. We also got the calamari app which comes with two great sauces and is breaded to perfection. The only thing that kept me from giving this 5 stars was the lamb gnocci. I read many times on here that it was an outstanding dish, so I guess I'm the odd man out. It's like a pulled-pork style of lamb and HUGE balls of gnocci that were hard to take down. The lamb by itself would have been great on a sandwich, but as a whole-- the dish was a let-down. Everything else we ordered was fantastic though and I will definitely be going back

Yeah, pretty good! The architectural atmosphere is by far the best part of Marcella's with the food coming in a close second. I seriously felt like I could be assassinated by the mafia at any moment when I was in the bathroom (yup, with the powdered soap), which was a definite plus. Pretty sure it's every guy's dream to be in a mob movie - assassinated or not (though preferentially not, but whatever it takes for the atmosphere. I'm not selfish, I'll take one for the team).The actual people atmosphere wasn't so great. I don't mind louder restaurants normally, but this one was actually a little much. I could hear the people immediately to my left and right, but any further down than that... fugetaboutit. That was too bad especially since I had new people meeting each other for the first time. So maybe bear that in mind if you want a solid cross-table convo or you have people meeting for the first time.Marcella's is really a neat place, though. Cool architecture, good food, and an assassination-probable bathroom make it a fun place to check out.

Stopped at Marcella,s with a client Thursday. I get to Columbus once or twice a year and always try to stop in here. Very casual atmosphere, ,friendly service and good,reasonably priced food.  Had the veal tonight, started with chopped salad, a little soggy, and calamari which was perfectly done. Veal had great flavor but was a little tough. It wouldn't stop me from having it again.If your in the area stop in for a good Italian meal, call ahead for a enervation as Marcella's is always packed.

My husband and I visited Marcella's while stopping in Columbus for the night. We went there based on yelp description of it having 'Italian tapas.'  The menu of these tapas was really just appetizers and not such a huge selection either. Despite that it wasn't what we expected, the food was decent. We shared the veal meatball which was moist and delicious, a beet salad and a pizza. The pizza was a bit greasy for me. Our server was right on task and very pleasant.

The meatball is the star of this show. Delicious!! I will say that it is too salty, but I'm going to forgive that and tell you to have it anyway and just plan on having stinging lips and a dry mouth for a bit. I recently tried the gnocchi and that was a no go for me. Way too doughy and not tasty at all. Maybe it was a bad batch or something but I can't risk ordering that again. Head over for Happy Hour with some friends and get appetizers and sangria for a great price. Always a winner for a girl's night out.

I have to agree with many of the reviewers and say that Marcella's receives an awful lot of hype. However, I also have to concede that I really like the restaurant. It has a neat atmosphere and the food is flavorful. I especially like the veal meatball. The stone oven pizzas have a crunch crust that can compete with any great pizza joint in Columbus. Gotta dig those olives too!The portion sizes are reasonable. The chance to have dessert (blueberry cheesecake!) more than makes up for the lack of leftovers or a stomach ache.The prices are on the lower end the Cameron Mitchell (or Short North, for that matter) spectrum.The service is great too.The restaurant is probably best suited to small to medium groups. It's very social feel. It's probably not the best place for a romantic dinner for two.In the Short North, it's a great place for drinks and appetizers. If you want to avoid the crowds a bit, check out the Polaris location. It's just as good.

Great birthday dinner experience.  They were able to accomodate a large group of us.  Their meatball is the best in town.  Split the spaghetti and meatball and the braised lamb gnocchi and it was perfect.  Both were delicious.  The cherry crostada for dessert was delicious too!  Perfect go-to Italian restaurant when people are in town visiting.
yummy. had a great time here. we were here for a brunch. awesome pizzas and great service. will come again.

I have only been for happy hour and boy is it worth it!  The happy hour goes from 4 - 6 and means half off appetizers and certain pizza.  That includes the famous/fabulous veal meatball.  The fried crispy pizza is worth ever bite and the price (at happy hour) makes it much better.
Outstanding AND reasonably priced.   Excellent antipasta salad and the Tortellini alla Manzo was truly outstanding.
Noisy, food is average, and everything is over-priced for hat you get. There are many, many better places in the neighborhood.
Great service, delectable food, bustling atmosphere. The meatball is savory, pizza was delicious.
HAPPY HOUR is where it's at...OMG...I think the pics speak for themselves...check them out...I always make sure that Marcella's is on my to do list when I'm in town!!!

I was a former manager that worked my way up of a well respected 5 star italian ristorante on the east coast.  I had to try the Linguine and Clams being from the east coast.  It was phenomenal, Bravo! The pasta was cooked very good.  It was much better than my old place! You should add Burrata and cut the regular Mozzarella.  The bread was underdone. A bit doughy in the middle.  Get rid of the chopped celery with the cheese plate, and add chopped olives or roasted peppers.. Sangria needs fruit. Delicious though. Otherwise, Thank you for the memories! We will be back.

Marcella's is another Cameron Mitchell concept, but it's totally different from Martini. I would say that Marcella's is more rustic.The most recognizable features at Marcella's are the large glass windows that open completely, blurring the boundaries between the outside and the inside. This is a very unique dining experience. Though I can only imagine what their bill is considering all the AC they waste in the summer.I had the goat cheese ravioli from Marcella's. Hands down the best ravioli in the world - that's right, in the entire world. It was so creamy and filling.If you're into cheese, try Marcella's; cheese is kind of their thing. They also have tons of small plates and olives plus an extensive wine list.

I love, love, love Marcella's. This is our defacto "nice night out" restaurant because we love the food and it's very affordable. The focus of the menus is small plates, but I love their pizzas so much they I almost always just order one of them. The four cheese pizza = decadent. ESPECIALLY during happy hour. Their happy hour is ridiculous - the entire menu is half off. We've had a bottle of wine, an appetizer or small plate and two entrees for like $25 bucks. In that light, Marcella's is also a great place to stop in for a glass of wine after work - the bar area is usually not very crowded at that time, and wine selection is fair, the sangria is yummy, and prices are good (half off everything!.)All of the waitstaff I've encountered here have been helpful and courteous. The Short North location is usually pretty packed, and if you plan on  coming out on a weekend, definitely make a reservation! (though often you'll still have to wait 20 minutes or so for a table.)

Just visited Marcella's this weekend as a friend and I were in town for a volleyball tournament and staying in the downtown area. We needed to carb-load and decided on this Italian Restaurant after looking on Yelp. I have to say, this was definitely the best restaurant we ate at all weekend. As we walked in, the staff warmly greeted us as we stood in this dimly lit restaurant (great date place) to get out of the cold. They quickly brought us to our table where I began with the Blood Orange Bitter Soda, which had the perfect amount of Tequila mixed with the perfect amount of mixers. For my main course I ordered the special of the night (Risotto Del Giorno) which was a Seafood Risotto. Ugh, it was cooked to perfection and had the right amount of seasoning and flavor to it. The portion was not ridiculous, but it was perfect for a satisfying dinner. My only complaint about the place, other than the large drunken party that hovered around our table area, which was unfortunately situated next to the bar, was that the waitress was a little cold. It was not poor service by any means, but just a little distant, if that makes any sense. She brought the check before we asked her too, didn't visit as much as we would have liked, and picked our check up (as she looked at the tip) almost immediately. However, in the end, the next time I am in Columbus, I will definitely visit Marcella and her Ristorante again!

Started the night with a meat and cheese platter. Amazing! Kept things simple with the Pasta Arrabiata($13), spicy goodness in my mouth! This place had consistent Italian food at a fair price. Also made a great Manhattan... If your in the mood for Italian, give this place a try!

I recently had dinner here with several old friends from college.  This restaurant has a great location and atmosphere.  It's easy to find parking close by, and it is right in the heart of charming Short North.  Much of the menu is tapas style, and is really great.  The only complaint I heard was from my vegetarian friend- if you don't eat meat you're pretty much relegated to cheese and bread (according to her).  They have a fabulous selection of pizzas and cured meats to choose from, as well as assorted cheeses.  All of these go perfectly with a pitcher or two of sangria.  I had the Apple salad, red sangria, and an assorted cheese plate served with honey and apricot preserves.  I recommend them all, especially the salad.  Possibly the best I've had of this type.Overall, I'd definitely recommend Marcella's to anyone looking for casual, fun dining with great service and great food.

Marcella's is by far one of my favorite restaurants to grab dinner with friends or have a romantic night out. My boyfriend and I go a lot, and like to try a little bit of everything. My fave small plates would definitely have to be the bruschetta, melted pecorino cheese and the arancini. The great thing about Marcellas is you can get a bunch of small plates or opt for a couple of the entrees to share. I have tried a lot of things on their menu and never been disappointed. Two of the best entrees I've had there are the risotto (changes daily) and the penne alla arrabiatta. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the service is usually hit or miss. I've definitely had more luck with the actual servers than the bar staff. While they make great drinks, the bartenders are usually not overly friendly or attentive. All in all though, definitely worth a try!

Great selection of beers and the food is solid too.  I went for a happy hour on a Monday and it turns out that the beers were 1/2 off as well as any glass of wine under $9 dollars.The service was rock solid and the bartender was able to recommend me beers based on what I usually drink.  I tried the Great Lakes Brewing Co. which isn't found in St. Louis and there was both the Christmas Ale and Edmund Fitzgerald Porter - DELICIOUS.  The TrÌ¦egs Mad Elf was pretty good too but a little fruity for my tastes.Anyway, I tried the pesto shrimp pizza and the meatball here.  Both solid picks.  Overall, I was very happy to try this place out and if I migrate to Columbus next year, it definitely is going to be a regular joint for me.

Wonderful flatbread pizzas! Space a little cramped, and don't inhale the powdered soap in the restroom by accident. :-) But overall I enjoy Marcella's. My parents and I usually go here when they visit me at OSU.

Service staff was warm and friendly.  Wine list had a nice variety of both Italian and American wines.  Food was great, a bit too much butter on a couple dishes but overall if I am ever back in Columbus I will return for a good meal.  The Beef Carpaccio with Ricotta Pancakes and celery is fantastic.

I definitely agree with all the other Yelpers who have specifically called out the fantastic happy hour specials and flexibility of the small plates.  Marcella's is the perfect place to come if you just don't want the full commitment of an entree.  Some of my favorites dishes are the veal meatball, arancini, white anchovy with tuscan bread salad and crispy potato pizza (which actually would be better without the crispy potato part of the equation). The only thing I didn't like is the zucchini parmesan - and I've been fooled twice by this.  I've got to remember to stop ordering it.  Just too greasy. I've actually never been in the main dining room area because the front area with the high top tables by the windows is just too much fun.  But you've gotta be somewhat ruthless to secure a table at peak times.  Which is a lot of the time.Most of the wines offered are Italian and are categorized form light to full-bodied.  There are 3 sizes to choose from - a glass++, half bottle or full bottle.  I can't think of many other places that have this option.

4 stars for regular menu, 5 stars for happy hour! I'm head over heels in love with this place. The cheese, meats, small plates, salads, and flatbreads are just heavenly. The entrees in my opinion are just ok, but this place isn't meant to serve entrees - one look at the menu and you can tell it is meant to be a tapas place. The open-air seating in the front when the weather is nice is fantastic. Happy hour prices are ridiculously affordable and you can eat AND drink like a king.
Really cool place, can't get enough.  Delicious food and lively atmosphere.  Little on the pricey side but worth every penny!

What a great time at Marcella's last weekend! We had reservations for 5:30 but when we realized we had accidentally parked VERY far away we had to truck it back to the car and call to let them know we'd be late. They were totally fine with it! So, so nice of them to be calm, cool, and collected about that-because it was Friday night and everything, I was expecting we'd have to just go home! So that was a great start to our service. We sat at the bar when we arrived because she did say it'd be a few minutes. Almost right after we ordered our drinks we were buzzed to our table. That was fast! I felt so bad!Our waiter was awesome. He was so nice and helpful, however I'm not sure of his name. He brought us our waters and gave us ample time to look over the menu. When we asked for suggestions he recommended the ravioli [it has goat cheese, mushrooms, cabbage, pancetta..forgive me for forgetting the name!] so we ordered it. We split an entree and also an appetizer of the prusciutto bruschetta, which i'm sure i butchered the spelling of. Anyway. This guy was SPOT ON! The ravioli was probably the most amazing thing I've ever put in my mouth. So creamy and decadent, such perfect flavor. AND THE CABBAGE. What an awesome addition to a dish. I'm a sucker for cabbage in things, and this was just, phenomenal. I want to eat this all day long. Perfect. The bruschetta was also awesome, don't let me downplay that! I have always loved this dish, and I almost always get it when I come here--so tasty! The tomatoes are so flavorful, with fresh herbs and fresh cheese. And the bread is so crispy/moist/soft, it's great.We had a great time. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, yet hip and exciting. Best part-the bill was super cheap and our belly's were both full! Great night at Marcella's in the short north!

The atmosphere is incredible, the food tastes AMAZING, but every time i have eaten here (maybe 5 times?) i have felt horribly sick afterwards.  Their dishes are heavy and greasy. I would suggest splitting a salad and a dish with whoever you come with.

Marcella's is my favorite restaurant in Columbus. Okay, I'm probably exaggerating a little bit, because we have a ton of great food in Columbus, OH. But, when I crave Italian is always Marcella's. It's really all about the meatballs. I would be content getting a bottle of wine and a meatball. They are that good. They are legendary meatballs. it's on the costly end, depending on what you get, but well worth the price.So, if you are a fan of a cool atmosphere, great tapas or a huge italian feast- you've to try Marcella's. Yum. Meatball to-go, please!

Its been a while since I've been to Marcella's.  In fact, the last time I was there was last year for a happy hour with CK.  Mmmm...Sangrias, I do remember those!CK and I headed back here Friday night for a bit of nosh.  We didn't want to eat too much (the entire evening was being planned around the prospect of downing muchas Jeni's ice cream) so we thought that Marcella's with its options of small plates would be a good idea.  So must have thought a myriad of other Columbus-ites!  It was busy.  We were told it would be a 30 minute wait, were handed a pager and we decided to take a walk while we were waiting.  45 minutes later we came back and we still weren't up.  It took us nearly an hour to be seated which I'm not knocking Marcella's down for because it was just that popular.  We didn't mind waiting, but just a heads up that on a nice day with the windows open, be prepared for a wait.The hostess was really friendly but our waitress didn't seem to happy to be there.  She just pointed to a table in the corner and told us that would be ours and that she would meet us over there in a few minutes.  Even with the small water glasses, she didn't bring enough water to fill our glasses and didn't offer to bring more until our food came out.  She gave us 3 pieces of bread for 2 people which makes me wonder who gets the 2nd piece.  The food was good though.  We both ended up getting salads.  I got the beet salad which had just the right amount of sweetness and had a nice amount of goat's cheese.  CK had an apple salad and she said it was good (it looked good!).  The portion sizes were perfect and left me feeling satiated but not full.  Plenty of room for ice cream =)  Service was quick and we were in and out in 20 minutes.  I think this is a good choice if you don't want to eat a whole lot...or if you do.  There are so many options that you can make and match a meal to suit your preferences.  Just a mark down for our waitress's lack of attention to detail.

I loved the spicy penne! Serving size was a bit small for the price, especially if you share. Overall my large group really enjoyed our dinner here. I also got a sangria that was very delicious, but didn't taste very wine-y. Lovely atmosphere. Beautiful decor.

Great food, great service. One of the guides said that this is not a good place to take children. I disagree. We took our almost 3-year-old and it was perfectly fine. They have a kids menu and the server was extra attentive. A family with well-behaved kids will have a great dining experience.

Really liked this place, stumbled across it with my mom when we were starving after being out all day and needed some good food! Great pizza and calamari, the desserts were amazing (cherry tart & profiteriols). Our waitress even gave us the happy hour pricing, 1/2 off pizzas and appetizers from 4-6 on weekdays. Really recommend this place for happy hour, service is great, food is wonderful, and the price can't be beat!
Yes, a great Italian place! Loved the meat balls for sure and also their filet.

I planned my friend's bachelorette party from out of town, and this was recommended to me from one of her friends from Columbus.Overall, I have to say I was really happy with our decision to go to Marcella's. I had one of their signature cocktails, which I forget the name of, but it tasted like an Italian version of a mojito with basil and vodka instead of rum and mint. It was really refreshing and delicious!We also ordered a cheese platter with three different cheeses. You can't really go wrong with this if you love cheese. We had a goat cheese, a gorgonzola and another that was very similar in texture and taste to a brie which we ordered simply because we had never had it, and all three along with the little sides of honey and whatnot were great. We also had the prociutto and melon appetizer which was very good. I ordered the Risotto of the day, which had a main ingredient of artichoke, which I thought was very good. It's hard to do a good risotto and get the rice just right, and this was great. Our server was very accomodating and agreed to do separate checks which, as a former server I know is a pain in the butt, but he was very gracious about it. Then we got our bill. Amazing! I'm not out in Columbus looking for somewhere to eat very often, but I would go back there if I wanted a casual and good meal. I really enjoyed Marcella's.

Get the melted pecorino appetizer, the pizzas are all good choices, and the chicken parm is amazing. Wait staff can be rude sometimes but the food and the area are always worth it. On weekend nights it gets really crowded and loud, need a reservation. But when the weather is warm they open the huge front windows and it is a great place to people watch and have some appetizers and a glass of wine. I recommend Marcella's to anyone I know that is coming into Columbus, and often go on dates here.

We had a great dinner at this restaurant over parent's weekend.  Before you go, you have to know what you're in for.  This is not Bucca Di Beppo/Olive Garden kind of food.  It is, in fact, Italian Tappas.  We (3 of us) shared a few different small plates (cheese, onions, zuccini, salad and pizza) and it was all good and fun.  We enjoyed each dish and all were served promptly (except our zuchini chips which were a bit cold and our salad which may have been forgotten and came out last but was very good).  Good drinks, too!  Total bill was very resonable but if you have a bigger party and share lots of things, I am sure it could get out of hand quickly (like all tapas restaurants).It is loud and skews to the younger set but it was fun and different and worth trying.  We'll certainly go back!

I was looking for a nice restaurant to take my daughter, her boyfriend and father. We wanted Italian and Yelp led us here and I'm SO happy it did! I made reservations for 7:30 through Yelp's OpenTable link. We got there right about 7:30 and got seated right away. While we were looking at the menu trying to decide what to get, our waiter came to our table. He apologized for the wait and took our drink and dinner orders. We honestly had only been looking at our menus long enough to figure out what to order and didn't think they were being slow. After he left another gentleman brought us the a Melted Pecorino Cheese and Braised Veal Meatball appetizers. He said they were on the house because of our wait. We were feeling pretty special now. The service continued to be fabulous through the rest of our meal. They brought bread, warm right out of the oven bread. Drinks and dinner were served very timely. Seemingly mysteriously our bread, water and soda were refilled. The "appetizer guy" stopped by to check on us...everything was great we reported. We had these dishes for dinner, all of them fabulous! Linguine & Clams, Chicken Parmesan, Chicken Marsala (which they happily gave me a half order), and Fettuccine & Meatball. Even though we were all pretty full because we ate all our dinners, we ordered a couple desserts to try: Cherry Crustada and Tiramisu. Both were also excellent. The only thing that could have made the meal any better would be some acoustic work in the room to keep the noise level lower. We would definitely go again!

I've been to Marcella's four times now, the first being a few weekends right after it opened.  That was by far the worst experience of the bunch...we had to wait nearly an hour for a table even though we had a reservation!  That being said, since then, we haven't had any problems getting seated so I chalk that initial experience up to growing pains.  My most recent visit was this past Saturday night after Comfest.  They seated a large group of us at about 11:30 p.m. without complaint.  I believe the kitchen may have been open late that night due to Comfest.  As for the food, I think it is pretty average to be honest.  I've tried their risotto, pizza, gnocchi, and a few other dishes as well and haven't been blown away by anything to date.  My favorite thing to order is the bruschetta appetizer.  Compared to some of the other Cameron Mitchell restaurants such as M and Cap City (both of which I very much enjoy), I find Marcella's to be just another good (but not great) Italian restaurant.

I recently won a bet with a friend.  Wager?  Loser treats the winner to dinner.  It was time to make him pay.  Literally.We decided we'd each skip lunch and eat early at 400pm.  I was a bit surprised when our server -- Erica, who was great -- told us that a significant number of menu items were half off due to happy hour.  Because I wasn't paying the bill, I brushed aside any talk of reduced fare foods.  We ordered a few drinks each.  I made sure to load up on creamy-centered arancini, the soft, giant veal meatball, delicious cheeses, fresh olives, and a simple but flavorful pizza.  Our server checked up on us several times and was happy to put in more food requests when I was ready to inflate the final total. Of course, I wasn't finished.  The beef tenderloin filet was an entree I've always wanted to try.  Since money was clearly no object for this meal, it was a foregone conclusion that I'd finally be able to sample it.  I'm happy to report it nearly melted in my mouth.  The pitcher of fruity sangria we ordered with our entrees just added to the experience.  Erica even refilled our wine glasses when she noticed them getting low.No meal at Marcella's is ever complete without one of their hefty slices of rich tiramisu.  Paired with a glass of dessert wine, it was the perfect ending to a gluttonous evening.  Our bill -- er, excuse me, *his* bill -- ended up being slightly north of $200; however, because of all the happy hour goodness, it ended up being just a little over $100.  I think he got off a bit easy.  Given all the food and drinks we ordered, this final cost was surprisingly low.While Marcella's does get fairly busy and noisy during the dinner hours, especially on Friday and Saturday nights, I've always found the food and service to be great with only one or two isolated exceptions.  So after this dining experience, two new things were learned.  Marcella's happy hour specials are well worth the trip; and, don't ever lose a bet with me!

Had dinner here with my wife and a bunch of friends. The service was very good, and the bar served up some great drinks. We sat down at a large table for 6 and ordered the iron pot of warm olives and calamari. My wife never usually eats a lot of meat dishes but she polished off the Chicken Giardiniera, and I had the veal. It was pretty busy because of OSU football Saturday, but the food came out fast. Food was fantastic! Waitress was funny, and made sure we had everything we needed.

Used to be crazy good. Has gone down hill in the past year. Sizes are small and I understand that, but prices dont reflect it well enough. I have a pretty large appetite and for me to eat here and be full it would cost me 40 dollars alone.

The only bad thing about Marcella's is the small space, other than I can't complain. The food is delish, the staff is nice and it's just a good tasty restaurant to go to. I always try to get a table by the window when i go during the gallery hop!

Typically a fan of Cameron Mitchell restaurants but the service was awful. They were bus, but after taking our order, we waiting over an hour for our food and were never asked if we wanted a second round of drinks. After mistakes in our orders, the food was just ok but not worth the poor service. Definitely done with this restaurant.

Let me open by saying that there was not a single dish at Marcella's that I didn't like. And I tried A LOT of dishes.For my birthday I wanted to go someplace nice. Someplace I could dress up, go out with a few close friends, and have a great experience, not just great food. I found that Marcella's fit that expectation perfectly.A lot of people on hear complain about the noise or atmosphere of Marcella's. Notice I stated above that I wasn't looking for a quiet place to eat with friends, just nice. Marcella's felt busy even for a Monday night, and yes, there was the din of other people, music, espresso machine, plates being passed around and glasses clinking to toasts being made. But all of that fit in nicely and allowed my group of friends to still be the rambunctious group we've grown up to become. My only complaint about the layout is that for a place where so many different plates of food are ordered and passed around, the table surface area is inadequate.The waitress and servers were okay. Our water was refilled with haste at every opportune time and were asked if we wanted refills for our Sangria. But that's about where the extended hospitality ended. When food was brought out, plates were just handed off at the end of the table with no effort to find the proper owner. When asked what kind of wine they used in the Sangria, the waitress couldn't produce the name, though did tell us everything else in it. When checks came, items were switched around and she did not split up the Sangria onto two checks like she offered to. But what's money amongst friends during a celebration? These things were the only clouds on an otherwise wonderful night.I wouldn't say that the food was the best food hands down that I've ever experienced, but everything was good. Unquestionably good. Everything that went into my mouth that night did not need to be mulled over about complexities or intentions. There was no art to the food, but everything was, for lack of any other descriptor, good.Our party started out with cheese plates (3 for $10 or 5 for $15), meats, small plates ($4 - $6) or appetizers ($6 - $9). The theme of the dinner was set by the massive passing around of plates and forks as each of us tried something new and different. The Prosciutto and Melon is a must, as is the Veal Meatball. When the time came, some of us ordered entrees while others ordered more small plates. I had the Goat's Cheese Ravioli ($12) and was floored by the amount of taste in such a boring looking dish. I tried the lasagna and the gnocchi, both of which were good but I felt I made the right decision.Desserts are reasonably priced at only $5 each and after dinner coffees at $3. I had the Profiteroles, and the chocolate sauce was thick and rich. A friend enjoyed a Caffe Caramello and commented that the sweet cream was a perfectly executed ending to the drink.Personal experience may vary, and I'm sure a good part of the night's pleasure stemmed from being surrounded by friends. The small prices on dishes is deceptive, as you'll want to try a few small dishes as well as order an entree, and you certainly can't pass on dessert or at least a coffee. Our table of 6 spent at least $250 on food and drink, but we left with full bellies and a general feeling of satisfaction.In conclusion, if you are looking for a private and personalized dining experience, this is not the Cameron Mitchell restaurant for you. If you want some place to enjoy the company of friends while sharing seriously good Italian food without sacrificing the quality that you would at a place like Buca di Bepo, than you should come to Marcella's.

I love that every review of Marcella's is centered around an explanation that it is a tapas restaurant and all that that entails.  In my experience, it entails you overpaying for small portions of bar snacks, ideally while drinking enough to make that a tolerable proposition.  With that out of the way, here is what I actually have to say about the restaurant I am reviewing:This is a review of Marcella's happy hour, 4-6 p.m. on weekdays.  Basically, it's great.  Pizzas are $4 (regularly $11 - see what I'm saying about overpaying?).  Caponata is another good option (I ask for bread with it) at $3.  A liter of sangria goes a long way, and sets you back just $8 (instead of $26).  Marcella's top-shelf twist on the Manhattan, that quintessential American cocktail, is just what the lawyer ordered and just $4.  For 2 hours every weekday, Marcella's is a refreshing and reasonable drink + snack option.  The rest of the time - it's tapas.

Located in a very trendy part of town.  I ordered the steak.  The waitress said oh boy you are going to love the steak.  And well I didn't so much.  It Was average, the service was average.  Nothing to get too excited about.

I have been here too many times to count. I absolutely love this restaurant. Most recently I went for my birthday. I had the bruschetta, theirs is by far the best I have had. I also tried the veal meatball which was also delicious. Of course I had a bottle of wine too and a caesar salad also. The ambiance is intimate and the staff is friendly and very attentive. Love it!
Food isn't great. I'd avoid unless taking advantage of a happy hour deal. You can do a lot better with your money than this faux Cameron Mitchell joint.
This is a great venue for birthdays, celebrations, etc. The food is great for sharing - small plates, tapas, pizzas. It is also well situated for college students, young professionals crowd, etc.

I always have a good time at Marcella, and it's a great pace to bring a large group (in my experience).  I am a big fan of their menu and quality of food.  The only negative aspect that I experience here is perhaps the promptness and/or quality of service.  Don't get me wrong, every single one of the servers I've ever had here has been super nice and personable, but sometimes I feel like they are maybe a tad undertrained or get too caught up with other tables.  All in all though, this does not outweigh what a truly solid restaurant this is....Marcella's never disappoints.

When the Polaris location opened last December, I wanted to wait to go to Marcella's in the Short North first, but I succumbed to the urge and went for lunch. We had worked up a hunger from Christmas shopping and there's nothing like a belly full of pasta and red wine on a frigid day. The restaurant just opened that week, so it was quiet and the staff was still feeling their way around. The bar is reminiscent of an Italian bistro, but the dining room has a much cozier "rustica" feeling, which we all immediately took to. I also dig the Italian rustic homestyle menu. I'm a big fan of small plates and found the selections were creative and varied. The bruschetta was fabulous- and I don't even like tomatoes! Overall, I got a good vibe and a fantastic bowl full of penne arrabiatta. A few months later, I still hadn't been to Marcella's in the Short North, but when I went to the Food & Wine Affair, a few of Cameron Mitchell's chefs were featuring tastes of various entrees... of all the fabulous places represented at the event, Marcella's was by far my favorite- hand's down. They had me at Gnocchi con Bolognese! I went back for 3 or 4 servings and shortly after found myself once again having at Marcella's (Polaris) ordering the gnocchi for dinner. The chef even came out to chat after I raved on and on about it.Gnocchi is a tricky thing and can go either way, which is why I often hesitate to order this as a full entree, but I knew otherwise. Marcella's gnocchi is perfectly cooked and the braised lamb marinara sauce is currently one of my top 2 Italian dishes in Columbus. Over time, I've tasted of several other entrees and ordered a few flatbread pizzas at the bar, all of which were great tasting. All of my dining experiences have lived up to what my expectation is of Cameron Mitchell restaurants- consistantly good food, creative concepts and solid service. I found our servers and bartenders to be friendly and attentive, despite the place being a total zoo one Friday night. The age group of patrons seem to be mixed depending on the time of day/night. This particular Marcella's strikes me as the sort of place you go to have drinks and dinner in a lively setting, not so much for carousing.  I do know they have carry out, because I've ordered several meals to go.In an area as overloaded with chain restaurants and mall food courts as Polaris is, Marcella's Ristorante is a shining star. I highly recommend lunch and dinner at either locations. Weekends at the Polaris Marcella's can become very crowded, but I've never had much of a wait for lunch- except during this holiday shopping season, but just grab a carafe of wine and sit tight!  It's well worth the wait.

Can someone tell me why there are so many Italian restaurants in the United States? And why do they vary so widely? On one hand you have the supremely expensive neuvo-Italian type places with 4 items on the menu ranging from cuttlefish to rare mushrooms. On the other hand you have the greasy pizza joints that mysteriously serve not only bad pizza but french fries and grinders too(whatever they are). All classified as Italian restaurants.Do we as Americans love Italian food that much? What is it, the tomatoes, the cheese? Well, dear reader, let me tell you. I've been to Italy quite a few times. Italians don't love American food as much as we love Italian food. But I digress. Maybe we like to imagine ourselves in a more exotic place like Italy (it's really not that exotic but bear with me). So with that in mind, we put on our finest clothes, meet with our finest friends, and go to a fine dining establishment like Marcella's. And viola! We're instantly transported to that exotic place eating fine Italian cuisine or so we think.All told, Marcella's falls squarely just above the middle of Italian restaurants being significantly better than Olive Garden, enormously better than Tony's Pizza and Wings, but not better than a truly family-run small place with the Italian-speaking grandma in the back preparing meals from all real ingredients. And obviously nothing will touch actually eating in a small ristorante just off the Piazza di Navonna.This place looks cool, is crowded, even on a Tuesday, the staff is friendly, and the food is good. But still, it's chain. and you can taste it in the food. it's just not quite as good as you would hope it to be. I sampled a wide-range of the items on the menu, from the cheese, to the anchioves, to the bruschetta and the gelato. All good but not fantastic. Bonus fact: Prices are reasonable.So prance off to Marcella's, even indulge yourself with valet parking. You'll enjoy but it's not the real deal.And yes, I'm a snob.
Service was fantastic and we all enjoyed our meals. I've had better sangria elsewhere, and should have ordered wine instead. However, my food was great.
Veal meatball is excellent!  Linguine with clam sauce is excellent!   Good service.  Friendly staff.  Reasonably priced. Good size portions.  Highly recommend!

We love this place. Their happy hour cannot be beat. We come here a lot for happy hour. Half price cocktails, wine, appetizers, and pizzas. My favorites are the cheese plate, the anchovies, the pizzas, the gnocci, the carbonara....pretty much everything on the menu is delicious. I grew up in the heart of great Italian food and this is the first place in Columbus I have found to satisfy my craving.

I like Marcella's, I've been here twice... but if I could I'd rather give it 3.5 stars.I came here with a group of 15+ people on a Sunday evening around 6:30pm. I have no clue why it was packed, but there were people filling the waiting area...it was kind of ridiculous. Anyway, I had no problem with my reservation, which was great. But the service was a little finicky. Two meals never came out, after repeated assurance to the my guests that they would be. Instead, I think they took it off their ticket and placed them as to-go orders. I got the calamari --which was pretty salty and oily, and had very little calamari in it. The cheese board--which was delicious as always, mmm! And shared the gnocchi---however, the dumplings were pretty mushy and resembled more like clumps of mash potato in some kind of stew. Also, it was kind of interesting because three people at my table ordered the gnocchi and all of our plates looked a little different. Some looked more substantial than others, fresher looking dumplings and cubes of lamb vs my stew plate.In the future I would not go here with a large group. Keep it to six so that you can enjoy the people watching, share the excellent small platters (the highlight of Marcella's), and share the bottles of wine that are 25% off on Sundays!
Not a huge fan of the atmosphere (or the atmosphere of any Cameron Mitchell restaurant--far too contrived), but the food is pretty good.

Is it alright to describe meat as melt in your mouth, or should that be reserved for candy coated chocolates? Aw heck, who cares - the meatballs here are MELT IN YOUR MOUTH! Simply amazing!The calamari is a yummy starter too, however I got a fried lemon slice in one bite and kinda wanted to gag.Oh and to end the meal, splurge - Go for the tiramisu.
