You won't regret it, I promise.Overall, I love Marcella's. I love the atmosphere and that it is the plate sharing sort of place. I love that they pour the wine the carafes at the table, and I love that they open all of the glass front and side in the summer. So cute and so yummy!

Last night my friend and I decided to grab some dinner and then go see a movie. We wanted to try something different and I've actually never been to Marcella's before. So we stopped in. Bad idea.Let me start off by saying that Marcella's is a nice restaurant and there's nothing wrong with it. But it wasn't at all what we were expecting. I had no idea that it was a tapas kind of place. I'm going to go ahead and recommend this place to couples. If you're out with your lady or man, come here, it'll be perfect. But with a friend it was a little weird. Marcella's is all about little shareable appetizer foods and that might be fun with a group or with a couple. Why? Because if one person gets the bill, no problem. If several people all pitch in, fine. And yes, my friend and I could have easily split the bill. But we didn't exactly have the same tastes. So this obviously wasn't going to work for us.So we found a spot on the street. No, there's no great places to park around here, and consider yourself lucky if you get a spot on the street in front. We had to walk about two blocks which wasn't fun in the bitter cold sliding on the solid ice sidewalk. At least it was nice and warm in Marcella's.A hostess greeted us and took us way to the back of the restaurant because it looked pretty crowded up by the front. We were seated at a 4 person table so I had an extra chair to throw my coat and purse on, which is always nice. Our waitress came right up and filled our glasses with water and brought us menus. She went over practically everything on the menu for us and left us to our own devices. We felt like idiots, but we were still confused. The menu consisted of these different sections: Olives, Cheese, Meats, Small Plates, Appetizers, Pizzas, Pastas. What? Basically, it was different. Which was fine. But we didn't really want to share appetizers or eat pizza. Aside from that, pasta dishes were our only options. Don't get me wrong, these appetizers and meal fragments sounded great. But it seemed pretty expensive to try all the things you'd want with just two people, especially if we didn't have the same taste. A couple with similar tastes would definitely do better here, but I think it would also be fun for a bigger group. I wanted to try some of the appetizers, but we both decided pasta would be our best bet. Besides, we had a movie to catch.So I ordered the Ravioli Mezzaluna. One glance at the menu and I knew that dish was for me. My friend can be picky and I don't even know what she did. She wanted some gnocchi dish but she wanted the garlic sauce of another dish instead of marinara sauce. The waitress seemed to understand and said that would be fine. So we waited and they brought out some sliced bread and poured us a little dish of olive oil and grated some parmesan cheese on top. It was pretty good, but I wasn't a huge fan of the bread. It was tough and chewy. Much better with the oil.We didn't have to wait too long for our food to come out. Our server told us the food was fast here and we probably only waited 15 minutes. But dishes looked very nice and smelled delicious. I dug right in to mine. Oh my gosh it was great! Only one other time have I had ravioli that good (the other was at a very expensive restaurant in D.C.). The ravioli was big - about twice or three times the size of your typical ravioli. It was filled with goat cheese (which is delicious) and cooked with cabbage, mushrooms and little pieces of bacon. The sauce was great - it was a brown sauce that tasted like a wine sauce. I loved it. I ate it all. Devoured it. But really, the serving size wasn't all that big. There were only 4 pieces of ravioli. It was the perfect amount of food to leave room for dessert. But I do like to have some food to take home later. That wasn't going to happen here. And my pasta dish was $12. Not too bad, but a little pricey for a meal that leaves you just a little unsatisfied as far as hunger. I mean, I was fine, but I could have eaten more.And as for my friend's food, they screwed it all up. But she didn't want to say anything for some reason. She got her gnocchi, but there were big tomatoes in it, I'm not sure if that was the wrong sauce. And there was no meat at all! She specifically said to the server that she wanted lamb and there was no lamb. She really should have said something but didn't. She still liked it and I tried a piece of the gnocchi and it was pretty good, although I don't think I could eat a whole plate of it. I definitely ordered the right thing, but I think they dropped the ball on my friend's food. Nevertheless, she should have spoken up about it - I'm sure they would have fixed it. But our issue was that we were on a time constraint.We considered dessert because they all looked so good, but our server was spotty towards the end so we ran out of time and just had to get the check. She put it on one but we had her split it. I'll have to try this place again with Jeff so we can share foods!

Just doesn't do it for me.  Food is mediocre, and unfortunately I've had some terrible service experiences.  It is usually a lively scene, which I guess is good.  But in terms an Italian restaurant, don't expect tasty fare.

Wish I could do 3.5 instead of 3. I love, love, love the food at Marcella's but, I always run into a problem with reservations running behind. The food at Marcella's is fantastic. The happy hour specials are, in my opinion, the best in the city. I strongly recommend the melted pecorino for a starter and depending on your mood the margherita pizza or chicken parmesan. I have had about 75% of the things on the menu and have yet to come across something I didn't not like. This is a great spot to meet with co-workers or friends after work. Now on to the down sides. First, the restaurant is VERY loud and gets louder as the night goes on. It does give off a lively vibe but, it's no fun to yell at the person across the table. Also, the wait staff can seem a little annoyed sometimes, I've noticed this more with happy hour than dinner. And, now, my absolute biggest pet peeve about Marcella's...they always run behind on reservations. People make reservations for a reason.  However, I have never been seated immediately or even in less than five minutes no matter my reservation time.  I made a reservation over a week ago for 6:15 on a Saturday as I was attending a concert that began at 8 at Nationwide Arena. Upon arriving at 6:10 I was told that the reservations were running 20 minutes behind. 6:30 was available when I made my reservation and there is a reason I did not choose it. Unfortunately, this night, waiting wasn't an option so we wound up at Steak Escape. :(. Also, the waiting area is non-existent, prepare to get intimate with other waiting guests!So, while I do love the food at Marcella's I will not go back again if I actually have somewhere to be afterward. But, if you are not operating on a schedule and can afford to wait, check this place out!

The best time to go to here is in the summer. My favorite feature of this restaurant are the full windows that extend and open during warm weather.I recently went here and without the warm air wafting in, it just wasn't the same!The menu is based on the idea of eating family style, ordering a few things and sharing. This is a common concept but the dishes and portions could be better if you choose to go this route.Having tried everything from the appetizers to the veal, you are guaranteed to walk away satisfied with the pizzas they have several creations and they are great for sharing along with the fresh salads and sangria.

While this may indeed be the best pizza in Columbus (no offense to Bexley Pizza Plus, but much to all those fans of the greasy processing of Donatos, Adriaticos, Papa Johns) the atmosphere could use a little work.  Hip and trendy, great food, but simply too loud.Went with my family on Christmas Eve and enjoyed the fried calamari a great deal, along with the wonderful fresh italian bread with butter.  For our pizza options we opted for Margherita, Funghi and Taleggio, and Shrimp Pesto.  While all 3 pizzas were great and the cheeses were fresh, sharp, and well melted the crust really stood out due to its thin and crispy texture.  The tomato sauce was great and the pesto was incredible, but the garlic sauce on the Funghi was a bit much (and I'm a pretty huge garlic fan.)For dessert, the Tiramisu was terribly overrated and nowhere near the quality of other Columbus establishments.  Tiramisu is a dish I get at every restaurant that offers it and I must say this is in the bottom 25% of those sampled.  On the otherhand, the Profiterole's were absolutely stellar, on par with those at far more expensive restaurants in much more culinary cities - The dish, additionally, was enormous.For the price, Marcella's may be one of the best options in all of Columbus.  Great, fresh food in large portions........if only the place were a little more quiet and had a better Tiramisu.  On my next visit I believe I'll sample some of the cheese tasting menu and the other dishes besides the pizza.

This is a really wonderful little place to eat. It opened 5 months before I moved to Boston and quickly became the place I went when anyone wanted to get some food.The small plates are wonderful and the rustic feel of the restaurant and the dishes is perfect. I love the open store front during the summer!The meatball is fantastic, the proscuitto e melone is head over heels fabulous and the pizzas are fantastic too.I really love tapas style food. Little plates just make me a whole lot happier than a huge chunk of meat with some version of starch and a tiny bit of veggies. The variety of food you can get is fantastic, especially with the amount of money you're spending. Another triumphant Cameron Mitchell endeavor. If I've said it once, I've said it a million times: Columbus, be thankful for your restauranteur, he knows what he's doing!!
Very good meatball, had two other apps at the table that were forgettable. Good italian atmosphere. Reminded me of my grandmothers basement which is a good thing!

I've been to Marcella's only once so far, but can't wait to go back.  We went for my birthday in January, had a reservation for 12 people, which ended up being 13 instead.  Our server was fantastic!  I wish I remembered her name, because I really can not say enough good things about her; the girl was cheerful, prompt, organized, etc.  She did not mess up a single thing any of us ordered, even though we arrived at different times, and kept ordering drinks and small plates.  She even climbed up on a chair to take a picture of all 13 of us with our shots of limoncello.  She was perfect!Quite honestly, everything was perfect.  Maybe it's easier for me to say that because it was my birthday and I didn't pay for anything; when I go back on my own dime, I might have to write an addendum that addresses value proportional to cost.We ordered lots of small plates - chesses and olives were all wonderful, some folks had calamari, which I think they enjoyed, but a good portion of our group was vegetarian (including myself).  We had a vegetable pizza that was absolutely heavenly - peppery arugula, bits of sauteed zuchini, onions, tomatoes, I don't even remember what else, thin crisp crust.  I tried some gnocchi, some sort of ravioli, and other things I'm forgetting.  Everything was very, very good.Drinks were wonderful.  We had lots of wine, the limoncello I mentioned before (less syrupy sweet than it is at Buca de Beppo, the only other place I've tried it, and I like Marcella's better), and some fancy drinks.  The Strawberry-Balsamic Martini sounds odd, but tastes fantastic!We also had desserts; I sampled someone's gelato, and one of my friends insisted on buying me a slice of tiramisu for my birthday, which our server was good enough to box up since I couldn't have eaten another bite.  When I ate it two days later, it was still ambrosia.As far as atmosphere goes, it's great for groups but some people might find it a bit loud and/or crowded for their liking.  I also love the way the windows out front can be opened like doors to give patio style seating in the summer; I hope I can sit out there soon and enjoy some more great food.And one last thing - I'm not always such a fan of Cameron Mitchell's restaurants, but this one I absolutely will go back to!

Whether joined by friends or your significant other, Marcella's Ristorante in Short North is a top-tier choice for satisfying those frequent Italian cravings. In terms of food, what this place does well is draw your attention to the better parts of Italian cuisine. Regardless of what appetizer or entree I've tried, my impression, to put it simply, is that the focus is on getting straight to the good stuff, in reasonable portions, and absent any unnecessary filler. My last visit was no disappointment. To start, the melted pecorino cheese was fantastic. It's a mix of crustini, apple slices, honey, and of course, a quality melted pecorino cheese. It's the real deal. For the main course I chose the ravioli mezzaluna. It was impressive and the mushrooms made the dish. With all that said about the food, what make the restaurant are the people and environment, both of which are vibrant in a way that mirror Short North itself. Weather permitting, I'd recommend taking a seat at one of the high-tops in the front of the restaurant by the large open window. You'll be immersed with all things Short North without loosing the charm of the restaurant or the solid Italian experience it provides.

Pure awesome.  One of my favorite places.  Ravioli Mezzaluna FTW.  More than half the time the server disappears for 15 minutes when we're waiting on our bill.  Really the only complaint.  Better than Polaris location.

My best friend's bachelorette party devolved into a day of eating, and so we thought that small plates might be a good solution for saving room for drinks later on.  Having planned this event from the other side of the country, I was encouraged that the local ladies were very enthusiastic about my choice of restaurant.  Having made several trips to Columbus over the years, I also knew it would be tough to go wrong with a Cameron Mitchell establishment.Ordering a few items each, we were still shocked by our overwhelmed table and our equally overwhelmed bellies.  There was resounding enthusiasm for the giant meatball, our wide variety of salads and just about anything that was served with cheese.  I've had better arancini, but it was easy to look beyond that brief disappointment.We attempted to hold back and not order dessert, but after a night of great service including tolerance for our ever-changing reservation, our waitress brought out a round of profiteroles on the house to honor of our bride-to-be.  How could we say no to intensely flavored chocolate, vanilla and pistachio ice cream?  Certainly we needed to top things off with a round of espresso drinks before moving on with our evening.

I'm a fan!  Crazy busy place.  Make a reservation, although it might now do any good.  It's probably easier to try to squeeze in between someone else's.  It's a great place for groups, but it's loud and filled to the brim with action.  Not entertainment, just with servers, and patron's and food, and plates and food and food and food.  My goodness, there's always food on the table.They do serve entree's but the small plates are what has created such a buzz.  My favorite's that you must try are: veal braised meatball-don't share!  get your own!  The zucchini parmesan, is made with full, roasted garlic cloves and grated parmesan cheese.  The Insalata con Rucola is such a light and refreshing 'meal' after your 'taste' of the other small plates.  Two wonderful drinks are the white sangria and the Limoncella Frizzante.  Also, both are very light and refreshing!Every meal is served with fresh baked, white bread and olive oil.  Just in case you had a spare minute or moment of hunger, I suppose.

Casual restaurant perfect for a friend get together or casual family meal. Highly suggest the Sunday Supper-a 3course meal for under $16!  The sunday special features their famous meatballs. Awesome! I am not a huge pasta fan but the sauce and the fact that you can eat this spaghetti & meatball dish with a fork rather than twirling says something. The sauce is robust and the entire dish is more like a casserole than a plate of pasta. No room for dessert? No worries! Take that tiramisu home with you. It will be your best friend & wonderful reminder of the high caliber of food prepared by Marcella"s. Delicious!

We came into town late and hungry, and were looking for someplace that was open and looked appetizing.  As per a relative's recommendation, we made our way over to High Street and Marcella's was the first place that caught our eye.  Even though it was a Thursday night, a decent crowd suggested that the food was probably palatable.  And frankly, we were so tired and hungry we could have eaten cardboard.Surprisingly, however, Marcella's turned out to be a great find. Being from out of town, we went not expecting much, but came away with leftovers from an amazing meal:  veal braised meatball, pecorino fondue (not what it's called, but basically what it is), and capellini fra diavolo.  The meatball was gorgeous, as was the fondue, and the capellini was pretty good too. ;)The only glitch was that our waitress forgot about us for 30 min, and we had to flag down someone else to find her for us.  However, she totally made up for it by giving us an extra appetizer and our original appetizer for free!  Which made the extra wait worth it, especially since we wouldn't have had the meatball if she hadn't brought it over.Since we were there on a Thursday night, it was pretty quiet, and we got a table immediately.  It does seem like a pre-date or pre-night on the town place, since most of the people we saw in there were dressed to go out. Still, it seems like a college crowd primarily, and my brother and I were fine in our casual clothes.Definitely recommended if you're in town!

I have been here twice now, and I am somewhat torn in how I really feel about this place. My first visit was definitely a 5-star experience. Great food, service, atmosphere, etc. all around. I went with 4 girlfriends and we had an amazing dinner. It was so relaxing and cozy inside, the bread was warm and delicious, we split a bottle of wine (a "litro"), and we all left very happy with our entree choices. However, my second visit was not so great. It wasn't horrible by any means, but basically the glaring blemishes on the dinner were these: 1. We had a reservation. My boyfriend's parents were in town and he wanted to take them here since it was in the short north and we could walk around after eating and show them goodale park, jeni's, etc. So we made these reservations a week in advance. No problem, right? We even confirmed again the day before. All systems were go. Then we get there, even 10 minutes before our reservation, and they make us sit and wait. No big deal, we were early, so we figured we would wait a little while they got the table ready. No. We waited and waited and waited... after literally HALF AN HOUR of waiting (20 minutes PAST our reservation), my boyfriend and I asked them what was going on, and said we had a reservation at 6:30pm. They didn't apologize, and just said they would let us know when our table was ready because they were running behind and waiting for tables to open up. I'm sorry, but isn't that the POINT of a reservation?? So you DON'T wait for 45 minutes to be seated?2. After being seated and eating, etc. I got up to use the bathroom, and en route, slipped. I was wearing a dress and startled a nearby table. Apparently someone was mopping the hardwood floors or had spilled a drink or something, but it happened not once (victim being me), but TWICE throughout the night (another unidentified victim). I am going to assume they weren't mopping floors during dinner rush so I'll blame it on a spill. Come on, people. Clean up spills! Even if it's water - obviously people can still slip. How embarrassing.Apart from those, dinner was just ok. We were talked into an expensive bottle of red wine for the table which made us feel fancy, and my meal was good. My first visit I got the salmon, and the second visit I got the gnocchi bolognese. Loved both of them. I will say I think they changed the bread they serve before dinner though. And by change I mean downgraded. First visit was warm, fluffy, and a little herby. Second visit was bland, cold (yes, cold. Like from the refrigerator), and kind of hard.My boyfriend's mom got the veggie pizza and loved it. However, my boyfriend got the veal and was not impressed. Especially for the price. It looked sloppy and slathered in sauce to me, and he said it wasn't cooked that great either. His dad got the linguine and clams. It looked yummy, but he said it was waaay too garlic-y and he didn't even eat half of it. I felt bad that he didn't enjoy the meal. So maybe a third visit is in order? To be the deciding factor between one great visit and one underwhelmingly not-so-great visit. Stay tuned.
Went here after Ohayocon. The food was amazing. Service was great. Probably will be back next year.
Food is great but waited for a tavke while everyone else got one then the hostess gave attitude about losing our spot on the wait list.

I have only had excellent experiences here with the food. I love the gnocchi and the pasta pomodoro, the tiramisu is a must! If you are going for drinks I highly recommend the grapefruit basil martini, and the wine choices are great as well. Service can be a little iffy depending on when you go, if you are going on a friday or saturday MAKE RESERVATIONS! This place gets packed and it can definitely put a damper on the experience when you have to wait for an hour for a table. Take your time here, enjoy the atmosphere, the food, and the drinks, you may even forget you are in Columbus, Ohio.

This place had very good food.  I ordered the chicken parmigiana which was excellent.  Risotto and bolognese were good as well.  The bruschetta was heavenly and when we went (a Sunday night) bottles of wine were 25% off!  Definitely tough to beat.  This was my first dining experience in Columbus and it was not a disappointment!

I went with a big group of friends and waited for 45 mintues for table. Once we got to sit down, there wasn't anything that it is really capture my eyes on the menu, so I ended up having a pizza which I thought it's just OK. I just think people come and eat here because It's in the Short North
Great food and a fun atmosphere, we were intown visiting I would say from what we saw at least on weekends reservations are very helpful.
WOW!! Love this place!! Outstaning food, good service, great atmosphere, good prices. Definitely will be back.

pretty decent food all around. The appetizers that rock are the meatball and also the melted picorino cheese dip. More impressive was the customer service. One of our entrees was incorrect so they didn't charge us. Our food was brought out hot and our drinks were never empty.
Solid Italian place with good atmosphere and jumping on a Tuesday night. Good prices. Went based on Yelp reviews and was not disappointed.

My wife and I came here for the first time a while back, and then again when my friends were in from out of town for a birthday.  The service is excellent.  I like to base my reviews of service on how much the servers chat with us and whether my water glass sits empty for long periods of time.  The chit chat is always at a minimum, yet very friendly and even with the small water glasses, we never went thirsty.The food is great as well.  Our favorite is the cheese flatbread pizza appetizer with their veal meatball on it.  Just ask for the meatball on it.  It's very good.We will return again and again.

My company did our holiday lunch there for 88 people and everyone was VERY satisfied.  I was surprised that many people even fit in, but it's deceptively large - I never guessed how large it was from looking at the storefront.Waitstaff was great, very attentive, and kept the food coming.  Favorites for the table: the goat cheese ravioli, the Sicilian pizza, the veal meatball and sausage.  The chicken giardinera didn't go over so well.  Desserts are also excellent - the tiramisu isn't soggy and the blueberry sauce on the cheesecake is delish.We also visited on Valentine's Day.  It was very crowded (my boyfriend's chair was continuously bumped by the waitresses who, to be fair, were hustling to keep everyone happy) and there were surprisingly few couples and lots of groups.  Sangria was good, arancini was not (Pastaria Secondi at the North Market has better).  The service was pretty good and we were pleased even if it wasn't the romantic atmosphere we were hoping for.Definitely check it out, but you have to go with a group so you can excuse order lots of things and sampling everything.  It's very much worth it!

Nice area, good vibe, and friendly, attentive service. Wine list could be deeper based broader, incl Italian.  Got steered to a dodgy Amarone when I wanted to go Brunello, after they were out of Barolo ordered. Stiill, very pleasant experience. I'd go back.

Been here for dinner a few times (I have a condo right up the street).  It's always pretty packed but like Emily said this place is deceptively big.  Always been able to get in without a reservation.Prices are fantastic and portions are good.  Try the linguine with meatball (just one, but it's HUGE) for a taste treat.  I hope you like sharing because that's how the dishes are designed.VERY reasonable wine list.  Overall a fantastic dining experience in the heart of the Short North.

I really like this place.  I've been here for large parties (which I generally hate, but Marcella's handles them well), and also dinners for two.  I love their food and their wine selection.  We went on a Monday night and they had 25% off bottles of wine, so we had 4!  Just kidding.  But we did share a nice bottle of wine and enjoyed the meatball and carpaccio and then our entrees.  All was delicious and the server was really sweet and not hovering or annoying.  The tiramisu was delicious and the bathrooms were clean.  On the way out, I heard My Morning Jacket playing on the speakers.  Perfect!  Will definitely choose this place for dinner or drinks in the future.

I have been a fan of the Marcella's Short North location since it opened. A fun and interesting atmosphere is the perfect stop for an after work happy hour, catch up with friends or romantic dinner.Ill admit that I stick with what I like, so here is my usual menu (split between 2 people):Crostini appetizer with cheese apples and honey (unbelievable)Pizza (any kind will do!!)Pistachio Gelato (unbeatable)In conclusion, if you are looking for a night of good food, conversation and atmosphere, definitely make a trip to Marcellas!

Everyone in my circle just loves Marcella's. Prices are fair, portions large, and who doesn't love Italian food? What SUCKS hard here is it's always PACKED to the brim - like people falling out the open air windows kind of packed. No room to navigate between tables and chairs. Having a reservation at this place is completely useless because you will still end up waiting at least 20 minutes for your table, but more realistically you will wait 40 mins. So of course you have to try to maneuver your way to the bar and kill time. But you won't find anywhere to sit so have fun. Sure the open air window thing is great but wait until you're dining there on a first date and it's a bajillion degrees outside w/ 99% humidity. They NEVER shut the damn windows! They'll blast the AC but it still gets sucked out the windows as your makeup melts off your face. Not to mention the very large AC vents hang from the ceiling and if you know how condensation 101 works then you'll have little water drops randomly falling on you depending on where you are stationed. A friend of mine who is 50% Italian, speaks fluently and has been to Italy multiple times (which in my book makes him an authority on all things Italian), swears this is the most authentic Italian food in Columbus. I can't argue because I've never been to Italy. Just try to avoid this place on the weekends and super hot nights!! It's louder than most restaurants, so good luck conversing with your company.

So... we were just passing through Columbus on our way to St. Louis, MO for the holidays when we happened upon Marcella's completely randomly.  Thank goodness we did!  My husband and I like to consider ourselves beginner foodies and have frequented some of THE best restaurants in the DC/MD/VA area, and although Marcella's is not in the same league as places such as Komi, Inn at Little Washington, etc. (some of the top rated DC area restaurants) the value can't be beat!  Our waiter was very knowlegeable and we ordered everything he recommended and loved it all.  We started with the pecorino cheese and veal meatball appetizers.  Both were delicious!  We then moved on to a caesar salad and the Sicilian pizza.  The total for the night was less than $50 and we also had wine!  You can't beat that!  We are thinking of making this trip an annual trip to MO and would definitely make it a point to stop in Columbus to go back to Marcella's!
Lived up to all the hype, all the expectation. A terrific meal, terrific service. Had the meatball for an appetizer, the risotto (as a side dish), gnocchi and chicken piccata. All great.

Staff is very accomodating. The music is great. The overall vibe is high energy. The food was fantastic and Brandon the waiter is HOT. being a Dallas foodie, one gets jaded but Marcellas rocks and can teach Dallas a thing or two. Went last night and I want to return tonight- answer the damn phone! LOL! Congrats, you had me at the olives and sealed it with profiteroles.

Marcella's Short North: decibel level was ABSURD, we literally could not talk to anyone except the person immediately next to us and then it was a matter of leaning over and shouting in their ear. I am not exaggerating. Noisiest restaurant I've ever been in. I would have turned around at the door if the restaurant hadn't been the choice of someone I barely knew -- who, it turned out, had also never eaten there but only gotten carry out. The food was inconsistent -- caprese salad was excellent, gnocchi was mushy, teens liked the pizza and fried risotto, potato dumplings in the soup were doughy, tomato sauce was oversweet -- and definitely nothing to make it worth it to deal with the noise.

Was in Columbus OH for biz and me and a couple of co workers decided to stop in to have dinner. I have to say the decor was very nice and atmosphere very romantic a good place to bring that special some one. The service was good. Our server was very attentive and the food was not bad. The bill wasn't bad either. The only one issue was that I was billed twice. The next day I was checking my account and saw two charges. I called Marcella's and spoke to the manager Dennis. He was very nice and resolved the issue very quickly and on top of that sent me a $25 gift card. All I have to say is WOW that is excellent customer service.

I found Marcella's to be surprisingly authentic.  By authentic, all I mean is that I spent a summer in Florence once, and eating here reminded me of food there.  Really tasty dishes, decent wine list, great prices.  One of my favorite Italian spots in Columbus.
Bright and buzzing spot. The food is well executed. But somehow it doesn't make one feel like an insider like most good Columbus places do.

Being stupid college students, my friends and I took a very large group-about 10 people- to Marcella's on a gallery hop night.  Although we made a reservation, we of course had to wait.  The restaurant just isn't made to accommodate ten person parties.  After we sat down, however, the experience was absolutely incredible.  The restaurant is nice yet affordable, especially if you want to split plates, which they don't mind at all.  I think the most any member of our group spent was about $23, and he got an appetizer, full plate, and dessert.  I had the  ravioli mezzaluna, prepared vegetarian, after seeing positive reviews about it on yelp.  Despite the size of our group, the plate arrived quickly and steaming.  Unfortunately, they didn't make it vegetarian, but it was replaced even more quickly and taken off our bill, and it was absolutely outstanding once we dug in.  All the desserts our group got and shared were phenomenal as well, and so was the cheese platter I split with a few friends.  Definitely, definitely recommended, and I will absolutely be back, albeit with a smaller group.

I have been to Marcella's twice now and each time has been excellent. Having traveled to Italy, I can say that this is the closest thing to "authentic" Italian food that I've had in the city. I especially like the mismatched plates and dishtowels as napkins. It's a very lively atmosphere, so you'll need to speak up a bit to converse with the other people at your table. I've had the spaghetti and the pizza, both of which were well prepared and heavy on the garlic (the way I like it). The wine list is extensive and the markup isn't terrible. Really you can't go wrong with this place.

WARNING: If you are claustrophobic and are expecting Chicken Alfredo you may want to go to Olive Garden across the street. This review is for the new location on Polaris Pkwy (the old Martini's). Marcella's is a cool concept and I realize people have complained about the portion sizes but it's a tapas restaurant. Everything is meant to be shared (AKA take 1 or 2 bites as it's passed around). You're supposed to sample a few different items and slowly get filled up as time passes. The music and fast pace create a social atmosphere in my mind. It is not good for families at night in my opinion especially ones with small kids. Tables are close together but not nearly as close together as the ones on High Street. Great drinks, maybe a little pricey but it's all top shelf liquor. Overall, a solid restaurant and every person I have taken there has absolutely loved the food so I thikn that says a lot.NOTE: Outdoor seating is available at the Polaris Pkwy location.

First time in Columbus, OH and I was only there for the Arnold Classic. Just before going to the Figure, Bikini, and female Bodybuilding show we stopped in to Marcells's for some food. The menu was interesting but nothing really stood out to us given our time contraint. Just before placing out order we said to Julia (waitress) that we were in a rush. She said that she understands. An eternity passed before we got our food, but Julie was sooo sweet I felt really bad. It was totally out of her control as a large order was placed right before ours. She gave us a gift card and comped out meal that night for the inconvenience. We decided to go back there again the follow day for lunch to use our GC. We were fortunate enough to have Julia as our waitress again. She was very nice, and very attentive. Overall the experience was awesome. The pizza was delicious, the ambience was fun and the music was great. I won't be in Columbus again until next year for the same show, but I'll be sure to go to Marcella's when I do.

Marcellas is a fun little tapas restaurant concept.  I see a lot of people dogging on it in here over some prices and some service issues, and those are reasonable gripes.  But the key to having a fun experience in a place like this is to know that it is a food-in-the-middle-of-the-table kind of place.  Picky eaters beware, you may have to try something new.  We always order a bunch of stuff we want to try first and call that an appetizer.  Everything comes out on wooden planks and goes on a rack on the table and is real easy to just pass around.  Whatever we haven't gotten yet that still sounds good gets called the main course.  And as for desert, I recommend the Manhattan on the bottom right hand corner of the drink menu.

Marcella's is worth trying if you want to eat in the Short North.While everything was good it didn't make us jump out of our seats.  I was a little disappointed that the Veal was not accompanied with anything.  Plus charging $18 for breaded veal with marinara on top is ridiculous, I could have made the same dish at home for around $5.The entree portions aren't that large, not for sharing unless you're starting with a couple hot/cold plates (which all looked good  passing by our table).Our server was excellent and the entire staff was friendly.We had made a reservation and we're seated immediately regardless of the wait, I was really impressed and thankful for this.I could see myself returning here if girlfriends wanted to hop around the short north and start with tapas.  But if my goal was to enjoy delicious Italian food I would go to Romanos Macaroni Grill in Dublin which is much more flavorful and reasonably priced for portion size.

Food is good, if a little overpriced.  I'm giving it 3 stars because of service.  I felt a little like we were putting the wait staff out, and they kept bringing us the wrong things.  Plus, there were 9 of us, the bill was $400 and they didn't even ask us if we wanted them to split it up.  Thanks for nothing.  I will concede that the Tiramasu is the best I've ever had and it's worth going there just for that.

Small plates/tapas style restaurant and one of the newest Cameron Mitchell restaurant offerings. Hip, contemporary and decent food (depending on what you get). Very popular restaurant. All menu items are meant to be shared so try a variety of items. Lasagna was subpar but other offerings were better.

We love this restaurant. This is my husband's and my favorite date restaurant. Definitely loud and boisterous, but you feel like you are where it is at. I love the atmosphere and the food is delicious. We always get the zucchini chips, parmesean crusted onions, risotto balls for appetizers...And then for dinner we usually share a dish. Some of our favorite main dishes are the fettuccini and amazing meatball, Chicken gardaneria (or something like that), the goat cheese ravoili is so good and the chilcken parmesean is probably the best chicken parm I have ever had. If you can save room for dessert. I think Marcella's has the best desserts in the short north. The profiteroles are amazing, the cherry cobbler so good...good selection. We love coming here and starting with a cocktail and then picking a wine. It is always one of our first choice of restaurants...and when we choose not to come here it is becuase we had just been there recently. I have also attended a bachelorette party here which worked perfect and brought my mom and dad here when they were in town. Always a hit!...

We visited the Polaris location for a late weekday lunch.  I really wanted to give this place four stars but the food didn't quite make it.  Decor and service were both very nice.  We started with glasses of wine.  They have a good selection.  A few are reasonably priced.  It seemed that 1/2 to 3/4 of the list was overpriced.  To start we had the Caponata, which was excellent, and the zucchini "small plates.  I think they tried to do a zucchini "potato chip".  It didn't work.  The zucchini was limp and dry.  Next we ordered Lasagna alla Bolognese.  What a disappointment.  The Bolognese tested like ground beef and nothing else.  I noticed they also had a lamb bolognese.  I asked if I could get fettucini with the lamb bolognese (not on the menu).  No problem.  The lamb bolognese was excellent.  The fettucini was a little over cooked but the real problem I had was with the portion size.  It was small.  This was listed under "pasta" not "small plates" so I expected more.  The lasagna was a normal sized portion.  I ordered a decaf espresso.  They were out of decaf.  We will probably go back to this place but will be more careful what we order next time.  I compared the lunch and dinner menus online. They look identical except the prices are higher for dinner.  I wonder if the portions are any larger for dinner?

My first great culinary experience in Columbus!  I kept hearing about how Columbus is a great food town, but Marcella's is the first place where I can see how the city got such a reputation.  I had the lamb shank with white bean ragu - fantastic!  Staff was helpful in pairing wine.  We made a reservation - which is a must - and still waited a few minutes for a table in the bar.  This and the bar atmosphere are what keep me from giving 5 stars, but the food is excellent.

Marcella's is, of course, famous for the meatball. You can get it as an appetizer with marinara sauce, or it comes on some of the pasta dishes. And you can add it to any entree for $5!At lunchtime Marcella's has a really great burger. It might seem strange to order a burger here, but it was an excellent choice! I was actually disappointed when I went for dinner once and found out the burger is only on the lunch menu. I love the crispy potato pizza! It took a while, but I finally discovered that their alfredo sauce is made with a kick. I had tried the fettuccine and meatball which comes with both marinara and alfredo sauces. I thought the marinara had a kick, so the next time I ordered a tortellini alfredo. Boom. Alfredo has a kick, so now I avoid it. It was unexpected!On our most recent visit the food took a little long to come out, and Marcella's made sure we were well taken care of and left happy. We could tell that service is really important to them.Be sure to visit the restrooms for some mouthwash and other fancy offerings.

Always a lovely place to go for GREAT happy hour prices. It's in the middle of Polaris Parkway and near a lot of shops, so if you're hungry from shopping...stop by and grab some cheap cocktails and delicious appetizers.I've tried all of their cocktail drinks and my favorite is probably the Whisky Rosso. There's a kick to it but at the same time it's got a sweet aftertaste. The strawberry balsamic martini is one of the other favorites on the cocktail list.Their calamari is always my go to dish to order, along with the meatballs! Absolutely tasty and packs a great flavor. The portion for the cheese bread is plentiful, I feel like I always order way too much food. Simply because it's hard to resist not taking a bite out of all their appetizers.Seating is always easy for me, but if you have a big party - makes sure to get there early to get a table for your party. They can easily accommodate your requests. The staff is always very quick and friendly.

"I'd really rather just never go back there again." - what I said to my husband as soon as we walked through the doors.Giving this place 2 stars because it was edible and it was kinda sorta like they tried to make the meals look appetizing. We went in at 8 pm last night because we were hungry, in no mood to cook when we got home, and wanted to try somewhere different. I was in the mood for Italian. They weren't busy, maybe 4 other tables in the main area were seated and 2 at the bar. Our waitress was friendly enough, and knowledgeable about the menu, so that helps when it's your first time somewhere. My husband ordered the fettuccine and meatball and I ordered the Chicken Piccata (it's what I almost always order when it's on a menu, I can't help it...I see that and it's tunnel vision from there). I also ordered a glass of the house Pinot Grigio since the entrees didn't come with a salad or soup, so I figured I could enjoy that while we waited.Well, after 10-15 mins, our waitress came back to fill our water glasses and I told her to forget the wine and she said "oh you don't want it anymore?" and I just stated "I didn't realize it would take this long to pour a glass of wine..." Again...they weren't busy. I don't know if she forgot or what but either way, I didn't want to have to crush it while eating my meal. She did bring us olive oil and bread. Three slices of bread. Nothing special about either of those and the three slices for two people was an interesting touch. Our meals came out shortly after I told her I didn't want the wine. It all LOOKED good. The bone in my chicken was an unusual surprise. It also wasn't cooked like I was used to seeing, not saying it was a bad thing, because it wasn't dried out, but it also didn't have much flavor. It wasn't breaded or pan fried, which is what I was expecting. Husband ordered the popular fettuccine and meatball and was a little surprised when it was super soft inside and red (looked and tasted not cooked). Our waitress did have a good explanation for that - apparently the meat is braised for a day before hand and it's a blend of pork and veal. He felt okay eating it after that, but when you're not expecting that, it'll put a halt in your eating. For the price, I feel like we should've just gone to Olive Garden and we would've both enjoyed our meals much more. So that combined with slow service and not super good tasting food, we won't be back.

We came here in the evening for dinner, and waited about an hour to be seated. This was a Valentine's Dinner date. We thought we were smart going the Friday before Valentine's Day, but everyone else had the same idea!Our server was very attentive, and kept our drinks filled.  Our order was taken, and the food was brought out in a timely manner.The food here is excellent. It's always so tasty and perfectly seasoned.  The meatball is always worth getting.I got the Fettuccine & Meatball Torn Bread Crumb, Alfredo, Tomato Marinara.  If you get just 1 meal here, I highly recommend this meal. It's so good. We also did a lunch another time, so I'll add comments about our lunch visit as well.We had the Crispy Potato Pizza (Pancetta, Parmesan Onions, Taleggio Cheese, Arugula) and the Marcella's Bistecca Burger (Rosemary Focaccia, Parmesan Onion, Roasted Tomato, Lettuce).The crispy potato pizza is so delicious: we get this frequently. Also the Bistecca Burger was such a great burger. It was a very classy top notch burger that was super fancy and very tasty. The fries it came with were perfectly seasoned and wonderful.

Happened to be In the Polaris area and going against my better judgment decided to give this place a try. A read a review about being a glorified Olive Garden and I think is about right. The Italian is BASIC... not much taste, oily and disappointing. Service was good in a Sunday but for all the advertising they do about being Italian they fall way short.... which is a shame since it is not a complicated cuisine! Stay away from any risotto and ravioli .we are not coming back

I cannot take this place serious if my Pinot Noir that I selected is served in a vessel such as this. If this is normal than they should only offer one red and one white wine.Disappointed before the food even hit the table.Update: yes, the food was no better. There are many other establishments that do it much better for the price. The food, the wine and the tacky music (Wang Chung was playing) made this my most disappointing dining experience in years.Perhaps Happy Hour in the bar might be ok but I'd rather dine elsewhere.

I would like to recognize the Polaris Marcella's staff for a night that we will never forget! We were coming in town from California and wanted to get all of our families together to celebrate the holidays and for some to meet for the first time. Our party size changed quite a few times but the staff at Marcella's still went above and beyond to accommodate us. We had two servers (I wish I could remember their names!) that were more than gracious to help us rearrange the tables to get all 17 of us around the same table. They provided the best service I have ever had especially for a large, needy, hungry party of 17! The food was outstanding and the manager came in to check on us as well. We were finished with dinner and my now- fiancÌ©, pulled out my beautiful ring and popped the question! The staff nor anyone in the room knew he would propose then. However, they girls were very polite and shut the curtain to let us socialize afterwards. It was the perfect evening and I can't thank everyone at the Polaris Marcella's enough! If you can please recognize and give those two girls a big milkshake it would be greatly appreciated!!!

Been traveling to Columbus Ohio for 3 years now and can't believe I just discovered this place. I wouldn't say I was wow'd but pretty close. The ambience was amazing. They have both in door and outdoor seating. We wanted to enjoy the summer breeze so we sat outside. The place had a great feel to it. Comfortable quiet seating. The service was pretty prompt too. We were a group of 5 and I don't think anyone of us had any complaints. The food was great...Garlic Bruschetta's...were scrumptious.. literally melted in my mouth..savored every bite. We also tried Calamari and loved it. Everything we ordered was so good. I don't think you can go wrong with anything you order on the menu here. Loved it. Definitely going back. Can't wait to try more....

Yummy place for a family dinner. Our four year old loves dipping their bread into olive oil. I'm a fan of their kids menu options, and LOVE their red wine sangria.I'm pretty sure Marcella's has the best meatball ever. I usually stick with the fettuccine alfredo with meatball. It's seriously delicious. We also like to come for a happy hour with friends. Please note that HH is only in the bar area and they fill up quickly, so if you want to snag a table get here as early as you can. The pizzas are good and I've also enjoyed my tastes of the picatta and the braised beef cannelloni.The only thing keeping this place from being a 5 star review is the bread they serve is just not great (it's cold, and usually dry - I expect more from a CM restaurant) and I think the price point can be a bit too high for some of the menu items - maybe I'm just cheap, but $17 for a plate of spaghetti that doesn't come with a salad or anything else seems a bit high to me?
Amazing food and service!!!  We had Ian as our server he went above and beyond to make our experience amazing. We went to the Polaris location l highly recommend trying it.
Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm :). And it's really good.  Use to be more like a tapas Italian but still great food. Best meatball ever.

Waitress was lovelyWhen the server gives you bread make sure you ask for some spices in your olive oil and add a little balsamic vinegar.The food was good but not amazing. It's like the taste and quality was right there but it wasn't enough?

We love Marcella's and have had a lot of fun memories at both locations. Highlights: shrimp pesto pizza, the lamb sauce on the gnocchi, linguini and clams, one of the few places to get arancini, great sangria and minestrone soup.

My husband and I decided to eat here because they had a gluten-free menu. We got there for lunch and we're seated immediately.Our waiter brought out the bread and olive oil for me but what was even a nicer treat was the gluten free bread for my husband!I had the lunch combo with a 1/2 cheese pizza and apple salad. The salad was delicious with grapes, apple slices, candied nuts, Gorgonzola cheese and vinegrette. The pizza had 4 types of cheese on it. My husband had gluten-free penne with chicken and said it was very good. Our waiter was a bit slow with drink refills but other than that, it was a good meal.

I had lunch with a coworker. We had a really nice experience.   Our server was very personable, attentive and helpful.   The have a great outdoor patio when the weather is nice.  I was a little leery that there would be a lot of noise from Polaris traffic, but it wasn't distracting.  I saw the servers bringing out a number of different salads and dishes from the kitchen for others, but the Ravioli Mezzaluna caught my eye.   For $13.79, the lunch entree is ravioli with goat cheese, cabbage, italian bacon and mushroom with a light mushroom sauce.  They bring a serving of the house bread to the table as well.  Prices are a little more than I would normally spend at lunch, but my meal was definitely fresh and tasty.  Definitely worth the experience and quality!

Where to start...my boss took us out to dinner and chose here. New to the area so didn't know what to expect. The meatball was delicious! Very large and very flavorful. The stuffed mushrooms and prosciutto and melon were plentiful and very good. We all got the pasta "your way" and it didn't disappoint. Service was decent and the wait time was within ten minutes of what they said. Only rating it a 4 stars as nothing really stuck out to me other than that meatball!
Great dinners and desserts with our team. Marcella's is fantastic. A gem in Polaris and the service was exceptional. Thanks Nick, you made us all feel at home

I was pretty excited to come here for lunch, a lot of my friends recommended it and always raved about it so I decided to come. Service was awesome, attention was awesome but what really fell short was the actual meal. It wasn't really busy so I didn't understand what the issue was in terms of being attentive to the cooking. The noodles were pretty mush and not even close to being properly cooked.

Waiter was not very informed on wine which in itself isn't unforgivable but the acoustics in the dining room was eardrum ahattering. This is the first time I sat in the middle of the room. If ur going to eat here ask for a seat along the wall. We skipped an appetizer to get out sooner. Mighta help if they turned off the piped music.

This is one of the best places to come for Happy Hour. They offer half off appetizers, select sandwiches, and flatbreads as well as drink specials. The food quality is excellent and I've never had a bad meal head. I would recommend the Chicken Parm sandwich. It comes with fries and it's very filling! They have two locations, one in Polaris and one downtown.

Delicious food, a great patio, and smiling faces all around ready to serve you. I love this place! Definitely a restaurant to try out. A family style restaurant with huge portions and lots of options for people seeking a hearty meal. However there are also lighter meals as well! Wednesday you can get bottles of wine at half off, and yes, wine is served with tumbler glasses because it is actually the traditional way in Italy to serve wine. They are always having great chef features throughout the week and weekend. Give it a try, it's well worth it!

My husband and I ate her for lunch.  I ordered tomato soup which tasted just like Campbell's tomato soup made with milk.  I also ordered the Parma Panini.  The Panini was good.  The spinach and roasted tomato in the Panini were fresh.  The fries were just fries.  Overall the food was okay.  Nothing spectacular. The dining room has wood floors.  It was loud as sound bounced around.  The restaurant and restrooms were clean.Our server, Kim, was very attentive.   Good service.
Came here for dinner on .Wednesday, quite compacted. Both inside and patio outside are nice. Ordered Linguine Clam , a pinch of  sausage and spicy, special and taste good.

Came here with my friend after shopping at Polaris mall.We ordered the olives as an appetizer and I had the Sunday salad as my entree.  I love the meatball in the salad, it's what I get every time! Will be back for sure!

Wow!  Was amazed how they took care of us tonight. Food was great, but came out spotty.  The restaurant took care of the whole bill to our surprise.  Wonderful way to take care of the customer.  Will definitely be back as the food tasted great and the ambiance was great for a Saturday night!
Overall a good experience. I had the veal meatball panini and fries...very tasty. My daughter had a pizza which we both liked. Generous portions, good service and decent atmosphere for a fair price.

Hello Happy Hour! 4-630 pm in the bar area; it's not that big might I add. Come prepared to wait or come early.  $18 sangria carafes, red and white. $5 cocktails and 1/2 off appetizers and pizzas. Every working professional was here cramped in a small area going to town on delious bites and drinks.  I wished the restaurant allowed happy hour in the main dining room. I ordered the Primitivo red sangria that was cabernet sauvignon, brandy, soda, strawberries and some other awesomeness that I can't remember.  Ha. That good, I promise.  My girlfriend and I ordered the Calamari. Very, very salty so be prepared.  Good size portion for the price.  Mixed in with the calamari was thinly sliced zucchini and slivers of fried garlic. Wow,  those were a nice surprise and very good! Overall,  a good experience that I will certainly come back to and will update my review.

We just held my sister's baby shower here in the party room that they have and I can't wait to come back to try more of their menu. The manager Nick was extremely professional and easy to work with. The space says it fits 30 people and we had around 28 and it was a tight squeeze. The room itself is really cute and nicely organized and decorated. For the shower, we had about eight different kinds of pizzas and I think they were a hit. The shrimp pesto pizza and the potato pizza were some of my favorites. The server also did a great job on our party. Again, I can't wait to go back on my next trip to Ohio and try some of the appetizers and entrees that they have on their menu.

Went here for Mother's Day. We made a 7:30pm reservation and we were seated promptly. Our server was nice but seemed flustered. After talking with him a bit, he let us know that he had been there since early that morning. I can understand now why he seemed a bit off his game. Overall though, the service wasn't bad. He was a nice kid. We started with the Meatball app and it was very good. I like my meatballs more seared...the ones here are very soft. But it was still tasty. For my entrÌ©e I ordered the Braised Beef Cannelloni. Not a good choice. This dish was RICH. It was smothered in sauce and cheese. Now I'm not one to complain about cheese...I love cheese. But this was just way too much. The cannelloni's were filled with beef. There was hardly any ricotta in them. This dish was just way too rich. I had a few bites and that was all I could handle. I think I just made the wrong decision ordering this dish. My bfriend had the carbonara and I sampled it. That was really good! Overall, not a terrible experience, but I know better next time to change my order.

I come to Marcella's a lot and I have to say, I think the one at Polaris is a lot better than the one in Short North for these reasons: the restaurant itself is bigger so less wait time (even on a Saturday night), lots of parking available, and it's not as loud (I can barely hear people at the one in Short North). I learned tonight that this Marcella's has happy hour in the bar/lounge area from 4-6:30pm! You can get pizzas, small plates, and some other food items half off and there's also deals on drinks. My fiancÌ© and I split a pepperoni pizza, calamari appetizer, and house salad for less than $25, which is great for a restaurant like this that can rack up a large bill. We were pleased :)I'm only giving 4 stars since Marcella's can be a bit pricey. That's what happy hour is for I guess!
Most amazing spaghetti I have ever eaten. Portions were perfect. Bread was great, as well! Priced reasonably!

I finally ate at Marcella's last weekend, and overall I would say the food was definitely a step above an Olive Garden/mega chain restaurant but not quite the super authentic Italian experience I was going for. We started with the arancini (fried risotto balls) - amazing! So cheesy on the inside and nice and firm so they held up well for dipping into the marinara sauce that comes with it. For our meals, I ordered the chicken parmesan -- pretty tasty, but missing some Italian zest. The only real flavor was cheese, so I guess I was just wanting more herbs and spices in the dish. My husband ordered the meatball with alfredo pasta, and though he loved the pasta he definitely did not care for the jello-like meatball. We've had some moist Italian meatballs before, but this giant meatball was just TOO moist for us! In my mouth it just didn't resemble meat because of the super-soft texture, which is what my husband didn't care for either. The meatball also didn't have any flavor besides the sauce on the outside, so again missing some "zest". Overall, I was satisfied with most of our food and would love to go back and try totally different things -- the entire menu sounded great to me!

Dined in on a weekday afternoon. Absolutely no wait and waiter was quick to greet us. He advised us that they'd essentially cook anything to order. I decided on something that wasn't even on the menu and he said it would be no problem - sure enough gen minutes later I get my food and it was exactly what I wanted and perfectly cooked. The waiter was very quick to get us water when we ran out and we had a great time. Would definitely revisit!!

CHICKEN APRICOT FLATBREAD PIZZA. I've been dreaming of this flatbread since I had it almost a month ago. Soooo delicious... the perfect combination of savory, sweet, rich, salty, etc, etc. and the perfect thing to wash it down with is a Stella on draft  yummmmmm

Just went here for the first time. SOOOO GOOD! Pricey but you get that anywhere these days. My son is picky but he killed his and my food. The waitress was amazing and so kind and so tending when my 17 month old was throwing a fit, trying to find something he'd like to eat. For sure recommend. It would def be five stars if the pricing was better!

Food was so so.  My lasagna was sub par and wasn't even heated well through which made me feel like it was something made yesterday and reheated.  Have been to the downtown location and been far more impressed.

The food was good, but it was pricey.  My philosophy is that if the bill is going to blow me away, the food better do it too.  Unfortunately, Marcella's didn't quite cut it.  That said, I could see myself returning on occasion if I was really in the mood for spending money and eating decent Italian.

Update November 2015Not sure why this gets less stars than downtown - the food is excellent and the service really good. Last time there I got my usual (Fettuccine Alfredo with the Giant Meatball) and the manager came up after. We spoke and I expressed my love for this meal. To my surprise the manager comes out with all three components and the recipe! Now I can try to make this at home - I cannot expect to equal it but to share your recipe with a patron is really out of the norm. Always well prepared food. Always good service. Always a fast meal (it doesn't take 2 hours to eat because service is so slow). I continue to come here and consider it my favorite restaurant in Columbus, Ohio.From July 2015Listen to my story. I love their Fettuccine and Meatball; it is one of my favorite meals EVER. I wad headed back to Chicago and wanted this meal before I left. We arrived at 11:30 AM on Sunday to find they opened at noon. We felt we could wait of our meal was ready at noon. I called ahead and asked if we could order now for Dining in. They say it would be ready shortly after we arrived. When we arrived at the restaurant a few minutes early we were quickly seated and our meal brought to us. The quality was impeccable and the service attentive and swift. I got my meal and was out the door in less than 20 minutes and I am HAPPY. Love this place!

3.5 stars. Marcella's is a nice place. Our service was very good.We started with an order of Arancini (Fried Risotto, Mozzarella and Marinara). I've only had Arancini one other time and it wasn't very good. This Arancini was really good. Danielle ordered the "Make Your Own Pasta" - penne w/ tomato cream sauce and a meatball (because i wanted to try the meatball). she's not always a fan of tomato sauce which is why she got the tomato cream sauce. she liked the sauce and even said that she may not have needed the cream. She didn't think i was going to like the meatball because it was so tender but i loved it. The reason she got the meatball was because the meatballs are a half pound each and they charge $9 for a meatball as an appetizer but only $4 to add it to the pasta creation dinner. Needless to say, i did love the meatball. It was very tender but it was also delicious.For my dinner I just got the ol' standby - Penne Alla Vodka. It was good but I've had better. I did like the sliced mushrooms in the sauce. They were great.If we lived in the area we'd very likely go back.

Great happy hour!!!  My friends and I shared a pitcher of the red sangria and stuffed mushrooms, arancini, zucchini, potato pizza and mushroom pizza.  It was the right amount of food for four people and we were pleasantly full.  I loved everything and am looking forward to trying more pizzas and cannot wait to order the arancini and stuffed mushrooms again.  The zucchini app was more like zuchini chips sliced quite thin and a little oily for my taste but loved everything else.  We spent about 12$ each total, quite a steal!

I love Marcella's! The food is delicious and the service is excellent. The atmosphere is nice but still casual. We have come here on special occasions like our anniversary, and we also bring our baby for family dinners as well. It's a great restaurant!

I was told by some colleagues this is the best Italian in Columbus. I sat at the bar as an "out of towner" on a week night for a work trip. The happy hour is great with an impressive drink menu, I had two cocktails, both were refreshing. I decided on the build your own spaghetti and had the bolognese sauce with a meatball on top. The meatball was awesome, and enormous. It was pretty packed at the bar but the service was excellent and I will return if ever the opportunity.

I will start out by saying that the service was top notch. Had a pleasurable evening of great wine and food with a friend. Although, afterwards we both became very very ill throughout the night and into the morning. I called the manager to bring it to their attention and they simply thanked me for bringing it to their attention. Did nothing to entice me to return. I was disappointed with the response.

Marcella's is a Columbus classic, and while I don't love the menu at the Polaris location as much as I do for the one in the Short North. That being said, both locations have an AWESOME happy hour, possibly my favorite in Columbus. Most of their beer/wine/cocktails are $5 and under, and a ton of food options are half off as well. No $5 bar food pretzel sticks and/or gross cheesy chips here! All of their pizzas are amazing, and they are only $5-$8 at happy hour and it is a decent amount of food. Outside of happy hour, the food is still fairly priced at about $15 per entree. They have a variety of Italian entrees including pastas, risotto, chicken and seafood dishes. I have enjoyed every dish I've tried, but my personal favorite is any of their risottos (they often have a dinner special with risotto). It is authentic, filling, and delicious!I'm not giving 5 stars just because this place, like all restaurants at Polaris, gets crazy busy and there is often a wait for a table and a pretty significant wait for food. This is fine if you're on a date/having a work meeting over dinner, but if you're looking for a quick bite to eat, this is not your place.

Arrived yesterday afternoon at 1:00 p.m. and were seated immediately.  It was a beautiful day, so we decided on dining on the front outside patio facing Polaris Parkway.  Fresh bread was brought to the table within five minutes, with extra virgin olive oil poured on an accompanying plate.  The bread was very good, but we recently had this same free appetizer at Romano's Macaroni Grill and in their version they grate fresh black pepper in the olive oil - this makes all the difference in the world.  My wife orders the 1/2 a mushroom pizza and a chopped salad, and I opt for the four cheese pizza.  My wife's food comes out, and we were immediately impressed by the presentation.  The chopped salad was very good, but my wife missed the note about the salad having Gorgonzola cheese which she hates (her mistake).  Her pizza is absolutely amazing with her commenting that this pizza had the best mushrooms she had ever eaten on a pizza.  My pizza was equally as good.  The sauce and crust were obviously homemade, and were near perfection.  The homemade mozzarella cheese slices were very creamy and just pushed this pizza over the edge.  Read my other reviews - I am a pizza fanatic (lunatic) and this was one of the best pizzas I've had - period.  Very impressed.  Our waitress, a young lady with dark hair (name withheld), was not very good.  I've had much worse waitresses, but she really didn't seem to care much about taking care of us, or answering questions.  I got the impression that I was bothering her with my questions (I had never been to Marcella's before - give me a break).  She also managed to charge my wife for two meals, an then blamed it on a computer glitch.  The other young lady who was working the patio really had her act together, and hopefully next visit we will be lucky enough to have her as our server.  Can't wait to visit again.  We are already craving that pizza.
I had the Gnocchi Bolognese and it was delicious and a very generous portion. The girlfriend gets the Spaghetti Carbonara every time and she raves about it each time.
Seven of us had dinner Sunday 3-5-17 (my first time). Great Food ,good service,fair price! Looking forward to Lunch sometime.

Yes, yes, yes. I approve.Day one - I come here for happy hour with a girlfriend of mine. We had other dinner plans so I didn't get to eat (other than an appetizer) but the menu looked so good....I decided to con the hubby into coming with me the next day. (Ps. He isn't too keen on Italian.)Day two - I get my way. It was yum, yum. Prosciutto and melon - omg yes. Seafood Risotto - mmmmhuh. Salmon - oh yea. Chicken Parm. All very good. Plenty of wine and drinks. Tirimisu was also delish.I will be back -

Marcella's is a very solid choice for italian in Columbus. You might be able to find better, but the combination of quality for the price point is definitely in favor of the patron.We started with the veal meatball appetizer which... is one massive meatball. Covered in sauce, and falling apart. Yum. I always say the most basic things an Italian restaurant should deliver is 1) from-scratch pasta (it's not that hard, and if it's 60% of your menu, do it); and even more importantly, 2) a home run red sauce. Marcella's does #2 very well, I was dipping bread, whatever I could find in that sauce. #1 I'm not convinced it's homemade... but it was not obvious that it wasn't. I had the gnocchi and the generous shreds of lamb in the sauce made it a satisfying meal like only meat can do. The gnocchi themselves had a good taste and texture, I honestly wasn't sure if they were homemade or not. If not, they have a good supplier as they weren't tough and chewy.

Went for lunch after Ikea adventure. Never heard of the place. Absolutely terrific. Just had lunch pasta and salad. I had linguine with clams and pancetta. One of the best I ever had. Wonderful flavor. My wife had penne arrabiatta. Said her sauce was some of the best she ever had. All is freshly made and it shows. Makes the chains look just very average. Very good service. Have to find a reason to come back to Columbus. On top of everything, price is reasonable.

Get the meatball appetizer. Served in a small cast iron pot, it melts in your mouth...and the sauce is fantastic. I highly recommend the arrabiata, carbonara, or the chicken parm. Servings are quite generous and reasonably priced. Can be a bit on the slow side when busy, but the food has always been fantastic.
We went there for a birthday celebration and the Waiter and the food we great. Ask for suggestions because the suggestions we received were spot on.

The service was fantastic! Scott was our server. The food was amazing! I would definitely go back to this restaurant!!!  The four cheese tortellini with chicken was the best that I have ever tasted.I would definitely recommend this place. Prices run about $15.00 per entrÌ©e but well worth the price because everything is made fresh!

Great happy hour. Really tasty food.Food - You have got to try the Gnocchi and Sicilian Pizza. The gnocchi were perfectly made. The lamb bologenese on top of the gnocchi had the perfect amount of meat, sauce, spices. We also tried the Fettuccine Alfredo with meatball. The meatball itself is like 3/4th a pound!Drinks - Like all Cameron Mitchell Restaurants, they only allow happy hour in the bar area. The bar area is way too small for how busy it gets. The bar stools are first come, first serve, but if you want a table you need to put your name in the waitlist at the front desk. On a Thursday just before 5, the waittime was at 45 minutes.. Once you actually get a table the happy hour is pretty good. They make the drinks strong. The noise level in the bar area is SO LOUD though. We were yelling to hear each other.I'm giving 5 stars for the food. The food was really good. Probably one of the best italian restaurants I've been too. The hassle & noise in the bar area are not considered in my rating. If they were, I'd give this place a 3.

Terrible terrible service! We were practically ignored the entire time. Not to mention when we ordered bruchetta it came out as fluffy garlic bread with dipping sauce. We were sure they made a mistake, but upon asking that was the "bruchetta." I paid 12 bucks and got the half pannini and the side salad (which was just iceberg lettuce). Don't come here unless you want inaccurate low quality "Italian food." Should have just went to Piada, or maybe eaten out a public trash can; would have tested better than the clown food they served me.

We drive through Columbus frequently to visit family amd most of the reviews were good. We were disappointed by the food. Service and ambiance was great...but as explained by the waitress this location is 'American Italian' whereas the other location is more italian. I wish we had gone to the other one. We had a caprese salad which was bland, and i got the chicken piccata which was not true chicken piccata. It had bone in and it was not a true piccata sauce. My fiancee had the linguine clam sauce, and it was flavorless and had very few clams in it. The best part was the pecorino fondue appetizer and his sweet tea. I sent the piccata back...which i never do, and they were very gracious to replace it with the shrimp pesto pizza, which was much better. Needless to say, after a $60 check, it wasnt worth it and we wont be back.

I would rate this 5 stars simply because they had an ENTIRE gluten free menu and amazing GF bread..which is heaven for those of us with celiac disease. The food was good. The service was decent. And the powdered soap in the bathroom was a unique touch. Good experience all around, no complaints! Decent environment, casual setting, fairly price, but also fairly average when it comes to Italian. Nothing extremely UNIQUE but wasn't boring either. If you need to eat gluten free or have celiac I'd highly recommend it

My husband and I ate here last night after having a nice gentleman in the mall recommend it. So glad we ran into him!  YUM!!!  For starters we had stuffed mushrooms. They were so good.  We both ordered the Penne with Ala Vodka Sauce.  It was the best I've ever had in my life!!!I'm telling you you must try it.The brewed iced tea was tasty.  The service was also excellent. We didn't wait long for our food at all.  I just wish I had room for dessert.We will be back when we are in Columbus again.

My wife and I are regular visitors at Marcella's and normally we have an outstanding experience.  Today, while the food was largely what we expected, the service wasn't.  We brought our daughter for her Birthday dinner and although the dining room was only half full and our waitress only seemed to have 3 small tables (ourselves included) we consistently were neglected.  After seating our beverages took 15 minutes to come out followed by 20 for appetizers.  To round out that experience, our Bruschetta was cold - probably too long sitting on the counter before our waitress picked it up.  Finally, our entrees showed up again without the waitress being anywhere around (so no Parmesan cheese shavings this time around).  I still give this experience 3 stars as the food is always so good but I was embarrassed to have picked it for a special occasion given our experience.

Needed lunch before going to an early afternoon wedding. We drove up from Cincy and found this place. Our server was friendly and quick. We explained that we had limited time to eat and get to the wedding. He made good recommendations and took our order promptly and got us our food quickly. I had the pizza, which was just awesome. Abby had one of the pasta dishes, which she said was very good. It made for a great quick lunch, but I would love to come back here some time for dinner and have a more leisurely experience. The wine list looked fantastic.

This place is just fine.  Veal meatballs was tasty but the description by our server was a little embellished. She described it as the size of a softball.  I fell for the marketing hype. Not as big as she described. Don't stuff tissues in your ......ooops different review.Had the shellfish risotto.  The flavor was there, the texture of the risotto was spot on, the creaminess I expect was present and not overwhelming, the downside was in its proteins.  They were overcooked.  Everything that had it going in this dish was ruined by the overcooked pieces.  They were generous with their proteins but poorly prepared.We ordered a variety of appetizers. Cheese plates, olives, meats, everything we ordered stimulated our appetite as they should.  Skip the bread.Had a big party - we used the room they had and it accommodated our loud group.

Dad was wanting Italian and we were hoping for something less franchised than OG or Carrabba's for his last night in Ohio; this place fit the bill. Table behind us was a large group of Italians (promising sign). Food was excellent--marinara had a good basil aroma, arrabiata sauce had other flavors beyond just chili flakes, the bread was dense and chewy, and the dessert menu had offerings other than Italianized versions of stuff you can find at Kroger's bakery. We had the almond chocolate cake and the cannolis. The cake had that chocolate liqueur taste to it that I love, and the cannolis were both delicate and rich, and came in threes with a side of berries.Drew and another waitress doted on us the entire time, and even comped some items for making us "wait" before coming to take our drink orders (honestly we weren't even aware we were waiting abnormally long) so it was a very happy surprise when we got our bill. I'll be bringing my family here when they come visit again, and hopefully we'll be leaving Marcella's with the same delicious garlic breath and a big bag of leftovers next time.
