It wasn't a bad attempt, but it wasn't memorable or worthy of repeating, in my opinion.Our waitress was friendly, as was the hostess. Service was a bit slow, and things didn't seem particularly busy while we were there. However, I liked the atmosphere, so I wasn't too bothered by the longer-than-expected visit.

This place is very modern and was a great experience for my wife and I! She ordered the chicken carbonara which was amazing and i ordered the chicken Parmesan, which was also amazing. If your looking to have a few great martinis, great food, and good service this is a place you need to try

I liked it. Overall seems like a safe pick for a date or out with coworkers. They don't hit you over the head with creativity or 'pizazz' and sometimes that's what you need.Food wise- you get what you pay for. High quality ingredients, good flavor, nice presentation. I had the special- sea scallops in a pesto lemon sauce with wild mushroom risotto and asparagus with some arugula to boot.Service leaves something to be desired, but not terrible. Based on the price of the entrees I would have thought the service would be better.

Came here with the fiancÌ© for a delayed Valentine's Day dinner on Friday. We had a difficult time finding parking, especially with the game going in, so we ended up using the valet. FiancÌ© was crying as he watched the valet stall his car. The food overall was very good. We got a loaf of bread with really good olive oil and pesto (?), and I probably at 3/4 of the loaf. We ordered bruschetta to start, but neither of us read the menu and didn't realize it came with prosciutto on top. I ended up picking it off, and the waitress mentioned that next time we could order a vegetarian bruschetta with asparagus on top instead. Good to know! The bruschetta was also quite oily- FH ended up not finishing one of his slices because it felt too buttery and messy and made his stomach feel weird. FH had his normal dish, the chicken Marsala. It was super tasty and he cleaned the plate up. I had the penne alla vodka, and the noodles tasted homemade. It was tasty, but I was so full from all the bread that I ate that I ended up taking most of it home. It didn't reheat that well, but it was alright. I would order it again. In conclusion, the meal was pretty average. I would eat it again, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back. As we were leaving, the valet took an extra long time to get FH's car. We were there for quite a while. When he finally arrived, he had gotten the seat stuck forward and apologized for taking so long as the garage was backed up. FH was concerned that his engine was warm, giving the impression that the valet had been driving his car for a while. Who knows.

This is a good restaurant. We got the scallop special and the campanella, split chocolate bread pudding for dessert. Food was good and I like this restaurant overall. A few dings: parking is a mess (even with valet) it's hard to see at night/in the rain with all the construction. Our server forgot to tell us the specials, mis-recommended a cocktail and it took 25 minutes to get dessert. It was a Wednesday so maybe just an off night. I would def go again.

We all went on Sunday (half price wine bottles ) and all got different pasta dishes. Everyone enjoyed their food I would say the best two were the lamb pasta and the vodka pasta dish. 3 rating because food kinda took awhile and nothing was super outstanding food wise. The martini salad was good!

I came here for an interview dinner and ordered bacon-crusted prawns (special of the day) and the chocolate cake. Everything was delicious--perfectly cooked with a good combination of sweet, salty, and everything in between. The portions are very large and the food is definitely on the heavy side. I wasn't hungry for like a whole day after! The food and atmosphere are very similar to all other Cameron Mitchell restaurants, so if you've enjoyed those, expect something similar.

This place is very modern and was a great experience for my wife and I! She ordered the chicken carbonara which was amazing and i ordered the chicken Parmesan, which was also amazing. If your looking to have a few great martinis, great food, and good service this is a place you need to try!

This was a really great spot for a business dinner.  The fresh mozzarella appetizer was to die for.  It came highly recommended by our waiter.  Just enough for a small bite for us 3.  We couldn't help but order the special for the evening:  bacon wrapped giant scallops on top of creamy cheese/bacon/jalapeno risotto (was not hot spicy, just savory).Their cocktails are really great.  I would at least try one and then a glass from the wonderful wine list.We said no to dessert......AT FIRST.  Then the waiter described the bread pudding.  We were sold and it was delicious!  My only regret is that I didn't take photos.

For the sake of efficiency, I'm going to list my experience.-Precursor and Martini to start.-Fancy bread and sauce to start.-Full plates of Italian cuisine that you'll fall in love with in a matter of minutes.-dessert was straight, and can be wanting, BUT your app and main course take very good care of you-drinks: couldn't taste the liquor but I definitely felt it after just one. Maybe it was just tonight, but damn yes.

Wtf Martini? We ate here on Friday and somehow they charged our credit card TWICE for a total of over 500 bucks! Martini blamed it on our bank! Good grief! That NEVER happens. After multiple phone calls over four days our bank proved that it was indeed Martini's fault and they did bill us twice! A lame and clueless apology was given after considerable hassle for us. No attempt to offset this with offer of a gift card or anything at all. Luckily we had enough in the bank to cover their very large error. Someone else might not be so lucky. Their food was good. But the hassle was not worth it. Check your credit card after eating here.

Try the butternut squash tortellini - superb! Best pasta dish I've had in the past year. The chocolate torte with hazelnuts was excellent, probably big enough for two people.Nice ambience, on the quiet side.Prices somewhat high, but worth it, in my opinion (salad+pasta+dessert was $41 before tip)

Amazing place with an amazing atmosphere. Enjoyed the evening with great selections of wines and Italian cuisine to pick from. Turned out to be a great birthday outing for me. Special thanks to Rachel for making it a great evening for all of us. Would highly recommend this place .Thx DR MD

Martini has kept it's high standards and high quality offerings over its tenure. I'm always happily surprised when I come here - it's Italian fare, but Martini sets the bar high.The space itself is upscale, and either bright and airy (for daytime/happy hour drinks) or darkly intimate for a nighttime dinner date. I actually prefer sitting at the bar, which is great for people watching and sports viewing on the ideally-placed TVs. Excellent and personable bartenders and host staff, equally as professional & focused as the servers.If you come to a place called Martini, be prepared to order cocktails. Again, they meet their own standards with quality and well-chosen offerings. On our last trip (a late-night jaunt post-phony-matrimony), the offerings were things like the Testarossa (Jameson, agave nectar, passion fruit, lemon, pio cesare) and Short North Tea (house made limoncello, pama, tea, prosecco, orange juice & mint). I really wanted that tea, but that's an Uber-night for me. I ended up with a ginger citrus martini (belvedere citrus, house made sour mix, agave nectar). Delicious and smooth. Of course, wine and beer are on offer as well.One must-have: Martini's beef Carpaccio. It's one of those BEST THINGS EVER. Every. single. time. never-fail. Just...yes.Martini's entree offerings are straightforward - lasagna, pappardelle, penne alla vodka, veal scaloppini - but they are balanced well and with great execution. No-miss with anything I've had so far.Sadly, I've never made it to dessert (I'm typically drinking it, let's be honest), but of course, if they are anything like other offerings, you won't go wrong.Martini is a great place to impress for a business lunch, happy-hour meetup, or intimate dinner.

This was my first time at Martini for a work dinner. I chose the lasagna along with a glass of cab and I was set. I could only finish half of my lasagna as the piece was so big, but boy was it delicious! This is a great setting for a romantic date night or a celebratory event.

Went for drinks and sat at the bar, it was a friendly and sophisticated atmosphere. Pricey for sure, but the drinks were absolutely delicious. I had a drink with basil in it that was incredible. If you're willing to spend a bit this is a really nice place to go!

The last time I was here was a long time ago. I had liked the ambience but wasn't that impressed with the food. However, i came here recently on a business dinner and the experience was far better. Starting with the server who was incredibly friendly and provided excellent recommendations, everything went perfectly.  For appetizers, we got the calamari, the mozzarella cheese, and the arancini. All three appetizers were delicious. I especially liked the calamari and the arancini. For dinner, based on the server's recommendation I got the lamb shank special with polenta. The lamb was cooked perfectly, melt in your mouth delicious! And the polenta served as a perfect complement. The folks at the table that got the pasta dishes really liked them as well. They cook their pasta fresh. A big plus. An overall excellent experience.

Just had dinner here for restaurant week. Our reservation was for 6:45 and we didn't make it to the second course until about 8:30. Our salads/aranchini were good, as was the second course (they accommodated our party by taking the meat out of a couple of these dishes which we appreciated) but the third course - two salmon dishes and one chicken dish were kind of gross. I think it was the quality of the meat. The chicken had this weird processed flavor and the salmon was very salty and lacked flavor otherwise. One person was happy with the short rib he ordered. I think I'll keep going here for happy hours but I'll pass on dinner.

I never noticed this restaurant until my roommate mentioned to me that 1. Drinks here are amazing2. The happy hour specials are a stealAs I am always on the lookout for the best Columbus happy hour joints, my friends and I traveled long and far to Martini and a blissful monday afternoon.The place was not busy at all, which was surprising considering how delicious the appetizers and drinks were. We had the lobster risotto, beef carpaccio, and the antipasto plate--you must get every one. We inhaled the food and washed it down with the strong drinks. Service here was on par as well.So come one over! I feel like no one talks about this place (which may be a good thing for me.....)

We enjoyed our meal we had the lamb meal the pasta dishes clam and chicken and we had aParty of 10 the staff Joe Joey and a young lady can't remember  her name did a excellent job food drinks and service was excellent . We've been here before and so we would definitely come back . To full to try dessert but next time for sure ate to much of that bread and olive oil.

Been to Martini's a couple of times, typically later on a weekday evening (ie: after 7p).  Usually when we get there the place is pretty busy, but then clears out shortly afterwards.Reservations are recommended as this place is fairly busy.  The bar area is great and both times I was in, there was large container of vodka with pineapple.  The Pineapple infused vodka is fantastic, and whatever their special cocktail is with the vodka, is a definite must try.  Both times we spent a bit of time at the bar and then we were seated.  Both a small group (3), and a larger group (9).  Service both times was excellent, and the servers are very knowledgeable about both the bar and food side, and they were quick to make suggestions.  The food came out in a reasonable amount of time.  Food was also very good.  However, for the amount you pay, I think it could be a bit better.  Meals here are pricey.  Don't get me wrong the meal is good, just not fantastic.The servers are always attentive and very quick to refill water and to get drinks served up.  Overall, I like the place, and for those nicer occasion meals, this is a wonderful place to go.

This place is great! Went for Happy Hour and just missed it because I didn't check the times. However this place is worth every penny.  The Pear Elderflower Martini is yummy - slight pear taste and not overly sweet or alcoholic tasting. Next I had the Sangiovese to go with the food. And now the food: the Arancini was sooooo good. You get 6 of them and they are cooked just perfectly with some marinara and cheese topping. Excellent deal even for the regular price. And OMG THE MOZZARELLA!!!! It is made fresh and served warm with crispy bread, roasted tomatoes, and a delicious olive oil pesto. This is a must. I'm sure is changes a bit day to day as it's made fresh etc but so amazing. If you are only getting one thing, get this. I was so impressed and pleased with this great little bar & restaurant!

WOW!Group of 7 and I wasn't paying - The place was packed for a Tuesday, mainly business and established people. We had a reservation and the table was ready and waiting. They ordered a few apps per person so I think I tried everything on the app menu. the Fresh Mozzarella and the Beef Capriccio were incredible, so were all the others, but those two stood out.  Six of the seven people ordered some type of veal and everyone's entree was perfect.  I had the Veal Martini and you didn't need a knife, it was scallopini style with prosciutto and arugula.  If they/we didn't order 8 bottles of wine I would have loved to have desert.  The waiter, I forget his name, knew his place, he was so good with the wine he could have been a sommelier. Teresa, the general manager, came over to check on the table several times.Professionally managed -  if your in Columbus, it is a must...The parking was rough :)

Drinks - check. Food - check. The best part about this place was the staff. Everyone is on top of their game. I sat at the bar and had more than three different people come and help me with drink and food suggestions and serving. Testarossa was my cocktail, which was awesome. And beet salad and Chicken Piccata were very good too. All in all great experience with great food.

Wow, just wow. Everything from the service to the wine and let's not forget the food. InSANE! Can't wait to visit Columbus again just to eat here. Made to order mozzarella app, lobster risotto, butternut squash raviolis, and the Milanese! I'm literally drooling on my phone the day after while writing this. Great atmosphere but maybe a little loud for a romantic date but perfect for groups or people that want to have a good time. Prices are very reasonable for the level of food and service. Was not upset at all at the tab. Worth every penny.

The food was really good. The calamari was tender and perfectly seasoned. The mozzarella was a bit stiff however the bread and pesto was great. I had the Picatta Chicken and it was just great. The only complaint was the table its self, it moved way to much when we were cutting our food. But that does not reflect on their over all score. Really recommend this for anyone considering eating here.

We had made 8:30 reservations for my friends birthday and upon arrival were told that our table was not ready but would be shortly which was fine. After being seated and ordering some apps it took at least 20 minutes for them to arrive. Then after finally ordering food it took at least another 30 minutes just to get that as well! I had ordered $39 worth of scallops and they tasted like $10 scallops. They came sitting on a bed of polenta which was super bland and had no flavor what so ever. The scallops were also chewy and lacked salt. The restaurant was really not busy at all but it felt as if our waiter was never present. 1st time here and definitely the last. There are MUCH better, less expensive restaurants to eat at! Do not recommend this place to anyone.

This is a new favorite in downtown Columbus! We were able to meet the executive chef who was amazing in describing the food and the history of the restaurant. The food was out of this world! I can't wait to return to try other items from the menu! I will admit that it is a bit noisy when they get busy, but we still had a great experience!!

Oh my god. Let me preface by saying that I went for a dinner that was paid for by a company I'm working with, so if I had been paying my own way, I'd have never gotten to try the many delicacies that this place offers (at a rightful yet somewhat steep cost).First, I had the Precursor, a whiskey/honey cocktail. Get that. Just do it. Then I had the Caesar salad, salmon, and a chocolate mousse torte. Everything was decadent, but the salmon was the highlight for me. My colleagues got the filet and were overwhelmed by its tastiness as well. The Caesar was a touch saltier than I'd have liked, but still great. The mousse was more cakey than moussey (our incredible server did inform me of this beforehand), and it wasn't the best I've had, but I sure had trouble telling myself I did not need to finish it.All in all, I don't usually give Italian places much of my attention, but I would have definitely missed out if this one was not a stop on my conference trip to Columbus.

Without a doubt the best food I have ever had in Columbus. The most wholesome fettuccine and clams I have had in Ohio and unique yet classic Italian flavors like no other. The ambiance is that of fine-dining without the snobby undertones. With all this positive feedback some may we wondering, why only three stars? Well. While the food and atmosphere were impeccable, the service was less than pleasing.  The floors are so slippery it took me 300 steps just to get to the bathroom. My friend's chair COLLAPSED from underneath her and the management was cracking jokes at her expense. The waiter was rude to my party probably because we looked young and weren't going to spend hundreds of dollars on wine (at 5pm on a week night).  He never mentioned his name, and when we informed him there was a surprise guest coming (aka another place setting) he rolled his eyes and reluctantly got another chair. I have been to Martini before and had a lovely experience but this last dinner put a bad taste in my mouth about the management. Yeah, the food is exceptional but if the service can't match, good luck.

Visiting Columbus for the Oklahoma game and this restaurant was recommended by locales. Restaurant was packed with lots of excitement but our table was ready right on time.  Great service and recommendations by our waiter. I had clams and linguine and it was great with fresh tender clams and great sauce. Friends had chicken parmigiana and all said it was very good.  Wine selection was very good and prices were much better than our restaurants in Dallas. Great service and great food, plus a fun atmosphere. What more would you want!

Excellent dinner in a beautiful atmosphere. Our waiter was incredibly friendly and personable. He was so knowledgeable about the menu. I always enjoy their pasta, especially the butternut squash tortellini. This is a great date night dinner place. They also have a nice happy hour with great cocktails and appetizers.

Pleasant date or business dining atmosphere in downtown in trendy and not overly formal feel.  Pros: The food is one of the best Italian I've had in Columbus so far and the server was attentive and wait times to speak with the server and waiting for the food was minimal.    - Malbec was smooth; the bruschetta tasted unique in a good way; The shrimp marinara had good balance of sauce, touch of spice and pasta.  The shrimp aren't too small either.Cons:  Less intimate for quiet conversation as the tables are open and visible to all. Didn't have options for wheat pasta of any kind.  The tuna salad isn't a salad at all, it has sparse greens sprinkled over beans with a slim layer of tuna.  While the bean dish/salad wasn't what I expected, it tasted good.Overall, this semi-fine dining spot was a very pleasant experience and is a good date night or place to hangout with colleagues.

I had a delightful dinner at Martini Modern Italian. The service, food, and ambience was fantastic! Amy was one of the BEST servers! She recommended the Butternut Squash which was phenomenal! All of the pasta is homemade. Some of the BEST pasta in the Columbus area. I also had the chocolate torte which was absolutely delicious!

This is one Of my favorite places to eat in Columbus. The cocktails are exceptional- get the old fashioned martini or the elderflower martini. . And, the shirt rib dinner is easily the greatest meal in the world. The dinner takes a while but with the drinks and the great atmosphere, it's a total win.

I go here about a dozen times a year. It's one of my favorite restaurants in Columbus. The food is always delicious: best tomato bisque you'll ever have! I typically always order the same few menu selections because they're perfect and I can't bear to not order them when I dine in. It's a great place to conduct business, have dinner with some friends or to have a romantic evening with your significant other.We often take all of our out of town visitors to Martini's so they can taste it's amazement. Cameron Mitchell did so well with this restaurant.

I have visited Martini's on several occasions and have never been disappointed!! The Lamb Pappardelle is fantastic and the service is always great. I love anchovy stuffed green olives and when I asked the bartender if they had any she said they did not. no less than five minutes later she brought anchovy from kitchen and stuffed 3 olives for my drink. Awsome !! that is why I go to Cameron Mitchell restaurants they always deliver the best service and the food is great!!!

Food hands down amazing. Bread was incredible.  I had the beef tenderloin and was probably the best I've ever had.  Great flavor and texture Service was ok. Server was kinda weird and awkward. He said he's been there for 13 years. He brought everyone else bread except us until I asked. Then I received it 3 minutes before entree arrived. He dropped off a water glass as he walked by which wasn't mine due to the lipstick on the rim.  I think he got the tables mixed up and there's still someone there waiting for their water Overall food was incredible but I know there's the 1 in 100 events of poor service so I would definitely go back
Went tonight for our Anniversary and probably won't return. We'd rather go to Bravo or Brio for their Italian dishes. Our server was very good tonight, as opposed to our first visit in February.
The Lamb chop was superior, paired with a great wine and topped off by excellent service.   Oh, did I mention the lobster risotto.  This is a must visit.

A great Italian restaurant conveniently located next to North Market. The lasagna was fantastic and the house made mozzarella was fresh and soft - made minutes prior to arriving at our table. One of the bright spots for Columbus Italian food, with a great wine selection and intimate atmosphere. Highly recommend for dates with the significant other.

Came here with my wife and parents before a blue jackets game and was not disappointed!  I would recommend reservations on game nights as this place fills up quick.  They accomodate to CBJ fans, and will get you out quickly to ensure you dont miss the opening faceoff.  The service was amazing and the food was some of the best italian food we've ever had!  The pasta is homemade, and the wait staff was very knowledgeable about the food which they serve.  The mixed drinks were also done very well.  I would go through each item we ordered, but theres no point, this place is legit One of the best restaurants in Columbus!

We decided on Martinis because in college (over 10 years ago)  we frequented the establishment for dinners and Happy Hours. After making a reservation and having a wonderful dinner with our server Joey, we sat at the bar for a nightcap. We waited patiently for over 10 mins, and the bartender mentioned it was last call. After another 5 minutes, she mentions she cannot serve my friend. Mind you- it was 3 hours at the restaurant, hundreds of dollars spent and 2 drinks with our dinner... and she couldn't serve a member of my party?!?! Are you kidding me? I suggest properly training your staff on when and how to judge one being belligerent or over-served. I can't believe this ruined a wonderful night. I am sorry for choosing Martinis to celebrate a reunion of friends and Christmas! You've lost some very loyal patrons. POOR SERVICE!

I have been here both for a cozy dinner with my fiancÌ© and happy hour with my sister. Dinner:Happy Hour: We got some drinks. My sister is more of a sweet drinker so she enjoyed her Pear Elderflower. It is her new favorite! I got the Grapefruit Gimlet which is solid. My boyfriend always gets the Precursor. He swears by it! We also split some apps, the anti-pasta platter and beef carpaccio. Both were satisfying. Seriously though, all their drinks are amazing. Martini is becoming one of my favorite restaurants in Columbus!

The one saving grace of this place was that our waiter was amazing, funny and patient with us (a large group with separate checks and many questions) despite the computer going down and being grossly understaffed. Kudos to this man!The hostess, however, was a different matter. As business professionals, we expected a reception that was at least cordial. She, however, literally turned her nose up at us, developed an immediately haughty tone, and couldn't have cracked a smile if her life depended on it. The lack of civility and professionalism was bad enough, but her snotty dismissal as she passed us off to her 'helper' was just perfecting her awfulness.The food was mostly subpar, in my opinion, although a good half of my table companions enjoyed their dishes. Mine was the tenderloin, touted the best in Columbus; it was like ground, wet cardboard, coated with an awful half-cheese sauce that was bitter and uncomplimentary to the dish. A table mate indicated her marinara dish was mediocre.Others, however, had the chicken carbonara, beet salad and the Arctic char (a special) and stated both dishes were delicious. The wine and martini parings were decent as well.Overall, for the price and hype, I would have expected far more in a place of this nature - thus the 2 star.

Gluten free folks will love, love, love this place.  They have an extensive gluten-friendly menu that includes appetizers, pastas and meats.  I ordered the chicken carbonara with gluten-free pasta and it was fantastic!As good as the food was, what really put Martini's into 5-star territory was the service. As a single female dining alone, I appreciate that the staff were very attentive and the service fast.  I ate at the bar and despite it being an extremely busy night, both the bartender and the manager checked on me multiple times to make sure I had everything I wanted.  I would definitely go back here again.

Saturday night, we go to dinner with my mom and her boyfriend. Drinks were great, appetizers were delicious. Then we sit waiting for our main dishes to come out. It took exactly an hour and 15minutes, but not before my mom had to stand up from the table to look for the manager to see where our dinner was. The server, Holly, was terrific! She stoof in the kitchen forever waiting for the food to come out. Dinner was delicious. I got the butternut squash tortellini, my mom had the lamb parpadelle, her boyfriend had the lasagna. My boyfriend had the chicken parmesan - not great! Chicken was over cooked. Moral of the story, the food and drinks were great overall, but the food took forever to come out. The manager ended up comping out dinner - which was great, and very nice! Thankfully the food was great, or I would have complained more about how long the food took to come out. One last thing. The toilets in the woman's bathroom are so low to the ground. Overall, good food, drinks, and atmosphere. I would go back and hope the kitchen does not take so long (I think they are understaffed).

Unfortunately the happy hour drink specials at Martini have changed.  There are still $5.00 mixed drinks, but you must select from the specialty drink menu. For example, the grapefruit gimlet and martinis are $5 but if you order a vodka and soda water it will be regular price. Despite this change, Martini remains my favorite happy hour location in downtown Columbus.
Excellent staff. Amazing martinis. Delicious food. Love the atmosphere. Very cool place.

Came here for our anniversary dinner.  The food is fantastic.  Sweetie got penne in vodka sauce.  I had a bite and it was very good; she loved it.  I had the butternut squash tortellini.  It was amazing.  Tender pasta, subtly flavored filling, nice cream sauce.  I also had a black cherry manhattan that was very good.  I'm not usually a cocktail drinker, so take my opinion with a grain of salt, but the flavors were well-balanced and on the whole it was very enjoyable.  The complimentary bread with oil and pesto was a nice starter.  For dessert we shared the vanilla brulee.  Very good, but not the best I've ever had.  The sugar was super thick and hard to crack through.  The custard was light and good.  The cookies on the side were fantastic.Some negatives: half-full on a Monday evening, the place was incredibly loud.  Conversations, kitchen noise, all kinds of craziness.  We could barely talk.  I don't know why places are designed to reflect noise.  Acoustic tile is your friend; minimalist design may look good, but if it is unpleasant to sit there...The table-side serving was weird.  The kitchen is right there- is it that hard to get plates to the table before they cool?  Lots of scraping and awkwardness for our server; if it had been busy I don't know how she could have done it.  Overall, the food was amazing, the service was good, the prices were fair for what you get, and the atmosphere was okay but not awful.  Valet parking for $8, but we had already parked.  We might be back.

My husband and I just had the worst experience tonight in this restaurant. We were out for a special evening and made a reservation at this restaurant which was close to our hotel.  We walked in to the bar area which was very loud so after waiting for the hostess, we requested a quiet table. She sat us at a table right next to the bar. We placed our order and got our wine and salad within a reasonable time. After waiting for an hour for our entree, and seeing that people around us who came later have been served already, the waitress finally told us that she forgot to push the button for our order so it was just being prepared then. She apologized and a few minutes later the manager came to apologize also.  Well, by that time, we were quite upset for waiting so long and our special evening was ruined. We wanted to leave but she assured us that the food will be out in 5 minutes. When our food finally came, 10 minutes later, (we both ordered the fettuccine with clams), it was so bad we couldn't eat it and left them practically untouched. The pasta was overcooked, the sauce was too soupy and had overpowering taste of butter.  They seem to drown everything there with butter. The croutons on our Ceasar salads were so soaked in butter that you couldn't taste the bread.  There is nothing authentic Italian style in this restaurant. But, the worst part is the service.  When we got our check, they had the nerve to charged us for everything inspite of the very poor service that they admitted to and seeing that we didn't touch the food. Who among you customers out there, would think that this was appropriate?  What decent and reputable restaurant would admit to being responsible for the bad service and not accommodate or compensate a customer for what they put them through. Totally classless, not to mention bad food, bad service.

My boyfriend and I came here for a nice dinner the last night before Ramadan. It was worth every penny. We had the lobster risotto, lamb pappardelle, and each had a veal entree. Everything was phenomenal and the server was wonderful. Wine and martinis were perfect as well. We will definitely be back.

'Martini' -- a word that leaves little up to the imagination and/or much room for interpretation -- delivers the exact dining experience that its name evokes. Boozy, shallow, antiquated and sweet, Martini is the restaurant equivalent of a mid-2000s cosmopolitan. Small doses of bright neon have arguably made a comeback (Major Food Group does this well with places like Dirty French, Santina and Carbone), but Martini utilizes bright pink lights sincerely and in excess. The restaurant will apparently undergo a renovation, which is great, and should start by removing the vinyl covers from the outside of its sparkling chandeliers. This cost-effective solution represents half the battle.The food at Martini mixes occasionally-clever technique with outdated Italian cliches, and is equally hit and miss. While my arctic char special showed promise and great care, with its rich truffle butter sauce, earth mushrooms, and bright frisee salad, the majority of appetizers fell flat, showing little creativity or ingenuity. And don't get me started on what was sold to me as "the best creme brulee in columbus", which came in a bathtub and had no flavor whatsoever, one of the worst I've ever had. The strawberry semifreddo, with its delicate balance of sweet and subtle, frozen and thaw, is the far superior option.The one area that Martini shines is the service: fast, friendly and knowledgeable. Then again, after the lukewarm creme brulee sent me running to the men's room, I was forced to delay the inevitable thanks to a small mob of festive kitchen staffers, who were quite loud about their happiness that the night was coming to an end. Soon thereafter, so was I, on both fronts.

In town for a convention and found this gem! The food is amazing and the service and atmosphere topped off a great experience overall.  Anytime in town I am definitely going straight back to martini to try more menu items. Braised lamb dish is highly recommended and feel free to switch up your pasta of choice. They do not mind. Highly recommend !

Veal and Chicken Parmesan are good. Doesn't taste like regular Italian like you would get at a normal Italian place. On the Veal Parmesan plate the pasta and arugula had contrasting flavors to the Veal Parmesan which made it all taste better together. The sauce was light and had a strong tomato taste which pared well with the other flavors. It was very busy even on a Tuesday, call ahead for reservations.
Server was super friendly, food was pretty good, cocktails were great, and the ambience was really chic. It did get noisy after a while though but we had a good time.

Wow this place was amazing!! Definitely a 5 star restaurant. We came here last weekend for a bachelorette party and the service was phenomenal. Our server Ronn was so great. The interior is beautiful and I loved the chandeliers. I can't talk highly enough about the food. I had the chicken Marsala and it was cooked perfectly. Everyone loved their food! Our server Ronn was nice enough to split the bride-to-be's food and drink on all of our separate tabs. This was above and beyond my expectations. Highly recommended!!!!
I always go to this great martini bar when in Columbus. The martinis ( every one) are great.  Happy hour has great appetizers. Staff is very accommodating.
Best happy hour in Columbus! Every cocktail is $5 during happy hour, and the bar seating is great!

I would go as far to say that this is one of if not the best restaurants in Columbus! Consistently good. The lamb paperdelle (spelling?) is amazing and so is the homemade mozzarella. Really anything you order will be fantastic. Worth the price. GO

Probably my favorite restaurant in Columbus where the food and service has always been consistently spectacular.  Any dish here is amazing.  Definitely try the bacon wrapped dates.  Although Italian and the pastas are delicious, they also have one of the best steaks in the area.  I also love sitting at the bar enjoying apps and beverages.  The Short North Tea is one of my favorite drinks.

Came on a Saturday night at 5:45 before the ballet. We were promptly seated in a nice empty part of the restaurant. The decor and ambiance is wonderful and was perfect for our ladies night but could also be a great date location. The waitress was very attentive and our glasses were always filled. I ordered the lamb Pappardelle, which was served out of a hot pan table side, it was delicious and very meaty. My friend ordered the Milanese, also delicious. Very crisp and covered in a thick great cheese. Other friend ordered chicken Marsala, very delicate and good as well. We split the chocolate bread pudding which was a hefty serving and very good. We also split a tiramisu. The tiramisu was a real winner, the cup it was served in was entirely made of chocolate! It was amazing! Only 4 stars because the food could have been a step up. But Id definitely return.

I cannot believe I have not posted a review before this... It is my favorite spot in Columbus! Hands down!Martini is just cool! The decor is modern but comfortable. The food is out of this world! They make a fresh mozzarella that is simply amazing! I love the pasta and shrimp dish too. Now, drum roll please... Do NOT fail to order the grapefruit gimlet!! I actually got the recipe from The bartender. They are fan-freaking-tastic! You will want more than one! The service is spectacular! Thank you Trent for making my visits extraordinary! I would recommend this place to anyone!! Cheers!
Amazing ...Here on cheer competition had no idea where to eat. So glad we went to eat here. Beautiful decor, food presentation. Staff was very friendly Must try!!!!

Spent NYE at Martini's. Service and pace of the meal was excellent. Must get the arancini and butternut squash dishes to share. I loved the juicy tomatoes and how fresh and light the panzanella salad was. I had the sea bass special served with gnocchi and arugula and I ate every bite. The gnocchi is cooked just how I like it- pan seared so it's just slightly crispy on the outside. I don't eat beef, but my husband had the veal martini (rated good)  and another friend had the ribeye (rated excellent).

Their filet is hands down my favorite filet in Columbus... and quite possibly anywhere.The chicken carbonara is really good too. They use fresh squeezed orange juice when making my mixed drink. Even with Reservations i usually have to wait a couple minutes for my table. Use the valet when you go because the garage parking will cost you just as much. Service is usually really good, i have been here many many times and i can only think of one or two occasions that i thought service was sub par.

If you're looking for a cool, swanky restaurant in the Short North, check out Martini!  We went for a surprise birthday dinner, and they were very accomodating throughout the entire evening.  The menu is a bit pricey, but honestly, the food was great and the portions were big!  I had the calamari appetizer- it tasted very fresh and was actually served on a bed of greens.  For my entree, I ordered (and loved) the lamb pappardelle.  The pasta is made fresh, in-house, and was perfectly sauced.  There was so much!!!  I finished it, but was very full afterward.  Their desserts sounded too good to pass up, so I got the lemon meringue.  It was good, but I liked the strawberry shortcake and bread pudding desserts better!

The service was excellent. The Chic Decor and atmosphere along with attentive staff give you the ultimate dining experience. We had the calamari, butternut tortellini for starters then Chicken Carbonara, and Salmon entree for me, All very good. Best of all you would never guess that my girlfriend's carbonara pasta was Gluten Free! She and I were well impressed with the Five Star food and wine selection. This place is a must on our next visit. Very elegant and memorable dinner.
Used to love this place but it's gone downhill. Probably won't be back for a while.Service is very lacking. Prices are high for portion sizes. Much better options in the area.

Come here every time I'm in Columbus. The food is excellent and so are the happy hour drinks. Try the fresh homemade mozzarella, bruschetta, and antipasto. I prefer the modern martini. Can't go wrong here!

Well, it might not have been the best night to try this place. Game &a a trade show was certainly too much to handle for the bar staff. Lobster risotto was disappointing. Scallops were a better second plate. Service was really not up the part...

Great happy hour! Great sitting at a table or the bar, and bartending staff was very attentive. My favorite drink is the grapefruit gimlet, and the cherry bourbon Manhattan is good too! Appetizers are all tasty, and one of my favorite dishes was the butternut squash tortellini. Perfect flavor, and impossible not to finish it. Great spot to get a fancier drink before the night out!

Great food and great service. Food was absolutely amazing, came out in a timely fashion. Excellent service and recommendations about appetizers, entres, dessert, and wine. Definitely a wonderful place to spend a nice evening and dinner.

This restaurant is not the place you want to go and have a nice time. The food was over priced and not very good. The atmosphere was so terrible. If you want to go somewhere with the snobbiest people that just bring your mood down then this is the place for you. This restaurant just ruined our night for us with the atmosphere and bad food.

Came here for a birthday dinner and the service was good.The most memorable dish was the Tuna Crudo, it's absolutely delicious! Ahi Tuna Tartare, Cannellini Bean Salad, Pine Nuts and Lemon Vinaigrette...YUM!!
Lovely space.  Good food.  ENTIRELY TOO NOISY -they should separate the bar from the eating space!!!!

So I came for a much needed ladies night with my mom and seesters. High street was of course where were going, and I decided to check out Martini. Let me just add this visit was loooonnggg overdue. I always walk past this gem gallery hopping and love the window fronts..  I made a reservation for us a week in advance, and requested a window seat in the comments. When we got there, it felt like VIP service! The hostess walked us right over to our table, and removed the reserved sign right off the window seat table :) We had a wonderful evening. I decided to try their lasagna which was divine. Every bite was a bite of pure glory. The appetizers were great and all in all service was exceptional. I really wish I remembered our waitresses name b/c she was that awesome ! Come here for a legit fine dining experience, stellar food, and a beautiful ambiance.

Great ambiance, delicious food, slow service! We came here on a Tuesday evening and ordered the mozzarella cheese appetizer to share and it was soooo good- I am a major cheese lover. We also split the Chicken Marsala and Butternut Squash Tortellini.. Both were amazing dishes but it was a good idea to split, that way you can break up the richness. The Marsala was almost like a thanksgiving dinner (yum!) and the Squash was suggested as their most favorite (which is was very very good) just also very very rich and creamy. On the service.. We sat at the bar, and the bar tenders seemed very attentive to almost everyone else except us.. We had to remind them we ordered an appetizer, as well as our dinner. I still highly recommend Martini.. It's definitely delicious Italian!

Took a customer here for dinner the other night and had an excellent meal.  It's a smaller restaurant with the bar taking up about 1/3 of the place.  Tables are pretty tight making it a loud place but it's perfect for the atmosphere they're trying to get.  It's a hip place and certainly popular with the cool kids in town.  Place was packed on a Wednesday night.  Point being don't go for a quiet cozy meal.  The bruschetta app was fantastic. I personally had the chicken piccata and although it was a bit on the small side it was perfectly prepared.  I highly recommend but be sure to make a reservation.

Not pleased. The waiter treated us differently the minute we deferred an appetizer and it continued our entire visit (we were on a time limit and couldn't stay all night). My boyfriend also ordered a beer because he cannot drink anything else, another point against us. The service was less than satisfactory and that alone is the reason we won't return. Our food was fine. Marsala with few mushrooms and veal raviolis with minimal veal. The atmosphere is cool and a reason I'd justify the costs but, I can pay less and be treated way better anywhere else in Columbus.

Been here a few times and no complaints but this time everyone complained about an overcooked filet. We were a party of 11 and spent about $1500 but the only good part were the drinks. One person complained about the steak and they remade it perfectly but if the rest of us that ordered filets had complained it would've just been rude and probably end up in a kitchen scene of the movie Waiting. But seriously, I personally won't be back and I doubt the team will be back. If we weren't drunk it would've been worse. Thanks but no thanks.

Stopped in for happy hour with some co-workers on Wednesday evening. Had two 5$ Martinis which were amazing and the ahi tar tar, also amazing. The pineapple infused vodka looked fun although I didn't order it, very unique. Service was good at first then they got busier and my bartender stopped checking back and I had to awkwardly stare her down to try to get another drink. One of my co workers showed up late and sat down approximately 10 minutes before happy hour was over and she was never offered a drink or help even after I tried to get their attention for her. So of course at 6pm the drink prices more than doubled and my co worker had a unhappy hour despite waiting.

Definitely yes! I took clients there for a meal and although they were packed the service was awesome. We opted for the dish that was recommended on Yelp the butternut squash tortellini and a martini salad. Both were delicious. I recommend highly.

We chose this restaurant because of its proximity to the hotel we were at for a conference and were pleasantly surprised!  Ive found that often places near hotels stay in business because of convenience rather than great food or service. Not the case here. 4 of us had drinks, apps, dinner, and dessert and we all thoroughly enjoyed every aspect!  Service and food were both very good!  It's a great choice - you won't be disappointed.

I'll start with the positive. I ordered the sausage campanella and it was delicious. The basil sauce was great, although I wish they had added more sausage. However, the portion was pretty good and I actually shared it with two other people. We also ordered the antipasto della case and it was okay, nothing to rave about. Now the bad. We went on a Saturday night at 8 pm and the service was awful. It took forever for the waitress to come once we were seated. Once she finally came it took forever for her to bring out bread and we had to ask her for it. She said it was busy, but I noticed she kept talking to the other tables around us and staying with them much longer. I had to keep flagging her down for stuff, such as getting more water and getting the check. When we finally asked for the check it took forever as well. Overall, the food was great but it wasn't worth it. Perhaps at other times it's better.

Went here for the first time this week. Atmosphere is classy and sophisticated and all the food including the table bread was delicious. Would definitely recommend the Chicken Parmesan and will definitely be back.

I decided to order something off the menu that I had never tried here before and selected the scallops. They were amazing! The sauce they came in helped bring out the flavor, and the greens made a wonderful addition. I had the tiramisu for my birthday dessert and if it's possible, it tasted even better than it's "coffee in a mug" appearance. I tried the Testatrossa cocktail with Jameson whiskey and passion fruit, I definitely recommend even if you don't like whiskey. I come here every year for my birthday and have never been disappointed!

Martini has been my favorite since I was a kid.  Everything is good. Martinis,  pasta, salad, dessert. They shake your martini at the table and pour it. They had Fiji water and pelligrino. Valet parking is $8.

Just left and our experience was stellar. Beef carpaccio, amazing. Their martinis are strong so this time I tried the sweet tea alcoholic beverage and it was spot on We both ordered the special, diver scallops on a bed of tiny roasted potatoes with cherry tomatoes and asparagus... But the sauce! Wow...pancetta bits in a tomato base thickened with cheese and bread crumbs...lovely. Pricey yes, do I mind? Not at all when it tastes so good.Staff was professional, friendly, and attentive.All types of dress from casual to business to dressy. Be warned: happy at the bar is very busy. And this is a noisy atmosphere so if you have hearing problems it could be difficult.

Understand it was after the holidays,but understaffed and it was reflected in the unfriendly attitude of our waitress. My meal was the worse example of chicken piccata I have eaten, not only taking into consideration that after eating half of it noticed it was raw. Had a few days of an upset stomach, and will need to analyze every piece of chicken I eat for awhile. Husbands veal chop was good, but being new to Columbus there are plenty of other options. This restaurant group will not be one of them.
Didn't bother to even stay! Horrible customer service. Long wait before attended to. My time is very valuable and important therefore don't waist it.  Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone

Loud, overpriced, overrated, and HORRIBLE marinara.I could stop there, as the marinara alone should be reason enough to stay away. If an "Italian" restaurant can't get marinara right, it shouldn't be in business. In fairness, the butternut squash tortelloni were fantastic and the veal chop that one of my dining companions ordered was delicious (but still overpriced). I had the vitello milanese. The veal itself was very tasty and tender, but the pool of marinara was not at all like the light, delicate pomodoro sauce that should accompany good veal milanese. It did nothing to enhance the dish; if anything, it detracted from it. The ball of fettucine that constituted the starch of the dish had literally nothing on it and was flavorless. And the terrible marinara, again, only made it worse. Absolutely not worth the $27 or $29 I was charged. And to make matters worse, it was so loud in the restaurant that the three of us had to nearly shout to have a conversation. Finally, when one of my dining companions mentioned my review of the marinara to the server...crickets. No one else dropped by to ask, and no attempt to compensate in any way was made.I won't be back, although I wouldn't mind it if someone scored me some more of those tortelloni...

Went back a year later and I have to say it's just as good as when I was there the first time. To start the martini's are a nice size, then we had the mozzarella, antipasto and the calamari appetizer all was great but I have to say the calamari was a bit to small. For dinner we hade the veal chop which was great, Chicken parmesan which is alway good and the butternut squash with tortellini also wonderful. For desert tiramisu which was fresh and made fresh. I'll be back but make sure you make a reservation

Martini Modern was one of my favorite finds while visiting Columbus.   The restaurant is an open concept with the bar in the front and the main dining area towards the back, and you could even see the kitchen. The decor was stunning, especially the three chandeliers, it is something best seen and not easily captured in photo. The dim lighting also adds to the ambiance. I was pleasantly surprised to find that they offered a Gluten Friendly Menu (as they note they are not a completely GF kitchen), pasta included. It surprisingly had a decent amount of options. The food and service was good. The drinks were what stole the show. The Short North Tea, which they had to slightly modify to be completely GF, was phenomenal. I would warn that one could easily drink these too quickly. The sweetness of the does a good job at masking how strong these suckers truly are.Martini's also offered one of the best gluten free breads I have had in awhile. It is the Chef's recipe and he has done a nice job of perfecting the recipe. It reminded me of eating actual bread and not the usual cardboard tasting offerings that other restaurants like to pass off as GF bread.If your looking for a place for romantic date or an intimate dinner with friends or even a chili and relaxing dinner, then Martini Modern Italian is the place for you. If you are a penny-pincher and don't like spending $30+ a person, then this isn't a place for you.

I absolutely love this place.  The food and drinks are delicious and the bartenders are awesome!  Happy hour is the best time to visit - they have great food and drink specials.  Each time we visit we sit at the bar.  Easier seating, great service, and convenient for parties of 4 or less.  My favorite dish is the butternut squash ravioli with Brussels sprouts.  The best butternut squash ravioli I have had outside of Italy.  If you have not been, do yourself a favor give it a try!

Amazing food, and wonderful service. Janada handled our table of 15 like it was nothing. Our food tasted great, and she definitely made sure every need of or table was met. I would definitely return again if she was our waitress.

It was quite good.  Lots of choices, even for having a somewhat small menu.  They will customize anything - I don't eat anything and they figured out how to feed me which was tasty.  They bring fresh parmesan and red pepper flakes to the table.  The bread and oil is good too.The drink menu is crazy.  Big variety of fresh concoctions although I had wine...It was a little expensive and I couldn't figure out why other than it had a good atmosphere and it was trendy.  Our server was not good, but I didn't take away a star for that...although I thought about it because she sucked so bad.I'd go back.  Although with how many choices there are in Columbus, it might be a while.

Extremely rude management.   Called three weeks ahead of a scheduled work happy hour for a reservation in the front of the restaurant as we like to enjoy sitting near the windows.   I was told they NEVER accept reservations for those tables - they are first come first serve.   So, I arrived at 4:05pm, as they open at 4pm, was seated around 4:30 (I was the first customer in the restaurant) and at 6:30pm we were asked to leave due to a reservation.   Since I called way in advance and was told they NEVER accept reservations, but yet told us we had to leave for a reservation?!  On top of that, the manager was extremely rude - she didn't even care one bit.   Extremely poor customer service.   The food is amazing but part of dining out is the customer service and I was treated as though I wasn't good enough to be there and they didn't want my business.

I got in, and said to myself, oh nice rack !!There was a wall of beautiful wine rack, and it forecasted what was to come. Attentive and friendly waiting staff. I was taking the photo of the lighted Christmas deco tree, and two friendly staff posed for me, turns out they were managers ! I was with a group, and ordered clam fetuccini alfredo. It was absolutely the best fettuccini alfredo I have ever had. So here it is. Five star. Go here. You won't be disappointed! !!

Service-wise, everything was perfect. Our server was very attentive and friendly, drinks were kept filled (and we got a free dessert because it was T's birthday!)The food left much to be desired. We got tuna crudo for an appetizer, which was very fresh-tasting and delicious. We also shared a spinach and pear salad. Now, for a salad that has "pear" in the name, there was a distinct absence of pear. C got a few slivers, T got none. For dinner, C got the special, which was a combo of scallops and jumbo shrimp. Sadly, the shrimp were overcooked (which was surprising) and the scallops' sear was a little on the light side. It was also garnished with a watermelon(?) radish that didn't seem to belong on the plate. However, it was served with a risotto that was pretty good. T got the veal milanese. It was pounded a little thinner than liked, and as a result, the meat was dry. For dessert, we shared the tiramisu, which itself was delicious, but it was topped with a mountain of whipped cream and inside of a chocolate teacup, which kinda killed the flavor. But it was free, can't complain too much about that.  The service was good, but for the prices, we would think that the food would be better.

Updated Review:It had been a little over a year since going here, and I have to say that the second time around wasn't as great. My BF and I went for dinner on a typical Friday night, wasn't too busy, but was still a full dining room. The food was good, just what I remembered from last time, but the service was subpar. Our waitress was out in left field, the first thing she said when she got to our table was how she wished she could pull my hair color off (weird? yes). She kinda stood there awkwardly and then asked about drinks. This behavior continued through the rest of the evening. It was almost as if she walked off the street and started working. We noticed that other tables had bread, so I flagged down a manager and asked for some.. UGH.Though the food was fine, and the atmosphere was fine, this is not the kind of service I wanted or expected. We could have went to Bucca de Beppo for cheaper. Based on that alone, I won't come back. I had been looking forward to this night about for quite some time, and the service really put a damper on it. Bummer._________First reviewRecently went here for the first time. We had reservations for 8:15pm, but waited quite a bit after, to get a table. The manager (Im assuming she was), apologized many times, and comped our appi and dessert! She came over quite a few times during our meal, to make sure we were enjoying our food.The environment was a bit loud, it was a Sat. night. The food was really good, and wine was just as well!I enjoyed myself, and the consideration that was given for my date and I, for waiting so long after our reservation.
I had the half Panzanella salad, shrimp fettuccine, and splurged with lemon tart! Delish all the way around! Highly recommend!

The food is awesome. I had great lasagna and amazing strawberry fredo. But the bartenders made me feel unwelcome there. They didn't give me bread until I was half way through my main course but they zealously offered bread to the girl next to me even though she wasn't eating. They were eager to please others at the bar but it took forever to even get one of them to order dessert. No one gave a crap and I couldn't even get water refill. I was almost forgotten. I rarely gave a waiter/waitress below 18% tips and today was the day. McDonalds sometimes has better service than this.

This is a chic contemporary designed restaurant that's exquisite in every way. We've hosted large party dinners two years in a row and the menu is creative modern Italian cuisine that's delicious and in good portion. Everyone raved about the service and wine list. The appetizers were practically fought over, (kidding) but we resorted to ordering more. We indulged in the Beef Carpaccio, Calamari and Pizettas.Our entrees were perfectly prepared. I definitely recommend the Chicken Carbonara, Filet Mignon (which is prepared with a red wine...superb), Salmon or the Butternut Squash. There was not one complaint, only raves from our guests. I especially appreciate the conscientious wait staff who gave honest suggestions on popular menu items and favorites. Everyone was professional and incredibly friendly.  Being that we took 60+ guests last year for our event, we saw many return on their own this year (separate from our group dinner we planned this year).I plan corporate dinners in Los Angeles to Miami to Las Vegas, Indianapolis, etc. throughout the year. Trust me when I say that Martini Modern is a stand out. Definitely put it at the top of your "must go" list.

Panzanella salad 1/2 order and Chicken Parm at the bar last night solo...great vibe in the place and cool modern feel. I would try other dishes next time but the food was very good. Only disappointment to me was the free bread, which was completely tasteless to me! Guy next to me was eating the butternut squash tortelloni and it looked delicious, and the other guy near me was eating the Papardelle with lamb ragu, I believe, and he seemed to be loving it judging by the way he was licking the plate!

Best Chicken Marsala I've ever had.  Everything was perfect last Friday night.  There were four of us and we couldn't have been happier.  Started with great cocktails and appetizers.  Our server, John was fantastic.  He knew the menus well and had spot on recommendations.  Our entire meal was delicious and the wine he suggested was wonderful.  The table had pasta, scallops and the Marsala.  Everything was really good.  We will return when back in Columbus.

Great place to bring visiting family, business, or a nice date night. Expect to pay a good amount but you are getting the quality that you deserve.They have a great bar staff that makes really diverse and fun cocktails. The wine selection was amazing as well and we had our fair share of bottles. Not to mention or waiter who was really on his Ps and Qs about the menu and had great pairings for drinks.Waited a few extra minutes for our table but nothing extreme. I'll be returning in the future.
Wonderful dinner. Able to easily get a reservation. Diver scallops with lobster risotto was perfectly prepared.

Came here for dinner. Our fabulous waiter recommended the beet salad. So I did and it was delicious. I love beets but my friend doesn't so I got her to try it and she also loved it. I also ordered the butternut squash. I feel like a lot of people said it was creamy, the thing about this dish is that it is creamy but it's very lite. It's not heavy and that's why I really enjoyed this dish. It was the perfect.

Visited Columbus recently and went to this restaurant based on Yelp reviews. The atmosphere was very nice. Our service was very good. They were attentive but didn't rush us. We had the fresh made mozzarella and pesto. So good I wish we had ordered two. The beet salad and the panzanella salad were both really good. We had four entrees and had a hard time deciding which one was the best they were all so good. We had the filet, the lamb pappardelle, the beef brisket and the shrimp marinara. Would love to go back to this place again. Wish we lived closer!!

My most recent dining experience here was last night for Restaurant Week. Luckily, there was no wait, so we were able to be seated right away. The Martini staff is excellent and very attentive; there are multiple people always refilling water glasses, so there's no chance of going parch! The food is consistently good. I highly recommend the fresh mozzarella appetizer- freshly made when ordered, this thin piece of warm mozzarella comes with several slices of toasted focaccia, their house made pesto, and the most delicious roasted tomatoes I have ever had!I can also vouch for their beef carpaccio appetizer, which is my absolute favorite. It's hard to go there and NOT order it!!The butternut squash tortelloni was very good, without being over the top rich like I thought it would be. Think massive tortelloni- the shape is a blend of tortellini and ravioli, with lots of creamy squash filling! The cream sauce nicely compliments the tortelloni without over powering it, and the few brussels sprout leaves and crushed marcona almonds provides a nice texture contrast.The short ribs are pretty good- I have to say I rarely order short ribs so can't be too critical. They were a tad on the fatty side, but I guess that's what short ribs are. The creamy polenta was delicious, as was the reduction of whatever that saucy goodness was on top of it. I have had the lamb papperdelle a few times, too- that is probably my staple dish there. AND, if you somehow have room for dessert after the end of the meals, I highly recommend the chocolate bread pudding. OMG my mouth is watering just thinking about it!!Good food and great service, what more can you ask for? The only "hiccup" we experienced with restaurant week was the fact that the second and third courses came out together about five minutes after we got our appetizer. We politely asked them if they would mind keeping it warm while we finished our appetizer, which they had no issue doing. They then brought the second course and followed with the third course after we finished. Can't wait to come back!

The atmosphere was very chill and it was kind of high class. The white oval bar was pretty cool but didn't get to sit there. The bruschetta was awesome. The portions for entrees were slightly small but tasted great. Martins menu was very big but a given because of the name of the restaurant. I would recommend this place to anyone for dinner and you might want to have a reservation.

Food: I love Cameron Mitchell restaurants, for me the Ocean Club is the best restaurant in Columbus.  However, our meal at Martini's was horrible.  The calamari was the worst I've ever had, and the parmesan chicken was dry with a tomato sauce that tasted like it came out of a can. I would say you could get better at the frozen food department at the grocery store.Service: The waiter was friendly enough, and the wait for our food reasonable.  However, we were one of the last three tables of the evening, and apparently our waitress decided to tend to some closing tasks and left us.  It took us a good 15 minutes just to get the bill.Major pro: 50% off wine bottles less than $100 on Sunday's.  This was the only bright spot of the meal.Summary: Totally sub-par food, especially when you figure the price you're paying.

Food = aService = b+Environment = cThere was very loud everything going on in the restaurant- some thumping music which was vibrating our chairs and then had to yell to hear each other- made us want to leave- the food was extremely savory though and the grapefruit gimlet was very good!

I have to say I was pleasently surprised by this place.  I really did not know what to expect and had a crappy day so was expecting a not so stellar, yet overpriced dinner.  Martini delivered 5 stars on every level in my opinion. Upon entering, we were greeted by a super nice host... quite chipper given the dreary weather I must say!  We were immediately sat at our table as we awaited our other guest who was going to be a few minutes behind us.  The server, Michael I believe was his name, was on the ball... made sure we had waters immediately and asked if we wanted anything while we waited for our guest.  We got the Calamari app and salads... I got the Arugula one... LOVED it.  I am becoming a huge fan of them and theirs was pretty awesome.  Some places do not get the right mix of sweet/salty/bitter... they did and that is what I think makes the salad. All three of us got the Scallop dinner special with orzo.  To die for!  I would go back and drive the 3+ hours to get there just to have this again (that is how good I thought it was). Great service, nice atmosphere and awesome food makes this a great choicw if you are ever in the Columbus area looking for downtown grub.

Tourists are we, and we wandered around Short North for a bite to eat.  We hit upon Martini's and are so glad we did.  It was busy in there but we couldn't tell as our waitstaff was very attentive.  Nice ambiance, lower lighting, excellent waitstaff, hostesses, and though I didn't see them, the cooks are excellent. The menu is not large, but there is plenty to choose.  I didn't see any eggplant parm, and I asked the waiter about it.  She said they would make it, even though it's not on the menu.  My sister and I decided to split an order and get a Caesar salad to go with it.  The salad was pretty darn good.  Yes, it was a simple salad but the homemade croutons!!!! They  seemed soaked in butter but not soggy.  Just flavorful and a tad crunchy.  I was delighted that the croutons were not square, they were hand torn.  Nice touch!   The eggplant came out, and was I ever happy with it. There were two large thick  pieces of eggplant, not peeled, atop linguine and tomato sauce, and cooked to perfection with mozzarella on top and baked til bubbly.  My sister and I split the eggplant, and it's a good thing we did.  It seemed we each got a full portion.   Of course I asked for the fresh parmesan to be put atop, big 1" curls of the stuff. YUM.  There was so much eggplant that I ate only a bit of the linguine, which was firm and done to perfection. My sister had chicken carbonara and ate every bit.  Other sister had butternut squash ravioli, and although I am not a fan and evidently  neither is she, I am sure that someone out there will like it. It was definitely homemade, not ordered from a supplier. Butternut squash isn't for everyone.  The bread and pesto and dipping oil  were outstanding.  There were a lot of prom groups dining so this tells me Martini's has a good reputation.  I will definitely be back if  ever get the chance to go to Columbus again.

Like all of the Mitchell Restaurants: high priced and moderate food items, set in a pleasant, welcoming atmosphere. The food was to be desired, based on the cost.  Service was as to be expected. I would personally try something different if I were to dine again in the short north.

Cameron Mitchell can do no wrong. We went last Saturday and had a great time. Handcrafted cocktails at the bar while waiting on the reservation. Dinner was fantastic. The freshly made mozzarella app was delicious. I had the lamb papardelle and she had the sirloin. The tiramisu for dessert was the best I've ever had. Overall, a bit pricier than Marcella's, but worth it once in a while.

I was in town aug 31- sept 3 for my nephews open heart surgery. I stayed at the Hilton next door to here & I stole my sister away from the hospital for a bit to treat her to a nice dinner. Our waitress (I can't remember her name ) was so sweet. Very informative with the menu. I had the grapefruit gimlet to drink. Very refreshing! My sister ordered the chicken carbonara & I had the penne alla vodka sauce. They were both amazing!! The waitress asked where we were from, told her OK & the story about my nephew. She said she would be praying for him. A few minutes later, the manager came out. She said the waitress told her about my nephew & she wanted to take of dessert for us, & wanted to send one back to the hospital for my brother in law. Then she said, anytime you want food, call & we will deliver it to the hospital for you, because you need to eat good while you're here! They don't usually deliver. We were so blown away by their kindness & generosity. So not only is the food amazing, so are the people that work there!

This bar is so nice. The decor makes you feel all fancy! Great for date night or a nite with the girls. I was able to have drinks and dessert here with friends this week. I like the vanilla creme brulee I had. Service was good. I would go back when in the area.

You definitely have to love $5 martini's during happy hour.  To go along with a delicious beverage are half-priced appetizers which do not disappoint.  I especially enjoy their antipasto della casa for both the flavor and the quantity.  Another 'perk' if you will are the large windows (which open when it's nice out) which allow you to enjoy the vibrant city while sipping an ice cold martini.  The only downside to is they tend to get quite busy once they open so be sure to stop by early.

I ate here with a large group during a training weekend.  I got the modern Italian twist right away when I perused the menu.  I ended up getting the special, which was expertly done salmon with gnocchi and some field greens.  Our table split the bruschetta and calamari appetizers, and just about everyone got either a glass of wine or a signature martini.  Oh, and that bread?  Fabulous.  Loved the pesto, and it was an interesting change of pace to eat slightly sweet, very light Italian bread.  Everyone's food looked amazing, and several of us ate the salmon and agreed that it was a great dish.  We ordered four desserts to share as well, and all were tasty, but the tiramisu was a bit off in terms of the ratio of ladyfingers and espresso to cream.  It seemed to be mostly cream, really.  The chocolate torte was pretty mind-blowing, though, and I ended up polishing off the last of it when it made its way down to my end of the table. My only gripe about the restaurant overall--and it's not a deal breaker for returning, I assure you--is that it's a bit dark inside, and very, VERY loud.  It was difficult to have a conversation even with the person next to you.  This is a great place with fantastic food, though, so I'd recommend it to others looking for a solid option in downtown Columbus.

Martini was around when I still lived in Columbus back in the '90's and I thought that through the years, the focus kind of shifted to Marcella's and Martini was the 5th wheel of the Cameron Mitchell restaurants.  I'm happy to say I was wrong.  Martini was a fresh, welcome surprise.  My partner and I dined here a few days before Christmas and had a great meal. I don't remember Martini being this upscale and food focused.  We started with the tuna crudo which was awesome. For my entree I went with the short rib.  There was a little chunk of fat but overall it was a good dish. My partner had the veal martini and he loved it.  Desserts were okay but not as good as the rest of the meal.  Our server was engaging and paced our meal perfectly so we could enjoy our night.Martini is definitely not the "red headed stepchild" of the Cameron Mitchell group.  It stands out as one of the better restaurants in the city.

We had the fresh mozzarella app which was awesome. Carpaccio had a nice crunchy polenta 'cake' ontop. I'm not a fan of polenta, but make it crunchy and I am!She had chicken parm which was good and filling. I had chicken carbonara that was great, so rich with bacon you didn't even need the chicken. Sunday is 1/2 off wine night, we lucked out!Bread pudding was a great tasting sponge for all our wine. Highly recommend and would come back. The overall feel/decor/service here was top notch, Jeffrey (server) was cute & serious & totally professional -- as opposed to last night's meal, I always had all my utensils, plates and was asked about my meal within 5 minutes of getting it. Feel like I wasted my time at Level last night.
Very busy, very high class (Read expensive) and very loud! Only had drinks, so the food may not be as bad.

We dined here on a Friday night. 7:15 reservations. We were seated right away, served our Martinis quickly - we both ordered the Modern Martini - it was average, at best. I expected a better martini at a place named for them...We started with the mozzarella appetizer - nice flavor; the pesto was good. I ordered the Marsala - it was good. My date ordered the tuna, which was cooked perfectly and quite tasty. Our server never returned to check on us. We sat for a very long time after we finished eating. We were never offered another drink. The food was good, but not exceptional. With the less than stellar service we received, we won't be returning. There are too many good dining choices in Columbus to visit where the food AND service are exceptional.

Well... I can't give a bad review... My Fiance and I got Engaged here! Although, I can still justify all the great things about Martini due to us being there before we were engaged!The staff is wonderful, great attitudes, great wait staff, all seemed very very helpful! It was obviously a surprise with the engagement, but my Fiance had a lot of help from the Manager and Staff in the planning process. They created, what looked like a menu and gave it to me calling it the "Specials," which was actually the proposal. The staff had arranged to provide a dozen roses after the proposal as well as two glasses of Champagne, which was a great help to my Fiance, because he said he was beyond nervous for proposal and they assisted with everything to make it run smoothly!Besides a fantastic memory... the food is delicious and we have never had any complaints. It's one of the better Italian Restaurants in Columbus and has a great atmosphere. It does get busy on the weekends since it's a prime location and is very popular. Make reservations if at all possible.We will definitely be going back!

Excellent ! Great atmosphere & ambiance. We had the veal tortellini and alla vodka pasta dish. Both were fantastic. The Caesar salad was incredible as well! If you are looking for Italian this is a must do.As a side note the martini's are superb

We went there for a business dinner. Everything was remarkably over-priced. I'm a chef, I know. We choose to not even enjoy drinks, the reason we went there so early. We ordered food, although descent, was overly rich.Too much so. I had my waitstaff box my left-overs. I threw it away outside. It seemed like the staff didn't care. Maybe they were having a off night. The chicken Picata was inedible....

My wife and  I had forgotten how good this place is. It was packed for our 8pm reservation but seating was prompt and service was excellence. The only hiccup was not bringing extra olive juice for my wife's martini but the server made up for it by "freshening" it up at the end, so she needed up getting almost an extra martini. The food, butternut tortellini was outstanding. My special was the pork shank on risotto and the gremolata was the part of the dish that brought out all the flavors. We will be back soon! O and the bread pudding for dessert was awesome. Great job!

Have been here several times for drinks at the bar and twice for dinner in the dining room since the remodel. One of the few places in Columbus where servers are well-trained in fine dining service. Service wasn't rushed, but nothing lagged either.Must try the mozzarella appetizer; housemade, it literally starts as curds. Served with crostini, tomato and a delicious pesto. Though I think it is best without the pesto bc of the quality of the cheese. Bread was served warm, maybe have changed this as mentioned in other reviews.Also ordered:Caesar salad-hubby loved he could order anchovies. Dressing made with anchovy paste--as it should be.Seared Scallops on creamy polenta.
