Perfect carmelized sear, as it should be.Chicken Paremesan (no ordinary chx parm) Lightly pan fried, precisely topped with rigatoni and melted mozzarella, ensuring a perfect bit.Chocolate bread pudding--the best of both worlds: bread pudding and the chocolate hazelnut melts when cut like a lava cake.Coffee-don't underestimate the power of a good cup of coffee at the end of a meal. didn't disappoint.Cocktails:Short North Tea. Since I am big a limoncino fan; could've used a tad more.Manhattan, up. woodford reserve, vanilla bean, amaretto soaked cherries.

I'm a fan of Cameron Mitchell restaurants and this one doesn't disappoint. The ambiance is perfect for a date or ladies night. They even have TVs at the bar for the fellas. Service is excellent, prompt & friendly. The food is fresh & delicious! The portions are larger than expected for all meal types. And the wine is great as well! Well worth every penny.

Simply put, one of the best meals ever!  Sure, you can get great food, wine or service other places but for all three to be nothing short of spectacular at the same place?  Amazing!We came on a Friday night while visiting Columbus from the East Coast and didn't realize what a gem we had stumbled upon. We had a great little table for two near the back but on a raised up level where we could see the bar and most of the dining area.  It was a vibrant place, busy but not obnoxiously crowded.  Our waitress Jonida was warm, let us dine at our pace, had fabulous recommendations and really was like a friend by the end of our meal.  We knew just from talking to her when we first sat down that we would be enjoying ourselves.We began with a great bottle of Barolo ( which they assisted on selection after we had narrowed it down) that was every bit as fruity AND full as promised.  I always appreciate when the restaurant actually suggests the less expensive of two bottles.  Next we ordered calamari - so lightly breaded.  I think my husband ate every bit of the flavorful peppers on the dish.  The house bread is also light, not dense, and the fresh house made basil pesto alone is worth writing home about. I usually pass on bread to save room but this was worth the indulgence.We continued to struggle with decisions since the entire menu looked appealing.  Jonida saved us by offering that we could have half orders of the pasta so our next dish was a half order of the lamb pappardelle.  Good thing she brought the bread earlier because after we finished this dish, we used it to soak up the fabulous Chianti wine reduction that remained on the plate!  The braised lamb was so tender and flavorful and the half portion was just enough.Our third course was our toughest decision but we went big with the tenderloin and the scallops.  Jonida recommended the tenderloin and of course she didn't steer us wrong here either.  Both were cooked to absolute melt in your mouth perfection.  The kind of dishes that makes you close your eyes after you take a bite, just savoring the flavor and textures. Some espresso and bread pudding and we were two of the happiest people on the planet!  As we ended our meal, we decided this is one of the best dining experiences we have ever had, comparing it to some of our favorite meals in Tuscany over the years.  Really, truly exceptional.  If we were local we would be regulars and can't wait for our next trip to Columbus.

The handmade pasta is delicious! I went here on a business trip for dinner. The service is great and so is the food. We enjoyed the calamari and bruschetta for appetizers and they we both very tasty and the two I would recommend. I also enjoyed a Caesar salad followed by the tuna. The tuna is flown in daily and they frequently run out as it is a very popular item. I did have the tiramisu, but would not order it again. I would highly suggest this place!

My husband called me from a conference out of state to rave about this restaurant! He said I have to put this on yelp because it was THE BEST Italian food he has ever eaten! Of course, I was starting to get jealous when he described the gnocchi, made from scratch, and the ravioli which was "to die for". The lasagna, melt in your mouth lasagna, was compared to that of a famous Italian chef we know personally in Santa Monica, CA. Food and ambiance=5 each, Service=4.5.He promised to take me there if we ever go to Columbus!

The food and ambiance are great. I just wish I hadn't seen a bartender cut her eyes toward me when speaking to a server, I guess because I was sitting at a busy corner of the bar (because it was the only seat available at the bar when I arrived as a party of one hoping to eat and drink).

Special Note:  All reviews are made from a Wheat Free Gluten Free point of view and may not align with other reviews based upon non-restricted eating.* * * * *   Menu Offerings - GF Menu* * * * *   Food Quality - Awesome* * * * *   Service and Staff - Friendly, Fast, Knowledgeable, and Proactive* * * * *   Surroundings - Upscale as a Martini Bar and Restaurant should beThe Martini Modern Italian is about as good as it gets to be wheat and gluten free.  A large Gluten Free menu (not grain free though) with "homemade" gluten free bread and pasta.We walked in as a party of three without reservations and was seated immediately.  Although the temperature outside was 4 degrees and the day of the week was a Wednesday, the restaurant was crowded but still had plenty of seating.The wait staff gave me a gluten free menu right away.  The main waiter noticed and when the bread came for my friends (who aren't wheat free), he informed me that the chef was preparing some homemade gluten free bread for me.  This was a surprise as I usually watch my friends eat the wheat based bread.  I have learned to do without.The meal itself was most excellent.  I had shrimp with penne pasta in a red sauce.  Very good.  I even had a second round of gluten free bread.  Perhaps the meal was so very good because immediately prior to the meal, I had just completed a 26 hour fast.  I do believe the meal was awesome despite the fast although when I counted up the calories with the Tuna appetizer, the half caesar, pasta dish, gluten free bread, and wine, the calorie count came out to my daily allowance plus my workout calories gained.  From a wheat free standpoint, the Martini Modern Italian stands out in the top 5 restaurants I have visited.

Lets talk about why this place gets so many 4 and 5 stars . Its the bar stupid not the food. If you want a great place to drink, hang, see and be seen this is the place.Great views, bright , well lit and easy access from anyplace in downtown columbus.The demogrphics is mid 30 and over professionals so you Ohio State kiddies have better places to hang.Ok so now lets down to business on the food ( lol ) .Let me start off with saying I never mind the price of the food if its good , moderate portions and meets your expectatons but ...Ok I order Grilled Prawns for starters and I have never been anyplace in the USA that gives you less then or more then 4 prawns .Well my friends these were rare "Golden Prawns" lol , you get two on a giant dish with some fancy attempt at home made sauce/brushetta dont know it was mystery addition to the dish. Two Golden prawns for $18.95 hahahha .Ok so then I figure let me ask for advice on my next dish. Steak or Shortribs the server suggest "shortribs" They were short alright ( wait for it lol ) they were short on ribs -- total of two ribs , yes two , 2, duce, 1+1 =2 , 4-2=2 , yes two ribs !!!! REally , it was actually funny , I cant make this stuff up , two ribs !! I would have been better off with McRibs lol. Howveer they were placed in a nice cicle of mashed potatoes that made a 8" circle under the ribs hiding there inadequit size that would even challenge the most understanding women in the USA who understand shrinkage, these ribs had serious shrinkage lol .So lets look at the pattern -two prawns , two ribs , I could imagine if I had ordered desert would I get two bites from an easy bake over cake lol ???Owned by the same guy who owns the Pearl you will see rave reviews bla bla bla , I guess you have to be on the food channel, and super footie when a bite is beter then a meal to really like this style restaurant but its not for me .Me and my buddy had three drinks each, Baby size fisher price meals for a total bill of $154.00 .We both said when done --lets go get a pissa lol ! Again great bar, great views and great location , but if your hungry for food take it someplace else if your hungry for culture your in the right place , shame they feel in all there formarts that they can trade one for the other !!!!

We had our daughter's grad luncheon at Martini's. The entire experience was AWESOME!  Alex (GM), Hanna (Event Coordinator), Ryan (Exec Chef) did an OUTSTANDING job!  We had a GREAT experience & feedback from our guests. We cannot thank you enough for all that your team did. Thank you & we will certainly be back!

I'm sad to be leaving a 3 star review, because historically Martini has been one of my favorite restaurants in Columbus.  I came here for an outing with friends.  The food and drinks were great - most of my review is based on a style of service that the restaurant has adopted that isn't to my taste.Four of us ordered cocktails.  Instead of bringing the cocktails, prepared glasses were set before us, and our server came with a shaker, shook our cocktails, and then strained them into our glasses - which might have been cool except she was shaking the shakers everywhere while she strained them and we all got splashed with cocktail.  Also two of the cocktails were martinis, which should be stirred, not shaken.We'd had lots of time to look over the menu, but when she came to take our orders, she talked us through the entire thing as if we weren't capable of reading and comprehending the menu items on our own.I ordered the nightly special, which I admit to being underwhelmed by.  Our starters were delicious, though, and my friends all enjoyed their food.   I loved the wine suggestion our server provided, though.  I'd be more than happy to update my rating if a subsequent visit changes my mind.

Seriously so good. One of my favorite Columbus restaurants. Pricey but worth it. The drinks are fabulous to the salads and main plates. Must try the butternut squash tortellini!!! It's is to die for! Great staff, nice atmosphere-swanky, excellent food!!! Will go back time and time again!!!

Beautiful and classy restaurant serving refined Italian food. All of the dishes are well prepared and presented using fresh and high quality ingredients. The antipasto plate offered a nice variety and was enough for my table of 4. For dinner I was impressed with their ability and willingness to handle any special needs. They offered me a half portion of any entrÌ©e when I discussed my own personal needs. The restaurant is great for a nice business dinner or a romantic date.

Went here twice, was rather disappointed the first time.  I had ordered the salmon and for dessert tiramisu, the salmon, while meant to be subtle in taste, bordered more upon the bland, while the tiramisu was dressed up as a cup of coffee, which was aesthetically pleasing.  However it was overwhelmed with more of the cream than anything else. Went back the second night and had the chicken carbonara and was not disappointed. I had forgone dessert as it was late and it was too warm in the restaurant.  I will say the rest of my party truly enjoyed their selections of wine, rave reviews on that!

I've been here twice, I had the butternut squash tortoloni both times which was fantastic. The calamari, fresh mozzarella, and arancini appetizers are wonderful starters. I also suggest the pear and spinach salad.

Martini's has nice atmosphere, moderate lighting and medium noise level. I ordered the fettuccine & clams which did not look like the picture on the website but was still tasty. It was buttery with good flavor. I would have like some citrus to cut the buttery rich taste and a little more clam. We got the chocolate tort for dessert and it was delicious. Light and rich at the same time, the chocolate and peanut flavors were amazing. Overall, a pricy place with food where other places can replicate for less. Basically you pay for the atmosphere.

My staff and I were visiting from Indiana and staying in a near by hotel. For dinner we decided to pick this restaurant. The interior of the building is beautiful. I love that the bar is set up in the front and the seating area for the restaurant is the the back. The place was packed when we dined. I was not surprised because the food was super good. The restaurant is expensive. It does have $$$ as the expense. So if you are okay with that. I would recommend it.

We went here for our 18 wedding anniversary and everything was excellent! I recommend the Mozzarella and Lobster Risotto for appetizers. Service was on point! From the time we walked in until we left, everyone was wishing us a Happy Anniversary. Thanks Martini for a memorable and remarkable anniversary and a special thank you to Katie!!!

Like the vast majority of the 99 reviewers before me I have taken enjoyment in my visits to Martini. I've arrived for dinner a couple times, but most of my experience has been at the bar. The ambiance is on the modern side and the dress ranges from nice-casual to business suits.As mentioned by many others they have an excellent dark cherry manhattan. It can come off a bit sweet if you aren't expecting it, but as someone who has a deep appreciation for whiskey and whiskey related beverages I approve of it. They also do fairly well at making an Old Fashioned (my favorite cocktail). In fact I usually judge all upscale sorts of places in some part on that cocktail, and they have passed... for now.The wine special on Sunday evenings is something to make a trip for as well. One can get a lovely dinner, a bottle of wine to share and enjoy a wondrous evening of food and libation without completely destroying their wallet.
Very Italian! Be careful on appetizers, they are bigger than expected... Handmade mozzarella a must. Tenderloin was a home run!!
Good food, great service. Great desert. Good atmosphere ....Would recommend if in Columbus
Really beautiful restaurant-quality dining experience for sure! Get the Filet Mignon!

Their food is very good but we have only had one great experience with service and the last time we went our water was not very accepting of food allergies and was not very willing to make any accept ions. If you are planning on going to this restaurant I would suggest that you ask for a water named Mo.

I made this reservation during a business trip for a group.  We wanted trendy and classy and that's exactly what we got.  The wine list was great, even though the first four bottles I asked for the restaurant was out of.  That was quite disappointing because they didn't note that on the menu, nor did our server mention it before I ordered.  Beyond that, the food was delicious.  The prawn appetizer was quite tasty and served in a lovely red sauce with vegetables.  Everyone ordered something different from the lamb pasta to the veal parmesan and they all were very happy.  I ordered the scallops on the menu and they cut like butter and were cooked to perfection.  Overall a great experience and definitely someplace I would recommend on any future trip to Columbus.  Extremely enjoyable.

We had dinner with four people on Friday night. We had made reservations which I highly encourage for dinner. We were seated but didn't get attention from a server right away. Once I asked, the server came by and apologized profusely. It was genuine and unusual for this type of restaurant. She took our drink orders and moments later an appetizer appeared - on the house - to apologize for the miss. I appreciated the server going above and beyond to make up for the miss. Dinner arrived promptly as well and was very tasty. I was so incredibly impressed at the service relieved despite the initial experience.
Very solid all around...best wait staff that I've experienced in a long time.  This was a return visit and there will be more visits in the future.Every course was delicious.

My boyfriend and I took his 9-year-old daughter to Martini for a "fancy dinner" treat, as she had requested Italian. We definitely picked the right place.The service was top notch - accommodating for the young lady without babying her. She got a huge Shirley Temple with tons of cherries, but ordered lasagna for dinner off the regular menu. I enjoyed the penne in vodka sauce, boyfriend loved the short ribs. Highly recommend the dark cherry Manhattan. We could've drank 10 of those. The description makes it sound like it'll be too sweet, but it's not. I want to go back just to have another one! On a Saturday night the valet was kind of a mess when we went to leave, so don't be in a hurry to get to your next destination on busy evenings.

The only reason this restaurant is getting 2 stars is for the outstanding customer service and the awesome drinks. The martini's and pine fin are made perfectly.The food however was so disappointing and lacked taste. The customer service was excellent, you are greeted with a smile and for the most part everyone is very attentive. The food, we started with the beef carpacio-flavorless, dry, and the beef did not seem to be quality at all. The bread that was brought over was ice cold, literally ...it seemed to be taken fresh out of the fridge. Scallops were ok, but not the best I have ever had. The flavor again was lacking.The tenderloin, was again just ok, not the best cut and it was flavorless, the pasta that accompanies it(the 6 pieces of small rigatoni), not even cooked correctly. Waitress was for the most part attentive , but seem to disappear alot. As soon as we told the waitress the food was lacking , the manager came right over to see what she could do to make our meal better, with out us even complaining. Again , customer service great, drinks great, food very disappointing.

We went around dinner time during the week.  The front of the restaurant is buzzing with people near the bar.  The tenderloin was strongly recommended so I tried it.  I am not a big fan of putting cheese on top of my steak.  It was ok and it was cooked right but probably should have tried one of the pasta dishes.  Appetizers (bruschetta, calamari and mozzarella cheese) were good.

I recently made a "dinner trip" up to Columbus for my mother-in-laws birthday. Didn't know what to expect since I did not pick the restaurant. My thoughts are below. Big props for half off wine night on Sundays. Our table had two bottles. Decor and Staff - Both were very wonderful. Our waiter was kind, personable, and more than attentive. Food - We have the calamari and scallops. Both were fantastic. The scallops were cooked perfectly. The hot peppers that can with the calamari were fantastic. Best calamari I've had outside of San Fran. I ordered the Lamb Pappardelle. Pappardelle is my favorite pasta - so I had high expectations. Everything about the dish was delicious. I typically hate mushrooms but actually found myself really enjoying them. I had the Banana Chocolate Bread Pudding for dessert. This was also fantastic. The chocolate came rushing out of the bread once you cut into it. The perfect ending to my meal. I would recommend anyone to stop by this place if you are in Columbus. I will definitely be going back!

I was in town with some colleagues on business and went because another colleague recommended the fresh pulled mozzarella . Overall, I'm glad that we went.  Our server, Justin and the GM, Alex, were very, very attentive and patient with all of our questions. (We are opening a restaurant and had a lot of questions about product, procedures and their operational and menu choices in general.)  In regards to service, by far, they deserve way more than 5 stars. In reality, I should probably deduct a star for some minor critiques but since I was kind of hunting for criticism and the small points based on my own personal preference, five stars is well deserved. I'll still include my comments just for the sake of sharing my experience. In general, the flavors, price, presentation of food and drink was great. The pulled mozzarella was a little overworked and tough, but still enjoyable. The carpaccio was wonderful, but I wished for a little more greens and some acid to elevate the dish- the beef was a little lost. Still, very good, though. The jumbo prawns were enjoyable- I don't think they were a shining star, but I certainly wasn't disappointed. We also ordered the lamb pappardelle which I really liked, but my colleagues were looking for a a little more "lamb" flavor. I don't really care for lamb so I found it very good. The sauce on the tortelloni and ravioli didn't have significant differences in their flavor profiles and while a bit heavy, the pasta/filling ratio was spot on and flavors pretty well balanced. I'm in love with the lemon tart. I certainly didn't need dessert, but I couldn't stop eating it!  All in all, it was a great meal and a wonderful experience- I'll surely be back next time I'm in town. Thank you Alex and Justin for making our evening such an enjoyable and informative experience!
Excellent calamari, perfectly grilled filet, scallop dish was amazing - great atmosphere -  oh and a perfect beefeater martini

Absolutely delicious!  Food was fantastic, the atmosphere was great, and it was an overall delight.  The servers were attentive and knew the dishes cold!  If your a fish eater, I highly recommend the salmon - it's fantastic and you will be extremely pleased you went with it.  Everything was simply mouth watering, and served with the perfect balance of temperature.  Overall, you can't ask for a better meal which is moderately priced.  This venue is definitely worth taking the time to visit.  However, come hungry, as the portions are generous.

Worth trying at least once.Pros:Panzanella salad is a must try!  I've had it twice and was delicious both times.Restaurant is very accommodating in splitting items.  My husband and I ordered several items and they split them on two plates each.Our server was both times we have gone have been great - always providing recommendations, quick refills, and keeping us updated on any delays on our order.Cons:Restaurant has a very open floor plan and is LOUD.  Not the best spot if you actually want to talk to your date at less than a yell.Drinks - my husband and I were both disappointed in our cocktails.  My "the bazzi" drink had a bitter aftertaste.  The bartender sweetened it up and then it tasted like straight pineapple juice.

We had such an amazing time tonight ! It was our first time in martini's but zeek made us feel very comfortable at the bar by suggesting some popular menu items. My boyfriend got the veal martini I think was what it was called .. And I got the tuna .. Pittsburgh rare. It was cooked to perfection & the flavors were amazing. The manager, Ashley, also came behind the bar and greeted us which made us feel great since it was our first time in. Quite the modern feel yet inviting ambiance. We will definitely be back!

Absolutely the highlight of our night out, mainly due to Angie (our server), who was extraordinary! Started off with a bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon that she suggested and the beef carpaccio and bruschetta apps. We were dinning with friends who were regulars there, so we followed their lead in doing the chefs challenge. The dish I got was a seafood and pasta marriage made in heaven. I was thoroughly amazed at the layers of flavor in the sauce and how perfectly the pasta and seafood was cooked. The sauce was a sweet red sauce that had a very light refreshing finish to perfectly compliment the taste and texture of the scallops and shrimp. I used the complimentary bread (not to mention the pesto that accompanied the read was delicious) to sop up ALL if the remaining sauce and sent the plate back with not a streak of sauce on it. Clean plate club for me :)Amazing night, awesome food and extraordinary service. Will be going back and highly suggesting it to friends and family. Thanks Chef and Angie!

This is my favorite restaurant that I've been to in Columbus so far. It is a beautiful restaurant near the Arena District and it is very romantic. My boyfriend and I went here on a date night and had the best time. They have a great wine list and drink list with a little something for everyone. And....THE FOOD. Out of this world delicious. My boyfriend and I both started with the handmade mozzarella cheese. They literally make it right before they bring it to you. It's still warm. It comes tomatoes and pesto and if I remember correctly some bread. It's one of the simplest and most delicious things I've ever eaten. Second course, we both had the veal and spinach ravioli. Best pasta dish we've both ever eaten. I can't even tell you how good this is. The sauce is the most delicious thing ever. When the manager came over to our table, my boyfriend joked to him that he would have liked a spoon so he could drink the sauce...he didn't drink the sauce...don't worry.Third course, my boyfriend had the veal martini and I had the short rib. I had never had short ribs or polenta and this dish made me want to eat both every day for the rest of time. It was amazing. Also, the waitstaff were so, so friendly and as always with me, that goes a long way.If I had more money and lived closer to this place, I'm pretty sure I would weigh 400 pounds because I would want to eat here all the time. Take someone you're trying to impress here.

This was my second time visiting Martini. First time was great which made me come back. I wanted to treat my parents out to a nice and delicious meal, but we may not be returning.Food was great - we ordered the mozzarella (fresh with delicious pesto), penne alla vodka, lamb pappardelle (little too salty) and marsala (very well cooked and flavorful). Service was terrible. Our waiter mis-took our order so the wrong dish came out which we received the corrected dish towards the very end of our meal. Then he charged us for the wrong meal that we did not have which I pointed out during the check. Without any apologies, he said that they are all the same price and you can check the menu. Then he came back saying oh nevermind your dish was few bucks cheaper. Needless to say, we were not pleased with such poor service which really ruined our dining experience.

One of my favorite places in Columbus! Excellent service & staff that goes above and beyond. I really appreciated what our waitress did for my friend's birthday, even though we were only there for one round of drinks. She brought out 4 complimentary desserts! I have also eaten here and highly recommend the steak & the pastas!

The girls and I were Gallery Hopping this past Saturday, so we met at Martini for dinner and drinks beforehand. I started off with the Modern Martini, dirty of course. Awesome! It came with three (yes, 3!) gorgonzola stuffed olives. My friend ordered the Testarossa which was a fruity martini mixed drink. Had a sip--definintely tasty, although I am not one to enjoy sugary, sweet drinks. Quite a selection of antipasti and salads. I ended up ordering the Panzanella salad which had arugula, garlic croutons, fresh mozz, tomatoes drizzled with balsamic. Incredible! For my main dish, I ordered the Chicken Carbonara. It was okay--nothing special. I snagged a bite of my friends Butternut Squash ravioli. That's where it was at! The service staff was very attentive and willing to answer questions. My other friend couldn't decide between the clams dish and the shrimp radiatorre. The waitress offered to do a half plate of each. How accommodating!We were too stuffed for dessert, but I am sure they have some incredible selections.I hear they have an awesome Happy Hour too. If I can get to Arena District in a timely manner after work, my first stop will be Martini!

One of the finest and most relaxing Italian meals that I've had this side of the Atlantic. I started with a grapefruit gimlet, which I would highly recommend . Next was the house salad, done just right with a touch of Gorgonzola and perfectly dressed with vinaigrette . For my main course, a lamb parpadelle with mushrooms and a velvet brown sauce, finished with marscapone. A lovely decaf cappuccino and the evening is fine!

This is my favorite bar and Dana and Janine are my emissaries to the top shelf.  I could sit at this illuminous white marble bar for hours and relax an afternoon away sipping on their delicious frosty martinis....oh wait I already do that

Tremendous service (Angie)l, excellent wine list and cocktails, marginal cuisine.We went here while in town on business for our anniversary.  Highlights:  beautiful space; well though-out wine list; very creative and inspiring crafted cocktails; hip neighborhood; perfect service.Lowlight:  we expected to be wowed by the cuisine and were disappointed.  For all the hype, we would have enjoyed a menu with deeper layers of creative and extraordinary flavors and textures.  We think you could get this menu pretty much anywhere.  That said, the execution of the menu items was good but not memorable.We would go there again, but most likely just for drinks and apps.

Outstanding food and superb service.  The panzanella salad was perfectly presented and very tasty. The chicken piccata was great and fish special on butternut squash infused risotto was to die for.  The staff was very attentive and made the evening very special.

Love love love! Great ambience, great staff, amazing food!I always try to ask for Michael G. for a server. I could go in and never open a menu and trust in his recommendations that our meal will be unforgettable!

I love this place.  Super convenient valet for $5.  Beautiful, trendy decor. Really attentive and educated servers and bartenders.  And the food is really great.What I order: Pear elderflower martini  - really awesome, with powdered sugar in it, I believe.Ahi tuna appetizer - the only place I've found that does it right.Panzanella - bread salad to die for!Prawns - this entree is way too much food for one person and the prawns are cooked just right.A bit pricy, but you get what you pay for and this is the perfect space for a date night or even a rehearsal dinner.

I really enjoyed the food, drinks and general feel of this place. It definitely has a modern feel, it's pretty and cozy. It's definitely a good date spot.I came here for a friend's birthday and there were 8 in our group. We started with drinks in the bar, which were all delicious. They really do know how to make a delicious dirty martini. The specialty cocktails were all really great, too. The bartender was hilarious and played along with our group of ladies who were clearly looking to have a good night.The server was fun, funny, understanding and patient. I'm sure it's difficult to work with 8 tipsy adults, ranging in ages from 22-forties, but he never seemed annoyed by us. Everyone enjoyed their food and the atmosphere was perfect for laughter, drinking, eating and talking.I ordered the linguine with clams. It was tasty...full of clams. Not the best pasta I've ever had, but it definitely hit the spot. The bread alone was amazing and made it worth going there. They brought my friend a free birthday dessert. Some sort of chocolate, peanut butter cake that tasted of heaven and decadence. I wanted 17 more pieces.Maybe not my favorite "nice" place in Columbus, but there's not much that Cameron Mitchell forgets about when making a restaurant/ lounge. I will definitely be back here, although I would be interested in sitting in the bar area next time.
The lamb pappardelle was fantastic. The restaurant was busy but had a great ambiance and the service was very professional. Highly recommend this as a top choice in restaurants for the Columbus area.

After the Yelp Masquerade Party, looking our finest and having missed a lot of the cuisine, My lovely date and I weren't ready to call it a night. We were brainstorming about what restaurants were close by where we could walk in, me in a tux, her in a lovely fall number, and not be overdressed. One of us brought up Martini, and neither of us had been in a while, so we decided that was the spot. We had some discussion about whether it was still a Cameron Mitchell establishment or not (it is), and I commented that it had certainly been remodeled since I was last there. Now, I started this review two months ago, so specifics of the menu and entree selections are sketchy at this point, but despite the fact that the food was delicious, that's really neither here nor there because what I really want to talk about is our server. His name was, if I recall, Mike (if it wasn't Mike, it was Matt. I'm 100% sure it was one of those two, 70% of which is on Mike, if you want to request him). Mike delivered some of the best service I have received at any restaurant ever, and most certainly the best service I had in 2011. First of all, he was hilarious. Incredibly so. He had an astounding wit, and his timing was perfect. He only interjected with a quip at exactly the right time. He had a southern accent that might have affected my opinion a bit, but the banter was effortless. It didn't seem concocted or contrived. A really, really enjoyable experience.Beyond that, his recommendations, and we asked for numerous, were spot-fucking-on. We each picked out two dishes we wanted, and asked his opinion on them. High marks on steering us correctly. I don't remember what she had, nor exactly what I had, but I recall that it was a squash-based dish and it was fantastic. I asked for a wine recommendation as well, and it was equally accurate. Our final bill was in the neighborhood of $50, and the dining experience was miles above my recent visit to Rossi, where I dropped $108.I see spotty reviews for Martini, so my advice would be to request Mike. He's worth two stars by himself.

my date claims that this was the best food that she's had in her 6 months in ohio.  that's quite the compliment, coming from the culturally-rich boston area.+1 for accepting OpenTable reservations+1 for $5 valet parking (useful in the short north)+1 for professional maÌ¨tre d'+1 for seating us as soon as we walked in+1 for atmosphere.  dimly lit, nice chandeliers, classy bar area, candles on each table, modern white chairs, and even well-maintained rest rooms.  nice attention to detail.  (the only TV in the place was a small one near the bar area.)+0 for dress code ... smart casual.   dress it up a bit, and avoid wearing jeans.+2 for *great* service.  our server, ryan, was younger but gave us some of the most professional service that we've had in ohio.  he was friendly, courteous, knowledgeable about plates and wine, didn't rush us, and paid great attention to detail.  ryan brought us 3 different samples of wine to help us decide on what bottle to buy.+1 for "Sunday Wine Night", which means half off all wines by the bottle on sunday nights.  they will even re-cork any bottles that you don't finish so that you can take it home.+0 for decent bruschetta.  it was good, but not quite what i was expecting.+0 for decent bread.  the bread would have been better if it were served warm, not cold.+1 for *fantastic* pesto served with the bread.  some of the best i've had.-1 for not bringing our bread out until after we finished our appetizer.  seemed like a cheap ploy to get us to order an appetizer (and it worked).the "first plates" on the menu are pasta plates, and are not any smaller than the "second plates".+1 for allowing patrons to order half-dishes of the "first plates".+2 for fantastic butternut squash tortelloni (Parmesan Cream, Marcona Almonds, Brussels Leaves).  my date tells me this was easily the best tortelloni she'd ever had.  recommended.+1 for good chicken carbonara (Cresti Pasta, Smoked Bacon, Asparagus, Cracked Black Pepper, Parmesan, Cream).+1 for great pennette alla vodka (San Marzano Tomato Sauce, Prosciutto di Parma, Vodka Cream).  very good.  recommended.+1 for decent portions.  i had enough to fill me up, and my date had some to take home.+1 for having cognac on the dessert menu.  though i didn't have any this time, i might next time.+0 for being a bit pricey.  this is a great restaurant for special occasions.  for bruschetta, a half-price bottle of wine, and 2 entrÌ©es, i paid $64 (before tip).by the door we noticed a sign advertising for their weekday happy hour (4pm to 6pm).  $5 martinis and half-price appetizers.highly recommended.  ask to be seated in ryan's section.  we will return.

Always good service here.The butternut squash tortelloni is easily one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had in my life. They also have pretty great cocktails, but I feel kind of 'meh' about some of their entrees.

Great find!  Another coach and I hit this incredible place during the National Volleyball Championships.  The highlight of Columbus!  Here's what you should order there:Carpaccio ( to DIE for)Beet Salad ( so delicious and good for your colon)Braised Short Ribs ( even though it's Italian - delicious over their polenta)CHOCOLATE BREAD PUDDING.. Do not miss this!  The most delicious dessert ever!  And I have had a few.....

Had a great date here on a packed, prom-weekend night. Enjoyed a drink at the bar and were so content we barely noticed that we weren't seated until 30 minutes after our reservation. They offered us a free appetizer as an apology, but we said that wasn't necessary.For dinner we had the beef carpaccio, which was fine, but no competition for the spectacular spinach and veal ravioli. Dessert was even better -- a creamy, rich chocolate bread pudding that made me cry a little.I don't understand the bread -- dry and cold and no match for the delicious pesto it's served with. No big deal, though. Bread takes up room you should leave for ravioli and bread pudding.

I can tell you I've eaten are literally hundreds of Italian restaurants and Martinis tops them all. I'm from Pittsburgh and anytime I'm in Columbus I have to stop here. There isn't a bad entree on the menu and I've tried them all. The two i would have to recommend as my favorites would be the butternut squash tortellini and the chicken parmigiana. They both melt I'm your mouth.

I have been to Martini eight or ten times the past several years as I travel to Columbus on business several times a year.This is one of my favorite Columbus Restaurants.  The food is always very well prepared and the waitstaff provides consistently good service.Martini is always busy when I am there, so you know they are doing something right, but even though they are busy we always receive excellent service.If you are in Columbus and anywhere near the short north you want to check this place out.  You will be glad you did.

The first time I went I got the filet.  It comes on a small bed of fresh noodly pasta, with a chianti reduction sauce, and some kind of infused butter of some sort on the steak.  It is so goddamn good I don't know what to say.The second time I went I got the filet again.  It's that goddamn good.Third time I got the lamb and spinach ravioli.  Really great.  The pasta has that super-fresh just-made homemade kind of wonderfulness going on.  The ravioli filling is balanced and the sauce is creamy, delicious, and not too heavy.My family and I always share and try a bite of everyone else's dish, so I've tried a lot on the menu.  Everything has been so wonderful.  My least favorite was the lasagna, but that's just me.  I prefer it to be a little more sloppy/saucy.Martini's probably has one of the best salad's I've had: the panzanella.  Holy sh*t.  Homemade croutons that crunch and melt in your mouth at the same time = god.  Roasted tomatoes on the bottom, mixed greens on top, great dressing, not overpowering.  The best.Even their bread is memorable.  Fresh focaccia with a slight hint of sweetness along with the hint of saltiness.  Comes out with olive oil and balsamic on one plate, and another plate with the best pesto I've had.Go there.  NOW!

Bread- soft and yummy, came with a little bit of melted butter and salt sprinkled on it with pesto on the side. AMAZINGTo drink I had the Short North Tea and my boyfriend had the pinapple sage. Both were AWESOME.For dinner I had veal & spinach ravioli. The creamy sauce and cheeses were exactly what I was craving. My boyfriend ordered the chicken parm, and it came with ziti baked ontop of the chicken! And it was probably the most delicious chicken parm I have ever had. TO DIE FOR.I went there on a Wednesday night around 7:30 PM, so I am not sure what this place is like on the weekends, but the ambience was perfect, and our waitor was very nice and attentive. This could be one of my new favorite spots in Columbus. Who cares if it's pricey because you get what you pay for! Seriously go to Martini ASAP.
Knowledgable, friendly wait staff. Great food. Good wine. Fun night!

My go to place when we have people come into town and we want to show them the short north area.   Ambiance is really cool.  Food is delicious. I am a big fan of the chicken Parm with rigatoni cooked in it.
Outstanding food! My first time on a recommendation from a friend and was guided very well.

My wife and I came here for her birthday only because we had a gift card for Cameron Mitchell restaurants and it was priced mid-range.Our experience was pretty fantastic.  Service was great (he was around when we needed him but not bothersome).  We had the butternut squash ravioli, as suggested on here, and the chicken parmesan.  The ravioli was amazing; the chicken was good but nothing exceptional.The only slight disappointment about our experience was the martinis, which is funny considering the name of the restaurant.  My wife had the Yellow Cake Martini, which she enjoyed but it tasted more like a kids drink than an alcoholic one.  And I had the Dark Cherry Manhattan which was way too sweet for a manhattan.  At $12 a pop these should have been better in my opinion.The atmosphere was modern but had a classy feel.  There is no dress code but don't be a bum ... you'll stand out.

I stick with my 4 star review. My husband and I came back here for a quick bite and a cocktail while we were back in town for the weekend. We walked in and sat right at the bar and ordered a yellow cake martini (my standby drink choice here) and a vodka tonic for him. Both drinks were delicious as always. We both got a beef carpaccio to curb our hunger since it was still early for dinner but we were starving. My husband claims that Martini's is by far the best beef carpaccio he's ever had and was so happy we could get a plate while we were visiting. I agree. It's thinly sliced, melt in your mouth, amazing with a crispy fried polenta cake on top and a tiny bit of greens and grated parmasean. Order it and enjoy the party in your mouth. I want to give Martini's a 5, but for 2 beef carpaccio appetizers, 1 martini, 1 vodka tonic, and tip - we paid just over $50. That's a bit steep for a quick bite but I don't regret it because I was a very satisfied customer.

I've been eyeing Martini since I first moved up here in August. When I finally got the opportunity to eat there, I jumped on it.I was surprised to find that when I went to fill out an online reservation through Yelp for an 8:30pm table, at 5pm, they were booked up and I had to wait till 9:30pm. Which wasn't bad. It was a Saturday night so it was fun to go out late.I dined with a friend who was up for an adventure just as I was. They aren't kidding when they list the dress-code as fancy and dressy. It had an almost club-style clothing feel. Especially with the club-style music, dim lighting and flashy decor.  Which, by the way, was awesome decor. My friend and I loved it. Especially their holiday tree which they had just put up. The red chandeliers were hard to not look at.I had put a note on my Yelp reservation that I'm allergic to shellfish and she to certain nuts. Upon arrival our waitress immediately acknowledged that she had received that note and would be sure our food was allergen-free. I was impressed by this and thankful for it.We took forever to order our food. I spent a lot of time cross-analyzing the menu, guessing at terminology, and explaining what I could figure out to my friend. I was thankful that our waitress was very understanding of our slowness, and it didn't feel at all like she was trying to push us out or hurry us up. She told us three or four times "Oh it's no problem, take your time." At first she was as any waitress, checking on us frequently. But soon she realized that we were two snails and she let us take our time.We started with "Promtini's" because I'm not 21, and she didn't want to drink. They were super cute, pink, fruity, virgin martinis. Tasty! I like when restaurants offer at least one other option to daiquiris for us underage diners.After much deliberation, we settled on the mozzarella appetizer to start the food. We were mostly curious as to how this "cooked fresh to order" thing was going to work. Mozzarella cooked fresh? What?HOLY COW; it was delicious. The mozz was so soft, bouncy, and, surprisingly, sweet! have never had mozz that was sweet. The pesto, you ask? HOLY COW; it was delicious. I have never liked pesto before. But I could not get enough of that pesto. Mix the pesto, mozz, roasted tomatoes onto the crustini into one delicious bite and HOLY COW; explosion of flavor.We spent another 20 minutes or so picking the next course. We settled on the chicken carbonara. We were not sure what the portion size was going to be, so we thought maybe we'd have to get one or two more pasta plates to satisfy our appetites. However, it was a rather large serving and satisfied the both of us. I was impressed with the dish overall. The sauce came to our plate in perfect condition. The pasta was nice and chewy, not that gross slimy stuff that most restaurants serve. It was a bit odd that in contained huge, crunchy asparagus ends. I like asparagus, but the pieces were huge. I did enjoy the slivers of garlic that added little garlic explosions to every bite. The bacon could have been a bit more crunchy, and a little less chewy but it wasn't bad.After the pasta we settled on two separate desserts because she has a nut allergy and I wanted the cake that had nuts. Both desserts were delicious, but I did like hers better. She had the ice-cream style cake with cherry sauce. The sauce really made that dish special.Sometime half-way through dessert I glanced at my phone and realized it was 11:50pm. What a restaurant to keep us entertained for that long with only two plates of food, and two desserts. This is definitely gone on our list of return-to's.

I was in Columbus for the first time and we had hair arrived just a few hours prior and dining here couldn't have made a better impression on me. The service was first rate.  We started at the bar and the bartender recommended a cab that was just what I was seeking. Full bodied. Spot on. Missy greeted us and was so professional and friendly. Once seated, April explained the menu and helped us decide. She was great. The chicken Marsala and short rib were both amazing. The decor - modern Italian design. Highly recommend. We can't wait to Coe back to Columbus just to have the opportunity to dine here again!
Food was awesome!! I liked the dinner atmosphere and the waiter was educated on the dishes and drinks. I would definitely recommend to anyone for a romantic dinner date.

Love this restaurant, and we have never had a bad meal here.  Service has been excellent on every occasion except for one.  (Don't remember the servers name, but she was big and loud and obnoxious!)  The waiter with the shaved head is the best.  The chicken parm is the best on the planet.  There is no debate about it.  The rigatoni noodles on top of the chicken with the cheese and the sauce...OMG!  Those that have been here with me sample the rest of the menu, and they have always been happy!  This is #2 on my favorite list for Columbus behind Hyde Park Steak House, but they are completely different restaurants.

Great dining decor/ambiance, only issue is seating is a little crowded, we came on a monday day night though so not all the tables were filled. I came with my boyfriend and we each ordered a drink, I had the short north tea and he had the dark cherry manhattan. We were both very happy with the drinksFor an appetizer we tried the bruschetta. So good, the prosciutto is great on it. My entree was the chicken picatta. Honestly the best chicken I've had, and he sauce and fingerling potatoes were amazing. My boyfriend had the veal milanease and he also enjoyed his meal. Overall a bit expensive for a Monday night dinner, but very tasty.
Went for dinner - had an excellent server who gave great food recommendations. the mozzarella appetizer, ahi tuna and squash tortellini were unreal!!! Great atmosphere and delicious food!
What a place.  Great business dinner. I had beet salad, fettuccine and clams and it could not have been better.  This place needs to be talked about more often!  Our entire party loved it!

OMG. Let me just say that I would head back right now and order exactly what I got at dinner last FrIday night. This place was amazing! First of all, the decor and ambiance are fantastic! Secondly, the drinks are really really tasty. Vodka martini with gorgonzola stuffed olives-can't go wrong, but the real highlight was the grapefruit gimlet-YUM! So fresh-they go down waaaay to easily. Food wise-I got the veal spinach ravioli in a cream garlic sauce. Oh, heaven. Large slices of shaved garlic melted in my mouth-not great for talking to cute guys at the bar later on, but it was so good I didn't care. Delicious delicious! Then for dessert was the chocolate torte with homemade whip cream-seriously, I want more now! Food spendy? Yeah. But it's so worth it. I'd sell my (non existent) firstborn for more ravioli and torte.

I ordered Martini's a couple of times while working in Columbus this past summer, and I am still craving their chicken parm. I stayed next door at the hotel where they recommended me to try here. The first time I got the chicken parmesan - it was wonderful. The chicken was cooked perfectly and with a twist - it had the rigatoni over the top of the chicken with sauce and cheese. There was just enough sauce, which was wonderful, and the rigatoni was cooked perfectly. I crave this parm. For desert I tried the tiramisu. The portion was so huge I could not finish it. It was delicious. Creamy and full of flavor. The next time I ordered from here I got the lasagna - which was good, but a little salty for my taste, and the chocolate bread pudding - which was good, but nothing to write home about. The hostess and bartender both gave me a warm greeting each time I went to get take out, and they know how to package to go food - which was great as I needed to work back at my hotel. If I am ever in Columbus again I will make sure to stay next to Martini's so I can order their amazing chicken parm!
Had a fantastic experience at Martini.  Absolutely delicious butternut squash tortellini after the spring salad, which was deliciously light tasting.  Great service and nice atmosphere.

This is hands down my favorite happy hour spot.  Cocktails and Apps are heavily discounted and the ambiance is perfect.Highly recommend any of their special drinks.  My favorites are the Basil Vine Smash, the Italian Grapefruit Gimlet, and the Dark Cherry Manhattan.I usually order the Carpaccio and Mozzarella apps.  Ask them to throw some extra arugula on the Carpaccio.This is also my favorite Cameron Mitchell establishment.

Arguably my favorite happy hour digs.. the drinks are excellent, strong, and well priced, the service is good around the bar, and I always partake in at least one of their 1/2 price appetizers. Dinner is also yummy here, though the service is a little slower, and I'd be just as happy ordering dinner at the bar.
Great service, great cocktails, and great food equal a great restaurant! The mozzarella appetizer is a must!!  Columbus is lucky to have this gem!!

Since the dinner was paid for by someone else, I ordered something a little more of modest price off the menu because I didn't want to rack up the bill.   I ordered the chicken marsala which is one of my favorite italian dishes anyway.  The table shared a few appetizers such as the zuppa pomodoro, brick oven pizzetta, and calamari.  The stand out among these appetizers was the pesto in the zuppa pomodoro.  It was so good I would drizzle it on just about anything... hot dogs, bananas, sushi, you name it.  Now I sound like a pregnant woman with food cravings.Anyway, back to the the chicken marsala.  The chicken was nice and crispy with a very light marsala reduction sauce.  I'm more of a fan of braised chicken marsala, but I thought the dish was definitely better than the marsalas from some of the restaurants in Chicago.  Oh, and the creamy mascarpone polenta was just fantastic.  Lastly, I'm sure the classic tiramisu is good here, but order the chocolate banana pudding.  I was already stuffed at this point, but my stomach gladly made another chamber to accommodate this heavenly chocolate drizzled goodness.  Decor and service was great, why the four stars?  I just felt there was room for improvement on the some of the appetizers.  Overall, solid restaurant and another hit on my Cameron Mitchell tour.

Wow, what a disappointment!My company Christmas gift was a $100 gc to any Cameron Mitchell restaurant and I decided on Martini as it was close proximity to campus and sounded good...boy was I wrong!Perhaps what led to the unpleasant experience was that I got carry-out.  But I don't really accept that since I think the food and service should be good regardless of where the food is eaten.I ordered a beer at the bar while I was waiting for my food, and ordered the bruschetta and a salmon caesar salad.  Here are the "highlights":*Never received my beer.*Never received the opportunity to ask for said beer since I was ignored completely by the four "busy" bartenders. (Half the bar was empty.  Sorry, not ok.)*About 2 minutes before my food arrived, I was asked if I'd like something to drink.  Actually, I DID want something, but that was 20 minutes ago.  So no thanks anymore.*I had asked for the olive oil and balsamic that normally comes with the bruschetta to be in included, but in individual containers so the bread wouldn't get soggy by the time I got home.  I was told "no problem," yet received neither.*The bruschetta order (costing maybe $9) consisted of 2 pieces.  At 2 bites apiece, we're talking $2.25 a bite.  Perhaps I don't have an educated palate, but that's what I call a freaking rip-off.*The asparagus on the bruschetta (only ingredients I can discern are asparagus, proscuitto and cheese) was the ends only.  None of the good asparagus tips.  I personally would like to know why I got the shit produce.   Nobody likes the ends!  And at the aforementioned $2.25 a bite, they must be making around a 95% margin on this item.  *The tiny caesar dressing container was about half full (look at me, I'm an optimist!) and was nowhere near enough dressing for the salad.  And I'm one ofthose that uses only a small amount of dressing anyways, so for me to not have enough means the quantity was severely lacking.*The salad itself had a few random pieces of non-romaine in it.  Not a biggie, but it was clear something wasn't right.  There were also maybe 3-4 tiny pieces of what I finally figured out were roasted garlic.  Again, not a big deal, but WTF were they doing in the salad?So...yeah.  Not so pleased.  The only good things that came out of this experience was that I didn't eat a lot so my NY resolution is still on track, and it technically didn't cost me anything.

Took my sister to Martini for her birthday.  Group included three generations with an age range from 9 to 75.The service was outstanding - from reservations to dessert.My wife and I used to go to Martini occasionally when we lived in Victorian Village a while back.  It was good then, but they have raised their game.  Food was excellent.  Home made pastas were a hit for everyone (Butternut Squash, Veal and Spinach, and Chicken Carbonara all got rave reviews).  My steak was good, but I should have ordered a pasta.  The beet salad and Caesar salad got good reviews as well.  Bread Pudding Dessert and CrÌ¬me Brule were excellent.  The tiramisu was good, but not the best.Like I said, the service was outstanding.  The server and kitchen handled special requests easily and made everyone, including the young kids and birthday girl feel special.

Class Act operation here. I visit Columbus often and have yet to be disappointed. The staff is just fantastic. The decor is just cool . We had an extremely minor food snafu that was made right, right away.  Boyfriend wasn't impressed with the cheese temperature on his lasagna. We were not looking for more than a pack up of his entree ( he's paranoid about sending food back)  but the folks at Martini sent the manager over and he absolutely made it right. It was our second night in a row dining there. First experience that weekend was with two filets. Delish!  First experience ever was the braised beef. Go there. The service and food are SO worth it! They are busy for a reason, folks!

I am on the fence. I really like the atmosphere. I like being able to look outside from most places inside. I like the lighting. Ignoring prices, i like the food and most of the drinks. But when i take prices into consideration, i am no longer as happy with my food. Ive been a few times, never "blown away". I was happier with the old martini's.

The Cherry Manhattan was a perfect way to end the day and start a meal. Appetizers of ahi tuna and sea scallops whet our appetite for more. The Martini House salad was a wonderful blend of mixed greens, Gorgonzola, pine nuts and other fresh yumminess. Definitely coming back when next in town.

this is my favorite place to go to for special occasions and to take out-of-town guests... it's a block from my apartment and the food+drinks are A++++. i don't even like tomatoes but the bruschetta is the best thing ever... perhaps i could eat that for the rest of my life. the pastas are all amazing, but of course the butternut squash is so delicious. if you love italian food and great service - go here!edit: i went here recently after a hockey game and was wearing a sporty tee. the waiter was really judgmental, i couldn't believe the difference in the way i was treated this time versus the many other times. perhaps it figures but dress well every time for good service.

What can be said other than Fantastic!! My wife is Gluten intolerant and has mushroom allergies. Not a problem! Even went the extra mile to get her some gluten free bread. Already had gluten free pasta on menu. We had the Restaurant Week menu which was great and not skimpy! Happy to support!

Second chances aren't always redeeming. When my best friend picked Martini for a celebratory dinner, who was I to argue? I hadn't been here in over a year so I bit my tongue and thought maybe, just maybe, they'd improved. A word of advice to potential patrons: Read the menu carefully before you go! If you're vegetarian, they'll have to make something special for you. Every single dish on the menu has either fish or meat. If you're allergic to gluten, you'll either starve or have to do the same. And for safety sake DO NOT order off the gluten free menu! The mozzarella appetizer that's listed there comes with bread on the plate, which is both insulting and dangerous.As a carnivorous gluten-lover myself, I ordered the veal & spinach ravioli. It was decent, but a sad-looking portion for the $18 price tag. There was sauce poured onto half the pasta, but not the other half. I'm not sure if someone forgot to finish plating it or if the point was for me to try the dish both with and without a primary ingredient, but it kinda sucked. I will say that I really enjoyed the mango sorbet served with fresh berries we got for dessert, but certainly not enough to say my experience here has improved any. Sorry, Martini. Still slow, still mediocre, still overpriced. No thanks.

For once, I don't have much to say.  The pasta was tasty, though the noodles were far from el dente. Just sayin' that if a place plays itself off as Modern Italian, they can at least cook the noodles right. The drinks were pricey as my Maker's Manhattan cost $9, which if I wanted to spend $9 on bourbon I would have gotten scotch. The atmosphere was pretentious at best and our server had the personality of a goldfish. Beyond all that, I am sure some people would really enjoy the place, its just not for me.1 HUGE problem:      As a bartender and booze connoisseur, the way they serve martinis is utterly ridiculous and counter productive. They bring them out in single drink sized shaker tins, shake them on the spot, and pour them into your glass. The problem with all this is that your drink was prepared by the bartender who sat the drink at the server well to be picked up where it surely sat for 2 minutes before it was carried to your table, then sits while your server places all the drinks and glassware down, then gets shaken and poured.  All the while, your martini, which is shaken to make it super cold without being watered down by melting ice, is wallowing in a bath of ice cubes for 5 minutes or more.  My suggestion, order everything on the rocks because that is essentially what you are getting anyway (or order at the bar so that it goes straight from the bartender to you).

I'll second the raves about the cocktails and the butternut squash tortellini!Now I'll explain why I only gave it three stars:  Made reservations for 8:30 on a Saturday night after reading reviews that said this was good for a romantic date night.  Arrived on time for our reservations and still had to wait 30 minutes for a table.  It was also very loud in there.  I'm glad they're doing good business, I'm just basing my review off the expectation that it would have the romantic ambiance we expected.Once I met the friendly and knowledgeable staff, saw the menu, and tasted the food, I understood why they were so busy--everything was fabulous!  The scallop appetizer was to die for!My only other complaint is that I got a bit of a stomachache afterwards because everything was so heavy (ie, buttery!).  Would not want to eat like this every day, but luckily at the price I won't have to.Overall it was a pretty satisfying fine dining experience and I would definitely come back for a group occasion.
Went here for a quick sip.  There was not much going on.  It was Monday so that could explain it.  Great pours!  I want to come back during Happy Hour to properly gauge this place.

Overpriced. Tiny dishes, albeit pretty. Blah service. Came here on a night that could have been slammed for them, but the bar was the only thing slamming here. The service was mediocre, at best, and rather snooty. It was Halloween Highball night. I wouldn't come back here for dinner. Maybe on another night I could have had a better experience, but there are too many great restaurants in Columbus and the surrounding areas to worry about giving a place another chance. I didn't recall a lot of choices on the menu. The appetizer we ordered was tasty but tiny. It was a plate of cheeses, olives, and meats. The Chicken Picatta was tasty but tiny. The bill was enormous, although we were a party of 4. Our good friend picked up the bill and we tipped (well, despite). Our evening could have started off better at another place.

The fresh mozz was not what I hoped it to be. Fresh made when ordered? I expected more. The penne a la vodka was fine. Pretty sure it was penne from a box. The short ribs were ok. Some more veggies would've been nice. Overall, it was average Italian food at above average prices. The place is loud. Can't hear the person across the table from me. Build some sound absorbers or something.

i love the look and feel of martini - a playful yet sophisticated restaurant..holiday decorations just right...i enjoyed very much the heirloom beet salad and the lasagna - our food server prepared freshly brewed coffee and was very attentive to our curiosities and questions...love that the menu is malleable and ingredients can be swapped out or added to liking or dislike...the chef is very relaxed that way - creating a suggestive menu not concrete...beet salad perfect proportion...lasagna not overly cheesy - i have no other adjectives except delicious !

Still a good experience in terms of atmosphere and service, but the food just wasn't good. My lasagna tasted like a microwave meal from the grocery store, and my wife said her steak was OK but not great. We hadn't been in a few years and it seems the food quality has gone downhill.

The greeter at Martini looked like she'd spent the week rolling around in a bronzer bed.  Ordinarily, I wouldn't care, but this level of orange could not pass without comment.Anyway, Martini's trend seeking is its downfall.  It would be really nice if fewer restaurants in cool cities like Columbus so aggressively sought to emulate the "feel," "pizazz," and "atmospherics" of "hip" spots back east.  This sleek hipness should be the object of scorn, not envy.  It's the reason my hometown, Brooklyn, is now largely intolerable.  Martini could have redeemed its consultant-crafted decor with good food.  But it didn't.  The beet salad was fine.  "Heirloom" seemed a stretch.  The tuna achieved the bizarre duality: rare and dry.  I suspect that the tuna was shipped via open-air overland slow freight carriage.
I have to say that their Short Rib main course is their signature dish.  Just buy it blind..it's that good.   You can thank me later...
The service was excellent. Although the menu selection was limited, each dish was prepared to order. I would recommend this place to anyone for a formal dining experience.

ATTENTION ALL LADIES! If you're bored with the restaurants your man takes you, give him a hint and point him in the direction of Martini Modern Italian.My first suggestion is to walk straight up to the bar and ask for the martini menu.  The list is so unique I wanted to try half the menu, but then remembered I was driving.  So, I ordered the pomegranate and tarragon.  And of course, I had to try the pear elderflower.  Okay, so I was taking a taxi home.While the waiters were bringing around the entrees, I was distracted by the aroma of the delicious food.  By the time it was my turn to order, I knew exactly what I wanted.  The bruschetta was to die for! And who can go wrong with fettuccine and clams.For dessert- chocolate bread pudding hands down!The restaurant itself looks very classy.  The white and brown colors gives the place a sense of homey and relaxation.   Remember guys: you don't have to go expensive but you do have to treat your lady right!

I could talk about the food (it was good) but instead I want to relay a story:We came to this restaurant on a saturday night for my girlfriends brothers osu graduation. We had made reservations for 730, didnt get seated until 8, and dinner didnt arrive until 9. So needless to say we were pretty disgruntled about the long wait, we expressed our displeasure with the waiter.... a few minutes later the restaurant GM Michael stopped by to ask about everything and told us he'd take care of us....and take care he did. Not only did he not charge us for dinner..BUT he also gave a $100 gift certificate to her brother, the new grad, and invited him to come back so that he could earn back our trust.Bad service happens...I understand this...but the level to which this restaurant went to make amends completely blew me away.Wow.

Whoa, this place us better than expected.  Much better than other places in the Cameron Mitchell family.  The butternut squash tortelloni is so ridiculously delicious!  My husband had the lasagna and he claims it ranks pretty high as far as lasagna goes.  Can't wait to go back!
Went there last week with familiy and friends.  I recommend the short ribs.  Excellent food and service.  You get what you pay for.  Check it out if you're visiting CBUS.

Very impressed with the modernness of this restaurant.  The hostess was kind and attentive.  Our service was not outstanding, but overall ok.  The carpaccio and polenta was amazing, the salted bread with pesto and olive oil with vinaigrette was yummilicious.  Then came the  panzanella salad. FABULOUS! Lastly after all of the prequels I had, I decided to go for the first plate as my meal, penne de vodka (I think that's the correct way to write it).  I have to say the noodles were perfect and the sauce was delicious, however I added chicken to the pasta dish and it was a little dry.  I had two glasses of the Moscato and it was the perfect pairing.  The person I was with had the piccata and finished his entire plate, he said it was awesome!

I felt like a really fancy dinner today and narrowed my choices down to Martini's.  When i walked in the door, it was happy hour, making all appetizers and drinks half price.  So I started off with the scallops.  They came with a small salad of greens.  I then had the antipasto which had a variety of tidbits on it including cheese, peppers, etc.  I then ordered the lamb pappardelle.  That was just too much food for one person and I ended up bringing half of it home.  But all in all, it was a very nice meal and very good service.

Went here for a friends birthday this week, I was kind enough to let her pick the restaurant and she demanded to try Cameron Mitchell's other Italian joint.  We got a large group table by the window where we could watch the passerbys and they could apparently wave at us.  I was amazed at how busy it was for a Tuesday night, I'm glad that we made a reservation or we might not have gotten a table.I started with the mozzarella and a friend had the martini salad.  I should mention that I'm a huge fan of cheese, especially when it is done well.  I love my appetizer and I'm not sure if anyone else managed to get a biteful...  For a meal we tried the chicken marsala, the veal and spinach ravioli, the lamb pappardelle, the milanese, and the gnocchi.  The raviolis were absolutely delicious, I nearly traded my marsala for the dish.  Sad to say that I feel jipped having gotten the chicken marsala.  The chicken itself was a bit overcooked and tough, fortunately the polenta made up for some of the lack of flavor.  Everyone else thoroughly enjoyed their dishes and cleaned their plates.Sadly none of us tried the martinis so I can't report on how they tasted.  But I'd suggest the bread pudding if you're looking for a dessert.  I'd suggest it for a fancy date, not such a great place for a large group outing.

Great new decor!  I went for dinner, and at night the lights are dimmed and the music is turned up a notch.  Patrons and servers are bustling all over the place!Girls beware!: The high polished wood floors are a disaster or embarassment waiting to happen.  The menu, revamped too, it pretty limited on selection.  I was disappointed about that.  For someone who doesn't like to eat pasta or meat, I was stuck with the salads.  Not a bad place to be, the arugula salad with brick oven baked tomatoes and a lemon vinegrette was wonderful!  I also heard rave reviews around the table about the beet salad and the Martini salad (which comes with prosciutto crisps on top).I did want to order the seared ahi tuna entree, but it was $27.  I couldn't swing it!  So I settled on the salad and the Brick Oven Pizzetta.  I don't recommend it.  It comes out looking like a plain, pita bread pizza.  It is sprinkled with Cambozola cheese, which doesn't melt well, and a extra virgin olive oil.  It's also served with an entire half of a roasted garlic.  I'm glad I reserved the rest of my salad dressing and the pesto from the bread dish.  I think if I order it again, I will request a side of marinara or something similar.  If you can request to be seated in Brian's section.  He was our server and although a big group mean a longer meal, he was fabulously attentive and had no problem separating our bill.  He also easily handled a special call in order for a surprise bottle of wine and a to-go meal.  One of our friends popped in just to say happy birthday and pick up his dinner.
Great Martini's, amazing fresh mozzarella appetizer and awesome pasta carbonara!!!!  Can't wait to go back!
Literally the best meal I ever ate in my life. I guarantee there is not a bad item on the menu.
Really enjoyed the restaurant, both the food and the ambiance. Excellent service as well. I would recommend the butternut squash ravioli.

Fancy chandeliers: checkCocktails: checkAppetizers: brushetta meh due to soggy bread and bland flavors Dinner: salad and ahi tuna ceviche just okay. Salad was a lot better than tuna as the tuna came out warm when clearly should have been cold. Seemed kinda pricey for a mostly pasta menu...Tip: 20% already included bc we had 8 in the group.Overall: not impressed, much rather go somewhere else.

LOVE this place!  Hubby and I were in Columbus last week and happened into this place because we were staying at the Hyatt down the block.  We sat at the bar and were immediately greeted by the female bartender (name?) and the male bartender Adam.  We were offered drink suggestions when we asked.  My hubby LOVED the Dark Cherry Manhattan!  Hungry, we asked Adam for food suggestions.  He recommended the Buffalo Mozzarella and the steak and described each beautifully.  We went with the Mozzarella appetizer and the Butternut Squash Tortellini.  OMG!  He was right on!  The Buffalo Mozzarella arrived freshly-pulled, warm and drizzles with evoo and pepper, accompanied my fresh roasted tomatoes, homemade pesto and crostini.  Delish!  The Butternut Squash Tortellini was to-die-for!  Seriously...it was one of the top 5 pasta dishes I have ever had!  This place is visually appealing.  Very modern and beautiful.  The huge chandeliers in the dining room are stunning!If we had this restaurant in Phoenix, I'd be there every week!
The food was fantastic I had never know Italian food could be this fascinating. Like the martini, good service Great work chef I will definitely be back

Went to Martini's (near North Market) for the first time last night and was a happy woman.  The ambiance was cozy and busy/crowded but we could hear each other across the table for two.  Our waiter, Ryan, was very helpful and pleasant but not intrusive.  His suggestions were perfect.  My gluten free bread was delicious and so was the pesto dipping sauce.  My beef carpaccio (sp?) was mouthwateringly tender and the sauce and garnishes perfect.  My guest is a fan of beets so her beet salad drew raves.  We both ordered the seared scallops and they were fresh and tender with a delicious sauce and brussells sprout/escarole garnish.  Dessert was a creme brulee to die for with a couple of cookies that just happened to be my guest's favorites.  All in all I was very favorably impressed by the quality of the food and the service, and you can bet I'll be back.

Modern creative food executed incredibly well. Polite, attractive staff. Beautiful atmosphere and attention to detail. I have eaten here over and over and now have started regretting it when ever I decide to go somewhere else.

One of the truly, worst meals I've eaten.   I had the shrimp marsala.  It had four or five, tiny, overcooked shrimp.  Most of it was an overly spicy red sauce on pasta--that I didn't bother to finish.  Ragu would be preferrably for flavor.   The black cherry martini was good, but for $12, it should be.  My sisters chicken was awful, and another member of our group said his chicken marsala was 'skimpy'.   Most of the group of six left hungry.   I'll never go back---a big waste of money.  If I want good italian, I'll go to Morretti's.  They know how to make a red sauce.

This place was really really good.  I went with a group and everyone cleaned their plates (as well as the appetizer & dessert plates).  I had the picatta and it was delicious! I also really like the wines we had (but I'm not sure what brand it was)My one complaint is that we sat right next to the kitchen, so it was REALLY loud... we had to shout at each other all night just to have a conversation.

One of my favorite restaurants in Columbus. The food is excellent, great atmosphere, good drinks and a friendly, professional wait staff. What more can you ask for? I've never been disappointed by Martini's. My recommendation: Butternut Squash Tortelinni. It's amazing! If you want a clean, delicious cocktail, try the grapefruit gimlet. I'm making myself hungry just writing this review. Guess I know where I'm going to dinner tonight.

The butternut squash tortellini was phenomenal. Love the decor. Service was great. My only complaint is the wastefulness with the bread. While delicious, they gave me 6 pieces. I took it home so it didn't end up in the trash.

Dark, fancy, expensive. Just what I expected from it. I like my food, but all I got was a salad. Ha! At least the waitress was super awesome. I doubt I'll be back, the menu didn't really excite me, especially since I'm not a meat-eater. Oh well, it was fun!
Best Lasagna hands down!  Great Atmosphere and excellent drinks :)Service was alright but not too shabby considering it was a packed house
The restaurant was hot inside,  the service was slow and neglecting, and the food was average.

3.5 stars. Was the food good?  Yes. Is the atmosphere nice? Sure. But was it overly special? Not really.  The value here isn't great either because it is pretty expensive and the portions are the size of a snack or at best a tapas plate.  My scallop appetizer was just that.  A single scallop.  It was quite tasty, but it's hard to tell from .35 oz of it.  This is a place that is good - no question. But I probably won't be back unless I go with a group or another couple.  I can't see myself saying "let's go to martini tonight".

Drinks and appetizers were excellent. Main course came around and the Chilean Sea Bass I ordered tasted like a cod I should expect from Long John Silver's. It was terrible. From this experience I would enjoy a few drinks and a snack then leave.

I had a simply delicious meal last night at Martini that couldn't have been presented to me better. The food was superb and worth 5 stars all by itself.My boyfriend's mother came into town last night for his OSU graduation (Master's in Music Ed. What What?!) and wanted take us out to a nice restaurant. We suggested Martini.I had gone here two years ago before they did some renovations, and changed the menu around a little. I had remembered the food being good, but I always like to write a review after it's fresh in my mind. Martini certainly looks elegant; high ceilings, fancy chandeliers, and white leather seats. The restaurant definitely sets the mood for more exquisite dining.We started off with a bottle of wine, a 2008 Sauvignon Blanc considering that we were all having white sauce and for whatever reason were already sick of Pinot Grigio.
