That was probably the most snobby sentence I've ever written. Don't care, moving on. It was a lovely choice that turned out to compliment the food graciously in the end.As far as salads go, we ordered a Martini Salad (romaine, arugula, pine nuts, gorgonzola, prosciutto, tomatilos, and balsamic) as well as a fresh mozzarella, tomato and basil salad that they had been offering special that day. Both were very good, and you could tell that if the greens or tomatoes had been any fresher, they would have still had dirt on them. The waitress had told us that the tomatoes had just come in and were from a local farm. Also, the Martini Salad had some cucumbers on the bottom! They were delicious, but weren't featured in the menu or in the salad. Next time, put them front and center.The appetizers came next: Fried calamari with a wonderful Worcester/ mayo/ mustard sauce. My boyfriend's mother said that it was the best version of that dish that she's ever had. We also got the brushcetta with the prosciutto on it. I wasn't as nuts about this one. It was good, but I thought the use of the prosciutto (while cut absolutely PERFECTLY thin, likes it's supposed to be) was to weird for me. I think its just my own person taste on this one.Entree: I got the pennette alla vodka. Simple, I know, but it was exceptional. It was made with prosciutto and mushrooms (which I also wish had been featured more) and a very light creamy sauce. The sauce was full of flavor but not too thick - it was absolutely perfect. The rest of my party got fettuccine and clams, lamb pappardelle, and the gnocchi bolognese. There was absolutely no complaints, just contented sighs and smiles.I was going to dock one star due to the service, but then decided against it. The waitress was not bad. She was even what I consider "above average". However, she made a few off-handed comments that rubbed me the wrong way. One of them was "Only two salads?" after eyeing all four of us. Another was a comment to me about my pasta "No protein with that? Shrimp, chicken, beef?" Uh no, If I had wanted one I would have asked for one. Thanks. And lastly "Wow, all pastas at this table. Are you all sure no protein?" My friend joked and said that it was because we all wanted to go to sleep that night. I get it, she's probably a nutrition major or something, but please don't judge our food choices considering that we're paying you a pretty penny to eat here. On paper, it sounded like what she said was innocent enough - but it was the way she said it, sort of condescendingly. But she was excellent with the water, wine and table service although. No thumbs on the plates!All in all, an exceptional meal with exceptional company.
The food was tasty. The "decor" was fun to look at.But what really made this experience good was the service. Our waitress was just a doll and really made us all feel at home!

For me, Martini is style over substance.  The decor and atmosphere is very hip and cool.  The food was just OK.  Martini has a very nice bar and all of the drinks were good.  If you're looking for a scene; this is the place.  If you're looking for good Italian food; there are far better choices

I came here when I was in town over the holidays to meet up with some old friends for a few drinks during happy hour. The martinis aren't the best I ever had, but they were excellent for the ridiculously low price--$4 apiece. The space was pleasant, with a lovely, bright view out onto High Street, and a small, low-key crowd around the bar as the staff was preparing to open the restaurant. The bartenders were great: friendly and attentive, but left us alone for the most part to enjoy our drinks.

Was in town visiting my boyfriend, and he made reservations here to enjoy a nice dinner with his good friends. First of all I love Italian, and second I love restaurants that just ooze in ambiance. This place married my favorite things perfectly with a touch of good quality service. Now our appetizer was calamari and although I love the dish, I have never come across a kind of calamari that tops all others. Calamari is calamari, it was good but not something that I would gush about. The entrees were different however. I got the Veal wrapped in prosciutto, and my boyfriend got the ahi tuna. BOTH were absolutely amazing. The veal was tender, and the prosciutto wrapped around was simply orgasmic with the sauce. The ahi tuna was also tender and the potatoes on the side just melted in my mouth. Just remembering the dishes makes me CRAVE it. Great food, Delicious Wine, Amazing Company are what allows me to rate this place a all 5 stars ;) I hope they open a store in Chicago ;)

Happened to be in Columbus recently on business.  Stayed in the area of the Nationwide Tower and found Martini's on Yelp.  Restaurant is very modern in decor.  Lots of wood contrasted by white laminate.  Bar takes up the front of the restaurant.  Open kitchen so be careful.  Can be noisy and odoriferous.!  Was seated in the back.  Menu is "Neo-Italian" with many of the old standard re-packaged with new names.  Case in point..  Veal Milanese..  Well, it's not "Milanese" in the traditional style.  It's really Veal Parmesan..  Now it's pretty good rendition mind you although the veal is a bit thin.  Chicken Picatta wasn't..  It was, however, a nice piece of very good chicken atop a bed of polenta.  Odd but, still good.  Butternut squash ravioli were wonderful as well although the pasta was a bit thick.  The pasta itself is wonderful.  House made daily and very well done.  Deserts are not bad.  If you have the yearn go for the Lemon Tart..  More like a mini lemon meringue pie.  Was outstanding.   Wine list is somewhat short but offers a wide variety at a reasonable price.  Wait staff can be a bit too "zealous" sometimes and a bit over-friendly.  Wanting to hang around and "chat" a bit too much.  Noise can be an issue..  This place can get very loud.  Be forewarned.!!  Prices are likely a bit high for Columbus but still fair.   I doubt I'll be back in Columbus, Ohio anytime soon but, if I do, I'd certainly put Martini's on my list to visit again.

I went with a large group to Martinis.  Food was solid, drinks were fabulous.  I had the pineapple infused vodka...well maybe a few of them... and I would go back just for that drink.  We ordered a few apps and kept the food light.  Each app was very tasty.  The atmosphere was also very trendy.
The service is impeccable!! Michael Mejia, GM, took very good care of me. Excellent job. These guys went above and beyond to make me happy!!!
Incredible dinner!  Calamari appetizer was the best I've ever had.  Mozzarella appetizer was also incredible. Tenderloin was delicious.  Highly recommend this place.

Came here for my 22nd birthday when visiting friends in Ohio - LOVED IT! Ordered calarmari for appetizer and it was delicious!  Food and the service was excellent as well. Super friendly waitress and the place is so trendy and nice! A++

My boyfriend and I had dinner here on Saturday night to celebrate our anniversary and we loved it!  We started with the mozzarella cheese appetizer, which was absolutely delicious.  I ordered the veal and spinach ravioli and my boyfriend had the chicken marsala.  Both were very good.  The sauce on the veal and spinach ravioli was a little too salty for my taste, but still good.  Overall, we had a great time and will definitely be back to try more dishes from the menu!

Reason enough to stop in Columbus.  The restaurant is a wide open see-and-be-seen room.  Noisy yet friendly.  Really busy.  I went on a Monday night and the place was packed.  We ordered every appetizer on the menu, and they were all fantastic.  So was dessert.  My only complaint is that wine by the glass is stupid-expensive.  There's no reason on earth for those prices.

I sent my food back twice because it was completely unpalatable. The waiter offered for me to order something else and I did and again it was terrible. By the time I sent back the third order I had completely lost my appetite. On the plus side the drinks are pretty good I just would never eat here again.

The sidecar here is probably one of the best ones I've ever had, but then again David Embury's 1948 seminal classic on "The Fine Art of Mixing Drinks" from the good old days of the 3 martini lunch has this to say on the subject of the Sidecar"This cocktail is the most perfect example I know of a magnificent drink gone wrong."And if you are a modern drunkard then might I recommend following that up with the amazing pineapple infused vodka that they are infusing right on the bar.  And then finishing it off with the alcohol soaked pineapple that's been soaking up booze for god knows how long.Oh and the food, from what little I can recall, was quite good.

My husband and I are new to Columbus and stumbled upon Martini's while strolling on High Street. Tha staff made us feel so welcome even though we had no reservation. The young man who was our waiter couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. He even told me about a drink they don't have on the menu that he thought I might like and it is my favorite drink now! The food is amazing and unique. We went back a week later with our daughter and her friend who were visiting and again were treated warmly like we were regulars at a very upscale restaurant. They bend over backwards to make you feel welcome and comfortable which is so unusual these days.

Went to Martini's as part of a largish group (8 people).  The service was simply okay, one of our orders was incorrectly taken even though everyone agreed it had been given correctly to the server. To their credit the error was corrected in a timely manner.  First I must say that others at the table seemed to enjoy their food much more than myself. I found the food to be simply average and nothing too interesting.  The spinach and veal ravioli with truffles tasted almost nothing of truffles and had a sauce which overpowered the veal. Their soup was basically what I would get from Trader Joes but cost significantly more. The pizzetta was large and tasted delightful but required far too much assembly at the table. The strongly flavored cheese was placed on a single piece of the pizzetta and the roasted garlic was still in its husks, making it not very easy to share at a large professional gathering.  My strongest complaint was that there were NO entrees nor small plates for vegetarians.  At a steak house I can understand this but since they are an "Italian Bistro" they should provide some simple pastas and entrees which are vegetarian friendly.  Their salads are not large enough to consider a meal.

Great atmosphere, great drinks, average food and service.Martini had a very nice decor and trendy vibe.  Probably a little too loud to be romantic.  The service was a little slow, but we were having a good time with friends so it didn't matter too much.  Special of the day - scallops and shrimp over risotto - was good but did not stand out.  Can't go wrong with a chocolate martini for desert!

This was a great restaurant experience.  We made the most of our dinner since we didn't order fancy drinks and ordered better food. We ordered Calamari (Asparagus, Mizuna, Meyer Lemon Aioli -$12) as an appetizer, split an arugula salad ($9) and the veal Milanese  (Parmesan Crusted Veal, Arugula, Plum Tomato Sauce on a bed of Fettucine- $23). We also ordered the chocolate bread pudding which was great, but we barely had room after our dinner meals. Overall our waitress was great, she refilled our drinks promptly. The bread they served wasn't that great. I had read it had great comments here on yelp so I had high expectations, but I was a bit underwhelmed by it. It's alright that the bread wasn't great because everything else was awesome.

I made a reservation for 7:45 on a Saturday night. We arrived ten minutes early but were not seated until 8:30. The employees at the hostess stand did not greet me when I walked uup and I had to verbally get their attention after standing directly in front of them for at least a minute. Once seated we were brought appetizers to make up for the long wait. Our server was very knowledgable and the food was excellent, but our service continued to be exceptionally slow. We were finished with our meal and our server walked by three times before we had to flag her down to ask for our check. I absolutely recommend the restaurant for the food, but maybe stick to slower nights if you want any kind of service at all.

I stopped here for drinks after a conference. The Apricot Sage was alright. If I drink bourbon, I will just drink it straight. My friend however loved this drink. The Pear Elderflower martini was delicious. My favorite was the Italian Grapefruit Gimlet. It was outstanding. I also tried the vodka with pineapples floating around, to soak up the flavor. All of the drinks were $4 at happy hour. I thought that was a good deal. I ordered the Chicken Parmesan. It didn't blow my mind, but it was pretty good. I tasted the Lamb Pappardelle. It was good. The bread was good. Salads were good. I think the food was alright, a little bit on the expensive side. The drinks are what pumped me up the most. Happy hour is where the real value is.
This was a nice place for a relaxing drink.  A little expensive, but not terrible.  We did not order food but the descriptions on the menu sounded yummy and creative.

Excellent all around, impressed as usual. Our female server was terrific and knew the menu and specials very well. The only thing that kept it from being 5 stars is the Tuna Tartare app that was okay. Maybe the tuna was old and it lacked any taste, probably some freezer burn?

I've been here several times with friends and the food is always good but I just wish there was more variety to it.  The service is good however and on a friends' birthday, the chef sent out a plate of appetizers on the house but other than that, I haven't felt like anyone ever paid very much attention to me here.

Been here a few times - on dates and also by my lonesome when I was hungry and in the area.Food has always been good but I can't help but think it's overpriced.  Wine list is good and not too expensive.Last time I went I had the salmon up at the bar and it just didn't taste right.  I hate to say the food here is hit and miss but that's simply been my experience.Ambiance and decor is first-rate for Columbus.Doesn't mean I won't stop coming, though!

After being so very disappointed in so many restaurants recently, my partner and I strolled into Martini one night after work. What a beautifully refurbished modern restaurant. And, the food and service were equally impressive! While the bill was not inexpensive; it was commensurate with the each and every item served. Each and every item--from the salad and dressing, to the meat, to the pasta, to the bread-- were prepared perfectly with premium ingredients and skilled cooking techniques. It's on our short list of Columbus favorites.

All I can comment on is the food.  I occasionally go here to eat or start an evening, but being single I simply eat at the bar.  So I have no input on the service.  And it's pretty hard to screw up a vodka and tonic (except for making it too weak), so I won't waste your time commenting on cute drinks that I have never bothered with.  To twist a phrase from Mae West: when it's bad, it's okay, and when it's good, it's really good.  I'll agree with others that the food is hit or miss.  My latest bad meal?  The special - scallops and shrimp on risotto.  The scallops were really nicely done.  The shrimp was just plain ol' shrimp.  The risotto was glued together in a tomato sauce that just didn't work with the other main ingredients.  My latest great meal?  When they get the chicken breasts on linguine with capers and wine sauce right it's worth whatever you pay for it.  So why do I keep going back?  Because the highs of getting it right are higher than the lows of getting it wrong are low.Plus, it's a great location to start the evening.

Decked off a star for the ludicrously slow service for an early dinner. 10 minutes to get drinks + 35 minutes for food. I also noticed the quality slightly decreasing. At least the hazelnut chocolate bread pudding made up for the long wait time. Jeebus.Oh, and what's the dillie yo with the wet floors? So not conducive to high heels! I would have wiped out completely had I not have a phenomenal sense of balance :P

This place is awesome!Great style, great service, fantastic wine menu and the food was delicious.Calamari as a table appetizer - so good I actually ate the tails for the first time!  Not sure what the dip was, but refreshing that it was not boring MarinaraMartini Salad - I could have eaten this as an Entree. Greens, tomatoes, crumbled cheese and light dressing...oh, don't forget the (bacon bits) prosciutto chips on top :) Chicken Piccatta - Deee-Lish!  Chicken cooked on the bone, with a tart lemon sauce, capers and fingerling potatoesRigsby's or Martini - nice choice to have for Italian food!

Wow!!  Just wow!  What a beautiful place!  I almost wish I lived around here so that I could come out here more often.  Two of us went for dinner and drinks on a clear cool Wednesday night.  We were greeted by very friendly hosting staff who were in the midst of a busy shift.  As it's a few minutes till our table is ready, we take to the bar.  These are no simple bar tenders, they are crafters of fine cocktails.  If you want a place that'll just sling you a cheap beer, move on.  If you want a place that will take the time to make you a martini just how YOU like it, pull up a chair.  The bar is complete with a cutting board, numerous garnishes, individual instruments for squeezing each different type of citrus and an assortment of muddling dishes.  Don't get me wrong, these guys aren't slow at all.  But it will take an extra minute to make a Sapphire & Tarragon Pomegranate house special martini or that perfect extra dry Sapphire Martini shaken until frothy cold in a frosted glass.  There are a couple of flat screens behind the bar to watch, however they are hidden from view of tables as to not detract from the decor and ambiance of the restaurant.For dinner, we are seated in a back room that has an array of ambient lighting on each wall.  The columns are painted in a deep shade of red, but with an almost neon red light illuminating them.... ok, enough about the surroundings, let's talk food!!  As is standard at this level of restaurant, we are greeted with fresh bread, olive oil and pesto.  Can I say this is about the BEST pesto that I've ever had?!?!  Yeah, it was!  The service was very friendly and prompt, I won't call it blazing fast but it seemed to match with the feel of the restaurant as they aren't a turn and burn kind of place.  They are happy to have you sit back and enjoy some conversation which isn't drowned out by the ambient music (Think Zero 7 & Thievery Corporation).  I had a Martini Side Salad and the Beef tenderloin which was prepared perfectly in a light, not over powering glaze sitting atop a bed of 8 or so large penne noodles.  I thought this was a particularly nice touch since the meal tasted so great, I couldn't help myself but clean my plate.  This keeps people like me for being soooo stuffed, I can't even move!!  Unfortunately, I didn't have time this evening to try out their desert tray, but I have no doubts that it would have been very very impressive!Ok, the burning question... why 5 stars you ask?  The taste & quality of the food, the staff, & the ambiance of the restaurant.  I would like to go 4.5 stars, but since that's not an option, Martini's... you get the full 5!!  Anyone passing through Columbus, I highly encourage you to swing by and check them out for a couple drinks and a nice dinner with a friend/date or with several friends.  I was told by the bartender that they recently redid the entire place - so, If you haven't been in a while, give it another shot!

Walk in then you think you are on the east or west coast not Columbus OH.  I was impressed by the wine display, bar was right when you walked in and the over feel of the restaurant was "low voltage electric".  Meaning it was trying to be chic but not overboard.  One thing I thought was unusual was the old school chandeliers had some glass around it, I would have replaced.  Service was attentive, except she gave too much of her favorites, location was right off the bar (not good for a business dinner).  The food, the Osso Bucco was average and was not shank it was the short rib, polenta was average, so I guess the entre was average.  But I did start with the Tuna salad with white beans and greens, I thought that was good, good grade tuna and beans with raw tuna that was a combination!

I just returned from a soirÌ©e at Martini. It was my first time there since they opened with the new concept. It's COMPLETELY different from what it once was.I went for lunch before. I sat in the front where everything was bright and white with green accents. I had the gnocchi and swapped the tomatoes for asparagus. I finished the meal with some very tasty ice cream. Overall, it was fantastic. I didn't understand why they would want to changed it.But when I walked in tonight, I understood. They totally blew the top off of the previous place. The new dÌ©cor is deep and dark with burgundy accents. There are swank chandeliers and huge glass vases everywhere. I was ushered to the back for a private gathering. We were very well taken care of. We had fabulous hors d'oeuvres. There were mixed berries with the best goat cheese I've ever had. There were assorted olives (pitted - blech!) There was a rather bold mozzarella. There was a light and crunchy pizza that I thought was just okay. There were tiny chocolate cakes with raspberries - yum. And, the best of all, there was amazing, amazing, amazing calamari. If you've only had calamari at Olive Garden, shame on you. Branch out, and start your quest at Martini. The calamari was light and crispy, it was accompanied by lightly bread asparagus, greens, and breaded lemon slices. There were so many different flavors including a surprisingly good vinegar. Each bite was self-contained but complimented the bite before and the bite after. I'm almost salivating at the thought of that calamari.I also had a great drink. The drinks at Martini are expensive, about $9 a pop. But if you go during happy hour, you can get them for $3. I had the Apricot Sage Martini (Woodford Reserve Bourbon, apricot nectar, hand squeezed lemon, and house-made sage syrup). The bourbon was strong in the sense that it hit me quickly after drinking it, but the flavor didn't overwhelm the drink in any capacity. I also had a sip of the Pear Elderflower Martini (Absolut Pear Vodka, St Germain Elderflower liqueur, and fresh lemon); If vodka and I were better friends, this would have been my drink of choice. It was succulently sweet and unlike anything I had ever tasted before.I've also had Martini food at catered events. In early October, I wrapped my teeth around their Osso Bucco with root vegetables. It was like butter. I could really taste the burgundy wine too.Be prepared, there aren't any vegetarian options when it comes to main courses.Also, they're no longer open for lunch.Martini was packed to the brim when I went at 5:30p. They obviously know what they're doing.

Great service from Keith.  My wife and I split the mozerella appetizer and the bread salad. I had the filet which was probably the most tender piece of meat I have ever had. Paired it with BonAnno cab from Napa. Excellent meal and super service! Will definitely return and recommend.

Seafood schmefood- get the steak. The Bluepoint oysters on the shell were some of the freshest and best I'd had in a long time. The shells were gargantuan. The Shrimp appetizer was also great. Of course they are jumbo (3 bites each) shrimp. You get 4. I had a steak recently at 'The Avenue'; but the 16oz ribeye here was better. Who would have thought ! It had a great sear and was cooked perfectly. Creamed spinach was on point as was the mac and cheese. I would pass on the lobster mashed potatoes. The starch in the creamy potatoes totally washes out the flavor of the shrimp and you just get the chewy nature of the shrimp flesh combined with the potatoes. No one flavor stood out. Nothing wrong with this side, but id save the $20 and get a different side. Very surprised by the bottle of 'whitehall lane' red wine. Very silky and smooth for such a green wine. Also the server staff did a phenomenal job. It was New Years Eve and they were very prepared. Obviously all hands on deck and it went well. They even provided noise makers and party favors and champagne !

This is fine dining defined in C'bus. Its got to be a million dollar decoration inside. Large full service classy bar, and an outdoor patio overlooking the heart of Easton.Service is the best in the city, its almost like you having your own waitstaff.All dishes are simply awesome, and chef prepared perfectly.Parking can be an issue. There is an adjacent free garage, but it a little walk, and I recommend reservations.My only nit is portion size. For these prices, I would expected more, but again, what was there was outstanding.And one of the most pricey places in C'bus too...2 apps, 2 entrees, and 4 drinks was a whooping $240. Enough to make it a 'special occasion' only kind of place.Oh, and get the oyster Rockefeller, its better than high end restaurants in NOLA!

Service was awkward. Never in my life have I been helped by three separate waiters. The one who kept coming to our table was a kind woman, made a few jokes, told us the special and was generally very fluent about the menu. I would like to say, though, that I felt uncomfortable about more than two waiters floating around my table bringing as well as taking. The head of house came over to check on us and not a second later our "main waitress" as I decided to call her, came to us to also check to see how we were doing. Awkward. Very Awkward. The dÌ©cor was nice, you could see the kitchen staff working and a wine rack at the bar. Good view of Easton, if you were sat at the window. The restaurant was fairly easy to get to, though I imagine on a busy day, would be a somewhat difficult trek.The food was excellent. Crab legs were outrageously expensive, yet they were delicious. I did note some pieces had some graininess to them. The legs were cracked in half on my plate, so I imagine tiny bits of crab shell got into my food. I also noticed a few dirt spots on the underside of the meat. The lemon wedge and the liquid butter, as you can imagine, worked very well with the simple dish. I appreciated the real butter and that I didn't have to crack the crab legs myself. Even though I enjoyed the crab legs, which were cooked well and I had an easy time removing the meat, I would never want to pay $65 just for crab legs again unless they were the only purveyor in town. Joe's Crab Shack is right across the street, I may give them a try sometime.The lobster mashed potatoes were the best side I've ever eaten. Lobster was fresh, cooked wonderfully and sang alongside the buttered and salted mash, garnished with a sprinkle of chives. Excuse me if this is the norm, but I'm not used to going to a restaurant and my mash isn't all old and dry or drowning in garnish. It even had a sauce, or oil, I couldn't exactly tell, but when it seemed like the mash was getting dry, I would mix in the strange liquid and all was well. Never had a lobster mash like that. I WILL come back for that, though I think this time I'll be getting a different main course.The main waitress suggested three beverages on the alcohol list when I asked if they had anything sweet and strong. One of the items stood out to me, the "Black Orchid." It comes in a martini glass with a ball of ice in the middle. This ball of ice holds orchid petals inside of it, formed to resemble a flower. I was astonished, wonderfully so. I'm new to the beverages scene as I still prefer soda, but I know what I want in a drink and I'm a fan of Honey Jack. The Black Orchid was a beautiful mixture of berry and citrus flavors. It was smooth and the taste was very addictive, I highly recommend this to anyone who craves a good sweet cocktail with a flare.My overall experience wasn't stunning, but it was high above average. The service, albeit awkward, was wonderful. My family and I were treated well, the food was absolutely amazing, and the restaurant was nice to look at. My family had the steaks, and even though I'm not a steak person, I felt the need to try it at least once on one of my next visits.Seriously though, leave me alone so I can enjoy my food! You don't need to keep checking on us every five minutes, you weirdos! XD

We were a group of 20 and had a great time at this restaurant.  They are conveniently located in the Easton mall.Drinks : They have a whole range of options from wine, beer and cocktails.  We ordered a few new wines to try and they turned out to be great.Food : From appetizers to entrees, we tried practically almost everything on their menu because it was a large group.  The food was exquisite.  I ordered the steak for my entree and it ranks on my Top 3 steaks in the country.  Loved the ageing, flavor and it was cooked to medium rare perfection.  All the sides were tasty and we had a lot of food on the table.Service : Par superior!  We had 3 gentlemen waiting and they were super efficient.  The main wait staff was very observant to the needs of the different guests at the table.  Rate the service a 5/5.Ambience : A classy restaurant with a touch of perfection.  They also have a private room for hosting events.  Paid parking spots are available in the mall or you can use the valet.Price : Expensive but you pay for the exquisite food and amazing service.  Totally worth it!Will I return?:  100% yes!!!

I'm really indifferent now about Ocean Club, this based upon the last few visits.  Prices have steadily increased over the years as portions, food quality, and service have all diminished.Eating here used to be an event.  The food was always fantastic, and the service couldn't be matched.  However, there are better places for far less money.  This from someone who has eaten here 50+ times in the past decade.Last night here is what I had:*1/2 wedge salad.  The bacon was nice and crisp, but the dressing was not the normal "cabernet buttermilk" dressing, but some generic creamy white dressing that resembled ranch.  I also believe the cheese was not blue cheese, but feta.  Flavorless.*Truffle mac and cheese.  Very very light hint of truffles, more of an afterthought.  Had already started to harden/congeal when it came out.  Heavy velveeta/artificial flavor.  Pasta over cooked.  Salty.  Tiny portion.  It was okay, if $5, but it was three times that.*Jalapeno potatoes au gratin--nice jalapeÌ±o flavor, but extremely small portion for the price.  Unbelievably salty.*Someone at the table also ordered the $12 baked potato........was a big potato but one would expect some kind of wow factor for $12.  Nothing special about this but the size.*Sea bass.  I got it asian style with teriyaki/soy sauce over rice.  The fish was excellent, no complaints on the taste or presentation.  But, extremely small cut of fish for $44.00.  It was more like a small plate in a multi course dinner.*Dining companions both got 6oz filets.....smallest steaks i've ever seen served anywhere.  And for more than $6/oz, it better be the absolute center cut.*Had a "club manhattan" cocktail, was good.All in all, for the price, OC isn't worth it anymore.  The sides used to be enough for sharing, but are now individual sides, with higher prices, and not as good.  Food is now very salt heavy, which tends to disguise poor quality.  Some of my old favorites are now not recognizable.  Portions are insultingly small.  Service is no longer the professional endeavor by the staff it once was.

I've been a longtime fan of Mitchell's Ocean Club. The food and service is always outstanding.Our little one loves this place, and requests to dine here every year on her birthday. We also love to come for a special dinner with friends.Happy Hour:Lots of seating - a large bar area + lots of high tops. There are lots of delicious choices on the menu and most options are only $6. The HH sushi rolls are $10 and the drink list varies from $4-7. Definitely get the Black Orchid martini - it's excellent and beautifully presented.We love the ahi tuna tacos and the lobster fritters!Dinner:Their portions are quite generous, and my husband and I often share an entree so we can also sample some appetizers, sides, and dessert.Our faves include the truffle mac & cheese, jalepeno au gratin, and the latkes! Here's a tip, the latkes have come off the menu officially, but every time we ask, they ALWAYS make them for us. SO DELICIOUS!Also, our favorite dessert EVER is the Baked Alaska. We just realized that they no longer have it on the menu, but our server mentioned that if you call in advance, they might be able to still make it for you. I'll have to call next time and see if it's true!YUM

Our fav and first C. Michell restaurant.   Food and service always top notch. Always feel like they go out of their way even if we are a walk in or a reservation.  The staff is always friendly.  Thank you for being best in class.

The food was really really good. We had the tuna roll which was delishious. I ordered the chop salad which was perfect size. We went for my brother in law's birthday and he got to pick a free dessert without the annoying birthday singing. The only reason it wasn't a 5 was because we had to wait at least a half an hour for our entrees. All of us were so hungry by the time our food finally came. I guess just don't go there during their busy hours.

Whoa!This place is by far my favorite place for dinner at Easton!  Sometimes they have a wait but it's totally worth it!Everything we tried was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing.  The waiters are all super friendly and very attentive.  I recommend trying to get a seat in the balcony area during sunset for an awesome view.The bathrooms are clean but only have one stall so you may have to wait.  I recommend using it after a meal since they offer free mouth wash to refresh your mouth. A must try while at Easton!

I'm never disappointed with the service or my meal here and this place has to have the best staff in town. They really do go out of their way to accommodate you and the atmosphere is truly delightful especially during the holidays with all the beautiful lights up. If you have a special event Katherine Domnici is incredibly gracious and she'll make sure your event is perfect. The wine list is great and has lots of variety. I've been to the New York and LA locations and they were awesome as well...but this location is my all time favorite and I highly recommend for the special events in your life or just a nice relaxing dinner.

The warm butter cake I got for dessert was what dreams are made of. I think it may have been a seasonal special, so my apologies if you can't find it on the menu. The scallops I ordered for dinner were also the best I've had in my life.

Absolutely phenomenal, 5-star experience - perfect from start to finish!If you are a seafood lover, this is your spot. If you really want to impress that special someone, celebrate an occasion appropriately, or simply take good care of yourself, THIS IS YOUR SPOT. Mitchell's Ocean Club is impressive from the moment you climb the staircase to the entrance and walk in - you're greeted by its sleek, elegant, and classy interior. I might also add that the restaurant is circular shaped, which for some reason I always fancy.The service is exactly what you'd expect. Our waiter, Chip, was very friendly, helpful, and attentive. I ordered two different cocktails (yes, I love my fancy fruity drinks!) - I started off with a Passion Martini, and I'll say that the presentation is enough reason to order it, as the drink literally bubbles and smokes during AND after it's poured! This one was delicious but definitely more on the tart side, so avoid if you prefer sweeter drinks. I later ordered the Black Orchid...oh man. This truly lived up to the Yelp hype and has now become THE best cocktail I've ever tasted. Words can't do it justice, so I'll leave it at that and hope that you do yourself a favor and order it the next time you're in Columbus.Onto the food - we ordered the calamari appetizer, which was phenomenal - subtly crisp skin engulfing a perfectly cooked center (not too chewy, like a lot of other restaurants) and coated in just the right amount of zesty Asian sauce. For my entree, I ordered the famous Chilean Sea Bass, and I will thank myself for years to come for making such a decision. This fish melted on my tongue and could not have been cooked better. I don't know if I'll ever look at any other fish the same way, after having been spoiled by this incredible dish.If you're looking for perfect ambiance, great service, delectable cocktails, and mind-blowing seafood, you'll put your phone/computer down and make a reservation at Mitchell's ASAP. Well...what are you doing still reading my review?!

I lived in Tokyo for over five years (fresh seafood galore) and I've got to say that this place has the best seafood I've had in awhile. I went here for New Year's Eve and it was just delightful. I had the lobster pair with asparagus. The lobster was cooked perfectly, best I've had in a long time!! We ordered a bunch of sides and they were each very good. Oysters were wonderful and the shrimp cocktail had a fun presentation. Still having cravings!

You can't go to a Cameron Mitchell restaurant and think anything bad the 3 money bar of Yelp is dead on how much you will pay for that dish at one of those restaurants. I've almost always had a pleasant experience at all the Cameron Mitchell restaurant's I've dined at in Columbus.What makes the Ocean Club so good is the seafood is very fresh. For instance the Alaskan Halibut that my husband and I ordered tonight is the freshest fish they have in right now. You can taste the freshness as you take that first bite. The sauce is just an extra to the flavor but the freshness is what really counts when ordering any type of seafood in my opinion. The Alaskan Halibut had lobster ravioli and asparagus and was so good!My husband also ordered the lobster bisque and said it's one of the best lobster bisque he's ever had in his life. It was so creamy and he could taste the lobster inside. I got the house salad and it was pleasant as well. It had your greens, granny smith apples, walnuts and honey dijon dressing. Great for a light crisp summer salad!Also eating outside is a little more quite if you want that intimate setting for dinner. I have been in both the indoor and outdoor and felt the outdoor was a better experience. The waiter's are more personable and you can enjoy the nice upper deck view of Easton. Not to mention listening to a concert playing tonight was a bonus during our dinner! I'll definitely be back to Ocean Club soon for a nice occasion!

I've been visiting this restaurant for almost a decade and they never let me down. As with most Mitchell's restaurants, the ambiance is perfect and the waiters are better than any place in Columbus. Cameron Mitchell restaurants are my favorite and I love this one.

My hubby choose this place for a romantic getaway weekend.  I was not disappointed.  Everything was great.  I had the filet mignon topped with foie gras.  He had the salmon.  We both had lobster Mac n cheese as a side.  Everything was delish!  We will definitely be back soon.

Best restaurant in Columbus.   Always consistent.  Amazing flavor and top notch quality food.  Our favorite sushi is the dynamite roll... it's to die for.  Also love the halibut and king salmon.  Really yummy bread, too!  Husband says it's the best steak in town,  too.

THIS WAS THE BEST MEAL I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE! The service was phenomenal and the steak was incredible! If you are ordering a cocktail get the orchid cocktail! You will not be disappointed in the experience!

We've been here several times and the food never disappoints. Prices are high ($12 french onion soup!?), but not completely unreasonable for the quality. I don't even like fish, but I know I can always get a good steak while my wife enjoys whatever oceanic treasure she feels like. The only downside for us is that the restaurant is horribly loud. Our latest meal was on a weekday evening. We sat on the heated terrace (which was supposed to be the quiet area) and could barely hold a conversation despite sitting right next to one another. We'll probably go back again when the mood hits, but for the money we would much rather eat at the Refectory where we can enjoy both the food and the atmosphere equally.

Headed there for a late 9pm dinner on a Saturday. Made a reservation about 45 mins ahead of time and were seated soon after we arrived. Service was top notch. Server made great recommendations. I ordered a lobster bisque and the surf and turf app (two large scallops and some brisket atop mashed potatoes). Both were very good though the brisket in the app was a little too salty than I would have liked. Nonetheless, as far as seafood served in the Midwest goes, both the lobster and the scallops were succulent. Flavors in both dishes were delicious. My dining companion ordered an 8oz. steak with a side corn dish recommended by our server. The beef was a good meat choice and cooked to request. The corn? As simple as the dish sounds, it might have just been the highlight of our meal! Great food an great service merit the four stars. I have to take one star off for the decor (was a little unimpressive given the status of the eatery) and the prices (the ingresients were good quality and flavors there, but still didn't justify the prices). All in all glad we tried it.

Perfect night, we had a little date night with our 7 year old son and everything was perfect. The waiter was FANTASTIC and the food was excellent. Perfect evening that started with shrimp cocktail and ended with peanut butter pie. The attention to our son in an upscale restaurant was great, we couldn't have had a better evening. The young adult menu was great, he had a 5 once filet with corn and apple sauce. I enjoyed a surf and turf my wife had the sea bass. Everything was prepared perfect. The waiter was on top of his game, friendly, funny and checked in with us to make sure our evening went well.

If they seat you in the back room, they'll probably forget about you. My experience could have been better. I don't understand the hype and I really don't understand the lack of attentiveness. THIS PLACE IS LITERALLY "OK". It's worth a try at least once, but would I come here again? probably not. The service was polite but it was far from attentive. It took about 30-45 minutes for someone to take your drink order, for someone to bring you bread, for someone to take your actual order etc. ( I completely understand if it takes that long for food to be prepared, but for everything else, that's unacceptable in my book). For what we paid, I've tasted better. The food was average. It was nothing amazing. I eat a lot of fish and seafood because I was raised in Louisiana and I live in Southern California. And from all the restaurants I've eaten at, it's always a hit or miss (mostly miss) with these Cameron Mitchell Restaurants. This place literally has the rep of being the best in Columbus, but quite frankly it's not. The ambience was nice. The crowd was a lively mix of young and old. My favorite part was the dessert. I ordered the Baked Alaska and I enjoyed it. If you're looking to spend money and act like you're fancy then by all means come here. But if you're looking to enjoy some quality food with quality service-- look elsewhere.

Great service. We had a wonderful NY strip steak, the teriyaki salmon, asparagus & mashed potatoes. Everything was delicious & cooked perfectly. Sides are ordered a la carte, but can be ordered in half sizes. I can also recommend the carrot cake from a previous visit. This is the perfect place for a special occasion dinner or date night.

Great food and drinks.  Server knew we we're there for a birthday.  Sadly, no recognition other than a Happy Birthday wish.Sitting next to regulars and same server gave them way better service and perks.Hmmm!Go back?  Probably not!

Excellent spot! A little pricy but the food and drinks are great.  Came to visit Columbus and tried this spot based on other reviews. Everyone was on point with the positive critiques. Would definitely recommend...

This was probably one of the best fine dinners I've had at a fine dining establishment in my life. 1) The service was amazing. We were never left wondering where our waiter was and he was very knowledgeable about the menu.2) the atmosphere was also great. I was there for an after work dinner. And all 6 of us in attendance were floored from the time we walked in until the time we left.3) the best part was the food!!! I had the ahi tuna tartare: Amazing. The Chilean sea bass: Amazing. The tater tots for the table: best tater tots I've had in my life. I believe there was Gouda cheese in them. Warm butter cake with ice cream on top for desert: simply amazing!I will be back for a nice dinner with my wife one day!
Fiance brought me here for our 6th year anniversary. Food and drinks are delish. Staff friendly. You can't go wrong here.

I know it says "ocean" in the name...yet, currently the best steak in Columbus!  Ribeye mediumrare done to perfection. Add a seafood appetizer and you've got surf and turf. Plus they have specials. Wonderful staff from hostess to server to kitchen make you feel special in an upbeat environment.  Justin's service was impeccable.  Treat yo' self then go donate the amount of your dinner to your favorite non-profit.
We had been for happy hour many times and loved the drinks and apps. A truly fantastic deal. Had dinner there and was sadly underwhelmed by the entree. Apps, drinks and dessert were solid.

The experience is better than the food. Straightforward steakhouse but out of three times being here all three times someone's steak was cooked incorrectly. The place is beautiful, everyone is so nice and professional but for the same money just go to Hyde park where the steaks are cooked to temperature.
Celebrated my birthday here with friends. Amazing steak and seafood. My waitress, Jenna, was awesome! We'll definitely go again.

Meh.  I've experienced better.  Let me start by saying, I didn't realize you need to make a reservation for Valentines weekend in Columbus MONTHS out.  I waited until the last minute (aka three weeks before) last year and totally missed the boat. This year, I started planning early and booked a reservation in December.  We had a good solid two months to look forward to celebrating marriage and a night with no kids.  When you are dropping over $150 on a meal alone-- the restaurant needs to either nail the meal or the atmosphere-- and Mitchell's Ocean Club did neither.When arrived, the hostesses took us to the smallest table-- I "hand measured" and guesstimate it was around 25 inches long.  I am a size 2 petite woman and this table was WAY too small for even me.  I couldn't even put my wine glass to the right of my plate because there wasn't enough room.  The awkward, cramped table totally killed the ambiance of the restaurant and made it difficult to enjoy our meal and conversation. I ordered the prime rib with a blue cheese crust-- and it truly was divine.  However, the sides at $10-14 each were so mediocre. The asparagus was cooked fine-- but we were expecting more culinary creativity.  They tasted like plain asparagus you would find at Cheesecake Factory.  Our cheese fondue appetizer was also a let down.  The accompanying dipping items could be upgraded-- it seems simple at its price point. The only silver lining to the experience was that our server was professional and attentive,Bottom line:  Huge disappointment.  If you are looking for a fine dining place in the Easton area, you can definitely do better.  J Alexander's is a high end chain that has a similar menu and in my opinion is much better.

The wife and I decided to treat ourselves for our 18th anniversary. We chose the ocean club on a sunday night and was able to get a table on the balcony overlooking to the easton streets. The weather and the time of day was perfect. We had a great view of the sunset.Our waiter was Bradley and he was outstanding. He was polite and extremely helpful for our first time visit. We both ordered the Surf and turf sunday special. 8oz filet for both. She chose the crab cake and I chose the scallops.We both ordered our steaks medium. Hers came out perfect, plenty of pink and extremely tender. Mine not so much. Although it was still good, it was fully brown with no pink at all. And a touch on the dry side. Her crab cake was huge. She liked the flavor of it. My scallops were perfect. Juicy and tender.We finished up with a 10 layer carrot cake. I am not a dessert person, but this thing was amazing. I highly suggest trying it.It was a lovely meal that complimented our anniversary perfectly.

We had a late reservation on Monday..it was our anniversary... We sat in a huge booth for a more intimate setting.. The ambiance was on point and so was the food.  I think they have updated their menu since our last visit.  My husband ordered the surf & turf...a filet and lobster tail with asparagus and mashed potatoes. I had the alaskan halibut with a corn & asparagus mixture along with lobster ravioli and a great bottle of red wine.  They even bought us dessert for our anniversary. We selected the warm butter cake with vanilla ice cream and fruit. It was so moist and delicious! Our server, Charlie, was so attentive and very helpful when selecting our bottle of wine. Thanks Charlie!
Great place.  Great service and food.4/5 because I felt my string beans were a tad under cooked.

This is one of the best fish places in town. It's located in Easton, and has great ambience. A big negative however is that inside it is VERY LOUD. They seriously need to consider putting some insulators to dampen the noise. The last few times it has been difficult to have a conversation even when the restaurant is not that busy. Outside seating in the summer is great though. I've tried a variety of different fish dishes here and never been disappointed. I used to order the Chilean sea bass before it got put on the endangered list :(. But you really can't go wrong if you are a fan of fresh fish. The lobster bisque is excellent, as are their crab cakes. The blackened snapper and the Yellowfish tuna are delicious as well. I would give it five stars if not for the sound issue.

The food was absolutely amazing, I tried the Chilean Sea Bass and it literally melted in my mouth. My boyfriend had the surf and turf which he loved too. Also, our server was very knowledgeable about the food and answered any questions we had in great detail. He also recommended the warm butter cake which was heavenly.

The ambiance of Ocean Club is nothing short of sheer brilliance. The luxury feel in conjunction with some of the best bartenders Columbus has to offer draw you in and make you want to stay by not only their skill level, but their magnetic personalities. I'd stay all day if my wallet would allow me, and sleep on a cot in the back if they'd let me

It was a fantastic dinner and the service was great. My uncle and I both ordered the surf and turf. My husband got the twin lobster tails as well. The atmosphere was just perfect. We have a wonderful dinner! Thank you!

"Are you celebrating anything?", they ask.  No, just enjoying great food on a Tuesday.  My husband and I wanted to be pampered and have a good night out without our munchkin. This is definitely the place to do that.  From the beautiful ambiance and great service.  We started off with a few hand crafted cocktails and the calamari.  We kept with the seafood theme and ordered the twin lobster tails and the crabcakes.  We didn't order extra sides knowing the food portions are small but very flavorful and appetizing. We eat with or eyes as much as our taste buds and Cameron Mitchells never fails on presentation.  We actually split our meals and left the right amount of full.  Not the full you want to go home and lay down full but the full that you are satisfied and could go out afterwards.  This is our top dining choice in Columbus for a more up scale dining experience.  We will be back soon for sure.

We were in town for the night and my son and girlfriend took us to dinner. What a beautiful place. We had drinks and a salad and then the power went out and then the fire alarms went off. I felt so bad for everyone. The manager the servers were great. The food and drinks we had were great and I will recommend the restaurant highly. Most places would have been a mess but not here. Everyone was professional. Thank you for a great time and looking forward to next time. Thank you Spence & Celeste Zachem

Service that hasn't let me down yet. We had a larger group of 12 and were well taken care of. We ordered the large seafood tower which has oysters, crab meat, shrimp that the group can share. For my entree I ordered a bone in ribeye which was dry aged and 1200 degree seared, and dded a lobster topping to it which was really delicious. All sides are family style, highly recommend the Brussels sprouts and Au grautin potatoes. We had a more private side room which allowed for much quieter conversation than out in the open in a busy restaurant. If you want an inexpensive meal this is not the place, but you shouldn't be here unless you want a special meal and service that comes with it. Great date, special event, or business meeting place is you want to have an enjoyable night out and great food you can consistently count on.

It was rather late at night when we arrived at Mitchell's ... it was 9:30 pm, and they closed at 10:00. To be honest, we nearly didn't go because I have been to restaurants that close their kitchen 30 minutes before closing to permit their staff to leave as close to closing time as possible. I consider this practice to be a bit unfair, but I also completely understand it. I would pretty much hate it if a large party came in just before closing and ordered everything on the menu if I were in the kitchen. But we did. The feel:Mitchell's Ocean club is an upscale seafood and steak place with a solid menu that contains some real surprises. It is in the midst of a shopping and dining district, and was actually a bit hard to find after our phone said "You have arrived at your destination" ... but we hadn't really. We were able to park on the street due to the late hour, but there appears to be quite a bit of parking anyway. The inside restaurant is surprisingly modern dÌ©cor, but we opted to dine outside as it was a nice clear night. There was another couple nearby celebrating a birthday ... it is that kind of place. Special occasions, memorable first dates, or just (as in our case) a cool night out with someone you care to enjoy a wonderful meal with). The menu:I always love it when I see a menu and I sigh because I cannot possibly eat one of everything that I see. There were a number of apps I would have loved to have ordered -- including one of my favorites Oysters Rockefeller, or the Oysters on the half Shell, or the Truffle Mac and Cheese, or the Lobster Bisque, or ... well you get the idea. I almost locked up. Then I saw they had Sushi .... Sushi Sushi Sushi ..... SUSHI. SO I got the Dragon Shrimp Roll. It was heaven. MMMMM. It was a generous portion of eight rolls. There was sliced Ginger and Wasabi on the corner, but while I did grab a bit of Ginger, I didn't need any Wasabi because the rolls were already an explosion of taste sensation. Luckily:My date ordered fondue. It was a four cheese mixture with beer and came with bread tips, veggies, and surprisingly enough an awesome salami. That's right salami. I would never have imagined such a thing. It was decadent. The Main:So I ended up ordering a Yellow Fin Tuna. it was thick, and prepared exactly the way I like it - rare. It was nearly, although not quite, tender enough to cut with my fork. I mean, I probably could have done so, but that would have been a bit rude. But it sliced easily and cleanly with the knife. The toping: various spices, greens, a couple of small potato's, beans, and mushrooms was not really up to the fine piece of meat. I would have preferred something a bit more tangy like a Mango Relish. That, in my mind, would have been perfect. Also good would have been something more spicy or even a Cajun spice. As it was it was good, but not quite striking. My date had a Steak and a baked potato. Both were excellent. As an aside, there was some left over fondue and we kept it around for the potato. It was a good decision. Our Server:Our server was Lisa, and she did a perfect job. She was not rushed, and did not rush us during our meal. She said that the restaurant believes if you arrive at 10:00 pm ... at closing, you deserve a meal and they will serve you. And, if our experience is any guide, they will ensure you have one of the best meals you have ever had. This was a real treat, in a memorable location. We will treasure the experience.

I went to Ocean Club for my birthday, and it really lived up to my expectations. I'd read some past reviews saying that it had the best steaks of all the Mitchell's restaurants, so I knew I had to give them a try. We were there on a Thursday night and got a great seat on the balcony overlooking all of Easton (As great a view as that can be). The service, and our server in particular, was fantastic. He was not only knowledgeable (which you expect from any CMR restaurant) but also incredibly funny and witty. Loved it.My girlfriend had the Black Orchid cocktail, which she absolutely loved, and we started off with the sweet chili calamari appetizer. I'd say of all of the dishes we had, this was probably my least favorite, only because I've had it so many other times before around town. I'm pretty sure Spagio had the exact same dish the last time I went there, and although it's good, it was a bit boring.For the main dishes, I had the ribeye I was craving with the blue cheese crust, and my girlfriend went with the Chilean sea bass. I had had the ribeye at the Guild House a week prior, and I have to say that this one was waaayyy better! The meat was cooked perfectly medium rare, and it basically melted in your mouth, and the blue cheese was pungent and blended with the steak perfectly. I could basically cut that thing with a fork.My girlfriend's sea bass was just as amazing and super delicate. The truffle sauce that came with it was delicious as were the whipped potatoes. We ordered a side of the jalapeno au gratin as well, and that was definitely one of the best potato dishes I've had in a while.Since it was my birthday, I got free dessert! Oh yeah! A nice gesture on an otherwise hefty bill. I could barely eat anymore, but I got the blueberry lemon cheesecake. It was just as good as everything else, but I had to pack up that bad boy for later.Overall, this is an awesome restaurant that you need to check out even if it's nestled in all of the Easton mayhem. It's obviously quite pricey so a great place to celebrate a special occasion (or if you have plenty of money to drop on dinner all the time. Kudos to you in that case). This is Cameron Mitchell at his best.

Amazing service, wonderful food and great ambience! Our waiter was top notch! Really enjoyed the fresh flavors of each dish. Apps were spot on, main dish was full of flavor, fresh and it was presented very well. Desert was amazing as well. This is a must try!
Celebrated our one year anniversary here.  Sat outside on a lovely evening. Server was great. Food and drink absolutely marvelous!

Good, but could have been great!The consistency of highly rated reviews brought me to Mitchell's on a Monday night after a day of training teachers. The ambiance was welcoming and eloquent, so I immediately felt awkward in my t-shirt, casual pants, and sandals. I steered myself towards the bar hoping to find a haven and stumbled upon the last 15 minutes of happy hour + discount bar menu!I quickly ordered a Cab ($7) and the calamari w/ chili oil ($7). Both were delicious, but I could tell that my squid was a bit overdone and chewy. A patron to my left actually stopped eating his because he said it was too overdone. Me, I powered through because the chili dressing was so crazy delicious I didn't really care. Let's be honest, at times food is merely a vessel to get the sauce/dressing in your mouth. This was one of those cases.From the myriad reviews, I knew I should go with the Blackened Snapper and ordered another glass of wine (suddenly prices jumped from $7 to $12-15). I knew I'd be going over budget, but when my days typically start with yogurt for breakfast and a granola bar for lunch, I'm apt to delve into dinner and felt this would be the place to do it.When it arrived, the presentation of my fish was haphazard. Seeing images of the dish regularly on the Yelp site, I had expected a whole fillet. I, however, was presented with three pieces all tilted uniquely at different angles with random vegetables and a hollandaise-like sauce strewn underneath. Not sure if this was because I was that "t-shirt guy at the bar" or if it was an off night?The dish was solid, but the fish was inconsistently cooked like my calamari. Edges on the thinner segments were chewy and overdone. The corn spoon bread underneath didn't seem to complement the dish well, although I understand cultural pairing, but I did enjoy the sauce (as I tend to enjoy most sauces/dressings).Overall it was an expensive night and not up to the par Mitchell's price point and reviews suggested. At the same time, the ambiance, celebratory enthusiasm (a couple's engagement was celebrated with a specially dish and several cheers), and high standards made me give it 4 instead of 3 stars. I will give Mitchell's a second chance if I'm ever in town and will see if dressing up + sitting at a table will elevate the service...?

Incredible experience from A to Z. I was extremely skeptical visiting Mitchell's being attached to a mall. However, Mitchell's far exceeded my expectations from service to food. We were seated in one of their private dining rooms and enjoyed the privacy and comfort this area offered. Our table of 3 started with the goat cheese ravioli which was simply of out this world. I had a bone-in filet oscar style that was cooked perfectly and tasted even better.
One of the best happy hour experiences in city! Awesome value and quality with a superior bar staff.
They have great steaks here cooked to perfection! Our margaritas were also amazing, try the passion fruit one! All of the staff was friendly and informative! Highly recommended!
This is my 2nd time going and the service was good and the food was OK the first time, but the crab cakes this time was horrible. I don't know what was going on this time with the cooks.

You get what you pay for. This place is pricy because the food is fantastic and the service is on point. The sea bass is amazing, the calamari are fantastic, the peanut butter mousse is to die for. The filet is just like the one at Hyde Park, which is amazing. I recommend coming to this place for a special occasion where you know you'll be spending quite a bit but you really want to treat yourself.. or if you have a company card! This place is sure to impress your clients.

Went with my girlfriend for a nice steak dinner on Sunday and we were not disappointed. We weren't planning on drinking with dinner, but found out shortly after we sat down that they have 50% off bottles of wine on Sunday nights. Our waiter was overly accommodating with tastings as we selected a bottle and gave us great recommendations based on our preferences. The ribeye is the BEST in Columbus and maybe the best I've ever had (even better than Jeff Ruby's Kobe Beef ribeye). It was the perfect temperature and delicately seasoned. The butter cake is to die for and I would highly recommend getting the carrot cake to go to enjoy with your morning coffee. *** helpful hint: you can take the wine bottle to go if you don't finish it with dinner

Another trip to Ocean Club, and yet again another home run!My fiancee and I decided to go out for a nice dinner this evening, and we decided on the Ocean Club as it has yet to let us down.  Once again, this proved true!We arrived at around 5:20 pm for our 5:30 reservations and were seated immediately.  As always, we had a fantastic server; on this occasion it was Nick.  We started off with a Passion Martini for me and a Black Orchid for the future wife.  Both were great, and I even ended up going with a second Passion Martini because it was so delicious (along with fun, it's one of the drinks that smoke when it's poured!).The typical Ocean Club bread bowl came out, which is always superb.  Some pretzel bread sticks along with what I think is a loaf of sourdough.  Fantastic!  We got our orders in for some appetizers:  the Point Judith Calamari (this is a MUST every visit!  SO GOOD!), and I asked NIck his opinion on the Shrimp Saute vs the Crab Cake.  He suggested the Saute and it turned out to be a great choice.  Three large crostini type breadsticks with cheese on top resting in a delicious Tabasco cream sauce, with four GARGANTUAN shrimp, which were perfectly cooked.  My fiancee wanted to drink up the broth, it was that delectable!  In the past, we've also tried the Fondue, which was great, but on that occasion we had a larger party to share with so it made a little more sense.  Still, at the end of the night, we ended up with 2 bags of food to take home so that point might be moot!Our entrees for the night were the Yellowfin Tuna (w/ fava beans, marbled potatoes, and truffle jus) for me; my better half had the Lobster Bisque along with the Chop Chop Salad.  As always, everything scored high across the board.  The tuna melted in my mouth!  I tried a sample of the Bisque and wish I had a cup of it as well.  I didn't try the salad but my date said it was fantastic as well.  Along with all of this, we ordered a side of the lobster mashed potatoes, which, honestly, how could you go wrong with that?  Fantastic!We had to decline on desert (unfortunately) because we both were stuffed, and ended up leaving with a full box of the calamari, along with the extra bread, soup, and mashed potatoes that we couldn't finish.  I promise all of you, within the next two hours (it is currently 1:33 AM), those will be gone.  No which way about it!I don't know at this point what other praises I can give this restaurant.  I'll leave it in the words of my fiancee after she took her first bite of the Shrimp Saute: "Honestly, I don't know if you can go wrong with anything here."  I agree wholeheartedly; we have never had anything here that we didn't enjoy immensely.  Yes, you will pay a little more than if you were to hit up something like Northstar, or Applebee's, but the food is in a whole other stratosphere compared to those places.  And somehow it's still cheaper than other "fine dining" in the Easton area!  Go, and go now.  Call ahead and have that calamari waiting for you for when you get there.  You will not be disappointed, and your addiction will begin.  The sweetest addiction I've ever had!

This place will never disappoint! I have been coming here for awhile. The food and drinks are always fantastic. I honestly feel when you come here the best place to sit is at the bar! The bartenders are so friendly and makes the best cocktails that I have ever had! The only bad thing about it is I have a hard time drinking anywhere else. I have had multiple items off the food menu also. It's always been fantastic. My favorites are the filet, surf n turf and the jalapeÌ±o au gratin potatoes!
Golden rectangle proportions used for aesthetics of the spiral ceiling, Fantastic service and juicy sea bassLobster sushi with mango kiwi was impeccable. Good vibes, good food, good time

I used to love this restaurant but I had a really unpleasant experience tonight. The service is too bad for me to eat here again. It's Karen who served me and my friends tonight. We told her not to put any mango in the lobster roll since one of my friends is allergic to mango. However, after we finished our dishes, my friend's lips started to burn. Mango is the only thing that he is allergic to so we asked the server to come. She didn't feel sorry at all and said my friend's lips look no different from before. We asked her to confirm with the chef and she didn't come back immediately. She walked around and around and finally came back and said the chef definitely didn't put any mango in the food. I said I felt really bad because I took my friends here but my friends got allergic for no reason. The server just said well I don't know what to do cuz I'm not a doctor! I just wanna say OMG I was totally speechless and she is the worst server I've ever seen. I really Hate that I don't want to come here again! Ever

Uummm... Yeah! One of the best places for seafood I've ever been to! This is a Cameron Mitchell restaurant and it doesn't fail to amaze in the culinary experience, that's for sure! Where do I start?... The location at Easton Park Shopping Center is great because there are many people even from out of town that are familiar with this area. The decor was really nice and in the summer you can sit on the patio/balcony and enjoy the nice weather! Everything inside the restaurant looks nice, modern and luxurious. The service was amazing. Our waitress was very attentive, knowledgeable and friendly! She was awesome and we let the manager know what great of a job she did!Now to the important part: The Food! We went there for seafood although they offer quite the variety of Prime Steaks (will have to try that next time)! We started with Lobster Bisque - one of the best ever! Roasted Beet Salad with a Goat Cheese Mousse which was incredible... Had some oysters on the half shell and they were really fresh and meaty. Our entrÌ©es were Arctic Char and Blackened Snapper - both cooked perfectly and paired with some amazing garnishes! The food was so flavorful in every bite and everything came together just perfect! We did share 2 half side dishes: the very popular Smoked Gouda Tots (which were amazing) and the Brussell Sprouts which never fail to please my taste buds! We definitely did not have room for desert, but we'll have to try it next time!Overall, everything was amazing and we'll be returning soon! I highly recommend this place for anyone looking at fine dining in the Columbus area!

We came here thinking that it must be good with all the high reviews. It turns out quite mediocre though. The service was lacking as well. They didn't bring the bread like they did for other tables.  Our table shared a few items. Oysters were not very fresh. It just tasted decent at best. But for the price 6 for $20 it's not worth it.  Filet mignon was not juicy nor tender. Lobster was kind of dried too. Mushrooms too salty

THE absolute worst!! Went there for Father's Day with my family and had the worst dining experience which ended with my brothers meal being THROWN AWAY instead of packed up with the waiter simply saying "oops I'm sorry". No comp, no apology from the manager, no NOTHING. It gets better... spoke with the GENERAL MANAGER that promised to fix the situation and make things right. A MONTH AND A HALF LATER still nothing. So disappointing and unprofessional

My food was totally amazing! I had the snapper and it tasted excellent. We had reservations a few hours before we visited the location and it was no problem getting us in.The interior is very nice. And the ambience has a very romantic feel. The main dining room was a little noisy for dining if I must say.The service is quick and pleasant. The food is a little pricey but for what you receive I guess it was ok. It conveniently located inside of the Easton town center.

Excellent service, the smoking seafood tower is phenomenal, we also had 2 sushi rolls, the prime and the lobster, mouth watering and amazing.I highly recommend Mitchell's,  the team here would not let a detail go past them, very attentive, considerate and accommodating.Our entrees were fabulous, surf n turf, Chilean Sea Bass and the lamb chops! Two thumbs up and oh my gosh!!!! Dessert!!!Yummmmmm yummmmmm yummmmmmThe mile high carrot cake! It was magnificent and to really make it amazing, try the warm butter cake, I think God actually came down from Heaven and made this cake!!
It's a really great place!! My husband and I had  a holiday dinner there. We had steaks, and they were sooo great and delicious. A nice atmosphere, great service and yammi food. We love this spot!!
This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Columbus. Great atmosphere, the cocktails are amazing, the seafood tower is phenomenal and you MUST have the warm butter cake!! Life changing!

We went to the Ocean Club for dinner on 3/18.  The food and service were both fantastic!  My wife had the surf and turf 8oz filet mignon with a lobster tail. Both were cooked to perfection. I ha the filet mignon with shrimp scampi and smoked Gouda tater tots. All were really good. We made a reservation and were seated in a semi-private room. This was much quieter than the mail dining room.  We had the 10 layer carrot cake for desert. No better way to cap off a great meal!

Had such a great unexpected dinner! I didn't know Columbus was so fancy!  Funny, I thought they were part of Mastros as Mastros is phenomenal.  I would give the food 3.5 stars but Ryan, our server made it a 5 star experience. We were visiting from California and he made our late dinner a great memorable experience.  Would definitely go back and request him! Thanks Ryan for being an exceptional server!

Started with fun cocktail and ordered the filet mignon with mash potatoes and my dad ordered the scallops. They were both spectacular! Sides come a la carte. Everyone gets a variety of breads to start such as pretzel bread. We ended with the 10 layer carrot cake that did. It disappoint! Great place for very special occasions

This was my first time at this restaurant. I went at the request of my date TSC. The service was impressive. Hand made lemon was perfect. The food was eclectic and interesting. Lots of flavor. Overall great experience, but my company was the main event. Nice atmosphere, but go early because it gets loud. I recommend and will be back.

We celebrated our anniversary at Mitchell's Ocean Club. The food and service are consistently outstanding and it has become our favorite restaurant in Columbus. The staff is very professional in a relaxed way and without pretense. Our server was attentive without hovering. Their sourdough bread is the best in town.The crab cake appetizer is big enough to split and I have never tasted better. I had the blackened snapper, my wife the filet. Both very well prepared and so tasty. We were asked if we were celebrating anything and of course we mentioned our anniversary. We were surprised and very pleased when we were presented with desert on the house, and were so thankful for their kind acknowledgement of our special day. We look forward to celebrating other special occasions at Mitchell's Ocean Club.

Service was top notch. Sever anticipated our needs and corded the meal at every step.  Food quality was on point.  Snapper was fresh.  Filet and lobster was amazing.  Desserts were all next level.  I cannot   Put into words how great the meal was. I had to walk the entire Easton mall three times to get comfortable.  The food was so good I could not stop eating!!!

So the only bummer is that this restaurant is a little further out from downtown - but it's worth the drive/Uber.The bread was amazing. I almost spoiled my meal with the pretzel rolls/sticks. The smoking seafood tower was impressive, and I've never had a tower with dry ice. Some of the drinks even contained dry ice! I ordered the lobster tails, and they were delicious. The butter was served in it's own little bowl over a flame, which was a nice touch. No one in our party of 8 had any complaints about the meal, and we all ordered something different - from steak to crab to grouper. Our server was attentive and didn't mind that we're a bit of an odd bunch. If you're looking for great seafood in the middle of Ohio, this is the place!

The Ocean Club is a favorite of mine and my husbands. We go when we want a good meal and don't mind splurging. We always get the tuna and filet and do our surf and turf. Both items are always cooked perfectly. Sides are amazing - jalapeÌ±o au gratin potatoes, truffle mac and cheese to name a couple. Service is also spectacular. Highly recommend.

I would give more stars if I could. Hands down the best restaurant in Columbus! Best service, food and martinis. Everything is top notch. Ryan and the bartenders are awesome. Thank you for being so wonderful.

100% 5 stars! Everything was perfect from the moment we walked in, to the moment we left. This restaurant is located in Easton Town Center, which is a super cute shopping/eating district. SOOOO many good restaurants and shops, I wish we would've had a day to spend there. Anyways, we had a 9:15 PM reservation. Sat down and ordered Martinis (Bubbles and Berry), and an appetizer. Our waiter was super friendly, made conversation with us, and very attentive. He brought us a basket of warm, yummy bread while waiting for our drinks. For an appetizer, we ordered the calamari, which was really good and they split it in the back. Had an Asian flair to it, with tons of flavor. For our meals, I ordered the 8 oz filet and black truffle mac and my mom ordered the double lobster tail. Both were incredible, cooked flawlessly. Kinda cool  to find out this was the original Ocean Prime.

We didn't have dinner here, only drinks and appetizers but they were sooooooo good!!!! I had a pear fuzz drink and we ate calamari and fondue. If it wasn't such a nice restaurant I would have scraped the fondue cup with my fingers and licked the plates. It was that good. Can't wait to come back for dinner!!

Mitchell's Ocean's Club is an upscale seafood favorite. As you'd imagine it is one of the wonderful Cameron Mitchell restaurants, which usually indicates that the meal is going to be high caliber. It is nicely nestled on the second floor of Easton Town Center Mall.  The interior was filled with upscale Maritime decor from the portholes and wooden-clad pillars. It reminded me of being on a luxury cruise liner.As for options, there is a myriad of both seafood and steak options. Since it's considered an "Ocean Club", I opted for the Chilean Sea Bass, which I've had before at one of its competitors. The Sea Bass arrived steaming hot with a slightly flaky crust - just how I like it. The fish tasted fresh and was full of flavor. The fish was decently sized and I could barely finish it since it was so rich. My only gripe was that the sauce was a little oily and just didn't pair as well with the fish.
