I preferred pan Asian style that is offered at other restaurants.Final verdict: I'd definitely come here again, but would probably reserve ordering Chilean Sea Bass at a restaurant that offers it pan Asian style. Also, I was happy to report service was phenomenal.

We went to Mitchell's Ocean Club for our 3rd anniversary.  I let them know when making the reservations online, and they made our night really special.  We arrived on time and they sat us right away.Starting with the bread, I think the pretzel bread is a unique addition to the typical bread bowl.We shared a bowl of lobster bisque.  I liked the corn fritters and lobster chunks in the soup.  It was creamy and rich, but rather mild compared to other lobster bisques.  I'm used to having more spice or pepper.I ordered the blackened snapper and my husband ordered the small filet.  We got parmesan truffle fries for the side.  When our waiter found out we were splitting everything, he offered to split our entrees as well.  That was great because it made splitting more even.  The filet was awesome--perfect temperature/color inside and very tender.  The fish was less tender than I expected, but I liked the corn spoon bread and vegetables that went with it.  I liked that the fries were thick, but not thick like steak fries, and had a crispy crust all the way around.  We had way too much delicious food, plus dessert was on the house since it was our anniversary.  We split the warm butter cake with ice cream and berries.  I loved that the cake was crusty on the outside, but warm and gooey on the inside.

Mitchell's Ocean Club is fantastic. The service is great, food is great, and there are plenty of options. On Sunday their wine (that isn't on the reserve list) is half off. Our server was great and the ambiance is perfect for date night, special occasions, drinks at the bar with friends (there is a very large bar area), or a night out to treat yourself. Expect to pay a good amount of money, but it's worth it. The reason I didn't give Mitchell's Ocean Club a 5 is because nearly everything is packed with butter. It would be nice to have a bit more variety for healthier sides and dishes.

I love the Ocean Club. It is by and far my favorite restaurant at Easton. It also happens to be tied with Cap City as my favorite Cameron Mitchell restaurant. Although it's a pricy restaurant, I would much rather splurge here than at Cameron Mitchell's similarly pricy M Restaurant. Location: It's at Easton, which is in my opinion the best shopping mall in Columbus. Don't want to park in the parking garage (which admittedly can be a cluster)? There's valet parking right outside the restaurant. Interior: Beautifully decorated, clean, not too loud, romantic, and in the warmer months with the option of outdoor patio seating.Service: Impeccable. I've always had great service here, and that's considering my first time here was at least 14 years ago!Food: From the wisconsin cheddar fondue appetizer to the salad to the seafood, I've enjoyed every dish I've ever had here. Even more amazing, in my opinion, is the fact that despite being named the "Ocean Club", I seriously think they have the best steak in Columbus! Their 14oz NY Strip Steak is to die for.Writing this review is actually making me crave the Ocean Club again... I'll definitely be back!

The best restaurant in Columbus and never disappoints! John W is an amazing server and we ask for him every time. As far as food goes you could close your eyes and point at the menu and you'd still never end up with something you don't like. We tend to gravitate towards the chilled crab legs appetizer, short rib appetizer, and the grouper is outstanding. Steaks are great too. Don't forget Mac and cheese. I could go on forever

Five-star dining, for sure... impeccable service, elegant presentation, superb dishes. I wished it wasn't in Easton, but I get it. I ordered the Black Orchid cocktail, which was poured over an orchid flower frozen in ice... and it tasted as yummy as it was pretty. The fondue appetizer was good, but I'd probably try another rather than order it again. The bread service included the most amazing sourdough bread I've ever tasted... seriously. Our halibut and Chilean sea bass were both perfect, the asparagus is terrific, and the jalapeÌ±o au gratin is a must-try. After all that I still couldn't resist the creme brÌÈlÌ©e for dessert, and I was thrilled with it... tons of vanilla flavor but not overly sweet. Good for a celebration or occasion (or just dinner on a Tuesday night for the 1%)... it's pricey. But if you appreciate fine dining and seafood, you need to visit Ocean Club.

Cameron Mitchell hits another home run with this one. This place is so elegant and lavish. Cameron sure knows how to bring some class to the Easton shopping center.The decor is beautiful and the waiting staff is extremely knowledgable and helpful. We ordered 2 dozen of the blue point oysters, and they were the largest that I had ever seen! They were DELICIOUS! The presentation is phenomenal. You will have to order them to see, but I can tell you it involves some dry ice theatrics. I ordered the New York strip and loved it. Others at the table thoroughly enjoyed the grouper. The sides are fantastic! The creamy spinach, Mac and cheese, and tater tots were some popular choices at our table. The MAC AND CHEESE is out of this world! Some of the best I have ever had. I cannot say enough about how wonderful our waiter was. He was very timely, friendly, and accommodating. The prices can be quite intimidating, but the food lives up to the price. I am no millionaire, and obviously couldn't afford to eat here every day, but this is perfect for special occasions.

My boyfriend and I came here to enjoy a night out.  Upon arrival the hostess looked us up and down and decided to place us in a back room- I was wearing a pencil skirt and nice top while my boyfriend was in nice jeans and a button down. We were placed in the corner of the private room 2 and I was extremely disappointed. I felt like we were on the misfit island. It was so bizarre and I almost had the audacity to ask to be moved. I don't want to come off as pretentious, but we go out a lot and we really wanted to enjoy the atmosphere of The Ocean Club. I felt that being shoved in the corner took away half of the experience.Onto the service- our server was cool and chill. Not the same type of professionalism you'd expect at the Refectory or Ruth's Chris, but we still liked him a lot. We each got a cocktail- passion fruit and the elderflower- they were good and had dry ice in then which was cool. As appetizers we ordered the surf and turf- Scallops, mashed potatoes, and bomb short rib- hearty, umami-yum! We also ordered the chilled crab meat cocktail and the shrimp sautÌ©. The shrimp was a bit fibrous, but the sauce was delicious. The crab was tasty too! We then had a bottle of the Starmont cabarnet and it had an awesome smoky flavor! We moved onto a Cesar salad and the lobster bisque. The bisque was tasty and they poured the soup on top of the croutons and lobster once it reached the table. My Cesar was ok, not amazing, not bad. Main courses: we ordered the blackened snapper, grouper, truffle Mac and cheese and the creamed spinach. Snapper was very good! Lots of flavor and delicious with the corn spoon bread. My grouper was different... It was in a broth with peas, some gnocchi, and the fish had a tomato sauce/ paste on top which was a strange flavor mixed with the almost chicken like broth. The Mac and cheese was absolutely delicious! Anything truffle wins my vote! The creamed spinach was smokey and made with bacon fat. Overall the food was pretty good! However, the experience for $350 that we spent was seriously lacking. This is why I took away 2 stars. We are huge foodies and like to try lots of things, ambience in a restaurant like The Ocean Club is important- I felt like we didn't have any type of feel for the restaurant and I was very disappointed with this part of the experience.

We dined here for my fiance's birthday. Our waitress went out of her way to make the night special. I had the crab cakes and he had the scallops. You have to try the passion martini! Our waitress also suggested that we order half sizes of sides so we didn't get too much food. She was right! This place is great for a special night out!

We booked a table for 6 people on a Friday evening, for a birthday celebration and had a fairly ok time.We all arrived to the restaurant on time and had to wait a good 15 minutes to be seated, which was fine. Problem is, they seated us close to the bar, which was noisy, a little crazy and I got to hear guys swearing like sailors for our whole meal.Our waitress was pretty awesome and she guided us through the various food options we could explore. We chose a seafood cascade of sorts for our appetizer, which included some huge shrimp, some very tasty oysters and a bowl of crab meat. Combined with the sauces that came with the tower, we quickly emptied the whole thing in what seemed like seconds.Funny thing was, they had taken our drink order and had also taken our starters order but we still had these large menus we had to hold onto, as they had not yet taken our entree order. It seemed like we had been seated for almost an hour before we got to "finish" ordering our food. So, we finally got around to ordering entrees and I chose the the NY strip steak. Not sure why I ordered a steak when at a seafood restaurant, but what the hell, we only live once, right? My wife ordered the Red Snapper and our friends ordered the Grouper and the Sea Bass. We still were shouting to each other, just to have a conversation and the bar area seemed to have gotten even louder by the time our dinner arrived. The table behind me had two guys telling stories to each other, bragging about things like chasing people with M****F**** guns, plus the one guy smelled like cheap aqua velva...yuck. So anyway our food arrived and it was mostly good, but not great. I did really like the steak, as it was crusty on the outside yet a nice medium rare in the middle. The problem was with the side dishes, as they were bland. We finished the evening with a couple of desserts to share, which were fine but when the bill came (over $500.00 for the six of us), we weren't sure it was worth it.I guess we were expecting more bang for our buck and all we got was a little "pop".Not sure if we will ever return.

I had a fabulous birthday dinner here! It was pretty crowded for a Tuesday evening, so definitely make reservations, even on weeknights. We started with the surf and turf appetizer: braised short ribs, scallops and risotto. I would've ordered two more of this dish to have as my main entree- it was a great combo and so delicious!We also enjoyed our entrees: Chilean sea bass and a medium rare perfectly cooked filet. I hardly ever order fish entrees, but I was pleased with the sea bass. I couldn't finish it though because I wanted to make room for dessert! In a previous visit, I had the teriyaki salmon and it was great too- the sticky rice and soy butter sauce made that dish! Side dishes: I had high expectations for the lobster mashed potatoes and it ended up being pretty good, but the black truffle mac and cheese was by far the better side dish! I could've had a whole bowl of it! You can definitely taste the truffle!For dessert, I couldn't decide between the carrot cake and chocolate cake with ice cream. Well, our server couldn't tell us which was better, so he brought out both for us! They were both excellent and so decadent! The carrot cake was 10 amazing layers and came with pineapple syrup, which I didn't care for too much, but it was drizzled on the side. I loved both, but I have to say that I think the carrot cake was better. My husband favored the chocolate cake. We were eating leftover cake for two days after and we enjoyed every single bite. :)

If you're willing to throw down some cash for a fancy night out, this is s great choice. This is the second time my wife and I have enjoyed ocean club and it's still a great place for great food! If you're visiting in a Friday or Saturday, I recommend getting a reservation. It's not exactly a hidden gem.Both times we've dined here we've enjoyed the goat cheese ravioli, it's so flavorful but not as heavy as you'd think. We both had the filet this time except I chose the truffle butter and the Mrs. Chose the blu cheese. We both agreed the truffle butter was much better but don't let me talk you out of the blu cheese. If you're craving blu cheese, you won't be disappointed.

Since moving to Ohio a few months ago, my man and I have really struggled to find good food; chain restaurants seem to reign supreme here. This is probably the only restaurant we've found that can compare to the restaurants in other places we've lived--Seattle, LA, and New York. (We've still got a lot of exploring to do.)We love our seafood and this place in the middle of Ohio, does not disappoint. The first time we went we ordered two salmon dishes, but ended up fighting over the teriyaki salmon so we now know to both order that every time we go back. That dish is fantastic. The cocktails are overpriced in my opinion, but I do appreciate the showmanship with the dry ice they use. It's fun to watch your martini bubble in front of you.We've tried a couple of different appetizers here, and my favorites have been the crabcakes and the ahi tuna. They are pretty pricey, but I haven't tried one yet that I didn't think was worth it. We were here last for my husband's birthday and they gave us the dessert special on the house (brown butter cake) and it was so fantastic. The best cake I have ever had. Best of all, the service in this place is fantastic. We are 3 for 3 for seamless dining experiences here with fantastic waiters and I can't wait to go back for #4.

Meh. In terms of cocktail and desserts, it was pretty good. I heard it was a great place for dessert and drinks and I had a craving for carrot cake ($11). Since they have the reputation of having the best in Columbus, I had to try it. Pretty good. A tall slice of ten layers held together with a subtle cream cheese frosting and thankfully no chunks of fruit like you find in some. I could have done without the Pineapple Syrup but that's me be picky. Other than that, I might get it again. Worth $11, not too sure. I've definitely had better for cheaper but I recommend you trying it or yourself.The Black Orchid cocktail ($11) was beautiful, accented with what looked to be an orchid flower frozen inside an ice cube sphere, but I didn't care for the choice of raspberry vodka. Made it taste too artificial. The Pear Grapefruit Fizz ($12) definitely wasn't worth the price point, leaving me wanting a lot more out of it. Tasted flat, in flavor and texture.I definitely need to try the dinner menu and report back.

My husband and I hadn't been here for a couple years so we figured a return trip was due. We started off with cocktails I had the Black Orchid and he had the Whiskey Clover and we both loved them. We ordered the colossal shrimp cocktail and omg I love their cocktail sauce as it has the right amount of horseradish. We also received the hot bread which includes the pretzel sticks and sourdough and the pretzel sticks are yummy. I ordered the scallops with Parmesan risotto and English peas with citrus vinaigrette and my hubby got the blackened snapper with a side of lobster mashed potatoes. Wow our tastebuds were super happy my scallops were cooked perfectly and I got a nice chunk of lobster in every bite of the mashed potatoes. I knew husband was happy because he barely spoke and his snapper was almost gone. We will definitely not wait so long for our next visit!

Let me start off with the first bad experience we had in the beginning. We made reservations for 8 for 9pm and then needed to add just one more person. The front desk was completely rude and said they can't accommodate one more person and thinks all the seats will be taken. I never heard of a restaurant not trying to make small accommodations, especially with a upper scale restaurant like this! So our 9th person went anyways and they easily added another chair to the table. Not sure why the front desk made it a huge deal over the phone.Anyways, my bad first impression changed after we met with the staff. They were very attentive, friendly, engaging, and went above and beyond. Our waiter, John, handled our party quite well considering it was a bachelorette so you can imagine the girls getting a bit loud and "crazy" especially with alcohol. He noticed our drink wasn't bubbling not the way it was supposed to and offered to get us an extra one on the house.The drinks were strong and tasty, just how I like them! Everything I tasted was delicious from the lobster cake, Chilean sea bass, the bread and butter, ribeye, and the absolute tastiest of them all...my blackened snapper! It had a bit of heat to it, the cornbread and tar tar is what makes this dish so good. Everyone literally cleaned their plate and not a piece of food was on it. They gave us complementary dessert with a party so big and how much we spent....the dessert was so good! I loved the extra chocolate cake/mousse; it wasn't too sweet which is great. Peanut butter/chocolate was amazing as well. Didn't care too much for the vanilla cake.Yes, it's pricey...but is definitely money well worth spent and I left with a belly full. I definitely want to come back and try this place out with my boyfriend on a nice outing.

We eat out super often.  This place is AMAZING.  You can tell that they take major pride in what they are cooking.  They aren't skimping when they hire their chefs.  Every single thing I've tried is just to die for.  Last night we tried the Dynamite Roll (sushi).  Holy moly amaaaaaazing!  My boyfriend even loved it and he's not even a big fan of sushi.  Try it. Trust me.  You will LOVE it.  Thanks so much for having such a perfectly yummy place for us to eat!!!  Don't ever change your service or quality of food standard.  They are both superior.  I would also recommend the chop chop salad and the halibut meal!  So deliciously perfect!

Had an awesome anniversary dinner here with the Mrs.  Excellent, elegant food capped off with superior service set the tone for a wonderful night.  We began with a split of two appetizers, the ravioli and the crab cake.  Both were great.  I got the King Salmon which did not disappoint.  Perhaps the star of dinner, however, were the loaded tater tots.  They were amazing and a lovely "big-kid" accompaniment to such a top-shelf meal.  A nice offset, there.  The house comped a ten-layer cheesecake due to our anniversary and that's never a bad thing.  We used to go to the Melting Pot for anniversary dinners and decided to change it up this year.  Ocean Club has earned a future customer for sure.

Haven't tried ocean club in 6 years after an awful service experience.  The food wasOkay, but service lacked and didn't make you feel welcome as they rushed you to get the next table.Made reservations and talked to the male manager at noon about making sure as a service organization they could be accommodating, he answered no before even understanding the issues.   We're going back to Ruth Chris where customer service is always top notch.

Every thing was perfect: food, atmosphere and staff.I never had such good tasting calamari before. I am definitely going back but only on for a special occasion. The prices are high but it is definitely worth every bit!

As my 1st time back here in about 10 years, I was anxiously awaiting this visit for my birthday a couple of weeks ago. The service and food did not disappoint. We started off with a wedge salad and calamari. Even split between 2 people the salad was a nice portion, and the calamari had a nice sweet yet slightly spicy sauce. For entrees we had the seafood bass and ribeye/Oscar style. Everything was so good! Fish and steak cooked perfectly. We also had a side of the lobster mashed potatoes. I've had these before at M, another Cameron Mitchell restaurant and couldn't wait to try again. They put ALOT of lobster in it so I definitely think the price is worth it. Also, the cocktails here are like works of art. It was my 1st time trying the Black Orchid which is probably the most popular cocktail at CM restaurants. While it is good, I think the Bubbles and Berries is my favorite. It's a real show when they pour it up for you. When I made my reservation on Open Table I mentioned it was my birthday and they did bring it up during service. My boyfriend and I both got complimentary desserts. Not your typical little birthday cupcake or anything either. I had a berry cheesecake and his was something with chocolate and peanut butter. It was honestly some of the best cheesecake I've ever had. The other dessert tasted like a big Reese's cup! Delicious, but probably not for people who don't like really rich desserts. While it's not someplace most people can dine at regularly, it's a great pick for a special occasion. Before I forget, the outdoor terrace is covered/heated during the winter! Big plus!! We were able to sit in view of the holiday lights :-)

What a beautiful and elegant atmosphere! I LOVED this place! I went to Ocean Club for a date night with my boyfriend upon recommendation from some friends I know. I'm so glad we went because it is one of the best seafood experiences I've had in a long time. The food was incredible and the service was some of the best I've ever had. I can't wait to return!

Went there for my wife's birthday, always a good idea to make a reservation, there is always a wait if you don't have a reservation. I made a reservation online and mentioned it was my wife's birthday.When we arrived the staff was very pleasant and they wished my wife for her birthday. Very courteous staff, once we were seated our waitress filled our water and gave us an ipad with the drink menu, my wife ordered the black orchid and she loved it, very creative drink with a flower inside the ice cube. The house bread basket was not bad, I expected better bread for such an upscale place.We ordered the lobster bisque and colossal shrimp saute. The appetizers came out pretty quick, the lobster bisque was pretty good but was overpowered by tarragon, it was not bad but I have had better, the colossal shrimp had some great crispy garlic  cheese flat bread to soak up the Tabasco cream sauce, the shrimp was jumbo not colossal, but it had great flavors.For the main course we had the Alaskan Halibut with lobster gnocchi and Sea Scallops with risotto. Both the entrees were pretty good, the sea scallops were a bit overdone but the risotto was great, the Alaskan halibut was executed well and had great flavors. We ordered the jalapeno scalloped potatoes, they were good as well.They gave us a dessert on the house, even though we were too full, our waitress said they will give us one to go for the birthday occasion, that was a nice touch, they gave us the dessert in a to go container with a candle and happy birthday written with ganache :).I give the service 5 stars and the food 3 stars, hence the 4 star review, the food is pretty good, but for the price, you expect more. The best part of the meal were the cocktails and the shrimp appetizer and of course the exceptional service.

The fresh oysters were presented on an iced bed of sea weed with lemon, fresh horseradish,  and cocktail sauce. Our filet was seasoned just enough to accentuate without overpowering the quality of the beef and cooked to our exact specification.  The waitress was prompt and courteous and the table presentation and maintenance was worthy of a 4 star establishment. This was our second visit with the same first rate experience. The only drawback was the level of noise which is understandable in a popular restaurant on a Friday night.

Good, just missing greatness.  Drinks are always well made. I had the whiskey clover and would have it again. 14oz New York strip (non-aged) was a 7.5 out of 10.  Nice char, better than average seasoning and taste.  It did however come up short on the finish.  Just slightly over medium rare and not warm through out.  I have personally made better steaks but I would eat this one again.  The Gouda tater tots were sub par at best as evidenced by they're overly dense filling.  I'll get the potatoes next time. Waiter was excellent Service was consistent. Will go again!

We picked Mitchell's for our anniversary dinner while visiting Columbus. We were not disappointed and our expectations were exceeded every step. We had a filet, red snapper and a dynamite roll. Our server was excellent and attentive. We will definitely visit again.

This is one of my favorite places to go when I am in Columbus.  The fact it's upstairs in the Easton Town Center Mall you would think you were in another world the atmosphere here is really nice.  The service here is great, especially at the bar. The food is always great.  My last visit came to meet friends so we sat at the bar and our bartender was attentive had water right away and he was ready for my drink order.  I love that!  They have a great wine menu and specialty drinks there is something for everyone.  This place is always busy so that tells you something.  Cheers!

Awesome food and service. Our server, Peggy, was absolutely amazing!!!! She was probably one of the nicest servers we have ever had and her recommendations were on point. The food was amazing. I'll probably use the word amazing too many times in this review, but to sum it up oysters, scallops, steak, lobster mashed potatoes, PEGGY = amazing!!!! Made our 7 year anniversary very special.

Absolutely incredible. You get what you pay for that's for sure. I can only imagine going here once every couple years but it is well worth the money you will spend. To start, my fiancee and I split the fondue appetizer which was the perfect starter. The cheese had great flavor and the veggies and meats to dip in it were fresh and fit very well with the aged cheddar. Big portions of food, perfect for two.For the main course I had the arctic char. Great flavor and the lemon butter sauce that it was cooked and served in had great flavor but was not overpowering. The fish came with a quinoa and brussel sprout concoction which was sweet, I believe it had a raisin and almonds in it too, and was a good flavor combination. This meal was delicious.The service was great and our server was eager to answer all of our questions and made great recommendations.

The service and food here are spectacular.  I've enjoyed the snapper, sea bass, lobster tail entree, lobster mashed potatoes, truffle mac and cheese, shrimp sautÌ©,and lobster bisque.  Everything has been extraordinary but the sea bass and lobster mashed potatoes are simply bliss.  The service makes you feel like dining here itself is an exclusive event.  The portions are reasonable, the prices on average for an appetizer or side is 15-20$ and 30-40$ for an entree.  They serve sourdough and pretzel bread as well.  I love coming here to celebrate birthdays as the food and service is always excellent.  They also give free desserts for birthdays.  It's easy to spend 75-100$ per person here but the fine dining with fantastic seafood makes it worth it.  When thinking about an exceptional dining experience, i think Ocean Club.
Overpriced and under portioned if your not wealthy don't even think about stopping here

Came here with a large group of coworkers and was disappointed at the sea bass after all the hype I've been reading and hearing. Everything else was like appetizers and sides were good. I had a cheaper sea bass at another restaurant in Columbus that pretty much kicked this one in the butt.

I got married last week (whoo!) and we were looking for a somewhat fancier restaurant to celebrate without the rest of the family around. The Ocean Club fit the bill very nicely. Not only was the food fantastic but the service was stellar. We made reservations off their website (super easy) and mentioned that we would be celebrating our wedding and love desserts. When we arrived for our reservations, we found a bottle of champagne waiting for us and our server informed us that dessert was on the house. (The champagne was a gift from my in-laws.) Then he popped the bubbly and we went to town on the menu. We started with the jumbo crab cake. Our server had the kitchen split it for us so we didn't have to fight over it. It was really good; a lot of crab, a little cake and some damn tasty sauce on top. Just enough heat to balance the sweet crab. For dinner, I went with the blackened snapper and my husband went for the twin lobster tails. The snapper was fantastic and the jalapeno spoonbread was so tasty. The lobster tails were a good size and my hubby enjoyed them very much. Another tic in the "awesome service" category: when he had emptied one of the shells, our server stopped by to remove it. At any other place, the shells would've stayed until they bused the table. For dessert, well, we ended up having both of our desserts comped. I went with the 10 layer carrot cake and he went for the warm butter cake. Both were awesome. I brought about half the carrot cake home and had it for breakfast the next day. We had a great time here and, since it is pricey, we'll be back for a special occasion.

My wife and I went on Saturday night. We were able to get a reservation same night. The attire was pretty dressy. Almost all the guys were in nice pants. The environment is really nice inside. As first timers there the waiter explained the whole menu and was very helpful. We had oysters as an appetizer. They were phenomenal. You can actually order them by piece. I had the French onion soup and it was pretty good. I ordered the filet. Legitimately the best filet I have ever had. Our waiter, Chip, was awesome and recommended the blackened snapper for my wife. She absolutely loved it. One of the best meals she had ever had. For the price and in general, we highly recommend dinner here as a couple or as a group.
To die for. The best seafood in the city with the best chefs and service staff. The atmosphere is professional and social at the same time nothing on their menu as ever disappointed

It's the only place I want to go that's not within walking distance of where we live downtown. It's worth the drive--and I cry about anything that's longer than approximately 5 minutes. This place will always be a little extra special to me because of how accommodating they are, which I suppose is a luxury that comes with restaurants with a head chef. I mentioned to the server that I was saddened because they no longer had a vegetarian pasta dish I had loved. She said, "No problem. I'll double-check, but I'm sure the chef would make it for you." And he did. And it was as perfect as always. The server also said that she'd have the goat cheese ravioli made with vegetable broth instead of the usual chicken. Just melts my heart. I don't like pie. I really don't. However, they gave us a free desert (and two free glasses of champs!) for our anniversary, so we got the peanut butter pie. It made me believe that Jesus has graced the earth with his presence again, and it is as this peanut butter pie. It's basically chocolate ganache over peanut butter mousse. Any further description would be an insult, because I could never do it justice. Order it. And visit OC.
Food was delicious. Expensive though. Very classy. Worth the money. I highly recommend this restaurant for that special occasion, you definitely won't be disappointed.

Just a great place for business or a romantic date. I will be back when I am in Columbus. I would say that this place can be right up there with any 5 star restaurant in the country. This is really a food gem.

After all the stores closed at 7pm at Easton on a Sunday night, I decided to check out the restaurant scene. Of all the options, Mitchell's rose to the top of all the rankings, so I decided to check this place out. Walking up to the second floor of a mall, I was skeptical at first, but don't be deceived by its location. The food, service, and ambiance were top notch and second to none. My server Scott has got to be the most attentive and conscientious server I've ever encountered. He made some excellent recommendations and really made an effort throughout the evening to ensure I was enjoying my meal and drinks. I ordered the elderflower martini and it was amazing, one of the best drinks I've ever imbibed. The presentation was also very dramatic, in a good way. When he poured it out of the shaker, the drink started bubbling and fogging up. It looked pretty cool! Not many places carry dry ice these days. For my entree, I had the blackened snapper and snap peas. The snapper was pretty good, but not the best that I've had. The bread basket was awesome. There were soft pretzels that were hot out of the oven. For dessert I had the chocolate peanut butter torte. This dessert was so divine and decadent. The texture of the torte was very fluffy and not too dense, definitely the best peanut butter dessert I've ever experienced. Overall, I had a wonderful experience and I'll definitely be back!

This open mall in Columbus is so lovely. There were a concert going.  We sat at the balcony to enjoy the breeze and late afternoon sun.The blackened white fish (forgot which fish) was wonderfully made.  Not too spicy or blackened to lose the fish flavor.  The services were excellent and the while (chardonnay) was just right.

I went here as my first dinner since providing care for elderly parent. I picked my wine and then told Rachel I didn't want to make anymore decisions. She served me the best meal I never ordered. Loved the filet, perfect medium rare. The jalapeÌ±o au gratin potatoes and Brussel sprouts were a meal in themselves. Best meal and great waitress. Will definitely be back!!

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary dinner. The place is very nicely set up, and gorgeous. The service was awesome! Never left us needing something, we were always taken care of.It was a little loud for fine dining though. I expected to be a little less noisy and more romantic. I guess it's not the restaurants fault though, they don't actually have a noise policy, lol. Would have been a lot nicer if it were a little more quiet to make it romantic.The food was delicious, portions however were a little small for the prices. Which are super freaking expensive. We both ordered steak with some sides. The steaks came out beautifully cooked and melted in our mouths! The calamari and lobster mashed potatoes we ordered came out just as nice. My only problems are the small portion sizes with very large prices and the loud atmosphere. This won't be stopping me from dining here again though. To be more specific on the pricing part.. For two drinking water ordering steaks and two sides it was around $130. BUT since it was for a special occasion they served us yummy carrot cake on the house which was very nice! I guess that's their thing. Which is pretty cool!

We've only been here about 7 times total but have never been disappointed.  The service has always been top notch, the atmosphere is inviting, and the food is outstanding.  My typical party of five and sometimes six has never experienced a single problem, and we've always left after an enjoyable 2 hour dining experience!

Excellent meal. We had a lot of fun with their server and I forgot her name. She was extremely fun and professional at the same time. Crabcakes were the best I ever had. Desserts were to die for especially the butter cake. I've been on many cruises and everyone ended with a baked Alaska. But, not like this baked Alaska. The best I ever had.  Steak was delicious along with our sides. Special night with my wife and daughters and this restaurant did not disappoint.  thank you.

I don't waste time writing reviews.  I had to on this one.  I cut my bone in filet with my fork!  And that was only one part of my meal. I could write a book, but just go there.  $$$$$$?   Yes!!!  But perfection has a price.   Just go and experience it!

I celebrated a birthday at the ocean club last week and I must admit I was very impressed. My initial opinion was how nice could a high end restaurant be when it is connected to a shopping center? The decor is very modern and it makes you feel like you're dining at a 5 star restaurant. We decide to sit outside, their patio is beautiful and it overlooks the outdoor shopping center.Our server was extremely nice and very professional. He educated us on the menu and helped us pick out the perfect bottle of wine. For an appetizer we order the calamari , it was cooked perfectly. I could've eaten the entire plate myself. It had a sweet chili sauce ad candied cashews. For dinner I orders a 10oz filet cooked medium rare. The steak came out a little over medium rare, but it was very delicious. I ordered the Au Poivre topping for my filet, its a black pepper topping. i enjoyed it. The sides are family style so we ordered a few for the table. My favorite had to be the jalapeÌ±o au gratin! Sliced potatoes and aged swiss. They were cooked perfectly. Finally for desert we had the white chocolate key lime tart. It was one of the best deserts I've ever had. Mitchell's Ocean Club is an amazing restaurant, be prepared to spend a lot of money though. It's definitely a special occasion spot.

My wife and I went I had been looking for a place to replace McCormick and Schmick's. We have had pitiful service the last few times we have been there. This year we went to Mitchell's for a Valentine's Day celebration. The restaurant allows you to use OpenTable to set up reservations which is a big positive for me. The waiter was very friendly and very helpful with narrowing down dishes to pick from. We ended up with a nice Caesar salad and both of us had the king salmon dish. The food is a bit on the "food art" side but very tasty. I would go here again for a nice occasion.I don't drink but it looked like there was a healthy choice of wine.

Came here for my birthday dinner with the wife.  Service and food was great.  We had the jumbo shrimp cocktail which was delicious.  I had the ribeye with truffle butter. Steak was cooked perfect.  My wife had the scallops with risotto.  The risotto was really good with great flavor! Also had a butter cake with vanilla ice cream with a raspberry sauce that wasn't on the dessert menu suggested by the server and it was wonderful!

If you are feeling seafood, this is definitely the route to go. The service was excellent and very helpful. This was my first time dining there, and I am pleased to say that I will go back. The dishes were very tasteful. The restaurant's atmosphere is a little noisy though.

Update:Mitchell's is located in the Easton Town Center, which makes it a convenient stop after a day of shopping. I have always found the food to be very good, and they seem to put a lot of effort into their service. On my last visit, I tried the Prime Roll from their sushi list and the berries and bubbles cocktail to start. I should have read the ingredients before choosing that particular roll, but instead just ordered what I assumed to be the "house" roll. I would not really describe this as sushi at all, except in presentation. It was cooked shrimp, cream cheese, and green onion, surrounded by what I would consider to be an over-abundance of gummy sushi rice, covered in beef carpaccio. I would not recommend this dish for someone actually expecting anything close to sushi. The cocktail was presented table side, and was good, if a bit sweet.For my entree, I ordered the surf and turf special. It came with a lobster tail, 7oz filet, mashed potatoes, and asparagus for $64. Everything was prepared perfectly, and my steak was cooked exactly to order. I ordered a martini, stirred, to go with my entree, and this drink was also presented table side in a cocktail shaker, and shaken next to the table before being poured. I'll give it to the waiter--he really tried to earn points on presentation, but you are never going to win over a classic gin martini drinker by shaking the hell out of their drink right in front of them. I cringe thinking about it.The creme brÌÈlÌ©e for dessert was very good. Valet is convenient, and located in front of the restaurant.Previous:My dining experiences at the Ocean Club have always been absolutely excellent. During my last visit to Columbus, I stopped in for dinner, and had an absolutely superb waiter, Shawn, who was able to steer me in the right direction from my first cocktail (the Black Orchid), to a wine pairing that would work with the surf and turf special (which was spot on). I would also like to add that, although my mother and I ordered the same dish, we ordered our steaks prepared very differently--I ordered mine "Pittsburgh," and she requested medium well, and both were cooked to perfection. The lobster roll sushi app wasn't half bad, either. Truly, I have nothing bad to say about this restaurant.

This restaurant is delicious! The selection of food is very very good. The service is exceptional! Our server, Clint, was amazing!  We didn't have to ask for anything, he made great recommendations, and knew the wine list very well.  We were there celebrating moving into our new house. They brought out a complimentary dessert with "congratulations" written on the plate. It was such a beautiful touch and absolutely delicious! Can't wait to go back!
The Ocean club is fabulous from the atmosphere to the service to the food. The Filet Mignon with truffle butter is one of my favorite dishes. Always cooked to perfection and seasoned just right.

Went to Mitchell's ocean club for dinner with high expectations based on the reviews, and while we had a great night, we were ultimately underwhelmed by the place.  I can be quite picky about details, but I think when you are paying top dollar prices then it should be all about the details, and that's where this place falls short.  The atmosphere was ok but we were seated in a room at the back which just didn't feel like it was part of the main restaurant.  Food: oysters were amazing to be fair (although unnecessarily accompanied with dry ice for smokey effect) but the rest of the meal was just ok.  Cocktails were nice but nothing special, and service was good (even if the waitress did lack discretion and manage to completely interrupt the conversation every time she came over).  The restrooms were messy with paper towels all over the floor, and a half empty family sized bottle of cheap moisturizer by the sink and dirty looking mouthwash....  Overall I think 3 stars might be a bit on the harsh side but too many people seem to be easily pleased dishing out 5* ratings willy nilly, and at $300 for 2 people this place is pricing themselves with the big boys so they need to be compared to them as well.  I doubt I will go back again as there are better places for food and price.

Possibly my favorite restaurant in Columbus for a date night.  Their wine and cocktail lists are great, and the food is always amazing.  My favorites are the scallops and sea bass, and even though I'm not a huge red meat eater I occasionally get a steak.  The service is always great in the dining room, but sometimes it's nice to just sit at the bar and listen to the piano (and stuff your face with truffle popcorn)This is one of the few places worth going to Easton for, in my opinion.

I think this might be a chain, everything in Easton is. But I really like this place. Of the several times I have dined here, I found the food really nicely prepared. Everything was seasoned nicely and had an ideal texture suitable for each dish. I have even sipped their dry ice cocktail, not sure how safe it is, but it's really fun. I can't comment on the prices because each time we were here, was for a special date so we didn't mind!

Something gets me about a place that serves their tap water unfiltered. Cooper's Hawk in the same shopping center is also guilty of this. Anyway. This place was ok. I got the surf and turf. I gave away the surf and didn't eat the turf. The mash was good. Loaded potato was ok. Asparagus was undercooked. I probably wouldn't eat here again, and I wouldn't say it was good. Thankfully I didn't pay. Pretzel rolls and sourdough were very good. Food service was extremely slow but server was pretty attentive. Ambiance leaves much to be desired, maybe outdoor seating would be better. Sushi appetizer was bad. Luckily there are a few more restaurants to try in Easton since I've been traveling here semi frequently for work.

What a meal!  Recently attended my friend's thirtieth birthday celebration here and am still thinking about the great food and service.  John, our server (party of nine) was great at letting us know about the specials and his favorites.  I had two handcrafted cocktails, a cucumber gimlet and a manhattan.  The gimlet was expertly muddled and very refreshing.  Friends tried the calamari, cheese fondue, and tuna tartar tacos. I tried a bit of everything and loved the fondue and the tacos.  The calamari was not particularly memorable, as it is a variation of the calamari dish found in all the Cameron Mitchell restaurants.  For my meal I had the blackened red snapper with jalapeÌ±o cornbread.  What a great marriage of favors!  Though my fish was slightly overcooked, it was still very pleasant.  Also split the truffled mac and cheese with a friend.  Of all the sides, this is definitely the one to get and share with a friend.  Probably some of the best mac and cheese in town.  We finished the meal of with some creme brulee and the famed Baked Alaska.  Again, the creme brulee was nothing spectacular and was very standard.  However, I could write odes to the Baked Alaska.  Layers of ice cream and cake, topped with a fluffy meringue cover and drizzled with berry sauce.  Yum!  A perfect ending to a decadent and fabulous meal.

Went here for a business dinner and had great food.  Server was slightly over bearing,  but very responsive.   We both had fish dishes that are delicious.   Has a great atmosphere.   I will go back again on a future visit to Columbus.

I celebrated my anniversary here and was very impressed.As others have noted, most people are skeptical about this place simply because of where it's located.  I do agree that this restaurant should have its own building, just to set it apart as a fine-dining restaurant.  If you stroll in here with a t-shirt, shorts, and flip-flops, you are guaranteed to stand out.  The ambiance and dÌ©cor are very pleasant, the food and wine selections are impressive, and the service is outstanding. Our server was very knowledgeable, professional, and really nice. The appetizer (jumbo lump crab cake with sweet corn cream) was quite tasty. I had the New York Strip with the Maytag bleu cheese crust accessory, paired with a Cabarnet (Mount Veneer, Napa 2011).  For a side, I had the creamed spinach (without the bacon).  The steak was sublime, but I personally was not too keen on the accessory I picked. I'm not a dessert person, so if I do have dessert, it will typically be fruit.  My husband has a sweet tooth, so we had the ten layer carrot cake, which was simply heavenly.  He of course wiped out most of it, which is fine with me : )This was overall one of the best dining experiences I've had.  If you are visiting the area or just looking for a great dining experience, give them a try.  If this is too far and you live in/are closer to the downtown area, try the Mitchell's at 45 North Third Street.If you live in or close to Polaris, try the Mitchell's at 1408 Polaris Parkway.

Of all the Mitchell's restaurants in Columbus this is probably my favorite. Anything I get here whether it's meat or seafood is always great and amazing. Food is always cooked to my preference. Service is also amazing. Martini choices are my favorite in Columbus as well. I love the Passion and the Black Orchid. They have a great happy hour as well.

For Ohio easily the best seafood fine dining experience I've had.  Visually the restaurant has an outstanding decor, but the main dining room can become very loud.  My wife and I were pleased to be seated instead in one of the smaller dining rooms off the main room which only accommodates four tables.The service from Brittany was top notch:  attentive but never intrusive.  The drinks were fantastic.  We would come here just to sit at the bar.  The wife had the pineapple martini and I had the Elderflower La Poire.  Both come smoking and bubbling from what I can only imagine was a small piece of dry ice at the bottom of our glasses.  The visual effect was entertaining and both taste very good.  We appreciated the wine list, which was reasonably priced, and although we chose a bottle there were several selection by the glass to choose from.It seemed like many diners around us were choosing steak which seemed odd since it is a seafood restaurant with the fish flown in fresh daily.  We both ordered the lobster bisque, but it was a disappointment.  Not bad, but we've had better at Willie G's which has the best lobster bisque I've ever tried.  For main course, my wife had had the Chilean sea bass, which came resting on a bed of mashed potatoes.  I had the halibut in a bowl of delicious sauce with some very small gnocchi and a few shreds of lobster.  There was a big dollop of completely pointless tomato paste on top of my fish, but otherwise the dish was flavored perfectly.When we go back we'll skip the soup and perhaps try a side or salad instead.  For fresh well prepared seafood, the Ocean Club is a good choice.

A really lovely place to enjoy dinner, have been here a few times now and it never disappoints. Some highlights for food are their oysters Rockefeller and king salmon. Their surf and turfs (they usually have 1-2 different varieties, depends on the special) are always excellent. Their yellowfin tuna was sashimi-grade, had a light sear on the outside, raw on the inside, so just an FYI if this is not your thing but my BF thought it was a wonderful dish. The waiters and waitresses really know the dishes and are helpful, but not pushy, while you select your dishes. I would definitely recommend a reservation, we usually just call ahead the day before or even the afternoon of and haven't had a problem getting a seat, but the restaurant does get crowded especially on weekends.

This place was a great find!  I stopped here while in Columbus for business.  Despite the overwhelming amount of favorable reviews this place has, I was a little skeptical at first because it was loosely connected to the back end of a mall. The restaurant is beautiful decorated and has tons of outdoor seating that overlooks the other shops in this area of Easton.  To paint a visual, this restaurant in feel is similar to other restaurants like Blue Pointe Grill, Del Frisco's, Capital Grille, etc.The place has a wide array of drinks that you can choose from on an IPAD.  I loved the options and was even more impressed by the staff's knowledge of the wines.  Besides, any place that sells Cakebread by the glass is more than A-OK in my book :-) For my entree, I tried the Blackened Snapper Oscar style with a half order of asparagus and potatoes.  I ordered way too much food so next time, I will only for one side (veggies, of course).  My meal was delicious!  The snapper was filleted, well seasoned, and cooked very nicely!  It came with a small scoop some corn goulash, which added a nice touch of sweetness to balance out the spice from the blackened seasoning.  Although I prefer my asparagus a little more crispy, both the asparagus and mashed potatoes were tasty and nicely complimented with a little accent of salt.I highly recommend checking this place out!  Enjoy!

A great dinner. I order a 10oz filet mid. and mrash potato with lobster. one thing I feel bad is the bread is taste a little rigid. but the price is not higher than I expect. I may come back if I come here again.

This is an odd pairing of fine dining and mall shopping.  The food is good. The service is impeccable. The value for money depends on your salary and attitude.  This is the same mall where you'll find a Tesla retailer.  If you think "let's go to the mall to buy a $100,000 electric car," then this is the place for lunch.  If you think "let's go the Costco at Easton to buy some new towels," check the menu at the door before being seated at a table.  Dinner for two, with salad, entree and drinks can easily run $100.  And the menu is modern with new takes on classic dishes, so be prepared for truffled champagne sauce,  jalapeÌ±o corn tartar, and brussel sprouts.Entrees (Chef's Compositions) run $26 to $49 on the dinner menu.  A salad starts at $9.  Steaks are a la carte, starting at $38.  Expect to pay $10 for a potato or other side.  Also expect the wait-staff to out-dress most patrons (this is a mall, after all) except on prom nights.  The staff avoids showing you that they cringe when diners arrive in t-shirts and cargo shorts (but they do).  They may even entertain you with a French accent just to make you feel more pedestrian.Easton is the right place for this restaurant, but it really should have its own building to avoid drawing in unsuspecting movie goers who looking for fish and chips or a burger, and grandmothers who offer to buy before realizing their social security will not pay for dinner *and* this month's rent.

The ambiance was great but I had a very disappointing time for the first time it should be noted at a Cameron Mitchell's restaurant.  Still it was my first experience at ocean club.  My date's food was good, but mine was not exciting.  Mostly, the experience was upsetting because I did not receive what is ordered.  The assisting server implied it would be corrected when I explained, but my server did not agree and no correction was made.

This was unbelievably unacceptable. The food was at par but the service: OMG! The worst ever. Wondering if that was because there were 3 Asians. Hope not! Talked to Manager on Duty (Jeff). Not sure he was particularly concerned. Guys, I am a regular here and I am super pissed.

I wanted to reserve my 600th review for something special, and this restaurant is indeed special. My bf brought me here for an anniversary dinner and this is likely the most delicious meal I've had in the city. We had oysters rockefeller, short rib and scallops, twin lobster tail, halibut, 10 layer carrot cake, and a crazy cocktail that bubbled and smoked for 10 minutes o.o I was blown away by pretty much everything, and felt like a pretty lucky gal for having the opportunity to dine here. The food is very consistent, and I don't think you can't go wrong with anything that you choose to order.

My very favorite restaurant in Columbus, Ohio!The service is always amazing. They are constantly educating you on their menu items and making sure you have everything you need. They always go above and beyond. The food- OMG! You cannot go wrong. Everything is so good! They are also always making accommodations to best fit your diet restrictions and will make things that they removed from their menu. The atmosphere is wonderful as well! Very romantic with a live piano player! I love the Ocean Club!
I had the tuna tartare.  Perfectly made. The staff was friendly.  Attentive, but not too pushy.  Great place to go out with friends or for a date.

Date night go to!! It's too expensive to eat at on a regular basis for me but it's fabulous for treating yourself or for date night! I am amazed of how fresh the seafood tastes, something I feel you don't get too often in land locked Ohio... And the desserts are always on point. The last dessert I had was the butter pound cake, warm and delicious!!
Tried the special - lamb chops, and it was great.  Like others, I also enjoyed the pretzel bread.  Service was prompt and atmosphere classy.

This place is AMAZING! Great food & drinks & service! I come here often and get their specialty drinks which are very strong and are well worth every penny! The steaks are very delicious, you don't need any sauce, it's well seasoned. Can't wait to go back, I've been craving the 8 oz filet with the signature truffle Mac n cheese it's AMAZING I highly recommend.
Good service, Mediocre food, high prices for what you get. Better food at Chipotle. It was recommend highly and was highly disappointing
By far the most complete meat and seafood menu in central Columbus. Far superior to Hyde park

The bartender was very pleasant and helpful.  She helped me make a good, local beer selection.  The New York Strip was great.  The jalapeÌ±o potatoes au gratin were good.  Then, she let me try the pineapple infused vodka.  That was fantastic.  Very good experience overall.

Located at Easton Town Center, this place is very upscale in style, but you would still feel comfortable here in jeans  too.  They have a great drink menu with a lot of smart cocktails. I loved the Peach and Mango Fizz.Note, I just spent time in the bar, not the dining room. I loved the calamari and the tuna tacos... both were very fresh - a MUST for seafood, of course. The atmosphere was calm and posh. It would be a great spot for a first date, not too loud to talk, but enough activity around to foster conversation topics. The service was really great - I had just come from my hotel in a taxi and had my bag with me. They kept it for me at the desk and worked with me to get going in time to catch my plane. I will return.
The crab cakes were AMAZING. My husband also enjoyed his Chilean sea bass. The atmosphere was nice and romantic. It was a great place to end my birthday festivities.
Overpriced. The menu is somewhat mundane. The Guild House menu is far more interesting.

Steak was terrible, the ceasar salad I ordered came out warm like it was sitting under the lights, it took 50 minutes for it to come out. And the steak was super chewy and had absolutely zero flavor, everyone at my party experienced the same. Best part of meal was their bread.

Never fails to impress. Good appetizers, good entrees - sea food is excellent and folks w/me say so are the steaks. Extensive wine list, although the prices are bit steep on most bottles, even for a restaurant like this. I did find Duckhorn Merlot for ok price and its a good one if you like Merlots. Sometimes I get two appetizers, one as app and other as entree. And it is plenty of food. Their home made bread and pretzel sticks are yummy. Sides are large enough to share and pretty good. I have eaten here at least 10 times in past 2 years and I have never had any bad meal including my guests.

I'll make this review short and sweet. Elaboration on Ocean Club, a well-known and passionately revered Cameron Mitchell restaurant, is moot. I'll just echo predisposed reviews: the food made me weak in the knees, the wine sinfully savory, and the wait staff flawless. I'd love to get my hands on a Cameron Mitchell restaurant employee handbook for conduct, because every one of his restaurants is rife with knowledgable, eager staff who assuredly earn their tips. I tip my hat!We ordered the lobster ravioli, blackened snapper, and crab cakes. Make note: there are no bread crumbs in the crab cakes. Simply solid lump crab. And my, were they incredible. So delicious, that I only want to repeat my crab cake experience in no less than a year--a dish this good cannot be overdone in such a greedy, crabcakeinmymouth fashion. Sidenote 1: I appreciate that the hostess tells us when our table will be ready, rather than how long we will need to wait. "Your table will be ready at 8:15" sounds much less aggrieving than "Your table should be ready in 50 minutes." Right? Sidenote 2: The bathrooms are more glorious than any fancy pants hotel bathroom. What did you say? You forgot your lotion/q-tips/breathmints/feminine hygiene products? Well lucky for you, princess, Ocean Club has an array of fine products to spruce you up and beguile the men.You know what you're expecting in every Cameron Mitchell restaurant, and Ocean Club is no different. I'd argue this is my favorite of his line of fine dining experiences. If I didn't know better, I'd have thought Ocean Club was perched on a seaside pier, rather than amid the Easton Town Center.

After being burned by extremely poor service at the Irish pub down the street, I came to The Ocean Club as a last resort. I should have just started here!After a great stiff drink, the bartender helped me to pick an entree and kindly recommended I reduce my sides to half portions, MAN was I glad I did! The Blackened Snapper was amazing (that jalapeÌ±o sauce!??!), the asparagus was perfectly al dente, and lastly the smoked Gouda tater tots...they are just something else entirely!I would highly recommend coming here if you are looking for a high-end restaurant that treats its patrons well. Thank you for turning my evening around and serving me a fantastic meal.
Best steak in Columbus. One of my favorites worldwide.

This is a very nice restaurant with really good seafood. We went there one "date night" and had an awesome meal! We started with oysters on the half shell, which we delicious and the presentation was very cool, they used dry ice so it looked like they were smoking! Then my boyfriend had the lobster bisque which was rich and creamy and very good. I had the ocean club house salad which was a good starter. For dinner, I had the blackened snapper which was very delicious and My boyfriend got the sea scallops which were also very good! Overall is was a pretty awesome dinner!

This is a great place in Columbus and it holds its own with bigger cities steak choices. Pretty much everything has been covered in the other reviews. I have only one thing to add. Blue cheese stuffed olives in your dry gin martini on the rocks. Slap- Yo- Mamma- But seriously, don't slap your mamma. Love, Yo Mamma

Came here for the first time to celebrate our daughters 21st birthday.  Great atmosphere, high end service and a great menu.  Everyone had something different and everyone was very satisfied.  They had a wine special this night with half off wine under $100.  We have 3 varieties of excellent wine for under 20 a bottle so this was a plus.   Some highlights on food were the crab cake and calamari starters which I would recommend.  The twin lobster tails were outstanding and the scallop risotto was pretty good as well.  All of the seafood is top notch.  Overall a great experience.

I love the Ocean Club. Been here before on several occasions and it's always exciting to go back. Had the opportunity to get some catch up time in last night with a colleague and we had a blast. We each had a salad (mine was the mozz/tomatoe special of the night) and hers was the chop chop salad.  We each got the 8 oz petite fillet medium and I had the mac n cheese truffle.  She got the jalapeno potatoes Au Gratin. Dessert turned out BETTER than expected. Creme Brulee for her and I asked for Carrot Cake at our server's recommendation.  I was brought Chocolate Cake (I know...oh darn!) and while I did not mind at all, was totally OK with it and NOT heart broken, our server insisted I get what I ordered and brought out Carrot Cake in ADDITION to the error Chocolate Cake. We asked for extra forks and we got to sample a little bit of everything so that turned out to be fun. Maria was more than gracious to box up the TWO cakes we had on our table - half slices each so each of us could take some home.  We get together roughly 1x a quarter and our last steak dinner night out was a disaster at another restaurant. This one confirmed our beliefs in the Ocean Club and reminded us once again we need to stick with the tried and true and go where it makes us happy.  Maria was an AMAZING server.  Stopped in when needed. Let us visit and catch up. Paced us exceptionally nicely. Offered suggestions, committed herself to our service and it was a great experience with her.   As always, we will definitely be back!

We had been wanting to check this place out for a few months and we finally went there on Sat. 1.  Service - slow but very good.  See I worked at Restaurant / Bar industry for a little bit.  So I was curious how they train their servers.  (FYI... Hostesses, servers, expeditors and managers were check our tables every 10 to 15 minutes) 2.  Food - I usually order medium rare for steaks but I ordered well done this time around.  I thought it was a little burnt and my wife concurred.3.  Ambiance - very upscale yet comfortable We think this might be #1 spot among all upscale restaurants in Columbus.  (We think it is better than Barcelona and Lindey's)

We love there gluten free selection the food is excellent. I have never had a bad meal . It's so good when me and my wife got married we had our wedding reception there the staff was great they even made us gluten free fondue. Thanks again for the wonderful experience the Cerni's

I dined here on a Sunday night for an anniversary dinner recently.  We enjoyed the Surf and Turf and half priced wine specials.  We sat out on the balcony and the ambiance was great. The service was excellent and everyone from the hostess to the wait staff to the manager had the utmost professionalism.  I had the crab cakes and Filet Mignon and my wife and I shared a very large Baked Alaska for dessert.  One of the best meals I have had in a long time.  Given the price I would only come here on special occasions but I would not hesitate to dine here again.
Great food and service. Had the crab legs and they did not disappoint. If you're looking for a fantastic upscale experience where the prices match the food and service this is an excellent choice.

I've been here three times so far and it never disappoints!!! The service is amazing, even when it is a full house they are on top of it! Recommendations?-make reservations! Even on a weekday you can have over an hour way during peak hours. -Get the calamari for an app! It has a tangy Asian flavor to it that's phenomenal- looking for a side? Order the corn. It is not just your ordinary corn! It is so flavorful and has a tiny bit of a crunch to it. Very surprised by this sideChances are you will like whatever you order. The portions are not overwhelming and each time I've been if I have leftovers, it's hardly any at all.

This is not Red Lobster and you will not receive cheddar biscuits.I was not aware how fancy this restaurant was when I organized a group of close friends to meet here for dinner and drinks on Friday. Thankfully, I had come from work and was still acceptably dressed for the occasion, although I felt dressed down in black slacks and a fashion knit top. I have been to the Columbus Fish Market and assumed it would be the same deal. Nope. But, nonetheless I had an incredible evening in spite of my expectations.Everything about the restaurant and experience can be summed up as "fancy & classy." This is the kind of place where you celebrate a promotion or ask someone to marry you. The waitstaff is painfully on cue to your every need, including the folding of your napkin while you are shown the rest room. Service was definitely 5 stars.The wine list was extensive. The vino guru at our table took it upon himself to order a bottle of red and a bottle of white to share. Between the 4 of us, we killed both bottles by night's end.Food was 5 stars as well. I had the ahi tuna and avocado as an appetizer and it was heavenly. For the main event, I ordered the scallops and they were seared to perfection. Our table of 4 did not opt to share a "side" which are large portions served family-style. About half my scallops atop garlic parmesan risotto came home in a doggy bag with me. Yes, it is quite expensive, but well worth it in my opinion. I hadn't seen these friends in awhile and we had such a nice time sharing stories and laughing that when the bill came, I didn't mind that it was much more than I usually spend on a night out. I had 5 star service, 5 star food and no regrets.
We went for our Anniversary. Had a fantastic experience. Service was impeccable, as was the food and desert!  Enough to share for our whole table.

I came here with my family for a special occasion and had a great time here. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. We had the raw oysters and the calamari as appetizers. I'm a big fan of raw oysters, but only if they're fresh and they were. The calamari didn't not come out breaded like I normally see them, which was a bit refreshing. The star of the meal was, of course, the Chilean sea bass, which I sampled from others' plates. The scallops I had were very tender and melt-in-your-mouth soft. The lobster was noted to be a little dry and not too extraordinary, so I would suggest skipping that. We even had a complimentary dessert. Everything was simply amazing.

I give this restaurant 5 stars! The food and service are always top notch. Whenever I have company coming into town and I want to give them the best of what Columbus has to offer I take them to ocean club.

Very good main courses.  Dinner was excellent.  Apps and sides were a little on the small side which would be my only call out.  For the sides they were pricey too.  The main course was very good and great quantity.  I had 2 kids and the server, Scott, was  very nice and talked directly to them and even shook hands with them at the end.  Very knowledgeable about the selection.  I would definitely eat there again!

When it comes to rating restaurants of this caliber, I most definitely pull out my fine tooth comb, and look for every little thing that could be 'off'. Unless you regularly dine in Tokyo or London, this is a reasonably expensive restaurant. My nit picky comb has come up empty. Twice. The first time we came here, my wife and I were being recruited, and we didn't get the bill, but were very, very pleased with the overall experience.Tonight,  I took my father and family here for his 69th birthday. The food and service was simply beyond flawless. Attentive, helpful, deeply knowledgeable staff. The food. Wow. Look, I will admit it, my wife and I are sticklers. We love to cook, and I used to cook professionally. We don't dole out praises easily. All of the food was excellent. The calamari appetizer was great. Candied and mildly spicy, but neither the sweet or the hot covering up the delicate flavor of the squid. Nuts and crispy vegetables in the mix. My wife is a vegetarian, and hates oily, heavy dishes. She ordered off menu, and asked them to come up with a dish with pasta and vegetables. Our waitress took the time to ask the right questions, and what came out was great. 3 (myself included) in our party ordered filet mignon. We each got different preparations, and we all loved our steak. I got the blue cheese topping, and.....I.....sorry, getting a bit misty here. Holy heck was it good. We ordered 2 potato dishes to share with our main courses. I LOVE this aspect of their menu design. You are in a top shelf place, but they wisely tell you that the sides are large and to be shared. It takes the edge off what could be a stiff experience for all, and creates a great table environment. The people running Mitchells OC deeply understand what makes great food great, and understand what excellent service looks like. They are not just going through the motions, this is the real deal. Flying someone in from Beijing or Berlin for a meeting? I would take them here without reservation.

I grew up in the area but moved to Los Angeles many years ago, so whenever I'm in town my sister and her husband like to take us out to their favorite restaurants.  Being that it was our anniversary they decided on the Ocean Club!   Wow!!!   As luck would have it the weather was dreary and rainy so we opted to sit outside on the covered balcony since we don't get to enjoy a lot of dark rainy days in SoCal.  It was so relaxing to sit and listen to the light rain while we ate dinner and so exhilarating to see the flash of white light and hear the crack of thunder seconds later!  Everything we ordered was spectacular!  The wine, oysters, steak, salmon, side dishes and dessert were delicious.  We tasted each others dinners and remarked on how good each entree was.Since it was our anniversary our waiter surprised us with dessert.  We all looked at each other exclaiming how full we were until we tasted dessert then we fought over it!  I can't even remember what it was since we ate it so fast!  The bubbling martini's with dry ice were an exceptionally nice touch.  Going to make those at home.Our waiter was very professional but once he realized we were there to party he let loose and had us all laughing with his off the wall comments. I cannot wait to go back to Columbus again.  Ocean Club here we come!

I hadn't been to Ocean Club in a few years, so when my husband suggested that we come here for our sixth wedding anniversary dinner, I said OK.  And, after our dinner, I remembered why we don't really come here: It's not worth the money.Now, the drinks are great.  Pricey, but I'll spend a little money on a nice handcrafted cocktail.  I tried the Passion Martini, the Berries and Bubbles, and the Grapefruit Pear Martini (for the record, I wasn't driving).  The cocktails were top notch.Our server was OK, but not great.  I think that he was trying to be nice and give us a a leisurely dinner, but when it was 20 minutes into the meal and we hadn't yet ordered dinner and still had menus sitting on the table, I got a little impatient.  For starters my husband had a Caesar salad and I had the oysters, which were nice, but had some shells in them.  If you have oysters on your menu, you should learn to properly shuck them and clean out the shells.  But I digress.  For dinner, I ordered the Chilean sea bass.  Now, I eat at a lot of Cameron Mitchell restaurants because I have food allergies and they are very allergy friendly.  When I ordered the dinner, I asked the server if they could please substitute the sides for something that I could eat (plain asparagus, a baked potato, etc.).  The server said it would be no problem, so I pleasantly looked forward to our dinner.  However, when my dinner arrived, I was handed a plate with one piece of fish, 6 small carrot shavings, and 12 (yes, literally 12) peas.  And that was it.  For $43.  Um, WHAT?  My fish was cooked beautifully, but I was pretty bothered that they couldn't or wouldn't make me some sides to eat.I should have said something to the server, but at that point I was so annoyed by the people in the restaurant who were really loud and the table seated next to us dressed really inappropriately and talking on their constantly loudly ringing cell phone.  I honestly just wanted to get out of there.  They did give us a free dessert for our anniversary, but I could only eat the sorbet, which was clearly not fresh and had some freezer burn on it.So, in closing, if you are looking for a really nice, romantic dinner, I'd suggest going elsewhere.  I'm giving this place 3 stars because my fish was cooked beautifully and the cocktails were fantastic.  But, we spent $240 and they couldn't even throw a freaking baked potato on my plate.  Nope - I think we'll just sit at the bar next time.

It's been a while, so please don't fault me.  We met the chef (!) after the meal by insistence of our waiter who learned we were leaving the next day for the Seattle area moving to Eugene.  What this has to do with anything is their ability to cook good fish (and it takes someone like this chef who had been trained in Seattle to filet, shuck and deal with fish for 10 years to get how amazed we were at the quality of Mitchell's Ocean Clubs food seafood; I am originally from Seattle).  The food was outstanding.  I don't know if they still serve the Truffle Mac and Cheese, but for a side dish, I will tell you, MADE our 3,000 mile journey and hassles a bit sweeter.  Try this dish if they still have it.  As people have waxed poetically about the calamari, this was our favorite as well.  The place is beautiful, wait staff is attentive but not intrusive (were they want to take your plate ever 5 minutes), and as Jonathan pointed out, don't be put off by it being in a mall setting, because the view, the food, and the staff more than make up for the overall mall business (not real fond of the internal part of the mall, but love the external beauty of the area, its calming and well done).Cameron Mitchell does a stellar job on this location.  I only wish we had gotten caviar, but that was not in our budget at the time, and with a quick reservation there also wasn't time to have set that up (usually caviar takes a couple day's reserve for most restaurant's to have it available if it isn't normally on the menu).  Would we go back?  In a Columbus minute!

We ate here over the weekend. Started out with possibly the largest Bluepoint oysters I have ever seen, were just delicious. Everyone shared their entree because they were so good. The butterflied Filet mignon was perfectly cooked, the scallops melted like butter in your mouth, and very clean not gritty, and the halibut was tender. Amazing food all around.Side dishes were fairly good. Twice baked potato was great, the only mediocre item at our table the entire evening was the asparagus spears. They shave off the skin, which is what a lot of fancy restaurants do, and they tasted okay, just not the best I have ever had.We sure picked a great night, not at all on purpose, because every bottle of wine under $100 was half off. So we took advantage of that. Our waitress was very attentive to our needs, even though she had a number of tables to attend to, and she even gave us a free desert, which was if a pound cake had made sweet love to a custard, with fresh fruit on top.We met the chef, who is a young kid who has been the head chef at this location for all of three months. Everything they prepared was spot on, and they had no problem substituting different sides or sauces that came with our entrees.We spent a lot and left our waitress a ample tip, and our appetites behind, very happy to have found this great place. I will return for sure the next time in Easton.

What here on last night and this place is excellent, pricey but we'll worth it. We had the oysters on the half shell, bone in ribeye, lamb chops, and king crab legs. All of the entrees were above what I expected along with great service.

So expensive! So crowded! But the food is great. Mitchell's restaurants have a good reputation and consistently deliver great food and nice ambiance - but I do think that you could get the same quality of food at a smaller less commercialized place, for a lower price and more intimate environment. But this place is a great place to entertain business clients.

My fiance and I dined here because we had gift cards.  This is not the type of restaurant we could afford without them!  Regardless, the service was outstanding.  Probably the best service I personally have ever received from a restaurant.  The food was also outstanding.  However, I think if they are going to charge upwards of fifty dollars for a steak it should come with a side.

Was it ok? Yeah. Expensive? Oh yeah. One app, one entree, one glass of wine: $80. The "Point Judith" calamari was swimming in a sweet sticky sauce more appropriate for PF Changs.
