Red Snapper was hot and spiced right but too much sauce. Stop with the sauces already.  Sooo self consciously upscale without the real fine dining one hopes for at these prices.

Coming from NYC on a business trip to Columbus, Ohio you don't expect to find a huge variety of good food places. I saw this on the top of the list and walking distance from the hotel we were staying at. Not to mention this restaurant is located at the heart of the main shopping center. We had gone in with 5 people on a Monday night at 9pm..Definitely not crowded. This place was quite fancy- asked us if we wanted sparkling, still FIJI, or just tap water. (that's when you know) and of course the wine list. An assortment of breads (sourdoughs and pretzel breads) were provided.I ordered the 10 oz Filet Mignon Medium Rare- I have to say solid choice. Met my cravings and exceeded my expectations. We ordered a lot of sides to compliment our meals (truffle fries, black truffle mac and cheese, snap pees, baked potato) Everyone who ordered steak was satisfied. My manager ordered the Sea Bass and Halibut but was slightly disappointed. We probably would have ordered dessert, but the service took quite while to bring the food out. So my only complaint is that the service was quite slow. But the steak was solid.

My friend and I ate at the bar.  The wine and cocktail selection is fantastic.   Bartenders friendly and provided good service.  I had the salmon which was okay....the few vegetables on top of it were slimy and just gross.   We ordered a side of corn that was delicious.  My friend had the red snapper which she said was good.  This was my first time to the Ocean Club but won't be my last!

The atmosphere was not the greatest...very cramped seating and way too loud. One of the ladies at our table was hit on the head twice by a server. Shrimp cocktail, Cobb salad, and peanut butter pie were good. The Chilean sea bass was just average...not much flavor. The lobster sushi roll was delicious.

You don't just come here for the food you come here for a great experience. The servers are extremely talented at catering to your needs even before you knew you needed something.  The main dish was beautifully cooked to perfection, however, the true delight was all the small things: the side dishes,  the bread, the apps,  even filling the water before it went below the ice. You also walk out of there with a very full belly...not like other high end restaurants where you get one pea on a tablespoon of mashed potatoes..you pay top dollar at oceans club and you get top dollar food.  Great for a special occasion, highly recommend!!

The atmosphere is elegant. The staff were exceptional. I had the snapper and was completely surprised. I ate the whole thing! So good I didn't want to take any leftovers. I had a signature cocktail recommended by the waitress, a raspberry compote Cosmo that bubbled and fizzed for several minutes. I took a video! Very tasty, but more like a dessert drink that pre-dinner. Overall lovely experience!

It's a Cameron Mitchell restaurant so it goes with out saying that this place is good. No, not good, great. The steaks are phenomenal, always cooked to specifications, served with some of the best a la carte sides out there. The best side is easily the creamed corn, the best of any I've had at any steakhouse anywhere. I love the oysters Rockefeller and calamari to start. The real reason I'm writing this review has nothing to do with the amazing food and service other Yelpers have already elaborated on... The Black Orchid. The greatest martini there ever was. It's beautiful to look at, and even more beautiful to taste. Deliciously sweet and easy to drink.. I think I could drink these all night. A must have!

Fantastic on all levels.I went here for my birthday last year. I was amazed by the atmosphere and the friendly staff from the moment I walked into the door. This was my first official experience at an upscale restaurant, and it's one I will not forget. I started out with the lobster bisque which was the best soup I have ever tasted. My entree was the chilean sea bass with whipped potatoes and champagne truffel sauce, cooked absolutely perfect. I also had a taste of the pork porterhouse that a family member ordered, and it was very good. I finished with the baked alaska which was definitely the best dessert I've had in a restaurant. Also got a taste of the creme brulee and the peanut butter pie. It is extremely expensive but definitely worth the splurge. Definitely a night where you will not be disappointed.

Great Mother's Day Eve at Ocean Club!  Wife had surf & turf with Black Orchid cocktail - all phenomenal.  I had teriyaki salmon with Maker's Mark Old Fashioned - terrific.  Both kids had Filets - ate every morsel.  Fondue appetizer is a must - delicious and fun to share.A consistent great meal at Easton.

May be the best restaurant in Columbus. Order anything, any way you like it and it'll come out with a smile. I ordered 8oz filet medium and added a lobster tail, which I requested Tempura style...no problem, and delicious. JalapeÌ±o au gratin potatoes are a must, and the chocolate cake was amazing (and FREE for our anniversary).

The food was outstanding, and I'm not here to write that, coz it will just echo the same thing that everybody have already said. I'm here to propose different things on the menu, and going against what everybody seems to have a consensus on :). I believe, if you choose mine over the crowd, you will not be disappointed. 1. Leave the truffle mac n cheese, it's good, but it's just a mac n cheese in the end. You can't bring much finesse on something so simple I think2. Try the carrot cake, instead of the baked alaska that everybody are raving about. It was good, but the carrot cake was more phenomenal. Baked Alasa, in the end, is just an ice cream (although kudos to the meringue and berry sauce)

Second visit to Mitchell's did not disappoint.  Pretty crowded for a frigid Tuesday night so this place must definitely have some draw.  Sampled a few apps..all very good....just not very memorable. The entrÌ©e was a different story. The blackened snapper was outstanding.  Server called it his favorite and I can see why.  My dining counterpart had the 10 oz. filet.  The best kept secret about this place is the STEAKS.  I had the ribeye last time and the filet this time was equally amazing.  Mitchell's LAND Catch might not have much of a ring to it but the beef was as good or better than any high end steak chain.  Great wine selection supports the meal. A Central Coast Cab did nicely.  This place stays front and center on my Columbus (Easton) dining options.

All the hype and then some! From the moment you walk in the door the experience starts. Friendly hosts welcome you with seemingly sincere smiles and usher you to your table. My preference of a window seat was quickly accommodated, and dining staff cleared excess settings promptly. My waiter was everything you'd expect at this caliber of establishment- knowledgeable, professional, and courteous. He checked in often and the team effort was commendable as multiple waiters checked in and refilled drinks and cleared dishes away while my waiter attended to other tables needs. The dinner was spot on. My lobster bisque appetizer is easily in the cities top two, and the Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes stole the show. One would not expect such fine seafood in the middle of the mid west but here it is. Ocean Club easily rivals any coastal restaurant I've eaten at. Though a bit on the pricier end in Columbus I actually found it quite fair, especially when you take into consideration that they are flying most of their menu in for freshness combined with their location at Easton. Certainly worth it and I recommend to anyone.
It was just ok. Very overpriced for the quality of the food. The noise level was extreme

I love this restaurant! The food and service is phenomenal. The atmosphere is lovely and sophisticated. We make an appearance here whenever we can. One of our favourite spots even for a pop in and have a glass of wine kind of night.

This was an amazing place. Everyone friendly, even overly friendly. Oysters were very fresh and dinner was fabulous.  If your ever in this area it is a must dine place. Call ahead for a reservation because it is always full. You will have a great dinner and atmosphere!
Ocean club is always amazing. You would be hard pressed to find better service and the food is second to none. Make sure to try the Tabasco shrimp appetizer.

The Ocean Club is stellar.  My hands-down favorite in Columbus (Lindey's = close 2nd).SERVICE:  Superb.  Always.ATMOSPHERE:  Lovely.  Our favorite thing to do is come here post-shopping, or just at the end of a long week, sit at the bar, have a few cocktails / a few apps and listen to the live jazz man (http://covetliving.com/gus/holiday-staycation/)COCKTAILS:  Outstanding.  Favorite = the Cucumber Gimlet.  The only thing I *will* say is that the cocktails are EXPENSIVE.  Have a few each and you're already at $100.APPETIZERS:  Goat Cheese Ravioli, Surf & Turf (Scallops + Short Ribs) & the Oysters on the half shell are AMAZING.  Best oysters I've ever had.  Ever.  And that means a lot because I lived in Charleston, SC for 10 years.DINNER:  I don't do full-on dinners very often (we did Halibut this past weekend, which was great), but the ones I've had have been good.  Smidge overpriced but what are you gonna do.Keep it up, kids!
The 'surf and turf' appetizer and the blackened snapper are excellent.  We always get phenomenal service here, and it's just a wonderful dining experience.

I don't like most "lifestyle-chain-store-in-a-box-surrounded-by-fake-brick-facade" places like the Easton Town Center, but Mitchell's Ocean Club is a solid spot to dine.    My sea bass was well-prepared.  Our sides were perfect--the corn was amazing, the sugar snap peas were delicious.  Dessert was huge and rich, far too decadent not to be shared.  The wine list is excellent.  Service is superb.  The miss on the fifth star is only due to the fact that they were out of several entrees.  The server told us this right away, but it seems strange to be "out" of several menu items at 6 p.m. on a Tuesday.  They should have printed an updated menu.

While on a business trip, I went to dinner with some colleagues.  It was s little more expensive than my budget, so I ordered the chicken, which was less expensive than other entries.  It was very good.  If you are not an expert on wines, they have a steward that, given your tastes and price range will offer great options.  From steaks yo seafood to poultry, the food and service was great.

I decided to sit at the bar to order dinner. The guy at the bar, Server 451 said the receipt, asked me once I sat down what I would like to drink. I asked for water, thinking I would look over the menu and decided which wine I would like with my dinner. Later on nearly 5 minutes of waiting I had to ask for a menu. I was given a food menu only, so I still didn't know which wine I was going to prefer with my dinner. Subsequently approximately 10 more minutes he came over and inquired if I was ready to order. I still needed a wine list, then after inquiring for one I was handed on a tablet to view my selection.  I did notice the bartenders were not too busy to serve the person sitting two seats down from me. This person came in after I did, had water, a drink and had already placed their order... all before I was given a food menu.The service was subpar and I felt that I was not getting the level of service this restaurant commands. After getting past the lack of service, my dinner ended up being excellent.

Perfect..  Whatever you want they do, and whatever they do is perfect.The menu is varied enough that you can get fish, seafood, red meat, poultry, pork.Everything is alacart.  Salads and sides are large, so share.Large list of craft drinks.  They have a large wine menu and also a "super" wine menu.  Markups probably approach the obscene level, but offerings I have had were all exceptional.Service is top-notch.If you want to be in a crowd, front room is good.  They do a great HappyHour too.  If you want quiet or romantic, ask for the back room.They have valet parking or you can park wherever in The MallWe spent 125$ for two.  No bottles of wine this time.Prefect.  Ocean Club and M have to be on par these days.  Both perfect.I was there on a Friday night, rez at 8.

3.5 out of 5 stars.Relative to the price, it would not be unreasonable to expect perfection or something close to it. Ocean Club does a decent job but doesn't quite nail the perfection.The seafood sampler was top notch. The wine selection and whiskey selection were on par with expectations. The calamari was great -- spicy and not rubbery.Now for the problems:Within our group, one person received the wrong entree. To their credit, they fixed it very quickly and then comped us a dessert. While anybody is entitled to a mistake, it is a bit awkward to have to wait for that person or eat while they wait.The steak (which seems to be their specialty despite the name Ocean Club) is promised as seared at 1200 degrees. There is no doubt that it is but the result is Pittsburgh Rare rather than something more traditional.Service was slow. Despite being a table of 10, there were several times when we had to search and flag down our waiter. I could see this during the middle of the meal but after you've served dessert, it should not be a surprise that the table may want the check.Overall, it's a decent experience. It's just not a 5 star experience.

Hands down, one of my favorite seafood restaurants in Columbus. What I love about it, besides the food/drink, are the great staff and ambience. The crowd is always lively, and while the atmosphere feels decidedly upscale, there is nothing pretentious about this place.The food is excellent. I recommend the Colossal Shrimp SautÌ©, Truffle Mac and Cheese, JalapeÌ±o Gratin, and the Chilean Sea Bass. The drinks are inventive, and the presentation is always lovely (go for the Black Orchid which is not only delicious but adorable).If you still have room, the desserts are sublime. The Ten-Layer Carrot Cake is massive. I don't even usually go for carrot cake, but I make an exception for Ocean Club's.

We were in town for a family gathering. I found this restaurant online and  we were not disappointed. #1 prepare to spend....#2 order the creme brulee for dessert#3 do sit close to the bar to overlook the area below...This restaurant is located to a loud tex mex bar that has happy hour specials...overall fresh good food...again prepare to spend...
I like this years ago when the had that WILD modern metal decoration.... then they changed it to boring brown wood????But was a very nice place!

Finally made our way to Ocean Club at Easton.  It was a great night!First, I would definitely not feel comfortable here in jeans.  Cocktail dress, slacks, suit.  Not jeans.Second, try to come on a Sunday!  Their bottles of wine are half-price on Sundays, what a bargain.  We wandered in and had no idea: we got lucky!Food: most everything we ordered was pretty amazing.  You can't leave without trying the rare ahi tuna appetizer, it was my favorite thing.  My husband said the filet was perfect, and the scallops and risotto were delicious too.  (Although I did enjoy the scallops at the Refectory a bit more.. Sorry!)The sides are a la carte, but are really big.  If you are a couple, ask for a half-size of the sides.  We got the mashed potatoes and truffle macaroni.  (I didn't like the macaroni -- it tasted a lot like Velveeta.)  We skipped dessert but the table next to us got a HUGE Baked Alaska to share and it looked pretty delicious.Service: super great.  They help each other out and are very friendly.  Plus they do not hesitate to tailor your meal for you, no questions asked and no up-charges.I really want to go back when the weather warms up so we can sit on the balcony area.

Excellent service - never had this good service at any restaurant I have been to in the US. I am vegetarian so could not try a lot of stuff, but what I got was REALLY good - the salad and Jalapeno au Gratin were both great!

I had a very large group. The staff did an amazing job servicing the whole group. Not one complaint. The food was exceptional. Oysters in OH?  Absolutely!!!!  Fresh and Clean. Will most certainly be back when in Easton.  I did the Sea Bass and it was some of the best I have ever had.
Great food, great service, and a great place to grab a cocktail. Simply put I don't think you can go wrong with this choice.

This bar is one of the sexiest in town.  Very old school, think Rat Pack.  Dry ice in your drinks, beautiful decor and lighting.  Enigmatic bartenders who know how to mix a cocktail and an easy, non-intrusive conversation.  Food is good, but the atmosphere is the reason we go.  Can find great food downtown, where we live, but nothing duplicates the Ocean Club bar's vibe.   Great for a date or a girls night out.

Easily one of the best meals I've ever had!I narrowed my choice down to two entrees, so asked the server which was better and with no hesitation she said the scallops.  So I ordered that.  The wife ordered the jumbo crab cake appetizer as her meal based on it being singled out on the menu as their "Signature Appetizer" (and that she loves crab cakes).  We also ordered a baked potato and "chophouse corn" as sides.When the food came out it took a lot of rearranging of things to make everything fit on the table, we were with another couple.  The sides are quite large, way more than what one person could handle.  The fact that each side dish feeds 2-3 people helps keep the cost down as they are pricey.  My scallops looked fantastic and tasted ever better.  There were four and they were very large, seared beautifully on both sides.  But the risotto which is part of the dish really upped the the scallops to another level!  They were incredible.The baked potato was just good, but the corn was great.  The server had described the corn as special, I believe that it arrives fresh every day and is cut off the cob.  Butter and spices are added but it was truly special.  Her describing it to us is what prompted me to order it.The service was very professional and good, and I think the key to our experience was using the servers (Jen) ability in our selection of food.  My entree and the side of corn were they two things she guided us to, and the wife's crab cake was high lighted on the menu as being special, and these three things were simply amazing.It isn't cheap, but it was certainly worth what we paid for it!About the only thing that was a negative was that we were seated in the middle of the main area and it was loud there.  Next time there we will ask to avoid being seated in that part, but even if we had to sit there, that certainly wouldn't deter us from a meal here.An all around amazing dining experience!

Felt like we were on a first class cruise-excellent service and atmosphere. The corn side dish was amazing-mixed with sugar and white wine;highly suggest.Lobster bisque was very good and creamyThe scallops we very good as well, but nothing could touch their corn side. I never thought corn could taste so good.

Refused to open our bottle of wine, despite my offering a high corkage fee for it. Total small town, small potatoes short-sightedness trying to get me to buy their inferior and overpriced wines. Terrible customer service and attitude from the manager in the process. Certainly never coming here again.
Everyone's food was excellent and it was a great dining experience.

I would highly recommend a reservation - we came here at 8p (one hour til closing) on a Sunday and they were packed!  Sunday IS half priced wine bottle day, though...so that may explain the business.  Nevertheless, we were happy we had a reservation.Take the opportunity to dress up and you won't be out of place here.  Very classy ambiance, the serving staff is great - very professional and friendly, and decked out in white tuxes.There is valet parking ($5) or you can park at the meter or one of the garages, but it's a bit of a walk if you're not lucky.  Just be aware while you're rockin' those high heels.  At 8p we found a meter right across the street.We tried the full contigent of app, entree, desserts and drinks and everything was great.Drink - just me, hubby doesn't drink.  The Black Orchid.  It comes with an orchid encased in ice and they pour the martini right at your table, all the way to the top so you can't even lift the drink it's so full.  Don't be afraid of looking like an idiot sipping your drink from the table - it's THAT GOOD.  Man was it good.  Honestly one of the best martini's I've ever had.  Tasted like it had no alcohol whatsoever in it.  Lest you think the bartender just made us a weak drink, I was feeling it after just the one, so that wasn't the case.Apps - truffle deviled eggs and oysters rockefeller.  The deviled eggs may look strange to you, but we love deviled eggs and these were really fantastic.  It's harder than you think to make a really excellent egg - they are very easy to overcook.  But these were perfect and had a nice zing.  The oysters...well, we have had better, but I will say these were the best oysters we've had in a landlocked state.  They were still pretty nice.  You won't find much better unless you're at the coast.Entrees: I went with the twin lobster tails, hubby had the ribeye.  The lobster was cooked nicely with a yummy spice on top, and I liked their little butter warmer with a candle.  Hubby's steak was EXCELLENT.  It had a fantastic char on the outside, just like it should, and was perfectly cooked to medium rare.  I am always a little wary of getting steaks at a predominantly seafood place, but this ribeye rocked!We got the truffle mac and cheese for the side (yes, they love truffling everything) and it too was excellent - highly recommended and worth the price.Desserts - they were out of the baked Alaska and PB pie.  Hubs got the carrot cake and I got the creme brulee.  Both were HUGE.  I'm not a huge fan of carrot cake but I liked it with the pineapple puree sauce they had...the creme brulee, for me, was the only thing that wasn't fantastic.  The crust was a bit too thick.For all that, $150 minus tip.  So it's not cheap.  But it is a great romantic dinner and you'll enjoy the food if you go into it understanding how much you'll be dropping on dinner.

Service was exceptional- hence three stars. Food was average. Our waitress was great and realized we were not so pleased with the Kansas steak and had the manager remove it for our check- again service was great. I wouldn't say I'd go back to eat though. Food was average and from what I heard it went from being seafood focused to now a steak house- we literally ate in the Prime Rib room. Cocktails were awesome! Dry ice affects were an added bonus to my martini. Try it out, but expect a pretty hefty bill and then go have a snack somewhere!

We celebrated a birthday last night and our experience was good. We were seated right away and our server was prompt, professional and made appropriate recommendations for our meal when asked. The food was served in appropriate timing and was excellent. We had an experience with a bone-in ribeye that had tendons running through it and was not good. But the manager removed it from our  bill and we were comped a steak to take home to enjoy later. We enjoyed our evening out and will go back!

Everything wonderful from beginning to end!  The wedge salad was cold and delicious. The yellow fin Tuna was perfectly prepared. Great choice for atmosphere, food and incredible service. If you choose to sit at bar, be sure to ask for Mark. He gave outstanding service.
The absolute best calamari in the city!!! Try the cucumber gimlet cocktail--refreshing and delicious.

I've been to Ocean Club twice now, and both times it was a great experience. It is kind of odd that it's smack dab in the Easton mall but once you go inside the restaurant, you almost forget all about that. The service is so above and beyond that I cannot think of anywhere else I have had better attention. The first time I went, it was just because. It was kind of annoying that everyone from the hostess to our waitress and even the manager kept asking us what we were celebrating when there was no celebration, but I guess it's understandable that 90% of people there are celebrating something. To be fair, the second time I went it was for my birthday and it was actually really nice to have everyone (from the hostess to our waiter to the manager) tell me happy birthday!Both times I got the black orchid cocktail and both times I loved it. Girly and smooth, with a cool looking ice cube (a flower petal frozen in the ball of ice!). Both times my date got the 10 oz filet mignon cooked medium. The first time it was cooked to PER-FEC-TION. Literally every single bite he took he was raving, almost to the point where I was annoyed. But I tried some and it was indeed perfect. We agreed you get what you pay for. Second time around was still good, but the first steak still takes the cake. Maybe we were just coming in with irrationally high expectations the second time. I went outside of my comfort box on my second visit and ordered the chilean sea bass. I have nothing to compare it to since I never had it before and don't really know the fish, but it was fine. The truffle sauce was creamy and yummy with it - I almost enjoyed the sauce more than the fish. We split a side of brown sugar carrots but were honestly so full from the bread and our dishes that we couldn't finish them. On my birthday I got a free dessert and the chocolate cake was the winner. 7 layers of fluffy chocolate that was not too sugary, and almost more bitter like dark chocolate. Perfect for me. The desserts are huge though, so sharing is caring!

18th Birthday celebration for my youngest son. Everything was terrific. Taste, presentation, service, atmosphere. Simply does not disappoint. Surf and turf appetizers outstanding. Crab cakes are wonderful (accompanied sauce a little too jalapeno), 14 oz. strip steak was the 'best I ever had' (son's comment).A memorable event. Thank you Denisa (our server).
We had a big group so I got to try a big portion of the menu. I really enjoyed the crab cakes and calamari

I've enjoyed several of Cameron Mithcell's restaurants but for some reason I had never made it to Ocean Club. So when I was back for Christmas and staying next to Easton, I thought this was the perfect opportunity.The whole place has a kind of a "rat pack; 50's vibe" to it and I like that. Staff is all in white coats and a piano player was singing holiday tunes. Menu is obviously big on seafood but also lists an extensive steak selection. We started with the crab cake which was awesome. Probably the best I've had. Since my brother in law had mentioned he had one of the best steaks ever here, I decided to give the filet a try, as did my partner. We both enjoyed it however my partner would have liked it pushing "medium" a bit more. I thought mine was perfect.  As for the sides, this is where Ocean Club took a bit of a tumble. It wasn't the quality or taste of the baked potato side dish, it was that it was SOOO freakin' big! Yes, our sever told us the sides serve 2-4 people but nothing can prepare you for the Nerf football sized baked potato they bring out. And the the thing was so hot you couldn't touch it (never mind eat it) until you were 3/4 of the way done with your steak.  It just seemed odd compared to the well thought out dishes we had previously.Great seafood and steak place but unless you have 5 people with you, skip the sides.

Just about perfect!  Our server was one of the best we have ever had anywhere!! His recommendations were spot-on. The oysters Rockefeller were huge and delicious. My husband really enjoyed his filet and it was cooked perfect. I had the salmon special with the mushroom risotto...delicious. We were so full after that we didn't have room for dessert but did get coffee. It was a great end to a wonderful dinner.

We enjoyed Mitchell's after a long day of Christmas shopping on an overnight getaway.  What a wonderful  surprise!  The place is first class and the service is excellent. Attractive dark wood decor and white table clothes.  You wouldn't think that such a fine restaurant would be on the  top floor of a shopping mall or that the food could be this good--but it is!We expected casual after-shopping diners and spotty attire.  Instead, it seemed to us that most of the patrons on this busy Saturday night were pretty nicely dressed and it appeared that they came to Eaton Town Center specifically to dine at Mitchell's.  And for good reason. The food and service were tremendous.  After a short wait at the extremely busy bar, we were seated at a quieter table next to a window.  Our server was courteous and knowlegeable.  He pointed out that the large sides could be shared and he even brought us a half order of one of them.  My wife had the sea bass with truffle sauce and it lived up to the other awesome reviews on this site.  I had the porterhouse which was broiled to a perfect medium rare and melted in your mouth.  Elegant!    And, don't forget desert--if you stop at the Easton Town Mall info center on the ground floor of the mall, they will give you a book of discount coupons.   Use the free desert coupon at Mitchell's to get the Baked Alaska....not the best of I've had, but very good nonetheless.  They have several other good desert choices.This is a better restaurant and the prices reflect that quality.  I don't think the portions were too small, in fact, we both took some home to our hotel to enjoy the next day!  We enjoyed our experience and we'll definitely be back.   Thisd would make a wonderful place for a special occasion or large business group.

Classic fine dining done quite well.THE FOODWe had;- The Tomato Mozzarella salad; outstanding. The ingredients were first rate and the composition was not overdone at all.- The Pork Chop; outstanding. The server recommended it medium, and he was spot on.- The Petit Filet, very very nice. The server recommended no more than medium and it was again just right. The peppercorn sauce was the weakness, I'd guess corn starch was the culprit.- The Black truffle Mac+Cheese, Button mushrooms and Creamed spinach were all very well done as well.- The wine and port pairings recommended by the server were perfect. - The Carrot cake was the best we'd ever had and the Creme Brulee was excellent.- All for about $150 not including tip, and the desserts were free due to it being our anniversary.THE SERVICEVery very attentive, knowledgeable and accommodating - maybe a bit too syrupy though. Later I realized some of the lines that were intended to be charming were rehearsed and were being repeated verbatum to every other table - and we thought we were special ;-)   But I would rather the service err on the side of it being overdone. He even offered to run down and put in more coins in the meter, we were definitely being pampered.THE ATMOSPHERESupper club decor and nicely done. The balcony was nice, even though the view is of the monstrosity called Easton. Some thoughtful touches, like a shade on part of the balcony to prevent the setting sun from being an irritant. But then some fans on the balcony would have really made it more comfortable. On the negative, the bathroom floors were sticky and there was splatter all around the urinal for the entire 2.5 hours we were there.All in all, I will repeat and recommend. I would guess you will consistently have a very good experience, as you should given the prices.

A friend took me here to celebrate and I was absolutely flattered to be taken somewhere so fanciful.  When we arrived the restaurant was full, thankfully we had made reservations in advance and had a table waiting for us.  Our server was promptly over to discuss the menu and wine selection with us.  She managed to talk us into a bottle Treana (although my goal was to limit my drinking...).  It was absolutely delicious, she had her flavors down and knew every question I threw at her.Our meal began with the goat cheese ravioli, which was delicious.  Looking at the menu, I had to stop myself from ordering too many appetizers, but I'll definitely be returning to try the truffle deviled eggs.  I went on to order the Chilean Sea Bass with champagne truffle sauce.  So delicious!  Maybe I just love truffles, but I think this dish was prepared beautifully.  My friend ordered the Ginger Salmon and both of us were very pleased with how it tasted (especially since I had it for lunch the next day).  The waitress was sure to point out that the side dishes come separately, so we had a serious debate over which to order.  Although tempted by the truffle mac, we settled on the scallion twice baked potato that was highlighted on the menu.  This was the only part of the meal that wasn't spectacular.  Don't get me wrong, it tasted good, but I'm sure I could have ordered something similar elsewhere.  Next time I'll be more adventurous with my side selection.And then there was dessert.  Oh dear goodness, I'm so glad I didn't skip this part of the evening.  Chocolate Peanut Butter Pie, I love you so!  This dish was simply amazing.  I would come back to the Ocean Club just to devour this over and over again.Yes, this restaurant is a pretty penny.  I won't be coming here for just any dinner, but for special occasions (especially romantic) it is a lovely choice.
Even an overwhelming Valentines Day crowd didn't adversely impact on the service ... Second to none. Steaks were cooked to perfection.  Our favorite spot in Easton for dinner.

Expensive as all get out, but delicious.  I did have to send my steak back though due to being under cooked and the sides do not come with your meal which is a total crock given how much you're paying. The deserts were phenomenal though.  The service was good but it was way too noisy.  I had to almost be yelling across the table just so my husband could hear me.  And the tables are so cramped and close together so that you can't help but be a part of the neighboring table's conversation.  For as expensive as it was you'd think the experience would be better.  It should be impeccable for a $250 tab for only two people.
Go for happy hour to get some good deals, and make sure you get the calamari, it's the best I've ever had!

PROS:  Very high quality seafood.  Cooked to perfection.  Ambiance is impressive for being in a mall.  Very classy place.CONS:  Extremely small portions and VERY pricey.  You can get the same quality seafood at the Jersey Shore for MUCH cheaper price.  My bill just for myself was $81 without tip and only had 2 glasses of wine.
The atmosphere is so nice! It's really beautiful inside.The service was amazing, and the food was even better.CRAB CAKES!It was a very positive and memoriable dining experience.

I went to the Ocean Club on a weeknight to celebrate a friend'sbirthday.  We had a reservation and were taken to our table right away.We ordered the Chilean Sea Bass and a filet cooked medium rare alongwith the jalapeno cheddar potatoes.  The bread isn't bad - nothingspectacular though, pretzel sticks and a circle sourdough loaf...wouldprobably be better if they had a specialty butter or cheese dippingsauce.  After we ordered I decided to peruse the wine list -- to mysurprise, they had a $6 glass of wine, which was a bonus!!  I was verysurprised that they had budget wine.  So...the food.  Average at best.We did get a sample of the mac and cheese which was really delicious --I would go back for a full order of it, but, I'll leave the sea bass andfilet.  As for service, A+, very attentive and helpful.

Such an elegant place to dine for a romantic night or to celebrate a special occasion. The service was impeccable and the food top notch. I ordered the crab cakes for dinner and they did not disappoint. For dessert we had the tiramisu and delicious coffee, probably the best coffee I've had anywhere. The servers were very professional and well informed on the menu. The piano player was a nice touch as well.
Awesome place, everything from appetizers to soup and entrees were terrific... As a traveler from Chicago, this place rocks!!!
Had a great dinner here last Thursday. Had the shellfish Cobb salad, black truffle Mac and cheese, and some wonderful Chimay Double beer.
Great food. Lobster bisque is excellent. Seafood tower has oysters, shrimp, king crab. Service is top notch

Never had been to this place but heard about it. Usually at upper scale restaurants the good portions are small but no not here I ordered the Teriyaki Salmon with sticky rice and veggies it was great would be an understatement. The service was in point and me and my lady enjoyed the ambience of the business.

I'm torn between 4 and 5 stars but one little nitnik pushes into the 4 star category.  That nitpik started the meal, so it took some recovery.  Anyway, we went on a Sunday night for our anniversary and the restaurant wasn't very crowded.  However, when the hostess went to seat us she sat us right next to the kitchen....like one of us would have to stare into the kitchen and at the computer where the servers are ringing people--a high traffic area.  Given that there were a plethora of other seating options, we asked to be reseated.  A server approached us and told us we could have our pick.  We should have listened and seated ourselves, but we let the hostess re-seat us......RIGHT NEXT TO THE KITCHEN!  This time it was against a wall with a window looking into the kitchen, so less traffic but still quite noisy.  I felt like the right thing to do would be to seat us as far as possible from the kitchen since there were plenty of seats. However, that was really the most annoying thing about dinner.That being said, once we were seated our waiter (who was the one who approached us earlier) was wonderful.  It was 50% bottles so we decided to get a Willamette Valley Pinot Noir and he told us a little about the three choices so help us make our decision.  I hate when waitstaff don't know the wine list, so this earned him points in my book. Later in the meal he also suggested a port to my husband who was deciding which to have as well. I had the oysters, snapper, and blueberry lemon cheesecake and my husband had the crabcake appetizer, filet mignon with bernaise sauce and the chocolate cake.  We split the stuffed potato.  The food was all good with the steak being a standout.  My husband said it was the best steak he's ever had, my snapper was excellent--hot and delicious but not overcooked.  I am from Florida and am usually deeply opposed to paying $3/oyster when I grew up paying .25/oyster but these were very good.  The potato was probably the one thing I felt like was 1) probably not necessary given we were unable to finish dessert and 2) truly overpriced in a restaurant where we knew we were going to drop some cash.Desserts were both delicious and tasted very fresh.  Overall it was really nice, excellent and unobtrusive service, really stellar food and other than the seating thing a great meal.

Mitchell's restaurants always feature really good, quality food.  The ambiance is great - good for a date or to bring a couple business partners.  Geared toward seafood, but their steaks are what I would suggest.  It is expensive but not uncommonly so for the quality and atmosphere. This is a place that I will be back to for sure, but probably not a place I would be a regular at.  Columbus fish market has the same quality for less money.

My cousins and I went here for my birthday. The food was really good. the waiter - amazing. We felt as if he had practiced his lines he was just that good. Even though I wasn't allowed to pay - this place is pricey so just be prepared and do dress up! Even though we were 10 minutes late for our reservations at 10:30 pm they were still excellent as far as being nice about it and even though they close at 11 pm there were still people there so it was nice. We order shrimp scampi for appetizers as well as calamari and for dinner I had the Chilean sea bass with a side of mashed potatoes - SO good!  I would definitely recommend this place to others.

My husband and I went to the Ocean Club for our anniversary. This was our first time there and it didn't fail to impress in both quality of food and service. Although it's attached to Easton, it does not have that cheap-eating-in-a-mall feel at all. The decor reminded me of what the interior of a yacht might be like and was very pleasant. At 6pm on a Wed it wasn't crowded at all but soon filled up - with some rather loud business folks and other C-bus yuppies -within an hour. Despite that, we enjoyed our meal. Is it the best fine dining in Columbus? No. I mean the surf and turf appetizer was glorified pot roast with mashed potatoes and 2 scallops. But it was very good nonetheless. I'd definitely recommend Ocean Club and I especially liked that their portions were of high quality and a normal serving size, not the gross, overblown servings at nearly every other place at Easton.

I get something different every time and have never been disappointed.  Some tips: 1. If your address is at least 50 miles away, the Easton Mall will give you a booklet with coupons.  There is a free Mitchell's dessert in there.  I recommended the carrot cake or peanut butter dishes.2. The calamari - so stinkin' good.  It is NOT merely battered and served with two sauces. 3. The sides are SO BIG.  TOO BIG.  We aren't from Columbus, so we never can keep our leftovers.  We found out this last visit that you can get half sides.  STILL HUGE.  Saves you money and you can try more things.4. They bend over backwards for you if it is your anniversary or they mess up something.  I once ordered a medium steak, and it was well done.  I had been eating it for 15 minutes (it was still good, and I don't like to send things back).  When our waiter saw it (that there was no pink within the meat), he was so disappointed that I had not complained, and he insisted on getting me a new one and ordering me a cocktail on the house while I waited.  That's service, people.5. Speaking of cocktails, get the black orchid.    We will be back next an anniversary.  No doubt about it!

What would it take for me compose a rave review of a seafood restaurant?  Before my first dining experience at Mitchell's Ocean Club Restaurant, I'd have confidently answered "NEVER."I have a profound aversion to seafood, so nuttily encompassing that I cannot contemplate swallowing anything which considers under the water's surface to be "home."  And if I discover having just eaten mashed potatoes prepared with, say, anchovy extract:  well, then, my dinner companion will be spending the next 20 minutes alone as I projectile-vomit, hopefully in a toilet stall and not at the table!  Bonkers?...no argument from me.  But not worth the $5000. fee to have a psychologist therapize it to non-existence.So it should be no surprise that seafood restaurants aren't a favorite.  Perversely, wouldn't you predict that my aversion might interfere with me regarding a seafood establishment as a favorite?When I decided to take my boyfriend for seafood on his birthday (his favorite), I took him to Cameron Mitchell's Ocean Club, I was blown away!  The menu assumes that not every guest wants fish or seafood, and so there is a significant section of alternative options.  From many subsequent meals there, I can say with confidence that the chefs are skilled in excellent food preparation beyond their obvious cuisine of expertise.This restaurant distinguishes itself by the fact there are no fishy aromas...ever!  The waiters and ..tresses are knowledgeable and willing to take steps " above and beyond" to make the experience perfection as the guest sees it.  Not cheap, it isn't intended to be a routine dining destination but it has become my "dress-up dinner destination.".                     Six Stars!!

Short and sweet - I thought this place was great from the food to the service. We shared our steaks and our sides (all alacart)  and had tasty drinks and YUMMY bread!  The service was great...don't hesitate to come here... can't imagine anyone being dissapointed!

Let's start out by saying I prefer not to dine in "mall" restaurants... But, we thought we would give it a shot since we wanted to avoid downtown on Halloween weekend.The food we had was great! The signature appetizer crab cake was really good and big enough to split... I ordered salmon and my fellow diner ordered the scallops... We got 2 sides to split... the asparagus and wild rice... Not sure how they did it, but, the asparagus was the best I have ever tasted...  Didn't know you could really change up asparagus... but, they did. My salmon was excellent... perfectly cooked and melt in your mouth good. I didn't try the scallops because I have a bad history with them. The portions were large enough we had left overs. The ambiance... is... OK. We were seated kind of in the middle of a larger room surrounded by tables... We probably should have requested a booth. I felt like I could hear everything the tables around us were discussing... and since I have a tendency to listen to other people's conversations... I found that kind of distracting and hard to ignore. The service was pretty good... Nothing spectacular. For "mall dining" I would say Mitchell's Ocean Club is pretty darn good.

This is where my wife and I went for our 10th anniversary and it is our favorite restaraunt.  The food and ambiance is amazing, but the best part is the service. Very kind and knowledgable staff.  We were placed in a very private table in the back. It was a dining experience I still think about and hope to have again.If you go there, try the surf n turf appetizer with the sea scallops and braised short ribs. Heavenly!

Easily one of the biggest dissappointments I've ever had!We dined with another couple who gave it 5 stars, so it shows how different each person's opinion can be.  If Yelp allowed 1/2 stars (will this ever happen?  They show partial stars on the review averages), I would give it a 2 1/2. Upon entering, it is very appealing visually as it is a classy establishment located in a mall, of all places.  After we sat down, the noise was totally overwhelming.  The acoustics in this place are horrible - easily the loudest place I have ever dined at (and that includes Red Robin with its population of loud screaming children and a place in Maumee, OH which has live music).  Within minutes, I had a throbbing headache from the clatter.  I could hear approximately 15% of what our server was explaining about the menu and specials.  This was not a good start to our experience so it would really have to knock our socks off to make up for that.  Good luck trying to converse with your dining companions without yelling.A basket was delivered to the table which consisted of warm bread and soft pretzel sticks.  I bit into the pretzel stick and it was so salty that I immediately placed it back on my plate (and I enjoy salt).  The other bread was fine.I ordered the appetizer surf & turf, which consisted of 2 large scallops and braised short rib on mashed potatoes.  My wife ordered the house salad.  We also ordered the candied yams and jalapeno potato au gratin sides.  The scallops were perfectly cooked and not fishy at all, but void of flavor - they needed some lemon juice or a sauce on them.  The shredded short rib was very good but a small portion.  I know it was only an appetizer, but I expected more for $15 when I can go to a nice restaurant in Toledo and pay the same for a full meal that comes with a large salad and have a much more satisfying experience.  My wife's salad was ordinary - it was supposed to have apple in it but she said there were only 3 small, thin slices.  The sides were nowhere near as large as the server claimed, since they were supposedly big enough to share between 2-3 people (especially since a previous Yelp review claimed the baked potato to be a Nerf football sized).  This appears to be an urban legend akin to the existence of Bigfoot or that Elvis is still alive.  Since they were average sides, perhaps it was to our advantage they weren't larger.  I can get a far superior version of yams in the form of a sweet potato souffle for much cheaper from either my wife's homemade version or Boston Market, both of which include the contrasting texture and added flavor of a streusel topping.  Mitchell's was basically candied yams with some large marshmallows melted on top.  I only had a small sample of the jalapeno potato au gratin (their "signature" side), but it did not make an impression one way or the other.  Another letdown considering the sides range from $8-$10 each.Caveot emptor (buyer beware) is my warning because sides are not included with the entrees, which range from $24 to $45.  In fact, the average price of the 17 entrees listed is $35.18.  Add sides and drinks to that and you will have a hefty bill for average food and an average experience.  When dining at a restaurant of this calibre, I expect the highest quality, taste and service - I want to be wowed.  It should rock my world or be a life-changing event.  This was not that type of experience at all.  Our bill was $50 prior to tip for an appetizer, salad, two sides and one soft drink.The service was average at best.  The server checked on us once after our food first arrived to see how it was.  Perhaps it was because we were low priority since we didn't order full entrees and alcoholic beverages so the tip would not be as large as surrounding tables.There are so many other wonderful and unique places in the Columbus area to have more flavorful food and a better dining experience than in the corporate setting of the Easton Center mall.  And you can visit them 2-4 times for the price of one visit to Mitchell's.  I doubt we will ever go back or visit any of the other related establishments.  WAY overpriced and overrated!

Absolutely Stunning!Met at this place for a business dinner with some colleagues and for the first time in Ohio, I was impressed with a restaurant.I am not going to go into detail about what everyone ordered as that would be way too much information.  I will just give some highlights.Apps: Oysters Rockafeller and calamari.  Oysters were divine and the calamari was cooked perfectly.Entre: I ordered the 10oz filet with the garlic shrimp scampi on top.  This was absolutely stunning!  And the lobster mashed potatoes on the side were to die for.The service was impeccable and attentive.  The place is pricey but well worth it.  Read through the menu, you will know what I mean.I dont need to go into detail here, all you have to do is read the other reviews.  They definitely speak for themselves.I will be going back!

I wanted to rave about my New Year's Eve experience a few months ago at Ocean Club. We were a party of four who had booked a reservation some time in advance for 9:00pm. As expected, they were packed that night and running behind. While we had expected that, we didn't expect a 45 minute wait for a table.However, Ocean Club addressed the situation before we even had time to say anything. When we were seated, they brought us out four complimentary appetizers and both the server and manager apologized for our wait. We would have been happy with one appetizer - four was a shock to our group. The appetizers were very good: the calamari, ravioli, cheese fondue, and another appetizer that I unfortunately cannot recall.Dinner itself was also fantastic. I had the ginger crusted salmon and enjoyed it. The rest of my party also enjoyed their meals, which ranged from steak to scallops. My date and I split the sauteed mushrooms for our side, and they were very well done. I snuck a taste of dessert from one of my party and it was the best carrot cake I've ever tasted. Had I not eaten so much for dinner, I would have ordered a piece for myself.We were eating dessert when the ball was about to drop, and to cap off a great service experience, the restaurant passed out party favors and complimentary glasses of champagne. My New Year's Eve exceeded expectations, and we would not have changed a thing!

I was expecting more from the food.I came here with a few coworkers for a after work dinner...we heard it was really amazing food. Service was great, our waiter was pleasant and patient...Food was just blah, we had -  filet Mignon (medium rare) - the french onion soup- half dozen oysters- Baked salmon- Tilapia with lobster- Potato Lakas- Steamed Broccoli- Tuna Tar TarEverything was super fresh but lacked flavor...I was expecting so much more.
It was okaaayyy. I think the food was not worth the price, but the ambience is probably the best you can get in Easton, which isn't saying too much.

3.5 Stars.  I REALLY wanted to love this place and it was good but not great.  I love the bar area and all the drinks are really fun and creative plus the truffle popcorn is to die for!  Four of us came for dinner on a Saturday night and the hostess was a little rude.  She asked if we wanted to sit outside noting our reservation requested it so I asked how hot it was, her response in a snotty voice, as hot as outside.  Well sorry I didn't know if they had fans or air conditioning in there since in the winter I thought they heated it. Whatever I can get over a snotty hostess.  Our waitress really wasn't all the much better although she wasn't rude just not friendly and we had to flag her down every time we wanted to order something and to get our check.  We came here expecting to order seafood and all four of us ordered steak bc nothing on the seafood menu was really jumping out at us.  Calamari for an app was good.  The steaks were good but nothing fantastic.  The sides were really good though, truffle mac and cheese was amazing and the jalapeno potatoes were great too and not spicy like I thought, just a little kick.  No room for dessert although I was very tempted but the peanut butter pie. Oh and FYI if you aren't sure how dressy the place is (we weren't sure whether the guys should wear pants or if shorts were ok)...some guy at the bar had a hat, t-shirt and jeans on and other people had suits & dresses on so it kind of varies, seems like anything goes since it's at a mall.I would probably come back and give this place one more shot bc I like the atmosphere and drinks but hopefully next time the service is better.

A beautiful place. The tables were a little too close for my taste and you could hear other persons conversations but otherwise beautiful. Ambiance was soft. Romantic atmosphere mostly. The guy playing the piano was just great. Georgia on my mind, sounded so good coming from him and it was just the perfect pitch not overbearing or too loud.Honestly, the food was good but I always had the impression from the name that they would beat out their fish market. I think I like the fish market better. They didn't wow me here. It was good but not worthy of five stars. I had the seared scallop entree and yes it was unique in its herbal bouquet finish and actually I thought the herbs were delicately tasteful crab cake appetizer was good and not too crispy and the corn was like a salad relish with no vinegar. The chocolate peanut butter pie was so light, and also good,,, but I wanted excellent. Now the question is would I go again; yes; but i would prefer Cameron Mitchell's chiefs at their fish market.

We went to Ocean Club for my husband's 40th birthday. The food was amazing. We had mussels, scallops, and surf and turf of filet and lobster tail along with a side of jalapeÌ±o potatoes au gratin. The service was attentive and I was offered a wine tasting to determine which wine I wanted. The only negative was the table seating which I found crowded too close together. Next  time I will request a more private table.  We went home with an incredible cheesecake for dessert. All in all a five star evening.

The food was fantastic, fresh and prepped just right, none of their meat or seafood is frozen.  Huge wine and drink list and unbeatable service. But this is all expected from top notch dining. Be ready to spend money, but it will definitely be worth it! I was there with a friend and we had the kitchen split the crab/filet/mahi entrees into two plates, this is probably the best option to go with if you want to try all 3.

I've been here quite a few times, but when we were here last week it was such a great experience that it prompted me to finally write a review! The service was excellent. Nate went above and beyond and was very accommodating with menu changes, wine recommendations, etc. We started with the shellfish tower, the shrimp cocktail and lump crab was the best I've ever had. The scallops I ordered for the main course were cooked to perfection along with the filet, cooked to a perfect medium. I recommend getting the filet oscar style, it is delicious! We also had the lobster mashed potatoes which were amazing. I've had them at M before and the lobster was tough, at the ocean club it was tender and they were so worth the $19!! Again, Nate was awesome and on point with the timing of apps, salads, entrees and wine pours. The next time we go back we would probably request him again! I only wish I had saved the pictures I shared on my snapchat. I'll take some more next time! :)

We have been going to this restaurant each of the last four years on my wife's birthday.  We are from the Cleveland area and were visiting friends.  The food is pricey, but of high quality.  The service was attentive.  Nice wine list.  Don't miss the smoking raw bar tower.  The crab legs are simply amazing.  The best seafood restaurant that I have eaten at in Ohio

Have eaten here probably 40-50 times in the last 10 years. Has become my wife's and my favorite place in Columbus.Atmosphere - great set up and decor. Somewhat typical wood tones that most "steakhouses" utilize, but it looks classy and crisp. Remodel from the original years was a welcome change. The addition of the open patio that wraps around the restaurant is awesome... great view overlooking Easton and you can enjoy the sunsets in the evening. I believe they put heaters out there in the winter and it works great. Party/meeting room in back has good privacy, and the place has a good "vibe" when it is busy, but does not become overly loud.Bar/lounge/Drinks - Occasional live music which is nice. Good bar space with tv's covering good sporting events. High tops are first come/first serve and good place to sit and grab a drink/light bite. Bar staff is excellent... very friendly, attentive and enjoyable to eat dinner with. Take out/call ahead orders are flawless with the bar. Not a cocktail guy, but have heard that have some good/interesting options available. No draft beers, only bottle. Wine list and drink list are published on iPads with a great interface that is easy to use. Their wine prices are fair (for a restaurant) and they really have a nice selection across the board. Captains list has some interesting options... very good offerings considering the crap wine lists that seem to plague almost every restaurant these days. Good stemware.Service - well trained, friendly and attentive. Have never had average or rude service here. Similar to the bar staff, wait staff is great. Management always makes an effort to swing by and say hi.Food - Excellent. Best seafood in central Ohio by far. Bread basket always fresh and hot w/ mix of pretzel bread and mix loaf. Appetizers are great size and different than the typical boring offerings of most places. I recommend the Ahi Tuna, the Surf n' Turf (scallops, short ribs and mashed potatoes) and the sweet chili calamari. Lobster bisque is hands down best bisque I have tasted... they do not overuse the cognac... flavor mix is great. A la carte fish and steaks available. Steaks are all good, but seafood here is my preference. Snapper is a good option if you want a bit of spice, seabass is always good (cooked very well, simple dish); Twin tails are nicely flavorful, and the yellowtail is a good dish. For sides, the truffle mac n' cheese seems like it was reworked recently, and the change was great... excellent dish. The jalapeno au gratin are delicious, and the new tater tots with smoked gouda were delicious. Wish they would bring back the yams. Green sides are typical, kind of boring. Dessert is average... carrot cake is probably the best.Great location at Easton, can pair up with shopping or a movie. Cameron Mitchell's best restaurant by far. Highly recommend this spot. Reservations are a good idea, but it if you hit the place around 5 seating should be easy. Was there a few days ago on a Thursday and the place was PACKED all evening long.Price can get hefty very quickly. Steaks around $40, seafood about $30-35 on average.

Mitchell's is a great place and a good reason to visit Columbus! Excellent service, fine modern decor and outstanding steaks and seafood make this the perfect place for a business power lunch. The evening ambiance makes it the right choice for that special date. Try the Crab Cake and you can't go wrong with an aged steak.

Ocean Club is not just a place for seafood. Being this is a Mitchells restaurant you can get there aged to perfection steaks. On this visit I had the Ribeye and the truffle mac and cheese. Quite frankly both were the best I have had in a long time.

Nice place. Great food, great drinks. EXPENSIVE though. Nice bar and friendly bartenders. I would recommend this place over Bar Louie or the silly place next door (which I can't remember the name of.)
Fantastic!Been here twice and have had excellent meals there.  The filet mignon was excellent and the martinis are highly recommended.Pricey, but definitely worth it for a special night out.

Mitchell's Ocean Club was teriffic.  From the French Onion Soup to the amazing ginger Salmon everything was great.  Even the bread that all the tables get was better than all the other neighboring places.

Went here last week for dinner with coworkers while in town.  What a great experience.  The only downfall I really could see was the piano player in the bar.  While I typically do like a little entertainment while dining, this guy's voice was SO overpowering.  By the end of the evening, we were all joking that he really should shut it.  But maybe that's because we'd had quite a few bottles of wine by that point.I started with the french onion soup.  Awesome.  I'm such a sucker for a good onion soup, and this didn't disappoint.  Side note...holy bread!  Smoking hot, crunchy crust, soft inside.  Yum.  For my entree, I had the scallops, which were cooked in a light sauce.  They were really good.  Not the best I'd ever had, but pretty solid.  We split a few sides as well- the mac and cheese was AWESOME, as was the jalapeno au gratin potatoes.  We also had the asparagus...but really, who raves about steamed veggies?Dessert.  For the record, I didn't want dessert, but I somehow managed to pick up my fork and take a few large bites of both the chocolate cake and carrot cake that were passed around the table.  That carrot cake.  Was.  Amazing.  I would go back there if only just for the mac and cheese and the carrot cake.  All in all, a great restaurant, and one I will definitely try again.

I had wanted to try Mitchell's Ocean Club for quite some time. I have heard rave reviews from friends and family, and I was really excited to finally get a chance to come here for a pre-Christmas Christmas dinner. Try as I might, it is difficult to find complaints about the Cameron Mitchell restaurants. I'm not a huge fan of Capp City Diner, but other than that, their food and service is always spot on.I'll start with the ambience, which is dark, romantic and classic. The bar was pretty, albeit packed. I am very happy we had reservations.I don't think I can say enough kind words about the service we had at OC. Our server was nice, attentive, interested and helpful. He was full of suggestions and insight, and really helped this become one of the best dining experiences of my life. I really have never received better service anywhere before in my life. These guys are almost too polite! Sometimes I want a server to have a little fun with the table.The food was really amazing, obviously, or this would not be a five star review. The Colossal Shrimp Cocktail was worth the hefty price tag. We took our server's suggestion of splitting a salad and had the Caesar, which was different than any other Caesar. It was somehow tarter (more tart?) without tasting like lemons. I loved it. I also love that they do a loaf of sourdough as well as pretzel bread. I read someone's complaint about these, and I couldn't disagree more. How many places offer bread anymore, let alone whole loaves of sourdough and something as interesting as pretzel bread? I also thought doing creamy, whipped butter was a nice touch. I don't usually like butter on bread, but this was really good. My boyfriend and I shared the truffle fries, which were good, but not as good as the truffle fries at Cameron's (I'm not sure how that's possible, but it's true). I had the salt and pepper tuna, which was perfectly rare and amazing. It was a large portion for the price, as well. I substituted the sauce and side for the mashed potato and truffle and champagne sauce. The sauce was amazing; as were the potatoes, but I don't think potatoes and tuna go together. This was obviously my mistake, so I would never hold that against the house. I took the liberty of tasting my brother's potatoes au gratin, which were basically one of the tastiest things I have ever tried in my life. They were out of this world. We were too full for dessert, unfortunately. I think the portions, including sides, are massive. I don't know how anyone would feel differently unless they eat huge dinners on a regular basis.What I like about OC is that it brings a few items from mad-men style steakhouses (potatoes au gratin, Baked Alaska, waiters in suits, hostesses in cocktail attire) and joins those items with updated, upscale fine dining options from the surf and turf worlds. My Only complaint is that it is very crowded. I understand maximizing tables and minimizing unused space, but it was a bit ridiculous shuffling all the way around the dining room only to be seated at the beginning of our path. This is definitely a special occasion restaurant, at least on my budget. I would be interested to sit at the bar and enjoy small plates and cocktails during their happy hour during a break from shopping, though.

5 stars (for Columbus).  From the breadbasket with a combo of fresh sourdough and seeded flatbread (aka cracker) and soft fat pretzel bread sticks, all the way through the wines and fishes and deserts, it was all mouthwatering scrumptiousness.  The price was high, especially compared to Ohio pricing, but it was worth it all the way.  I don't like that it's attached to a shopping center mall (Easton), but in Ohio, that's just where people like to be i guess, and it's where everything else popular and busy and energetic is, so i guess its suiting.LOVED my chilean sea bass.  The peanut butter chocolate mousse cake sounds kinda sloppy for desert, but it was awesome and very good and fine except that i felt very fat (and happy) after gorging on it.  Great service and nice atmosphere (inside the restaurant, i mean... although Easton is a nice indoor/outdoor shopping center/mall as far as that goes... as the saying goes, when in rome...).  The way they seated/organized reservations was a bit strange - they had a whole "8:30 pm" list and had us all (4 groups or so) waiting at the entrance together, until they slowly pushed out the other (6:30?) group, ...so the wait was rather tedious for having already made reservations.  That felt kinda cheesy and cheap.  But I did get to watch an old middle-aged, blond suburban ex-trophy wife with fake boobs drunkenly stumble to the mint dish and push my brother aside for a handful of stale mints.  That was worth seeing.So all in all, a very good restaurant.

One of the better restaurants in Columbus. I went here when it first opened years ago, but they've done some remodeling since (defintely for the better). The food this time around was even better as well as the service. Some of the tastier items on the menu were:White truffle caviar deviled eggs Goat cheese ravioliCalamariTwice baked potatoesScallopsFilet (Oscar style)Sea bass

My fiance and I went here the week after Valentine's Day, since of coarse, on Valentine's Day there were no reservations.It was worth the wait!!Our server, Scott, was AMAZING!! He made the experience so much more than the food. But, I can't forget the food..woah!! I had the Chilean Sea Bass in Champagne Truffle sauce. Then had creme brule for desert. My fiance had never tried it and love it!! If it sounds decedent it was. I don't think I have tasted such a delightful masterpiece. I am a serious seafood snob and this topped the charts! The food, the live piano playing, the service all 5 stars!!I would recommend it to anyone.. it is completely worth it!! :)

Without a doubt one of my favorite places to eat in Columbus.  Some people will knock it for its "corporate" feel, but let's be honest it's smack dab in the middle of Easton.Inside the restaurant is very easy on the eyes.  They have a great bar as well.  The good:  The food is excellent.  The tuna tartar app is one of the best in the city.  They have great shellfish and obviously the usual suspects iike beef carpaccio are delicious.The bone-in steaks are exquisite and if you're really feeling frisky the lobster is also delicious.  They serve it with these cool butter warmers.I've been here at least 25 times and have had a great meal over 95% of the time.Also I would say the service is excellent.  While I usually sit at the bar (which should always have great service) they are very attentive.  One thing I really like is if you are at the bar and then move to a table they will let you transfer your tab over (the servers don't bicker over tips).The only bad things are the slack dress code policy (seriously, it's embarrassing, but sadly that is how a lot of people dress these days).  And the guy playing the piano is WAY too loud and awful.  Forget about having any semblance of a conversation if you're within 50 feet of this clown.Overall I would recommend Ocean Club to anyone visiting Columbus, or looking for a special occasion type dinner.If you do it right, you can actually sit at the bar, order some apps and split an entree and a few glasses of wine and get out for $100.

The calamari appetizer was a surprising interplay of sweet and spicy. We had the scallops and the sea bass. The delicate sauces enhanced by the freshness of the catch was the perfect ending to a saturday night. The service was impeccable.

We came here extremely underdressed and unprepared for dinner after a viewing of the World Cup group win against Ghana. Regardless the staff was extremely friendly and served us well. Hands down delicious food. We got the calamari and shrimp appetizers that were fantastic. I got the 8 oz filet med rare oscar style that was one of the best cuts of steak I've ever had. Totally worth the $$ if you are out on the corporate dime, or out for a great dinner for a special occasion.
Nice service. Quiet atmosphere. I had the macaroni and cheese. I....went to a seafood restaurant and had the macaroni and cheese. Really nice service though.

Mitchell's will forever be in my heart.  I ate at Mitchell's constantly a few years back.  Easily one of the best seafood place's I've ever been to.  I never had a bad meal there, and the one time that my sea bass was slightly undercooked - the manager/chef immediately took care of it and I had a perfectly cooked sea bass in front of me a few minutes later.How I miss this place - very few places in MA can come close to this level of quality.
Fine dining,  some of the best seafood in Columbus.   Solid wine list and half off bottles on Sundays.

Nice location, nice staff, but I still felt like I was in one of those "seafood and steak" chains.  Not an Olive Garden kind of way, but an upscale kind of way.I had the crab cake appetizer which was quite well done.  Followed that up with the Amish chicken.  It was crispy and juicy and very well-spiced.  They have an impressive beer and wine list as well as a good overall menu.  But in all, I cannot give it 5 stars as nothing stood out as just unbelievable.Would I come back... yes.  Would I talk about this place to all my friends... not so much.

Fabulous. Excellent quality and quantity. I had the BBQ salmon with asparagus and stir fry for 21 bucks. It was s delicious piece of fish, cooked to perfection, with a great atmosphere. Service was also super. Best meal I have I had in Columbus.
Food and drinks INCREDIBLE but the service was non-existent.  I had to keep putting my hand up like a school kid to get someone to wait on me.  And I was at the BAR!  Not cool.

We had good tasting food and good service but if I drown things in butter and/or heavy cream it will taste good. Basically, there are far too many better restaurants in Columbus with better flavors. if you are stuck at Easton and like fish they can satisfy you with a decent meal. Great balcony.

It's a very nice place, BUT, way overpriced. The food is wonderful, however, a lot have places have wonderful food and it doesn't cost $200.00 for 2 people. I would prefer to have great food at a great price.

My husband took me here for our anniversary.  We were seated at the balcony outside of the restaurant.  I was anxious to try their dinner thinking with all there 4+ stars it must be amazing!  I ordered the scallops and my husband had the steak special.  I am not impress with the scallops a bit, I can make better at home.  My husband liked his steak but it's not Smith & Wollensky quality.  We arrived at 6pm, by the time we left close to 8pm, the main dinning room was packed with early 20s to early 40s group of people and was very loud.  I am glad we went early and got to sit outside.  This is a place where I would try only once and don't plan on coming back.  For the price of this dinner, it's definitely doesn't live up to all these 4 stars ratings unless I drink until my taste buds no longer able to recognize what I am eating.  I spoke to friends about this restaurant, they told us they went on their first anniversary before they had kids and never came back.  Their oldest son is now 13.  It's probably a great place to impress a date or to social drink, not so much for good seafood.

I quite like this newer incarnation more than the old Ocean Club, which gave one the feeling of being in a fishbowl when at the bar. After undergoing millions of dollars of updates (two years ago), ditching the aquatic blue detailing and adding a great wrap-around patio, the new Mitchell's Ocean Club takes on more of a loungey, prime seafood and steak house. The baby grand piano in the entrance way makes it clear there is live music - most nights of the week.  We had intentions of seeing Dave Powers play one night last summer, but he was off and the replacement was good. Not loud or intrusive, just mellow and mostly played rather than sang. back ground music can go either way. I usually find it to be a nice touch, however, we were on the far opposite side of the bar, about as far as one could be from the piano. Not to say it couldn't be loud in some areas. The menu was extensive, with entrees ranging from trout, salmon, snapper and seabass to filet, porterhouse and rack of lamb. I couldn't make up my mind, so we had a little bit of everything - and the chef made sure of it. We ended up with a most amazing sampling of nearly every appetizer: Truffle deviled eggs, calamari, goat cheese raviolis, tuna tartar and beef carpaccio... it was all divine. I'm sure I'm forgetting some.The two bartenders were super friendly and it totally tickled my fancy that one was able to reproduce my favorite martini perfectly from a simple description of the name and color (as I had no idea what exactly was in it).   I ended up splitting an entree, the seabass, with my husband and it melted on our mouths... and it should for $32.  By the end of the night, our tab was no laughing matter. A few $12 martinis, the sample platter of appetizers and an entree went into the triple digits. But we considered it worth the splurge and if I could afford to eat here once a week, I probably would, but alas, I'll settle for a few times a year for special occasions. Maybe next time we'll head for the dining room, which is a little quieter than the bar area. The Ocean Club is not at all a flashy supper club, but it definitely has that sort of undertone with dark wood, white linen tables and formal attired servers. It has a restrained elegance that appeals to my aesthetic, so I really liked the atmosphere of the whole restaurant. AND I'll leave my flip flops at home next time... I felt just fine wearing a sundress, but was a little self-conscious about the flip flop situation. No matter, we had a great meal, memorable service and a very memorable tab!

Excellent restaurant.   Service and food are spot on.  I eat here on business several times a year.   Had the surf and turf special tonight.   Thoroughly great.   It is expensive but some things are worth it.   Lobster bisque appetizer is a must.   Always a solid choice.   When a rare mistake is made the wait staff and manager work to correct it as you would expect from a top tier establishment. Mistakes are not the norm but do occasionally occur.   I always give special consideration to places that immediately work to correct the issue.   Tonight one member of our group had a gluten allergy.  The waiter worked with him through out the meal to assure that he had options.

I expected the Ocean Club to be damn nice. But damn, it was expensive.Greg and I treated his parents to a night out as a thank you for all they've done for us. I felt a little silly walking into a mall all dressed up to go to a nice dinner. But, once we were inside, it didn't feel like I was in a mall.We shared one bottle of wine and each had an entrÌ©e. No salad, no soup, no dessert - nothing else. The meal was over $200. Ugh.I had the mahi mahi. It was good, a little bland. I haven't thought about it much since I ate it. I haven't craved it in the middle of the night or anything, and I most certainly don't think it was worth the price.The wine was excellent. I can't recall quite which one we had, something white.The variety of complimentary breads was very nice and came with several butter and dipping choices.The atmosphere was sleek. It reminded me of a lounge you'd see in an international spy movie, all dark blue with deep colored woods and ambient lighting. The wine display was the focal point. It went to the ceiling and was incased in a lighted bubble case.Our server was an A+. She was polite, almost to the point of discomfort. She was so polite that I began checking myself: Am I sitting up straight?
