Are my table manners up to par?The Ocean Club made me feel like a princess while I was dining and a pauper when I left with empty pockets. It was a really nice place. I'll be back to try the scallops when I hit the lottery.

When it comes to "upscale" dining, I'm kinda hard to impress. I find many places are complacent with past achievements or just straight up pretentious (and, by definition, without any real reason to be). Not so here. Can't fault anything about this place. Informed, friendly yet professional staff, excellent food served in a timely manner. Beautiful surroundings (indoor and out). Valet parking..... And I'm a sucker for any place that has a dude crooning away to a baby grand. ....two words: Candied Yams.

Food: -Decent fish (think par with w/ other large seafood chains)-7 out of 10 for freshness, from pre-made desserts to tasteless corn to nothing-to-speak-of sauces-3 bad oysters out of 12, and a 4th bad one from one of the replacement oysters they gave me...try, try, try, but the cardinal rule should be: don't eat oysters in Ohio! Service:-Par. Nothing bad, nothing great. GREAT: ambiance. This is a great business dinner place or a place to go with friends. Just drink a lot to numb the food.

Great Atmosphere, very classy decorations with dim lighting and very romantic.  Good for a business meeting or a romantic dinner.  Pricey, but well worth it.  My group orded the raw bar appetizer which included crab legs, jumbo shrimp, and crab meat.  The presentation was outstanding with "dry ice" creating a fog effect.  The passion martini also has dy ice to create the same effect.  The chilean sea bass was amazing and was perfectly proportioned.  Very large selection of wine and also a number of "reseve" wines as well.  For dessert, I had The Baked Alaska which was just incredible.  I will come here atleast once or twice a year for special occasions.

Average presentations of average quality seafood with average quality service......in a Mall.  Yes, it is better than the greasy oversized portions at Fado, Cheesecake Factory, and other Easton options, ut the seafood is fresher at McCormicks and the presentations more varied and unique.  The seafood at Hama is fresher, as well.I realize it is almost sacreligious to speak out against a Mitchell restaurant in Columbus, but the prices here are no cheaper than M at Miranova yet the service, quality, and presentation is far inferior.Do yourself a favor; if you want to experience Mitchell at his best, head to M.  If you want amazing seafood at Easton, head to McCormick's.Cheers to the Baked Alaska however......delicious, and not very common in the Columbus menu scene.  Additional cheers to the variety in the bread basket.

The ten-layer carrot cake was great and so was the lobster bisque. Those two are a meal by themselves so you should not order a main course. The grilled red snapper was a big disappointment anyway. Tasteless piece of fish the way it was cooked. Good place to take someone you want to impress except when they order the over-rated fish.
Delicious! Even better, our server was great fun: cheers to John Beeker, who made our meal even better.

We always have wonderful food and outstanding service (ask for Peggy!) We shared the ahi tuna appetizer, the ocean club salad, the sea bass, and the asparagus.  Everthing was perfect, more than enough for two; and no room for desert!  We often wear jeans so I was puzzled by that review's remark.  I feel like you can dress up or down at this restaurant.  Good food is half of the equation, but good service is the other half.  Ocean club delivers on both.

I love this place! I live in California and every time I fly into Columbus I have to hit it up. It is funny reading the negative reviews, it seems that the most negative are due to either portions or noise. I my self love the ambience the portions could be bigger but I am not going to McDonald's or burgerking.  I wanted to give this place a great review because I fly 3000 miles and eat here every time.

Located at Easton, this is definitely one step above The Fish Market.  Great service in a wonderful atmosphere.  Reservations are highly recommended but you can walk in depending on the time of the day.  Always busy for dinner, especially on the weekend.  Doesn't feature the largest wine menu but you can find something to pair with you meal.  The seafood here is always fresh.  The desserts are respectable.  The bar is definitely a reason to go back. Great ambience with wonderful staff.  Their lemon vodka is very good.  Worth a visit. Makes for a good date night if you're going to be over by Easton or after picking someone up from the airport.

Best restaurant in Columbus! It's a little pricey but worth every penny. I highly recommend the Blackened Snapper with a side of the Lobster mashed potatoes. The crab cakes and the tuna tartar are both amazing appetizers. The Martinis are absolutely amazing and the wine list has something for everyone. On top of all this the service is second to none. I have been to all of Cameron Mitchell's restaurants in Columbus and this is my favorite. This place is also very gluten free friendly, since my GF is a celiac this is very important to me.

There doesn't seem to be many good seafood restaurants here in Columbus but the Ocean Club is definitely the cream of the crop. My wife and I went here for dinner after catching a movie one week night and the food was fantastic. She got the scallops and they were big and perfectly done. I got the fresh salmon which was also perfect. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes top notch seafood.

The best service in columbus! its in the Easton towne center upstairs. the ambiance is nice.I ordered the filet mignon and it was awesome! very tender and a very good portion. also the amish chicken was pretty good. Im not a fan of the crab cakes they had too much breading.order your entree but share the sides. the sides cost about 9 dollars each but theres enough for 2.if you are looking for a good drink get the pinapple martini.

Mitchell's Ocean Club is great. I've been here a couple times and it never disappoints. While the price is definitely not cheap you get excellent food and wonderful service. The wait staff is very friendly and knowledgable and will make sure you have a great dining experience. The food of course is the main attraction here and whether you are seeking seafood or steak you are guaranteed to find something delightful. Each time I have been here we have ordered the raw oysters and they are so fresh and delicious each time. Presentation is a big deal at the Ocean Club as our oysters were brought out on an ice tray with the house made cocktail sauce in a "smoking" dish effect from dry ice in the center. Definitely makes is much more of an experience. I forgot to mention the drinks! The Ocean Club has some neat signature cocktails such as the Black Orchid and Elderflower la poire (it was called something like that). I won't spoil the excitement but if you want a delicious and memorable cocktail order one of those. As far as the rest of the meal goes my favorites include the ravioli appetizer which was also very tasty, the lobster bisque, and for the entree I thoroughly enjoyed the filet ala Oscar one time and the sea scallops another. The sides are served family style and my absolute favorite is the Black Truffle Mac & Cheese. It is to die for. The desserts are tasty as well and the coffee is served in a French press which adds a nice touch. Overall if you are looking for an upscale place with options for all don't miss out on Mitchell's Ocean Club.

We went here on a saturday night without a reservation so we knew it may not happen.  No problem, though.  We had a drink from the bar and shortly two seats opened up at the bar which has full service for dinner.  I was aware this place was a bit expensive, so the prices didn't come as a shock, and my husband and I had a really nice time.  We ordered the chilled crab meat cocktail for an app, and it came out with a smoking dry ice presentation, which was kinda neat.  It tasted very good.My husband got the steak and they cooked it correctly.  It didn't come with any sides, which I thought was weird because it was pretty pricey.  My husband paid extra for a baked potato.  Really?The steak was good.I ordered the scallops and risotto.  The dish was good, not great or memorable.  A shame, because I really wanted a great dinner.   It was cooked fine, just...not..., anything special.Service was fine.3 stars for the everything.  Yes the food was good, but for the prices it should have been great.  And no side with the steak sucked.  Like I said my husband and I had a nice time, mostly because of each others company.  I might come here again to try something else on a special occasion maybe with a giftcard.

Good drinks and wine selection. Seafood was good although my salad dressing was a little off-putting. Too tangy and overpowering for my shellfish Cobb salad. Others enjoyed their plates and we enjoyed the live piano and atmosphere.

I was going to give Mitchell's Ocean Club a glowing review based on my first meal there.  The food was phenomenal, the experience would be have been great too if it weren't for the slightly too loud piano man.  Last night, however, the piano man achieved new heights in the world of obnoxious, loud background restaurant music.  One song after the next, no breaks, no key change, no tempo change, every song just barely out of his range and louder than a dance club.  There was a collective sigh of relief when he finally played a cadence.

We ate at the Ocean Club one evening in June.  I love a good crab cake and these were scrumptious!!!  Everytime I think about them I want to get in the car and take the 2 hour round trip just to get an order.  I have forgotten what my hubby had to eat that night but he also enjoyed his meal.  We also split an appetizer that was yummy.  We will definitely return!

Simply a great all around experience.   Top notch professional service - food is extremely tasty and superb atmosphere.  Great place to take your date ... great place to take that important business client!

YUMMY! By far the Ocean Club served the best meal I have had in Columbus. When I travel, I always have one "special" meal (typically=expensive). I have had amazing meals in Las Vegas, San Francisco, LA, Key West, and NYC.  The meal at the Ocean Club was definitely on the list. Everything is served ala carte. My girlfriend ordered the tuna with a Maytag blue cheese crust  - absolutely delicious! I ordered a lobster tail, and while it is rather difficult to  screw that up, it was yummy. We got a side of sauteed forest mushrooms and I think we could have eaten a meal consisting of those and the warm sourdough, flatbread, and soft pretzel sticks. The mushrooms were meaty, deep flavored and not at all oily or greasy. We also got mashed potatoes which were good, but focused our efforts on the mushrooms. The waiter was polite, knowledgeable and friendly. We ordered a bottle of champagne (the cheapest :) and our glasses were never even half full because of his attentiveness. The decor is very nice and feels like an updated throw back to the Rat Pack era.My only complaint - and it's not really so much a complaint as an observation - is that its location at Easton means that there are people who look as if they spent the entire day shopping and happened upon the resturaunt. There were groups in jeans and t-shirts and flip-flops and one family with about 4 children under the age of 11 who broke at least 2 glasses. I felt the atmosphere required a bit more formaility. The waitstaff certainly projected a more formal feel. Overall, if you are looking to splurge, go here. You can't miss.

I can't review much regarding food. We sat at the bar to have a cocktail and appetizer to break from shopping. Service was great. I like whatever house moscato they have. My friends got the crab Rangoon's. They were just ok to me. I do want to go back and eat there sometime, though!

Had lunch here while Black Friday shopping at the Polaris Mall with my family.Yes, it is a bit on the pricier side, for Asian cuisine, and like some others have said, it reminded me a bit of PF Changs (I even actually said that while we were there). But still very good...lots of options on their menu and good quality food that tasted fresh.Our server was excellent. I can't remember his name, but on my receipt it says Aren. He was awesome, and so friendly.I had the Hunan Chicken, which is stir-fried chicken, broccoli and mushrooms in a fiery brown sauce. However, I don't like mushrooms, so Aren gladly let me swap mushrooms for carrots. My mother had an order of Crab Rangoon and a California Roll. My SIL had the Thai Basil Scallops. I tried the crab rangoon and scallops and both were delicious. Best Crab Rangoon I've had, anywhere.My dish was perfect. The sauce had a nice little kick to it, and there was loads of chicken in my bowl. The portion was large so I had leftovers to take home for a second meal.Again, a little pricey ($32 for the Hunan Chicken, Rangoon and CA Roll), but the quality was better than other Asian restaurants I've been to, so it was worth it to me. Would go back if I were in the area again visiting.

Molly Woo's is fine. But it's a little too expensive to be just fine.We made reservations for our anniversary. We were excited that it had a gluten-free menu and I made note of my wife's allergies when I made the reservation. When they seated us, no gluten-free menu was provided and by the time we realized it was a separate menu, the waitress was gone and we waited more than five minutes for her to come back. Not terrible service, but for the price, I would hope that somebody actually looks at my reservation ahead of time.Then, when our food was served, we were not given gluten-free soy sauce. By now, the server knew about the issue, but again disappeared for seven minutes. Other than these two incidents, the service was unmemorable.The food is just not great. I had the mango chicken and my wife had the firecracker chicken. Both dishes had that commercial Chinese food taste of being overly sweet without much other taste. I didn't taste mango, I tasted sugar. I don't know why Chinese food is moving in that direction. We also ordered sushi and the sushi was not particularly fresh or clean tasting. The fish was a little soggy. It was definitely better than supermarket sushi, but not as good as most average sushi places.The decor is nice, though the room feels a little like a warehouse. Some people have said the lanterns are overdone, but I think it's kind of the point.After tax and tip, the meal cost $68 for the two of us, including the sushi appetizer, a Coke, and a beer. For that cost, I'd like the meal to feel a little special. It did not. Service was average to meh. Food was meh. I would rate this place 3 stars if my meal was closer to $50, but given my experience, I cannot recommend this place.

I love Molly Woo's. Has slightly more/better flavors than PF Changs. We always sit at the bar and the three ladies that work there are wonderful. Their happy hour is great: $5 cocktails and apps. The honey chicken is always amazing. As are the crab ragoons and potstickers. Their ragoons are a bit creamier than most but still nice. Overall, a great place to eat

We come for happy hour all the time. Yummy food and drinks! We love the king pao calamari, egg rolls, and crab Rangoon. We often get the lettuce wraps, but they aren't the best I've had (for the best lettuce wraps, try Hunan House!)My favorite cocktail is the blackberry bourbon. For dinner we love the coconut curry shrimp, garlic chicken and their wonton soup. They also have an awesome coconut cream pie. I'm not vegetarian, but I really do love their crispy tofu. Hit or miss:Dan Dan noodles (they use the same chicken for this as for their lettuce wraps - sometimes it's a bit to gristly) Firecracker chicken - I think it depends on who makes it. Sometimes the veggies are different and cut differently. I don't think this is the best Asian in Columbus. It's comparable to PF Changs, but I think Changs is slightly better. You do get amazing service and it's nicer ambiance than most of the Asian places around.

The food here is comparable to P.F. Chang's but what really sets Molly Woo's apart is their service and beverages. I had a blackberry bourbon, which was one of the most unique alcoholic beverages I've ever had. Visually it was unlike anything I'd ever seen with it's deep red color and flavor-wise it was fantastic! Hubby opted for the homemade ginger ale, which totally challenged both of our perceptions of what ginger ale should be. Our server Andrew was knowledgable and patient and made excellent suggestions, including both of the aforementioned drinks.

Man oh man, did Cameron Mitchell open his wallet wide for this Asian restaurant of his.  It's fancy and it's classy without a doubt and it has enough eye appeal to make this the perfect place for a dinner to impress.  The multitude of red Chinese lanterns are a nice touch too.The food, on the other hand, could have been better... Now, I love a good Mai Tai ($9.75) and theirs certainly looks cool in their tiki glasses with the little paper umbrella but they have all the all the oomph of a glass of fruit punch.  I passed on their rather pricey Hot and Sour Soup ($5.95) as I wasn't up for spending $30+ for lunch that day.  The lunch sized Hunan Chicken ($10.69) was a decent sized portion and it did come out with a considerable amount of chicken but the meat vis-a-vis the vegetable balance was way off.  All in all, this dish reminded me of a zestier but soupier version of a Chinese buffet Chicken and Mushrooms with a little added broccoli.  3 stars for more flash than substance.

I had never heard of Molly Woo's Asian Bistro until my mom and I came to Polaris shopping center on a Sunday afternoon. We were hungry and didn't realize most of the shops at Polaris didn't open until noon. Luckily, Molly Woo's opened at 11:30, so we stopped in for a quick bite to eat. Our server was very friendly and attentive. The food, similar to PF Chang's, came out fast. If you're looking for authentic Asian food, this isn't the spot for you. But if you're looking for PF Chang's-type Americanized Asian, Molly Woo's hits the spot. We decided to just ordered a bunch of appetizers and split them as our meal. I got a bowl of hot and sour soup, my mom got egg drop soup. Both soups were delicious and piping hot. We split an order of chicken lettuce cups - again, tasty and hit the spot. We also shared an order of potstickers and one Caterpillar sushi roll. The potstickers were good - hard to mess those up. And the Caterpillar sushi roll was ok. The spicy tuna tasted a little off but all in all, a decent sushi roll. So if you find yourself at Polaris and craving decent Asian American food, Molly Woo's delivers.
Molly Woo's offers so many delicious "gluten sensitive" options! I really appreciate the effort they have made to cater to this dietary restriction.
Sushi there are a little bit small, but really fresh and awesome! Great service. I recommend this place.
This is strictly on the bar. We were seated at the bar. Was pretty busy. The staff was very nice. Had some appetizers and everything was great as well.

Omg omg omg. DELICIOUS food! This is my second time at Molly's Woos and I don't understand why I don't come here more often! We ordered the crab Rangoon as an appetizer and it's probably the best Rangoon I've ever had. I ordered the Mango Chicken with fried rice which was absolutely amazing. My FiancÌ©e ordered the Lo Mein with chicken and shrimp which was equally as amazing. The food, the service, the atmosphere this place deserves more than 5 stars. I used to pass this place all of the time because I assumed it was too expensive but it's not! We spent just over $40 on 1 app, 2 entrees and 1 non alcoholic cocktail! Give this place a try if you've never had it, but only if you're ready to have your taste buds explode.

Molly Woo's was overall an okay experience. I really loved our waiter, he was funny and attentive. The food was alright. Perhaps I've been spoiled with homemade Asian food growing up, I felt that the food was good but not spectacular, especially compared to the fantastic experiences I've had at other Cameron Mitchell locations. We ordered Pad Thai and Dan Dan Noodles, I liked the Pad Thai better. The Dan Dan noodles were good but too salty in my opinion, but I do recognize that westernized Chinese food is typically saltier than traditional Chinese food. I went during lunch and one thing that I did not enjoy as much was the dark and red lighting. I understand they are going for a specific feel/atmosphere, but it was almost too dark to see and lighting was too red, especially at lunch time. I wished it was a little brighter.

Arrived last Sunday about 11:30 and were seated immediately in a near empty restaurant.  My wife and were impressed by the decor and our waiter, Gary, made us feel welcome right away.  I order the honey chicken and my wife tries the hunan chicken.  We had never been to a Chinese restaurant like this as we have only been to our local MSG-heavy establishments that normally leave us feeling ill.   Our food arrives at the 15 minute mark and both of our dishes are near perfect - can't think of a thing I would change.  I somehow managed to eat my entire dish and did not hear as much as a gurgle from my stomach; normally I would feel like I needed to be carried out via stretcher.  Ingredients must be higher grade and flavor enhancers must not be used at Molly Woo's.I believe our total lunch bill, without tip, was around $30 and was worth every dime.  Great food, great atmosphere, great service.

We have eaten here many times and always left happy until today. The food was very bland and the waiter was uninterested. We can at 2:00 pm so clearly we missed the lunch rush. I doubt that I'll come again. I gave it one star simply because my husband's dish was good.

I don't understand all of the amazing reviews for this place. The food was not good at all. Everything lacked flavor and the noodles were overcooked mush. Save your money and go literally anywhere else.

So happy to eat here again after we moved away. The food was excellent. The Kung Pao calamari was fresh and tender with a light breading. AND it's gluten free - you'd never know. They had favored martinis which I like, and the service was outstanding.

Listen... We all know that this is American- Chinese food. Lol, everyone needs to simmer down. That being said, this is the goddamn best American Chinese food I have ever had. I drive TWO hours just to come to this place... Cuyahoga Falls just doesn't have good food. I've Tangoed with just about everything on the menu, but the Hunan Chicken is my favorite. The sauce has so many different flavor elements to it: a little spicy, nutty, garlicky, etc. Tender pieces of white meat mixed with tender broccoli, mushrooms and chili peppers. You can choose white or brown (/gag) rice to accompany your dish. It's seriously so good, and you get a lot, but I always finish my plate because MAMA DIDN'T RAISE NO QUITTER. The sushi is pretty good, too. Always fresh and flavorful. You also NEED to try their hot tea!! It's a must!

Gluten Free: YesCasein Free: Yes- but verifyMolly Woo's can best be described as a cross between a PF Chang's and the Cheese Cake Factory.Why you might ask? For the reasons listed below:~Located in an upscale mall~ ridiculous portion sizes. Yeah leftovers~ large restaurant with multiple room sectioning~ Loud environment~ Relatively low price What Molly's has going for it:+ Separate gluten "friendly" menu. They have a ton of offerings+ Cross Contamination - They did a good job in handling this. Food was marked, with what appeared to be a large stick/toothpick looking thing, to signify it was GF. +Free Wifi- decent signal + Reservations- This place can get packed. They used OpenTable to handle their reservation management.+Food- huge portions and decent taste. Don't go in expecting traditional Chinese food, as this is not the place for it. The food is extremely Americanized

At Polaris and decided lunch at Molly Woo's....not disappointed....Started off with lettuce wraps, very tasty, light, a great starter to share with friends or that special person....I ordered an orange beef and girlfriend ordered orange chicken, I tried both, I think the orange chicken was a little better, both were delicious, the orange chicken was a bed or piping hot fried chicken in a tasty orange glaze...sometimes orange chicken has too much sauce which makes it soggy and takes away from the chicken, not the case here....entrees came with steamed white or brown rice, also I would recommend ordering the ginger ale, chunks of real ginger make the soft drink over the top and a must have if you like ginger..Service was excellent, in and out for lunch within an hour....Thanks MW for an enjoyable afternoon : ))

My fiancee and I met up at Molly Woo's with two of our work buddies!  My fiancee and I started out with the calamari witch was delicious (I prefer the ponzu sauce to the srirachi mayo but that's just me!)Our pals ordered the crab rangoon and the dumplings; both said they were great.For entrees, I tried the honey chicken (with brown rice) while my wife to be had the Pad Thai.  Our friends ordered the Pad Thai and Sesame Beef, respectively.  Those two loved their dishes.My honey chicken was tasty!  Sweet but with a little bit of spice to it.  I'm looking forward to trying the teriyaki shrimp next time.Now, dessert.  My fiancee and I were looking forward to splitting the banana spring roll; when we ordered it we were told that we would receive half of the order because of an error in the kitchen.  A few minutes later, we were told that the banana spring rolls were all gone, but that we would receive the donut dessert on the house.  Awesome!Donuts were great.  Our friends both ordered the creme brulee; one had never tried creme brulee before and ended up sending it back (no fault of the kitchen, she just didn't like it).  Other friend loved it!This is where my 4 instead of 5 star comes out.  We waited over ten minutes to get our check after it was beyond clear that our dessert was finished.  Overall, great meal, but the service at the end soured us a little bit.Still, I would recommend this place in heartbeat!  Can't wait to try it again!

Wanting something quick and smile around 5:30pm we stop in here.  It always make one feel good to be acknowledge when you seat yourself at the bar.  Being in a deaf relationship it was also very nice to see that the staff is willing to try ASL and help.  The service was friendly and shift.. thanks for a god experience.  Oh ya the pepper Beef, ask for noodles on the side and chicken pad thai were enjoyed by both of us!

My friend and I stopped in at Molly Woo's as we were about to exit Polaris Fashion Place. We were hungry and contemplating fast food on the way back to our hotel when the impressive facade and even more impressive smell brought us into Molly Woo's. The host was a man with a very splendid Rollie Fingers style mustache and even better attitude and approach to customer service and hospitality. He was very accommodating to us and my friends little girl, a baby who was with us. (I'm so used to restaurant personnel giving a knowing, exhausted glance at babies- I get that babies can be loud and unpredictable, but give us a chance!)I can't remember our waiter's name, but he was very accommodating and polite throughout our dinner. He brought the drinks very quickly and the food as well. I had the Firecracker Shrimp and fried brown rice, which was not too spicy and pretty delicious. My friend had the fried rice bowl and loved it. The decor and atmosphere is very beautiful. I loved the plethora of red lanterns hanging from the ceiling and believe it or not the baby with us did too. She was so mesmerized by them that she barely made a peep the whole time.The beer selection isn't bad, but it's not great. That's about the only thing I think needs any improving. I'd definitely recommend stopping here for a bite to eat.

In my opinion, Molly Woo's isn't doing anything new or creative but the food is definitely better than any Chinese buffet you'll find and it's even a slight notch above P.F. Chang's. We went on a Sunday a little before 1:00pm, and though they were pretty busy we were very quickly seated at a table in the center of the open-room restaurant. All of the waiters we dealt with were friendly and professional and the food was served quickly. My husband ordered 2 appetizers for his meal: fried pot stickers and lettuce cups. Both were presented beautifully and tasted delicious. The lettuce cups were super similar to PF Chang's except the chicken was larger and chunkier and soaked up a lot of the juices which I prefer over traditional wet lettuce wraps. I had the garlic chicken (with no scallions). The chicken was juicy and lightly battered and fried. Tasted great, but I will say that it was not spicy at all even though the menu says it is. I also had the fried rice which was very good, and a side of the rainbow vegetables since I love baby corn and broccoli in that brown sauce. Prices were comparable to any chain restaurant so no surprises there. Overall, Molly Woo's is nothing mind blowing but if you're craving really good Americanized Chinese food in a gorgeous restaurant environment I would definitely recommend this place. Plus it's conveniently attached to one of the greatest malls in Ohio so you can fill your belly up and then go walk it off while you're shopping.
The ambiance, food, service, is phenomenal. This is a great place to be during after noon mid evening time frame.  I had a great time here, time to go again.
Very delicious! Crispy fried tofu was my favorite! Great cozy ambience. Courteous and fast service from our waiter Sarah. No wait time for dinner. Would come back for more!

The bartender, I think her name was jewel, was incredibly rude when I was there. She was on her phone the entire time! Almost impossible to order a drink. I was going to order food, but since she wouldn't give me the time of day I decided not to spend my money at a place where the customer wasn't a priority

My goodness. My boyf and I go out to eat a lot and decided to try somewhere new where we both had never been. Ended up at Molly Woo's and we will keep coming back! Wonderful atmosphere, perfect lighting. The drinks were AMAZING and I wish I was rich enough to try every single one. Our sever Jess was fantastic. Super knowledgeable, kind, and helpful. Furthermore, the prices here are not unreasonable at all for a CM restaurant. We will certainly be back !

We called in an order and it wasn't ready when we got there, but once we got the food and got home it was excellent everybody enjoyed their entrÌ©es the appetizers were good. Would recommend this restaurant to anybody who really likes good Chinese food. Parking is a little bit of a houseful though but the food is worth it.

I would say that this place is comparable (maybe slightly better) than PF Chang. I've been here a few times. The service is always excellent. The hostess and servers are both polite and helpful. The problem is the food. It tends to be on the greasy side and not particularly flavorful. We've had a number of different dishes here from time to time. The lettuce cups are probably the one menu item I like the most here. With the accompanying sauces, the chicken and the salad cups go well together. The sushi rolls are sort of below average for a sushi place, but edible. Their pad thai is not bad and their firecracker chicken is pretty good. This is a place that has a fun ambience, friendly service, and okay food all at a reasonable cost.

Having never eaten at Molly Woos we were quite impressed. From the time we walked in the door, to the time we left, the staff were incredibly nice. We met up with friends who made the dinner reservation. After arriving we didn't have to wait but maybe 20 minutes to get our table. We arrived early so it didn't matter to us. So many items on the menu to choose from. After reading some reviews on yelp and otherwise we decided to get four different dishes and share! So glad we did! I ordered the pineapple chicken and instead of bellpepper I had them add cashews. Sadly, it was the only dish we did not care for. The sauce was really sour which was surprising because of the pineapple. However, our waiter was so great he traded my dish for the honey chicken ~ which was amazing! We had bottomless steamed rice so also ordered the fried rice. It wasn't bad! The other dishes we ordered were the tempura chicken, the honey chicken (yes, we had two!), crispy tofu and lo mein. The hubster did not care for the temperature chicken, but  the other dishes were pretty good. Again the favorite was the honey chicken!The dessert menu was anything but Chinese so we had no problem ordering :) CrÌ¬me brÌÈlÌ©e, chocolate cake, and toasted coconut cream pie. Delicious!

I am a big Molly Woo's fan, but my meal tonight was disappointing.   I had the Shrimp Phad Tai and the taste was very good!  What was not so good was that the noodles were not done.  The noodles shown on this sites Phad Tai were spaghetti noodles.  Mine were the traditional wide rice noodles.  They were not done, so they were chewy.  I will not give up on Molly's Phad.  Try it again next.  The taste was really good!

I did not like the food at all. We were planning to go to Molly woo for long time, but was disappointed with everything.First I ordered my dish with no beef & then I get one with it. The waiter changed it but now this dish was made in such a hurry that it didn't taste that good. Noodles were chewy &sauce was too tangy.My husband said PFchang is better than this!!

My husband and I stopped for a late lunch on our way back to Cleveland. This was my second visit. Both times we had friendly, helpful servers. Love the ginger peach tea which we order with a glass of ice to pour over for iced tea. I think the food is consistently good. Is it the best Asian food I've had?  No, but restaurant is clean and nice ambience with friendly staff. And there is something to be said about convenience and consistency.

I just wanted to say thank you to Molly Woo's and Bill (our bartender/server) from last week. It was 2 days before Christmas. The mall is packed. We have our 18 month in tow and sit in a booth in the bar. Bill welcomed us with a wonderful smile and was so kind. As an ex-server I know kids can be annoying but he was more than cordial. Our daughter has a severe egg allergy and when we asked about the prep of the food he very knowledgeably expressed that all the meats were marinated with egg. He immediately offered to check with the chef to see if anything was prepped and not marinated. I told him that was unnecessary and he insisted. He came back letting us know that all options we available. We ordered her beef and broccoli and she loved it. Our meals were outstanding. He was very (very) concerned about us letting her get a hold of our potstickers since they do have egg. That was very sweet. Bottom line, we had a great experience as always. Just that little extra effort on Bill's part made all the difference and was immensely appreciated. Keep up the amazing work. We'll be back soon.

Molly woos has been at Polaris for years and this was my first experience. Overall the food was fine- started with apps- lettuce wraps, pot stickers and egg rolls. For the main dish variety of basic Chinese food to share. All fine but not for the price. Now onto the bad parts. Sat down at 545 and did not leave until 745. It took forever and terrible service! No manager walking around. Our waiter got the meals wrong, drinks wrong etc.  they did remove them from the bill but I would rather pay for what I ordered. With so many choices around Polaris I don't know why anyone would choose Molly Woo!!!

Very good. Had great service and good food. So many great options on the menu but the rolls are excellent.  Definitely try the Crab Rangoon appetizer. .perfect for two people to share. I'm looking forward to my next visit!
Lettuce wraps here are my favorite. Good place to go to for an event or just dinner for two. Love the way it looks inside too!
This place is an insult to Asian culture, seriously. Beyond that, a crappier P.F. Chang knockoff. Scallops - awful.Fresca cucumber berry drink - awful.

You would never know this is a Cameron Mitchell restaurant unless you looked it up. The quality of this place isn't anywhere near his other restaurants. Go here if you want to eat overpriced, mediocre Asian food. There's a pretty decent happy hour: $5 cocktails & spirits, $5 select starters and sushi rolls, and $3 draft beer. The only beers they had on draft though was mainly only Sapporo. For starters we got Crab Rangoons. They came with some sort of dipping sauce. We're pretty particular about how we like our rangoons, and these came out harder/crispier than we like.I tried the California and Spicy Salmon roll. These were actually pretty good. You can tell this was better than grocery store or cheap chinese, since the chucks of salmon and crab were big! However, I didn't taste any spiciness in my spicy salmon roll.My fiance got the Firecracker Chicken and thought it was good. But it's $14.50.. I could get something comparable for about $10 at another Chinese restaurant =/ The point of going to a Cameron Mitchell restaurant is for the quality and atmosphere, both of which this place was lacking.And on to the atmosphere: there was only the quietest music playing and it was fairly empty inside. We were sitting in pretty awkward silence whenever we weren't talking.I'd go back since it's a pretty nice sit down restaurant, and maybe it's better for lunch or during peak dinner time (not happy hour). But I wouldn't recommend this place to a friend.

Crab rangoons to start...AMazzzzing!! There are about 6 or 8 with each order. They're perfectly crispy and the red dipping sauce is on point with some scallion flavors.I ordered the ginger crusted salmon and was thoroughly pleased!! The crust on the salmon was delicious and the sauce around the dish is TO DIE FOR!Service was great! I am never disappointed in this area at any Cameron Mitchell restaurant!

This place has about the most wonderful dish I have had anywhere. Molly's Feast is colorful, cooked perfectly, and so delicious! Yum! I would come here every week if I could, just to get Molly's Feast!

I loved the decor, and our waiter was friendly, charming and professional.  The food was such a disappointment.  The food is dead mediocre, and no one in our party of 10 was impressed with their order.  It was edible, but often oily.  The fried rice was oily, the Hot and Sour soup was canned tasting and my Thai Seafood Medley was oily and bland despite asking for it to be extra spicy. Oily is not a flavor! I really wanted the food to be worth coming back for, but it is not. The decor deserves better than food being less interesting than a strip mall $5 all you can eat China Buffet.

The decor and ambiance is beautiful,don't quite get the almost pitch black bathrooms, how is a lady to freshen up?Especially since the rest of the place isn't dimly lit, this was just strange...We sat in the bar area, thankfully they have a few booths, which we were lucky enough to nab.Happy hour has $5 apps, and all kinds of drinks so I took full advantage of that and got the potstickers, spring rolls, lettuce wraps and tempura fried veggies.I think even for $5 each it was pretty steep, 2 super greasy eggrolls, one bite and i sent them back.The potstickers were great just nothing unexpected.The fried veggies yummy, but also super greasy.My favorite was the lettuce wraps, in my opinion where you get the most for you money, it was half a iceberg (made me think I'v paid way more for a fourth a wedge at other places like Eddie Merlots last week) with chicken, noodles and water chestnuts.The man had the honey chicken with fried rice which he enjoyed.In all I was expecting more from a Cameron Mitchell restaurant, it was not bad, just nothing I haven't had a thousend times before and $35 including tax and tip is steep for the fact that these were happy hour prices and we only got one entree, 3 apps and no drinks, sat in the bar not getting to fully enjoy the inside of the restaurant which I'm sure would have been a much nicer meal with a view better than the insdie of the mall.

Molly Woo's is a place that I frequent about once a year.  The decor is very nice and the restaurant has a very attractive interior ambiance.  On our most recent visit, the service and the food were both very good.   I was, however, disappointed with the Wonton soup which I remembered enjoying on previous visits.  It seems that the sodium content of the Wonton soup has increased dramatically during my last couple of visits.  In fact, it's gotten so salty that I won't be ordering it during any future visits.  On this visit, I had their Dan Dan Noodles - one of their "rice and noodle dishes" and it was exceptionally good (chicken, onions, carrot, sprouts and cucumbers in a spicy garlic sauce).  My wife had the Lo Mein Combo (chicken and pork) with assorted vegetables which was also very good.Overall - I think the food is reasonably priced although it's a bit pricier than your "run of the mill" Chinese restaurant.  On the flip side - I think the drink menu is a bit over-priced and we were satisfied with iced tea.  Another plus - unlike many restaurants that serve watered-down iced tea, the tea was served cold but not with a lot of ice - the waitress then offered to bring an extra glass of ice that we could add at our own convenience - NICE TOUCH.I'd recommend this as more of a "special occasion" restaurant than a place you'd go to on a regular basis looking for Chinese food.  It's a lot more upscale than your typical neighborhood Chinese restaurant.

Great name for a restaurant, that's about it. The sushi roll ingredients (other than the tuna) were practically unrecognizable to me, they had very little flavor other than the soy sauce. Disappointing no matter who's concept it is.
Cameron Mitchells attempt at Asian Fusion. Credit for the try but the one time I ate here I was in bed for 3 days with food poisioning from bad sushi....another try? me thinks not!

Large, beautifully-decorated restaurant located in Polaris Fashion Place Mall.  We were there on a quiet Thursday night and were seated right away.  The waiter was very attentive and gave us some good suggestions.  We started with the California roll appetizer.  It was a great way to start off the meal.  My friend had chicken lo mien and I had the honey chicken and fried rice.  We both loved our meals and there was plenty of food left over to take home.  Certainly will be back the next time we're in Columbus!

It's like Grand Chinese restaurant.The food is good, not outstanding, as you would expect from Cameron Mitchell Restaurant. Service is good as expected.Although it's Cameron Mitchell Restaurant, the prices are very resonable.

This is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in the central Ohio region. I also like that you can actually watch the kitchen prepare your food. The staff is always friendly and the wait on food is always timely. It's dark in the restaurant if you can get a window seat. One funny mention; the music that was playing was R & B. We were wondering why not Chinese. It doesn't really matter

Me and my sisters took our mother here for Mother's Day. Stupid me, I booked for Saturday instead of Sunday, but the extremely helpful and considerate wait staff got us in right away with no prompting or asking on our part.I had the Philly Roll appetizer, with Mandarin Orange Beef for main course and cold green tea to drink. Everything was delicious, not too heavily sauced, and was the appropriate levels of hot and cold.Our waiter was polite and knowledgeable. None of us had eaten there before, and he took the time to go over the menu and talk about some of their specialties. I left satisfied and pleased, and I can't wait to eat there again.

The Woo's Spare Ribs appetizer is enough of a reason to try this place. During happy hour, these appetizers are half price! Think crisp, juicy, sweet and slightly hot, meat candy. Pair this with a pot of Crimson Berry Fruit Tisane and you have a perfect snack or small meal. The acidity of the tea cuts the fatty taste of the ribs, and clears the pallet for the next bite. I've noticed some variation in flavor over the years. It's always good, but sometimes, it's blow-your-mind, wet-your-pants good. I salivate every time I think about them. I was told they boil the ribs to cook and tenderize them, then they sear them for crispness. The sauce is what really makes this dish. Get an order to go, because you'll want more by the time you get home.Their desserts are insane too. The Banana Spring rolls are my favorite. I don't even really care for bananas, but warm bananas wrapped in spring roll wraps drizzled with chocolate sauce, topped with crushed peanuts, and complemented with cold, high-quality, creamy, vanilla ice cream is a winner. Their seasonal Pumpkin Won-tons dessert is a serious contender.I've had many of their other dished and I've never been disappointing with the food. Servers are usually good. The hostesses usually need a lesson in customer service. They seem to think they actually have power, not just restaurant power. The definition of hospitality is: "the friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers". This is a job ripe for automation in our economy. Most hostesses just suck. Save yourself the aggravation and eat in the bar area. Service is always great there.

High class Chinese cuisine in the heart of Polaris fashion place. Great hot tea choices in cast iron kettles. Good appetizers and food is good.Happy family in brown sauce is my choice. Wife always gets fried rice. Have had two occasions where rice was hard on night though

The food here is fantastic,  not 5 star cuisine, but standard chinese food done very well,  little pricy but mostly worth it.  However, for takeout, about the fifth time I got it,  received a substantially under portioned amount of my entrÌ©e, like 1/2 of a standard Chinese food container costing well over 12 bucks.  Tainted my otherwise great experience with this place.

I've been here a couple times. The first time - the szechuan was okay.The second time, I say at the bar with my buddy - the bartender was attentive and friendly.The pot stickers my associate ordered weren't bad, but a little bland.I had the beef and broccoli-made spicy. My first bite, I thought they missed my request. The second bite, I was desperately grasping for my water. Delicious.I'll be back - it was empty for lunch, the food was good, and the bartender (and the way she interacted with everyone else at the bar) makes me want to come back.

I will miss Molly Woo's! Had to visit the Columbus area today to take care of some business and had to stop by my favorite Asian bistro! I love the staff and the good never disappoints! I've been going here for probably 10 years now and have befriended staff members who have grown into managerial professionals. I always get the firecracker chicken w/ mushrooms on the side and definitely crab ran goons for starters! This is one of many great Cameron Mitchell restaurants that the city of Columbus has to offer. I wish this place could be found in other major cities but sometimes that's just the way it is! That's what makes the journey of finding great places to dine more interesting! The decor is amazing and no detail was missed in creating a very relaxing and beautiful environment for its patrons. I highly recommend dining here!

I tried to catch an early dinner with my son on Wednesday and it was horrible. We ordered drinks, a sushi roll, two entrees and an entree to go. We didn't get our entrees for 45 minutes and then had to wait on the to go entree. It was obvious our server didn't put our order in on time. There was no manager anywhere to be found to talk to. The firecracker chicken was disgusting. It sounded Kung Pao Chicken but it was just fried chicken in a lame sweet chili that tasted like it came straight out of the sauce packet that comes with egg rolls. I'll never go back there.

Did not go well  Tried this place out and was not impressed.  Rangoons were not anything special.  Ordered Pad thai and asked for no nuts, but it was still full of nuts.  It was not that tasty either.

I dined at Molly Woo's for the second time this past weekend with my mom while visiting my parents. I've only come in here for lunch, but always enjoy the food and service. In the past two times, I've had the lettuce wraps, the crab rangoon, the egg rolls, and the happy family entree. My mom and I typically pick two items and split them and it is always enough food for the both of us. On this particular time, we came in here around 1pm after a bit of shopping. We opted for a booth in the bar as we didn't want a lengthy experience. We chose the lettuce cups (as they are called here, but they are lettuce wraps) and the crab rangoon. The lettuce wraps were by far some of my favorite lettuce wraps. The chicken mixings is perfectly cooked and the sauce they use gives it enough flavor without drenching the entire wrap. The crab rangoon was good as well. They offer six of them. They are smaller than a regular chinese restaurant, but much tastier! I also went with a glass of pinot noir, while my mom had iced tea. The bartender did a fine job, but the service was nothing to write home about. We did sit in the bar for a reason and all in all it was a good experience. I'd be happy to come back.
Good Happy Hour.  Reasonable $5 small plates and specialty drinks and good service from the bartenders.

My husband and I tried Molly Woos for the first time today! I had always heard good things about this place, but I have to say it was quite disappointing! For a starter, we had the tempura shrimp and vegetables! The shrimp were just little tiny ones and the batter was not light and delicate like it should be! It was more like eating onion rings! I had the beef with broccoli, I did not really care for the sauce. It was ok, just nothing special!!! My husband had the Mplly's feast which is described as stir fried vegetables and fried tofu! It had a better taste than the beef dish, but was just nothing special. We have been to many Asian inspired restaurants! I actually prefer PFChang's to this place! My least favorite Cameron Mitchell restaurant. I would not call this high end at all! Also the server who waited on us had grooming issues! He seriously needed t
There gluten free calamari is excellent just make sure your gluten free items have the bamboo toothpick . They even have a dedicated fryer ! The price is a little high but the food is very good !

Came here last night for dinner with my family. On a nice day, molly woo's has a great outdoor seating area that's spacious, comfortable, and beautiful. I ordered and shared some wonton soup, steamed potstickers, and pineapple chicken. I was a huge fan of the soup and potstickers, but the pineapple chicken was nothing out of the ordinary. The portions were a bit small for the price but the quality and restaurant ambiance was great! The inside is very well decorated as well with a contemporary and cultural spin. The restaurant is continently located on the outer edge of the mall by Brio's- easy to access and valet was only $5. Overall, would recommend this place!

Definitely a great place to eat. It's not that expensive for the great food and service you receive. You can also order half plate if you would like. I went for lunch with a co-worker about 6 months ago and now I go back at least once a month if not twice a month even to order out. The firecracker chicken is soooo good. I haven't ever had anything that I don't like yet. My friend ordered something called a lettuce wrap for an appetizer and I didn't think I would like it at all. It turned out to be delicious. Great relaxed energy. Not loud either. It's a must try!!!!

My mom and I came in this afternoon for lunch. We've been in before and love the spring Rolls so we ordered those, which are always great. Our bartender changed our minds on our lunch order by recommending a TNT roll. My mom isn't one to branch out on sushi, so when she heard there was cream cheese and raw tuna she was unsure. We ended up ordering it and we both loved it!! We both said we would order it again. Our bartender, while I don't remember her name (dark brown hair), was very attentive and clearly knew the menu by giving these recommendations. We will definitely be back!

Had the Shrimp Pad Thai, Spicy Scallop roll, and Crab Rangoon.  Everything was delicious! Loved the spice in the Pad Thai. Scallop roll was fresh and had amazing levels of flavor. Crab Rangoon was light but rich and creamy. Portions were big enough for 2 or more to share.

Not to bad a place and much much less salty than PF Changs.  I've been for dinner and happy hour.  The dinner wasn't too bad nor was it mind blowing, but it was good.  Happy hour though is great!  5$ drinkies and appetizers.  I had a mango martini that while short on some kick was still delish.  The crab rangoons were good but I sent back the chicken lettuce wraps.  The chicken was just cooked to mush practically.  No prob! They took it back and I got something else - the spring rolls.  I tried the veggie sushi roll (wait! if no fish does it still count as sushi?) and it was interesting but not something I'd go for again. If you choose the right appetizers your happy hour will be happy.  Plus, at $5 a pop you can afford to experiment.Next time I'm going for the calamari.

Mehhhhhhhhhhhh.I came for dinner with my brother and his girlfriend to celebrate our shared birthday, and was kind of underwhelmed. First, the good: -the paper lanterns and other Asian-y decor was actually really beautiful. -there was no wait for a table at 6 p.m. on a Saturday at Polaris-Spicy scallop rolls were pretty darn tasty!-Iced tea was served with an extra carafe on the table, which was a nice touchNow, the not so good:-The food was pretty blah. The three of us ordered a few things and kind of shared everything: the chicken cabbage salad, firecracker shrimp, spicy scallop roll and spicy tuna roll, plus drinks. Besides the spicy scallop roll, everything was pretty similar to what you'd find at your run-of-the-mill $10 strip plaza Chinese buffet.-Everything was way overpriced, even for Polaris. - Service was friendly, but reallllllyyyyy slow... Like - 15 minutes between being seated and taking a drink order, and then another 15 minutes to get them.Overall, it wasn't terrible (although terribly expensive for what it was - $70 for three people who were still kinda hungry afterwards), but I doubt I would ever try it again.

Shared a Molly's Happy Family with my young daughter thinking that $12.99 will be more than enough to share. Food came in and was disappointed. Few slices of chicken & a few pieces of shrimp. There were more mushrooms and baby corn. Q2's $8.99 Happy Family had more substance - scallops, beef, shrimp, roast pork and veggies. My teenager had the recommended Sake Shrimp and was not very delighted. Like she states "we could've gone somewhere else and got more bang for our buck". I think we paid for the ambiance and overhead. Noticed too many employees in the kitchen not doing anything but chatting. Not a place I would recommend to friends.

To start, I'm not super familiar with a Asian cuisine. My wife however, having spent time in China and Korea, is. We both really enjoyed eating here. There was a lot to choose from and everything was reasonably priced. I had the black pepper steak dish which was absolutely delicious.If you want dessert, split the banana, peanut butter chocolate thing (forgot the name) in an egg roll.

Molly Woo's is one of those places that I don't think of as a "regular" dining option, but friends or family occasionally bring them up as a special occasion sort of place.I don't think I've ever had a really bad meal there, but I don't think I've ever had an incredibly memorable one there - at least, not for the food. The company has often been another matter, but I can't guarantee that for everyone.It's nicely appointed, the food is solid, service has always been good, the patio is nice, and the drinks are tasty. I think some of the portion sizes are on the small side for what you get, but on the other hand you are eating at Polaris, and you get a similar price bump there as you do at Easton. If you're up by the mall and you'd like a nice sit down meal, this is a good option. If you're thinking of driving out of your way, I think it might be a bit much.

Upscale Chinese dining. I've only been here a handful of times but so far, it's our favorite Chinese restaurant in Columbus. You can't really go wrong with a Cameron Mitchell restaurant though. It's a bit pricey but well worth it. The sushi is fresh and tastes great. Every entree I've tried was great too. We usually pass around our dishes and share. My son loves their honey chicken. My favorite is the szechuan chicken. The sauce is delicious and the skin was so crispy. I normally never eat the skin but it was irresistible! We also love their egg rolls. If you've only had cheap take out and buffets, you owe it to yourself to try Chinese food as it's meant to taste!
Consistently high in quality and great service. Best spring rolls ever. You can't loose with the Mango Chicken, Asian Chicken Salad, Firecracker Chicken, and Crab Ragoon!
Swert chili sauce on egg roll.Kids chicken nuggets, pounded, overcooked.Tofu honey...dinged sub from chicken sweet and duvet dpicyGreen beansGood service
Absolutely authentic asian food! Went there by accident, but only the food but also the decoration looks classic.

Eaten here multiple times never really impressed me. Expensive for Chinese food, and no different on this visit. 20$ each for cashew chicken and half of a chicken and lettuce cups appetizer. Dining room is very beautiful and impressive in that right. Nice place to splurge on a bite when your shopping wouldn't make a special trip here

I was here about a year ago and I remember this place being pretty good but this visit was blahhhhh!The hubs ordered the firecracker chicken and it literally tasted like ketchup chicken. Obliviously, there isn't any ketchup in the sauce (I think) but seriously, close your eyes while eating it and it tastes just like it. I had the wonton soup which was good and the lettuce cups which were nothing special. We love CM Restaurants, but not this one! Probably won't be back.

Molly Woo's is by far the most underwhelming Cameron Mitchell restaurant I've been to. The positives... The atmosphere was really nice and impressive upon arrival. The host was kind and we were seated within 5 minutes. Our server was kind. The areas for improvement... The food was very average and I would compare it to other chain Asian restaurants. The prices were not too high, but for the quality of the food it was overpriced. The service was very inconsistent. Upon arrival the server was prompt and efficient. It took a really long time to get alcoholic beverages. As the evening went on the service got slower and slower. We planned to try dessert but because the service was so slow, we didn't have time to even try it. Next time I'm craving Asian food, I will likely  go elsewhere.
Spicy tuna roll was all spice, little flavor. The rest of the meal was slightly subpar. Its a fuzz better food than panda express.

Molly Woo's is by far my favorite oriental restaurant. I've been to many different ones in the Columbus area, but Molly Woo's always is the best. Located in the Polaris mall, don't expect mall food. Molly Woo's is a Cameron Mitchell restaurant. I was there last night with my family as well as my girlfriend. I tried their Pineapple Curry Shrimp. It was great. Molly Woo's offers many different items on their menu. I often have gotten their Cashew Chicken, another favorite. They also have two private rooms, one is their Bamboo Room, which we ate in last night, and one is a bit larger and is known as the Dragon Room.They also have a nice full bar with a TV. The waiters at Molly Woo's are very helpful, kind, and are always willing to help you make a good selection.Molly Woo's is a great restaurant for oriental cuisine.

I used to really like Molly Woos, but I think the quality and service has gone down hill of late. Cameron Mitchell restaurants are usually so much better. My husband had the sushi and wasn't impressed. My beef dish was amid a huge pile of green onions. More onions than beef.Didn't help our server had a big party, but managers and other servers ended up refilling our drinks, clearing plates, etc.The restaurant does take reservations, which is a plus, since many at the mall don't. The red lanterns and ambiance are nice.

Dinner timeUpon entrance:Not a busy night Greeted promptly and seated with our already seated friendsService:Our waiter was very attentive, listened well.Food:I tried the Thai Basil Scallops (GF) The scallops were really good and extremely flavorful. They were cooked almost perfectly!The sauce was exactly right for this dish, excellent scallops for Ohio. The eggplant was not what I was used to, but it fit well with the dish.Although 3 of them had some small amount grit in them..(sand perhaps)?I would have said something to our server but we were with guests and I didn't want to spoil their dinner.But It was not pleasant to eat.Dessert:CREME BRULEE - A+

I am speaking as an ex-Cameron Mitchell employee,s o I tend to be a little biased on how good their food is (although, I am always surprised at how basic their sushi selection is, I would think they would come up with an off the wall roll).My last experience is not based on the food, but by the staff and the service.  My roomie and I went for a girls night out and had ordered a gluttonous sushi, an appetizer of crab rangoon (oh yum!) the happy family, and the kung pao chicken.  I took a bite of something in the happy family, and a bone or something sliced the side of my tongue.  I spit out the food into my napkin and stopped eating.The server came by and asked if we wanted a box and I declined and told her what happened.  2 minutes later the manager was at the table, offered us a free dessert and an apology.  I figured in the Cameron Mitchell world, yes, a free dessert would be offered and probably the happy family taken off the bill.  At the end of our meal the server offered an additional dessert "to go" (we declined, but thanks!) and our ENTIRE bill was waived.  Wow.  Unnecessary, but wow.  It made for a great evening, except my tongue felt like i had stabbed it with a toothpick.  Overall, the manager was extremely apologetic and sweet about it, and our server had been top notch all night.Good recovery Molly Woo's.

First, the only good thing about Molly Woo's: Besides the fact that you're in a Mall, and that you just had to drive to Polaris (even if you're from nearby, traffic out thisaway is still a nightmare), the inside of the restaurant is beautiful. Airy, whimsical, fantasy Asia. Lovely.The food is "meh." As others have said, perhaps the biggest disappointment is that this is a Cameron Mitchell restaurant. Everything about the food is boring. It's exactly what you would find at any Americanized chinese takeout place, nothing more, nothing less. The problem is that you expect more.I couldn't find anything on the menu that looked inventive. Most dishes begin with a breaded&fried chicken and topped with a too-sweet slick brown sauce. Yawn.No problem with the service, but you still get a weird "chainy" vibe from a place that isn't a chain. The pretty space is not enough for me to come here any more than I already have.

The family and I have been dining here over the past 8 years.  The quality and consistency of food, the service and ambiance are all to be appreciated.  While the appetizers are a bit pricey, the overall dining experience more than makes up for that.  I would like a few more vegetarian entrees knowing this is fusion cuisine, but definitely worth my business.  Always keep going back there in spite of the parking hassles that Polaris could present.

Usually BEST food and service...not so much.Sat in the bar during happy hour on Friday- BIG MISTAKE.Our bartender literally forgot about us to the point I had to get up and ask for the check in which he looked shocked/confused on who I was. I get it that you are serving the bar but you also have patrons and TIPS from AROUND the bar.EVERYTHING EVERYTHING has scallions/green onions on it. First of all they are the number one cause of E-Coli and worse- remember Chi Chi's people?? They are NEVER cleaned properly and I avoid them at ALL costs.The spareribs came SMOTHERED with them on it- there was NO mention of this in the description-many other foods do say it so I appreciate that. They were VERY fatty and I will not get again.Calamari- as my dinner guest stated "WOW when it smells that fishy..." RETURN.Got the honey chicken which I was told my the chef is boiled and cooked in a scallion broth...sigh. It was flavorless and barely touched.Not going back...funny as we sat by the mall windows EVERYONE was going to Brio...we should have as well.

I definately frequent Molly Woo's over any other Cameron Mitchell restaurant. It has consistently well prepared dishes, the wait staff (and bartenders) are friendly & attentive, and there are few surprises.For cocktails, the bartenders make great martinis with  inventive flavors!   If you try something new & you don't like it, they will happily make something else for you which is nice.For starters, the lettuce cups are excellent, as well as the seared pot stickers. The sushi is delicious, especially the spicy tuna roll with cream cheese & avacado. For entrees, I've never had a bad meal. My favorites are the Woo's Garlic Chicken, the Cashew Chicken & the Mongolian Beef. My friend always gets the Dan Dan Noodles & says they are the best around. The portions are large. I usually box up half my meal immediately & it's perfect for lunch the next day.In the summertime, the outdoor seating is preferred. Even though it faces the mall parking lot, they did a good job turning the area into a private little oasis. (unlike the Brio)

Great food. If your not familiar with this restaurant like we were, if you low of or have been to PF Changs, it is very similar. They have great drinks such as the Godzilla and the Sangria is AMAZING! The one downside if that the egg rolls are $7.95 for only 2 pieces. The lettuce wraps get you further for the price.

First things first, this review is on food and portion size only. Our server was Excellent. She made our night. My wife and I had never had dinner here. Our night out was our first night out since our sons where born. Other than our server being great, we should have taken a nap somewhere. I got the Kung Pow Scallops ( I think that is what it was called) and my wife got Wor Sui guy. ( I don't know how to spell).  My meal was almost $18.00 and Annie's was $15. We should have gone to Lucky Dragon! My scallops where fishy and the chicken portion was so small. And Both of our sauces tasted the same. We thought this would be 2 absolutely different tasting meals but they tasted the same with different textures. We go to Cameron Mitchell restaurants often but this one will be very hard for us to go back to. We dropped $90 bucks on 2 meals and 2 drinks each and honestly left hungry!  It seemed to be a lot of regulars at the bar, so we must be missing something. It is hard for me to right a poor review on one of CM restaurants but this one the food did not do much for us.
All I could taste was the excessive amount of salt. Small portions, overpriced, uninspired . It's pretty hard to screw up Chinese food, but these guys have.Will never go back.

Big fan of Molly Woo's, I am becoming such a frequent customer that the bartender recognizes me every time I come in! I love their crab rangoons and their Wor Su Gai is amazing, not a fan of the wonton soup though and i feel like their portion of just an order of house fried rice is too high. Would highly recommend eating here, my bestie usually gets sushi and she says it's killer!

My husband and I had dinner at Molly Woo's for the first time March 21, 2014. The restaurant was clean, dÌ©cor was very nice and the service was super fantastic. The food was very good and well plated. The only reason I did not give this restaurant 5 stars was because the food, while very good, did not stand out from other restaurants of similar cuisine and price.

I love Molly Woos! Food was delicious and fresh. Hostess was friendly. Server was knowledgable. And if you are gluten free, there is a HUGE gf menu. I'm gf for health reasons. Not a fad for me. So if I eat even crumbs accidentally I get very ill. I ATE HERE WITHOUT INCIDENT. And if you're celiac that's critical. Cameron Mitchell has done it again. The reason I only give it 4 stars? I wish they would designate that the food they are putting in front of you is in fact gf. Either on a special plate or with a pick that is labeled gf (like a rare pick in a steak) or anything. The least the server could do is say "here is your gluten free lettuce wraps ma'am!" That way you KNOW with certainty the food you are being served is gf. Thank you for a meal that is not only safe but so so yummy. I will go back the moment I can!

$5 Happy Hour is great!Finger-lickin' good ribsCalamari was fried just right. No grease. No fuss.Samurai and Spicy Tuna rolls- I've had better.  Sushi Palace, anyone?I went back for lunch and ordered a chicken and broccoli.  Again, prepared authentically.  It was little expensive for lunch, but it can't beat the experience.  Some guys were making fun of New Jersey, and I pulled off my earphones to say, "Hey! I am from Jersey."  Next thing I know, the other suits at the bar were from Jersey (East Brunswick). HeheBooyah!

Been to Molly Woo's several times for dinner, usually a special occassion like celebrating a birthday.  My experiences have all been pleasant, just nothing that really stood out, except for maybe the decor.  They've put a lot into the decor here; all designed for an Asian ambience.  Have to give their designers an A+ for that.  The staff have always been great.   I just always struggle with the menu.   Each time I struggle to find something that appeals to me.  The wait staff always suggest items, but none have really been memorable.  I did have the Mongolian Seafood Hot Pot for lunch on my last visit and enjoyed it, but I think I enjoy the decor more than the meals.  Maybe its just that the decor is so over the top and the menu is plain and simple; the two just don't seem to mix and confuse the senses.

This is like an upscale PF Chang. The food was delicious. I got the hunan beef for lunch and it was a good portion with unlimited rice. I am here for the Arnold Classic and figured I would go and try something new.

Was there for the first ever time for their Lion Dance event with a group of friends.  Very lively atmosphere, great decor and extremely courteous service.  The lettuce cups I had weren't the best though. Was a bit disappointed.  Would certainly go back to try something else.

I moved to Columbus from the Cleveland area a few months ago and was amazed by the lack of good Asian food in the city. I tried a few other places with dismal results. I could throw a rock and hit a Panda Express in this city but finding a place that provides good Asian cuisine is like locating Big Foot. I live close to Polaris and decided to give Molly Woo's. Good choice. The location is easy to find, there is parking readily available, it's decorated nice, the service is good, and most importantly the food is very good. It's a bit pricey but worth it. I was disappointed that for $7.50 I only received TWO spring rolls. To say I found that ridiculous was an understatement. I had the basil scallops for my entree which were absolutely delicious. It's easy to overcook scallops, but these were cooked perfectly. I noticed A LOT of children with their parents at Molly Woo's, which is fine, if they are well behaved. I generally go out to eat later in the evening to avoid the family of 4 crowd. Kids really aren't my thing, especially when they are hanging over the back of my booth and making me feel uncomfortable while I try to eat. Also, please remember not to block the walkways with your baby stroller.All in all I had a nice dinner at Molly Woo's but found some of the prices for appetizers to be absurd.

I can't help it.  I love Molly Woo's.  Molly Woo's is able to combine my favorite parts of chains (streamlined best practice type service, menu items that taste pretty close to the same every time) with my favorite parts of independent restaurants (good service, some original dishes).  I've never had to wait here (although you can make reservations online if you worry about that sort of thing).  I've never had a bad meal here.  I love that you can get brown or white rice.  I love that you can get chinese AND sushi and both of them taste good and like they're supposed to.  I like entrees are brought to you so that it's easy to share with other people you're dining with.  I'm a spicy tuna roll and sesame chicken kind of girl, in case you're curious.  And, I have to reiterate, I love that I've never had to wonder where the server is with my napkins/water/whatever else I need.  They always appear before I start wondering if they died.All this being said, it should be noted that this is Chinese done American.  The decor is red walls and paper lanterns, but the music is more "Rock the Casbah" (which kind of made my last dining experience here anyway, so I'm into this sort of thing).  I've seen everything from cut offs to prom dresses here, so come as you are (which might be partly due to it being kind of part of Polaris Mall).Also of note: sake on draft!  Why isn't sake on draft A Thing Everywhere?!

Man Oh Man is Molly Woos ever good! Wow-wee! As a matter of fact, it's so good that if you don't like oriental food, you'll love Molly Woos! My wife and I absolutely love the chicken lettuce wrap appetizer. I'm a huge fan of the Mongolian Stew. My wife loves all of the chicken entrees and can't pick just one as her favorite. Molly Woos is the only restaurant in Central Ohio that I felt confident enough to bring my entire family recently. Three generations of us celebrated a reunion at Molly Woos and not one of my family members complained about a thing. From the decor to the diverse menu to the fabulous service, we strongly recommend Molly Woos to whoever wants a unique, enjoyable dining experience with a lot of taste at a reasonable cost.
Food was delicious! Was a time that our server disappeared for awhile when we needed him, but other than that the experience was great.

The dish I ordered would be considered by my compatriots as the only "authentic" offering on the menu, however, execution was anything but.  The flavor was acceptable, but it was absolutely drowning in sauce.  Unless it was intended to be a soup dish (which it isn't) this is an automatic red flag.  Otherwise, the decoration and ambience felt like a carbon copy of a national chain Asian bistro which shall remain nameless.  Not a good choice for Chinese food, but perhaps not bad for a working lunch.

A group of us were searching for dinner in the Polaris one evening and decided on Molly Woo's.  None of us had ever been to the restaurant so we were uncertain of what to expect.The four of us split an order of the potstickers.  Very typical Chinese restaurant fare, but I'd have expected something a bit more from CM (especially at $7.95).  My friends each ordered a main plate and I tried the vermicelli salad.  My friend's dishes were good, but not fantastic.  My salad was overwhelming in size, I was only able to consume half.  It was something I'd expect from a Vietnamese restaurant, but at twice the price.Sadly it seems you pay for the atmosphere at Molly Woo's, it has a gorgeous and clean interior with attentive staff.  But more importantly, the food was less than stellar.  I won't be returning, there are CM restaurants I thoroughly enjoy but this isn't one of them.

As I mentioned on my review of Tai's Asian Bistro, I am a New York transplant pretentious Chinese food snob. For all the background on that, please read that review! But as I had mentioned there, I love most Chinese food varieties, from sit-down, to creepy carry-out, to indie mall Chinese food. But there are two kinds I really do hate: Ultra-Americanized and Chain (i.e. Panda Express or Manchu Wok) Chinese. And unfortunately, Molly Woo's definitely falls under Americanized Chinese.You can always tell Americanized Chinese food when you bite into it. It's not saucy enough. The breading on the General Tso's or Sesame Chicken is too hard. The chicken doesn't taste right. And you can always tell Americanized Chinese restaurants when you visit them. They look ULTRA Asian, attempting cover up their Americanness with ornate decor such as paper lanterns and dragons. And that's exactly how Molly Woo's was.Every other Cameron Mitchell restaurant that I have been to, I have adored. Martini is quite certainly my favorite Italian restaurant in Columbus. But this foray into Chinese food did not work for me. My Sesame Chicken was basically tasteless. It was so unmemorable that I do not remember what my girlfriend got.Sorry Columbus, but I would choose Tai's Asian Bistro over Molly Woo's any day of the week. Even though Tai's isn't waited service or a romantic atmosphere, at least it has taste and better prices.
Meh! Given the wait and cost, I was expecting much better quality than what we got. A mall is the appropriate location for this--it fits right in with the food court.

Went here for dinner here tonight -- and decided this time I was going to treat myself to a nice glass of wine.  I thought with a nice spicy chicken dish, I'd get a nice fruity white wine to cut the spices.  I wasn't disappointed  when I got the Sokol white blend -- a blend of what I wasn't sure, but it was very nice.  A bit on the pricey side for one glass, but it went nicely with the Firecracker Chicken.  The chicken was nicely done -- with lots of yummy garlic and thai chili's.  So I was just as impressed as I was when I first visited here -- great service, great food,  great wine and great atmosphere.  The only thing that really stinks about this place is the parking -- ugh!

Molly Woo's was my first restaurant to dine in when I moved to Columbus. Not only is it beautiful, but I have never had such great service....and we go there about once a month. The firecracker shrimp and potstickers are phenomenal.
Food was very good.  Spring roll was delicious.  The pace of the mask was a little fast.
