There are many other options on high street with the Cameron Mitchell name that I would choose over the pearl.
Love Cameron Mitchell places this place no different. Cuban sandwich is amazing!!! and Burger Rulers!!!!

Oh man, I really got myself hyped up for this place.  I've always had this place of my radar for many years, well ever since it was put in.  I mentioned something to a good friend about always wanting to check this place out, and so it happened, we made it happen.  Reservations set for 8pm on a Monday night, hoping it wouldn't be too crazy for an area that always seems busy for great food.I usually don't order a lot of food, but tonight I was planning on trying a lot and may have spent way more money than I normally would, but in the end, I planned for it, this was a night out to spoil ourselves and we most certainly did.Valet was key, I would highly recommend taking advantage of it in this area.  I usually take one trip around the block for a open spot, and if nothing is available I go straight to the Valet, it certain cases like this, it's money well spent.Ok, enough of how we ended up here and lets get straight to the food.Starters and Apps:1. House made tater tots, you get a good amount and these were really good.  Fried potatoes on a menu isn't really too fancy, but these were incredible.  I'm still curios how they manage to get silky mashed potatoes fried up in a cube. Best value for money.2.  Lamb meatballs, a must get item!!  These were the best things I had for the night.  Only comes with three, so at $3/piece it's a little pricey, but mmmmmm mmmmm! Very good!3.  Old fashioned devil eggs, I wouldn't order this again.  Not because it was bad, they were good, but to me, I learned devil eggs are kind of like those food items where you really only like the version you grew up with because nothing else can compare.  It came with 4 so at $2/piece, which I also found to be a little pricey for what you're getting.4.  Devils on horseback, another really good item that came with about 5 pieces to share.  I pretty much like anything that's thick bacon wrapped, and these were very good.5.  Jalapeno corn spoon bread, this was really good too.  Even for a friend who doesn't like cornbread, he said to remove the dish because he was going to eat it all and not share with anyone.  Smother the honey and butter over the top and dig right in, this was yummy!Raw Oysters, they have several locals to choose from.  I can't vouch for how they taste as I'm not into raw oysters or anything that I find very salty, but my friends enjoyed what they got.Mains:Southern fried chicken, this was a good dish, nicely breaded thick pieces of chicken friend with a good spicy sauce on the side if you want to add some.  Like every sticky bun I've had, excellent!  and the green bean casserole was tasty, I wish more came with the dish.Cuban sandwich, good tasting pork and some great bread.  Nothing else to really say, but it's a good sandwich that they offer.Catch of the Day, this evening it was blackened perch with lump crab meat.  It was very good.  Fresh seafood with some chunky crab? YES please!!So we ended our night without any pie, so maybe next time.  Our server was great, she was on top of getting things cleared without being intrusive while doing it and the cocktails were all really good and well made.  Another CM place that I'm impressed with.

My first time at The Pearl was awesome! This retro joint is located downtown on High Street in the middle of Short North.Parking is ample. If you can't find a spot on the street, there's a parking garage right around the corner.The ambiance is a dimly lit, casual oyster bar. I recommend sitting at the oyster bar and watching the oyster shucking.I took the advice of fellow helpers and ordered the jalapeÌ±o bread - boy was I glad I did! The baked and fresh oysters were spot on! The Beet Soup was like nothing I've ever tasted - delicious!I already miss you, Pearl!

We ate brunch at The Pearl based on a recommendation from another friend that was visiting Columbus as well. We ordered coffee, a bloody mary, The Benny and eggs and grits. The Bloody Mary (spicy) was the perfect consistency and spiciness for my tastes. The Benny serving was large - I had asked for the gravy on the side and I think that was a good idea. Grits were delicious too. Window dining seat and the laid-back, but conscious service complemented our food for brunch.

My wife got the Brie grilled cheese sandwich and it was amazing. I shared the flank steak with a Kimche rice and it was fabulous! To start off we had the cornbread which everyone raved about for good reason. At first I thought the cornbread was just ok but by the second bite I thought it was good and the third bite just melted in my mouth. The honey butter made it go over the top.

We're total foodies, and The Pearl did not disappoint! We will be back.The staff was incredible - very friendly, very knowledgeable, and the food was so good. They have a grilled cheese sandwich made with brie and pear jam. I have never, in my whole life, tasted anything like it.  So Good.

I wish I could resonate with the high reviews people give this place, but I can't. My husband and I visited Columbus over the weekend and decided to come here for our dinner. First of all, everything takes an extremely long time so don't plan to be anywhere after your meal that has a set time.We ordered the duck fat wings and the n'awlins hot oysters for starters. Wings were decent but the oysters were very bland. Despite the cheese and visible seasonings, they had no flavor whatsoever. At $14 for just three of them, that's disappointing. Came with a piece of bread and I have to say the bread was better than the oysters.The server raved about the entrees and their drinks. I mean realllllly raved! Thus, I ordered a margarita as he said it had a kick and was "in your face" strong. Negative. It came in a tiny glass and tasted like salt. For our meals I had the shrimp and grits and hubby had the burger which the server said would be the best burger my husband had all year. Another lie. My husband didn't even finish it as it had no flavor. He said it wasn't good at all. My shrimp and grits were a very small portion, and the grits were very lumpy. Broth was decent with the onions and peppers with the shrimp, but the foundation of the dish (grits) were a miss, so I couldn't enjoy.Skip The Pearl. Everyone moves in slow motion and the food isn't up to par in my opinion. Won't be back.

Food - 5 stars, everything the four of had was deliciousService - 4 stars, good but not greatValue - 3 stars, overpriced for what you get ($9 for three one inch wide lamb meatballs, $10 for a small cocktail, $160 brunch for four with four cocktails and one dessert). The lack of value is the norm with Cameron Mitchell restaurants. Ambiance - 3 stars, unless you like the vibe of extremely loud and tables crowded together. We were in a booth and it was so loud the that waiter could not hear the orders from the people sitting against the wall, nor could they hear him. We have been there three times, and these themes are consistent. I am sure we will go there again in a year or so, but will frequent higher value peer restaurants more often in the meantime.

Sunday brunch has something for everyone. Prices are good and petiole were just right. Parking out front was easy to catch. The front window was opens d the weather added to the atmosphere.  We didn't try any oyster but will be back.
Nick was a great server. Super helpful with menu selections This place cares about both good service and excellent food
Everything was great, outside of the Roach on the wall and sub-par service. Don't think I'll be recommending this to others.

My husband and I were looking for a restaurant in Short North that: A. we both had never been to, B. Wasn't too fancy/$$$, and C. Wasn't a no-frills bar & grill.  We settled on The Pearl and we're both pretty happy we did.We went on a Wednesday after 9pm and the place was still pretty full of folks, which is a good sign in my book.We were quickly seated and had drinks in hand within 5 minutes.The first thing my husband says to me is "this restaurant has a lot of good looking people working here".  Yes, it's true.  The hosts/esses, wait staff, bartenders, even the cooks are all very attractive so you get some dinner eye candy. Drinks aren't too expensive and you have a lot to choose from.Most importantly, the food was amazing. My husband's order of fish & chips was huuuuuge and he really liked it. My Arctic char was delicious. The roasted cauliflower really went well with the fish. I can see The Pearl becoming a regular stop for us.

A long walk from our downtown Columbus hotel. Worth every step!! Yellow perch was outstanding.  Both of my other companions had Arctic Char and were quite enamored with it.  Salad was great and we had to try the deviled eggs. Special presentation and spicy delicious. Dirty Martini had too much vermouth. Obviously bartender doesn't drink martinis.

The Pearl is my favorite restaurant in Columbus! My husband and I celebrated our one year wedding anniversary here this past weekend. The service was incredible, they knew we were celebrating and went out of their way to take care of us! The cocktails are always delicious, I'm a huge fan of the Ramos Gin Fizz and my husband loves the Old Fashioned. We contemplated ordering the seafood tower but decided to just order our favorites individually. We started with a dozen oysters, then had some peel and eat shrimp. To finish the meal we ordered the New Orleans style oysters! They were amazing!!We were treated to two desserts for our special day! We had the Brown Sugar Pie (OMG) and the Mud Pie. We were in heaven! We will be back very soon!!

Was really looking forward to this place but it was a bit of disappointment.  I do not recommend the artic char - the fish and everything on the plate was pretty bland and tasteless.  The tater tots though were good and the devils on horseback - bacon wrapped Gorgonzola stuffed dates were delicious.

Not only is the food spectacular (love the bacon wrapped dates, hanger steak, BEST BURGER in town, and BROWN SUGAR PIE -- life changing pie), the service will blow your mind. I frequent here and I love sitting at the bar because of Brendan & Dan (two of the best bar tenders ever). I would highly recommend you to try the Pearl and get everything I mentioned and ask Dan/Brendan for a solid cocktail!!

I've never had anything here that wasn't good. It's part of the Cameron Mitchell empire so its quality is to be expected.I recommend the Extra Spicy Bloody Mary, Which is the best in Columbus. For brunch get The Thomas, it's just brioche, skillet potatoes, two eggs, bacon and sausage for $18.00.

Really nice place in the heart of the Short North with a lot of menu items that you wouldn't see just anywhere.  I got to try my first oysters this weekend when my girlfriend and I went for a late dinner with some friends.We started out with jalapeÌ±o corn bread, which was SO good!  There was just the right amount of jalapeÌ±o kick without it being overpowering, and the presentation on the wood plank was cool too.  My only complaint here was that the honey was inside of the dollop of butter on the wood plank, with no cup around it, so when I took some of the butter to put on my bread, the honey ran out and over the plank (whatever, not a big deal).A few people in our group had the Moscow Mule; very flavorful and in a nice copper cup.  $10 each if I remember correctly, a little pricey to me, but it was a special occasion so no big deal.My girlfriend had the ricotta dumplings and I had the hanger steak (medium rare).  The steak comes out plated very beautifully, and was very flavorful.  You can tell when a steak is cooked perfectly when you don't feel the need for any extra sauces.  There was some added flavor from the kimchee, but that steak would have been delicious even without.Our server was extremely attentive and took outstanding care of us all night long.  As a table, we ordered a slice of each of the four types of pies that they have at The Pearl (key lime, apple, a house special, and a chocolate).  We split these all up, and every one of them was great.  I definitely recommend The Pearl if you're looking for a nice evening out.

Dinner here was surprisingly good! We met out of town friends here for dinner as it was highly rated and offered a great variety for our group that ranged in ages from 4, 17 to 50.We made it in time for happy hour which ended at 6 and I am so glad we did! Half priced drinks and small plates plus $1.50 oysters offered a great discount off the menu prices.Standout items were the baked oysters, confit chicken (chicken wings), spinach salad and all the pies! We had the Brown Sugar Pie, Billionaire Pie al a mode and Frozen Strawberry Pie.  I was definitely glad we saved room for dessert as that was the highlight to me!I would certainly eat here again and make it a point to be there in time for Happy Hour.
Amazing place, vibe and service.  The deviled eggs and lamb meatballs are a must.  They have one of the best tasting burgers I have ever had.
BrunchOutstanding. Omelettes, Chicken and Waffles, oysters, cinnamon buns, had a blast. Enjoyed our food

Fried Chicken was good and the tator tots on the side were just ok.The best item I had were the Baked Clams! So delicious! They were piping hot and came buried in bacon and Parmesan! Service was slow but good! I'll probably visit again if I ever come back to Columbus.

Been to the Pearl several times and I must say, it is one of my favorite restaurants in Columbus, Ohio.  Situated in the heart of the 'up and booming Short North', this gastropub is already set up for success. The restaurant is always packed, the table proximity, and low lighting gives in to that feeling. The menu is pretty simple. Some carefully selected and well made starters like deviled eggs begs you to move on to the snack items like the house smoked salmon with guess what, another deviled egg served on the side.  But don't stop there, get the  jalapeÌ±o spoon bread and it's game over but wait!We came in for oysters! And 'lo and behold', it's Thursday, $1.50 oyster night.  While you're enjoying a dozen of the variety raw half shelled, save room for a few 'Nawlin' style! Baked in magic sauce and loaded with buttery goodness, you might want extra crusty French bread to soak it all up. Sweet satisfaction! We could not eat one more bite but seriously considering the brown sugar 'crack' pie! But really that must be for next time.  We finished up our pump kick and the the super spicy Bloody Mary and a miller light beer back...contemplating the walk to the car...
We had a 3 star and a 5 star meal here.  I'll be coming back.Oysters are a no brainer.  Ambience is excellent.  Great menu.  Wait staff world class first visit.  Not so good the next time.

The Pearl presented a couple firsts for me: it was my first Cameron Mitchell and it was my first time experiencing oysters. It was NOT the first time I had to pull the ol' "quickly check your bank account app after seeing the prices" trick, but it was totally worth it. Appropriately placed near Short North's upscale offerings, The Pearl is an anchor to Columbus' 5 star dining experience.Giiiiiiiiiiiiiiiirl, let's talk about those oysters. Here's a tip: you may not leave The Pearl until you have consumed their oysters. I can personally vouch for the Oysters on a Half Shell and the N'awlins Style Oysters. Incredibly fresh. Great flavors. Their snacks and starters are also very impressive. The jalapeÌ±o corn spoon bread is a great dish for the table! My favorite dish on the entree offerings has to be the hanger steak. But Phil, it's the Pearl. Why are you eating steak at a seafood place? Great question. It's probably one of the best steaks I've had in Columbus. Incredible. If there was one thing keeping this from a 5, it's probably that the replay value isn't through the roof for me. I've been there 3 times, and by the third time I was suffering from a bit of menu fatigue. It'd be cool to see some new offerings every now and then. Overall, I give it 2 thumbs way up!
In my humble opinion, best happy hour in the CITY of Columbus! This is always my choice for HH - the barrel aged cocktails are well-balanced and delicious.

This place was underwhelming at best. The oysters were probably the highlight of the meal. The tater tots were morel like fried mash potato balls than true tater tots, which would've been fine if I hadn't been expecting tater tots. The lamb meatballs were unique but not something I'd get again. The dessert was very thin and not at all decadent as you'd expect dessert to be, which is truly a shame considering I'd been wanting to visit this place for such a long time. Sadly, it was a disappointment.

This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in not only the short north but all of Columbus. To start off they have valet parking for $8 right in front of the restaurant which you aren't going to find anything cheaper for the 1-2 hours you'll spend dining. The restaurant itself is classy but not over the top. They bring in the American nice restaurant vibe with adding pieces here and there to make it resemble a seafood restaurant as well. Now to the food. We started off with the Charcuterie Board. While it was good it wasn't my favorite and I'm not sure if I'd get it again especially because it was pretty expensive. Along with this starter we also ordered the Parmesan baked clams. They were cooked in a butter garlic sauce and topped with Parmesan and were awesome. For entrees we got the Artic Char, which was cooked perfectly and came with a roasted cauliflower and purÌ©e, and the Braised short rib, which fell apart and melted in your mouth. Both of these were amazing. I can't speak to every server at the restaurant but the one we had was the most informed waiter I've ever received. He had tried everything on the menu and knew just about anything you could ask about the food. We had told him that it had been a while since my girlfriend and I had been to a nice restaurant and he even brought us a free pie with homemade whipped cream. I don't like whipped cream, but I couldn't get enough of theirs. Overall, it was a great experience. Little on the pricey end but well worth it

Dined on a Friday during happy hour and it can not be beat!!!  Happy hour here is one of the hidden gems in the short north. The jalapeÌ±o corn bread is worth a go, as well as the New Orleans oysters. I found them quite tasty and would recommend them anytime, especially when they are half off during happy hour.  The quality of the food is top notch and the service is accommodating and personable.
If you haven't tried the tater-tots, you're doing it wrong!

Last night was my second night at the pearl. I would say the food should be given a 3.5 rating rather than 3 stars. We came late on a Saturday night. We had reservations and the staff properly accommodated us accordingly and we did not have to wait. We were greeted immediately, but after that the service was a little spotty and we waited awhile before we got to put in our actual food order. We started off with the lamb meatballs and jalapeno spoon bread. The lamb meatballs come with three and were flavorful. The spoon bread was honestly the best thing we had all night. It was moist and was accompanied by butter and spicy honey of some sort. It was big enough to share between 3-4 people. For entrees we all shared a cuban sandwich and ricotta dumplings. The dumplings were good, but the portion was small and I felt they were missing something when it came to the flavor. The cuban sandwich was good, a little salty, but a good portion. We swapped out the stew for fries, which were also pretty good. For dessert we tried a chocolate creme pie. It again was good, but nothing absolutely amazing. The location is great and menu isn't bad, but nothing particularly sticks out about The Pearl.

Heard that the JalapeÌ±o corn bread was awesome; it was good but not the best thing I'd ever had. Oysters on the half shell ($9/3) were satisfying, and Hanger Steak (medium rare) with kimchee rice was outstanding, and the four pie sampler was good - bacon on a pecan pie? Really?

I love the Pearl! No other place like it in the city. If you like raw oysters, you found the right place. The food is consistently good. The New Orleans baked oysters are amazing!! The hanger steak dish is also fantastic. Delicious, hand crafted cocktails. The bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable.  I have never had a bad experience here.

This is a great place for a date. My husband and I went for his birthday. Reservations are highly recommended for weekends. Parking can be hard so either valet or risk finding a meter. The drink list is great for a Gastropub, try the local North High pearl oyster stout. The jalapeÌ±o spoon cornbread was super yummy, but i did not taste any jalapeÌ±os.  The selection of oysters was great, we got 4 different east coast types, I always let them choose the variety.  The meals were really good, although the serving size was kind of smaller than I expected, which is fine if you get an appetizer. The service over all was absolutely wonderful.

Went to the pearl today for brunch I can tell you the device was excellent. Our table shared oysters, jalapeÌ±o corn bread and pickles all were very good. I had one of their bloody Mary's spicy it was good not great. Our plates were eggs sausage and sausage gravy, I tried it and it was very good. The fish and chip were well above what you might expect. I love good Cole slaw and this slaw was as good as I've had, finely sliced and creamy. My daughter had the short rib poutine, I tried a bite and again very good.Only negatives were cocktails were a little pricey 10.00 for a bloody, overall prices I thought were a little high but in the end food and service made it palatable.

Stopped by here late on a Tuesday night (around 9:00 pm) with a girlfriend.  We saw they had the front wall open and some super comfy armchairs with our names on them, so we sat down and waited for a server.  And waited.  And waited.  The place was not that busy.  Servers walked right by us without even glancing our way.  The hostess was standing right in front of us, looked right at us, and ignored us.  After about 10 minutes, I got up, went to the bar and ordered drinks.  I brought them back to our chairs and we sat and enjoyed ourselves.  At no point did anyone from the staff come and ask us if we needed anything else, wanted another drink, or anything.  Left wondering if the two of us fifty-somethings were just not cool or cute enough to rate anyone's attention?  The drinks were fine, but the customer service smacked of ageism.
I dont feel like writing a review right now, but i will when i get home. just know thst this place is fantastic, cool?
We only went here for cocktails but the food coming out all around us looked amazing. It was the best whiskey sour I had ever had, and the service was impeccable.

Just got into Columbus last night and Yelped this place.  The food was very good, maybe a bit salty but our server was awesome!  Jordan was an awesome server with a great personality!  He was very attentive to our requests and was fun to talk with too, thanks Jordan!

In town for conference so I did some research and this place looked pretty good. Six of us waited an hour on Tuesday night, we had no idea it was so popular. It was worth the wait. Service was excellent. We had the fried chicken, shrimp and grits and the short rIbs. We were very happy with our choices.  We'd all recommend The Pearl.

Came here for Sunday brunch (and thankfully had reservations). The food was good and our waiter was friendly and attentive. The ambiance here is great, especially during the summer when the front windows are open. I highly recommend the Duke of Pearl cocktail. I had the short rib poutine topped with sunny side up eggs along with 3 oysters. The oysters were fresh and a pretty good size. The poutine dish skimped a little on the short rib, but it was well prepared and tasted great. I am looking forward to coming back for dinner to check out additional entrees and the wine list!

Very trendy, well-visited place. It was packed on a Saturday night. We waited about 45 minutes to be seated. I loved the way the male waiters were dressed. They each wore white dress shirts with a ties and vests. Sort of a throwback to the days of speakeasies. Anyway, I probably ordered the wrong dish; as it seemed that most of the patrons were thoroughly enjoying their meals.Mine wasn't bad, just not as good as I hoped it would be. I ordered braised short rib, which came with a side of mashed potatoes and root veggies.I also had a glass of merlot, which made up for the points lost on the meal. The waiter Kevin was friendly.The decor was very nice as well. In the bathrooms were large glass bottles of listerine with cups. I'd never seen anything of the such. Listerine? Ummm, ok.Anyway, overall I enjoyed it. The one super cool thing was that our bills were presented to us in books. I noticed that other patrons had written inscriptions inside, although I did not. I will purchase and read the title I received, however. It may be a sign that I need to read it.

First few visit to Pearl were fantastic.  In the year the food quality and service have really dropped.  Consistently late seating even with a reservation.  Randomly canceled a reservation made on Open Table, no explanation or notice.  Last straw with this place.

Date of Visit: 5/4/2016We were looking for a nice seafood restaurant and came across The Pearl. It was quite crowded so we were hoping the food matched the enthusiasm of the clientele. We began our meal with their stuffed dates (Devils on Horseback) which were very good and went on to order the Shrimp and Grits and the Ricotta Dumplings. Both entrees were perfect size and extremely delicious. We ordered a desert I had their blackberry cobbler and my associate had the Boston Creme pie, both deserts were large enough to share and the waiter should've made the clear when we order because we both left a large portion of it as we stay in hotel and have no way to refrigerate leftovers. We'll be returning to The Pearl after sampling the rest of the restaurants on High Street.

It was fine. I got the ricotta dumplings and it was yummy. The fried chicken my boyfriend got was a little dry. Not as impressed as we could of been. Cornbread was a little underwhelming as well. In summary: A little over priced and a little over rated.

What a fun date night. Now that my hubster and I are empty nesters we have decided to eat our way through the area. Our goal is to try something new a different every month. In December we decided we needed to try Pearl. I'm so glad we did. It's true that it's pretty loud hit not so loud you can't have a conversation. The decor gives a totally 70s retro vibe, but in a good way. I want to go back for the tater tots and deviled eggs alone. So so so yummm.  My mouth was so happy. The margarita wasn't too sweet and was very strong. Just perfect!! For dinner I ordered the shrimp and grits, liked them a lot but could have used a bit more spice and my sweets ordered the pork chop and it was good as well. Their snacks menu is Definitely where it's at. Can't wait to go back for drinks and snacks!!

Early Sunday dinner March 19, 2017, reservation for 9.   We were looking forward to trying this Cameron Mitchell restaurant- (Mr Mitchell certainly would not be pleased with this location had he been in our seats).   Service was terrible, our waiter was rude & then ditched us.    9 peeps- 3 apps, 8 meals, and 2 slices of pie ordered.   All 3 courses took forever to arrive it seemed.  Apps were good, meals were sub par for a Mitchell restaurant,  pie crust was as tough as leather, diet coke was ordered and returned...... wasn't diet,  was flat, and not crisp or cold.   Grits were at best room temp.  Fish and chips were ordered we asked that the fries be well done.   Fries, tarter, and cocktail sauce arrived - but no fish or slaw.   20 minutes into everyone's meal we asked about the fish - was told it was never cooked.   We cancelled that order. I get it-  we aren't hip -   we weren't drinking -  but if you don't want host  a family of non drinkers on a Sunday afternoon -  please post it on your site or at the front door.     It was embarrassing as we were hosting guests from Florida.....  they did comp the pie and apps - as they knew the ball was dropped, however,  we won't ever recommend or go back.

Top notch food and service. From the time I got there, the service was excellent. The hostess was courteous and took care of me right away. My party was not there right away so I took a seat at the bar. The Bartender was professional and attentive and they had a great appetizer and beer menu. We were seated close to my reservation time and the food and service continued to be great! Started with the oysters which were amazing! Followed by the Hangar steak which was cooked perfectly and had a  wonderful flavor. Waiter was attentive and knowledgeable and really took care of us. TOP NOTCH establishment. I would go back again!!!

Short North Brunch All Star  Wanted brunch and The Pearl's menu looked interesting so packed in the family and went there.  The wait wasn't as long as expected, only 25 minutes.  Parent note:  had my infant son with me and he needed his diaper changed.  They have NO CHANGING STATIONS AT ALL, but all the bathrooms have a table with mouthwash  and cups.  I cleared off the table and used it to change him.  Also there is no place to leave a stroller and while they have booster seats and high chairs, it is really tight in there so the high chair is being squeezed by by patrons and staff the entire meal.  Also it is loud in there.  On to the food; tried the Tavern Benny, N'awlins Oysters, chicken and waffles, and huevos rancheros entrees.  The chicken and waffles was the least appealing because the waffles were dry.  The chicken had lots of flavor though and was quite enjoyable.  The huevos rancheros would be second lowest even though it was great.  Had a southwest feel to the flavors, they provide the dish with soft shells to be loaded up like tacos.  Excellent!  Second best was the tavern benny.  This was like biscuits with gravy and an absolute flavor bomb.  The best dish, however, was the N'awlins oysters.  The flavors for these 3 little oysters were incredible.  It was garlicy, cheesy, oyster goodness.  Only wish is that there was more for the course.  This brunch is a must-try, make a reservation if possible to avoid the wait.

The Pearl is amazing!  The food is outstanding (the oysters are so fresh!) and the cocktails are tasty.  I have dined here so many times and had just a few not-so-great experiences, but even when something gets screwed up, the staff goes over and above to fix the problem!  The thing that has absolutely sold me on this restaurant is an experience I had here a couple of years ago.  My daughter has several food allergies, so what she can order from any menu is limited.  She had loved an item that was on the children's menu, but we came in this particular time, the item was no longer on the menu.  The server offered to run over to Marcella's (a sister restaurant nearby) to get something similar that she would like.  Although the other restaurant was not so far away, the offer floored me.  We did not take the server up on his kind offer, but it really left an impression.  The service here is always that fantastic and can really make the difference in a memorable meal.

One of my favorite places in short north. Nice ambiance. Well decorated. Good drink list.. usually I'll get wine here. Entrees are a good variety of "upscale comfort foods." Pies are excellent.. haven't had a bad one yet. Sometimes we like to end our nights out here and share a bottle of wine and order slices of pie. Highly recommend!

Service and restaurant are great but does not over power the food. I wish when I ordered dozen oysters I was given option to order 12 of the same oyster vs 4 different kinds which 3/4 were very horrible. Fried chicken wings and clam chowder overly salty. I was warned but I feel the need to try myself. I'm glad I tried it out but I will never go back. Only positive food option was the jalapeÌ±o cornbread and the peel & eat shrimp. But not worth price or bad food experience.

I would consider this place cozier than classy, which for me is winning. It's good food without the stuffiness and very personable servers (shout out to Eric).I think I had the best seat in the house.. facing the window for the best people watching ever! But aside for that, let's talk about FOOD. I had the following:Tuna Crudo - This was delightful.. I'd ask for NO SALT as it made this way to salty. It's nice thin cuts of tuna and every other bite a piece of rock salt.. too much, but it didn't stop me from eating it. I just moved the salt around.House Pickles - These were nice starters. Nice variety and nice flavors."Special" Roasted Chicken -- I had them replace the quinoa salad (which I hear is mahvelous with charred broccoli and root vegetables.  This was good, flavorful, and moist!Of everything I have a new love for charred veggies. I think this might have been my favorite. Sounds good, but it was so delicious followed by the Tuna and the chicken. One thing to note is that food is not a factory here, so don't be in a super hurry. From sit down to check for 1 person, it took about an hour and they didn't seem that busy.
Best restaurant the the short north hands down. They also have a killer happy hour. Tons of raw oyster options, fantastic broiled shrimp, and other options for land-lubbers.

I tried the JalapeÌ±o Corn Spoon Bread. It was served on a wooden board with a pad of butter with honey in the center of it. The bread was flavorful and of good texture and consistency. The honey was a great compliment to the flavors. For my main I got the Hanger steak. The menu said it was pineapple marinated, but I didn't notice the flavor. The steak was on top of Kimchee Fried Rice and a fried egg was placed off to the side. The heat from the Kimchee Fried Rice was the noticeable ingredient in the dish and while it caught me off guard it was not overwhelming. I mostly ate the steak by itself, and then broke my fried egg with the remaining fried rice which made for a nice side. Overall the food was okay. I felt the flavors and textures in my dish could have melded better together. My friend's fish (with the fish and chips dish) was a bit fishy and my other friend's shrimp (with the peel and eat shrimp dish) could have been cleaned more pristinely. The waiter we had was friendly and on top of things. The decor in the restaurant is simply beautiful, warm and inviting. I would welcome spending more time in such a comfortably decorated space.

Went here on a business dinner; great atmosphere but a bit on the loud side. Menu is a bit all over the place but the food was really pretty good, service was outstanding. If in the area, it'd be a toss up to come back as there are many places in the area to try.
Great atmosphere, and everything we had was good.  Smoked salmon for an appetizer, short rib was perfect, and hanger steak was tender and flavorful.

The ambience was nice and the food was good. However, the waiter was cocky and not pleasant. He seemed annoyed we were there. The ladies who delivered our food was very courteous and nice. He didn't offer dessert but just gave us our bill. We got the feeling he wanted us to leave asap so the next party could be seated. We were there on a Sat night with a party of 8. I expected better service considering the price and ratings. We were really looking forward to it and was very disappointed.
Excellent experience! I had the deviled eggs to start and the fresh catch as my entree. Delicious! The cocktails were great and staff was attentive and courteous.

I cannot rave about this place enough. We have been here several times and although each time the place has been packed, we always had an AMAZING experience. The first time we were on a Food Adventure  (which by the way is HIGHLY recommended as well) and we were treated like royalty with huge samples of amazing food and great drinks and service. We've even gone there on two special occasions, our anniversary and when we announced our engagement to our families, and again we were treated so special. I actually wish I could give them 10 stars out of 5... it's that great for real. Go there and enjoy!
Amazing customer service. Amazing food. Very upscale environment.  I love that you get your receipt in a book. Yes, an ACTUAL BOOK! The place is a bit pricy but it's worth it!

Solid 4...maybe a 4 1/2.  I had the calm chowder for starters.  Now, I've had clamp chowder from Nova Scotia to San Francisco and this was the 1st time I've ever had whole class in the bowl.  It added an extra little something to it.  Really good stuff.Then I had their house pickles.  A little sweet, a little dill and a little spicy and very addicting. For my main course, I had the strip steak, grilled broccoli and loaded potato.  In a word, FANTASTIC!  Cooked perfectly and served on a cutting board.  Really tasty.  If you're in the Arena District, it's worth the short walk.

I have been here a few times, and I really enjoy most everything I have ate and drank. The devilled eggs are quite good, with a tad bit of a bite. One of my more liked entrees is the Hangar steak over kimchee fried rice, it adds a funky flavor profile that lingers nicely.
I loved my meal at the Pearl.  Had brunch with a friend.  We split a cinnamon bun and I had the grits.  I could tell it was all quality.  And the checks in old books, love!

Oh my goodness......where to begin. We had a brunch reservation and waited 15 min for our table (no problem, busy day). Finally, we were seated and ordered a round of drinks. We waited 20 min for our drinks. I ordered eggs over medium (they ended up sunny-side) and sausage, they ran out of sausage so I got bacon. My fellow diners both ordered the omelette special of the day; which included mushrooms, bacon, and gruyÌ¬re cheese. I will include pictures of the omelettes, as they were neat inedible. The mushrooms were not even cooked, and they tasted like cork-- inedible. It was also cold and the eggs tasted pre-made with bacon, and zero cheese. I am a supporter of Cameron Mitchell's restaurants and local Columbus businesses alike; and I am very disappointed. Also, the counter next to my table was dirty and not bused the entire 2 hours we spent here. We told our server about the inedible mushrooms, and she apologized and took it off the bill. Left the restaurant hungry, with no word of apology from at least the manager and I will not return. JalapeÌ±o cornbread is the bomb though
We had a mahi mahi with salsa and sauce. Tasted very bland. The fish was overdone and was also overpriced.

The oysters were pretty great. We got raw, fried and baked. Fried came with collared greens, they just tasted like fried food. Baked was nice, there is a spicy kick to them. The best is raw, to my surprise, they make sure there aren't too many shards of shell, and the presentation is nice. Fried chicken was quite delicious. It comes with four large pieces of fried chicken, perfectly seasoned and moist, and a cinnamon bun which was like dessert and dinner at the same time. Loved it!  Great service to boot!

It was fine.  Yup that's all I got.  I've never been a huge fan of any of the Mitchell's restaurants.  They aren't bad.  But they just don't stand out as anything special.  There's no soul in the food.  It could be made by anyone and it needs heart.If one more person says Cap City is their favorite diner I will freak the f*** out.

De-flippin-lightful! Had 9:15 reservations here last night, and it was most certainly a good choice. As we arrived a little early, we sat at the bar. The bartenders were fantastic! Super knowledgeable and very personable. I really enjoyed my punch...cant remember the name. It had apples and rum and tasted like unicorn glitter and autumn. My partner's manhattan was also very good. We were seated at 9:15 on the dot, and our server was just and friendly as the bartenders. He took time explaining the menu and was upbeat and helpful. We ordered cold oysters, and they along with the house cocktail sauce and the horseradish sauce were amazing! I ordered the fish and chips, which were fantastic. The fish was moist and crispy and not at all soggy or greasy. And the chips were hand cut and yummy. My partner's steak was good, but came out medium-well. When our server came back around to check on us, he saw the steak and recognized that with was overdone without anyone having to say anything. He brought out a new steak and a free dessert. Score!! I will definitely be back! Never thought seafood and comfort food could work, but it definitely does...here at least.

Really cute place ... Great vibe inside and the decor is very cool. Gives you a real feeling of being in a vintage seafood restaurant. You can also view the semi-open kitchen and raw bar. Drinks are awesome, try the Moscow mule which they're famous for or the duke of pearl (comes with a tiny plastic soldier) but watch out for the pepper flakes! The stuffed clams are a must for an appetizer. The crispy melted cheese is to die for and soaking up the juice with a crispy baguette is the cherry on top. Entrees....the hangar steak is delicious and is served with a perfectly done kimchi fried rice, not too spicy but the right amount of kick. The short ribs are also a great choice, completely melty and the port reduction is perfect for the mash. Unique touch at the end of dinner having the check arrive in an old book, with pages full of patrons signatures and notes.

LOVE the food, Love the HH, and Love bartender Brenden! I arrived at the bar around 4:50 and had no idea the happy hour was so amazing! HH runs from 4-6 and includes all drinks, starters, sandwiches, and oysters. They have a really good wine list and the cocktail list is pretty expansive. Brenden patiently answered all of my questions, was very attentive, and made some great suggestions. For starters I had the smoked salmon and it was really good and kind of interesting being served with the deviled egg. The main course consisted of ricotta dumpling and jalapeÌ±o spoon bread. Both were incredibly delicious except I think they could add a bit more kale to the dumplings; the honey and whipped butter was an excellent addition to the spoon bread. I love me some grilled cheese and decided to get it to go. Of course I couldn't leave without getting dessert and dug in to the brown sugar pie which is just as divine as everyone says. I can't wait to come back to try some of their other delicious options.

I went back for burger and beer week and fell in love all over again. Excellent service (this is a CM restaurant, after all) and great prices for the specials. I tried oysters for the first time and WOW--even if you like them raw, you have to try the baked oysters; cheesy, spicy, and absolutely delicious. According to their Instagram, they have happy hour prices on oysters all evening on Thursday, so I'll definitely be back for that!
Great food and wine! Love the atmosphere  Tater tots  and devils on horseback are a must have

I had never been to The Pearl, but after eating dinner there with my boyfriend, I definitely want to go back!  We started with the Jalapeno Corn Spoon Bread, which I would have never ordered if I had been on my own, as I am not a corn bread fan or really into jalapenos.  It was delicious, which caught me completely by surprise.  The jalapenos contrasted with the sweeter taste of the corn bread.  Very easy to share with a couple of people, too - it was a little big for just two to split.  We also tried the Lamb Meatballs snack, which was much smaller as it is just a few meatballs with a sauce and garnish.  These were yummy.  For dinner, I had the braised short rib.  It was very tender; it kept falling apart without any help from a knife.  It comes with mashed potatoes and a few root vegetables, which balance out the rich sauce that the short ribs are covered with.  Very good.  We finished with a slice of their signature fresh pie, which was delicious.  Throughout our meal, the service was impeccable, and we never felt rushed or neglected.  I also liked the dim-lit, cozy vibe of the restaurant.  What initially kept me away from The Pearl was the way traditional menu items are infused with some sort of oddity (like the jalapenos in the corn bread) that made me think I wouldn't enjoy may dishes on the menu.  I couldn't have been more wrong!  Don't get caught up in the details of each dish, just trust that The Pearl knows what they're doing.
Food is amazing here. Everything. That cinnamon sticky bun is life. Can't wait to go back!

Fantastic place for dinner!  Simone was our server and she was awesome!!! We tried so many things!! Lamb meatballs, grilled oysters, the Cuban and The Pub Burger no bun with roasted broccoli.  Amazing!!! The food is so good!! I can't wait to go back and try different food! Our drinks were fantastic! Dirty Martini, North High Oyster stout, and wine! This is our new favorite place! I'm so glad we stopped here!

This place is very very  good. Went there with 7 guys while at a conference. We were all impressed. Started out with some excellent oysters.  The octopus appetizer was unique and tasty. Highly recommended. I had the grilled cheese sandwich and the grilled Brie with the pear jam was an awesome combo.  Others liked the Cuban sandwich, fried chicken and fish and chips. Service was outstanding. Good wine and beer selection and they have a variety of pies for dessert.  I highly recommend this place.

Took the wife to The Pearl for her birthday with the whole family.  First, our waiter was beyond excellent.  Second, the food was very good.  We tried the cornbread (fantastic) and the buffalo wings (good).  I ordered the Pub Burger and it was very good, and very large--couldn't finish it, but took it home and it was almost as good (with my limited ability to reheat) as it was at the restaurant.  Great atmosphere and a fun experience.  That was our first time, but we will definitely go back.

I recently brought my boyfriend here for a birthday brunch with friends. I made a reservation through Open Table for 12:30pm. When we weren't seated until 12:53, I was not a happy customer. What's the point of making a reservation?? The girls at the hostess stand weren't very polite either. My group was just about to go somewhere else when they come over to seat us and from there, things were great! The restaurant is beautiful inside. I love the way the way the servers dressed and gave the restaurant a really classy feel. It gets pretty crowded but they manage the space well.We brought a cake with us for the birthday boy and our server offered to put it in the cooler for us. She was very attentive and friendly. I ordered the huevos rancheros and they were a little bland because I had to get them without the sauce in order to be dairy free but they were still good. My boo got the French toast and he loved it. My other friends got the burgers and they looked really good, too.What really put our visit over the top was when our server brought out The cake with lit candles on it! It was perfect. We had such a great experience and it was mostly because of her excellent service. We will be back and hopefully our experience with the hostess stand will bring them into the 5 star range next time!
I've had mixed experiences here. The cornbread is probably the best thing on the menu but the fish has been very dry twice.

Once you're midway through dinner, you'll realize why you can't get in without reserving. Casual, cozy, the awesomeness of it comes through in the food, and the (finally!) just-right sized menu. Shrimp & grits among the best I've ever had, the short ribs and horseradish potatoes not to be missed. Also: enjoy must-have jalapeno cornbread and believe that the Devils on Horseback are one-of-a-kind (and you get FIVE of them, so how does THAT work??), beer offering good, cocktails better, with the Bulleit Punch hitting the spot.This place will outlast the pretenders on High Street... it's got the real Southern savoir faire.
Eh the food here is hit and miss. Some things are really good something's are just really bland. Service is meh

My mom absolutely loves seafood, so with her coming in for the weekend it seemed like the perfect time to try out The Pearl. And are we glad we did! We were seated right away on a busy Friday night with our reservation. Even though I booked a week beforehand, we were unfortunately placed at a high top table right by the door. I would recommend you request a table toward the back to avoid the hustle and bustle around your meal, as it took away from the awesome ambiance. The restaurant itself isn't the largest, but it has a sultry downtown feel with oceanic decor. My mom and I split the spinach salad, topped with goat cheese, almonds, and a bacon vinaigrette. The ingredients were delicious and fresh, but was overloaded with dressing. For the main course, I ordered the Hanger Steak. They were out of the strip steak used for this dish, so our awesome waitress offered to sub it with the Angus steak instead at no extra cost. Hands down the best steak dish I've had, pineapple marinated and topped with fried egg. Mom got the pub burger, and loved it! She said the cheese was the perfect touch. Overall, great food and service. We will be back!

Couldn't believe I stepped into The Pearl the first time just for their brunch, lol. Overall, their brunch menu is brief but classic. Tried their omelette is of great quality and also has a touch of healthiness. With the warm and welcoming ambiance, this place is really capable of giving you a comfy good-morning day after day.(Maybe it's just me, the moment I walked in this place I had a familiar feeling of Marcella's.)(Btw, their checks are handed to you with an old dog-eared book. I thought this could be a plus haha)

We went there for brunch at 11 on Saturday and had no trouble getting a seat. Our server was very helpful and even allowed me to do half of two dishes. I had a peach bellini and it was solid, lots of champagne. For the meal, I had had of the Tavern Benny and half of the pancakes. The Tavern Benny was awesome, very flavorful and moist. The pancakes, however, were very dense and had too much lemon for my preference. I would order the Tavern Benny again, but definitely not those pancakes.

Great experience all around. We came in tired and hot from a day at the Zoo. We were seated right away and greeted promptly by our server - who was great. We shared peel and eat shrimp. They're gulf shrimp and flown in daily! We also shared the charcuterie  which was mostly good. The chicken liver was out of this world good but the rest was just ok. We then shared the dumplings. They were light and fluffy and flavorful. I thought then wine by the glass list was limited but the cocktail selection was great. They serve their bloody mary's with a miller high life back which was awesome! Great spot!

Cannot go wrong here. Everything on the menu including drinks is well thought out and absolutely delicious. Food done right. I have never had anything to complain about at this restaurant. Some of my go tos are the Moscow mule, oysters on the half shell, the beet salad, pub burger, and fried chicken. I've sampled many other things on the menu as well that are just fantastic. Not to forget the service. Always knowledgeable, friendly, and professional. Continues to be my favorite restaurant.

I really enjoyed our dining experience at the pearl. We ate on a Saturday night and there was a wait if you didn't have a reservation, you can make one online. We started with the jalapeÌ±o cornbread and honey butter for a starter. It came in a cast iron baking dish and was so yummy, not too spicy and just a little sweet. I ordered the fried chicken and my colleague ordered the shrimp & grits. The fried chicken was really good and I love how this dish was served with a sticky bun! I didn't even need to order dessert. I had a bite of my colleague's shrimp and grits and it was really tasty as well. The portions are large and perfect for sharing. Next time I will be back for the cocktails!

This is one of my favorites in Columbus. Been there twice and have never disappointed. It's definitely on the expensive side but completely worth it. The shrimp and grits were amazing, and the spoonbread is definitely a must try. And obviously the oyster are a must try as well.
Amazing atmosphere. Very delicious food. We had oysters, chicken there, and it was so yami. Great service. We liked this place
Great food! Good service.... we were able to get right in without a res by sitting at the oyster bar :)

+ Very good food. Started with the tater tots which were heavy but good. Had the Southern Fried Chicken with the cinnamon bun was delicious, almost like chicken and waffles but you're not left with that sugary coating taste in your mouth. The portions wer

Rustic feeling Cameron Mitchell - still very high end. I got the short rib and my mom got the fish and chips. We started with a salad and oysters. The apps were good. The food seemed to take a while to come out, but was tasty when it finally did come out. The fish and chips was really big and is big enough to share. For dessert we got the brown sugar pie, which is like pecan pie without the pecans. It was good, but not as great as I was anticipating. Overall nice night, but I prefer a lot of the other Cameron Mitchell restaurants.

Devils on Horseback are phenomenal. Chicken Wing starters with hot sauce are also not greasy and delicious. JalapeÌ±o corn spoon bread melts in your mouth. Entree was the grilled cheese. An explosion of delicious cheese and pear jam takes the cake. Also tried the Ricotta Dumplings and the Pub Burger. Absolutely amazing flavors. The oysters are also shucked to perfection! You can't go wrong with anything on this menu. Bet the Snickers pie is just as good. You're gonna have to wheel me out of here.

Wow, guess I don't have the taste for expensive food?? Or maybe people just think it taste better if it cost more and it is served in a fancy atmosphere?My wife had the $90.00 oyster tower on a half shell which she liked, but not worth the money.I had the Cuban sandwich that came with a side of chili, both were awful! I would have rather had White Castle sliders!The service was great, hostess was very nice!All jokes aside, worst Cuban sandwich I have ever had! Thin cheap meat, a few nasty pieces of pulled pork, gooey pickles, yuk! (See picture)

We went here for brunch on a Sunday. Got seated right away.  The menu had a good variety. My Bloody Mary was very good. Even came w/ a mine Miller Light to cleanse your palate. My husband loved his Short Ribs Poutine.  I got the yogurt w/ fruit & granola. It was OK. It primarily just had apples in it. It was a weird combination. I would have preferred strawberries.

I have gone to The Pearl roughly 5 or so times before today and am not sure why I haven't reviewed. Let me just say, that they were a good 4 stars before but skyrocketed to 5 today!We decided to hit this place up for the wife's birthday and I am glad that we did.  Yes, we did have to wait even past our reservation time, but that was no problem with the outstanding service!  Our server Gaby is the best!  She did not hesitate and was on top of everything.  The drinks were wonderful.  The food was even better!  First of all Gaby brought us some apps of spoon bread and deviled eggs.  We were not expecting these but wow! Both were very good.  We then had the smoked salmon and assorted oysters.  The baked oysters were exceptionally good!Also, we happened upon some confit pork that was being served to our next door neighbor table and that was just incredible!  Along with this we also got to chat with Natalie, the executive chef, as well as Ian (regional chef?) who were both really friends and so passionate about the restaurant. I can not recommend this enough.  I don't know if this was just an extra special night, but this was just amazing!

Get there for happy hour! Sandwiches, drinks and appetizers are all half off until 6. Everything we had was delicious! Burger was phenomenal. Our table got all of the starters and shared: highly recommend the tots & spoon bread! The service was absolutely exceptional!!! All the drinks we tried were also impressive. Absolutely amazing spot- excited to come back! LOVE.

Reservations recommended on Weekends. Food menu looks good and makes you want to have more than one item. I tried cornbread with jalapeno which came sort of lacking a lot of JalapeÌ±o and was too sweet for my expectations. Shrimp and frits..as expected! Balanced taste of the herbs on kielbasa with the sauce and shrimps. Beers were average, especially the ones on tap for the night were not impressive. Heavy seas beer on tap was too much citrus... almost like having a bottle of perfume. Ommegang reminded me of juice albeit was very strong for a beer. Overall, I rated this place a 3 stars for freshness of food, great services. Took 2 stars for the cramped space, noise and lack of parking nearby.

Amazing atmosphere. The food is done very well. The service is also great.  I had the Korean style steak and it was tasty. The pork chop is very tender and  juicy. I forgot what appetizers I got but they were all very delicious.

This is the only place I go back to whenever I visit Columbus and it's always been a good experience. Last night's visit was one of the best. Raw oysters, baked oysters, fried oysters all fresh and delicious all the time. Lots of good drinks and appetizers are half off for happy hour. Beet salad, clam chowder soup, deviled eggs, tuna crudo, brown sugar pie: some of the best. Nothing tops their corn bread with honey and spread. It's a must have. We wanted to try the short ribs but had no room left for that. Next time. Don't miss the bloody marrys and the margaritas at the Pearl. Tasty! Service was interesting. Didn't try too hard but did a good job. My boyfriend's birthday dinner was perfect. He loved the food and the server's attitude. Not too overwhelming but there when needed. Thanks Eric.

What a phenomenal restaurant! Visiting Columbus on business and the agency took me here for dinner, racing that it was one of the best. Located in the hip North Shore neighborhood, this restaurant is a classy joint, a fusion of seafood and nice casual steak house. Atmosphere it's classy yet comfortable. Service is great! We started with the Tater Tots, Deviled Eggs, and Bacon Wrapped Dates; all fantastic! The deviled eggs were surprisingly gourmet, the tater tots like none other I've had, and the bacon wrapped goat cheese stuffed dates out of this world with perfectly balanced flavors! I had the special for my entree: Wild Sockeye Salmon with a Wine Butter Sauce, Roasted Tomatoes, and Marscapone Polenta. INCREDIBLE! So decadent, very gourmet. This was honestly one of the best salmon dishes I've ever had! I am also told the Shrimp and Grits and the Cuban Sandwich are tasty favorites. This was a wonderful and filling dining experience!

We ended up going for a late brunch, and things started out great, but then they went a little downhill. The server was great at checking the dishes for a nut allergy, and she seemed attentive, but then one guest didn't receive her drink, for the entrees guests didn't get their orders of tater tots (they were kind of worth the wait, but still...), and then the second round of drinks was pretty terrible. I ordered the Duke of Pearl cocktail first, and it was amazing! So good that others at the table decided to switch their orders for the second round from other cocktails to the Duke of Pearl, and this second round was in no way like the first. Members of the party took sips of my drink, so they had an accurate comparison. The food was decent, but I doubt I'd make a huge effort to return. On the plus side, I'd never been to a restaurant that was so considerate as to provide mouthwash and little cups in the bathroom. Interesting and thoughtful touch!

AMAZING Happy Hour!  We shared 4 snacks/starters between the two of us - PLUS sandwiches and 2 drinks each.  Prices were so good, we spent less than $60!!  Everything was outstanding! Including the service.  This FL girl was seriously impressed!
High class, quiet, and best Oysters I've had in Ohio.

Two words: Cinnamon bun!The greatest cinnamon bun I've ever had in my life! Maybe one of the best taste sensations I've had. Period. Maybe that's an exaggeration, I don't know, but it was pretty damn good.Anyway, I always wanted to check out The Pearl, but it was impossible to get in when it first opened, so I just forgot about. The girlfriend and I didn't have any plans on a Sunday night, so we thought we'd check it out. The restaurant appears big, but the kitchen takes up most of the left half, and most of the dining area is in the back. Our server was really friendly and helpful and really funny. I could have him review each dish for me all day.We started with lamb meatballs and the smoked salmon. The lamb meatballs were amazing, definitely my favorite of the two. I'm not usually a smoked salmon person, but I had no problem eating most of this dish. However, the lamb meatballs were the bigger win for me.For the main course, I went with the fried chicken, which of course came with the best thing ever, the cinnamon bun! I don't even know if they paired well together, because the thing was so good. Put it with spaghetti for all I care. All right, so the fried chicken was fantastic as well. There's so much good fried chicken in this city already, no wonder we're overweight. Oh well, it was super crunchy with tasty seasoning and the chicken was moist and delicious. It also came with some braised greens, but those were pretty forgettable. By the time I was done with this dish, you could wheel me out.Unfortunately, me feeling like shit isn't when I stop eating, especially when I haven't been to a restaurant before, and all of their desserts are pies and sound amazing. No idea what a brown sugar pie was, but we got it, and it was wonderful. Basically they just take a bunch of brown sugar and pack it together in I'm guessing a bunch of other unhealthy oils and butter then shoot homemade whip cream all over it. Fantastic. My new favorite dessert!If you haven't been to The Pearl, I would highly recommend checking it out. It's a little less pricey than other Cameron Mitchell restaurants, but it's serving the same high quality food. They have a brunch that's supposed to be wonderful as well, and you can get the cinnamon rolls on the side. I'll be the one ordering 15 to go.

Well, here it is. This is a review I had been putting off for awhile as I had been avoiding this place. They hype around it rather put me off as happens with many places that are hyped up. I hear people tell me how fantastic everything is. That's great, I am glad to hear but it puts me off as I will go and it will never live up.  Okay, enough of all that. So their brunch was good, the combos they offered all sounded fantastic. I went with poached eggs with sausage, biscuits, and gravy. It was damn good if I am to be honest. I had some oysters too which, again tasty. The bloody mary did live up to the hype so I was excited about that. Probably one of the best bloody marys in town honestly.  Now it begs the question, Is all of that worth the price? I feel it was not. As good as the bloody mary is it was not worth 10$. I had a very excellent bloody mary the weekend before at Ethel and Tank for 5$. E&T also has a bloody mary bar that goes along with it with more selections of vodka. So the bloody mary, good but not ten dollars good. The meal was around 14$ which was fair I feel. The oysters 9$ for 3..... eh not worth it. They put them selfs out as an oyster bar but I have been to posters bars and I got way more oysters for 9$. So that was a little disappointing.  I will go back for sure, try dinner or lunch out. Their fish and chips looked amazing and that is one of my favs. I also saw they had bangers and mash so I want to go back and try that as well. It will though, for the price, not be my new place for bloody marys sadly.
This is one of my favorite places in the short north. The salmon appetizer is amazing. I've never had a bad meal at The Pearl

My parents and I just came here for dinner, and couldn't be more impressed with the food and more importantly the service we received. Colin was one of the most attentive and well-informed servers we've ever had at a restaurant. Any question we had, he answered in such detail. I have no doubt that all of their servers are educated on their menu, but Colin went above and beyond. Recommend him the next time you stop in!

I'm having a grand withdrawal after this place. The Pearl can very well be the highlight of my Columbus visit. Came here during happy hour- had the best Moscow Mule for $5!!!!!! And many orders of oysters- got carried away with $1.50ea price point! Our waitress was incredibly friendly and attentive- thanks Anna (hope I spelled your name correctly).

This place is great!  I came in from out of town to host a dinner for clients.  The 8 of us loved it.  From the duke pearl cocktails, the bacon covered dates, ricotta dumplings, smoked salmon, braised beef, grits, Arctic char, oysters, and lots of wine; we all thoroughly enjoyed.  Great ambiance, great service, and quality foods!  Defiantly be back next time I'm in town.

What a fun spot! Upbeat crowd, extremely courteous staff and deliciously unique food. The drinks were not overly sweet nor strong and our server Mark went above and beyond to make sure we were happy. We all tried the beet salad and loved it. The roast chicken could have had crispier skin but the meat was delicious. We would have tried one of the pies but we wanted to save room for Jenni's ice cream. We will come. Ack next time we're in town!

The Pearl is a perfect mix of upscale and casual. This is my go-to crowd pleaser restaurant, and that strategy has never failed me - not even when my less-adventurous friend ordered a well-done burger. The menu reads like a partial list of Southern picnic items, but the food itself is top-notch comfort. After several visits, I love it all, but my particular favorites include the devils on horseback -- bacon-wrapped dates -- and the molasses pie.The atmosphere is "modern rustic," complete with reclaimed wood, mason jar glasses, and Edison bulbs. They keep the place dimly lit and their servers in plaid, so it all feels like you're dining at an unscale country inn. Service here can be a little slow when it gets busy, but is great overall.

The food was great! The baked oysters and the cornbread was phenomenal! I also ordered the chicken wings and they were great too, the real blue cheese was a great compliment to the wings. The atmosphere is very relaxing, the place is clean and the service is good too. I will be back soon!

We stopped in for drinks before our reservation down the street on a Thursday night. The decor of this restaurant is very cool.  The open garage doors at the front of the restaurant gave it an open air feel. Our server was very knowledgable but the service itself was slow, it seemed to take quite awhile to get drinks. We enjoyed our time but I think it is overpriced. $10 for a basic cocktail is a little too steep for me. I am glad we stopped in to check it out, but it isn't somewhere I see adding to our regular rotation.

For a Cameron Mitchell restaurant in the Short North, The Pearl was a huge disappointment. If you're interested in the experience you could potentially have, keep reading.It was a date night for my girlfriend and I, we had been eyeing The Pearl for months now and were excited to make a special night of it. We had made a reservation in advance and were placed in a terrible table in the corner of the restaurant. Our server at the time had 3 tables, us included. During which we were left unattended for an extended period of time, with drinks and plates empty. Meanwhile the table next to us with a different server was well taken care of. Our server was sometimes on the floor, but never attending to us. We felt she was very disconnected...2 drinks later, one in which we had to ask the assuming manager for...we over heard another table in her section mention our server had forgot their order of oysters, which is especially concerning since this business carries a slogan as an "oyster bar." Food was warm never hot, drinks were especially good thank goodness for that. Otherwise never going back again. With the competition in the Short North, The Pearl better keep up.

Thoroughly enjoyed the evening at The Pearl. Food was excellent, service was great, nice atmosphere. Started with a bucket of shrimp. Cooked just right and perfect for 4. I had baked oysters and a beet salad - all very good and it was my first time trying oysters. Others at the table had steak and fish. All were very happy. Server was very pleasant, helpful and knowledgeable. Did not hurry us even tho we stayed talking well after dessert. Definitely a place I'll go back to. Definitely recommend getting a reservation. It was packed on a Saturday night but not so loud you couldn't hear each other.
A cool and unique spot. I have been for brunch a few times but would love to go back for dinner sometime.

We have been waiting to go to this restaurant for months. Could only get a 8:30 reservation.  Food was terrible. The burger was super salty. Hard to mess up a burger.  Hanger steak was unbearable. It took 5 minutes to chew so I gave it my husband, the food defiantly did not live up to all the hype.

The Pearl has wonderful food and great service!  There are times we'll visit a restaurant and feel like the oldest people there, but the Pearl has a great mix of young and experienced patrons.  The prices aren't bad, especially for the great food you're getting.  I would recommend it to everyone.

Everything looked so good we panicked. The ambiance was great. Carly our server was astounding and patient as we couldn't figure out what to order. Laurie the Assistant General Manager was super sweet. Everyone was professional and the energy was great! As I said. We panicked! We ordered six raw oysters, 12 baked oysters ( in a creole butter ), smoked salmon, and a dressed colossal crab meat ( the crab was SO jumbo and tossed in louie sauce ) and paired it with spicy bloody Mary's. For course over the top we ordered the deviled horse ( dates, cheese and bacon ), ahi tuna, and lamb meat balls. Paired that with a Moscow mule and a cilantro jalapeÌ±o "bevrage".  I would definitely recommend this dining experience and request Carly! Can't wait for our next trip through!
Our server, Sam, went above & beyond to make sure we were happy.  Her attention to detail was impressive.  Promote her to corporate!

The Pearl provided a great dining experience for our diverse group.  We had spent a long day at a sporting event and were eager for some tasty food.  The place was crowded on a Saturday night.  The decor was quirky, yet inviting.  The crowd was eclectic, leaning towards hipster.The food was universally delicious.  Each person in our party was very pleased with their selection.  Two of us ordered the fish and chips.  The fish was crispy, tender and not greasy.  The chips were hot and crisp.The southern fried chicken was a pleasant surprise.  I must admit I was a little skeptical of fried chicken this far north.  My mistake.  The chicken was perfectly fried and light.  The cinnamon roll served as a side was a unique twist and provided a great contrast of sweet and savory.The shrimp and grits were another pleasant surprise.  The shrimp were large and properly cooked, not over or under done.  The sausage and poblano pepper added a nice fiery flavor that complimented the dish without overwhelming the other favors.Finally, the cocktail and beer menu was extensive.  I chose the Pearl oyster stout.  It was a real treat.  Crisp and dry, perhaps the best stout I've ever had.

Who knew that we'd visit this place for the tater tots, but we do. They are indescribable. Get them. Or else. The cornbread is also too good to be true. And the grilled cheese with pear jam? It should be illegal. I want it every waking hour. The energy is neat, and I'd definitely recommend it for a visit from out of town or if you've never been. They also serve the bills in used books, which is just  (so perfect).

The Pearl is one of my favorite seafood restaurants in town, and probably my favorite place to visit if I'm in the mood for shrimp.I've never actually made it to the entree or dessert section of the menu, but I can tell you that the appetizers and seafood is fantastic. The Tavern Fries are warm and thick cut, crispy on the outside and soft inside. I dare you to just eat one. The House Smoked Salmon is also quite good, but nothing to write home about.If you only get one thing, get the Peel & Eat Gulf Shrimp. Just do it. Trust me. They're colossal; full of flavor without tasting too much like the ocean. Divine. Also of note is the Dressed Colossal Blue Crab. At $19 for a small portion, it is on the pricey side, but it is absolutely worth every single bite.The only downside is the wait. I've had a reservation every time I've dined there, and yet I wait an average of 20-30 minute past my reservation time before I am seated. Yes, sometimes I've had stare-downs with the hostesses in an effort to convey my displeasure. No, I'm not proud of it. No, I don't think I was seated any more quickly as a result.

Always enjoy going to the Pearl when we are in Short North. Great food and amazing mixed drinks. Took family there yesterday and the food was phenomenal. Service was above average. Only issue I had was while my 3-year-old was using the bathroom, a picture fell off the wall and hit her. I spoke with the manager whom offered us a slice of dessert. I just told him to get it fixed before someone else gets hit. Stuff happens.

This place is solid!  I didn't realize it was a cameron mitchell restaurant but when I found out it made sense...Great place for brunch; we had 3 dishes with the chicken and waffles being the best (best chicken and waffles I've ever had).  If you get more than 4 mimosas, buy the bottle.  Service was excellent.
This is so good it is unreal.  Not the cheapest but still worth it.  Great service and great food.

When I want oysters and a great cocktail I come to the Pearl.Never had an unpleasant experience.The staff is top-notch service.  The bartenders in particular are knowledgeable and highly skilled.  If I want to impress out-of-towners, I usually come here.Stylish design and layout in a cultured and hip neighborhood/ with an open air- street vibe make this a very desirable space to socialize in warm weather months.  Only detracting factor is the high price point.Highly recommend.

The best waiter I have met! Our flight got rescheduled the last minute, we literally need to go right after we order. He did not only managed to get us all the things we ordered right away (a dozen oysters, half dozen clams with two drinks), and get the check done in seconds. He also took out the cost of clams and even apologized for us not being able to enjoy it (even if it's not his fault at all!). He just made a Terrible day feel so much better with smiles and kindness The oysters are a bit frozen and dry. I guess that's the best you can get in mid-west where transportation from the coast is unavoidable

The pearl is a very nice and classy place to dine with great atmosphere. It was very busy  but the server did a great job of making us feel important and not rushed.I did not enjoy my fish n chips however. It tasted plain and didn't really stand out. Pretty disappointed actually because I would rather eat at long john silvers than their fish n chips. I was able to try the southwestern chicken with the cinnamon roll which was very delicious! I would be ordering that next time I come back.Overall, a very good experience besides the fish n chips. Will be coming back soon!

I went to The Pearl last Saturday with my sister and her friend. We arrived around 12:30 and got seated immediately, which was great because the place seemed busy/full already. We got the spoon bread to share and it was delicious! The outside was crunchy but the inside was so moist. I got the daily omelette, which was yummy and the perfect amount of food for me. My sister got the grilled cheese and she said it was delicious, but who doesn't love brie and jam? Her friend got the sorry rib poutine with a side of house made sausage, which looked very good. We each got a different piece of pie to try, although mine was more of a cake not pie. It was good, but for $6 I would skip it next time. Overall I really enjoyed the meal and would definitely return.

Went for 40th anniversary... Ambiance was nice, tables a bit close together and the service was very good. The waiter made recommendations and was steering us towards the fish. I wish I would have paid attention. I ordered the Fried Chicken and was so disappointed, I could only eat 1 piece out of 4. The flavoring and grease level was off putting and I didn't even eat the leftovers. The side dishes were disjointed; the greens were disgusting and the sweet roll belonged at Cinnabon or dessert. My wife ordered the short ribs which were a bit too fatty but flavorful. They gave us a complimentary piece of pie; about a 1/2 serving for 2 people. Would I go back? With all of the other great choices in the short north, maybe.

My wife and I visited this past weekend for dinner.  We started off with drinks and 1/2 dozen oysters which were fantastic.  We followed them up with the Devils on Horseback which we both enjoyed.  For entrees, I had the trout and my wife had the ricotta dumplings.  The trout was delicious and prepared really well.  The ricotta dumplings were also prepared perfectly, but not something my wife would order again.  The service was top notch and our server did a great job describing every dish and answering all of our questions.Overall, we really enjoyed our visit to The Pearl and we are looking forward to returning.  My only reason for 4 star is because the restaurant was a bit loud.  Other than that, perfect!

This is a nice date place.We tried their...chicken wing confit: good juicy tender chicken wings yummydevils on horseback : the first few were good but then it started to feel greasy charcuterie board: delish, but I think it's quite pricey sausage sampler: there was 1 sausage that tasted funky to me, it was a lot of meat so you can split this among a couple peoplecrispy fried curds: nothing special, not worth ordering unless you LOVE mozzarella sticks in curd formshanger steak: good steak- "kimchee" fried rice was alright crack pie: yum! must order!

If you like fine dinning, this isn't it.  If you like to be seated at the time of your reservation, this isn't it.  If you expect quality to be commensurate with price, this isn't the place.
