The food is good.  That's it.  Just good.  You could probably make most dishes better yourself.  The Oysters are awful compared to many other locations.  Avoid.  They're simply bad.  Most dishes have little to no imagination.  The service is average.  If you're a novice at dining out, it's worth checking out once or twice.  Otherwise this is a terribly average and boring place.

Some of the best food in Columbus...But...We walked in to find our reservation at 7 wasn't ready ok, no biggie. Decided to waited at the bar or as close as we could get to it.  Ordered a drink from a somewhat snobby bartender, who, granted was busy, but acted like I inconvenienced him when ordering two mixed drinks. The food, excellent, price point, fair and the table service was spectacular.  Unfortunate beginning to our evening however it turned out alright.  I will return!

Delicious brunch menu when we went about 2 weeks ago, we had chicken and waffles, the Canadian delight poutine and egg rancheros, all of which was delicious.  Great service and willing to accommodate custom orders as long as it wasn't too off the menu.  The decorations and environment was pleasing and nicely done with lots of lit candles.  We are from the south so we have had better chicken and waffles but it was great for up north.  The deviled eggs our neighbor table looks like they were worth a try.

Went there with a friend for a late lunch.Had a great experience: the jalepenio corn bread will melt on your tongue.. the favor is so different.. Mouth watering taste!I ordered their special which was a seafood pasta was also great.. portions were right for one person except for the corn bread you can share it even though you wouldn't want to! hahaTheir cocktails are amazing, service is fast and efficient!

I was out with colleagues who raved about the Pearl, and so, off we went.  The space itself is pleasant, it reminds me of what a lot of restaurants (especially cool restaurants in big Midwestern cities) look and feel like - see Taste in St. Louis.  The waitstaff wears hipster chic, the check is delivered in a novel (which is filled with doodles), and the waitstaff explains everything on the menu with great gusto, offering diners oodles of information on their own preferences.  The best of what I sampled at the Peal was the ricotta dumplings - the pop of cheese pairs nicely with the squash, kale, and mushrooms.  The grilled cheese was also, much to my surprise, uttelry delightful - melted brie, pear jam, pesto, and roasted squash (it comes with a small salad).  The shrimp and grits was, in my mind, a bit bland for what the dish promised (it comes with a short rib kielbasa, and lots of gouda cheese).

Probably my current favorite Cameron Mitchell (in addition to Hudson 29 and the perennial star, Cap City).  I love everything I've tried, including the deviled eggs, salad with beets, meatballs, fried fish, shrimp and grits, etc.  However, I keep coming back to the stellar grilled cheese.  It is so good.  That pear compote is killer.  And the arugula dressed in vinaigrette nicely balances out the cheese.  If you haven't had it, you need to make a special trip to try it asap!!!!

We weren't given a table until 45 min past our reservation, and then were seated at a high top table in the bar area. No apologies from the hostess staff, and no drinks or apps offered, even when we requested service. Rather poor treatment. Food was good enough, but when the experience starts off on a bad note it's tough to enjoy the night. From reviews on other sites, this appears to be a common problem. Diners beware.

The Pearl never disappoints, unless they're too busy and you have to settle for somewhere else! It just dawned on me that I am yet to leave a review. We stopped in last night near close just for a drink. A waiter assured us that despite the hour we had time for a drink (this is not typical for any restaurant on a Monday night near closing, especially after a long holiday weekend). The bartender also didn't mind, in fact he recommended a drink that took mixing and shaking, not just a simple pour. This stood out to me, I know making complicated drinks can be time consuming and resource intensive, especially if you're trying to prep for the next day, but he made a recommendation and described it so well I couldn't say no. The drink itself was great (bourbon flip?!) Something with apricots. I'd recommend any drink here, even if its not your standard, they have such a neat array of garnishes and ingredients. Anyways, we appreciated the service and expertise of the bar tender. The Pearl never disappoints!
OMG I am love with this place!Best traditional martini ever.Lamb meatballs and beet salad.Leaving happy and healthy.Waiter was superb! Will come back next time in town for sure!

I love the atmosphere of this restaurant. Neat vibe. Cool decor and great food. We ate at a table by the bar. I was put off at first... It was uncomfortable and noisy. Too many people standing at the bar for us to truly enjoy our experience. The food was delicious. I'm obsessed with their beet salad, which I had with shrimp. My fiancÌ© had their steak. Drinks are good, but pricey.

Stayed across the street at le meridian.  Decided to try this ace out as we had previously heard great reviews. We got the jalapeÌ±o spoon bread to start. It was ok. Nothing special. I had the Cuban and my wife had the grilled cheese. While hers was excellent mine was average at best. Atmosphere is good. Beer selection is good but the food itself was not overly impressive.
Having dinner on Easter Sunday with the family.   Food is good as usual.   But they always forget something that we order.  They would get 5 stars if they would remember everything we ordered!

Loved this place!My husband and I made an easy online reservation for our wedding anniversary on a Friday night.  We were so excited to go especially after my husband's aunt and uncle told us of how great of an experience they had when they went there.When we arrived we were given two glasses of champagne, on the house, since it was our anniversary.  We got there just in time for happy hour so all of our drinks and appetizers were half off!!  I had the moscow mule which I loved and the Jalapeno Corn bread with a honey butter for an appetizer was just absolutely delicious.  My husband and I tried oysters for the first time and we had them three ways: rare, baked and fried.  I think fried was my favorite but all was good.  After the oysters and corn bread we were a little full so we order one flank steak to share.  The staff was nice enough to split the meal in half and serve it to us in two separate bowls!  The flank steak came with kimche and it was just divine!  We skipped on desert because we were more than satisfied. I can't remember our waitress name but she was excellent as well.I would say this is definitely a great place for a casual romantic lunch or dinner.  It does have a bar and the day we went the entire restaurant was packed.  The noise wasn't too loud but this probably wouldn't be a good place if you really want a really quiet and private romantic dinner.  Other than that the ambiance of this place with its dim lighting and table candles were great.  I would definitely come back to this place when I am in Columbus next time.  Thank you The Pearl for showing us such a great time for our anniversary!

One of my favorite restaurants in Columbus. The food is always delicious, the drinks are made well, and the crack pie is to die for! Awesome rustic feel inside too. Highly recommend this place for appetizers and happy hour or date night.
Absolutely awesome! Service, Bartender friendly and attentive, Drinks on point along with recommendations. Interior is hip and defiantly would come back
Lack luster customer service at the bar... I wouldn't recommend for a Bloody Mary although they do add a miller high life- which is a classy touch.

Really impressed!What really set it apart was the service. I have a little age on me and it was the best I ever had. I was not a fan of the martini special so poured it in my friends drink (the server saw me do it and gave me a new Saphire Martini on the house). My friend then joked he wanted chicken pot pie (not on the menu) and ordered something else. The chef showed up with chicken pot pie! Again the server was amazing, really liked the setting, and enjoyed the food.

Less than impressed after reading the reviews!? Reserved brunch and on arrival was told to wait while they prepped our table although numerous tables were available. Then they proceeded to seat 4-5 parties ahead of us. Finally seated us at the worst table in the middle of the room versus a booth or along the wall. Pickles were a small dish, not a pot , dates and bacon were gross and greasy and hard, crudo was a mish mash, drinks were slow but house cured salmon and granola were very good. No hurry to go back, Marcellas is a lot better.

I came here the morning before my wedding for a pre-marriage lunch with my Groomsmen and had an awesome experience!  The best advice I can give is if you're coming for brunch on the weekend is to ensure that you call ahead - this place gets PACKED.  Which would me my one negative - even though we had a reservation, we still waited about 15minutes, but oh well, no biggie.The joint has a very unique and urban decor which sets up for a great atmosphere if you're here celebrating as I was.  Each of the staff was also very friendly, nice, and helpful - even guiding me to the bathroom! haha.  We each got mimosas, appropriately, which were fantastic and a little strong - just how I like it.  And, oh man, was the food delish! We each got different brunch plates and everyone was raving.  My favorite had to be my brother's breakfast poutine because, well, poutine for breakfast! Always a good decision.  I had the pancakes and bacon which I also loved.  I would highly recommend this plate as the pancakes had a hint of lemon, which really added a unique and different flavor to the pancakes, elevating them above the normal.Overall, we had an awesome experience that really set such a fun mood before my wedding - The Pear is a fantastic spot to hit and celebrate any wonderful occasion with good friends and good food.  Also, Gordon Ramsay just posted a photo of the burgers here at the Pearl on his Facebook and raved about it - just sayin'!

I came here last Sunday after the Columbus marathon with my VP, her husband and her family a total of 8 of us. I arrived early and got seated at our table and ordered a spicy bloody mary which the server stated was voted the best bloody in Columbus. It was served with a little bottle of Miller like a lot of restaurants serve it in Madison, WI. It was a good bloody. The table ordered the charcuterie board to split and someone ordered the chowder as well. The winner of the board was the chicken liver pate, it was silky and best served on the grilled bread with some house made pickles.I ordered the poutine and while it was good with some good flavor although it needed some salt and pepper as the fries did not have any salt on them. Shredded shortribs were good, two over easy eggs good, I should have asked for them poached that really would have been great. The short rib sauce was a bit runny and lacked depth of flavor. The table then ordered a slice of each pie, the slices were keylime, dutch apple, billionaire brownie and the brown sugar pie aka David Chang's Crack Pie.   My favorite out of the selections was the key lime as it was tart, and the grahm cracker crust was buttery and delicous, however it had a lot of whipped cream as a garnish. Price for me was $31 before tip.

Decided to write 1 more CMR review.  The Pearl is interesting to me, the service is ALWAYS good, it seems authentic and original, and the crowd was fun.  This will seem weird but the burger there is one of the best in the city.  Give it a try The Pearl is worth your time.

My partner, me, and two of our friends decided to try something new Friday (10/29) evening.  Our friends chose The Pearl.  I generally find the restaurants in the Short North a little pretentious and over-priced for my taste, but I was open to checking out somewhere I haven't been before.I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere of The Pearl.  Not too flashy or pretentious.  A good mix of different kinds of people, all there for different reasons.   Although I will say the placement of the bar could be better since the front door seems to get a little congested with bar patrons.We sat down and were offered drinks.  I ordered a Slo Gin fiz, my partner ordered a beer, and my friends ordered two other drinks (I forget what).   Our server came back to the table to deliver drinks, and I was informed that they do not have slo gin anywhere in the place.   So, I took the suggestion of the server and got some other type of gin fiz... which pretty much tasted just like a margarita.... but I like margarita's so I was happy.Three of the four of us ordered the Burger.  My partner and I ordered ours "Medium Well", and one of our friends ordered it "Well Done".   When the burgers arrived, we were hungry and couldn't wait to eat!   I bit into my burger only to realize that it was underdone.   The inside was very pink, and I could taste the blood in my mouth.   The same for my partner's.  Our friend who had ordered the burger "Well Done" had what I would consider to be "Medium Well".   Aside from the burgers being underdone, the burger itself was good.... but just good... nothing to write home about.   The fries were good, though!Our other friend ordered the "Catch of the Day" which was swordfish.  He said it was good, but once again, it wasn't great.Bottom line, I wasn't super impressed.  The bill for the two of us was $50 for two drinks and two burgers.   Frankly, I would have been happier with a couple of burgers from Five Guys, and I would have spent about $30 less.  I will say that the service was pretty good.  Our server was attentive, answered all of our questions, and made suggestions.   I guess I would consider trying it again sometime (and getting something else), but just thinking about the underdone burger turns my stomach a little.  It wasn't awful, but it wasn't great either.  I've had a lot better... especially for the price.

Excellent! We loved every bit of this restaurant. We didn't try to oysters this time but can vouch for the grilled cheese, meatballs and their signature dessert. Will definitely be back. Pass on the fish and chips.

Wow, what a surprise to find such a delicious southern comfort restaurant in Columbus. Great happy hour specials ... Half price drinks, snacks, and starters. Get the deviled eggs and jalepeno spoon corn bread. The fried chicken was flavorful and served with green bean casserole. Service was excellent from start to finish!

Amazing Happy Hour. The pearl has a great weekend brunch, amazing cocktail menu and wine list.  If you stay for dinner you will not be disappointed. Plan to Valet on the weekends, parking can be tough.

This place it pretty great! Quaint trendy atmosphere, great location in the short north, and a quick walk from hotels downtown even if it's cold out. Ordered:Smoked salmon: flavor profile: 3.5/5 , $11 presentation: 3/5 I love smoked salmon, and this is house smoked. It's thick chunk of salmon rather than sliced salmon. The real take back from this dish is the plain white toast that it's served with. With such a nice piece of salmon I would really like to see Texas toast, brioche, or some other type of toast that isn't so plain. Chicken and waffles: flavor profile: 4/5, $18, presentation 4.5/5This is a great trendy dish, everyone really seems to love chicken and waffles now a days. The waffle seemed a bit dry though and lacking a bit of sweetness in the batter. Devils on horseback: flavor profile: 2/5, $8, presentation 2/5Tried something new, this is a traditional german dish, and needless to say I didn't enjoy it one bit. Very, very creamy, I believe it was a type of mayo. I would not recommend this dish to anyone looking to step out of bounds or don't really know what they're getting into. Bloody Mary: flavor profile 4.25/5, presentation 5/5 This bloody is fantastic! House made bloody mix, which everyone can appreciate. It's a little bit thicker of a drink this is why the give you a miller high life pony beer on the side. This was a great compliment to the drink, and not to mention bang for your buck! Love this little place, and would definitely recommend it for someone else.

Great place  in Columbus Ohio.  Wonderful beer, wine and cocktails with a terrific food menu which adds all the elements for a fun dining experience. Natalie Bidinger has created a exquisite dining experience which is a must visit when in Columbus Ohio.

This place is decent but like every other Cameron Mitchell's restaurant, it's a rip-off of some place in NYC or Chicago or LA... This place sort of looks like he went to Maison Premiere in Williamsburg, BK and copied most of the decor. My last brunch there was anything but awesome. My cappuccino was bland and had to ask for an espresso shot to put into it. The server lied and said there was no bread, only biscuits. Cameron Mitchell is such a pain in the ass guest, that he wants his servers to do anything for the guest. Where's the soy milk and toast, Cameron?Other than that, the food and drinks are usually acceptable. I do like the copper mugs for Moscow Mules.

Their manhattan is my favorite in Columbus! Using luxardo cherries, it's awesome. 4 out of 5 stars because they are so hard to get in to starting on Thursdays and through the weekend (if you don't have reservations). The bar space is pretty limited, so if you're like me and just want to pop in for a drink, it's kind of hard. Otherwise, if you can significantly plan ahead- this place is pretty good!

After my visit, I might rename this "The Imitation Pearl." It is not a classic oyster bar in the New York or San Francisco style. In fact, there are only a few seafood dishes on the whole menu.Cameron Mitchell restaurants usually feature a theme that they hope to franchise. The problem is, there is no theme here. It's a nice enough place, but the menu is a mish-mash of dishes from fried chicken to Cuban sandwiches, to pork chops. The seafood offerings are sparse and pricey. 3 tiny clams on the half-shell (the clam meat was the size of your fingernail) are $8 and the New Orleans oysters are no larger and cost $11 for 3. The clams were fresh and tasty but the oysters were a cheesy, salty, oily mess. The peel and eat shrimp were large but dry and kind of bland and a poor value at $17 a half pound.My wife was pleased with her braised short ribs and I agreed that they were delicious.Service, like at all CM joints, was prompt and friendly.The wine list was just the right size (not overwhelming) and well thought out. My Chateau de Campuget Rose at $8 a glass was a fair value and excellent.If you're looking for an oyster bar, this is not the place. If you're OK with a typical American bistro menu in a casual, warm and busy neighborhood venue, then The Pearl may be your gem. It was more like cosmetic jewelry to me.
There is a fun atmosphere here. The food was absolutely great! The service was excellent and great looking, but my two favorite things about the restaurant were the cornbread and the oysters.

As with most Cameron Mitchell restaurants the atmosphere/theme is executed to perfection.  the tavern/oyster bar feel is balanced in a very chic way.  The cocktails are always good and the service is always superb.  Every waiter we've had has always been incredible knowledgeable of the menu and has been an excellent help in deciding what to order.   The Chicken Confit Wings are crisp and tasty.  The Spinach Salad is delicious and is great paired with some of the richer menu items. The grilled cheese is heavenly and flavorful.  The short ribs are tender and absolutely delicious, that meal I was a little distracted as Cameron and his family were sitting at the table next to ours so as any foodie fangirl would do I gawked at him most of the time waiting for another genius restaurant idea to come to life as if he just thinks of them constantly.  I digress. Per usual food, service, and atmosphere are all top notch which I've come to expect from any CM restaurant.

Made reservations and included a note that I was taking my boyfriend out for a special birthday dinner. We arrived very early for our reservation (an hour early), and they said they should be able to get us a table earlier. After waiting 45 minutes, they took us to the worst table in the house, practically in the lobby, surrounded by crowds of people. See the photo. Does this look like a place for a special dinner? Wish we'd gone elsewhere. Update after our meal:I took my boyfriend to The Pearl to celebrate his birthday. It was our first time there, and I made reservations noting that we would be celebrating his birthday. We arrived an hour early for our reservation, figuring we would have a drink at the bar. No such luck, as the bar was packed and people were crammed into the lobby like cattle. The hostess said she would be able to get us in earlier than our reservation. We waited 45 minutes before she took us to the worst table in the house. People were standing elbow to elbow all around the table that was honestly located in the lobby. Does a lobby sound like a good place to have a special dinner? I told the hostess that this was a special birthday dinner and we would rather wait for a better table. We waited until our reservation time and she took us to the 2nd worst table in the house. There was barely enough room to squeeze between tables and our neighbors were 6-8" away. One of our neighbors had piled their coats taking up half of my seat on the booth side, making it very uncomfortable. The booth also had a seam at my seat, so I sat crooked the whole meal. Because of the "crammed in like sardines" table arrangement, the server on our neighbor's table actually placed her butt on my boyfriend's arm several times during the meal. We were utterly disgusted. How can you enjoy a meal with a stranger sitting on you!? She didn't even mention it or apologize, which tells me either she's aloof or it happens all the time. Most disappointing: nobody, from the server to the hostess, even wished my boyfriend a happy birthday. I wasn't expecting cheesy singing or anything, but writing Happy Birthday on the dessert we ordered and paid for, or even just wishing him a happy birthday is the least they could have done. Next time, I will save the $76 I spent on dinner, and instead buy a nice bottle of wine and cook at home or go elsewhere. So utterly disappointed in The Pearl.

Don't come here if you are vegetarian, pretty much everything is meat, with maybe a few fish options. There is one vegetarian option, the grilled cheese, but you better like Brie, Pear Jam, Roasted Squash, and Arugula Pesto if you're going to order that. I got the Arctic Char, basically because I didn't know what else to order (Fish and Chips are typically really greasy), which was good, but I wish they had had more menu options that were meatless (and not super greasy).

Run, don't walk, to the best Happy Hour in Columbus. 4-6p, M-F, half off all snacks, appetizers, and drinks. The Moscow Mule, which I get every time, is boss. I also swear by the cornbread with a warm honeyed-whipped butter, grilled cheese with pear preserves, and the charcuterie. The Pearl has successfully elevated your traditional deviled eggs, and, to state the obvious, offers a generous selection of oysters. I definitely ask the waiter, every time, to steer me in the right direction when ordering the oysters. Do you think I know the difference between east and west coast oysters? Pfft: I don't.The waitstaff at CM restaurants are one of the reasons I love them. The wait staff will bend over backwards for you, and strikes the right balance between being nice and professional.

Stopped in for drinks with girlfriends on a Saturday afternoon. The restaurants wasn't very busy so we were able to snag a table right on the sidewalk. The doors were open so it was fun to sit right on the street and people watch. Drinks were great, I had a Moscow Mule which was delicious. They can also accommodate special requests for the drinks that my friends had. We shared the Devils on horseback and the tater tots and both were great. Can't wait to go back for a full dinner.

I was not impressed. It is 'okay'.... but seems to be more hype than substance.Actually, over the years I get less and less impressed by Cameron Mitchell and his efforts. There are simply too many great restaurants in Columbus to go to 'okay' ones.
The short rib poutine is one of the best dishes I've ever had. Would highly recommend.

I had the clam chowder and smoked salmon with a Manhattan. The clam chowder was nice, but needed an extra dash of salt. The smoked salmon was delicious. We also got the treat of the brown sugar pie. Which was so so good. Had a nice Manhattan to top it all off. Very good meal and service was excellent!

Great little gastropub in downtown Columbus.We arrived on time for our reservation on a Wednesday evening and found the place packed. We waited a few minutes for our table, but were seated relatively quickly.Server was attentive and helpful. Dining companion and I both skipped beer/cocktails, but that may have been a mistake. Drink menus looked excellent.I had the grilled cheese (Mmm... brie), which was phenomenal. Friend had fried chicken, which he raved about.My only complaint is that this place is in Ohio and not all convenient from my Illinois home. :)

The standard at which other CBus Restaurants needs to be held accountable. Octopus Solid, Fried Oysters on bed of collard's Fantastic texture and balance of flavor so. Attic char does not get any better. Server Amanda excellent. If I could send her to LA she would crush all other's in LA restaurant Scene.

I'm not easily impressed when it comes to restaurants and this one absolutely blew me away. The food was perfectly cooked and presented beautifully. The service, however, is what really made me love this place and want to return again and again. I came on a busy Thursday night and we were greeted and seated immediately. Our waiter had a great enthusiastic attitude, was very knowledgable about the menu, and was very attentive to my needs as a customer. Eric, I believe our waiter's name was, offered multiple menu suggestions, one of which was the tater tot appetizer which I praise him for! I didn't know tater tots could be that good. The ambience was perfect for me-- fancy yet not too formal to where I felt I couldn't laugh loud and enjoy myself (which is exactly what I did thanks to a couple of cocktails). The entire staff impressed me and the staff dress code was something I noticed and really enjoyed, everything was visually pleasing. This place is really a hidden gem in the Short North and because of the service, might just be my favorite dinner restaurant! The bathrooms also have listerine in them which is fancy shmancy. I loved my experience and I will definitely be returning.
Great Manhatten & Oysters returned the next day it was so good! Happy Hour! And a full menu.

Had a reservation for 8 people on a Wednesday night during a convention. Very busy and we weren't sat until 15-20 mins after our reservation time. Stood around very cramped bar.Our server was AMAZING! Great recommendations, split food for people sharing dinners, very attentive but not hovering. The Pearl Oyster Stout (exclusive from North High brewing) was one of my favorite beers I've ever had.  Rich and smoky, almost like a nice cigar. Everyone in our party loved their meals (the fried chicken and cinnamon roll, a specialty, looked really good) but my shrimp and grits were just ok. Fairly small shrimp were a little  rubbery and the portion size was small (I wasn't full after eating) but it was pretty good.  101 Beer Kitchens shrimp and grits are much better.Would definitely come back for the Oyster Stout but would probably get the chicken or something else.

Went here for brunch and while passing the oyster bar made a note to come back for these little rascals.  The decor is very interesting but still nice.  They give you your tap water in these big milk bottles which is nice instead of them coming back  forth refilling your glass.We had the devil on horseback appetizer and I swear I could've been happy just eating plate after plate of those yummy things.  Too damn good.  Hubs had a Cuban sandwich as his meal and it was tasty - not authentic - but tasty.  I ordered the fried chicken with greens and cinnamon roll.Greens were good, roll was huge but the chicken was not crispy.  I was told by our server that that is the way the chef prepares it.  Me?  If it's fried chicken then I want it to go crunch when I bite into it.   So I asked for a different entree which was the short ribs over fries.  Hardly any short-ribs but plenty of fries and gravy.  Hubs loved it, I didn't so we traded plates.  Even though both of my plated weren't exactly all that good to me I do want to return and try the oysters...and more of those appetizers.

Meh. Went for brunch with a group of 7. Nice atmosphere, friendly wait staff, coffee was a tad strong for my taste, but then we got the food... Portions are definitely on the small side, which is totally fine, except they're excessively priced. $14 for half a Belgian waffle and a single wing of fried chicken? $14 for "short rib" poutine, which came with three barely noticeable pieces of meat, a few cheese curds, and a load of fries swimming in a soup "gravy". Rest of the table got the $11 omelette of the day, which was OK, but very light on bacon. I certainly wasn't expecting some grand value given the chef's name, but this was a tad ridiculous.Cut the prices 25%, add more substance to the food, and I'd give it another star, but no amount of hipster vibe can justify these prices for average brunch food. Perhaps dinner is better....

Everything was perfect except for one thing...Service was incredible.Wine was excellent.Food preparation, presentation, and taste all very good.The only issue is that the food was not hot. In fact, some of it was cold. I know that waiters can get busy and that this type of thing can happen. So it's not a huge deal.I would recommend this place to a friend.

Went there for happy hour and couldn't have been more pleased. With our oyster shooters and other beverages to start. The lamb meatballs and raw oysters were all very good for a starter. We finished with a Cuban sandwich with black bean stew. All yummy. Our server, Kevin was the best. This is the place in Columbus to visit.

The food here is actually good for Ohio, i would reccomend the great lakes fish and chips but my rating is based on host experience, who lied to me four times, his name starts with a k and ends with an n. Red hair, so I ask the guy if the bar tables were a walk in bar sit down and he says no, yet it's obviously a bar, then I said I would like to sit in a real table then, where he replies that the bar table was the only thing he had available. I didn't mind the first few lies just smiled and said okay we will take that then.  As I look to the back to see a lot of empty spaces he starts saying actually we can sit you back here, so now the situation changed, next he starts excusing himself by saying we like to sit everyone close together for serving purposes, I look in the back and a few people are sitting back there, finally I ask him his name and he said his name was Ted, I asked the waitress for his name, who was fantastic btw, and it didn't match what he said

Had an amazing dinner here! Went to The Pearl after it was highly recommended by many locals we met at the US Senior Golf Open.  We were not disappointed. The Moscow Mule was delicious - one of the best I've had. The Tater Tots were nothing special, would not order them again. The Nawlins Baked Oysters were outstanding!!  They were served with a delicious piece of hot bread. We both had the Shrimp and Grits and thought they were wonderful. Highly recommend this dish. The service was fast, very professional, attentive and friendly. A+ all around. We will definitely return.

My goodness, this place is wonderful.  Hubby and I were in town for an Ohio State game.  We hadn't been to Columbus in 3 years, so we walked around and found Pearl and looked it up on Yelp.  The food, drinks and service was OUTSTANDING.  I ordered the fried chicken, which tasted just like my mother used to make.  Reminded me of my childhood.  It was tasty and juicy.  Came with collards and a sticky bun, which was light and fluffy. Also had the Moscow Mule drink.  The best drink ever.Hubby had a Cuban sandwich and he loved it.  Our waiter was fantastic.  He knew the menu and made recommendations based on my tastes and he was spot on.  Going back for the bruch..  Great restaurant.

Not what I was expecting, too bad!Went to the Pearl for my one night in Columbus. I heard great things and my work colleagues and I decided to go. Service was poor and the food was mediocre. Our appetizer came out after our salads. The devil dates were good, not great. The spinach salads were  bland. I had the short ribs and asked for a different vegetable selection. 30 minutes after we ordered the meal came out - wrong.  The ribs were good. Finally, ordered coffee and Brown Sugar pie. Coffee came within the cream and sugar. Got the cream. Had to flag another waiter to get sugar for my now warm coffee. Slightly saving grace - Brown Sugar pie was delicious. There was no attention to detail. Overall I'd rate the whole experience a B- and would not go back. There are too many restaurants in the area to spend your money: try somewhere else!
Loved it....great food right in the heart of the Short North...Folks were friendly and service was great.  I live in CA but when I come back this weekend I am going here for sure :)

Nice setting. The oysters were delicious. The Bloody Mary good. Then came my eggs with no toast or potatoes. Downhill from there. The best food can be ruined by mediocre service. For the prices charged, I expected excellent service.

Although the food was outstanding, the service left a bad taste in my mouth. We waited about 45 minutes past our reservation, which was originally a 45 minute wait, only to be greeted by further slower service.

Apparently at The Pearl it is frowned upon to stand by the bar drinking overpriced refreshments while waiting to be seated.  So came here with two other couples, while the 3 ladies sat at the bar sipping their $10 cocktails the guys stood near with beer in hand collecting a dirty death stare from the hostess every time she bristled by us. A rather uninviting situation, especially considering we arrived 15 minutes before our reservation and continued to wait for almost another hour until we blew that popsicle stand and found a more welcoming atmosphere - which in the Short North they're a plenty.Bad experience overall; bottomline, don't even waste your time attempting to check out this overly pretentious place. btw - if you order the 3 oysters on a half shell app (yes folks I said 3 as in 1,2,3 - strange when you're used to ordering them by the dozen), sorry I digress, so when you get the 1,2,3 oysters for a mere $8 and at that price expect to find a 'real pearl' in those oysters... prepare to be disappointed!!
The seafood tower was impressive and the Manhattan's addictive pair that with the trendy hipster atmosphere and it made for a great fun evening.

Many of Cameron Mitchell's restaurants have happy hour deals, but I think happy hour at The Pearl is my favorite. The selection isn't as extensive as Marcella's, but I think that the options you get are the best. My roomie and I stopped by around 4:30pm on a Friday and managed to snag a tall bar area table by the window, and we sampled the following items: 1) Ramos gin fizz cocktail - I love refreshing citrusy drinks that aren't too sweet, and this fits the bill. It has egg whites in it which give it a cool foamy texture, and it was perfectly balanced.2) Moscow mule cocktail - roomie's drink, pretty standard but really great. Moscow mule is one of my favorite relatively standard cocktails, and this was one of the better ones that I've had.3) Jalapeno corn spoon bread - so. crazy. Get this. Sounds standard, I dunno what they do but it's incredibly addictive. The jalapeno gives it extra oomph but it's not spicy at all if you're worried.4) Chicken wing confit - standard but maybe not my favorite, they're just chicken wings that have been fried. The texture is actually a little tougher than what I hope for, the happy hour wings at Harrison's are better. 5) Baked oysters - these are a steal and taste amazing, I really wish that I had ordered more but I was getting full and we were planning to eat elsewhere later.Overall, wonderful meal and the place is just so pretty. One minor mishap is that we had added the pork belly taco but I think the server forgot and didn't put the order in, then kept checking in on us cause we were lingering for awhile waiting for it, but the service was good otherwise. These's a few other items on the happy hour menu like those tacos that I'd like to return for and I'd even be interested in coming back for the regular menu, so I'll be back.
AMAZING! Do yourself a favor and get the smoked salmon and charcuterie board, good heavens! SO TASTY! My husband and I can't get enough, plus great cocktails! A++

I've been waiting to try The Pearl for a while now. We went here on a Sunday night pretty early, around 6 or 6:30. I wasn't sure how busy this place was on Sundays but can tell you from walking around the Short North - it's PACKED on Friday and Saturday. Ends up we definitely did not need a reservation, traffic picked up a little but not really until we were finished eating.Our server was perfect! Very friendly but not overbearing. He helped me pick out a nice Pino Noir based off of what I usually like. It was absolutely delicious.We decided to try the small plate of Lamb Meat Balls. The lamb was great and the marinara was very fresh. There was a cream sauce too, not sure what it was, but it was zesty and I couldn't get enough! We also decided to get the Smoked Salmon app. This came with a couple pieces of toast, (didn't do much for me) and a devil-ish-ly good egg. I thought the salmon was very good and the nice smokey flavor that wasn't over powered by the tarter sauce that was on top. Once our server rattled off the special I decided immediately that's what I would get. The special was an Amberjack filet with a side of tomatoes, fingerling potatoes, zucchini, yellow squash and an olive tapenade. The flavors were really good and clean. This was a very light dish - thank god! The only thing I question is the Amberjack. I haven't had this type of fish before so maybe this is normal? Most of the filet was very light and fell right apart but there were a few bites that were tough and fatty.  I'll have do some research on this, but I can say I didn't enjoy those (very few) bites. For desert you have one choice.... pies! Looking at the choices I decided the Brown Sugar pie sounded the most interesting. This is now my official new favorite desert. This pie was sooo freaking good!!! It's not too sweet and had amazing flavor and texture. I'm sure the rest of the pies are just as good but if you want something different you cannot go wrong with this! I will definitely be back and can't wait to try some of the other dishes on the menu!

I love the Pearl. Dinner food is great, I yearn to try their brunch, but I'm going to focus on their happy hour.Half off all apps and shareables, half off [basically] all drinks. Wow. The house made tater tots, jalapeno corn bread, and the meatballs. All so good. I wish I had time to go for happy hour every night. And the service is always excellent, not pretentious.Have continued and will continue to go back.

Best restaurant in Columbus!  Favorite dishes include: deviled eggs, tuna, beet salad, oysters, flank steak with kimchi and the cornbread.  The drinks are great too--especially the Bloody Mary.  The only things I haven't enjoyed are the poutine and the burger but everything else has been excellent.  Pearl has a happy hour during the week which is really good value too!I still love this place but went for brunch today and it was a bit inconsistent from the last 4 or so times we've been.  The hangar steak was good but the rice/kimchi were a bit greasy not crispy/flavorful like usual.  The stuffed French toast which is usually oozing with deliciousness left a bit to be desired and the poached eggs were not properly done.  Also, the serving platters for the deviled eggs have rust on them which I'm fairly certain is not healthy to ingest.

I came to Columbus to visit my sister who goes to Ohio State. This was actually my first time in Ohio period. I came to the pearl to visit my sister (who works as a host there) and was blown away by their food and drinks. The exec. Chef brought over a few snacks to start, I don't know the name but you need to order it. (Chicken wing dish and stuffed dates dish) AMAZING! Then I had a half dozen oysters and being that Ohio is not very close to the ocean, I was questioning the freshness...they were actually better than the oysters I've had in Southern California! For my main dish, I absolutely loved the short rib poutine (not sure if I spelled it right). As for libations...the Manhattan and their bloody Mary's are top notch. I will be in Columbus for 5 days and need to go back to try more of their menu! ITS THAT GOOD!

After my first visit to The Pearl, all I could think of was how GOOD everything was. I started with a Moscow Mule that was served in a proper mule mug with amazing crushed ice. So refreshing, make is a second please.The decor is cool, we were trying to decide where its inspiration came from. We settled on a sort of old western speakeasy fusion which doesn't make much sense now that I type it out. Food. Devils on Horseback. Yum. I still can't remember exactly what these are, but they were delicious. The pot of pickles is literally just what it says, a bowl full of tasty pickles, and exactly what I was looking for. Shrimp & Grits, also yum. These were unlike any shrimp and grits I have ever had; it was more like a stew than anything. Still, wow, with the kick of the peppers and the unique addition of short ribs, everything came together to form a fantastic dish. Service: good and friendly. A little slow. I think this was on purpose. The Pearl seems like a place where no one is in a hurry and you are encouraged to relax. The check came out in a unique manner (won't ruin it for you) and we had fun counting the number of lewd drawings on said medium.

This was my husband's choice for his birthday dinner; he had been before but I hadn't.  It's very pretty and I was impressed they seated us 30 min. earlier than our reserved time.  Good thing, since the bar was full.  We had a cozy corner in the back and a great server.  We each had a cocktail and the deviled eggs appetizer.  Very good.  We both chose that evening's special, which was a red snapper entree with squash.  We both loved it.  The fish and vegetables were perfectly cooked and seasoned.  We had beer and wine with our dinner as well.  We did not do dessert since we were pretty full.  It was a really nice experience and I would probably return.

Second time here and I was impressed.  Came around 7 and there was about a 30 min wait for a table, but there were open seats at the bar so we grabbed those.  We started off with the Jalapeno Corn Bread, which had a really nice balance of textures, and the honey and whipped butter that comes with it are perfect.  For my entree I had their Catch of the Day, which ended up being a Thai curry stew with shrimp, scallops, mussels, clams, and some other kind of fish (I blanked when the waiter explained...oops).  It was a lot of food and kinda pricey at $30, but it was so good I didn't care.  The dish had subtle Thai flavors and a nice spicy kick that didn't overwhelm the dish.  Gotta say I was very happy with it.  For dessert we split their Peach and Strawberry Cobbler and added a scoop of Graeter's ice cream to further indulge.  Praise, this dish was heaven.  The crumbly crust on this pie was to die for and the fruit inside were fresh and tasty.  Oh and that ice cream...whole nother level.  Drink menu is also pretty good here if you're into that.  They offer valet parking for $8, but there are also plenty of meters in the area.  Cool place.

Visited this place on a sunday around noon for brunch,  ordered the jalapeÌ±o cornbread ( it's not spicy at all) and also the short ribs, also got the amazing french toast .... This place has great service, food comes out fast and very good quality! Perfect brunch place in Columbus ! Defiantly try the Moscow Mule ! Yumm
Awesome Braised Short Ribs. So tender and melts in the mouth. Also recommended the Hangar Steak. Don't get the dessert pies, avoid the Brown Sugar Pie. My group's pie experience wasn't great.

Split the tartar tots , deviled eggs and Cuban sandwich.  All were very tasty but the tots win hands down. You get a ton and the dipping sauce is terrific.  We had reservations for an early 530 on a Saturday.  Arrived at 450, snagged two seats at the bar and gave our reservation to another.  Bartender was great. Merlot hit the spot. Ambiance rocked.  No wonder everyone is a fan.

This is probably my least favorite restaurant so far down town first off my sister wanted to come here for her birthday so we made a reservation which they got us in pretty quickly. But after that everything want down hill from there not only did it take almost an hour to get our food to our table; but they also messed up on my sisters salad which then took another 25 mins for them to try and fix it. Usually when you are seated at a table; your waiter is suppose to come back and check up on you to make sure everything was ok but that didn't really happen period cause he only come back twice.The worst part was when after we got up from our table we saw him taking a shot with two other male clients that had him as their waiter. If your going to work in the restaurant business do what your suppose to do and don't take any offered shots by any of the customers when your on the clock. But overall I won't be coming back.

We were in town to visit friends and go to a show at the Ohio Theater. We went to The Pearl. It is in a good location and is a nice space. I thought the food was good but not exceptional. The craft beer selection is very good. Our server was friendly and helpful answering our questions. The appetizers were not very good. The jalapeno corn bread did not have much kick at all. I am not sure there were any jalapenos in it. The sausage sampler was just ok. The entrees were better. The ladies split shrimp and grits and the chicken that came with a cinnamon role. They both enjoyed their meals. I had the short ribs. I thought they were good but not memorable in any way. I would try other places before coming back to The Pearl.

My love and i decided to try this restaurant out for our new years celebration. The atmosphere in here was lovely.  Being foodies We ordered a sampling of many things.  The lamb meat balls were so moist and fabulous.  We ordered the deviled eggs and although the flavor was not necessarily anything unique the delightful way they were displayed was a whimsical addition to our dining experience.  The smoked salmon was perfectly flaky, tasty and served with toast and another egg. The parmisan oysters were a little gritty but not enough to over cast the rich flavor.  As my partner bit into the jalapeÌ±o bread she gasped how moist the bread was and she delighted in the honey butter served with it.  I even had a small bite (i am not able to eat spicy food) and found it not to be hot but sweet and delicious. Our meat platter arrived with mutiple meats, cavier, pate and pickles. I personally loved the chicken pate jelly and had a hard time not eating it all and stealing it from my partner.  The mustard caviar was my least fave on the board but my partner enjoyed it. Our entrees consisted of grlled cheese, which was fabulous with a hint of a sweet texture and served with a light dressed arugula. Riccota dumplings in a tasty sauce and fish and chips.  The dumplings had a nice textile to them and although they could used an option to add some kind of meat, if you wanted, were flavorful.  The fries on the fish and chips tasted old and over warmed, but the server mark offered to have new made.  As i declined he removed them from the bill.  The fish is definately the star of this meal.  It's flavor was crunchy and light, moist and perfect. The Cole slaw was fresh and the house made hot sauce was my partners favorite. Finally we tried some of the restaurants pies. Our server brought out the strawberry chocolate pie for us to share. The dark chocolate mixed with the light and delicious filling was Devine accompanied by the strawberry.  We took home the Elvis, which is more of a custard whip than a pie, but the filing is not over powering and the pie was perfectly sweet without a sugar coma taste.  My partner had the dutch apple and deemed it very good. The service was perfect.  Our server made sure our silverware was changed at each course and everything was at a perfect pace.
We always sit at the bar- always great service. Love the atmosphere of this place.Would recommend the jalapeÌ±o cornbread and the pumpkin pie. You can tell it was homemade and it was amazing.

Typical Cameron Mitchell.  Everything is tight and perfect.  Here's the rub.  It was lunch time and I asked if they served 6oz beer portions instead of the usual 12 oz.  Many places around town are doing this now and it is really nice to have this option.  Server said "no problem" in true Cameron Mitchell style.  No issues, he can do my request.He served my beer in a 12oz glass, filled to the half mark.  Okay, he delivered as he said he would and they didn't have a proper glass.  The bill comes and he charges me the full $7 price.  Bummer for him and bummer for Cameron Mitchell.  He should have told me up front, but he slips the price in at the end.  Bad form.  Corporate Cameron should bring this up at their next meeting.

So, this review is based on 2 visits. I have to start by saying that both visits delivered excellent service staff who made great recommendations. The first visit also brought with it amazing raw oysters. However, the raw oysters during my second visit looked like they had been handled by an inexperienced shucker. They were mangled and shriveled in their shells and the water was dumped out. Two of the biggest violations when serving raw oysters! That said, the experiences overall have been really great, but I hope they take some time to make sure each of the relevant staff members is appropriately trained in shucking and serving raw oysters.
Service is on point every time. The Moscow Mules are the best I have ever had. Same with the deviled eggs!

I was impressed by the nice selection of drinks here.  Cocktail menu could be flushed out a little more.  I recommend ordering the punch.  The vibes were pretty good at the Pearl, just needed a more interesting playlist.  DÌ©cor was nice, bathrooms were very clean.  As far as customer service and attention to detail, I felt that we got great service.  Could have been a bit more personal,  but it was fine.  My only suggestions for improvement would be to change the lighting scheme (the yellow was overpowering).

SUCCULENT!!!  Wow!! Start with a Bloody (best in town) served as it should be with a little Miller.  Oysters on the half shell from three different regions offered at a fantastic price. We had the Benny, aka biscuits and gravy and the huevos rancheros and they were so tasty (it ended WAY too quick).  Ask for Gabby or Easy for an added wonderful experience!! See you next Sunday (and every next Sunday)!!!!!!

While in Columbus on business, we came here last night for dinner.  Even with a reservation, it took the restaurant over 45 minutes to seat us.  Apparently, they were running really behind.Our server (can't remember his name) was very friendly and attentive and gave some great suggestions on food.  I was between the Fried Chicken and the burger, and he suggested the burger all the way.  I also ordered a Moscow Mule for the first time.The other ladies at the table ordered the following: clam chowder and spinach salad, another burger, the dumplings, the fried chicken, and some curds to start.The curds were ok, but I think it was because I really wasn't in the mood for those.Didn't get to try any of the other items, but my burger was good and the fries were yummy.  The only issue I had was the cheese that came with the burger(not a big brie or gorgonzola cheese fan).  I did however, order my burger with bacon!I was already full so I didn't order any dessert, but some of the other gals ordered the strawberry pie, the pecan pie and the brown sugar butter pie.  And of course I did try those.  My fav was the brown sugar butter pie.  It was AMAZING.  If I were to come back it would be for that!Overall, ok.  If they are running behind on reservations and you are hungry, try sitting at the bar or finding another spot to eat cause you may be waiting a while like we did. :-(

We went to the Pearl twice while we were in Columbus. The first time we went with a group for drinks and sat in the couches in the front. My husband and I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich to share. It was very sweet but the salad it was served with balanced the sweetness. We returned for brunch on Sunday and the place was packed. We shared the spoon bread, which came with butter and honey. I ordered a house salad and the waiting staff forgot to bring the dressing until we were finished eating. My husband ordered the Cuban sandwich (because he can't get enough of that in Miami). He said it was outstanding and he only ate half so there was a second half for the plane ride home.The service is pretty good and very friendly. It's worth checking out if you are in the area.
we love this place and make it a point to go to everytime we come to columbusGreat people, amazing food and out standing atmosphere!!
Made a reservation at "The Pearl" for a group of 6 then the next day the restaurant canceled it by sending an email. Sounds like poor management to me!

Oh, a must visit in Cbus. In typical Cameron Mitchell fashion, you'll find stellar service and fantastic food.Many great menu choices. Love the deviled eggs, fried chicken, fish and chips. Save room for dessert--it's worth it.

Perhaps the Pearl had an off night but I've been sitting here in my hotel room for the past hour deciding whether or not to give 1 or 2 stars.  Honestly one of the worse experiences in 30 years and I travel the world.  I also had a client with me and 2 colleagues and they were also disgusted.  Keep in mind 2 live here.  I live by the ocean in Charleston and my client lives in Washington, DC.  She loves seafood...1.  600pm reservation and they couldn't find it even though I showed them the confirmation email.2. Requested a table for leg space in a quiet area and we were seated in a booth.  Absolutely cramped.3. Appetizers ordered 2 orders of baked oysters, 2 orders of baked clams, 6 raw clams and 6 raw Blue Points. VOMIT!  Long story short all of it was sent back.  Why?  Shells and dirt in the food and after sending 2 pieces back for being bad the new pieces they brought were puke bad. I still have the taste in my mouth.  Why would I ever think a restaurant in Columbus can serve shell fish, especially raw.  Waiter said they threw away all the clams and oysters that were in the case and opened up new bags.  HELLO.  Nasty nasty nasty. BTW.  Blue Points this time of year are twice the size so your distributor is selling you the "b or c" rated oysters.  Hire someone who can buy good seafood. 4. Dirty martini came not dirty and served in a margarita glass. LOL  I'm not kidding.  Ordered 2 draft beers and they were good because it masked the bad taste in my mouth.  Beer was a little warm. 5. Entry 1 fish and chips - wasn't finished by guest 1 and didn't want doggy bad.  Can you say greasy greasy greasy. Also they should serve thicker filets. Entry 2 shrimp and grits!  LOL! Spending the past 20 years in Atlanta and Charleston please take this off your menu. Where's the beef....I mean grits!!!  At least the shrimp were cleaned correctly.  Entry 3 short ribs - or I mean fatty ribs.  Good Lord where is the meat!  Sorry but they were appetizer portion and full of fat.  Entry 4 - steak but where is the beef.  Crazy!!!6. Service C+ but he tried and we felt bad for him because all he did was apologize all night.  Not his fault and he did get all appetizers taken off the bill but he was a bit clueless. Maybe he was new. Perhaps a 4 star restaurant in Columbus but wouldn't last 3 months in Atlanta or Charleston. For those of you that have posted 5 stars please get out more often.  This is a 1-2 star restaurant on a good day. Can't believe I still paid almost $200!!!  Glad I'm going home in the morning!!!

My favorite spot to visit when I'm in Columbus.  The jalapeÌ±o cornbread and hanger steak with kimchi fried rice are both amazing.They have a great selection of drinks and a great atmosphere.  Definitely interested in the oysters the next time I'm in town.

Dining at the Pearl feels like popping into a (fancy) pub in New England. The decor is clean and modern but rustic- think dark wood contrasted with subway tile. The servers plaid shirts are cheesy but effective (and honestly I've had worse work uniforms). We have never received less than stellar service.The drinks menu features a fun mix of classics and original concoctions. I am a dedicated consumer so I've tried lots of them. #hero. When we go here, we always start with a platter of half dozen oysters, no matter what. I have yet to have a bad oyster here- they've always been fresh, briny, and delicious. What's more, I appreciate the staff's expertise in the oysters. They are always able to describe the tastes and textures of each enjoyable little mollusk. For a main, sometimes I will get one or two of the appetizer/small plate situation- I love the deviled eggs and the jar of pickles, and I've tried almost all the salads, and have yet to be disappointed. I've also ordered off the traditional menu and have loved the chicken and waffles, the steak, the burger, and whatever cuts of fish they are serving at the moment. Despite the fact that it's always busy here, the staff is pleasant and professional. I've had good luck with large-ish groups as well as popping in unannounced with a friend for Happy Hour (which by the way is great).If you haven't tried the Pearl yet, please go. Get a couple of oysters. Grow up, they're delicious.

BRUNCH! was freakin amazing. Service was top notch, atmosphere comfortable, food was spectacular. I ordered the Tavern Bentley and my hubby ordered the chicken and waffles. We shared the stuffed french toast, which I highly highly recommend!!! Hubby said the Bloody Mary was the best he's ever had. If I wasn't pregnant I would have gotten one myself! Best meal I've had in a long time! :)
It's average at best. There aren't many choices of food. The oysters are fresh and delicious but there aren't many options. The service took forever. Won't come back.

Amazing happy hour and cool atmosphere...I have tried many places in the Short North, but The Pearl is one of my favorites. My friend and I hit up happy hour for the cheese curds, gourmet grilled cheese, and oysters washed down with a few house beers. I also celebrated a birthday there. The service was great and they brought a piece of pecan pie on the house. The atmosphere makes for an exquisite experience - trendy, cool vibes, vintage furnishings, high tables and bar stools, and top-notch bar.Hands down, The Pearl gets it right!
Great Happy Hour, so-so brunch.

A great place to eat in the Short North. It is a pretty busy place, so booking a table on Open Table is worth the time.The food and service were great. Even my colleagues who prefer simple/no fuss dining loved the place.

This was the first time that my date and I have been to this restaurant. Absolutely delicious!! We ordered the Parmesan Baked Clams to start. Utterly delectable. They were gone in seconds!  We also ordered cocktails (Moscow Mule and a raspberry drink).  The Moscow Mule was recommended by the waiter and it was very good.We ordered Today's Catch (salmon) and the Arctic Char. Both dishes were well-prepared.  They each had a crispy outer layer, which made the fish taste so delicious!All in all, the food was amazing. We would both recommended this place to our family and friends.  And, we would definitely come back again.

The decor here is absolutely beautiful and sophisticated. Thank goodness for happy hour so a poor grad student like me can afford to eat here. I started out with a moscow mule, which kinda just tasted like lemonade with a tiny hint of vodka. I think it has either too much ginger beer or has been diluted down with water. My friends had their IPAs, which they were happy with.I got a few orders of oysters, baked and raw ($3 for 2 oysters). The baked one was seasoned with different cheese and was crispy and good, but the oysters looked smaller than the ones they serve raw for some reason. The raw oysters come with 2 types of sauce and lemon. I enjoyed the raw ones more, but that's because it just tasted less fatty and fresher. The pork belly taco was good. I asked for some hot sauce and that went superbly with it. My couple of my friends ordered the chi town dogs which looked really good and filling. For the same price, they also had smoked salmon, which I got to sample - tasted ok. I also sampled the nuts & kettle corn, which tasted like ordinary honey roasted nuts and kettle popcorn - nothing special.Overall, my bill was about $18 and i wasn't entirely satisfied. I would say I get a better happy hour value at marcella's but I'd come back here for the oysters.Oh! A nice touch at the end was each of our bills were given in hardcover books. This is the first place I've seen doing this. It gives a very nice touch.

Loved it starred off with the calm chowder some of the best chowder have and I've lived in boston.....next I had the bacon and parmesan cheese crusted clams had a little to strong of the parmesan but we're superb none the less and left me wanting more and the  I had the braised short rib and it was so tender you could smash it against the plate,I can not say enough about that short rib it was juicy and the flavors works so well with each other,all in all I am in love with the Pearl and is definitely a new favorite spot of mine.
One of my go to restaurent! Located in the heart of Short North. I love the cool and modern diner look of the place.

I joined a friend for dinner here recently and had a great time.The downside: The bar is small and packed. If you plan to have dinner, you need a reservation well in advance and even if you show up on time, it is likely you will have to wait up to 30 minutes for your table to be ready.The upside: The atmosphere is great, the menu has something for everyone. If you are a raw bar person, they have a great selection and every one of them is delish. If you aren't a raw bar person, they have a killer burger and fries and also a yummy Brie grilled cheese. You should try:The moscow mule (it comes in a copper mug - vodka and ginger beer with mint)The oysters (some of every kind)The Pimms punch (comes in a mason jar - cranberries galore - pretty and sweet)The grilled cheese (Brie brie brie - oh yum)The desserts (The cobbler is TDF)Once you are seated the dining room is great. We had a booth in the back and sat and talked for hours. The bill came and I was like.. That's all? I was thinking it was going to be  ALOT MORE.They were slow on the dessert and to make up for that, they didn't add it to the bill... so that was really nice as well.They offer valet at $6

Finally stopped into The Pearl one busy Saturday night with Bryant M. It was as excellent as everyone I've spoken with says.We sat at the kitchen/oyster bar (what do you call that bar by the kitchen?) and it was so low-key compared to the crush of people just a wall away. It took a little bit of time to get menus but hey, busy Saturday night, we get it. After our orders were taken, everything came out quickly.And everything was really tasty. The devils on horseback are a must-try if you like bacon; the sausage sampler was good. I got a bourbon and apple punch that I wish had been just a tiny bit sweeter, but it was also (surprise!) really good. Service was excellent, too. I love how they leave water with you so that you don't have to try to flag down a server for a refill. I drink water like ... like something that drinks a lot of water, idk. I drink a lot of water. It was nice to have it. And the check comes in an actual book! Being a book blogger that tickled me--though they should consider pasting in some library card holders for credit cards (if they haven't already, I didn't look that closely, I admit), as mine fell out and almost skittered into the kitchen.Looking forward to taking my husband here on a date.

Came here for happy hour with a few friends. The food itself had some up and down points, but their service could use a bit of work. We had one order (pork belly taco) not show up for almost an hour (whilst everything else came out within 20 minutes), and we also had an order of oysters just completely go missing. Both those orders were refunded/comped, but our waitress didn't seem particularly concerned about the fact that food was simply going missing. Also, since we were seated near the window that lets you look into the kitchen, we had the pleasure of seeing someone drop an entire case of oysters onto the floor. That definitely doesn't leave a good impression... Now, onto actual food: Oysters - We tried the mild, salty, and sweet oysters. The mild and sweet were not bad, but the salty oysters were pretty small and not really even worth the happy hour price. Also, whoever is shucking the oysters needs a lesson in how to do it properly, because we kept getting oyster pieces in our mouths.Jalapeno Corn Spoon Bread - One of the few dishes I'm actually glad I ordered. The whipped butter and honey really nicely compliments the cornbread, which was warm and fluffy but not too flavored. House Smoked Salmon - Definitely regret getting this. Perhaps a misunderstanding on our part, but when we read "smoked salmon," we were expecting the type of smoked salmon you get on bagels, not a giant chunk of salmon smoked on a grill. The portion size was generous, but the dish itself was still not really worth getting. Pork Belly Taco - Whatever they were trying to do, it was not "korean style BBQ" as far as I, an Asian person who spent 5 years roaming LA's Koreatown, am concerned. The sauce was also pretty underwhelming, but (as with the salmon) I do give them credit for giving a good size portion of meat. Chicken Wing Confit - Literally just chicken wings that may or may not have had a tiny bit of spiciness? Not bad wings, but not worth $4 for 4 wings... Short Rib Sloppy Joe - Pretty much what you'd expect. The poppy seed bun was very tasty, but nothing else really stood out. Overall, not necessarily disappointed in the experience, but not very impressed either.

Wow! Beet salad - creative, delicious, no greens but included apples and Cashews - pretty interesting Lamb Shank - moist, perfectly paired with unusual mustard mashed potatoes, couldn't place the herbs - loved itDessert - some brown sugar pie concoction with a caramel like substance made from maple syrup - fucking incredible

Been to the Pearl a few times and can't really fault it!  Great beers and cocktails, interesting menu with tasty twist to each dish, and really good service too.  Yet to try anything I haven't liked off the menu but Oysters are delicious (as expected), as is the cornbread, hangar steak, and the short rib.  Ive walked in and been seated pretty quickly a couple of times but would definitely recommend booking ahead if you can as space is a bit restricted and not ideal having to loiter at the front when it's busy.  Will definitely go back again. And again.

We thoroughly enjoyed all of our meals here! Started off with appetizers of smoked salmon, deviled eggs, and lamb meatballs....all of which were superb!! Dinner consisted of braised short ribs which was super tender, with horseradish mashed potatoes and julienned vegetables-oh so good! Another dish of the steak, which is citrus marinated and cooked perfectly medium rare with kimchi rice and side of veggies-super delectable! From the looks of another patrons dinner of roasted chicken it looked fresh and moist and perfectly plated. For drinks, we had the famous Moscow mules and they were tasty! Highly recommend this place and to make reservations. We used open table and that worked great for us!

I highly recommend brunch at The Pearl. Their Bloody Mary's and other brunch cocktails are amazing. We had the Huevos Rancheros and Short Rib Poutine, and both were very good. This restaurant is on the slightly pricier side, but between the atmosphere and service (not to mention a great view of High St at the tables by the front windows), it's definitely worth it.

Had a wonderful meal with my family celebrating my wife's birthday. Then all hell broke lose with the crappy valet service. While other patrons came out and got there vehicles within 5minutes, we waited nearly an hour only to find out that our keys were still in the stand!! The head guy kept lying and saying there was a backup in the parking garage.  My ass!!!!! Enjoy the Pearl, but park yourself!!!!

There is no doubt that the pearl is a great dining establishment. On our last visit there, several service mistakes were made and all were promptly rectified without our asking. We ended up with three rounds of free drinks due to errors made by the waiter and hostess. Being  at a Cameron Mitchell restaurant, we knew we would leave satisfied even though the beginning of our night started off rocky. We went on national oyster day and needless to say the pearl was packed. They struggled to keep up but instead of giving us excuses they gave us sincere apologies and freebies. That's what makes them a world class business. The food is excellent, too. I highly recommend the smoked salmon appetizer and of course, oysters. They have different varieties from around the world all with different flavor profiles. As always, my favorite time to go is happy hour, where you get half off drinks and shares/snacks plus some of the sandwiches. Definitely worth a visit (or ten)!
If you love oysters and clams like I do this is the place for you my friend.  We will be back!

Let me just say this is my favorite place in Columbus. Went to look for apartments around the city, stopped in here for dinner. We had reservations, which I do recommend because even at 945 people were waiting. Our waiter was wonderful. Atmosphere is fun. Waiter brought us a free appetizer (deviled eggs) and dessert (a banana peanut butter pie--amazing), both of which were delicious. We loved it so much that we went back the next morning for brunch. Also received a free appetizer of cornbread (the best I've ever had). Biscuits and gravy were wonderful. The staff is the nicest I've experienced in a long time. Definitely plan on visiting many more times in the future. Short north is the place to be in Columbus.

Delicious- Great menu selection that is not overwhelming. Nice Southern style food with unique twists! Shrimp n Grits killer, Cuban sandwich outstanding and Ricotta Dumplings a must try. Tried several appetizers Be sure to save room for the Pies! Service very attentive and friendly. Keep up the great work

I've always been a fan of C.M. restaurants, but The Pearl may be biting off a little more than they can chew. About 2 months ago I made reservations for 7:15 on NYE here, that's 2 months advance notice. A week before NYE The Pearl called to confirm that I would be there at 7:15, and I was, with the 3 other people who I was having dinner with. We stood in a packed, uncomfortable foyer and waited to be sat for 45 minutes. When we finally got a seat at 8, it was in the bar area in which we kept getting ran into by patrons standing at the bar. With that said, it leaves me to wonder if they would have sat me had I gotten there 45 minutes past reservation time, let's be honest, probably not, but on NYE, they know that we were left with little choice but to wait out our turn because any restaurant worth anything was going to be full on NYE. Let's move on. The fried chicken, amazing, Devils on horseback, love them, Moscow mule, the best in town. Problem here, we only got one drink each because our server never really came back to see if we needed another. Hopefully next year, The Pearl can accommodate all of the guests that they "think" they can.

The wife and i stopped by , a great decision.  Had a few local ipa's the wife a few margaritas.  Appetizers the lamb meatballs will tingle the palette,  bacon wraped dates killer , and pickels were refreashing . Split a Cuban sandwich.  Walked out happy and the price during happy hour 4pm ta 6pm  was more then fare . Will return no doubt !

It is always a test to go to a restaurant on a holiday.  We decided to go for Easter Brunch as usual the service was excellent.  The food was delicious and perfectly prepared.  We had two meat eaters in our group, a vegetarian and a vegan.  There are no true vegan options on the menu but as usual the chef was a super star.  The vegan french toast, with skillet potatoes and a citrus salad was outstanding.  Thank you for a wonderful meal

Really lovely place! I took my boyfriend for his birthday dinner and we just did the happy hour, which was amazing. We tried SEVEN dishes and each had 3-4 drinks for under $100. It's great because the happy hour isnt limited to just the bar area.

Highly recommend the pearl for brunch. Our server, Andrew was extremely profession, knowledgable, and made us feel so welcome. Andrew is the reason we will continue to come back to the pearl. He is awesome!

Really good food and great service. The oysters were great and the clans were super fresh. I also really liked their burger except it was a little salty. The one thing that was a complete knock out dish was the corn bread. Divine is the only way to explain how it tastes. It's a must order dish for everyone. Service was good and server was friendly. Ambience is great and loved their attention to detail.

This place is amazing. Great food and service. Bar staff is incredible. Ask for Bartender Dan. He makes great drinks and is a super cool guy. Brought my wife and we were beyond impressed. Spoon bread is amazing. We ordered shrimp and grits and the chicken. Awesome.

Love the drinks...I highly recommend the punch...it's served in a real crystal punch bowl!  The atmosphere is fantastic.  The service is great.  What I have had of the food was just okay...maybe I was expecting more since I've been here a few times for just drinks and everything else is soo top notch.I've tried the beet salad, the cheese curds, the fish and chips (perch) and the fried chicken.  All just so so in my opinion...other than the salad which I really enjoyed.  Cheese curds - bland. Fish - too much breading and the fries were cold. Chicken - overcooked but the sweet roll was tasty!Oh....the punch ...we had grapefruit...ill go back just for that! Loved it!I do want to go back and try again...maybe I made some incorrect choices.

Love! Love! Love! They have thought of every detail. Great lighting, killer music. Waiters in vests and bowties.The syrup for your pancakes? In a flash, like brown bottle- no label. Bloody Mary? Made with crushed San Marzano tomatoes.The tomato soup on the kids menu? Made to order, finished with a little cream. Well, the little one wasn't impressed on that one, but we managed to fight over the last bite.We finally made it here for a mini-celebration brunch. Execellent service.We ordered:Oysters-They are bit overpriced at 3 for $8 and pretty tiny at that. Esp when I get some of the same ones at MarketDistrict for $1 a piece.Devil's on HorsebackShort Rib Poutine-Tender short rib, delicious cheese curds. heaven on a plate.Ricotta Dumplings-Delicate and delish.Southern Fried Chicken-Yep it's $18. It was good, but my sister admitted not the best ever.Buttermilk Pancakes-Great lemon flavor, so fresh. Almost a light dessert. Crisp delicious bacon, too.Tavern Benny-Pappa thought it was good, but not the best dish at the table.Kid's meal grilled cheese-it was a darn good grilled cheese! and the little one ate nearly the entire thing.Moscow Mule-Here's my advice, buy the cup. Those copper mugs are $20 online (without a drink in it). Hubby now wants a set, so we will be back and buying them here! It's a little pricy cocktail  for the amt of ice, but it was tasty!Bloody Mary-One of the best I've drank. Call-out to vegetarians-there is a salami on the skewer.We finished with the Brown Butter pie. It's a rip-off of the Milk Bar's crack pie. But guess what? The recipe is on the internet and it taste just like this one. BOOM!

Sitting here right now enjoying the Shellfish Tower! #Delicious My wife and I love The Pearl. The food is outstanding! It's a great social setting to come and enjoy some drinks and apps with friends. I decided to setup a Valentine's surprise for my wife and the manager - Kelli - and her staff were amazing, handling all of the details to make it happen. Top notch service! Top notch food! Top notch drinks! Great people! What's not to like?

Happy hour is the best time to go since it is a good time to try a little bit of everything. Oysters are amazing for not being as fresh as you would get next to the water. Tried both the baked and raw and they were really good! Their deviled eggs came out on a funny chicken scale that really made no sense but it was a nice touch. I gave this 5 stars because my only disappointment was their drinks, I ordered their dirty gin martini and it wasn't dirty at all, in fact it was a bit sweet. Service was good and attentive. Definitely a restaurant to come back to!

We went there for happy hour with co-workers.  Half priced beer and apps. AMAZING!   Oysters, sloppy joes, pork tacos, deviled eggs, chi-dogs and more. Everything was EXCELLENT!!!  This places rarely disappoints. We will be back!!

So the atmosphere is real positive and nice. This is definitely Columbus's top spot (from the amount of people trying to get a seat) and it took an hour before we could get a reservation. Had the clam chowder which was really good  Had the hanger steak which was quite flavorful but the chef was really heavy with the salt which kind of messed up the experience. Overall the staff was really helpful and respectful which was good.
