When I came with friends we split the punch and it came in a little crystal bowl with little crystal cups. OMG just like when you had tea time with your stuffed toys only as an adult... with real people... and sweet sweet booze. In the fall I had something cider themed and it was amazeballs as well. This is a perfect date spot - delicious food in an upscale atmosphere without trying to hard or being too trendy. Definitely recommend.

I have to admit when the Pearl opened up 3 yrs ago, their food/menu was on point; however, 3 yrs later, and the menu, legit, has NOT changed whatsoever. I mean, of course, I expect there to be a lot of dishes that stay on the menu over the years at good restaurants, aka-the crowd pleasers/signature dishes, BUT they honestly haven't changed anything which leads to a boring, lackluster, mediocre dining experience. This seems to be a big syndrome of Cameron Mitchell restaurants as of late...a pattern, if you will...of really not trying all too hard to continue to develop and pursue a continuously changing and revolving menu. I believe most CM restaurants suffer from this problem, and the Pearl is just one of many. I desperately hope that they contemplate changing it up!!! Also, the last time I dined there, our dining experience suffered greatly from a poor management of the front of the house...there was a busboy that was sorting silverware in the front so loudly and for so long our entire table couldn't literally not hear our conversation. Our waiter only offered to us ONCE for a drink for the entirety of our meal and we were there for 2 hrs. Overall, disappointing. Thumbs down!!

I'd been wanting to try this place for weeks before I finally went a few days ago.I wasn't disappointed. A few tips, though:- DON'T get the oysters. I'm not sure why this place advertises itself as an oyster room when the oysters are pretty mediocre at best. Admittedly, I'm not sure where you'd find good oysters in Ohio.- Get the grapefruit punch! It is excellent.- My favorite part of dinner was the hanger steak. It is REALLY good combined with kimchee fried rice.- Was also able to grab a bite of a friend's ricotta dumplings, which were also decent.

This place is great! Seriously. We went there last night for the opening. We've been before to the CM's restaurants but I wouldn't say we liked them a lot. I'm just more into a little bit different style of eating, food etc. But oyster bar always sounds good to me, so we made a reservation 2 weeks in advance.The place was completely full and it was very nice crown of people. Pople who know why and what for they are there, people who know the definition  for every item on the menu.The interior is beautiful, waiting area is nice makes you feel relaxed while sipping a glass of wine/ cocktail and waiting for the table to be ready. Stuff is amazing. Everybody seems to be very professional and friendly. Even on the opening night you don't feel like there is a distance, something might have been forgotten or anything like this. We had to wait a little (extra 10-15 min) but we didn't really feel it, 'cause the cocktails were so good and it gave us time to look around.The bar.To start with we are not the people who get easily surprised by drinks or food. We tried enough and made enough, so when it comes to this field we kind of know what it is really supposed to be. I tried Bourbon Apple Punch, while my husband had Scofflaw. Both were really good. Beyond ours expectations (we are used only to having good quality drinks at Mouton so it was nice to have it else where).  Punch was soft and nice, while Scofflaw had more complex taste. You can tell that there was an effort put into making these guys. The portions are pretty big by the way. Later we  tried Moscow Mule and Manhattan. Manhattan is a barrel aged and thus is softer than the normal Manhattan. It comes with the best from all the cherries Luxardo cherries. Moscow Mule comes in the copper mug and tastes as good as it looks.The food.I haven't really noticed people around eating. I saw a few french fries baskets and it was pretty much it.The only item I really wanted to try was a Shellfish Tower (Dozen oysters and Clams on the Half Shell, Half Pound Peel & Eat Gulf Shrimp, Louie Dressed Colossal Crab, Cocktail Sauce, Horseradish Mignonette) which costs $90. But there is definitely no reason to try to it because it you can easily get the same set at the North Market or Whole Foods for a better price and also, there is no way to judge the "food" and quality and cooking by ordering raw seafood.So  we skipped all the starters, cause they didn't look any appealing. Appetizers looked better, but two items we ordered were probably the only two items I'd like to try anyways:Charcuterie board (Foie Gras Terrine, Hard Salami, Chicken Liver Parfait, Country Ham, House Made Pickles) and House Smoked Salmon with Poached Egg, Brioche, Scallion Tartar Sauce.Charcuterie board surprises with the size. Two of us were not able to finish it. Chicen pate had too much of a butter flavour to me ( I like the taste of liver, not the butter), pickles were very good and all the rest were pretty good two. Salmon, again, was a good entree size. It was very tender, had light smoky flavour and silky taste. Probably my favorite from all. Poached egg is my favorite type of cooked egg, but it wasn't runny at all, so I didn't like it. Tartar was extremely good though!We also had oysters. One of each from the East Coast. Well, oysters are just oysters. They turn into OYSTERS when you are on the coast only. So..but horseradish mignonette and a cocktail sauce were delicious (normally I eat oysters with just a lemon a juice).All the entree items sounded a little bit to heavy to my taste, but I assume they all are very good.The place is really good. I dont think We will be back for oysters (cause it was the less impressive part of our dinner), but we will definitely stop by sometime in the summer when the windows will be open to try other cocktails and share an appetizer.

Four of us headed out to the Pearl for their opening night.  It was bustling!  Totally full and the staff really hustling around.  The ladies weren't done admiring the decor before we were seated.Mark was our server and did an outstanding. He knew the menu, didn't oversell, but provided helpful insights. There are a lot of items on the menu we will want to go back and try.  Last night, we had theClam Chowder - really good, maybe outstandingDevil's on horseback - bacon wrapped dates - loved them, savoryShort ribs - terrificHangar steak - perfectly cooked and in a really great saucGrilled cheese - I didn't try it, but the word is very good.Burger - expensive at $15, but maybe the best in town.We didn't even get to The seafood and shellfish.  This will be a destination dining experience in Columbus.

My group of five met there on Wednesday the 31st of July.  The atmosphere was great.  We had a table next to the big open windows.   To start, we had the rollmops, devils on horseback and the crispy fried curds.  The rollmops were good.  Pickled herring was good.  The curds didn't' taste like cheese curds to me or anyone at the table and they went largely uneaten.  The devils on horseback were not exciting and could have used a spicy sauce to balance the sweetness.The burger was over cooked  and the fish 'n chips wasn't liked much.  Both were served with luke warm fries.  I don't understand why the simple things can't simply be done.  The ricotta dumplings were good as was the beet salad.  We might go back, but there are certainly a lot more options to consider for considering a return to this establishment.

The Pearl is great, and welcome change to the food scene in the short north. The food is top notch, but appreciate the laid back atmosphere of the Pearl. The menus has numerous options of fun, classic, feel good food in addition to the obvious oysters on the menu.Our table started with oysters that were fresh, delicious cornbread, devils on horseback, and the fried cheese curd. All were fantastic. For the main mean I had the hangar steak which was cooked to perfection and had a great Korean vibe with the kimchi rice. I also tasted the fried chicken (fantastic) and fish and chips were absolutely huge.As for the atmophere the Pearl was packed, but to be expected the first week. The space isn't the largest or the most quiet. So if you're looking for quiet and intimate you may want to look elsewhere, but if you're looking for a fun, unique restaurant in Columbus the Pearl will leave you happy.The service is great, the staff was very nice and knowledge on all the food including nuances between oysters and the dishes.Overall I loved the Pearl and will be heading back soon. So many items on the menu looked great and service was top notch.

Wanted to see what all the buzz was about so made a reservation for 8PM on a Saturday night...FOOD: inspired menu, nice presentation, great quality and quite tastySERVICE: they try, but they're still a bit of a mess, 30 minutes to get to our table even with a reservation. drinks and food are equally slow to arrive on a busy nightSCENE: definitely hip, picking up on the gastropub theme, with a speakeasy vibe, but a bit over the top... (your bill arrives in an vintage hardcover book. read on for more excruciating detail)The Pearl has a great theme and is a good compliment to the Cameron Mitchell fleet and will likely pop up in other locations quickly. There's just a few things that irk me:The scene is so contrived that it just get's silly after a while. Everything is done with a purpose, but that same purpose seems kind of transparent. Examples range from water served in mason jars (interesting at first, annoying after a few sips) to yellow-hued exposed lighting (yay, I'm dining in a sepia photograph, fantastic), to the bill that arrives in a hardcover book (even the bartender seemed a little annoyed with this bit of theater...wasn't a very good read either). I couldn't help thinking by the end of the night, that I was in 2013's answer to 1993's TGI Friday's...The food is really quite good and way more authentic than the decor. The menu has a lot of variety. The menu  mashup between an oyster house and steak tavern doesn't quite make sense, but everything is prepared really well with uniqueness, based on simple dishes that have been around forever. Example:  The hanger steak is a modern twist on bibimbap. If you enjoy staring uncomfortably at other guests, ask for the corner table in the back room. You'll feel like like Jim Lehrer moderating the presidential debate.I'd probably go back....

Still a big fan after visiting and partaking in the gluten-free menu. Even the bar staff is knowledgeable and made sure that the AMAZING cioppino special was safe for me to eat. Spending a Saturday night at the bar was quite the amusing experience. Lots of good people watching and fun folks!

This is one of those times I wish we had half stars, because this place sits more at a 3.5 for me. In full disclosure, I've only been once (this past weekend).Two initial thoughts:- I'd tried coming here once before with a group of friends. My friend called on Monday for a Friday reservation and they were fully booked. When she asked if we could swing by, the hostess told her not to because they didn't leave any tables for walk-ins. Um, what?- The atmosphere is fun, and this place is deceptively big. That being said, it's pretty dim once you move further back into the restaurant.Food + service:I came here with my boyfriend and his parents for Sunday brunch. We loved the New Orleans baked oysters (that broth, yum!). We ordered a slew of dishes - including the grilled cheese, tavern benny, fried chicken, and huevos rancheros. I will say that my huevos rancheros, while not absurdly small, was about 1/3 of the side of the other plates and I couldn't find the chorizo at all in my dish.The service was great, and our waitress was attentive and friendly. I do think this place tries really hard to be in Brooklyn. From every waitperson wearing flannel shirts to the mason jar water glasses, you might get a hipster vibe. If that's not off-putting to you (it's not for me!), I'd suggest giving it a shot. My taste of the fried chicken was satisfying enough that I'd go back and order that again. I'm also curious to try out the (raw) oysters next time; the selection does seem a little paltry (and the prices a little steep) for a place that touts itself as an oyster bar, but that's just my opinion.

Another Cameron Mitchell staple! The Pearl just opened on High Street and it is top notch! My friends and I went the 2nd weekend it was opened... How? I randomly went on Open Table and found at 7:45 perfect timing reservation! Someone must have canceled as I had checked all week and it was booked solid. We were alittle weary of going as we weren't too impressed and excited about their menu-- the menu items seemed interesting and we didn't know if we would be able to find something we would like. Well... we were wrong.So, the experience! We got in slightly before our reservation and had to wait about 20 minutes so we went up to the bar. The upfront waiting area is nice; nice big couches; however, it was crowded. I take this as a good sign- I mean, it should be crowded...it just opened! We went to the bar and each got a drink- Moscow Mule, Citrus Punch and Ramos Gin Fuzz. All the drinks were great! They also had a great variety of drinks on the menu, that it was hard to decide what to get. For $10 a drink, it needs to be great, and they were! When we got to the table, we believed we had prime seating! Tucked away between both rooms in a spacious booth, right under the mouth-watering dessert board. The waiter was very nice and detailed out the menu for us. We ended up ordering the recommended Devils on Horseback (bacon-wrapped dates)- they were so delicious, but small, made you want more! It was a slight tease... but a good one! We then ordered some grilled cheeses and the hanger steak.  I know we should have ordered oysters, and we will next time... As we were enjoying ourselves, waiting for the food, we didn't even realize that it had taken slightly a little long until the manager came up to apologize. He said that since the chef is a "perfectionist" he wasn't pleased with how our food came out and wanted to remake them. In the meantime, he brought us another round of drinks for free! When our food finally arrived, everything was top notch delicious! Another manager stopped by to see how it was, and even brought us a free basket of fries- which is the key to my heart!  Everyone was super nice, making it an unexpected delightful, fun experience! Dessert- we got crack...pie! And boy was it crack! Topped with some Jeni's ice cream, it was delicious! Again, we were impressed more and more as the night went on.When we felt that the restaurant couldn't get any better... the bills came and they were in these old, worn out books. They also invited you to sign the inside of the books.  I thought this was so extremely creative and unique- I have never been to a place that did that! It was very cool. Overall, we went here not knowing what to expect as the menu items looked a little odd and we have never heard of/nor been to a GastroPub... but we didn't expect the greatness that we experienced. We are so happy and excited that this place came to the Short North and we are looking forward to going again and again! This will be one of our staple weekend restaurants!

Another great place by Cameron Mitchell! I love the upscale food with a cool casual atmosphere. Water glasses are the cutest small mason jar looking cups and the Moscow Mule was delicious. My friend and I tried the Old Fashioned Deviled Eggs, 6 oysters on the half shell, the Chicken Wing Confit and the Pub Burger. The oysters were everything we were expecting and the deviled eggs were creamy and tasty. The burger and chicken wings were the real stand outs. We didn't expect anything outstanding from chicken wings but these ones were the best, fall of the bone, flavorful wings I've ever even imagined of tasting. The burger was cooked to a perfect medium warm pink center but the Cambozola cheese and tomato jam were what made the burger a stand out from any other burger I've tasted. I'm excited to try out their brunch that is starting in a few weeks!!

Love, love, love The Pearl.  The hubs and I went there for dinner on our anniversary and went for brunch once over the summer.  Both were absolutely amazing.  The oysters are the best I have had in Columbus.  The brunch is REALLY good.  I got the chicken and waffles and the hubs got the poutine and washed them down with great bloody marys (they come with sidecars of high life).  One hint: get the spoonbread, you won't regret it.  When we went for dinner I got shrimp and grits and the hubs got the pub burger they were both delicious and cooked perfectly.  Lastly, the service...it is fantastic.  The servers are knowledgeable, friendly, and quick.  Now I am day dreaming about a bloody mary.  MMM...

I'll give it 5-stars for the spot-on opening.  Visited for Happy Hour on Friday.  They opend at 4PM, I got there at about 4:15, by 4:45, the place was packed!  Service was excellent.  Appetizers were served quickly.  The beers were great. The Rollmops were very good... they're pickled herring but better than others I've had before.  The chicken wings were also excellent and as advertised, extremely tender. The hot sauce served with them had good flavor and the blue cheese dip also was tasty, My only (minor) issue with the wings were they seemed just a tad too salty.  The space is exceptional.  They did a great job building this place out. So we now have another great spot to hit in the Short North thanks to Cameron and Company!  Great Job!

I have dined with friends many times and loved the Pearl, the atmosphere, the servers, the food everything was wonderful.   My last visit was horrible, I reserved a table for four but it was set for three.   The waiter didn't notice it until we asked for a 4th place setting.  The food was horrible and we were rushed to eat and felt we were being pushed out of the door.   That was my last visit; there are plenty of great Columbus restaurants that appreciate their customers.

So this is the new place everyone has been talking about. The new addition to the Cameron Mitchell list has been on the top of my Must Try list since I heard about it. If you're familiar with my reviews, you know I don't go out to fancy expensive places often, but my boyfriend and I decided this was the spot to try for his birthday dinner. We made a reservation for 8:15 pm last night, a Saturday. We actually got there a little early and were seated right away(that might have something to do with the fact that I called to confirm my reservation, so they knew I was serious). We did have to wait 5 minutes, but understandable as we were early. We overheard the host telling these 2 girls that walked in without a reservation that a table wouldn't be available until about 10:30...so MAKE A RESERVATION. We sat down at our table and right away...I started to notice some similarities between this joint and my favorite new Columbus restaurant, 101 Beer Kitchen. For example, the mason jars, the jug of water on the table, the simple cloth napkins, the old books(101 uses old books for their drink menus, here your checks come in one), the thick butcher block tables, and the overall decor was so similar. In fact, that's the reason I'm knocking off a star. I LOVE 101 Beer Kitchen and it feels like this place is kind of ripping it off. And that made me a little mad. As far as the food goes, you can't really go wrong. We started with the Rollmops, which I had never heard of before. A rollmop is a filet of pickled herring wrapped around a dill pickle with sour cream, onions, celery, and parsley. I loved it. I was worried it would be super fishy, but it had a great balance of fish flavor, salty, sweet, and sour. Then, we each had some oysters. I went with the Nawlins Style baked oysters. They were spicy and cheesy and came with a great chunk of crusty bread to soak up all the juice. My boyfriend just had the oysters on the half shell. It came with 3 and fresh horseradish. I thought the oysters were a little overpriced. But our entrees were incredible. I had the hanger steak. It was a pineapple marinated steak served with kimchi fried rice and a fried egg. I loved Korean food and this was perfect. My boyfriend had the Pork Trio, which he said contained the best pork chop he's ever had. The bite I tried was awesome. In all, I loved the food here, but I probably won't be back until the fuss of the new restaurant is all over.

Really cool atmosphere, good food, great service.  REALLY loud & bustly - obviously - because it's the cool new kid on the block.We went on opening weekend, and it was SLAM crowded.  Like I was at a rave.  We had 9:00 reservations and didn't get sat until a little after 10.  Not a huge deal - obviously no one wanted to get up so they weren't turning over tables, and the people there were so nice and accommodating and gave us a free app.  We also didn't really care because we were just happy to be there hanging out.  Great dirty martini.  Really good burger.I have been back since a few times - once for Brunch (AWESOME), another few times for early-evening cocktails (perfect for this, and for people watching), etc.  Cocktails are always great.  BEST APP ON THE MENU is the Smoked Salmon.  Healthy Portion for not a lot of coin, and it's absolutely freaking delicious.Also reviewed it here: http://covetliving.com/gus/holiday-staycation/
Service was good! The dinner was good, and cocktails were as well, but I came here because a friend recommended that I try the dessert.  I have absolutely no complaints, whatsoever.

Visiting from out of town, we celebrated my dad's retirement here during their brunch. Walking in, I was quite impressed with the decor and the atmosphere. We had a great table in the back and it wasn't too busy which was nice. Our waiter was great and made excellent  recommendations. I was feeling rich, so I got the $18 fried chicken. I've had better on the south side of Chicago but still good. The greens were amazing though! I had none leftover and kind of wished I kept them to myself instead of letting my family try.Get the pie! We got two slices to go and they were excellent. I forget what they called if, but it's a take off of crack pie. I was so inspired from it, I made one later that afternoon!Also the checks come in a book. So cute! You can write in it which is nice if you're celebrating something like our group was. Really great place and I'll be sure to return next time I'm in Ohio.

I have made a few trips to the Pearl and each time I have been delighted. First, reservations are a must! Their cocktails are delicious, and reasonably priced. The service is absolutely top notch. On one visit my cake was late according to the waiter (I didn't notice) so he didn't charge me for it. I was more than content with his apology (because I didn't notice) but he insisted. The staff is pleasant and attentive. I highly recommend the pork trio. My mouth is watering simply thinking about it! The atmosphere is causal but classy. Great place to take a date.

Incredible! Amazing ambiance, terrific food, and an overall fantastic dining experience. Service was helpful and friendly.Be sure to try the Devils on Horseback-- they're bacon-wrapped dates. Unreal.

I decided to bring my guests from out of town to give the place another shot But was very disappointed with food and the 2 drinks I ordered. The first one was an old fashion that was watery and tasted very weird and not even close to any old fashion so I drank a quarter of my glass and thought to order something else. I got the other drink which was a Mexican mule that I had to return because it was tasteless and the server excuse was that this is how we make it and every place makes it different. Food was nothing impressive at all after my tongue was on fire due to the tremendous amount of hot spices that they put in my shrimps and grits. I will never come back again.

We have been to the Pearl four times now and if they had a back room, I'd sleep there.  We are oyster geeks but if you have deviled eggs and love deviled eggs, just order them, sit back, and enjoy.  Add to that the beet salad and I just wanted to lick the bowl and to be gracious to the other diners, I did not.  We were there during a time when a bus boy spilled a pitcher of water on my lap.  I could've made a scene, threw things at the wall, but the manager gave us free drinks and again, graciously I didn't stand up because everyone would have thought I wet myself.  To the food.  Fried chicken, fried chicken, fried chicken.  It was incredible and with sticky buns and amazing greens, I would leap over KFC buckets to get some more. My husband knew I couldn't finish the chicken so he ordered the bangers and mash for his meal.  Attention Schmidts, there's a new sausage restaurant in town.  Wow and with mashed potatoes, well, I could've kissed the chef on the lips.  Run, don't walk, to this place! This is our favorite restaurant and if you happened to see a girl who looked like she wet herself, just laugh because she got her drinks on the house!

Great food and atmosphere. The service was a lot slower than a typical Cameron Mitchell restaurant. Plus they messed up our check and when I sent it back to pay the manager came back and didn't run my credit card and failed to run the gift card I bought. Just trying to pay and leave took 30 minutes. This is our second time and we love the HH specials and the specialty cocktails are awesome. But, this experience left a lot to be desired and this was my fiancÌ©e and my Valentine's Day dinner since she will be out of town on Sunday. Not the best experience and not a typical Cameron Mitchell experience!

The Pearl has super expensive, but delicious food and drinks if you are into that thing. For the price, you would expect some level of competence from the serving staff at an establishment such as this. My first and only time going to The Pearl was decent overall but shrouded by some unpleasantness. Our server hardly paid us any mind the entire night, no one's water glass was never refilled, and he took my girlfriends leftovers faster than she could speak and threw them away even though she was planning on saving them. She is very kind and didn't want to make a scene but the dude threw away 1/3 of a $15 burger and a bunch of fries.My two cents: there are too many other restaurants with great food in Columbus for WAY less than The Pearl and probably better service too.

I love Cameron Mitchell restaurants. This is a great one, especially on a busy Friday short north evening. The drink I had was the scofflaw and it introduced me to a fabulous drink!  I love the oysters and the seafood tower or terrine. Not sure of name. Waitstaff is fun too.

I went here for my wife's birthday and we couldn't have been more excited.  At first glance, I don't really get the oyster bar theme.  Yes, they have oysters, but it isn't a seafood restaurant.  It actually more of a diner.   Starting off, the drinks were a fortune.  $50 including a normal tip for 4 drinks.  The Mule and the punch was all ice.   The Scofflow (sp?) was pretty good.  The bar was packed and it was hard to move.  We were seated and immediately were brought champagne for the birthday.  Very nice.  The seating was a bit cramped and their really doesn't seem to be any "ideal" tables.  We were in between two couples and you can't help but be involved in their conversations.   We ordered the dates and the devised eggs, but they never came.  Other couples were receiving their entrees as we were asking about our apps.   The server only brought one of them and comped us even though he said "you never ordered apps"?   He spent the rest of the meal trying to over please which was annoying. I had the chicken and cinnamon role.  Despite what I had heard, the roll was very average.  The chicken was cooked well but it was three thighs and one dummy.  The greens were bland.  My wife had the salmon which was the special.  She was happy.   Dinner was only $60 with 2 drinks, champagne, and a cake even though the bar drinks were outrageous.  Overall an average experience.  If you light heavy food, this is a must.  If you want seafood, don't bother. We live in the burbs.  We will probably try everything else downtown before ever coming back.
Best oysters I've ever had! Great drinks and service. The pub burger was fantastic. The tomato jam that comes with it is phenomenal!!

This place was good.  That's it.We got the jalepeno cornbread and it was kind of dry.  OK, nothing amazing.  We ordered many kinds of oysters and they were OK.  As usual for a Cameron Mitchell restaurant, the service was great.One thing that was amazing was the Moscow Mule cocktail.  Mmmmmm.

You can't really go wrong with a Cameron Mitchell restaurant.  Seriously, I have almost been to all of them.The Pearl is by my apartment and I have been here several times.  Probably one of the only places I may actually order oysters (I'm from the east coast, so seafood in the midwest seriously frightens me).  Hands down, the best Moscow Mule in town too.In general, I think the menus at most Cameron Mitchell restaurants are all over the place.  They try to please too many people that they lack any distinct direction.  Besides a few signature items, if you've been to one, you've been to them all.  That said, the food is always great, which keeps me coming back.What you do get with the different C. Mitchell restaurants is the varying ambiance that each of them has.  The Pearl has a great American bistro feel, that makes me feel like I'm back in NYC.  I've had the shrimp and grits, both the steaks, chicken, and lamb shank.  Never been disappointed.I do have one quam... And this is a mute point because I have a gluten allergy and can't even eat this... But who pairs a cinnamon sticky bun with fried chicken?  Don't get me wrong, I see where it's coming from.  Back in the day, when I could eat it, I loved fried chicken and waffles...  But the idea of a sticky bun just kind of grosses me out.  I won't judge though.

I was intrigued by The Pearl from the moment I saw a story on the local news. After trying twice to go there for lunch ( they open at 4), some friends and I had dinner there recently and it was as enjoyable as I hoped. When we arrived, there weren't many people there. The hostess sat five of us at a high table right near the bar.  We asked to be moved to a booth and I'm glad we did. Within a short time, the place was packed and we would have been smack in the middle of a high traffic area, a definite deterrent for me. Our server was personable and his recommendations seemed genuine. He was attentive and enjoyable to interact with. The appetizers tempted me to pass on dinner. Our party of five each ordered one and we shared. I've never been to a restaurant that serves deviled eggs-a personal favorite. The jalapeÌ±o corn bread and honey butter upgraded another traditional favorite. We washed them down with Moscow Mules served iced in a pewter mug. The clean flavor balanced the somewhat dense appetizers. The shrimp and grits entree was also a twist on a traditional dish. Chorizo and poblano peppers added a slight kick to the mild shrimp and grits. What initially looked like a small serving turned out to be the perfect size. We shared dessert as we did the appetizers. It was unanimous that the apple berry pie ala mode was the favorite. A very close second was the brown sugar pie. I never tasted the Boston Cream or Snickers pie. I was too busy grabbing forkfuls of the others. The Pearl is worth a visit on a hungry day. Our group is already planning our next visit.

I was able to use Open Table to get a reservation 15 minutes before we arrived during gallery hop. Still amazed by that. The vibe of the restaurant is really laid back while still feeling formal. The oysters were delicious, and absolute top quality, it was like they had just come from the ocean which was refreshing for an ocean sick east coaster. The wine list was a little lacking while being over priced. The staff was friendly and welcoming. I would certainly go again.

We went here because our friends raved about it. I wasn't very impress, it's very crowded. And the food was not worth the money. I got Louisiana chicken and oysters. Oysters were very poorly presented for the amount we paid. Was not very fresh.

I went to The Pearl last night for a Birthday dinner. We had a table of 5 and sat down for our reservation at 6:30. Drinks: It took over 25 minutes to get our bottle of wine and two martinis. The waitress did come back after about 10 minutes to tell us that the bar was really backed up. I'm grateful she did so, so we had a clue what was going on, but it's still no excuse. This isn't Cameron Mitchell's first restaurant, and I'm sure all of the waiters/waitresses are experienced. What was the deal with that?Appetizers: Our appetizers came well before our drinks. We got the Seafood Tower, Devils on Horseback and the Jalapeno Corn Bread. When ordering the Seafood Tower, the waitress was kind enough to tell us that most people leave behind the Clams and asked if we wanted to double-up on the Oysters instead of receiving the Clams. We followed her suggestion and the men at the table gobbled all two-dozen Oysters right up, along with the crab and peel-and-eat Shrimp. The Devils on Horseback were DELISH, and I don't think I've ever eaten a date. Jalapeno Corn Bread was delicious, and the butter that came on the side had freshly-poured honey on top. Yum!Main Course: My parents had the Arctic Char and loved the dish. I had the Steak, but substituted the sides that came with is with the sides that came with the Short Ribs. I enjoyed the Steak, but with the $40 price tag, you're better off going down to Hyde Park. All of the Entrees looked delicious. I liked the design of the restaurant and all of the small details, like the "plates" that the steaks and short ribs were served in. I will definitely be back, but might let them work out some of their service kinks. 25 minutes for drinks (let alone waiting 20+ minute after ordering a second round) is ridiculous

Incredible. The staff seem very knowledgeable when it comes to spirits and the food is incredible. We had excellent service. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great dining experience or drinks with friends.
Amazing service - amazing food- one of the best places I have been in the tri state area. Perfect date night.

Affordable for the average foodie in all of us. This restaurant is a cute concept and seems that others agree because it gets BUSY! Make a reservation if you can or go at off peak times. If you can overlook the hipster appeal you might fall in love. All the servers have beards and wear vests and everything about this restaurant seems to scream trendy, which can be intimidating. Service is good. The waiters (I am assuming they hire women waitresses too but didn't see any) are very knowledgeable about every detail of the food and drink list, which is great but can be annoying at times when they go on an on. I think they want to educate people and be helpful but it was a bit much. The beet salad was yummy and the fried chicken was delicious. Pies were good but not to die for, not even the crack pie. There is a common theme, they care about quality. This restaurant is affordable upscale and fun if you like trying new things.
Great food. Fantastic service. First time here in the evening. Didn't have a reservation for tonight with 5 of us. They juggled and got us in. Oysters were excellent as well !

Myself and some coworkers decided to try The Pearl last week for their happy hour and were more than pleased.  We were able to sit at the windows in the overstuffed leather chairs and enjoy a light breeze and good conversation.  As for the food, the Devils On Horseback were fantastic especially when washed down with the North High Brewing Oyster Stout.  The flavors of these two items complemented one another quite well.  We also sampled the deviled eggs and the jalapeno spoon bread which were good, but not as great as the devils on horseback.Our server, Hannah, was attentive but not intrusive which allowed our group to further enjoy the evening.This place is a must for those in the area.  I will definitely be returning the The Pearl to enjoy their full dinner menu in the future.

So we had a reservation, and we got sat at the right time, but we ended up waiting for about 15 mins for a server to come around, being a manager in restaurant I started to get slightly annoyed, and then came Mark, we love Mark, if you make a reservation... request Mark. He completely made up for the fact that we had to wait for him... waiting for Mark was the best decision of my life. So then we asked to speak to the manager, we got Cliff who ended up being the most amazing human being on the planet. The fact that the entire staff took extra time to make sure we were completely satisfied with our experience was so amazing and so refreshing. The food was phenomenal, from the appetizers to the main course to the PIE... everything. Hats off to the staff and hats off to whomever hired them! If I could give more stars I would.

Drinks: Not terribly pricey, and pretty darn tasty. That's a combo I can get behind.I didn't have a chance to eat here, but I did hear it's excellent. Overall, very good atmosphere. Clean, upscale, classy. This is the kind of place you can take a date for a good time without feeling too stiff.

I had brunch here and it was delicious!  We started off with a round of mimosas and they were delicious.  The orange juice was freshly squeezed and the ratio was perfect.  I had the Stuffed French Toast which I would recommend to anyone.  It was amazing and the bacon was cooked perfectly!  Others at my table had the pancakes which they said were wonderful and fluffy with a hint of lemon and the chicken and waffles they said was great too.  The service was friendly and wonderful.  I will definitely come back!

When we walked into the place, we thought we were in a big city like Chicago.  We made reservations and had to wait under 10 minutes.We had the rollmops( herring) Moscow mules, oysters on the half shell, fried chicken, and hanger steak.  The first Moscow mules were watery, but they immediately replaced them. The replacement was better.  The hanger steak and rice plate was amazing and my husband thought the fried chicken with the sticky bun was delicious.The 2person toppers are close which lend the people to talk to each other.  You had to if you wanted to leave your table for a minute.Wide range of types of people, which is nice to see.  We will definitely go back

I normally don't review, however when things are not just right I have say something. High end tavern type atmosphere. Very comfortable. However when a dozen oysters cost almost $40.00 and the least expensive bottle of red wine is close to the same amount and a very small salad is $9.00 and a very small Skye vodka is $10.00 its time to say hey...this is not NY city and we do not have waiters walking around in black ties....this is a Tavern. Food was very tasty, but portions were small. I am not a buffet type person...but when a short rib costs $27 and there is hardly anything to share on a ala cart I sometimes wonder. Last but not least from the hostess who was in a hurry to seat us, when we were talking to a friend in the lobby to the waiter who kept saying are you ready, are you done, can I get your check...we were there approx. 1.15 hours. and spent $200.00 not including tip and only 5 drinks for 4 people.Maybe we should of stuck with burgers and beer...

Had the Tuna Tar Tar wrap with a side salad. Was delicious. The only reason it didn't get five stars is because the wrap was a little lettuce-heavy. As in about 50% lettuce. All the ingredients were fresh and tasty, however!

It is a really good restaurant. I have some oysters here and they taste really good. The cheese sticks are good too. It is really good to eat then when they are hot. The sauce is great. I have also had some pork with sausage. The pork was cooked as a steak. It seems like medium. Really tasty! But the price is really high. It cost me 140 bucks of those foods.

I am on business trip and stayed pretty close to this place. It looks like a pretty relaxed restaurant, bar sitting places plenty, and atmosphere is quite friendly and relaxing.The menu was not that impressive and price was a little higher than I expected. Food was ok, service a bit slow, and there are a lot of servers and just half of the tables were full. So I guess the service is just as normal, so not that impressive at all.

Service was great, food was amazing. The jalapeÌ±o spoon read is delicious, I highly recommend. Deviled eggs are very good also. For dinner, the shrimp and grits were great- just the right amount of spicy. There is also an extensive craft beer list.
The Manhattan is the best I've ever had.  The food was amazing - we had the short ribs and shrimp & grits.

I've been several times, but generally only when invited by others.  The food is pretty good, service is attentive, and the atmosphere is nice, but not for the price.   Also would expect more seafood options.

This restaurant was recommended to us, so we decided to give it a try. We're visiting from California for work conference and decided to have dinner here. The place was very busy and we had a 45 minute wait, but it was worth it. Everybody was very friendly and courteous. We ordered the clam chowder which unfortunately was a little cold. We also ordered oysters which were half off today and fresh!! They tasted great. Another small appetizer that was good was the dressed blue shell crab. The dressing was a little sweet and creamy. The crab was Pre shelled and arrived in a very small bowl and was also very good. We decided to share the steak dinner which was a ribeye steak. They split it for us which was very nice. They also gave us each an individual baked potato instead of splitting One between us.Everyone in the restaurant was very friendly and accommodating. We had a great experience and would definitely come back here. We ended our meal with the brown sugar cake which was also delicious.

I enjoyed a great Sunday lunch today.  We were seated promptly.  Eric, our server, was very attentive.  The oysters are really fresh!  I wish I could cook an omelet like the one I enjoyed this morning.

We reserved a table for 3 on a Tuesday night @ 5:30.  The place was almost empty from 5:30-6:00, so the atmosphere was more of a private dining room.  We all 3 ordered some type of sea food-2 orders of the "Wolf" fish, and 1 Blue Crab and Clam Chowder.  All 3 were excellent.  The fish was well prepared. and more of a fish steak than a flaky fillet.  The Blue Crab had a ridiculously good sauce on it, and you could tell they use fresh vegetables in the chowder.Remember to save room for pie, any type, you won't go wrong!

All show, no substance. Place looks great, but the drinks and food were off. Manhattans were small and mostly sweet vermouth, which is a crime to this eater from KY. Bacon wrapped dates would've been better left alone instead of topped with a cilantro relish and drowned in oil. Ramen was weird - spices didnt seem to fit, there was hardly any "pork tenderloin" in it, and the more we tried it the more we were convinced of its failure. Are they trying little moments of asian ingredients in these dishes? I would suggest sticking to what they know. Service was impatient and a lityle pushy, like we were at lunch at applebees and he was trying to max out the bill (which was way too high for such a mediocre experience) and turn the table over asap. We wont be back!

Amazing atmosphere, great wait staff, snotty bartenders but they know their business, and quality, eclectic and tasty food will bring you back again and again.  It's cozy, dark, romantic, warm and inviting from the front door to the corner booth in the back.  I can't recommend stopping in for dinner here enough.  Simply amazing craft beer selection, quality cocktails and a bar stocked with regional liquors make sitting at the bar a conversation piece itself.  Don't miss this gem if you're in Short North.

Decided to find a great restaurant in the short north, thanks to yelp ended up at The Pearl.  Loved that we could make reservations.   The menu was fantastic!   Cooked clams, oysters and appetizers were are excellent.   Came back after NHL Skills Competition for dessert - Idk what it's called but brown sugar and butter - oh my!  We will be back!

Very good oysters, presentation, reasonably priced, and great desserts. Best Moscow mule and Bloody Mary I've had in awhile too. Only downside is that the server said dessert was on him for my birthday but it ended up on a plate, not him. Kidding, sorta. Great restaurant, highly recommend it!
They do a nice job of making up for mistakes.   Great atmosphere, good food.   It's a CMR!!

My dinner was great. I feel like the menu was a little limited so you need to have a specific craving for what they serve. The service was great. I even ordered a specialty drink and the waiter brought me a different one because I didn't like it. Free of charge. It is a little crowded and noisy, but the short north doesn't have a lot of space to begin with . I recommend getting a reservation. We went on an off night and it was packed. We would have had to wait forever to get a table.

The Pearl was recommended to us last year but we had to wait an entire year before we could make a return trip to Columbus. Well, it was certainly worth he wait!!  The service was excellent. Our server was very knowledgable on the menu and she made some excellent suggestions. First, the Moscow Mules are the best we had ever had. Then for a starter we tried  the Devils on Horseback which were fabulous!  For the main course the hanger steak and the short ribs did not disappoint. For dessert...it was some more Moscow Mules!! Overall it was a great meal and wonderful evening. You will enjoy The Pearl!!

So very good.  Columbus does not have great wings in my opinion, and wings are far from what you expect at an upscale oyster bistro, but they are great.  Slowly cooked in duck fat and not overly sauced, they are very tasty.  Kale salad gets a solid B+ and the burger was amazing.  Good add to the Short North.

AWESOME!  The Cesar salad was the absolute best ever!!!!  It literally seemed like the lettuce was infused with air (sounds crazy I know).  So light and fluffy!  The Cuban was amazing as well!  Great ambiance!!

My experience at the Pearl was generally excellent. We were shown quickly to a nice table, our staff was attentive and appropriate. And the food was very nice. I've knocked off a star for two reasons: first, my date's scallops were slightly overcooked (no hate here; they're brutally hard to get exactly right) and second, their cooling system for their draft beer was broken. I understand that these things happen but one reasonably expects the chance to have a good draft beer at a nice restaurant. My dinner would have been a better experience if I weren't drinking out of a bottle.Parties at surrounding tables were pleasant and well-behaved, the noise level was engaged but still made conversation possible, and the prices, while a touch high for Columbus, were representative of the restaurant's location and were justified by the overall food quality. I will add that they make excellent cocktails and nobody attempted to oversell us on any food or desserts.

After using Yelp for reviews for years my dinner(s) at the Pearl warranted my first review. My colleagues and I were visiting for a conference and were so blown away by the food we came back again before leaving. The table favorite on both occasions was the smoked salmon. Seriously, order it and prepare to be amazed. The chicken wings were cooked to perfection, perfectly crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The ricotta dumplings were also a standout but honestly every single thing was amazing. I'm a foodie & eat at hundreds of restaurants a year and The Pearl is among the top 10.
Mark C. is the best waiter, ever. He took care of us from the moment we sat down. The food was delicious and the drinks were phenomenal. We will be coming back to the Pearl every chance we get.

Finally made our first trip to The Pearl last night.Despite being later on a Wednesday night, it was very busy, so reservations are definitely a must. We had a cozy booth away from the kitchen, which made me feel like we'd lucked out. I think it definitely would have been annoying to have sat at some of the tables out in the main thoroughfare near a busy and bustling kitchen.They seem to have their timing down already, as our server was attentive and the food/drinks came out quickly.We enjoyed the jalapeno spoon corn bread to start, along with some oysters. Both were great. The shrimp was good, as was the fried chicken. The food was solid and of good quality, but the pricing seems a tad high overall.A big highlight was the lemon meringue pie that came in its own individual tart. It seems that the pastry chef here is a big strength.Overall, we enjoyed the first visit and would probably be back, but definitely by booking reservations first. This doesn't seem like a place that will ever be easy to walk in to for a table!Side note: valet is available for $6 and was well-staffed.

Everything you cant want in a restaurant. The food, excellent. The service, outstanding. The alcohol selection, superb. This place is perfect for diner before heading out to enjoy the rest of short north or it can be the destination itself. If you want to go all out and really treat yourself you can but the menu is set up so you don't have to spend a fortune to enjoy top notch dining if you don't want to. Even with the excellent seafood, entrees and appetizers the item to get is the beet salad. Out of this world. This place is a Columbus must try!

Decided to try yesterday afternoon (10/5/14). It wasnt one of mine better choices.  We were greet with " How can we help you?" We should have turn and walked out at this question,  but sadly we stayed and were seated in the back of the restaurant.  For a sunday afterNoon,  this place was slow, slow enough that out drinks shouldn't have been as long as a wait that they were. Then trying to order our starters was like pulling teeth.  And the choice  to leave was made for us when one started came out a good 8 minutes before the other. We had planned to order a late lunch but, didnt want to wait for the dinner rush to come AND go before we got to even order. How long does it take to fry up an order of the cheese curds?. Its seems longer than to cook the bacon on the devil on horseback. The service for a Cameron Mitchell place should have been  light years better than it was. I felt that it was  a bother  for them that we walked in to start with. The server disappeared every chance she got, the host with the better than thou attitude was visiting with the last remains of a larger group that left before us walked in.  This same host also had to be dragged way from visiting to print out our bill. We left before the server came back from the dark hole she had been hiding in.  And to not our surprise,  No one of the staff members we had to pass to leave said a word to us. I guess they were to much into chatting among themselves to notice us leaving like the building was on fire. For the price  and service,  I  would recommend any other place than The Pearl.
Very disappointed.  The fried chicken was so undercooked your could see blood.  The dumplings were average.  Only high point was the corn bread.  Don't plan to return.

Amazingly friendly staff, awesomely delicious food. They make a wicked Arnold Palmer too...non alcoholic drinks are my thing. We ordered the deviled eggs as an appetizer and they were served on this crazy chicken thing, very cute. Beet and Roquefort salad was delicious and served. With avocado and egg, unusual but tasty.

I've been in Columbus for a year now and I'm sad to say it took me this long to get to the pearl. (I've been missing out) From the dÌ©cor to the dessert everything was spot on perfect. One of the best breakfast places in town.  I went with the french toast, delicious. I highly recommend you not make the same mistake as I did. Thank you for the birthday treat!

The atmosphere is great, I love this place! We ordered the jalapeÌ±o cornbread which is amazing, along with - tots, lamb meatballs, spinach salad and oysters! The food was phenomenal and I love how they use old books for checks!

One of the best things about a Cameron Mitchell restaurant, is their willingness to work with their guest and aim to please - and that they did! Every time I go, the wait staff is attentive, the drinks are fresh and creative, and I can always expect I to enjoy my meal - good to the last bite.Be cautioned: it'd behoove you to make a reservation via OpenTable

The Pearl is a gem--was there on a busting Friday night for Happy Hour and was it a happy hour.  Service was good and even though busy it was actually possible to have a conversation.  My first taste of the delicious Moscow Mule will not be the last--especially with that touch of ginger to spice it up a bit and served in a copper mug.  The bourbon apple punch and margaritas ordered by my friends were well received.  The fries were tasty so much so that we ordered a second batch; the oysters briny and fresh; the chicken confit (wings) good but not spectacular.  The pork belly taco stole the show--as my friends and I opined--great for the carnivores amongst us.  Hanger steak for dinner excellent!  As the Guide Michelin says:  Ì¤a vaut un dÌ©tour--it's worth a detour!

We were in town visiting from Cincinnati, and we try to hit the restaurants the locals love. We were led to The Pearl, and were very pleased with our experience. We came in around 10pm on a Wednesday night, so it was not busy. We had exceptionally knowledgable service and had plenty of time to get to know our waiter, and get great answers to our questions about the menu.Our drinks were amazing. Bloody Mary was excellent and the Moscow Mule was perfect according to my wife. They have great beer choices and our server gave us tastes of different drafts to help us decide.We had oysters different ways, and tried a few different oysters from different places. They were amazing and super fresh. The devils on horseback were a great appetizer as well.The fish was farm raised the night we were there which was disappointing. Would have loved some wild caught. They could use a couple of vegan options.Overall, excellent atmosphere, drinks and food. Highly recommend for a night out or celebrating a special occasion. Very expensive, but worth it for the memories.

First off, make sure you have a reservation especially on the weekends or you'll end up waiting quite some time for a table. Fantastic atmosphere and very cool patrons. We had a reservation so were day about 10 minutes after arriving. First off, they have a pretty decent drink menu, but I always go for the Moscow Mule, but their house porter on draft is great too. The jalapeÌ±o spoon bread is a great appetizer. I ordered the pub burger and my friend got the roasted half chicken, both delicious choices. The service was absolutely fantastic and made the experience what it was. I think it's a bit overpriced for what it is, but overall, great experience.

We ate at The Pearl Restaurant on a Sunday evening recently. We tend to dine a little early to avoid a big crowd, but this place was packed by 6pm. My husband started with a Manhattan that lived up to the waiter's description of "best in town." (Now he's making them at home!) We tried the jalapeÌ±o corn spoon bread as an appetizer. Very nice presentation with a mini cast iron skillet on a custom wood board. On the side was a generous dollop of whipped butter, drizzled with honey. Fantastic concept, and the flavors were delicious. The only thing that could have been better would have been salted, rather than unsalted butter. The unsalted butter with the honey was a little too sweet, and the salt would have balanced it out and added depth. For our meals, my husband ordered the fish and chips. The fish was fried Lake Erie perch. It was fried just right, and served with plenty of french fries. I got the shrimp and grits, served with short rib kielbasa. The gouda cheese grits were creamy and just the right texture, and the homemade kielbasa was heavenly. There were plenty of shrimp in the nicely sized portion, and the sauce added a smoky note that was just right. We shared a piece of coconut cream pie for dessert. The crust was clearly homemade, very thin and flaky, and expertly roped around the edge. The pie had a perfect, creamy texture and plenty of toasted coconut sprinkled on top. It would have achieved "best ever" status with the tiniest change - a little salt in the pie filling. I hate to harp on the salt thing again, because I know it can be a personal preference. But in my opinion, the right amount of salt can make good food GREAT food, without raising one's blood pressure. All in all, this was a very good meal in a restaurant with fantastic decor and atmosphere. We will go back.

I went to The Pearl for a Sunday brunch. The N'walin Oyster was really good, I especially liked the soupy buttery sauce on it, kinda wished I could have more than 3 small pieces though. The clam chowder was great but not exceptional, but I appreciate that they put real clams in it. The deep fried cheese curds were fun and pleasing. The Benny's Tavern was really good too. I especially liked the ambiance of the place and the speedy customer service. I really wanted to try the Chicken and Waffle because of the good review others were giving, but they were out of it.. may be next time...

I sincerely felt like I wrote a review for the Pearl the first month it opened but that must have been a dream or a plan on my part that never became reality.I've been going to The Pearl since opening night. I've been back time after time.What keeps me coming back?1. The service. Everyone is incredibly friendly. My server from my first time 7 months ago still remembers us and says hello.2. The location. It's gorgeous inside. Just freaking beautiful. The atmosphere alone is worth 4 stars.3. The food. I'll be honest - I've had a few dishes that I was very "meh" over. I hunted around and tried a few different dishes but as soon as I had the fried chicken - it was all over. It's surprisingly good. I'm a southern boy who grew up eating fried chicken on a regular basis (even today it's a favorite request of mine to my mom!). This is just about the best I've had in Columbus and even outside my mom's kitchen. I mean - it comes with a cinnamon bun - AS A SIDE! drool....4. The drinks - they are always delish. I mean, one of them comes in a glass punch bowl.5. Brunch - my newest discovery! I love brunch at The Pearl! The bellinis are yummy. My personal favorite for brunch is to get all sides - sausage, potatoes, and a cinnamon bun! If that doesn't sound good - get the fried chicken!So there you have it - why I love the Pearl and still give it 5 stars after 7 months.
Good food and service.  We had spoon bread and I had a pork chop that was very good.  Good beer selection.

I have eaten at many restaurants in many cities and none match what I tasted tonight. We had the oysters raw and baked and they were delicious.  I had the chefs special of "dinosaur ribs" (beef long ribs).  OMG what mix of flavors!!!  Service was great but as they got really full there was a slow down as you would suspect but it was excellent.  I recommend this restaurant as a great place for dates, romantic dinners or just hanging out with friends

Went there Saturday night at 7pm, our party got seated immediately. First thing we noticed is how nice it was to have a conversation without yelling like Marcella. Pretty good food, our party ordered Hanger Steaks, Grilled Cheese, Artic Char. Plus the clams, cornbread and Devils on a horseback was excellent appetizers. The service was good too, but I think our waiter J. has ADHD. Our favorite is still the Ocean Club for a CM restaurant, nonetheless we'll be going back again.

I like short, succinct reviews, but after dinner at The Pearl with friends last night, short just won't do.  This place is a mess.   I will avoid it like the plague in the future and suggest you do also. Here's why:Atmosphere  - I do not know who told the powers that be at Cameron Mitchell headquarters that loud is good. They must think it means cool.  It doesn't.  I thought Marcella's was loud, with its allegedly piped-in noise.  That is sublime next to The Pearl.  Could not hear the waiter (more on him later).  Could not hear ourselves, even across an incredibly small table for four.  This is not fun. It makes an evening out with friends horribly difficult.  Some people actually like to converse with their meals.  Not here.  Oh, did I mention dark?  It is dark.  Ridiculously so.   Tables are small and very close together.   The people next  to you would become your new best friends, if you could only hear them.Waitstaff/Service - Our waiter was hopelessly overmatched by the demands of the job.  He was well-trained in reciting the "very special to me" parts of the menu and the drink menu.   After that, it was so bad it would have been funny if we had not been paying for it.  He botched the order.  He got the oysters right.  Of the three beet salads ordered only one came, along with my fried chicken.  One of our companions had asked about the fish.  After having it explained to him, he declined to order it and instead ordered a beet salad to start and said he would order an entrÌ©e later.   The fish arrived anyway, along with one beet salad and my chicken, which I had asked to be held until the others ordered their entrees.  Our companion complained about not ordering the fish but it looked good so he let it go, cancelling his beet salad. My wife sat there with nothing in front of her.   The three of us ate our dishes at her insistence. The waiter explained that the pantry was backed up and he was sorry.  Twenty minutes later and still no salad.  We asked to see the manager. He explained that the salad included a hard-boiled egg and someone hadn't cooked enough during prep. He said my wife's salad would be complementary, as would any dessert we wanted.   In another five minutes, out came not one, but two salads, the waiter having forgotten to cancel the other one.  At this point we were fed up with the whole mess and decided to leave.  Along with this, we couldn't get forks. Every time a plate was cleared, along with the forks, no new forks appeared.  Ever.   The level of service and coordination was equivalent to a first-time restaurant opening night.  If that.Food - The food was good. Not great. Good.  My chicken was moist and the breading nicely done. The beet salads were deemed good.  The fish was rated OK.  The Boston Cream Pie was good.  Value - When you are serving good food it should be at good food prices.  Fried chicken like I had would be great at a chicken shack for $8-$10.  Not for $18.  The fish was $27.  Short ribs were $27. Short Ribs!! The oysters were 3 for $8!!! The wines suffered from a 300% markup.  These prices are in the extraordinary dining experience range. The ambiance and food quality are in the OK range.  I can easily spend that amount at G. Michael's, The Refectory, or other top notch tables and walk away content that I have received excellent value for my money. For good food I can go to Black Creek Bistro or Skillet or other purveyors of much-better-than-it-needs-to-be-for-the-price eateries and also walk away content.  The Pearl offers OK food and mind-numbing noise at grand luxe prices.  There is absolutely no value to be found here.  To add insult to injury, they charge $6 for valet parking.  They put a restaurant in a parking-difficult area of town, ask you to drive there to eat, then gouge you for parking.  Shame on them.Overall - As H.L. Mencken said, "No one has ever gone broke underestimating the taste of the American people".   I do not know why this place is popular.  I do not know why people think so little of their hard-earned dollars to spend wayyyy too many of them on something that delivers such poor value. It is like  paying for an Audi 6 and letting them give you a Ford  Focus.   And smiling about it.  I guess the CM people have it down pat in knowing just how far they can push people with disposable income with their "concepts".  This one is horrible.  Never again.Final Note:  I am not a young man. I have eaten out often around the world.  I am an ex-chef.  Without a shadow of a doubt I have never left any other restaurant anywhere at any time feeling so cheated about what I received in return for my cash.  I am still mad.

I want to love The Pearl SO hard. But I just... can't.I blame it all on the hype amongst Cbus foodies. I think this place was built up to be something truly amazing because we had not seen the likes of a new gastro-pub in awhile, so everyone accepted it as phenomenal when really, it's just another option to Short North dining.First off: make a reservation. I've read some reviews stating that, even with a res, you would have to wait 30 minutes for your table. Thankfully, we had a res but walked right in and were seated immediately.ATMOSPHEREOne is given the illusion from the street looking in that this is an open, well-lit, bustling place to dine with plenty of seating in full view of High Street via open windows. Not so. Most of the seating is in the back. In the dark. Under very strong AC vents that had me shivering through most of our meal.SERVICEMaybe it was just our server, but it was pretty bad. We weren't welcomed, asked if we had been here before, introduced to the menu, told what the catch of the day was. WTH?DRINKSI had the Moscow Mule. It was delectable and strong. My one complaint was the plethora of floaters. Not sure if they were mint or lime or some other herb... but there was definitely too much of it and I had to keep picking it out of my teeth/lips.FOODLet's break this down by what we ordered:- Devils on Horseback (bacon-wrapped dates). Ordered these because everyone we talked to had raved about them. Flavoring is good, and I enjoyed the relish on top, but they don't even compare to the holy grail of dates that Third & Hollywood serves.- Sausage Sampler. This was amazing. Served with kale and sauerkraut and this delicious whole-grain mustard. YUM.- New Orleans Baked Oysters. Flavoring was impeccable, but these were served lukewarm, which detracted from the overall deliciousness. I was especially bummed because this was my boyfriend's first time trying oysters... and he was subjected to sub-par-ness. - Braised Short Rib (he got it). Meat was very tender, but could have used a bit more salt. Portion size was nice. Some would call it "small" but I believe we live in a world where oversized portions run rampant.- Arctic Char. The cauliflower puree was surprisingly savory. It paired well with the fish (seared to perfection!) and accompanying veggies (cauliflower, capers, pickles and peppers).Overall, it wasn't a horrible experience. It's just that, I expected more after hearing all of the rave reviews. I'll give it another chance, but not if there's more than a 20 minute wait.

Not incredibly impressed. I enjoyed the atmosphere but the service was terrible.  I get that it was Mother's Day but there were tables seated after Us that were finished eating before our 3 meals came out.  The grilled cheese was good but honestly there was more food on my child's kids meal than on my plate.  A little overpriced for the sandwich and 3 bites or arugula.    No one asked how our meal was, or if we could use anything else.  Deliver the food and take off not to be seen for 25 minutes.   Check please !
Top 5 spots in Columbus. Service was prompt and polite. All of the food we ordered was above average. Nice environment, will be back.

Simply delicious. Pot O Pickles are the bomb!! Everyone at our table got something different, so we nibbled off of each other's plate. I didn't have a single complaint about anything. I really dig the mason jars they serve drinks in.

First of all, we arrived right when the restaurant opened. We asked to sit at a high top table in the bar. The unfriendly and rude hostess informed us that "those tables are for people who have reservations." I have worked in the restaurant industry for over 10 years and this is a first! I have never been to a place that reserves ALL bar tables for only those people with reservations. When we arrived, 3 tables were open. The duration of our meal, 2 tables remained open. Absolutely absurd that some tables are not allowed to be utilized by guests without a reservation!! Second, the meal was WAY over priced. I ordered chicken and waffles. At least use a smaller plate to present the food! The meal took up less than half of the huge plate. You are only given 1/2 of a waffle for $14. I have ordered chicken and waffles all over the country in much more expensive cities (Seattle most recently) and everyone serves a full waffle and definitely more chicken. We're not talking about oysters (or something  similarly expensive). We're talking fried chicken and a waffle! None of this is expensive. For $14, you should at least expect a full waffle. I was no where near full and had to eat again once I got home. Should have gone elsewhere for brunch!

Every time I walked past The Pearl since it opened, the same thought came to mind:  "I really need to try this place."  From the outside it looked clean, fun, and well-lit.  Water in Mason jars!  Checks delivered inside books!  Servers wearing jeans and vests!  VESTS!  Well-played, Mr. Mitchell.A few weeks ago I (finally) had the opportunity to experience The Pearl with a few friends.  We waited only a few minutes for our reserved table.  Seeing the bright interior and happy, smiling patrons seated at tables upped my Excitement Index considerably.  This was going to be a meal to remember.This is the part of the review where ominous music begins to play in the background.Upon being shown our seats, I learned something about the layout of the restaurant.  That happy, bright, fun area everyone sees from the outside?  That represents perhaps one-third (maybe a little more) of the total seating.  The rest of the seating is found in The Back.  It pains me to say this, but The Back is a low blow to anyone who has expectations of a clean, fun, well-lit dining experience.  The numerous fruit flies surrounding our table were, simply put, disgusting; our conversation was punctuated by random claps as we tried killing the things.  Perhaps we would have been more successful if the owners had sprung for decent lighting in the area.  There's a distinct difference between "mood lighting" and "dingy".  On the bright (ha!) side, the darkness kept us from seeing dining guests at other tables.  This was a bonus considering how tightly the tables were packed in the space.I felt like I was being punished.  I quickly had to find a positive to the situation.  A drink!  Alcohol makes everything better!  Five or so minutes later I had a Manhattan in front of me.  It was ... fine.  Honestly, I've had better.  Honestly, I've made better at home.  With a $10 price tag, I'd expect a great drink.  This was ... fine.  The Pearl was sinking fast.  Looking at the menu, I wanted something simple.  Throw'em a softball so they had no choice but to succeed.  I chose the pub burger.  Meat is ground daily?  I'll have that medium, thank you.  It turns out $15 does not buy a burger cooked medium.  It was easily medium-well and on the verge of being well-done.  Perhaps that's what happens when a burger is flattened on the grill so it will fill the bun rather than leaving it thicker and juicier and simply using smaller buns.  But what do I know, I'm just a consumer -- and the cooks in the kitchen know what they're doing, right?  Oh, and the fries were warm.  Apparently $15 does not buy hot fries, either.  After eating my overcooked burger with my warm-ish fries in the dark surrounded by flies and sitting a foot away from complete strangers, I was understandably a bit bummed.  I had already spent $25 on a poor experience, so let's round out the evening with dessert!  I do have to say, the Oreo pie was wonderful.  It was easily the highlight of the meal.  Had I know the delight that was the Oreo pie, I would have ordered three of those for dinner and called it a night.It was finally time to leave The Back.  As my eyes adjusted to the light in the bright, cheery, sunny front of the restaurant, I was a bit shell-shocked.  I thought back to my feelings when I first arrived.  Mason jars for water?  Eh.  The book in which my check was delivered?  Ho-hum.  The vests?  Yeah, the vests were ok.  I guess.  Clearly, the Excitement Index had plunged into negative territory, the icy depths from which it was unlikely to surface.Meh.  I've experienced better.  Two stars it is.  Sorry, The Pearl, I won't be back.
This is definitely Mitchell's best restaurant and possibly one of the best in Columbus. I recommend it to everyone. A little pricey, but worth it. Try the devils on horseback and a Moscow Mule.

I had the pleasure of dining at The Peal last night. I have to say, I was not expecting a lot from Columbus, but this place set the bar high! The offer valet, nice, considering parking in this area is limited. The service and the food was excellent! They did not have my choice of beer, but our server suggested something similar and it was great! We started with the Gulf shrimp, and it was better than I've ever had, even at restaurants on the Gulf! For my entree, I had the strip steak, again, fabulous! A great cut of meat, cooked to a perfect mid rare. We even had dessert, the oreo pie, and it was great. Highly recommended, a little pricey (200 + tip for 3 meals, 2 apps, 6 beers and desserts, not terrible, but on the high end), but well worth it.1

Went for Father's Day brunch at the Pearl and felt like I was back living in NYC for the day. I could easily see this place in Soho (a la Balthazar). Food was good, lots of selections for brunch, with a quirky drink menu (bloody mary comes with a side mini Miller High Life bottle!) The noise level was high and the tables were close, but like I say, NYC style. You either love or hate it. What I especially liked were the details that made this place stand out from other wannabe hip watering holes. Like quaint, kitchen towel-esque cloth napkins and mason jar water glasses. I think it might be a nightmare trying to get a drink here on a Friday night, but for brunch it's the bees knees.

Everyone in our group of 5 really enjoyed their meal. While the filter shows expensive it has some reasonable prices items as well. Only bad thing was that it has a limited menu. But the offerings are quality items.

My husband and I had our second dinning experience at The Pearl this past weekend. We had a 8:15 dinner reservation on a Gallery Hop Saturday and were seated as soon as we arrived. Every table was filled, some people we watching the OSU game at the bar and the atmosphere was great.The food was fantastic, as were the cocktails. We shared the deviled eggs (the best I've ever had), parmesan clams and fries while we sipped our moscow mules. For our entrees we had the hanger steak and pork trio, both we so good we were hesitant to let the other sample. Decided to skip dessert this time in favor of a trip to Jeni's down the street, but I still dream about the brown sugar pie.The only downfall was the lack of a Gluten Free menu. He husband and I don't have celiac's disease, but we certainly feel better when we avoid gluten, especially bread, and pasta. There are PLENTY of dishes that don't include those items, but most Cameron Mitchell restaurants have a GF bread/pasta/batter option. Again, not a big deal, I just figured that they would have a few more offerings like Cap City and Marchella's.

The Pearl is fabulous!  What an grand opening...we dined there Saturday, February 9, the first week it was open.  Everything was running very smoothly, but then that's not a surprise considering this is Cameron Mitchell's restaurant!  We had a reservation at 5:30 p.m.  We were seated within 3 minutes of when we arrived, but first a cocktail server took my drink order!!!  She had to bring it to the table because we were seated so fast.  Do try the barrel aged Margarita.  They are superb!  Best I've ever tasted!!  Jesse was our server.  Love the jeans, checked shirt, vest uniforms!  He suggested two appetizers we tried.  Devils on horseback, cheese stuffed dates, with a savory twist.  The deviled eggs are better than I can make, and I'm good...but more than that, the reason to order them is the presentation.  You won't believe it the way they are served to you!  The four of us tried the beet salad and we loved it.  Roasted golden and purple beets and sliced apple, with avocado, egg and toasted pistachios with a yummy buttermilk dressing.  Not a leaf of lettuce and you don't  won't miss it!  For entrees we tried:  fried chicken, braised short rib and oysters from the raw bar.  Everything was delicious!  The cinnamon sticky bun served with the fried chicken is to die for!  At the end, Jesse told us we simply must try a piece of one of the fresh baked pie selection.  We chose their "Crack Pie" which is called that because it is addictive...brown sugar, butter and oats and fabulous whipped cream!  Even at 5:30 p.m. it was completely full of people, a little loud, but not enough to overcome chatting at our table. There seems to be a lot of space for people in the bar to stand.  But if you want to eat there, you probably should make a reservation.  The Pearl is going to be the hot place for quite awhile from the looks of it last night.  We can't wait to try it again.  There are many other things on the menu we can't wait to try.Definitely don't forget to order the deviled eggs!

Went there recently to celebrate a birthday. Very crowded on a Tuesday night, reservations are a MUST. The cocktails were delicious, the rum punch was very refreshing but not very strong. The service was fantastic, very kind and thoughtful. Gave us dessert on the house as we were celebrating. Husband had the hanger steak with fried egg and kimchee fried rice. Very flavorful but pretty spicy, beware. The arctic char was good but the best part of the dish was the roasted veggies. Will definitely come back when the dining room isn't packed full.
On a recent trip, I visited this place twice. Great atmosphere, great service, good food.I have tried apps, salads, oysters, beer, wine, fish and chips all great.Thank you.

This was one of the best brunches we have ever had.  My husband had the stuffed French toast which was sinfully good! I opted for the short ribs entree which was equally amazing.
