The service was outstanding.  Everyone had a smile and were very welcoming.  Our waiter, Nick, did a great job.  If you are in downtown Columbus, you have to try this restaurant!

Super excited to get a gift card to be able to try this place and not hold back! We started out with both of the barrel-aged cocktails, which are delicious, but pricey. Worth the try for sure. Of course we had to get some oysters, and the blue point oysters were the only ones left for the evening. It was my first experience eating them, so I'm not sure I can describe the quality of preparation, but I enjoyed them. For my meal I chose the ricotta dumplings, and I'm so glad I did.  Not only were the dumplings themselves perfect, moist, and flavorful, but the potatoes, mushrooms, and crispy kale added great texture and it all went together perfectly. For dessert we went with the butterscotch pie. The chocolate crust was good, but it overpowered the butterscotch. Still pretty good though. Our server was very enthusiastic and ready to answer all of our questions about the menu. They put the check in an old book, which was a cute touch, too.

TOTALLY OVERATED.  This place is OK.  As i have heard elsewhere, it seems to be trying to find its identity.  If you are looking for a place to be seen, high noise level and matching high prices, then this is the place for you!  In no way is the food the priority here.  I ordered the fish and chips and my friend ordered the Atlantic char, bothe were mediocre tasting.   We had the Devils on Horseback, which were good, but there were only 5 of them!!! Honestly, you can go to the Hollywood casino for the seafood buffet and have a better meal for a much better price.  Also, it won't take you that long to get seated.  The service is good, if you consider constant interruption during your meal with questions like "how is it".  Furthermore, the attention seemed insincere.  Yes, you will need reservations, probably because the Pearl is the current "it" spot.  We both agreed, we would not be coming back any time soon!

Great food.  Jalapeno corn bread with honey and butter was ridiculous.  And although I was sad to pay $18 for fried chicken (isn't that like a family meal at KFC?), it was so good it was almost worth it.  Lots of flavor and super moist chicken.  As a salt lover, I was impressed how salty the greens were.  And the cinnamon roll, it was how I would imagine eating a fistful of warm frosting -- in a good way.  Arctic char wasn't bad.  I would skip the oysters, those tiny suckers are expensive.  I guess that's what happens when you're landlocked.  Excellent service.  Make a reservation.

Have been anxious to try, had been looking forward to going. The interior is really cool hipster trendy, restroom narrow and smelled like urine. Pub Burger was excellent, fries over cooked nearly burnt. Naw" lin baked 2 of the 3 were good, one was bad, dead oyster bad. The drink was blah bourbon/cider punch. Sam the server was awesome. It may have been an off night.
Excellent food and service! Loved it! The devils on horseback .. Great, clam chowder.. Awesome, oysters were fresh and tasty , hanger steak.. Great too!

Great brunch ! Oysters for breakfast. We loved it. The waitress, Jill   Is first rate. Ask for her. She really knows her stuff. I asked for a special sauce for my oysters. She knew exactly what I wanted and had it made for me.

The ambience is cool, oysters were very good. Outside of that, go elsewhere. Cameron Mitchell restaurants have been slipping in quality for years now in my opinion, and this is just one more to add to the list. Service was terrible, despite the fact that we were there at 5pm when the restaurant was otherwise quite empty.  Apparently due to the location, it draws quite the Convention Center crowd...the clientele surely does not match the brand they're trying to establish. We went only bc we had a $150 gift card, so luckily there was no direct impact to my wallet with this visit. Put it this way: I'll never go back.

Had the oysters, fried chicken, others in my party had the wings and short ribs, white clam chowder, all really good, there is some talent in the kitchen.  Server was good.But, arrived ten minutes before our reservation, waited thirty minutes to then be offered a high top in the bar.  There were clean and unbussed tables in our view. Several later arriving parties were seated in the small high tops while we waited.  We were a party of four.  Had to refuse the small table and insist on a real table, made me feel uncomfortable refusing that table and sending the seater back to the hostess, who seemed clueless as to what was happening behind her.  It was Sunday evening, maybe the manager was off?And, while waiting the thirty minutes at the bar the mother of a kitchen employee was enjoying a few plates of Belon oysters, nice treat, when we ordered them at the table, they were out, oh so unfortunate, no connection to the table, but under the circumstances turned me off to the place.I'll pass on the future, a shame because its a really nice meal!

First of all I came in with a world renowned wine maker, should have had VIP service but was treated like garbage. Spent $300 in 30 min but had horrible service. Had to send sausage back that was way under cooked and saw the manager roll his eyes. Terrible, will never recommend or visit the restaurant again

First of all, I must say that I loved the Burgundy Room, the restaurant that was previously where the Pearl is now. There isn't much that could make me feel better about the Burgundy Room closing, except maybe the Pearl opening. My boyfriend and I went to the Pearl for my birthday last week, and everything was wonderful. We had reservations at 8:30, and we were sat promptly. I ordered a margarita, which was a little small, but then I switched to wine, which was lovely. Our server was very attentive in the best way; he was around, but not too much. He suggested the Devil's on Horseback, and they were delicious. My entree was the Great Lakes Fish and Chips, but the fish was perch. Perch! I grew up on Lake Erie eating fresh perch all the time, and this is the first place I've found perch in my 13(!) years in Columbus. Order the Great Lakes Fish and Chips. My boyfriend got the fried chicken entree, which was good, but mine was better. When we asked our server to take our picture because it was my birthday, he did, and then he asked if he could bring out some free pie. Of course! Who says no to any pie, let alone free pie? The Crack Pie was also very good. Overall, it was a great evening. The service was fabulous, and I heard the price was reasonable.

What a great new spot for the Short North.  I came here opening weekend and so did the rest of Columbus.  The food was great, with flavorful gastropub selections and of course delicious oysters...my favorite.  It's nice to have a spot like this offering fresh, raw seafood in a landlocked city.  The service was great.  The atmosphere was great.  I will have to come back.

It's a cool design.  Love the subway tile and mason jar. The drinks are better than good.  The service is great.  But then it's a little down hill and unfortunately, the thing that's most important - the food - is just average.  I'm torn on Cameron Mitchell joints in general.  They tend to be more style than substance.  A box version of a popular concept.  That's exactly what this place is.  Really average food with fancy names pretending to be fine dining in a very manufactured setting.  It's just doesn't feel right.  It's worth a visit or two.

Service, food, and drinks couldn't have been any better.  It might be some of the most amazing brunch I have ever eaten.  The chicken and waffles were out of this world delicious.  Can't wait to come back for dinner!

Four of us went to the new kid in town, The Pearl, to check it out. We all eat out a lot and need to know the newest great place to go! It was busy and the atmosphere is fun. We started with the "Devils on Horseback" cheese stuffed dates wrapped in bacon. They were good, not the very best stuffed dates, but very good..another place in town does a similiar date appetizer I like a bit more. But they were very tasty. We also had the pork bao buns. The pork was very tasty, the bun was a bit odd. I didn't love them. We also ordered half a dozen Chesapeake oysters. No complaints on the oysters. Yum! Only wish I could have had a true mignonette sauce with them vs. the horseradish one. The horseradish way overpowered what is so wonderful about a mignonette. And I love horseradish. For entrees, two out four of us ordered the chicken. They both loved it. I tried their cinnamon sticky bun. It was totally awesome...but; from a purely marketing standpoint I am a bit confused why they serve a big sweet bun at dinner. It seems to kill the idea of anyone ordering that entree will ever order a dessert. I can see that as a great brunch idea, when most don't order dessert anyway. (Maybe a big southern biscuit or cornbread on the savory side would leave them wanting a sweet after dinner?) I ordered the Cuban entree...and, as it turned out is a sandwich. I had no idea. It doesn't say anywhere. So, it was a bit surprising. I had read it as a pork confit, (often served in a small dish or on top of the other items.). It also had a slice of some other type of meat on it, which, I didn't like too much. The black bean stew was good that was a side. Our last entree that was ordered was the braised short rib. He didn't say much, but kept eating. I take that as a good sign. We didn't order any dessert. All-in all, it was good, Not blown away. The menu seemed a bit more meat-oriented than I expected, but hey, we're in the midwest. I am really excited to have an oyster bar to come sit at and watch them shuck oysters as quickly as I eat them. After living in Boston for twenty years then moving back, I've missed that sort of thing.Go, enjoy. It's good.

The seafood tower is amazing but it is also around $90 if you're looking to do some spending! The oysters are big and delicious however it also comes with clams that's are ok. The Bloody Mary here is hands down the best Bloody Mary in columbus and it's served in a mason jar with amazing toppings!
SO SO GOOD. I LOVE the deviled eggs and the smoked salmon :) Oysters are a MUST and the drinks are amazing.

It was my first time going to the pearl. I went with my boyfriend last night. The food was phenomenal we both had oysters and the braised short rib with a few glasses of wine. The service however was awful. 30 minutes passed by without our oysters for our appetizers. We finally managed to flag down the server and she told us they are shucking the oysters now. We think she forgot to put the order in since two tables sat down and ordered after us and they all got their oysters before us. About 10 minutes later we finally received our oysters, it should not take 40 minutes for oysters. After that our service went more smoothly. Overall I would defiantly go back again but would pray to not get the same server. She was just struggling the whole time we were there with three tables

Apps are hearty and rich. I love deviled eggs.  Great  drinks and draft selection. Oysters are pretty darn good for Columbus. Entrees are hit or miss. Desserts are over the top...prices are in line with other spots in town.

The best oyster bar in Ohio that I know of. Great oyster selection to choose from. Had 7 different types the other night so I ordered two of each. Always make a point to eat here when in Columbus. Also enjoyed my hanger steak which isn't usually a favorite of mine. Nice atmosphere.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

We had reservations the third night (a Thursday) after opening, the place was packed.  We were sat at a hi- top table near the bar and were able to order drinks and snacks quickly but we eventually had to initiate the order for our dinner (maybe our server thought we were just having drinks and snacks?) . There were 3 of us and we ordered the Crispy Fried Curds, old Fashioned Deviled Eggs, Pot-o-Pickles as snacks then Southern Fried Chicken, Grilled Cheese and the Cuban.  I tried a little of everything... we all liked the snacks.  I wasn't a big fan of the sweetness from the "Pearl Jam" in the Grilled Cheese, the Cuban was ok, the pork was stringy/ pulled and made the bread soggy on the inside which we didn't like, the Fried Chicken was good but we wished it came with the JalapeÌ±o Corn Spoon Bread rather than the Cinnamon Sticky Bun...the Sticky Bun it's own was amazing, we just didn't like it with the Chicken.  I really wanted to like it more and would The Pearl would not be the first on my list of places to eat in the Short North.  The atmosphere is great and it would be perfect to meet friends for drinks.

Went to The Pearl a few days ago for restaurant week.  We made 8:30 reservations, and when we showed up, our table was not ready, and they handed up a buzzer.  We ended up waiting 40 minutes for our table that we RESERVED.  They apologized, saying they had other big parties.  But isn't that the point of reservations?  It gives the restaurant a chance to manage large tables, knowing that other parties are going to arrive at certain times.  The food was good, but unfortunately botching reservations is a line in the sand.  I will not be back.  Understandably, as I dine with clients often, I would never risk making reservations here again, the service is simply too unreliable.

good dirty marini, bad martini glass.place has a cute ambiance, and a tasty deviled egg appetizer, but my peel & eat shrimp could have used something a LOT more fun than carrots and celery.  is old bay only an east coast thing?  what else did i get?  ten days later i can't recall.  meh.

3.5 Good for the oysters. Tried the fried curds and was not a fan, it more more batter than cheese. Had the beet salad as well, which was unique and tasted good, just not sure if I would order it again. Heard the punch was good but was disappointed.atmosphere, service and oysters are worth it. it is expensive so might not be your best bet if you're not looking to enjoy oysters. We did not get an entree because nothing really caught our eye, other than the grilled cheese. Will probably try it again but food it ok at best.

We had a great dinner here over the weekend celebrating my husband's birthday. We had a great table in the front right by the windows. I can't remember our servers name but he was excellent. It took him a little while to come over initially but he did stop by and say he would be a couple minutes so that was okay. We ordered drinks and the deviled eggs, parmesan baked clams, and devil on horseback, all were fantastic but the eggs did have a lot of onions in them so if you aren't a fan I would steer clear of those. For dinner we ordered the grilled cheese, two of us picked the fried chicken (sticky bun was awesome), and my husband ordered the short ribs. We all really enjoyed our meals but the short rib was I think the winner although I didn't love the horseradish mashed potatoes personally.  The portions were ample although the grilled cheese was kind of small, I would maybe order a side of the chowder or fries as they look delicious.I thought maybe they would recognize that it was my husband's birthday but they didn't, not a huge deal.  We did order the "crack pie" which they are apparently not allowed to call it anymore so its the brown sugar pie.  It was really good but not the best pie I have ever eaten.  It was a good dessert to split though after the dinner.  I would definitely make reservations, I think I had to go 2-3 weeks out.  Once thing to note there was a little drama at the Oyster bar, apparently the seats may or may not be first come first serve so I would check with the hostess just to be sure.  We couldn't get the whole story but there was some controversy over who should have gotten the open seats so best to check.  The staff seemed to handle it well so kudos to them.  Overall we had a great meal and will definitely return!

I want to love this place: The location is great, the decor is perfect and the drinks are yummy (especially the Moscow Mule); however, the food is pretty dismal. I've been here several times and tried different things, but everything seems pre-made and not all that fresh. My brother got a pasta dish, which was good, but not nearly enough food. The pies are also good, but again, this place is supposed to specialize in seafood...

Save room for dessert!! The crack pie is delicious! You will also want to get some of the cornbread to start. Extra points for the fun presentation of butter and honey.I went on a Sunday for brunch with a friend. We both went with the huevos rancheros. They don't look or taste at all like what you expect, but they are really good and I actually enjoyed the novelty of a new approach to a classic. They are less influenced by the usual red ranchero sauce and are flavored more by the beans, chorizo and guacamole that accompany them. Going back for dinner this week and I'm excited to try some oysters!
Brunch is served saturday and sundays until 3pm. Order the Chicken & Waffles with an extra spicy bloody mary. You will not be disappointed.

This place is really nothing special.  Just another new place in the Short North.  I was there for 'Happy' hour and they charge $9.50 for House Cabernet.  I'm no wine snob but that seems high for House.  Anyway, the staff is very attentive and seemed interested in what I was ordering.

I give an A plus for decor/ambiance. We started with the pickles. Gross. Don't waste your money.  I had the grilled cheese.  It was decent.  Not going to run back for it any time soon but it was decent.

This place is packed for a reason. If there aren't any tables, try a spot by the oyster bar. It's a cool spot to sit, plus you get up close and personal to the kitchen action. The jalopeno cornbread is a must to try. I had the fried chicken dinner which came with a side of greens. They were yummy, albeit a little on the salty side. If they tone down the salt, they'd be perfect. The dish also comes with a huge cinnamon roll--a play on the chicken and waffles bit that's so famous--and just as delicious. I also tried the beet salad which had an awesome flavor profile. Will definitely be back again and again.

This new restaurant is the best spot for oysters in Columbus. Additionally they have legit Moscow Mules which set the place apart from the competiion. The decor is cool, the location is great, and the wait staff is nice/knowledgable. Pricing is out of line on some items (such as baked oysters - $11 for 3 - Cmon should be 6) and of course it is always crowded because of the Short North location (but that comes with the territory). Overall I am very pleased with this place and my 5th visit will be coming up soon (hopefully this weekend).
amazing service. devils on horseback = amazing. great beet salad. best moscow mule around.

Let me start out with the great.......the FOOD! The Oysters, clams, clam chowder, hanger steak, fried chicken and grilled cheese are all amazing. The twist they put on each one to make it their own dish is spot on!!  Now for the not so good....We made reservations more than a month in advance for my birthday celebration. Twelve people on a Saturday night.  Even with the reservations made out so far in advance we had to wait for almost an hour past our reso time for our table. Then the table they offered only had seating for ten people. We then had to wait another ten minutes for the only table large enough to accommodate a party of twelve.  My suggestion...go with a party of two/four people. Expect time at the bar before dinner to enjoy their great drink menu and then have a great meal.  This is a rare combination of trendy with well above average food.
Wow!!  Who'd have thought that Columbus area would have a great seafood restaurant!  Worth coming back to
The oysters were excellent! I suggest getting a double order!

This is one of my top five favorite restaurants in town. We've been here multiple times, largely because of the selection of oysters. They typically have 5-6 options to choose from, all fresher tasting than any other place in town I've tried. They come with a terrific cocktail sauce and horseradish. We almost always get the smoked salmon as well, it's always good and the tartar sauce they provide with it is the perfect compliment. Most of the cocktails are good, but the margarita here is fantastic. Really good beer selection.Other standout items include the burger, which is perhaps the best in town, and the clam chowder. The atmosphere is inviting and the service has always been phenomenal.

I had brunch here on 7/6/15 with my wife, my dad, my sister and her honey.  This was the first time that my wife and I had eaten here, since we were from out of town visiting.  We had the jalapeno cornbread that was so good that they could have put it on the dessert menu.  My wife ordered the beet salad and she said that she would definitely have it again.  My sister and I both had the Waffles and Chicken.  It came with a warm blueberry sauce and an Ohio honey maple syrup.  We both loved them.  If I could have squeezed it in, I would have had another.  My sister's honey had the Huevos Rancheros and enjoyed them immensely.  Unfortunately, this is where things went a little south.  He ordered another beverage and it took almost 10 minutes to get it.  Then he ordered some more tortillas for his dish and they were not delivered until he was completely done with the dish.  I would have probably given the experience an "A" except for the services snafus.

Had an absolutely wonderful experience there. We arrived for dinner early so we could get appetizers and drinks off of their happy hour menu. This is probably the best happy hour menu I have ever seen. I wanted to try oysters for the first time and they were only 2 for $3 on the happy hour menu as opposed to 3 for $8. Nearly every drink is half-price and a majority of their amazing appetizers are on the happy hour menu at a reduced price. It's a great way to sample lots of great tastes for little $$. The service was top-notch as well. The waiter was very  informative when we asked for suggestions. The waiter made a point to swing by to take one last drink order before happy hour ended.   The specialty cocktails and punches were all delicious.  The entrees were delicious too, and to top it all off, the waiter gave us a free dessert. I wish I lived closer to Columbus so I could go there more often.
Awesome happy hour.  The pork belly tacos are fabulous.  Didn't stay for dinner but will definitely go back.  The restaurant dÌ©cor is very urban chic.  Fabulous service too.

Wonderful ambiance, great drinks and service. And you can actually have a conversation!  Fish and chips almost 5 stars. The ricotta dumplings - 2 stars. Because there were only 5 of them!! Come on guys, these are just flour , eggs and a bit of cheese!!!!  Definitely an appetizer sized portion.   Pies were good.  Will give them another chance

I couldn't have asked for more from the Pearl! After a disastrous almost dinner next door, me & 5 others came to the Pearl.  We waited less than 10 minutes for a table & our service was superb!  Our server answered all of our questions, & had some great recommendations! We started with some appetizers, pickles and oysters.  Everything was fresh and delicious! I had the Cuban sandwich (which I split with another person), it had amazing flavor & was big enough that I felt full with only eating half of it!  Other members of our party order the steak, & pork trio.  The food was devoured and everyone raved about what they had. This will most definitely become a regular spot for me!

I want to begin with stating that I love Cameron Mitchell for all that he does and it pains me to write a poor review of any of his restaurants but the service here is lacking and there is a definite need for more vegetarian options.  I do not know what percentage of the Short North is vegetarian or vegan but I imagine it is substantial.  When I asked the server if certain items could be served without meat, she told me to go down the street to other restaurants where there are more vegetarian options because this was just not a place where many options could be found.  As a former server and bartender and as someone who has worked for Cameron Mitchell, I found this completely unacceptable.  With that stated, after picking meat out of the food I ordered, I must say it was good.  But really?  "Go somewhere else" rather than accommodating the customer?  There is no reason for this.  She acted as if she had never heard of a vegetarian diet before.

My husband and I had a fantastic dinner here.  We had reservations, but because of the weather, we were running a bit late.  When we arrived, the hostess said that they were also running a little behind.  I didn't wait more than 2-3 min before being escorted back to our table.  Everything was amazing, the server was polite, friendly and checked on us just enough, but not too much.  I had the beet salad.  I LOVE beets, so when this arrived to my table, I was pleasantly surprised because it was not your typical beet salad.  The addition of avocados and a creamy dressing made it "melt in your mouth" good.  For entrees, we had the artic char and braised short rib.  There was not a bite left on the artic char plate.  It was so good, and I'll definitely look forward to the next time I can have it.  My husband enjoyed his short ribs.  Overall, the ambiance of the place is very nice, and it's just a great place to have a date.  We can't wait to go back!

I wish it was all I had dreamed it would be.  There were some cool things like the check being brought in an old book but that did not make up for the poor service and I mean practically non existent, gritty oysters, greasy food and $5.00 can of beer...beer, in a can for $5.00.  We love the Ocean Club and were hoping for a casual laid back version...not to be realized.

Went on Friday night, very busy...only reason not 5 star was due to confusion at the front with getting us seated. After reminding them we had missed seating us, they apologized and followed up with 2 complimentary appetizers. Devils on horseback and house smoked salmon were great! So was cornbread... Short ribs and half chicken were both wonderful. Beer menu was nice, good variety... Service was prompt and helpful. Wife and I are definitely coming back.

We sat at the Oyster Bar just after the Derby finished - a great way to get a seat when you don't have reservations. Appetizers (Smoked Salmon Deviled Eggs and Devils on Horseback) were truly delicious. Good selections of beer + wine. We took our time enjoying each appetizer separately. Our server was absolutely wonderful! I'll plan to return for dinner next trip to Columbus!

While the menu and concept are great, the food just never seems to be all that good. Went to brunch on a Saturday and had a great table and a really nice server. We ordered vegetarian huevos rancheros & the eggs Benny. The huevos were so strongly BBQ flavored they they sadly weren't worth eating. Tortillas came on the side & the consistency of the dish was all kind of mushy.  The eggs Benny was ok, but not much flavor and it again was all kind of underwhelming. This was my last time trying to again be disappointed at the pearl.
It was medium.  Had an early dinner with friends two weeks ago--our first visit.  Everything about it was average.  Cannot figure out what all the fuss is about.

Was missing San Fran and had dinner here during the holidays. Great ambiance! Awesome drinks and the short ribs were to die for! Food was seasoned so well!definitely had a food orgasm and great service!

Easily got reservations for a Tuesday night about a week in advance to have dinner with some girl friends. There's been enough on the ambiance so I don't think I need to go over that. At 6:15 the place was full around the bar area but mostly empty everywhere else. Well by 7pm this place was packed, shoulder to shoulder, people eating and drinking standing up. A little insane. Drink wise I went with the Moscow mule, which I've loved ever since I had one for the first time at the Jury Room. Here they serve it in fancy rustic cooper mug thingamig. Goes with the mason jar, DIY, Pinterest wedding, rustic, theme they have going on here circa 2010 (yeah, that was a bit of a backhanded compliment, but it's Ohio. We're a little behind here). I didn't care  much for the crushed ice - better suited for the summer time, BUT the crushed ice did seem to keep the drink really cold and from getting super watery. I also didn't care for the lime pulp I kept having to pull out of my teeth every time I took a drink. YUCK! Thankfully I was just dining with my friends. Ordered some oysters - we got 3 of 4 kinds they were offering so we each got to try 1 of each. $8 for 3 oysters seems kinda pricey but the rent for this location ain't gonna pay for itself. Also, we're in freaking Ohio not a coastal city so no $1 oysters here. I like whichever one they placed in the middle of my plate. No idea which region that one was from. As for my entree, I went with the fried chicken. Lots and lots of chicken but is fried chicken really worth $18? Again paying for the cool atmosphere and rent location. Didn't care for the collard greens side. I prefer my collards in juice form. Cinnamon roll was awesome. Tried the coleslaw from my friend's fish and chips - yum! Will probably stick to snack and starters next time, and maybe a glass of wine or margarita instead.

I've been in to The Pearl a few times now and have always had a consistently yummy meal. I recently went for brunch and had the stuffed french toast with banana rum spice filling - it was absolutely delicious! The decor is nice, although it does seem like they're trying a little too hard to be hipster.

How a place can open at 4 yet have no valet or any other type parking available until 5:30 is beyond me. Luckily the staff was very helpful in preventing a tow by the hovering tow trucks from what would eventually become the valet lot. Crazy!!! Otherwise the food and service were  great but I'm afraid the parking situation will keep us away, especially on the weekends. If but for the parking fiasco it would at least get a 4 as do all Cameron Mitchell restaurants.
This place is excellent. It's a southern      gastro-pub with oysters. The crack pie is a must have.

Visited for the first time today, had the Tower.  The quality is definitely good....but not great.  The shrimp, lobster and oysters were great, the clams were just average.  The horseradish and cocktail sauce were boring and bland.  The Lagunista IPA was exceptional.  Greg, our server, was knowledgable, friendly and attentive.  The price for the Tower ($90)  ended up not being worth it.  Seemed more like a $70 presentation.  The interior of The Pearl is awesome...great low lighting and ambience.  The bartender did not use the beertap glass cleaner for the right amount of time; only 2-3 seconds.  Definitely a great place but the Tower is a disappointment.  I was torn between 2 or 3 stars, went with 2.

Been here a few times, now, and, on the first visit, absolutely loved it!  Had the oysters and some shimp and both were really fresh and delicious!  On my second and third visits, however, the food was disappointing.  Tried the cheese curds and french fries along with the oysters and shrimp and, although the seafood was good, the cheese curds were underwhelming and the french fries were soggy and had an "old" flavor to them.  Service, on all three occasions, was not the greatest.  Sat at the bar and, although there were several bartenders behind a fairly small, 12 or so seat bar, service was very slow and the bartenders definitely had a bit of an "attitude".  Not to say I wouldn't give it another shot, but it is not on my list of places to go in the near future.
CM can copy a concept and launch it in Columbus like no one else.

My family had been wanting to eat at The Pearl for a really long time and when a girl I work with that has the pickiest pallet I know liked it I was in. We made a reservation weeks in advance for my birthday and received an email that was forwarded to all guests to let them know the time of our dinner. Our reservation was for 6 people at 8:00 pm. We arrived to the restaurant at 7:55 and I was pleased with the charming decor. The hostess told us it would be a little bit of a wait and did not apologize so I thought it would be maybe 10 minutes. At around 8:25 my brother asked her when we would be seated. She gave him a snarky attitude and said she cannot predict when the people at our table would get up. We were finally seated at 8:42 and did not receive a single apology from either of the two people at the hostess stand even though we had reservations at 8:00. Even with a bitter start I went into the food with an open mind. Overall everything was decent. The one thing that I found particularly delicious was a taste of my brother in law's burger. The oysters were very fresh but I did not find anything else to be above and beyond. The staff was enough to make me not go back.
